reviews.text: Love this place. Been a while since I've been here but took a friend to lunch for a birthday. Here is the feedback and why it got 3 (would do 3.5) rather than 5:
This is more of a 4.5 star restaurant, but Yelp sadly wants to limit me.
Food is awesome but they definitely rushed us out. We literally had one bite left when the waiter took our plate, and didn't even ask if we were done.
Warm atmosphere. Good (not great!) food. Good service.
First time at the restaurant, although I have heard about it for years.  It did not disappoint!

From the moment I walked in, I knew Kokkari would be special. Not just because some of my foodie friends declared it their favorite restaurant in the city -- though that certainly helped build anticipation -- but also there was a warm, homey vibe about the place, punctuated by intoxicating smells and happy conversation.

This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco so far. They serve Mediterranean, healthy, hearty food. My ultimate favorite is the wood-oven roasted whole fish with lemon buerre blanc sauce. The place has an awesome atmosphere but tends to be very busy. Make sure to book a table ahead of time. Almost always we have to wait in line to be seated (even with a reservation) and we don't always get the table in the main room (the one with the fireplace). At least it is worth waiting for.
By far one of the best restaurants in town. Someone once said that the first impression always sticks and, I must say since stepping foot in this restaurant, I was really impressed.
A long-awaited trip that required a farther-out reservation than your average Michelin-starred French bistro, but wow, was it worth the exercise in patience!
Really enjoyed the service. I thought the food was good, but not amazinnngggg. I enjoyed the octopus and the lamb chops.

Earlier this year, while cleaning out my closet I found a receipt for Kokkari in one of my coat pockets. The receipt was from 1999 and was greyed and brittle with age, but the memories from that dinner--and several others I've had there throughout the years--as still vivid. A sign of a great dining experience is how long it stays with you (I mean the memories, not the bad taste when you burp).
My first time here was 8 years ago when I moved to SF. I had fish that was not memorable and so I did not come back for a long, long time.

Very overrated.  The server we had was a bit slow and liked to hear himself talk.  He went on and on to get through a list of specials, and none of us could get through the whole thing without losing focus. Just spit it out or  give us a piece of paper.  He was also took an extraordinary time to bring the bill,  etc.  We were overall pretty annoyed by him  and  the several mistakes he made,  including misorders of  drinks etc.  Service could have been much better for the amount paid.  We  were a group five people.  Our order was very costly.

One of my other favorite restaurants in the city. Their lamb shank is to die for. Also, they have a seasonal peach salad that is simply delectable. I literally crave for it. The fudge sundae is probably the best dish they have though: the softest, home made whipped cream ever. 10/10

I decided to take my boyfriend here as a celebration dinner and also because he loves Greek food. It was our first time traveling to the west coast and this place made it special. The food was served moderately fast, but not too fast. I got the lamb shank, which was so tasty. We got the octopus and zucchini cakes as an appetizer that were fantastic as well! Great service and a fun atmosphere with a lamb roasting over a fire in site. The bak lava dessert was delicious.
Come for the service. It's exceptional. The food: I've had better Greek. Not sure what all the hype is about.

So good every time! Attentive, friendly service and a lot of simple foods (what we've ordered, at least) done very well. Love the mezze platter. It's also not as loud as you might expect a restaurant of its size to be.
We ordered the market fish for the first time ever. It was delicious! Great ambiance for a special occasion.

Some of the best greek food in San Fran, and you know it by the sights and smells right when you walk in. They have a spit in the middle of the restaurant and it makes your mouth water as soon as you walk in. It can get a little bit expensive, but the service and food is totally worth it; go for the fried cheese and octopus, oh and the lamb is always good.
Friendly personnel.

Atmosphere is ABSOLUTELY incredible!!!  Beautiful!!!  The food was very good but didn't live up to the wait staff and ambiance. Don't get me wrong. It was delicious but we expected more from the Yelp reviews. We would go again but not until trying a few other places. It's worth the visit just for the atmosphere, though!
Amazing food. great service, and a perfect place to take a date.
One of my favorite restaurants and it is as good as ever !
We fly across the US and eat here whenever possible. Worth every calorie!! The waiter helps us with dinner selections. Tell Max hi when you come.
Walked by this place a while back, and when I finally had the chance to go, I couldn't contain my excitement.

I had lunch at the bar - solid wine list by the glass to choose from.  The Kalamari appetizer was fantastic - squid stuffed with warmed cheese drizzled with olive oil and chipped olives.  Absolutely a wonderful and flavorful dish.  My main course was the Moussaka which was good but not great - it could of used a touch more seasoning.  Ambience is stellar with an upscale business crowd albeit I felt comfortable in jeans and the serve was excellent.
Kokkari made our trip to SF so much better!
Best restaurant in the city. Order goat and order the desert blintz like filled deliciousness. Grilled fish (full fish) is also amazing. Dates, work lunches and dinners with friends perfect....

Great ambience but a little surprised by the hostess- (diner-esque attitude, "just wait over there miss"). Food was so-so but still enjoyable. Huge portions which may sound like a plus to some but I was expecting (and prefer) smaller quantities  of better quality food. Attentive service although she took my almost $7 bottle of San Pellegrino half-full and returned with a new full bottle, then charged me for the 2 bottles. It was freezing in the restaurant, despite the warm atmosphere and rotisserie fire. I had to put my coat on throughout dinner which never feels relaxed. I ordered the grilled octopus- seasoned well but a few pieces were not cooked properly and were almost gooey. House salad, nothing to write home about and the braised lamb shank was tasty although not melt in your mouth as I would expect from this level of a Greek restaurant. The presentation on the lamb was not appetizing sitting on orzo with a bland sauce.

Ok so we couldn't get in for dinner ( world series and the fact that this is the most popular place to eat in the city). We opted to get there when they opened at 11:30 and get seats at the bar. By noon time it's was almost full. Success! We ended up getting a terrific meal, half roasted chicken with roasted potatoes Greek style. Chicken soup, stuffed grape leaves all absolutely wonderful. Bartender was very friendly and prompt without feeling rushed. The atmosphere in the restaurant was warm and welcoming even though it's a large space. They have private rooms down stairs for functions. Open kitchen in one room and a roasting fireplace that they roast the chickens  and lamb among other things in the main room. Just a great experience overall and I can see why it's rated #1 on TripAdvisor. Now the best part dessert! The wife got the baklava with homemade vanilla ice cream and I got the galoktobutica with pistachio ice cream and candied fruit. By far the best dessert I have every had. Forgot to mention that I am 100% Greek so this makes me an expert on the subject. Go here if you are lucky enough to be in this wonderful city.
Unbelievable food and service. Try the zucchini cakes and if they have it try the Sunchokes.
What an amazing and fun experience.

I think we came to Kokkari on a Sunday night. It was mostly on a whim, and out of a desire to try a place that we've never been to before. Reservations are definitely recommended, since the wait without it is probably an hour, but the ambiance is lovely and the service is impeccable. It may have helped that our server looked like Tom Hiddleston as well. :D

So I have a confession.  I have never liked lamb and have generally avoided it since the first time I had it long, long ago when I got terribly ill from it.  Kokkari has changed my mind.  Our charming waiter who not only recommended a fabulous bottle of wine for our table, also ordered a nice sampling of their menu for us, which included their lamb chops.  Holy. Moly. So. Good.  Make a reservation because on a random Wednesday night the dining room was full and bustling, and I even saw people getting seated as late as 9:30 or 10:00 pm!  I'll definitely be back - I love late night eats!

Had the lamb chops as the main course- which are delicious. For apps we had the brussel sprouts and shrimp- I was pleasantly very surprised as I'm not a huge brussel sprouts type of girl. Dessert was fantastic- had the house speciality-luckily I got the last one. The semolina dessert is the way to go:)

So I ended up here on a whim as part of an executive team doing a dinner here. The restaurant is in a neat little area of town, by the bay bridge and piers. The inside is gorgeous, woodsy, rustic, and plain beautiful!
Delicious food (esp Lamb Souvlaki), excellent service and nice ambiance.
Great ambience. I recommend all their lamb dishes--not gamey at all, very tender in texture, and the flavor is wonderful.
Had a delicious dinner at Kokkari. A lovely atmosphere. It's huge but it doesn't feel big because it's broken into several rooms.
Went early bar fills up quickly so don't expect a quiet drink before dinner.
Desert tip,
I never expect to find a good restaurant right downtown. I only picked this place because it was close to a colleague's hotel. I was soo pleasantly surprised.

Traveling from the East Coast and I wanted to get some Latin food and I came to the right place. The fried yuca was excellent especially the hot sauces that come with it (just ask for the hot sauces).  I ordered the arroz con pollo and it was fabulous. The mojito was well made. Excellent meal!!

We found the food we ordered at La Fusion to be very heavy, rich and ultimately unhealthy. Food was good at the first few bites, but not great. Since we have never dined here before, we ordered the more popular dishes favored by most customers:

Great food, reasonable prices and fine service.  A guest and I spent an enjoyable 2+ hours enjoying ourselves.  Try the tuna tartar cerviche.  The portions are reasonably large so that one appetizer and one entre and one dessert and one bottle of wine sufficed for two hungry people.  The lamb shank was very good.  A few bottles of reasonably priced wine ($34) are on the menu.  That with 2 coffees cost me $110. including service,  It was money well spent.  Go.
Good food, affordable, friendly service and the type of ambience that makes it comfortable for a date or just sitting down with friends.
This place takes reservation only or else you wait for a bar seat! This place is small but really good!
Really enjoyed the experience.  Off the charts Chicken!
The food was very good, ambiance was casual/romantic at night and the prices were average for the food quality(Lomo Saltado was premium quality meat).

Chose La Fusion because of its proximity to public transportation. Luckily they were able to seat me and my friends at the bar even though we didn't make a reservation. That being said, the restaurant is rather small so make a reservation if you can.
Describing La Fusión is easy: absurdly good food, absurdly nice service.
What a night....

This place is one of the best I have been too.  The ceviche was spectacular.  The rotisserie chicken could not have been better, and to top it off, the mac&cheese is absolutely out of this world.  Everything was fresh, service was great.  Will be back again for sure.

Omg, it was my first time having peruvian food and this place is SOOOO GOOD. I made a lunch reservation here at 12:15pm and when we arrived, we were immediately seated. We both got their rotisserie chicken (we get to choose if we want white meat or dark meat) and a side dish. I opted for the quarter dark meat ($14) and side of truffle mac n cheese ($2). When our food arrived, the presentation of the chicken and the warm bread salad was very appetizing and I couldn't help myself but take a picture of my food. My first bite of their chicken surpassed my expectation. It was seriously the most delicious rotisserie chicken I have ever had in my life. The meat was so hot and juicy, so flavorful, so tender, so fresh. The skin was so flavorful and crispy. It completely blew our minds. Their warm bread salad is like giant croutons but 10 times better. They were warm, crunchy, and tasted like they were soaked in the juice of the rotisserie chicken. Their truffle mac n cheese was soo yummy and cheesy as well.

Everything we had was on point. We ordered the empanadas to start (and were able to get all 3, not just 2) with a pitcher of sangria. Then half chicken with truffle Mac and cheese and the seafood pot pie. The bread salad is like a bunch of big croutons, but they were amazing. So savory. And the sauce on the pot pie was really flavorful, a little spicy. Great spot!

I'm on this Peruvian cuisine obsession at the moment and I usually have to trek out to the mission, so it's great to have delish Peruvian restaurant near my place.  The white fish ceviche was really delicious. Rotisserie  chicken had good flavor with the sauces. Great place to catch up with a friend or a romantic dinner.

I had a reservation, confirmed via email too. We showed up and there was no space for us. They "gave away" our reservation. They didn't even attempt to make it right either... Just said, "oops, sorry".

My husband and I found this place after reading all the reviews. Fortunately we arrived early on a weeknight. The food, atmosphere and service were amazing. I had the arugula with roasted red beets and my husband had the red lentil soup. After cleaning those dishes of every last drop they brought fried yuca and empanadas. The dipping sauce was to die for and the yuca was fried in the lightest batter to perfection. Finally, I finished with the seafood pot pie and hubby had the pork tenderloin. Amazing flavors and great ambiance. It's a good thing we had to walk back to out hotel.

I has the Seafood Pot pie in the chefs recommendation.  It was excellent.  The restaurant is Peruvian food fused with some Mexican spices.  At $20 a bit pricey for lunch.   I will come back the next time I'm in San Francisco.

When there is a separate menu for ceviche, you know the place is doing something right. The space is small and you should probably come with a reservation for dinner. I came with a friend on a Wednesday night at 6:30PM and we were seated immediately at the bar, which also filled up relatively quickly.
Food was 3.5 stars, minus 1 star due to extremely slow service.
YUM :)

The dining area is small, but the food and drink is fantastic. The rotisserie chicken is delectable, and the chicken sandwich is one of the best I've ever had. There is also a great cevice menu with several great choices. The sangria and mohitos are good. Overall, a great place for a friendly meal!

I'm impressed that this place has such great reviews. Maybe it's because I didn't try their famous chicken, but the 2 of the dishes that I tasted were pretty mediocre. I tried the tuna ceviche and the tuna tasted as if it had come from a chicken of the sea tuna can. The lomo salteado was also bad, it had no flavor, the meat wasn't tender and the fries were soggy. The highlight of the night were the empanadas. They were actually very tasty as well as the 3 different sauces that come with them. I won't be returning to this place.

Everything I had here was epic. I'm usually a harsh critic, I swear.  We walked in without a reservation and originally had to sit by a door near the cigar club so I was annoyed and had a sore throat. They let us move to another table anyway because I'm a big baby and I ate my body weight in delicious food:

Everything here was the bomb-diggidy from the truffle mac n cheese to the rotisserie chicken, ahi ceviche, empanadas, seafood appetizer, and seafood pot pie. The Peruvian beer was also really light and refreshing. Awesome all across the board!

There's no sign for this cute and delightful place so watch out for the number 475. Service by Maria was top notch. Food was great paired with Carménère. I can't believe I missed dining here since it opened 3 years ago. Clean bathroom.

I'd like to say, I've been to several Latin fusion places so i think i have a pretty good grasp.  Let's start with the positive.  The pricing is reasonable considering everything in San Francisco is pricey.  I like the fact that it is small and intimate.  The manager from Spain was also pretty friendly. He gave us a full half carafe of sangria.  Sadly the sangria wasn't very good. Neither were the mussels or the ceviche everyone was raving about. The portion was small and the fish was tilapia.... really? Being in the coast i would expect fresh fish not something we get in the Midwest.  Disappointing all around.  We were so hungry because of the wait that we ate everything anyway. The only saving grace was the crab causa. I have been to much better fusión places and this is not one is return to.  (And I'm Peruvian so I know ceviche!)

Tonight I wanted to take my girl somewhere sweet, close to home, with fair prices. She had the salmon pot pie, and I went with the lamb shank , wow!! I mean wow!! Not expecting such a fantastic meal, the appetizers were fantastic, the sangria .... Great! Ahi appetizer .... Yum!! Ambiance ..... Perfect!  Great service, good people, excellent chefs.... We'll be back for sure
Their supposedly famous rotisserie chicken was bland and overcooked! Texture was mushy, not sure what the hype is about. And the waitress was walking around almost naked.
Beautifully prepared Latin American food.

Excellent food. We had the Argentine empanadas, classic fish ceviche, and half a rotisserie chicken. Everything was delicious but the croutons dressed with chicken jus were the best! We wanted to try dessert but were too full. My husband had a glass of wine and I had Sangria and everything for less than $70. Worth the wait but we sat at the bar to expedite dinner.

The 4 1/2 stars did not disappoint! Great food. Ordered the rotisserie chicken, tuna ceviche with mushrooms, mac and cheese, and the pork tenderloin dish with pacu-pacu. Great experience at a decent price! Highly recommended.
The food here is great, and very well priced.
Amazingly good, quality food! Came here with a few coworkers and everything we ordered was great! I got the chicken salad sandwich and it was awesome! It's very small so make sure you call ahead.

Delicious! I had the mixed green salad and the chicharon de pollo. The flavors of the salad were amazing and the chicken was cooked to perfection. I loved the sauces that came with the chicken. Not to spicy, just right. I'm rating this 4 stars because chicken and my salad were served separately and my chicken came out a tad too salty. The sauces helped tone down the saltiness. Would definitely visit again when I'm back in town.
I've had my fair share of Peruvian food but it's something that's not around every street corner so when there's an opportunity to eat it, I am "game".

This was only my 2nd time having Peruvian food, but OH MAN La Fusion blew my mind. I brought my parents and my boyfriend here after seeing the stellar reviews on Yelp, and they were all very impressed with our meal.

Food was good. Not super impressed with the service. We walked in and they offered us a table near the front of the restaurant, they just said it would be a few minutes. We waited 30. At least we had a seat at the bar. Especially, since they gave away the table they originally promised us.
If you like beef, go for the Lomo Saltado, it's just amazing!

I had reservations yesterday at 630PM (via OpenTable) with my girlfriend to celebrate a personal milestone. I had kept it a surprise from her the whole day and just before we left, she guessed the restaurant based of the address. Needless to say, she was very excited as she loves Italian food and heard good things about Barbacco.
Really good food. Like everyone else said, the Brussels Sprouts are superb. Also, don't be afraid of ordering your own thing - the staff is very accomidating.

Dishes are encouraged to be shared, and if done that way, it's somewhat like Italian tapas with an American twist. Great suggestions from the staff and I had a great meal. Fantastic brussel sprouts too.
What an amazing meal :)

3.5 stars.  We had dinner here and thank you for putting on the Giants during the postseason.  The apps were great, but entrees were oily and needed salt.  Definitely would come back, but plan on ordering a lot of small plates and apps.  Another patron next to us obliviously asked if they could change the channel to a college football game since "no one was watching the Giants" on the path to creating a dynasty.  Thank goodness for good food and common sense at Barbacco.
Loved the food.  Try as many as you can.  It has been a while since I have had suck good bruisshette and squid.  It was too noisy.
Barbacco is the ticket.   Better food, nicer buzz, than Perbacco.  I like Perbacco too, but Barbacco is just more fun and immediate.  Sit at the counter.  The help looks scrumptions.

Fun spot to go after work! My friend and I are a little bit meatball obsessed and we had heard good things about Barbacco meatballs, they did not disappoint! We came here after work on a Friday, we got there around 5:45 and it was pretty empty but it was packed by 6:30.

Completely different atmosphere from Perbacco, the fine dining restaurant next door, which is also very good. Sit at the bar at Barbacco, and you will get perfect service, at least we did. Much more casual than Perbacco, with food more like modern Americanized Italian tapas.  Americanized because, for example, everyone's favorite tapa there is the deep fried Brussel Sprouts. They are terrific, guaranteed, but unlike anything I've ever seen in Italy. Not that Italians don't do deep frying....I'm just saying.
Incredible all around. Fried Brussels, cab on tap, and chitara are to die for. Excellent date spot. I would go back again and again!
Great food and service - went for lunch and had the beef stew.

Nice restaurant in financial district for a quick dinner. I came here with the bf and was promptly seated. We got the Brussels sprouts, spicy meatballs chittara, and the pork ragu. Everything was tasty, but pretty salty. The Brussels sprouts were crispy, but tasted like they were soaked in vbalsamic vinaigrette salad dressing. Not necessarily a bad thing, but after eating 6-7 pieces I was kind of over it. The pasta had great texture and the meatballs were really good. I def would recommend the chittara. Overall, good first experience.
Reservation at. 5 pm.  Was handed the lunch menu- strike. 1
Great spot for lunch and dinner, business or date. Love the poached tuna salad and the pastas are delicious. Excellent wine list on iPads.

I had dinner my first night in town and was floored. First of all, the hostess and servers were so friendly and helpful! I had a billion questions and they were so patient. The food was unreal....I had the Brussels and they were so amazing. Crispy, and fried in duck fat. I could have had them for dinner. I also had the albacore tuna...so good. I loved every bite of this meal! Check them out! Only drawback....they were closed on Sunday for lunch when I tried to go back.:(

Not only do I know them for their consistently delicious office catering, but they have even better goodies for lunch. I was impressed by how addictive their brussel sprouts were! It was decadent! Also, kale salad can be pretty lame, but they juge it up right with flavor. I had a nibble of duck confit salad too and was pleased with its tantalizing taste. Great for business lunches, but leave cocktail hour to Perbacco :)

I came here with my future MIL on a Tuesday night, and we had a fantastic time. The atmosphere is great, the staff are very friendly and make great suggestions, and there are tons of options on the menu. We split two veggie dishes and an entree and were incredibly full. I also had their panna cotta for dessert and it was KILLER. By far one of the best desserts I've had in a long time, and I would go back for it alone!
*Love the atmosphere
Really nice atmosphere,
Pleasantly surprised with my boyfriend's pick to go to Barbacco! The ambience is perfect for a date night, service was great, food was delicious and was all reasonably priced.

I am a fan of their sister restaurant Perbacco so maybe my expectations were set a bit higher than if I've never been to Perbacco. I could definitely tell the difference in terms of food quality/recipe/attention to detail, and customer service- just not as good as Perbacco.
Modern Italian restaurant with a nice ambiance.
Good food, well priced, great service. Solid.
3.5 stars, rounding down.  Nothing really noteworthy.  Nothing bad, nothing great.  Go if you like/want pasta.  Meat dishes are bland.
Two words: Brussels sprouts.

Went to Barbacco to meet up with my roommate after work (he works in the Financial District). We made reservations beforehand, and it's a good thing we did. The place got crowded soon after we were seated at the bar. The place itself was quite small.
This place was really good. Had the bruschetta and fettuccine with chicken. The service was good, food was good. Really can't go wrong here.
The fried polenta and the marinated shrimp were flavorless and the chicken under a brick was dry.  The corn rigatoni was undercooked but the corn saute under it was delicious.

My wife and I went to Barbacco on a Friday night for our 26th anniversary.  When I made our reservation, I had told them about our occasion. When we arrived, the hostess seated us and we were treated to glasses of Spumante by the owner to celebrate our occasion.  That was a very nice touch - totally unexpected.
Man oh man I wanna come back here for dinner!
The service and food was perfect! I highly recommend this restaurant to experience the San Francisco ambiance.

While the service was truly outstanding, we were not at all impressed by the food. We had a pasta dish each, a couple of appetizers, and the fig cake, and while they were quality dishes, we probably won't be going back, given other options in the neighborhood.

Maybe eating Barbacco out of take-out containers at my desk takes away from the experience, but I found the food to be mediocre with nothing particularly memorable about it. I had the chicken under a brick, which was essentially two chicken thighs with herbs and lemon juice served with broccoli rabe. I found the chicken to be too greasy, although once you peeled back the slightly soggy skin, the chicken was tender inside. I also had the sweet corn appetizer, which was mixed with cherry tomatoes and basil. I loved this little salad particularly with the fragrant basil flavor that made the dish bright and refreshing. Overall, the highlight of the meal was the appetizer, while the chicken left me wanting more particularly for the price that I paid.
Good service, a little bit on the loud side, but otherwise a solid choice, and the food was quite tasty. I was a little disappointed with my entrée the last time I was there though.
Outstanding.  I've eaten at Perbacco, but this was the first time at Barbacco.

Everything here is wonderful! Bruschetta meat platter tasty and Brussels sprouts and cauliflower roasted was to die for!  Had the poached tuna salad which was great I like the bite size greens but the tuna had a few scales on it! Hahaha that's fresh! Lol overall love the ambience cool dining chairs and glass water carafes! Will definitely be back!

Mediocre food and worse; rude service. Even though we had reservations the so called table was adjacent to a different group's. Basically we were asked to sit next to strangers because they had a few empty chairs at their table.

Last Friday I was scrambling to find a chill early-ish dinner place in/ near Soma for the same evening. Everything that had 4 stars and above on Yelp did not have any tables available before 9pm. After at least 30 mins of frantically searching, I scored a table for 2 at Barbacco. I was so glad I came! The restaurant is spacious, not too loud, has decent food, good service, and most importantly, very reasonably priced. Will definitely come back again!
Called to make reservation. Hung up after being placed on hold for 10 minutes. Oh well.
Shrimp sandwich - the best sandwich i've had in a while! Juicy shrimp and squid, nicely toasted bread. Definitely coming back.

Corn bread really good, Mac and Cheese good, Fried oysters pretty good, Pork Belly... WTF!? GROSS!... I guess I'm just used to pork belly having a little bit of actual meat (protein). This was all fat. Chubby chasers might like it but I'm more into lean with a little cushion... sorta like the pork belly Chairman Bao fries up. This was NOT that. The place is worth a repeat visit though. I would order all new things probably (well give me the corn bread again! that was the best part).

Great restaurant option in the Union Square area. The food is pretty good but certainly not the best Southern food I've had. They give you free cornbread and butter to start the meal. I went for the fried chicken based on the previous reviews and it was decent but I probably won't opt for it again. Friendly hostess both on the telephone when making a reservation and in person when we arrived.

Wow. I've been hearing about this place and, let me just say, it lives up to the hype. It's busy, but for a reason. Make a reservation if you want to eat there. There was a two hour wait on a Thursday. We started with the black eye pea fritters. SO good. They were salty in a good way. I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the pork chop. Both were amazing. The drinks were good and beer list local and diverse. Excellent customer service. I can't wait to go back and try something new from the menu.

So, I would have recommended this place based on my previous experiences until I went last night. Now I'd say , enter at your own risk. We had a 7 o'clock reservation and I was 5 minutes late but they were nice enough to seat Jovanie before I got there and he put in our drink order and our food order. The drinks were on the table when I got there along with their cornbread in a skillet which was good but will never be better than Kim Alter's version. All good so far. Then, it took 30 minutes for the Brussels sprouts and Mac and cheese to arrive. Yes, apparently it takes 45 minutes to make appetizers here. Oh, and the Mac and cheese was cold. Not cool, not room temperature, Cold. But I was so hungry that I didn't say anything and just ate it.

Three of us split several dishes: black-eyed pea fritters, chicken wings, cheddar grits, brussels sprouts, and pulled pork mac & cheese. All were good, but my favorite was the fritters. Cocktails: the governator and a rye one that I can't recall the name of. Splendid power lunch.

I went here with a couple of great friends of mine but I wasn't impressed. I don't see how this is any kind of attempt on being Southern or Soul food. There grits are instant so that's a few stars lost right there! And when I asked the waiter about there grits he could do anything but look at me, and say that all grits are the same. No sir, I assure you they are not and your lack of knowledge worry me. But for people who have never had real Southern food while still remaining in their comfort zone of upscale bohemian vibe than it's good.

We came here on a recommendation from a friend while we were visiting San Fran who recently moved to the area. (She actually came to meet us for dinner as well.) We perused some options and decided to give this place a shot as we liked the look of the menu. The staff was very friendly, service was prompt and the food was great, particularly the Brussels sprouts and risotto which I ordered. My friend loved the Mac and cheese. I'm a huge Manhattan fan so I got really excited about the bacon Manhattan only to be pretty underwhelmed. I should have went with beer. Overall I would recommend. Probably not for a romantic date though, as it was a bit noisy.

I'll take complimentary cornbread in a mini cast iron skillet over a basket of bread rolls any day. I loved the tri tip sandwich. Bread was fresh, peppers were pickled and creamy aioli didn't hurt. One of the few tri tip sandwiches i could hold in my hands and not have half the sandwich contents fall out. It came with skinny, nicely salted crispy fries. My favorite kind of fries! With dishes like country fried steak with chorizo gravy, fried chicken over creamed collard greens and pork chop with pumpkin it was so hard to decide. My sandwich left me more than content but there's always room for bread pudding! Definitely good .. sugar and all.. though i personally prefer a more moist and gooey bread pudding. I really enjoyed my meal at Hops & Hominy overall. Service was great. Restaurant has a great vibe (although a bit creeped out by the bathroom wallpaper of wispy drawn faces). I'm keeping this bookmarked for brunch. The fried chicken with honey and fruit sounds worthy of another trip back.
Good southern food.  Nice staff.  Accommodated us when we were 15 min late for our reservation.

Not bad for southern food in downtown SF, but not great either. I loved the cheesy grits and the cocktails with sweet tea and peach flavoring. The cornbread that came out with the meal was ok since it was hot and freshly baked but a little on the dry side. The butter had been whipped with something sweet, which was interesting.
I started with the black bean fritters, served up with a yummy yogurt-y sauce. Good, but not epic. They had sexual chocolate wine on the menu, and I was all over it. So damn good.

I ran into this place by chance. It's tucked away in an alley. I was positively surprised by the ambience. It's a largish open place with a rather cheery atmosphere. ordered a pulled pork sandwich, service was surprisingly quick and it was done to satisfaction.  Good selection of beers.
i ate shrimp and grits. lovely food! so many ppl there~~~
Eat here!

As a bar this place is great, but as a restaurant the food is hit or miss and slightly overpriced. I understand that it is downtown SF prices, but this is a place where it's really important to order the right thing in order to not feel jipped.

Great atmosphere and a cool place, but don't ever expect to put your name in and wait for a table a reservation, preferably days ahead, is a must. The cornbread was delicious and the appetizers were really good but the entrees were not anything that special. Would go back for drinks and appetizers but not dinner.

Great place in SF for southern comfort food. Lunch and dinner menus are equally pleasing, change periodically,and please the palate. Not a place to go if you are on a restrictive diet, but if it's your 'cheat' meal, you would be hard pressed to find a better place.
A fun lively spot for a drink or some grub - non-touristy vibe smack dab in the tourist district.
Yummy! Fun! Thanks Katrina for being a wonderful waitress. See you next time we are in San Fran
Delish! Great service.

This place is equivalent to WILLIE & JANE in Venice Beach. The Southern speakeasy feel, the decor, the servers plaid shirts uniform, even the cocktails are oh so similar. But the only difference is, Hops and Hominy is in SF, it's in a small hidden alley and it's awesomely small town home-y.

This place is a solid three, juuust shy of four stars. I loved the ambiance, the corn bread, our cocktails and the service. That being said - I felt like the other food that we ordered was good but it didn't necessarily impress (we had the pork chop and shrimp and grits).

This will definitely be my go-to place for awesome, affordable cocktails in the city. For $10 with premium liquor and ingredients, these drinks pack a punch and are totally, totally worth it!  And you get free cornbread upon arrival.. and don't hesitate to get a nice dollop of that sweet butter on it: the butter is seriously amazing!

I look at all the reviews and I see all great comments people have put. This tells me one thing. SF needs more spots that serve southern cuisine because this place was not great. There fried chicken is at best edible and the shrimp and grits were the worst I ever had. There not grits, it's polenta, no actually it's mash. Drinks were also weak but I like the mason jars. Upside, cool atmosphere and the waiter was nice. Menu needs work but I hope you make it.
Awesome waitress, super nice. Good food, good wine, good service, what more could you want

This place changed my life! It was incredible! They do a good job of making down home Southern food upscale without being pretentious. I had the fried chicken with a biscuit and creamed (I know, what?!) collards. I also had the gin fizz cocktail. The meal was so good I didn't order dessert because I wanted to savor my dinner for the rest of the night. Can't wait to go back and visit!

Really great little gem. Nice take on southern food with options to suit all tastes. I had the fried oysters, which were AMAZING, and the kale salad with shrimp. Also enjoyed a really nice bubbly cocktail (can't remember the name). Thought the beer, cocktail and wine list was great. But back to the oysters for a minute: juicy with delicious batter...yum!! If you're looking for something different for a business lunch or even if you're sightseeing around Union Square, I would definitely recommend this place.

Really marginal. Ordered tri-tip steak sandwich, all bread and little meat, lots of gristle. Supposed to have horseradish, did not get. About 45 minutes to get order.  Very hot in restaurant, noisy, and I won't be back
When you walk into this place you immediately feel cooler. ;-)
Great food, great customer service. Tough to get a reservation but a must try in the Bay Area.
Love this place! The wait staff is genuinely kind ( and that's coming from an ex-server), the hosteses are sweet as pie.

This place is AMAZING!! The food... YUM!!! This goes for the drinks as well.. The bartenders Brendan and Will are super sweet. I come here a lot after work to grab a drink, dinner and watch the giants game.

I went to Hops and Hominy with my co-workers for a team meeting, and sat down to small appetizers and drinks. I realized as I was walking up to it that it was formerly Azul (a nightclub back in 2010). I had been there once in its heyday before it got shut down.
Very interesting take on southern cooking.  Loved both the cornbread and the country fries steak.  Excellent beer selection to boot.
I like this place. Went here for lunch and have been for happy hour a few times. Lunch was nice and quiet, while happy hour was hoppin' (haha get it?)

Just went here tonight and enjoyed the food and service. I had the chicken and dumplings which was great and my boyfriend had fried steak. The beer selection was amazing and very unique.  The service was wonderful our waitress was very attentive and great.  We are from the south and have never had southern food like this. It is a wonderful unique take and the butter that comes with the complimentary cornbread is the best!
Real pleasant meal, the house burger, corn bread and mac&cheese!!
Delicious Southern food with a modern culinary twist.

This restaurant is "off the hook"!  My husband and I had a date night here and we have no complaints. Food, drink, and service were awesome; the chef, David, even came out to our table to check-in on us - sheer southern hospitality.
Great Southern mains and apps; dessert menu needs some work.
Excellent menu selection. I had 2 super tacos for under $8. Both were good and a good portion size. Get here early because the line quickly fills up with people.

My bf and I went here for dinner last night. It was around 9 pm but there were still several people waiting to be seated. Crazy on a Thursday night! I have been here a few times before but my man hasn't so I was excited to bring him here so he can try the food. The first thing he said walking - in was.. "Baby, it smells good in here". The hostess said there's a 35 minute wait but we didn't mind. We sat inside as we watch people coming in to the restaurant. People keep coming and it is passed 9:15! We both loved it since it gave him an impression that the food will be good. We got seated after 25 minutes. We started with the Platanos Fritos: Sweet, fried plantains, black beans, Mexican crema. They came up so warm and well cooked. So soft that it melts your mouth. The black beans were cooked so well; it didn't tasted bitter at all.
Fantastic margaritas, great street tacos, enthusiastic staff, good happy hour deals. Enough said.

This place is great for lunch or dinner depending on what you are looking for.  I go here at least once a month for lunch and get their super burrito which is delicious.  They also have free chips and salsa as well as a salsa bar with a wide assortment to choose from.  Any Mexican restaurant that has a wide variety of salsas I usually find myself happy with.  Their orange sauce is awesome and I definitely recommend it.

One of the best Happy Hour deals in the South of Market/ Convention Center area of San Francisco. But you have to hurry because the place fills up as soon as 4pm hits. The quesadillas with chicken or steak and the nachos with chicken or steak are the best deals from 5-8 bucks. You can't go wrong! That alongside with affordable margaritas and well drinks during Happy Hour, plus a buzzy crowd makes Tropisueno your best option before a movie at the Century Theatre or the AMC nearby or a meeting convention center or just hanging out with friends when needing an affordable option. I highly recommend this place, not necessarily remarkable but always affordable.

I've seen so many of my friends ' reviews of this place and passed by it numerous times.  I thought it was more of a traditional restaurant setting because it looked like it was everytime I'd pass by it, plus since they take reservations in the evening.  So, I chose to meet my aunt there for a lunch break.

Came here early with a group of work friends. When we arrived we were pretty rudely told that we would need to get up at 7 for a reservation already in place. Completely understand the reservation thing but it was such a turnoff the way they approached the situation.

i was with my friends in happy hour on thurday and the waiter that  we got  was a little one nasty we ask  him if he could pick up the curtain because we want see out side he said not for a rule of the restaurant after two rounds of drinks we pay the bill and in less that  five minutes this man came and told us we have to leave the  table to other costumer. i think that was very ignorant.
I have been here a few times now and it is amazing every time. Margaritas are great and the food is even better. They also give you chips and a trio of salsa. This is one of my favorite restaurants.

This place is incredible. My boyfriend and I came here for the first time on Saturday afternoon. The line wasn't too long, and the food was brought to our table in less than 10 minutes. We each got a combination plate with 2 items (they come with rice and beans, too) and holy guacamole the portions are HUGE. Had we known, we wouldn't have ordered so much! It was great, though. There are tons of salsa options. It was a little too chilly to sit outdoors, but the inside tables were still nice. Inexpensive. Margaritas are yummy. 5 stars!

Great service and ambiance but I wasn't 100% happy with my meal here. My mom and I got the guacamole and chips and four soft tacos. The guacamole was delicious and the portion was generous. They also had a great salsa bar with a variety of salsas to choose from. I thought it was nice they included a section in the salsa bar for extra cilantro and radishes. The downside of my experience here however was the tacos. The meat was well seasoned but nothing amazing. The tortilla was really hard and not steamed properly. I'm thinking this isn't a normal thing for them -- I probably caught them at a bad time. Will come back to try again.

Came here for lunch and had the enchilada plate.  I got one steak and one chicken.  Everything had great flavor.  I usually don't eat beans but the refried had a good taste. The rice had a good kick.  In all the whole plate made me appreciate the whole meal more. Lunch is served fast causal style.  You order then get a number to wait for your food to be brought. I think dinner time is more of a sit down affair. The line is long but moves fast. The tables turn over quickly too during lunch. I will be back.
Food is Awesome... worth the wait (there was a long queue when we went.) The salsa bar with atleast 8 - 10 types was my favorite part, and they served fresh chips to go with that.
The decor is enough to step foot inside the building! It has sort of a Mediterranean feel to it, but almost Havana-like, which I guess would be Casablanca-esque.
Happy Hour Report:
They use queso on some dishes, without noting it on the menu, so watch out if you're pregnant...

A popular place recommended by lots of different sources including locals.  In town for a conference, and craving good Cali Mexican food (coming from Hawaii).  Service was good and at expectation.  Ambiance was busy and loud, but it was a Saturday dinner at 7:30pm.  Food was uncomplicated, straight forward, and flavorful.  Had the carne asado taco and chicken enchilada combo, friends got the hanger steak dish (forgot the name sorry).  All around very satisfied with our Cali Mexican food fix.  Bonus: it was right out the door from the Marriott Marquis where we stayed.
I've been here many times covering all times of the day from breakfast to lunch to happy hour to dinner!

Had the most amazing pollo asado tacos there. They were perfectly seasoned and the chicken was so tender. Some of the best chicken tacos I've ever had. Their salsa sampler that comes before the meal was also a nice treat, delicious!

I love this place. Good prices, large portions, authentic fresh food that is so flavorful and cute inside! The flauta was my favorite and made with corn tortilla instead of flour like most places make.

This place was good. Really good. We came here with a group of six for my brother's  bday, and boy oh boy this place delivered. Fantastic ambience, great server who helped my dad and stepmom find more "American" Mexican dishes (I.e, quesadillas, lol). But really the food here is fantastic! Loved their guacamole, salsas, habanero mango margarita (the waiter was worried I didn't like it because I had to take breaks to enjoy the spiciness level but it was really tasty). I definitely will be back for a date night with my husband :)
Solid spot for some good tacos for lunch or dinner. Make reservations for groups as it is fairly popular. Chicken mole was yummy!

Last night was my birthday, so my husband decided to take me to dinner anywhere I wanted.  We are new to the east bay, so we asked one of our new friends where a good spot for great Mexican food.  He told us the best place to go was to head into the city and trying Tropisueno.  My google map said it was only 20 minutes away, plus it was still pretty early, so we figured "why not?!"

Came for a quick night snack with a couple of friends. I tried the beef tacos and they were amazing. Very tasty. My friends got the different ceviche plates and they were all good. Would get 5 stars but the hostess was a little rude and unwelcoming, so they lose a star for that. Otherwise would come here again most definitely.
Enjoyed our late night meal on a Wednesday after the Giants' World Series Win. The best item is the chicken soup. To die for! And it's huge! Not to mention the rice and pinto beans, just heavenly.
Dinner for two at 10:45PM after a world series game.  A nice walk from AT+T park (.9 mi) on the way back to Marriot Marquis (Moscone area).

I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant - after all, we're not in the Mission but I'm a fan. It's a beautiful, spacious restaurant that serves HUGE portions at affordable prices. Their salsa's and Margarita's are amazing. Friendly staff too.

We arrived at around 4pm on a Saturday and it was kind of chaotic. It was not clear where to go and who was in charge. Once we figured out that you order at the window we took a seat in the bar (not at the bar). It took sometime to realize that no one was going to take a drink order, so we walked up to the bar to order. The restaurant opens at 5:30pm, and it was then that our table in the bar started to get regular service. Once we figured out how it all worked, we really enjoyed ourselves. The food was very tasty. I would definitely go back.

Best Mexican food. Mole is outstanding. Tortillas are home made. Chips and three kinds of salsa are great.  Chips are thin and after the three requisite bowls I am not stuffed. A gem and you need to come here but reservations are a good idea. Final tip. Try margarita with mango and jalapeño. You'll need at least two. Really.... Go here.

This place is great for workday lunches.  There's always a line, but it moves pretty fast.  The food here is always rich flavorful and delicious.  My favorite is the Tropisueno Torta, which is a sandwich with three kinds of meats on it.  They have bowls of chips and a salsa bar with several varieties.  There is plenty of seating indoors and out.

My boyfriend and I made reservations here while visiting from Philly, in town for the Nike Women's Marathon. We came based on the other reviews and the closeness to our hotel. The décor and ambiance of the place was so great! I loved the lighting and the feel of the place. It didn't feel chainey or like it was trying too hard. I'm a vegan and they had a tofu dish on the menu but I asked the waiter if they could accommodate me by making the enchiladas without cream or cheese and with veggies.. It wasn't an issue and they were delicious. The salsas were tasty and the portions were hefty. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal as well. Our bill was about $30 for the two of us... It was a steal! I wish I could have taken my left overs but our hotel didn't have a fridge! Great eats in San Fran :)

There's not too many medium-high end Mexican places in SF, but this place is pretty solid. I wish they had more veggie items though. I haven't tried any of the meat products there but they sound fantastic. Their ceviches are really good. Service is prompt and with a smile, even when the place is slammed. The drinks are really good too. The salsas that come with the chips are great, I like how there's 3 different kinds of different textures and flavor profiles.

I was brought here recently with some workmates. I am usually skeptical of Mexican food outside of the mission, but my expectations were by far exceeded here. Tropisueño is a beautiful Mexican place that manages to combine affordability, decent ambiance, and very good food. Good rice and beans. Meat is tasty and of good quality.
To sum it up:
Always here at lunch. Great shrimp burritos...guac and tacos.

Portions are plenty and quality is pretty good. I got the chicken quesadilla. I could not finish it myself. They have a salsa bar so go crazy. The waiters who bring your food (you order at the counter) are really hard working and accommodating. Tip them!
Great margaritas!!!!

Always love this place whether it be for lunch, happy hour, or dinner.  I've had the tacos for lunch/happy hour, mango ceviche & enchiladas for dinner.  The spicy mango margarita is amazing, reminds me of those mexican lolly pop candies!

This place is great for happy hour!  Margaritas are $6.50, tacos are $2.50, Fernet shots are $3 (unheard of!).  The portions are very generous and chips and salsa are free!  It's hard these days to find free chips and salsa in the Bay area.
Got the pollo asado. Chicken was tender, and the sides on the plate were pretty good. Could've  used more veggies, but I usually think that for everything.

The Kefta Kabob and Chicken Shawarma are fantastic! The folks working here are friendly and efficient and the line always moves quickly. Also it's amazing that they always know who ordered what and I've yet to see them screw up an order. This is definitely my go-to spot for mediterranean wraps!

Chicken shawarma i love you!! Haha Oasis grill is basically right next to Embarcadero bart and it's so convenient. I never get sick of this place. The chicken is juicy and there are so many flavors going on. SO many sauces in there. Ask for spicy!! (: The portion size is huge too...you get so full...
Yum!  Just opened up recently (near Mission on 1st St).  I'm a huge fan of the Greek salad and ask for a dollop of the cucumber/yogurt on it.  Very generous portion and yummy.
Oh mann... I am going here again very soon.

the service here is so good. there's a guy who remembers everyone and greets them happily. one of the all time best things about oasis though is that they don't try to upcharge you if you want a little extra sauce on your wrap. that makes a huge difference.
Taste is great, one of the best shrawarma I find in SF.

The food is fantastic, and the service is stellar. These guys work HARD getting everyone's orders out in a timely manner, even during the lunch rush. Line out the door doesn't mean you'll be waiting for your food for long. Spicy chicken shawarma is my recommendation.
Long wait from 11:30 to 1:30. Good prices, good amounts of food. The Falafel was okay but the chicken schwarma was amazing.

This place is the shit!! And the owner is a boss for making 15 wraps at once during the World Series parade rush. He remembered everyone's order and was able to match orders with faces when the place was so crowded it was so hard to get through. But he did everyone's order within a couple of minutes. BOMB! Best gyro I've had in a while
get the beef & lamb gyro under the lavish wraps menu and just eat here. you won't regret it.
Excellent food and super efficient, hard working operators. Passing up on the German Ritter Sport chocolates is hard too.
Very solid if you want a tasty shwarma (all I've had so far). They are grilled too, which is a nice touch and adds some great subtle flavor.
Fresh, crisp and spicy. Hands down, these guys make the best falafel I've had in years. I am definitely coming back!
Great food and price for the FIDI!

This is a go-to place for many during lunch so the line is long...but definitely worth the wait.  I always get the beef and lamb gyro wrap. It hits the spot. I like Mediterranean food and have been to a few others in the fidi neighborhood, but this one is by far the best. I would give it five stars if we could dine in.

Long line, but good food. That pretty much sums it up. Came here for lunch for the first time this past week. I was surprised at how long the line was, but it moved pretty quickly (they have the operation down - each person taking multiple orders at once). I got the Spicy Chicken Shawarma and it was a solid choice. It was extremely filling - they do not skimp out on the meat. Although, I was extremely full afterwards, I didn't feel satisfied.. I felt like something was missing in regards to the flavor or ingredients. ...still haven't been able to pinpoint what it was, but maybe you can. Overall it was a good meal, but I wish it was a great one.
Update on 10/13/2014: I always try their shawarmas and decided to go for their greek salad with spicy chicken with a side of pita bread. DELICIOUS! I love everything here!

I decided to take a chance and try out a new place for lunch today and boy was I glad that I stumbled into the Oasis. Seriously, this was the best falafel I've ever had in my life. I watched them shape it from fresh chickpea flour and deep fry it right in front of me. I got the spicy falafel wrap and it was AMAZING!!! Just the right amount of spice and the portion size was enormous! Some Mediterranean places give you a tiny wrap on tiny pita bread and leave you feeling hungry afterwards, not at the Oasis!

I really like this place. The food is yummy and quick, even though the line starts forming immediately when lunch starts (and earlier). I come around 11:30ish and the line is already out the door (ok, this place is pretty tiny inside), but it took about 20 minutes from waiting in line, ordering, paying, waiting, leaving.

I can never finish a plate by myself. They just give so much food, but it's not like I'm complaining or anything. I love this place! I heard it's busy at lunchtime on weekdays, so I suggest going in the evening when it's less crowded. Either way, totally worth it. I ordered their chicken plate, which comes with an insane amount of chicken and rice, as well as three sides. If possible, get the hummus. It's DELICIOUS. The food is fresh, and the service is okay, but hey I'm here for the food. Stop by someday!

I decided to give this place a few days before doing this review. I decided to try this place out per recommendation of a coworker. After ordering my Lamb Wrap and paying I stood in the back of the place and watch to make sure I got the right wrap. Low and behold there was a freakin cockroach crawling up and down the back wall. What made it worse was one of the worker was watching it. I gave him the look like dude are you going to at least freakin kill it. I knew that should have been a sign to throw that wrap in the garbage but I gave it a try. Have eating less than half of it back at my desk and be yelled at that I should not eat it by coworkers I threw it out. Lets just say I had a stomach ache all Saturday! I will never ever try this place again! I wish i would have taken picture of it because I went at 12 which I guess is this place's prime time since the line was out the door! Thankfully it was one bug! Word of advice maybe tell your employees if they see one to freakin kill! at least.

This time around I ordered our staff lunch from Muhamed. I was SO happy that our lunches arrived on time. And the delivery guy was even able to pronounce everyone's names correctly.  They got everything right. And everything tasted great. Our staff was happy and so was I. So thanks Muhamed and Oasis Grill for a fabulous lunch!

I do not get why so many yelpers gave more than two stars to this restaurant. My husband and I were definitely deceived by the good reviews:/. We tried the chicken and kabob wraps. We also got the humus and the cucumber yogurt mezzes.
Awful.  Stale falafel.  Gyro in strange wrap not pita. Soggy and sloppy.  Tasted bad. Wasted over $30 on food from here
We hosted a lunch for a business and I had to provide lunch for 15 people. I am in San Diego, and Oasis was recommended.
Oasis Grill was my #1 favorite lunch spot of the summer. The gyros and falafel are great, but the chicken shawarma is PERFECTION. Can't recommend this place highly enough.
This place is fantastic. If you like shawarma or gyros this is the place for you. I got the spicy chicken shawarma and couldn't have been happier.

Went here for the first time today and ordered a chicken shawarma & falafel combo spicy! Spice factor is pretty mild but I think it makes a world of difference compared to the regular chicken shawarma which I also tried. Definitely one of the most filling lunches I've ever had in the FiDi for under $10. (Plus they sell Kinder chocolates and the harder to find Ritter Sports!)

Some of the best falafel that I have had. Really friendly and fast service, also inexpensive. The falafel wrap is gigantic, a meal in itself. Get the spicy version! Everything tastes homemade here and it's a great location near BART/MUNI. Only two stools to sit on, so maybe take your food somewhere else. I will definitely go back, yum!
What I Ordered: Beef and Lamb Gyro
Were stopping by to get something to eat on the way home.

The food they make is great! it's authentic, fresh, and the taste will send you over the moon and back! Also, they have German chocolates for sale! And if you are a foodie, then you know that German chocolate is amazing!
So I was craving Mediterranean food one day at work and vaguely remembered almost walking straight into a wall of people lined up outside some dumpy looking restaurant on Drumm Street.

After debating lunch options for what seemed like hours (I wanted pizza, he wanted a sandwich), I stumbled upon previous Yelp reviews of Oasis Grill. When we walk up, the place is deserted and my husband gives me that look. You know, the "what have you gotten me into?" look.
had a lamb gyro that was the size of my head.  it was awesome.  good prices and friendly faces! also open on sundays when everything else in the area is closed.

I have been trying everthing from wraps to grilled wraps , plates ..... food is so delicious that i can resist my self going there everday ....... fast and friendly service , nice owner , great food .....  5 star.... must try :)
Very good! Will be back for more shawerma soon.
Delicious!  Stumbled on this by accident while visiting san fran, what a find.  I had the chicken wrap and was amazing....now Going back this weekend to try something else:)
We got the chicken shawarma and messa plate. The babaganoush was nice and the tabooli..the rest was nice but not spectacular

Food was delicious and a good value for downtown SF, but OMG, may I PLEASE redesign their front of house layout!? It's chaos and ends up with disgruntled customers even before their food is made! They are very busy at lunch time with a line out the door.  That's great. City folk are used to standing in line for good food. When you get to the front of the line to order, you don't know it because there are dozens of people milling around and blocking the entrance who have already ordered and don't know to go outside and get in the OTHER line to pay! The order takers have to yell through the crowd to tell the next person it is their turn to order and they need to fight their way up to the counter. By the time someone in the front of the payment line tells the folks who are milling around after ordering that they need to go outside and get in line to pay, they are five or ten people behind where they should be if they had known or if the person who took their order bothered to tell them to go outside and get in the payment line. I like this place, the food is good and they put it together nicely. I worry that lots of people just leave without paying because it would be so easy to do. While you are milling around not knowing where to pay, and your order taker yells to get your attention and hand you your food, there is nothing preventing you from just walking away without paying. No one would know in that chaos! I want them to get paid for their food. I don't want customers cranky because they stood around for five minutes before someone told them they needed to get in the payment line. Their popularity requires that they set up a better system. It would be so easy! I hope the flow is different the next time I go! Five stars for the food. Three stars for the customer experience.
This place was THEEEEEEEE BEST! Ivan is an amazing bar tender!!!!!!!!!!!!! Great time. And all of the food is so delicious.

This place is awesome. It reminds me of a very special place in my heart: Vegas. Haha have you ever been to a Lavo champagne brunch? Well, if you haven't, this place is pretty similar sans the half naked people in slutty outfits and huge crowd.

This is probably one of the few bars in the area that is not packed post work on a weekday.  I came in around 6:00pm or so and there were plenty of stools to sit on.  They have a limited amount of tap brews to get and a lot of bottles on site.  Most of them veer towards the Belgian/White Ale sort of thing with a few IPA thrown in.  The food is what I was digging.  I tried the chicken tacos and even though the tortilla was super small, the filling itself was great!  The mini tortilla barely could hold all of that together.  Also had the parmesan truffle fries when I got my 2nd beer.  It was a good pairing with the beer and it wasn't a small amount either, perfectly suited to be shared for two people.
It's a little confusing whether this place is The Pink Elephant or Alibi.  Either way I'd say its important to note with friends when meeting up!
Went here for brunch this last weekend for their self serve bottomless mimosa bar.
Place was lively in sat at noon! Only gripe was they kept asking to clear plates and Bill came before we asked!
Showed up late in the evening because Dave's was packed and I was looking for a bar that served snacks. Overall, this place is alright, but nothing impressed me.

Lots of beer selections, especially Belgium.  Pretty cool place but I feel like the tables could be a lot cleaner.  Otherwise, the happy hour menu is not bad. $5-6 wines and well drinks.  Lots of seating. Appetizers and fingers food is alright but pricey is a bit steep.
Brunch review only!

Holy moly! Self serve mimosa bar with 20 flavors is enough for the 5 stars. Luckily we had a Groupon $25 for $50 worth of food! The smoked salmon Benedict on the biscuit was delicious even though it didn't need to be!

This place was SO. STUPIDLY. LOUD. It's set up as a pretty regular-looking place, with lots of tall tables and a long bar, with TVs above the bar - but the music was annoying-bro-club loud. The focus is Belgian beer, but the food is all Latin, and they were playing some crazy loud Enrique Iglesias. It all seemed like an odd confluence of styles. Our plantains with black bean puree were very yummy, but the guacamole and salsa fell flat. The beer selection looked interesting, but we couldn't agree and settled for a vodka tonic, which was tolerable but weak.
Great food, and server, but the DJ train wreck and mindless sound volume ruins the party scene for Saturday brunch.
On a week day Pink Elephant:
Great place to have a good time and enjoy delicious food and cocktails. They now offering entertainment every Friday night I will check it out this week and see what is like!!!

I came in here thinking this would be an awesome place to catch the games on Sunday and grab mimosas...definitely not the business. Food was average at best and mimosas were whatevers...they have a bucket that has Nasty spoons that you use pour mixers with your overpriced "Andre" champagne. Music was whatevers for the most part...live DJ but he was definitely average at best. I think what ticked me off the most was the fact that a bar like this does not subscribe to a proper cable/dish service and I was forced to watch the game on my phone...almost seemed like they were using dial up to stream games on the tv and fairly embarrassing to watch the dude behind the bar struggle to load the games. Overall, pretty whack experience...probably won't go back

Went there on a friday, it was decent. There are no mimosas that day but there is  a lot of beer to choice from. I got the quesadilla, it was good. Not something out of this world. The service is what was weird about this place. I kept having to try and get their attention to pour me water, they are really inattentive about that, despite the fact that there weren't many people there. They have big screens at the bar so this place would be a good place to watch games. I was not super amused though.

Stumbled upon this place with a peer in a big conference week in the city. The atmosphere is great with the best selection on beers in town specially Belgian beers. The service amazing though a packed place with the SF Giants playoff game on TV. Must go place hidden near Moscone.

An interesting location with cool decor and fun music for Saturday brunch. The eggs Benedict are fantastic, though the hollandaise is a bit salty. Great home fries with feta! Juice bar is awesome, with dozens of options. Sassy bacon is to die for. Good service also!

The Pink Elephant is like brunch club madness. You've got self-serve bottomless mimosas in a bunch of different flavors with good tunes blasting at you from the DJ booth. All of that is great, if you're in the mood for it, but be warned that it's really loud in there, so if you're with a big group, you're not going to be able to talk to most of the people you're with without shouting (and even then, they probably won't be able to hear you, as my group quickly learned). But moving on...

I never write a review, and it so happens that the one or two times that I do write a review, it is on a place that was extremely disappointing.  I have been here once in August prior to my horrible experience.  I went here with some friends and already did not have a great impression of this place but decided to come again.

I'm here to watch game 6 of the World Series their TV is connected to the Internet and the connection sucks!! Service sucks as well. Half hour to get my drink order and had to follow up. If not, I don't think I'll get it. Truffle fries I had to pick up myself from the table by the kitchen. By the time it reached my table it's already cold. Being from the hotel and restaurant industry this establishment needs to work very hard to make it.

Alibi is a great spot to hang out and enjoy some beer and grub.  They have a huge selection imported German beers and on Wednesday, they usually feature one of those beers.  They have some cool mugs too for some of those beers.  Really its a good beer spot.

Such an awesome hidden spot!! Their brunch is amazing! They have bottomless mimosas with so many different flavors - its a pour-it-yourself set up so you can pick whatever flavor you want. They food is also amazing! I got a duck benedict and it was phenomenal! Highly recommend if you can find it! :)

Chilled with a couple of the bartenders who were great. Awesome music and atmosphere. Upbeat but not douchie or ghetto. Drinks were good - only had the fries which were bangin. Overall great experience.

Nope nope nope. If you look like you just walked out of an Old Navy ad and you don't mind bros hitting on you, this is your joint. There is no character here and the food isn't worth the atmosphere. Super douchetastic. The servers were nice but there may not be a hostess? We just stood there until the bar took pity on us and got us help. The French toast is tasty, the burger wasn't good, the eggs benny also not great. The menu is limited, and not in a fancy way, and there is no coffee... AT A BRUNCH JOINT.

If you can overlook what can only be described as a spring break dance party for tech workers, the MR beef burger for him and bottomless mimosa bar for her make this place a real contender for my SF brunch dollars.

Really awesome place to hang. I'm not a drinker, I admit, but I'm always looking for the perfect place to hang and chill with friends after a hard day. This place was entirely SF in its flavor and a great place to catch up with good company.
good place,  good people, good food. what else can you ask for? It's my go-to place to  socialize with buddies on the weekend

Maybe I'm just getting old, but 6 friends of mine and I strolled in here for brunch on a Sunday morning and thought the in-house DJ blasting hits at 11am was a bit much. Maybe it's because we were hungover from the night before...

First time coming to The Pink Elephant after hearing from friends how great this place was but after coming here, I'd only come back for a night event. We went here for brunch on a Sunday morning; there's an in house DJ playing music while you eat your food, drink, and watch Sunday football.

Brunch review - For all those recommendations on the sassy bacon, DELETE THOSE COMMENTS.  The sassy bacon was the biggest disappointment I've had in food eating history.  When someone tells you they're serving you bacon, you expect some delicious ass bacon because, of course bacon is delicious by itself.  What is the sassy bacon? The sassy bacon is PORK JERKY, sweet teriyaki PORK JERKY.  So if you want a cold dry sweet spicy piece of pork jerky feel free order the shit outa it.  If you had in your head that you wanted some delicious hot salty greasy bacon, then prepared to be let down..........................Eggs benny was aight and thats all folks

An excellent happy hour spot in FiDi! It is one of the few places in the city that plays ratch hip hop - a bar after my own heart (: I came at 5:30PM on a Friday and it was pretty packed but my party of 5 was still able to get a standing table pretty easily.
Could be better service. People don't have all day to be here during lunch. Slow service and not attentive to update the patrons on changes.

The Pink Elephant's located down a weird alley. This adds to the uniqueness of this place. The place has some very interesting paintings and a very very nice looking bar. There's a few TVs in this place that they played some sports game on.

They have a full menu on weekdays for lunch and dinner, but only serve brunch on weekends. Even so, the brunch menu is quite decent, with a selection of omelette, eggs benedict, french toast, and a variety of burgers.
The food was decent and the beer selection was good, but the place reeked of auto fumes and ran uncomfortably hot.

Crystal is one of the managers here and she rocks!  She took a shot of Fernet with me and is super cool.  Ivan is super awesome too.  I like to buy shots for people who will take them with me and they were down so this place gets 5 stars immediately!  Good food too!  Truffle fries.... Get this, free bacon during happy hour!! Whaaaat!?!?  Go here, nuff said.

Came here for my brother's birthday, great music[thanks to the live DJ], delicious craft beer, and affordable drunchies. The lights are dim and the evironment is ecstatic. Restrooms are clean and most of all the staff is extremely friendly, the waitress checked in every now and then to make sure we were good. I have to say this is the best experience I have ever had at a gastropub and I definitely recommend taking a visit. Definitely coming back **

Meh. The brunch is good, especially the potatoes, but the portions are small and you'l likely leave still hungry.  I've heard good stuff about their happy hour though so...I'll be back (in Arnold's voice).

Don't usually leave reviews but this place deserves it! Staff is way beyond friendly, they also have a wide selection of beers to choose from, their "Sassy bacon" is mouthwatering. Overall, a very chill place to grab a couple of drinks and hang with friends or down a boot of beer! Haha

been using yelp but never cared enough to review. the sandwich was amazing i was compelled to write this post! i was looking for cheap lunch in the financial district and it is a few steps away from the transamerica building. the service was ridiculously nice though it was just a guy making me a vietnamese sandwich. i asked for extra spicy and he put the hot sauce in it and gave me a side habenero sauce. i loved it and he said next time just tell him to put habenero sauce in it too.

Pretty solid place for sandwiches. I've only ever gotten the banh mi, which has a great mix of vegetables and flavors. If you're in the area for lunch, it's definitely a place to try out. Sandwiches are cheap and pretty filling.

Ugh - took a chance on this place for lunch and it was a mistake. I ordered the combination pork and chicken Bahn Mi.  It was completely slathered with mayo on all sides and the meat did not seem very high quality.  I could barely finish half of my sandwich and left the rest on top of a trash can.  This was definitely the worst Bahn Mi that I've tried in SF.  Make sure you ask them to hold the mayo or go extremely light.  At least it was light on the wallet - may try something else eventually but it won't be any time soon.
Fresh sandwiches, LOVE the wheat bread (it's not your typical sliced wheat bread), and of course, love my favorite, cranberry turkey sandwich!

I don't often get to the City.  So when I was able to take a class in SF, I looked forward to sampling some of the more popular lunch places.  I'd been craving banh mi thit nuong all week, so when I read all the great reviews for banh mi, I thought I found the spot.  So I ordered the BBQ pork banh mi online and picked it up minutes later.  I'd read about the lines, but there wasn't any at 12:15 on a Thursday.  They're very nice, and the shop is pretty clean, especially for the area.  I took my sandwich to go, and opened it at the classroom.  It turns out that BBQ pork doesn't mean thit nuong, but rather thinly sliced roast pork.  It killed my sandwich right there.  Then there is the huge piece of lettuce.  Why?  Oh well, the sandwich was okay.  The bread was actually quite good, but there weren't enough jalapenos either, and my banh mi thit nuong craving was left unfulfilled.  I will not be going back.  Maybe I should have checked if there were any Vietnamese people giving this place a good review.
My team liked this catering spot. Solid banh mi (not great) and spring rolls.
I'll repeat what someone else said, the chicken had an odd rubbery texture, but their vegetarian sandwiches are excellent.
Order online to maximize ordering process efficiency!  I prefer Eat24 app and website, but that's just a personal preference.
I'm a fan!
This is a great lunch spot for take out.

I have been here twice for lunch. The first time I ordered was a little bit confusing because there is also a tea place inside, and nobody was standing at the Munchboxx counter. But eventually, someone came to the cash register from the back and took my order.
This review is for lunch time in the Fi-Di.
The Vietnamese chicken and pork sandwiches are so effing good. And the people are nice.  AND there's a boba place in the same storefront!

I was so impressed by this hole-in-the-wall. Tucked in the financial district, one can enjoy the crunch of the bread and the explosion of flavors! The veggies are fresh and the meats are moist. Go for the Vietnamese sandwiches!

MunchBoxx is going to be my destination banh mi shop if I'm in Downtown SF again. No real complaints about the Half BBQ Pork Half Five-Spice Chicken sandwich -- it's awfully tasty, finger-licking scrumptious, and absolutely filling for lunch or quick dinner. A few comments: I've never seen romaine lettuce included in a banh mi and some cucumber would help lighten it up. I also didn't really detect the distinct five-spice flavor in the chicken, though the meat is juicy.
- Half pork half chicken with an egg
This review is for wedding catering.

Their banh mi was delicious for 5.29. Add an egg for a dollar and it was a heaping mass of ham, pork, daikon, carrots, and romaine lettuce, with crumbled eggs and a paste of vietnamese mayo. A winner for lunch.
Tried this a second time, and while it wasn't as disappointing as the first, it still didn't wow me. If Saigon Sandwich is 5 stars, this has gotta be 3.
You know that whole gluten free craze? Well, it's not the business for me. My body is built on sammiches =)

I'm a fan of the breakfast basile! The amount of spice perfectly complements the avocado and cheese and egg. The only complaint I had was that I'd wish I got it on a croissant. I think the texture would have suited the ingredients better.
Another good lunch option!
