Came here because I was grabbing a Cool Tea Bar drink. Ordered a  1/2 pork  1/2 chicken with no jalapenos and cilantro. The sandwich was pretty big. Inside lots of veges. Meat was an ok amount(I need more meat!!!). Taste was really good. The meat was not barbecue burnt. Cooked really well. Tender and flavorful. Definitely can taste the pate. Bread was like a toasted subway sandwich. About 8-9 inches long (that's not what she said) Overall, good sandwich :).

I started coming here for the Breakfast Basile which is a "secret menu," I suppose(: But I alternate between the Breakfast Basile and the veggie & avocado sandwich. The way the bread is toasted is perfect in my opinion and the cashier & cook(?) are super nice. It helps that it's a block away from my work too.
I will preface this by saying this is based on 1 visit and on the Vietnamese Tofu Sandwich.

Amazing croissant vietnamese sandwich for less than $4 before tax!  And the sandwiches are  much bigger and better than the sandwiches in saigon express in ec4.  Pastrami sandwiches are great also.  This is the best value sandwich in the fidi!
If you're in the mood for a 'regular' sandwich or a Vietnamese sandwich and you're in the area, this is the place to go.

Might order ahead of time next time bc the wait can be a little long. The sandwich itself was ok- wasn't rely my favorite preparation of pork or chicken. A little more expensive than other places I got Banh Mi, but could be worse.
the veggie vietnamese sandwich here is very good. i add avocado and hold mayo.
Delicious. I got the half pork, half chicken Vietnamese sandwich and it was great. Service was good and it's always nice to stay under $10 for a sandwich, chips and drink.
Came here because of all the great Yelp reviews & because it's close to my coffee shop.

Good Lunchtime spot for Vietnamese Sandwiches in this area of SF. service is fast, and you can get a sandwich with chips and drinks for under $10. Most importantly, the sandwiches taste good for the price!
Solid Vietnamese sandwich.  The best part is the roll, not too hard but still crunchy, very unique. The carrots rock too.  I didn't try the American style sandwich yet but will soon

I've been here probably 50 times now and have decided that the cranberry turkey sandwich should be had on a sourdough roll with Swiss cheese and all the fixings because when it done as such it is the best sandwich possibly in the world... Staff is super nice and if you don't go exactly at noon, the turn around time gets you out of there always in just a few minutes. It's just about a perfect $7 lunch spot!
Good food, friendly staff, great location, speedy service.

Found this place through Go Dish. Admit I giggled at the name. My turkey cranberry on ciabatta was delicious! As I ordered, I mentioned in passing that I only eat half my sandwich at a time and he delivered half on the tray and half already wrapped to go. It was a small touch that was really awesome.

Yummy chicken viet sammy and they don't skimp. They give you lots of meats and vege. The staff is so nice. We sat down and after our sandwich was done, they walked over and gave it to us. Later on they gave us two empty cups so we can go get water. We didn't even ask. This place is awesome!
IT WAS A SAD DAY FOR VIETNAMESE SANDWICHES

Munchboxx, Think about the name for a second and see if you LOL. Wait for it... I know I certainly did when I found it and so did the friends I was going to lunch with. But Yelpers don't lie folks, this place serves up tha bomb bahn mi, which is the last thing you'll think of when you walk into this unassuming sandwich shop.
Great lemongrass tofu sandwich with sriracha sauce!
Went here for lunch and was satisfied.  I prefer sweet crepes over savory but I enjoyed both types here.

Our daughter visiting from Seattle on business brought us here, another great place we hadn't discovered even though we live about 6 blocks away! The menu changes daily so it's written on a big butcher p s per scroll ha

What a great place to grab lunch downtown. The crepes are gluten free and delicious. The owner and the folks that work there are so friendly and accommodating. I recommend the "Like a Vegan (or not)" crepe with aged goat cheese. So yummy!
Really good food

Great food at reasonable prices. This place serves savory crepes (unlike English, in French, a savory crepe is a galette and a sweet crepe is a crepe) and is a great lunch-time spot. Fast and efficient.

With delicious buckwheat crepes, hard cider, and sweet fruit compote, taking center stage in the realm of your taste buds, this Creperie is more than just an alluring storefront in a back alley. Being greeted at the counter for tea, cider, beer, and your order, allows one the instant satisfaction of inviting warmth. Further adding to the charm of the self-serve flow, grand birch trunks sprout from the ground, to give a rustic appeal for your dining pleasure. The Fi-Di crowd trickles in for lunch and you are served by a polite gent with your goodies in hand. Pricing is fair, seating is ample, food is tasty, people are nice. I take all of my favorite Francophile friends here for a quck bite.

I like to think of galettes as part of my cultural inheritance, even though as far as I know I have no French blood, because my name is Brittany and galettes originated in the region of France called Brittany. What's a galette? A galette is a thin buckwheat "pancake" that is served with savory fillings. Similar to a crepe, but the darker buckwheat and "square" shape are key differences here.
Great place for lunch. Not too heavy and the prices seemed reasonable. Nice atmosphere.
Before coming here, I didn't know what a galette was. A friend made sure I understand that this makes me an uncultured yankee with no appreciation for the finer foods of French cuisine.
Nice ambiance, clean and simple. The salty crêpes are tasty and they offer good combinations. Also the juices are worth trying. Good place to try something different for lunch!

Decided to venture out instead of making it another microwaved who-knows-what lunch and stumbled across this lovely little gem tucked in an alleyway.. And by stumbling, you know I meticulously Yelped it first ;) Authentic, guilt-free French crepes? Yes PLEASE! :)

We arrived right smack in the heart of the weekday lunch rush. We were a party of 4, very hungry women and the place was packed. At first glance, we were not optimistic that we'd find a table. The layout is a bit off - two 2-tops are separated by suspended faux birch trees and then a couple of high tops positioned at an angle didn't seem like the best use of space. Our guess it was due to some building code not letting them seat more patrons. Nevertheless, we were approached by a very nice bus boy who found us a table. It was pretty loud, but as soon as our food came, none of us had an empty mouth to speak with! The food was delicious! The buckwheat crepes were lovely - thin but hearty enough to support the yummy stuffings. Two of us got The Chicken First which had the perfect balance of emmentaler swiss cheese, diced grilled chicken, sauteed leeks, fresh spinach, lemon zest and crème fraîche. It was served with a small bunch of lightly dressed mixed greens.

This place is excellent! It's rare that you find places like these where the food is worth the price. You are paying a bit more than what you usually would for crepes, but it's well worth it! I personally got the meathead (bc the guy at the counter said it was more filling, and I was hungry) and it was definitely good! A bit heavier, but not greasy. I got to try a bit of the lumberjack, and it was nice and creamy, a great contrast to the meathead. I'd come back again. Also love the ambiance. Great spot to spend lunch!
Cute crepe place in fidi for a quick, but still nice sit-down lunch.

The crêpes are the best in the world, the variaties are really really good, but it's so noisy inside. Although the place is pretty big, it's sounds like you're in an elevator with 50 people, screaming. So best place for take out!!

Yummy-licious! Great service, great ambience and even better food. The menu is the hardest thing. There are just too many amazing options on the menu that you have to come here more than once. It was a hot day and though they typically don't serve iced coffee, they were gracious enough to make it for me.

I tried this place twice, and I really wish I liked this place because it's so close to work... but the savory crepes I had were just mediocre... So far I've had #1 basique with ham, #7 bruce's choice, and the house red wine. The best way to eat your crepe is to mix everything on top and then fold it in half... that way you get everything in your crepe in a bite! WAIT... or maybe this is NOT the way to eat it because I didn't really enjoy my crepe... but it's definitely the cleaner way to eat. Both savory crepes were okay, but I wouldn't order them again. The house wine was pretty gooood; I would get that again.

Gluten Free, taste, yummy, believe me!  As I walked down Kearny street and I passed Sutter I knew I had gone to far according to Google Maps.  I turned around, walked back half a block and saw Hardie Place, a little alley without a view, but it was of no matter.  I was on a mission to find out if this "Gluten Free" Crepe place was worth all of the fuss.  Well, let me tell you....it is and some!  I walked in and ordering the Chicken "MeatHead" Buckwheat crepe at their rustic, organic counter, took a seat and waited for my order to go.  As the waiter brought out my order in a recycled mini-pizzia size box I wanted to dive right in but, I decided to find a rood top garden (as San Francisco is having it's summer) and soak up some vitamin D.

the food is very good. aromatic. i had mushroom crepe and was impressed with fresh fragrance of the mushrooms. not too heavy. downside is, they don't serve coffee any more. i really wanted ice coffee so that was a disappointment but i will def come back. during peak lunch hours --- the space is hollow and noise echoes, hard to have business lunch convo but that's peak lunch hour anywhere. a good place to bring my foodie friends to when i'm in sf downtown!

We passed it up the first time as we were waking because it's literally hidden at the end of a small alley that you wouldn't think twice about walking down. Never the less, we finally found it and boy am I glad we did! I love crepes. Every city I go to, I have to look up a crepe place. This one certainly delivered. You walk in, order from the menu on the wall at the right, pay, then sit down and wait for your food to come to you. Wish I lived in San Fran so I can come here frequently. I got the mushroom crepe and my husband ordered the chicken one with pesto. Both were delish!!

This was my go-to place for lunch near work, and I was never disappointed. They accommodated me really well as I have an allergy to nuts, so when ordering the sweet crepes with fruit and Nutella, they would always replace it with chocolate sauce/syrup instead. As for savoury crepes, I tried the meathead which was very decent, and the combination of cheese, meat, and vegetables was great. The place is very chic and great for a lunch spot with friends or even a lunch date.
Best crepes outside of France, lovely place

I LOVE places that try to be both authentic and chic at the same time. The food and flavors here scream Breton cuisine -- that unique culture in Normandy. The style though is financial district classic lunch -- you order at the counter, get your food delivered to your table and you don't have to bus your dishes.

From my exceptionally scientific experience, I've concluded that it's hard to mess up a sweet crepe*. Sure, some are prettier than others, but at the end of the day, even a terrible sweet crepe is pretty dang delicious. But savory crepes, my friends, these are a completely different story. Without the sweet, mushy goodness to rely on, things like texture, density and flavor-balance play an important role. And at Galette 88, the savory crepes are the stars for good reason. You can choose from one of their recommended menu items, or choose your own adventure with ingredients like ham, chicken, pork sausage, salmon, a bevy of beautiful french cheeses, fresh seasonal veggies, and some curveballs like potatoes, browned apples, capers, crème fraîche, grilled jalapeños. It's tough to go wrong.

Came here on a Friday afternoon to eat with two other friends. The place got pretty packed quick. It is a first come first serve kind of seating, so I went to order the food while my friends sat in our seats. I had the Agua Fresca drink, which I thought was a bit watered down and bland, but it did look pretty haha. I had the chicken crepe which was super filling and savory! The extra dollar for the sunny-side up egg was a nice touch too. My friends had the ham and salmon, which was good too. I liked that thee dishes were very filling so the price was pretty worth it. It is also in an alley-way where Sushiritto is, which is kind of hidden if you didn't know about it. The atmosphere is very hipster, with drinks served in mason jars, wood furniture and simplistic/modern menu designs. Service was good, but they don't do much because someone takes your order at a separate counter, then someone delivers your food and that's it. Water is at a help-yourself station so I can't really judge much on the service. Will be back if I ever come around the area :)
Both "the other mushroom" and "bruce's choice" are delicious!!  I like the intimate atmosphere.

I'll try writing this as objectively as I can (and as much as an opinionated review can be), because the way I feel about crepes is much like the way I feel about sandwiches: I enjoy good ones, but they're never something I seek out or crave anymore.

I used to love this place and started going there a couple of years a go when it just opened up. Unfortunately, it has slipped some. The owner is super nice but because she is not always around, the quality may not be consistent. I usually get the brie huger or meathead with sausage. My last two visits the crepes were somewhat bland and the crepe crust was pretty dry. I also miss their fabulous coffee from local a Calistoga roastery, which I love. They discontinued coffee service. I may no longer be a regular at the joint, unfortunately.
can only speak for the la mixed salad. it was yummy! fresh and nice complex flavors.
The first time I've had French style crepes was through a catering company at my office (

Went into the city to grab lunch with my dad on a Thursday. We knew this place got super crowded so we headed in around 11:30 and I'm so glad we did! I ordered the vegan, which was chock full of zucchini and very yummy, but the crowning glory was the bleu cheese, apple, walnuts and honey crepe. It was so rich and velvety yet not overdone. I would come back here a million times for that crepe. Amazing place, but, be warned: by noon it's packed!!

Fresh, gluten-free buck-wheat crepes with a variety of really delicious options. My Vegan (but not really) with a ratoutille-style filling, complete with edam and extra mushrooms made me incredibly happy. It was a good portion (by American standards, for a European, not too big, although I still couldn't finish it all for lunch). All the other fillings looked and sounded delicious too. I think if I lived nearby, this place would be a dead cert regular spot for me.

Tried and true French restaurant serving the real buckwheat crepe. I have tried their complete (my favorite! Feels like being in French Brittany!), lumberjack and Brie hugger and a host of sweets ones and the fact of the matter is: you can't go wrong with any of them! Great combination of fresh flavors while honoring crepe heritage.
Hidden in a tiny alley and off the beaten path you turn the corner and see this shining beacon of light in the distance that is Galette 88.
Long lines to order but don't let it scared you away since most people do take out here. There's not always a lot of room to sit but people are in and out quick.

Delicious Creperie tucked in an alley off of Kearney! I ordered a traditional buckwheat crepe with ham n swiss that came topped with a soft egg yolk and green salad. My mom ordered hers with smoked salmon, it too was delicious. I would order the smoked salmon filled crepe next time! We had belgian style ales from Canada. This place was lovely, and had a nice atmosphere. Closes at 2:30. We came close to closing and there was no line.

Pretty tasty!  Very noisy though which is the only downside to this cafe.....hard to eat and catch up with friends but delicious if you want to eat only.  The crepes are also gluten free!!!  Nice to find something unique and gf in the financial district.

Amazing authentic crepes!!! I ordered the meathead with chicken and was quite satisfied. Loved the salad on top and all the flavorful fillings. You really can tell all the ingredients are fresh and high quality. Would definitely come back again.
Very lovely crepes place!
To be honest, I'm not much of a crepe guy. When my coworker told me that I was going to have to eat a crepe for lunch, I was not excited.

The service was terrible, but the food and wine more than made up for it. If you like the food at Mailino at the Gramercy Park Hotel in NY, you'll like the food here, too. It's more refined, though--not as rustic.

My new SF obsession. I've always been a huge fan of Barbacco, so it was difficult making the reservation for Perbacco instead this time. However, I'm so glad I did because it surpassed all of my previous expectations.

Came here while on our honeymoon. Ambiance and service were spectacular they even gave us a free dessert when we mentioned we were celebrating our honeymoon which was a really nice touch. We have some great food in Miami and this place was excellent but the pasta was a bit under seasoned. The caramel gelato with sea salt was a stand out.
My birthday dinner choice when I went up to SF for my birthday weekend.
Try octopus in the appetizer, it's very nice, I have imagined walking into this restaurant, ordering 3 of it, finishing it and walking out.

Having dined before at Barbaco, we had some idea of the kind of food we would get, so that prompted us to make this reservation to celebrate a birthday and two anniversaries.  For some reason, we were escorted to the big marble table right by the kitchen - and we could see what was going on there- and though it wasn't quiet, it was certainly a more private space than the tables in the front of the restaurant that were much closer together.

I had the butternut squash ravioli and the flavors were amazing! It's a nice place to have a slightly fancy dinner. The waiter also gave great wine pairing recommendations! The prices (around $20 for a pasta dish) were also not too bad.

We went here for our friend birthday.   Had reservation at 8:00 but got seated about 15 minutes later.  My husband's drink actually didn't arrived until we asked our server for it after get seated at our table and food arrived ( 30 minutes since we ordered)
One of my go to's for lunch in the financial district.
oh my god this place is amazing.
Been here a few times for dinner and every time a great experience!

Overall The experience was good and the service great. The only criticism I have is everything we had was too salty . We had the butternut squash ravioli as an appetizer and it was so salty I couldn't eat it . The veal tartare was excellent. We added truffles on it which cost the same amount as an entree but it was worth it. We also had the quail and tagliatelle which were both very good but both salty. I would have given this place 5 stars if it wasn't for the over seasoned dishes.
Had lunch here again today. It's not often that I come here--but when I do--I remember why I love this spot. Great entrees, cocktails, and desserts. Gotta start having more business lunches here.
Met a friend here for dinner last night.  The halibut entree is the best halibut I've ever had.  Perfect!  Nice place, I'll definitely come here again for that halibut.
A strong 4 stars. This is a great place for business or a nice dinner. Everything was quite good.

Not a bad Italian restaurant, tho I think I've had better. I got the pappadelle with the lamb ragu, which seems to be popular with other Yelpers.  It's not bad, but the pasta didn't wow me.  It's in a nice location though, great for after-work dinner/drinks if you work in the Fi Di.  The service was great!
Good food, great ambiance.

Perbacco's not a bad choice if you're in the area. Probably the best thing we had here was the housemade charcuterie. Everything else was pretty standard- not bad, just not all that memorable. I think if you're in the area or you live in this neighborhood this would make a nice weekday dinner spot. Otherwise I wouldn't call this a must have...
Best SF Italian, IMHO.  Outstanding regional Italian wine selection.

Amazing experience from booking the reservation with Jeremy to finishing with dessert and coffee. We were a party of five celebrating a birthday. The guest of honor not only received a handwritten birthday note from Perbacco, her dessert plate also was inscribed with chocolate birthday wishes (and who wouldn't love that!?)

Exceptional food and service, even by San Francisco standards. The salami platter was incredible and every entrée was superb.  The ambience is business professional, allowing for conversation but not dull. I'll definitely be back to sample the menu and enjoy the extensive wine list.

Really happy with my experience here although I give barbacco my 5 star rating. Granted I came here for a private function and only sampled the pre fix that was provided I will come back for the full experience based on how nice the service was.

Stellar experience from start to finish.  Pappardelle with short rib ragu was everything I hoped it would be.  The horseradish finish was sublime and meat falling apart tender.  I ordered the halibut for my main and was impressed.  Nothing overpowered the delicate fish that was cooked to perfection.  My husband had the scallops and although they were tasty, the accoutrement was a tad on the fishy side.  Even the bread was something to return for served with fresh, sweet unsalted butter.  Fabulous beverage selection and impressive service.  I will definitely be back for more.  Thank you Perbacco staff.  You aim to please and we certainly departed more than satisfied.  Great place for a gathering of large groups especially when seated upstairs.  We all had a blast.

Overall a very solid experience. I thought the food was pretty good, but not super memorable. The bar area was nice with a great selection of wine/cocktail. The main dining was pretty average... more cramped and loud than I would have liked. Price was higher than I thought it should be for the quality of food.
Very nice team dinner.   Service was very good, dinner options were solid.  Wine provided was good.

I really want to love this place. After 2 tries, I my experience has been a consistent "meh". The food is certainly is okay but does not knock your socks off. I went again today. The waiter was excellent at service. He recommended the gnocchi. It sounded really good, but it was really just okay (and probably needed salt).
I ate here a while ago, and it was just amazing food. I was very happy with everything. My girlfriend and I enjoyed everything.
Great Italian food, had a great time with a group of friends. All pasta dishes were awesome! Now gotta try Barbacco!

Perbacco is a nice upscale Italian restaurant situated in the financial district in SF. You can take a stroll along the Ferry building, see the Bay Bridge from afar, and even drop by the Cupid's Span and then plan a little dinner at Perbacco since it's walking distance.
Perbacco is legit. And coming from a full-blooded Italian who cooks his own serious Italian food, that's saying something.
The Plin al Brasato was outstanding.
This has to be one of the worst meals I've ever had.

Great place for a business lunch.  Be sure to make reservations as the lunch crowd comes in fast and both floors can really fill up.  This was my second visit... Service was good this time (as was last time) but not overly friendly.  For my beverage, I asked for some cranberry juice mixed with Sprite and my server seemed a little put off by the request.

Ate dinner here, they make homemade Grissini which are very good. Also had the Potato Gnochhi with Duck Ragu, Gnocchi were good, everything else in the dish was just OK. Had the Papardelle with Quail Ragu, noodles were great homemade noodles, the rest of the dish was pretty good.
Love this place. Great atmosphere. Food is great. A little expensive but this is SF! But service sometimes is spotty.
Sat at the open bar for lunch.
One of my fav restaurants in all of San Francisco!

I made a rez on opentable and requested a birthday dessert and they executed.  They even had a birthday card ready with our menus.  We came here a little early but they seated us right away (our rez was at 6:30 p.m.).  Armando, our waiter, was great!  Very friendly, informative and efficient.  The wait staff that cleared our tables and filled our waters were very attentive and efficient.  The older men in suits helped with carrying out the entrees and there were plenty of staff and help (reminded me of Barbacco where there is plenty of staff and they all work with one another seamlessly!).  Service was excellent!  The wine Armando recommend was great with my dinner.

Perfect again! We went there for lunch a few weeks ago and the food was just amazing. We had the brussel sprouts and gnocchi for appetizers. They do have a smaller portion of gnocchi if you want it as an apperizer. For the main course, we had the Brasato which was divine and the risotto which was also wonderful. Overall superb food and continues to amaze. I would be hard pressed to find an italian restaurant of this quality in the city.

This was my first time at Perbacco and I will definitely be returning. The service staff were amazing, and everything was fresh.  Had the cherry tomato appetizer with the Coujette (garlic potato gnocchi with farm duck ragu) - it was the best gnocci I've had.

I like the atmosphere. It's a small and quiet place. However service is terrible and food took forever to come! We were seated outside as there was no more room inside, which is fine. Until it started raining over our table and I asked to be moved inside. The waitress answered in an aggressive tone "What can I do? Can't you see it's full?........ It might take 30 or 40 minutes.". How about a "Sure, we'll let you in as soon as a table clears up"?. After a while she did let us in.
The meatballs and the pizza were amazing. Straight legit Italian that I randomly went into. So glad I did.
Great place for an authentic Italian experience!

We came here for dinner as I needed to carb load prior to a half marathon. Luckily we arrived before 6p because after 630p this place was packed. And when we left around 730p, there was a long line outside with large parties.
Beware vegetarians: veggie lasagna had STALE veggies on it !
How does one mess up spaghetti?

Terrific lunch stop!  I walked in with zero expectations and walked away WOW!   Dynamite house made ravioli.   Friendly and prompt service.  Small and intimate space that is comfortable.  Hoping I can return for dinner again on this SF trip.  Great Italian food.

This is probably some of the finest Italian cuisine I've ever had in San Francisco, a city that usually can barely come up with even barely decent Italian food.  We've gone back 4 times in 3 days, and everything we've ordered was outstanding.  The Spaghetti Carbonara, a dish that I have NEVER had even a passable version of outside of Rome, was probably the best I've ever eaten.  Usually Americans make Carbonara like a mop of soggy white mush, but this was perfectly cooked, the pancetta was slightly crispy, and the sauce was put on with a light touch.  It was perfection.

It's hard to return to a restaurant in SF since there are so many damn choices. But I've been to Pachino at least a handful of times for dinner with friends and family, once for take-out when I wasn't feeling well (and the only cure was more pizza), and once for a 20-person work lunch. I was happy with the food every time. They let the dough for the complimentary bread rise for two days. Their Neapolitan pizza crust is quite delectable. The desserts are made in-house. The gnocchi is excellent. I could go on and on. You might see me there enjoying a few of their chalkboard specials again soon.

Came for a quick dinner here and it was a good overall experience. Intimate setting and great service. Had a good carbonara. Didn't give five stars because it was not overly special but no complaints either.

The service was great, the food was average it's nothing special, location depends on whether you sit inside or outside I think you're better off sitting inside because the outside isn't super nice and it's a really busy area so it's pretty loud. I probably won't be returning but they aren't a bad spot to check out!

Mediocre food, terrible and extremely slow service (had to ask for our food and check several times), and made my pregnant friend use the men's room, with a man in it, because they couldn't figure out the keycode on the women's room. VERY unimpressed.

This place is the bomb digity. Monica was a great server! Great recommendations. The food is amazing, the service is first class, and the atmosphere is the bees knees. I would highly recommend a date night or a great homemade family dinner. Monica is the best!
very good italian restaurant low price. I advice pasta.

I like the laid back feel of this place, and its proximity to so many things (the rent must be very expensive for such a nice location).  In terms of food, it was solid, not outstanding.  I had a burrata app and the boar sausage pizza, and liked them both.  I would return if I found myself hungry and in the neighborhood.
So yummy! Loved the atmosphere and the staff! The tiramisu is amazing. Spaghetti with meatballs was also great.
2.5 Star

I came here with a bunch of friends as prom dinner. The moment I walked in, our table was already nicely set up. The waiters were definitely the best, filling up our water from time to time and politely answered the questions I had about some of the food. LOOL

Fantastic pizza, just the right amount of char & chewy-ness without too much gluten development. The fresh pasta was well done, but its meat sauce a bit flat. Service was friendly but scattered and a little slow.

This place rates four stars for food, and zero for service. We sat down for dinner and spent 15 minutes trying to get anyone to pay attention to us so we could place our order. The main guy just ignored me when I told him we were ready to order, and I think the only reason why the woman took our order was because we were loudly discussing leaving. Also, we were seated right next to the kitchen, so we were treated to the sights and sounds of the main guy breaking dishware as he threw it into the tubs in a fit of pique. Sorry it was such an inconvenience that so many people came into your restaurant tonight; trust me, it won't happen again. It's a shame really, because the pizzas and gnocchi were really good.
The good:

There's a reason I've been regular at Pachino for over a year. The intimate setting and personalized service makes it feel that I've been personally invited to eat some home-made, darn-good, come-back-for-more specially prepared dinner.

I had the funghi pizza and the Nero D'Avola wine. The service was very friendly and even though I dined by myself they were friendly (which is not always my experience when dining on my own). I thought the pizza was very good. I'm not a huge fan of thin crust but I still really enjoyed it. I also saw all kinds of other dishes I wanted to try - bruschetta, pasta, great-looking desserts etc. I ordered a cappuccino after dinner and it was very good too. I live out of town and was just here for business but if I'm back in San Francisco again I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

Great service and very good pies. It's always a pleasure when I actually get to look forward to the crust instead of dreading it or leaving it on the plate. We didn't get any other dishes but I can say for certain this place makes good pizza.
I walked into this place and wanted to love it. Pachino's got nice atmosphere and the service was very good. But the food was just uninteresting.

Go here for great authentic pizza and the exceptionally charming and friendly Italian man who runs from table to table giving great service.  The place is rather small, so getting a reservation is recommended for prime times if you want to sit inside.
Liked the nightly dinner specials.
Good food, little portions (especially pasta, pizza and tiramisu ok) but...
Bellissimo! The food, the service, the ambience...wonderful!
The service is what makes this place. You will always feel welcomed especially if Antonio is there.  Great food with fresh ingredients.
This was the best meal during our stay in San Francisco. Charming service. Incredible food.

Lunched here the other day when I heard Antonio is in charge now.  I am now a regular.  Antonio makes you feel like you are a king at home, like you live in Rome.  Great wines, have Antonio pair for you.  Home made pasta too!  Get the Carbonara, it's unreal.  Yes, it's a small space but that's pretty standard in this neighborhood...  Highly recommend this hidden gem.
Excellent f ood- every time I am in SF I make a trip to Pachino for the prosciutto appitizer - amazing!!
Just finishing meal here. Was very nice and tasty meal with good and not annoying service. Nice lunch experience.
One of the best pizzas I have ever had in San Francisco....
Antonio definitely makes you feel at home. This place is small, but the service and the food is excellent.

A very tight space with one waitress?  I didn't get it.  Completely disorganized and their pizza was just ok.  Not enough toppings.  Hardly any little morsels of basil on a margherita pizza?  Hardly any cheese?  Wow, they made some pure profit off my dough with sauce order.  So completely disappointed.
Really nice experience to be here. Cosy, nice and social waitress and good food. I'm italian and definitely recommend this place.

I had reservations on a Friday night (and was able to change last minute to a half hour later, so that was tight) so got seated right away. I definitely recommend booking in advance too--this place was packed due to being small, and a lot of people faced uphill wait times sans reservations when walking in. Also, when you find parking directly in front of wherever you're going, you have to assume it'll be a good night. And overall, it was. The pizza takes forever but it's really good. The Margherita pizza with pepperoni my girlfriend had was solid, but takes forever to make. My pappardelle was tasty, but the pizza was better. My only complaint is the wait times and overall service. While the owner (I assume it was the owner) is also the waiter, and has to accomodate both the inside and outside tables and does his best, we still were in there for a long time. The pizza has to cook awhile, but after around 20 minutes when I asked one of the other servers when we'd be served, she said she'd get right back to me and never did. Often enough, I saw the one cook they have in the back just waiting around for orders to fill, but maybe she had things in the oven and was waiting for them to bake. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. But when we were finished and waiting for the check, I again (foolishly) asked the other server for the bill and after another "I'll get it to you right away", she never came back and I was forced to ask the owner for it again. I'm not sure if she just ignored me or would get it to me the next day, but being at a restaurant for over 2 hours is pretty crazy. I don't know if I'd be back simply for the wait times. The food is good, however.

I have to say, I missed this kind of pizza - I had the Prosciutto, Arugula and fresh mozzarella - YUM YUM YUM. Seriously this thing is the bomb, especially with the perfectly made crust. Crispy and chewy at the same time, OMG I'm drooling again :)

I have dined here twice in 2 1/2 years with the last time being 2 weeks ago. I was slightly bothered that it took a while to be seated at 2:30 pm on a Friday. They didn't seem particularly busy. So, we sat at the counter. Our server was nice enough though his humor was dry. But, my glass was full and I rarely had to ask for anything. He did not hover or try to make conversation while we were at the counter which I appreciated.  I love the Chilean Sea Bass which is what I've ordered each time visiting Taidch (and why I return).  It is cooked perfectly and the sauce is great. I also ordered the Dungeness crab cocktail as a starter.  I give that a shoulder shrug and "meh." For dessert, I had the bread pudding. The bread pudding was cold but the sauce was warm. It was just ok. I will likely not order it in the future. I thought it was tacky that the entire baking pan just sat on the bar and the servers plated the desert from it. The sauce was in a small crockpot next to the coffee maker and whipped cream from a can. It will be a long while before I return, only for the Sea Bass.

Went with my cousin for my birthday dinner while out of town. Within seconds of walking in the door you realise this is an institution more than a restaurant. The ambiance is very traditional 1950's I would say, in a very pleasant way. The staff are all very formal yet friendly, and provide excellent service. The perfect mix of formality, friendliness and attentiveness without being intrusive. We shared the oyster rockefellers for starters followed by the freshest meatiest crab cakes ever, and the seafood cioppino, which was superb. Had the bourbon bread pudding for dessert. The bread pudding itself was not special but the bourbon sauce made up for that.   Restaurant experiences this good don't come often. Well worth the visit.
Have been wanting to come to Tadich Grill for years! We finally went last night. It has such a cool old San Francisco vibe, and the service is great!

Excellent food and great service.  Our dining experience was the best I have had in several years.  45 minute wait on a Monday wasn't an issue as the bar is sufficiently stocked with nice booze and the bar staff was efficient and knowledgeable, making great old fashioneds.  Dinner was excelent. Started with calamari and clams... clams are great! Aslo shared the Tadich platter which consisted of smoked trout and salmon, calamari salad, jumbo shrimp, crab , and pickled fish. Excellent.  Like everyone else, cioppino for dinner.... BOMB!  Can't wait for my next time.
This place is top notch.  Go early because it gets busy after 6pm.  The Martinis are great and food was excellent.
Oh the old school glamour + Croatian charms!

Walked over Friday night at the recommendation of the hotel clerk.  Had a drink at the bar while we waited for our table, chatting with the very friendly bartender.  Forgot my glasses so the waiter rounded up a pair fir me.  Had the Chilean sea bass; hubby had the filet mignon.  Everything was perfect.
The clam chowder had a lot of clams, but lacked flavor. Why the hype?
Good ambience, good service, loved the free bread. Good amount of food, enough for leftovers. Long wait, reservation needed. Good wine
The food was very good. Calamari was excellent. Crab cakes were very good. Ciopino  was very good. Wine prices were very reasonable.

We had heard amazing things about Tadich Grill, and since it is the oldest restaurant in SF we had high hopes. Service was good: we were seated quickly even though the place was hopping. We started with the calamari, which was a good choice for appetizer.  Breading was light and crunchy, the squid was tender with good flavor, and the portion was huge. Unfortunately the main course was a letdown. While I enjoyed the cioppino which had plenty of fish, jumbo prawns, clams, and mussels in a hearty tomato broth, my wife's crab-stuffed red snapper was bland, unseasoned, and overcooked. I had a couple bites of her dish and was thoroughly unimpressed even though mine was actually pretty good, and more than I could finish. So while I can endorse the calamari and felt the cioppino lived up to billing, the red snapper wasn't, in my wife's words, worth the calories... or the price.

The  bartender is really good.  My wife got a lemon drop martinee  which was superb,  best ever.  I got Alaskan  salmon  and she got  red snapper with crab.  Both were great.  The waiters could be  bit more personable,  they seem to be very professional and chatting it up not big on the must do list for them. Ok,  I can deal with that. No women waiting in sight,  OK.  The food was good,  that was important. Pricey,  yes. Good,  yes. The lady next to us had a steak which looked great and smelled better. Most people sit at a bar which is fine for a couple. It is worth a visit for sure. Other than not excepting American Express credit we had no problem.

We were there a few months ago.  Agree with another yelper that the usually fail proof cioppino was underwhelming.  Needs a lot more kick and shellfish flavor.  The garlic bread was so soaked and drenched in butter it was not edible.  Get queezy thinking about that.  Great atmosphere though and I will order something different than their world famous cioppino next time. Until then, I can only review the seafood chowder that I have ordered every few years.

Surprisingly the place looked packed but the wait was only about 20 minutes when they told us 30 . Cute old school resturant.  Delicious fast service.  We had the crab cocktail *alot of crab! But nothing fancy. And the seafood cioppino had a variety of seafood and it was delicious. Must try like the fellow yelpers stated

While working in the area we (a mom, a young model and I, the photographer) came upon this hidden gem because everything else was closed during the after lunch pre-dinner hours.  We were about to open the door and a rude old lady and her mother shoved us out of the way, "EXCUSE ME!" they belched and cut right in front of us, and they were promptly seated first.  That was the only negative experience we encountered.  We smiled it off and the staff more than made up for their rude patrons.  We were seated immediately in a wonderful closed off booth which happened to be right next to the rude ladies.  We laughed because our table was by far the better, roomier, more private and classier table.  The food was superb, melt in your mouth deliciousness.  I ordered the clam chowder which was perfect and creamy with tons of fresh tasting clams.  I also had a garden salad with blue cheese dressing which was spot on with lovely tender greens.  The ladies shared a sea food salad (they said it was perfect and that they would be returning the next time they visited the city).  I will also be returning with my husband for a date night.  The server and staff were excellent, very attentive, we didn't have a dry glass or have to so much as glance their way for any wants, even though the place was packed.  It was a perfect lunch.  When we left the rude ladies even asked how our meal was.  I wish I could say better than theirs, but they were chowing on large, bright red lobster tails accompanied by martinis.

Love this place! This is our go to restaurant for our date nights. I decided switch up my regular order and try the Cioppino instead of the Prawn and Crab La Manza ( I probably butchered the name, lol). The Cioppino was yummy but nothing beats my regular dishes. I wish I could go every month for this yumminess.
Enjoyed dinner here.  We walked in with a large group and were seated right away, although the waiter told us that most folks in the city were home watching the World Series.
Cioppino is excellent.   Clam chowder is average at best.   Don't put on the bib if they give you one because you will look like a fool.

I went here last night as a first timer and I will continue to come back. I had the Bone in Rib Eye Steak and my friend had the Cippino. The food was to die for and the service was excellent! I've never had a steak prepared to perfection. Since it was my birthday I ordered desert and when the waiter brought it out the whole restaurant began to sing happy birthday to me. This place was awesome and I would totally recommend it to all my friends.
Fresh, high quality foods, turned into fabulous dishes with expert preparation and seasoning along with full size portions and expert wait staff eliminate any minute disappointment at Tadish Grill!

Had my birthday dinner at this classy restaurant. Food was great! Ordered Seafood Cioppino, Sand Dabs, and Rockefeller. All of them were tasty. It's just they don't take reservation, so we waited about 30 minutes.

For an up-scale restaurant, their service really sucks! I took my wife there for lunch. The waiter is not polite. It made us feel not welcome at all. For the kind of price they charge, I was expecting a much better experience. The waiters there are old and snobbish. I'll take my business else where from now on.
Oh, Tadich Grill - we could have had a beautiful relationship, but now I will never know. This review is based purely upon the shocking customer service I received from your bartender there today.

I'm going to let you in on a little secret of mine,  I go to three different people; hostess, bartender and server independently and ask them "what here is going to change my life and bring me back a second time?" All three employees independently said "get the Cioppino"

Came here to lunch with one of my boss'. He was from Atlanta and said he's been eyeing this place the past couple days. So we walk in and it was pretty packed. Good thing we came just in time because they sat us down immediately.
You would think that a higher end restaurant would have better customer service, but apparently if you are dressed casually and look very young everyone will treat you like a burden.
Energetic atmosphere but the food is bland and boring.
I have eaten lunches out of my office for  over 40 years in SF financial district, including Tadich Grill on occasion.
Order the Ciopinno ! You will not regret it. Savory, Italian seafood stew. Yum! Service was excellent as well as friendly staff. Loved it!

Dry....best description I can think of for the food and service. Walking through the door at 3pm, my first meeting with anyone was aloof at best. I'd rate the waiter about the same. For late lunch, I had the halibut. Easily, I can name ten places in SFO (where I've been coming for 20+ years) that the halibut would be much better and almost half the price. The fish here was extremely dry, vegetables outstanding and fries OK. The only reason I came here is this place is a legend and has been in business forever. If I was forced to come back again it would be vegetables only.
I've been eating here since the 1970's. Killer seafood but I love the Petrale Sole! They print the menus daily and make excellent souvenirs, IF you ask the waiter first.
Great food, quick service, and amazing recommendations from the servers. A must try if you haven't. Ordered the Ciopino and was delicious!
This restaurant is reminiscent of old-world S.F. charm. The food was really good and I'm very happy this place was chosen, I'd gladly recommend coming here.

How this place does not have 5 stars! I was here for lunch one day a while back and it is hands down one if the best places I have eaten. Food excellent! But the service is what would bring me back time and time again. The kitchen is slammed, and all the old dudes in there are calm and organized and look to be on top of it. That's probably why the food comes out do quickly and good! The place is clean, the staff if super friendly and they are busy! I'll eat here every time i visit San Fran! Oh ya, the pock chop is tasty!

Fan-frickin-tastic.  The cioppino, while expensive, is one of the best versions I've had. The clam chowder was also exceptional. I'd take a star off for a too limited wine by the glass and beer menu, but the food was too good to do that.

I was visiting a friend in SF and asked her to choose a popular SF restaurant. She suggested Tadich Grill. We met up around 5:30 and the wait wasn't too bad (less than an hour) for our group of four considering they don't take reservations. We could have been sat earlier, but our complete party hadn't arrived yet.
If I ever come to Tadich grill, it would be for the atmosphere and their really delicious New England clam chowder...and fries. Oh!don't forget Seabass, that was pretty phenomenal too!

After toiling as a postdoctoral scientist for a couple of years, my girlfriend got a great paying job and she wanted treat me to a restaurant of my choice.  Based on highly rated Yelp reviews, I chose Tadich Grill.  When we first walked in, the place smelled more like urine than the ocean.  Nonetheless, we sat down and ordered. She had the sea bass and I had the cioppino.  Perhaps the food would have tasted good, had the service been better.  I give the place one star for food and none for service.  The server did not once ask how the food was.  I was quite hungry and had a hankering for rice so grabbed the server's attention to ask if they have a side order of rice.  We didn't ask for the price, simply the availability.  The server rudely replied, that's $8, as though he judged that we couldn't afford an eight dollar side dish.  The wardrobe my girlfriend had on cost more than a thousand so $8 is pocket change.  But I digress.  After we ate, my girlfriend took out her wallet to pay.  The check had not been given to us but the server was ready to grab the credit card from her hand.  She asked to see the bill first.  The server walked away with an attitude and returned with the check.  But rather than leaving the checkbook on the table, he opened it for her to see but would not hand it to her.  It was quite a bizarre experience.  We are generous tippers--at a fine restaurant with good service, we tip as high as 40%.  Otherwise we tip 20%-25%.  This is the first time we tipped less than 10%.  We would not revisit this place.  We recommend that you ask for a good server or simply go to another restaurant.  Seafood places are dime a dozen in the Bay Area.  Great services are not easy to find but surely one can find a place with better service than Tadich Grill.

Just simply my favorite place to eat in San Francisco. The feel, the decor, the fabulous service, and the absolute to die for ciopinno. After each meal I have had there over 10+ years of going, I feel quite okay that I've experienced the best of it all. And though it would be tragic to be run over by the California line street car, that's as fine a last meal money can buy all told.
I got charged for my bill plus another $52!!!!!

Came in on a rainy afternoon on my own. Lovely old style bar (even with an old cash machine) and a really friendly host. Saw a lone stranger and made feel welcome. Small but nice beer selection. Will come back

Came here with a few friends after work on a Thursday and the place was pretty busy. Only two bartenders so service here can be a bit slow. Beer selection is pretty limited so if you're looking for a wide variety, I'd recommend going elsewhere. For $5.5 a pint,  it's about your average glass of beer. A lot of reviewers seem to complain about a credit card minimum but the bartender on the night that I went didn't seem to enforce that. If you're looking to get a snack to go with your beer, I'd highly recommend the truffle oil parmesan fries. They're GOOD, and the portion size is huge (thought at $9, this is what you should be expecting).
Wish I could review this place, but I can not think clearly. They....ran.....out.....of.....french....fries. I mean..... FRENCH FRIES!!! I came for the fries.
Great ambience
walked in killing time. Larry is the man. that's all. great refuge in the madness which is the addz
Excellent atmosphere and good food at reasonable prices! We piered up at Pier1 1/2 and walked over. Was a great experience!
Had another delicious meal here today. Salad with shaved brussel sprouts, gumbo and an awesome crab melt.  I only wish I had ordered more!

This was literally 20 feet from our parking space and we walked into a bar that had the boisterous happy hour crowd. I was tying to figure out how this used to be a ship but instead got distracted by all the memorabilia on the walls.

Definitely stop here if you're looking for a drink at a place with a good atmosphere and some history.  Only had a couple beers, but could have stayed for hours.  One of the oldest bars in SF. Crowd is mostly locals from the financial district.  Decent beer selection.
Small bar with food.  Supposedly the oldest bar in SF?

This is a really great place with great, friendly staff. The patrons are varied, everyone from my dad, who is 66 and mostly business, to young 20 something professionals to mid thirties tattooed typical San Franciscans. Best part is everyone feels comfortable. I had a sidecar the other say that was on point (very hard to find a tender who knows how to make one let alone a good one). They also have bar snacks like pineapple peanuts and corn nuts that are made in house. The beef jerky is SPICY. As far as good goes, they have a menu that varies from burgers to ceviche. The onion rings could be a meal on their eon and come  in a huge bowl. Tastes great with their home-made ketchup! All together this place is great for lunch or after work and you're bound to meet someone you like or find yourself having a conversation you love.

So what's all the hype about the Curly Burger?  I've had tons of great hamburgers and tons of different foods with either an egg or bacon on top.  Now here's another one, right?  WRONG.  This burger was ridiculously fantastic and I'm not sure why.  The burger was cooked to perfection.  The bread was great.  I'll have to go back (again and again) to figure it out. In an effort to make it (less un)healthy, they were kind enough to swap the fries for a nice house salad.

The food is great and service is also not bad at all. We went late and they seated us pretty easily we were 6 people. So kudos for that. The chicken and the spaghetti which seemed to be the order of the day among my peers ended up being delicious. However no appetizers and no bread! What's that about?
Pricey small portions but delicious. The servers weren't very friendly to us but the orders were taken quickly and the food delivered timely.

I liked the place, but the blonde female bartender that started at 5pm Monday August 11th refused to divide our checks amongst the 4 of us. Our order included 4 beers and 4 plates of food and wasn't complicated; but had one person paying for all 4 beers while we paid individually. Not worth firing over, but bad customer service. The dude that served us in the Metallica Shirt with orange golf T ear rings was incredibly nice and polite, and added to the places friendliness.
too pricy and the food quality is oky.

the hamburgers were pretty good, but my friend ordered a burger with fried egg and they put the fried egg UNDER the meat so the yolk cracked and leaked into the bread which made the bottom all soggy and hard to eat. my fries were mostly about 1 inch long (yep, no typo) and very overdone. basically inedible. oh, and I told them I didn't want any fries, so instead of asking if I wanted something else (a salad would have been nice) they ignored me and brought the awful fries instead. it is a nice setting and the server was pleasant. I'd give it another shot because the atmosphere was nice and  burger menu was pretty extensive and had some interesting combinations, but overall, this was very disappointing.

A terrible experience this evening. I've been to this place many times, and it's predecessor incarnations, since 1980. Tonight I was having dinner and drinks with a friend and the female barkeep would take empties and drop them into a tall plastic garbage can with other bottles, causing a very loud, unexpected noise. We were sitting about 6-8 feet away. After getting freaked each time it happened, probably 5-6 times over 30 minutes or so, I went up to her and asked if she could place the bottles in the can rather than drop or throw them in.

Great place for happy hour and office get togethers; many of the patrons (like myself) are regulars that work in the neighborhood. Also the food is wonderful as well and the barkeep and staff are very friendly.

This place is amazing. Believe it or not this part of San Fran used to be where the ships would be docked in the 17 and 18 hundreds.....miracle of land fill huh? So many ships were stacked up that they would sink the ships....cheaper than bringing them back to their port of origin
Love the food here. Night cook with the beard cooks my burger perfect every time.

Love this place! I walk by it almost daily to work and they have a little door open for coffee and small breakfast items, but I've never tried it. They do have a pretty nice lunch menu and have TONS of drinks to choose from. If they're busy, the service can be a little slow, but that's the story for most places!
Let's just say they forget to submit my order every time never fails, I'm here 30 at least just waiting on my order

One word of advice for this restaurant: Lay off the salt!! Gumbo was ok, but way too salty. Chicken wings were off-the-chart salty, had barely any meat, and too much hot wing sauce. The friend mushrooms, at least, were not salty, but had no flavor whatsoever.

This place was absolutely horrible. They started off by saying they were out of burgers, then they said they were out of hotwings. They later came back and said they now had burgers. When the food came out, the burgers were burned and the chicken Sandwhiches were served on burned buns. The server was then rude once it came down to splitting the tabs. He initially said he could split the tab then changed his mind after we ate. We questioned the bill because he actually overcharged our group $10, then he gave us attitude about it when asked about the bill.  If I could give this place no stars, I would.   This was all  around the lunch hour. We only went to this place because they had good reviews on yelp.....turns out most of the reviews were for the breakfast hours.

Five stars for the crew in the morning serving breakfast. I try to show up once a week for a breakfast burrito with bacon (nice, fat chunks of bacon). They also give you coffee or orange juice with it, if you want.

I have found my new work breakfast hub!  I'm sitting here grubbing on their "plain" breakfast burrito (eggs, cheese, potatoes, "mild" salsa, add avocado) which is very tasty...nothing spectacular, but absolutely no complaints.  What gets them their 5 stars, you may ask? The 16 oz. OJ thats INCLUDED in the $6.50...love, love, LOVE IT!!! So not the norm, especially here in the FiDi...that would be an extra $2 at McDonalds...I'm definitely sold!!!

It's going to be a sad day if my company moves to somewhere that isn't close to Old Ship. They secretly have a breakfast menu that goes until 10 a.m. on weekdays (breakfast burritos, breakfast sandwiches, scrambles).

Food menu has changed, but best nachos in the FiDi. I frequent since it's a block from my office. Justin is the best waiter. He loves to get people drunk. Don't be surprised if he comes around with shots of Jameson. I love this place period. No judging
Food, service everything was great.  Had the nachos - delicious!  Grilled cheese was so good.  Prices are reasonable.   What more do people want??

Stopped in here after checking out what pubs were around me and this place had the higher yelp reviews so I thought I would stop in and grab a beverage. All I had was two beers, the price was in line with I thought they would be but I'm not sure if there was happy hour pricing in effect as it was after 5pm on a Monday. The service was good enough and friendly enough but I'm not sure that I would go as far and say it was a "Cheers" vibe. I'm not a regular so maybe that would change things.
Love the food and the atmosphere at the Old Ship.    Especially love Alexis who always takes great care of her customers!!!!
Weird bartender with pony tail is wack. Blonde bartender with Tatoos equally wack. Pauly? One of a kind.

Food= Amazing.  All fresh ingredients and made from scratch.  Paulie the bartender was on top of his game.   This was my first visit to the OSS, and I can't wait to return.  I heard the nachos were out of this world...I will have to try them next time!

Decided we wanted something within walking distance from our hotel.... Hello Old Ship Saloon!  Ordered crab dip with won ton chips,  burgers, and truffled fries.  The crab dip was fairly good.   The won ton chips were good.   The burgers were not good. We ordered the burgers medium.   Medium usually means a little pink inside.   This burger was charred on the outside and bloody on the inside.   So bloody in fact that the buns of the burger was soaked in blood and colored the bun red.   So glad we didn't get e. coli!  The positives were the place was chill and seemed like a good place to just hang out and have a drink and server was nice.
Eat the wings! And the Salisbury steak special!
One of the finest beer and burger yielding establishments in San Francisco, hands down!
The Old Ship. What to say? If you're looking for a cheers type vibe, this is it. Larry (the bartender is always quick with my drink. Love it.

Service is very very slow!! Took 5 mins before someone show up and  sat us down. Then it took another 10 mins before someone came to us to ask what kind of drinks we would like.  My husband and I quickly ordered 2 soups and a beer from the waiter. We don't know how long we have to wait before he will be back. The beer and water took another 10 mins. To that point I am already tire of waiting. My clam/ mussel chowder wasn't that tasty. All the way FAIL!!!  I suggested they need to improve on the service so even though the food are not great but at least people won't be there waiting for nothing!

This place is no where near as good as I thought it would be, given the high rating on yelp. It is way too overpriced, the food was good to a certain extent but I've definitely had better. Only a couple out of the 12312312 courses were INCREDIBLY good. Maybe it's because my tastebuds are not sophisticated enough, but I do not see this as a Michelin star restaurant.

Cool tasting experience! Every dish was a unique flavor & texture with at least one ingredient that we had never tasted before. The overall flavor of every dish was also novel and fresh. My favorites were the thousand year old quail egg, lobster coral, grilled abalone, jellyfish wrapped shrimp and the sake lees sherbert. I could have done without a course or two as we got very full by the end and it made it harder to enjoy the later courses. Wait staff was attentive with a high server to customer ratio. I enjoyed Momofuku Ko in NYC a bit more but Benu is still worth trying out if you are a foodie.
Benu is probably one of the most exciting restaurants in San Francisco right now and it just earned Three-michelin stars!!

I came to Benu before the third Michelin star was awarded. I liked the thousand year old egg and a few other dishes, but most of the dishes had too complex of a flavor or were too bland. Unfortunately, it wasn't only my opinion but that of everyone else at the table who have a varied palate. It did not seem to be worth the price for me. And now with another star, I assume the price will only go higher. I really wanted to like Benu, as I found it to be atmospherically pleasing.

If you're not a foodie, you will not enjoy its offerings. I noticed that the people who tend to like this place enjoy it's flavors because the taste experience is different and unique from other restaurants, not necessarily because it tastes appetizing.
A decent meal at the recently minted 3 Michelin starred establishment!
went there a couple years ago... took some notes... forgot to write a review... my bad.

Wow, what great timing for a recent visit to Benu.  I didn't realize, at the time, that I would be dining at a newly crowned Michelin three-star restaurant.  Benu has been on my radar ever since I read about its inception several years back.  About a week prior to my visit to the city, I logged onto OpenTable to see if there were any availabilities at some of the fine dining establishments - notably Saison, Quince, and Benu.  I needed something really special since this was my first trip to the city with my girlfriend.  To my luck, I was pleasantly surprised that Benu had a cancellation and now had an available table on a Friday night.  Previous attempts on OpenTable were unsuccessful for several weeks prior.

There is magic that flows from the  hallway of Benu's kitchen into it's small, dim, austere dining room.    These were small bites- tastes which were shooting stars of familiar Western flavors intelligently and poetically merged with Asian essences.     My wife and I had no idea it was elevated to three Michelin stars recently; the staff seemed very humble and certainly didn't seem to exalt in it.   They just danced in and out of the theater stage which was our table, setting up place settings, explaining the course, then vanishing the consumed dishes in preparation for the next act.    It was quite the privilege and a sight to behold.
Wow this place is the BEST! I feel so lucky to have a dinner at this amazing place..
What an amazing experience!  Went there for my birthday and had dinner with wine pairing. Every dish was delicate and delicious. Unfortunately can't afford to go there as much as I would like to.

My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. The ambiance is not as welcoming, but the food is really delicious and presented very well. The first few courses are all very small, but they are misleading. i was exploding by course 10-ish (there are 17 courses total).
Simply amazing.
Eclectic food.  Bite sized dishes.  Some were amazing others were interesting.  Very expensive and definitely plan to be there a long time.  Our dinner was 3 &1/2 hours.

Came to Benu after stuffing ourselves with fruit and fish in Hawaii, and grandmother's food in CA - in addition, we live in one of the country's most Korean-concentrated areas (Northern VA), so most of the flavors were familiar to us. We liked:

I have mixed feelings about this place, I really had very high expectations, but after all I left this place with a lot of things to improve in each category.  1) Ambiance: most of the tables are close to the walls, meaning that most likely you will be seating right below a AC vent, they do control the AC temperature, but if you are on the cold side, bring a light jacket at least. 2) Service: Overall is pretty good, but I was hoping for a little bit of explanation of each dish, some of the waitresses basically brought  the food , repeats  the name and take off.. c'mon,  customers are paying a premium here, can you tell us more about the food, what's the reason behind a particular dish, ingredients, where they come from, little details like that. 3) The Food: I think a lot of the reviews here between 3-4 starts are pretty accurate when it comes to the food itself. My overall opinion is that there are probably 4-5 dishes out of the 18 that really stand out, the others, sometimes they are just pretty.
Food: 4

i went yesterday for my bf's B'day. the experience overall was great. the food is very creative and tasty and our conversations were mostly around the food the whole night as they were so unique. The service was great.
We love omakase style restaurants and Benu is definitely one of our favorites.

Eating at Benu is easily one of life's greatest dining experiences. Came here for last Vday. I agree fully with Darren K's review - money and fine dining does not translate to good food. Benu stands out above all the other top restaurants in the Bay Area, and is unequivocally my favorite. Flavors here cannot be found anywhere else, and each dish is incredibly unique. From start to finish, everything from the service to the food was immaculate. I cannot wait to go back.

One of my favorite of the Bay Area zen fine dining establishments.  Has a definite voice and purpose (integration of distinct Asian flavors and techniques with California sensibilities with flawless execution and breathless experimentation).  Standouts (i.e., some of the best thing's I've ever tasted) include the beggar's purse, the lobster soup dumplings, the bean curd dessert, beef cheek topped with onions, faux shark fin soup dessert (the sheer number of these is a testament to how great this restaurant is).   More consistent and satisfying from first course to last than many other tasting menu experiences in the Bay area.
I had a great dining experience here.  Perfect for any kind of celebration or get together.  Every plate was worth taking a photo.  Very good food and excellent service.

I came here for my birthday and it was probably one of my favorite meals in San Francisco. Yes, the portions are tiny, but the flavor is not. They do apply unique methods -- not for the sake of molecular gastronomy--but to get the best flavors. Unlike many places of this caliber, nothing feels over-engineered. The sake list is awesome and the service was great too.

Jellyfish, 1000 year old quail eggs, pig's head, shark fin soup, ... This restaurant will broaden your tasting buds' horizon. Friendly down to earth service, relaxed setting and simply amazing food. It's been 2 weeks but I can still taste the dessert...
I have mixed feelings about this place.  We spent $500 per person and I left hungry.
Anyone want reservations for tonight (9/4/2014) - we unfortunately had to cancel.  :-(

In recent years, San Francisco has experienced a gold rush of fine dining thanks to the city's tremendous tech boom and its newborn neophytes with wealthy appetites.  Money and fine dining hasn't always translated into good food though.  In Benu's case, it absolutely has.  In fact, the food here is quite spectacular.

(+0.5) This place has totally changed my lack of interest in asian fusion. They are able to make asian fusion a meaningful meal to those who are already familiar with asian food. The jelly fish wrapped caviar sprinkled shrimp tempura is a perfect example of how the classic japanese fair can be transformed to a better tasting and better looking culinary experience. It is extremely hard to do asian fusion justice and benu is almost there.
DETAILS. DETAILS. DETAILS. It's all about the details at Benu...

Can I give Benu 6 stars?  After being super disappointed after going to the "Restaurant at Meadowood" we thought our initial experience at Benu may have been a fluke so we decided to indulge again.  I was pleasantly surprised that they track if you have dined there previously and alter your meal a bit so the experience is different (how cool is that?).  Again we experienced superb and knowledgeable wait staff and were thoroughly delighted course after course (including the drink pairing of coarse).  Benu continues to be my all time favorite dining experience.  I am ready to be the Benu poster child!
With yet another year of marriage under our belts, a celebration was in order.

I LOVE this restaurant.  No seriously.  I've been here three times and it's always solid.  Granted I can't eat here every day but the (now) fiance and I always talk about how amazing Benu is.  I've been to The French Laundry and Saison but this is still my favorite special occasion restaurant.
I really enjoyed my experience at Benu last Friday. It was my first time enjoying a fine dining experience with such strong Asian cuisine influence, and I must say that it was pretty amazing.
How can anyone not give this place 5 stars?
Mini-bites at Maxi-prices
What an amazing meal.  My bf spoils me to death and surprised me by taking me here for our anniversary.  I've been dying to try this place knowing that Corey Lee is french laundry trained.

Had dinner here with my favorite people for my birthday last January. The food was great, lots of flavors. Definitely well plated, single spooned bites. I now have more respect for deconstructed food and molecular gastronomy because of Benu and it's chefs. I met the Master sommelier, (had a little obsession about them after watching Somm) he was very nice and gracious. I think the location is like a gem in the city, very quiet and private. I would definitely come back here and try the wine pairing.
I have to say this is the best Asian Michelin food I had, even better than Lung King Heen in HK which is a Michelin three star restaurant
Enjoyed every course here. My favorite was the lobster shanghai dumplings, duck with a truffle bun and the chicken liver.

This place was awesome.  Its impeccable service and great food deserves the 5 stars that I'm giving it.  Normally I find amazing service in Asia, but I've surely founded here at Benu.  We went with a friend who comes here quite often and Corey Lee treats the regular with specialty.  He customizes the tasting menu based on the person who makes the reservation and changes it according to the taste of the host.  We had a special tasting menu that wasn't the same as the others.  Another thing I liked about the service was that we could just tell the somm how many people were drinking and how much we were willing to spend, and he just picked out great wines for the meal.  that way we weren't confined to the wine pairing and spend that much.
Food: 3

i get random cravings. Sometimes to the point where I think I'm pregnant. (I'm not) Tonight was one of those nights. I wanted pastrami. Working in the Financial District at night leaves little options for someone hungry after 6pm. I used my nifty Yelp app and found this place just a few blocks away. I'm already looking forward to coming back here.

Sammy's is tried and true and a regular in my lunch rotation. They have a top notch, uber efficient, made-to-order sandwich bar, which stocks an Army-level supply of Dutch crunch (or tiger bread or giraffe bread, depending on where you hail from). Oh, and their meat portions are quite generous. My go-to is the Italian hoagie.
Solid sandwich! Decent deli meats and decently prices. Very friendly staff.
Been coming to Sammy's for 2 years now and they are the best.
Quick deli sandwiches that do the trick!

I like coming here because they're close to work, really efficient and quick and they make a pretty darn good Sammie.  I suggest not going too late, since they might be out of the meat, cheese or bread you want.  All the Sammies I've tried (the Italian, BFS, Turkey & Salami and Pastrami) have been really good.    The staff are really friendly and helpful.  They put a good portion of meats and cheeses on each Sammie and I like the French Roll or Dutch Crunch the best.

Yummy! Super speedy, tasty & reasonably priced sandos. I've only been twice (so far) and have been happy with both orders. I've had the BLT with avocado & the Roast Beef on Dutch Crunch. Can't go wrong with either. Also the staff is super friendly & let me reiterate speedy! I was in and out in less than 5 minutes.

Even if their prices might have gone up recently,this is still the first place you would want to grab a sandwich from. This is because they are still offering very affordable and tasty products. The vegetables are quite fresh. I love the chicken and egg salad mix. also, I appreciate the fact that I don't have to wait long for my order.

I've been wanting to try this place for a few weeks now and decided to take the plunge today.  I walked over at about 1:40 p.m. so I missed the lunch rush (yayy!).  The women who work there were very friendly.  I ordered the Italian Hoagie which consists of an Italian Triple Threat, salami, mortadella and ham on sourdough.  The woman making my sandwich was careful to ask me if I wanted all condiments to which I replied Yes!  While she was making it,, the anticipation of biting into it grew so much that I almost twisted my ankle trying to run back to my office so I could hurry up and eat it (Note: I do have on 4 inch heels).

Very good deli sandwiches, but I feel like its missing a little kick to push the sandwich up to 4 star status. I dunno if I went on an off day, but my sandwich was definitely not as big as some of the ones posted on yelp.

Sammy's on 2nd. Okay here is my breakdown. The sandwiches are great, the people are great. From the outside it looks like another corner store but inside there are great women, making great sandwiches. Why the three stars then? The reason is because I don't think I should be paying nine dollars for a sandwich off the menu. It is delicious, and well made, and the service is amazing, but I would much happier paying 7 dollars versus 9.
Good sandwich, hole in the wall. reasonable price
I love this sandwich place. You might think, Ok, woah, they're just sandwiches. And while they are, they're just so damn good.
This review is for the deli, though Sammy's also has a selection of convenience store items and a substantial beer/wine/liquor selection.
Ever hear of the broken window theory?
We always get our sandwiches from here, and it's exactly what you'd expect!  BLT's are great, roast beef is pretty good.  They have a nice selection, nothing too fancy, and decent drink options too.

The boyfriend and I were looking for wine to bring over to his sister's place only to find that most shops that sell liquor around SoMa close at 7PM...  WHAT?!?!  So after using my handy Yelp app, I found Sammy's on 2nd, which opened until 11!
Just finished eating and had to review!

Meh. Ingredients are fine but overall the sandwich is pretty bland. It's like a fatter version of subway. I got the Italian Hoagie - the dutch crunch bread was not crunchy at all, besides the meat there was just a thin leaf of lettuce, a slice of tomato, some peppers, and vinaigrette. No yummy sauce. Perfectly acceptable meal but I could've made it at home for significantly less than $9, or got a smaller version at Subway for $3.

Attention all sandwich lovers! Check this place out :) Sammy's on 2nd makes fresh and tasty sandwiches. I was introduced to this place by a co-worker one day for lunch and have been coming back ever since.
What a find! Never knew this place: 1.) Existed; 2.) Served sandwiches inside (I guess if I didn't know it existed than 2 wouldn't matter...)

Some colleagues and I ventured a bit further from our usual 3-block radius to go to Sammy's for lunch. I got the veggie sandwich on Dutch crunch, along with the soup of the day. With better bread, it would easily be 4 stars, but none of us actually liked the bread that much - maybe it was just today's batch, but it was extremely chewy, unlike any Dutch crunch I've had before. The rest of the sandwich (construction + choice of cheeses/veggies) and the soup was quite good for the price. We'll probably try it again at some point, but this first visit didn't get us hooked.
Best convenience shop in the neighborhood. Good sandwiches too!

Sammy's makes some delicious sandwiches and the line is much shorter than Algiers. The sandwich was made of chewy Dutch crunch pastrami and avocado. I like that they offer soup, tiramisu, and a variety of convenience store goods.
