The house special with pastrami and Swiss on pita was great for a quick bite on the run.  They have a decent beer and wine selection and the sandwiches are tasty. I'll definitely try it again.

Fast and friendly service en when they are busy, Sammy's has fresh deli ingredients and a nice selection of fresh breads for sandwiches. My personal fave is their chicken salad on Dutch Crunch. So good.  Even if I end up eating at my desk while working, that Sammie alone makes the day better.

Love Sammy's! The sandwiches are delish, everything is so fresh and and the bread (esp the Dutch Crunch) is yummy. Also everyone that works there is super nice and the service if quick. Great place to go for lunch!

It's just after 11pm. You are close by. Yelp said you were open. The big posted board outside your establishment stated you were open. But your door is locked and even though you are vaguely smiling you are waving me away. I don't think I'll be coming back here anytime soon..
Just like the sandwiches I remember growing up with ... love, love, love Sammy's.

Each falafel is 75¢. Walk out with four falafel for $3, along with some hummus and you have a value lunch. However, when it's a lunch rush you may not get the hummus. When it's the down time it's more likely. Their sandwiches are enormous, and sure there isn't sriacha-roasted truffle drips on them, but they're enormous, likely near your office, and serviceable. That's really all I've got here. Also, the service will get you in and out in under five minutes.

Excellent sandwich and perfect service.  I ordered a turkey, avo and bacon and when the gal opened the avocado she deemed it not adequate.  I love that attention to detail.  This is really my bosses place but I have to have a Sammy's at least once a week.
Very nice service and a good sandwich

Same good Sammys I remember when I used to work at CompUSA and they used to be on Sutter St or somewhere there. Excellent sandwich. I'm eating a chicken breast sandwich on dutch crunch with pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, and a little mustard. I may have to spend a little more, but it's worth it over the same chicken breast sandwich I could buy at a chain sandwich shop which tastes a bit more bland. The store is well lighted inside and the employees here are warm and friendly.
Not very tasty. Poor quality products. Stale and chewy bread.
Quite possibly the best cold sandwich in San Francisco may be Sammy's American Hoagie! If not in all of SF, then certainly in the Financial/SOMA area.

I just ate my first turkey sandwich from Sammy's On 2nd and I am sure it will not be my last. Where to start? The dutch crunch that is the perfect spongy vehicle to get meat, cheese, and veggies in my belly? The quality of their deli meats? The awesome fresh veggies they put on their sandwiches? All of those are true but what I think is the best part is that everyone who works here is insanely friendly and attentive.

I got the pastrami and it was honestly nothing amazing to me. For $7, and for all the rave this place gets, I had high expectations and Sammy's just didn't cut it. The sandwich wasn't flavorful and tasty like a great sandwich should be. I don't think it's worth it. I've had better sandwiches, way better sandwiches. It was a good sandwich, but forgettable.
Why didn't I know this place existed? I've been getting off the same bus stop which literally stops 2 feet away from this place and I never even glanced to see what's inside.
The deli ingredients are good, the place is clean, and the prices for the location are reasonable. Add friendly staff, and you've got a solid place.

Yummmmmmmmmmm I came here with my coworkers and we got three appetizers: deviled eggs, chicken pot pie, and tater tots. All three were really good. For my entree, I got the lobster roll ($27 o_o). It was pretty good. The bread was soft, sauce was great, and lobster was good... but not worth $27... I prefer the lobster roll at woodhouse (sorry!!!)... but the service here was great!!! We were sitting outside while it was raining, and because some of us got slightly rained on, they gave us dessert on the house (some pb&j dessert that was good)!! Whooooooo.

Really liked the place.  My best friend and I were visiting SF for the wkend and our hotel was less than a mile from the restaurant.  We ordered apps and drinks, they were all really delicious.  We ordered the bacon wrapped meatloaf, tater tots, and chicken pot pie.  As far as drinks, we had Sidecar and Ginger Cosmo, everything was so delicious.  Between the 2 of us, that was plenty of food and we were stuffed. Our server wasn't that attentive, otherwise I would've given them 5 stars. Definitely recommend!
Favorites:

Today a group of 4 of us went to Sauce for lunch . We asked for a table and the hostess said "I think I can make 4 work" and then proceeded to give us a table out on the patio. After about 10 minutes of us being greeted someone whom Id presume to be the manager came over and stated "We have a fully reserved dining room, how did you get this table" to which we replied The hostess. He then (in a very gruff tone)  stated OH the one who just said that she didn't seat you?! and then Huffed and walked away. We then sat for 10 more minutes without being approached by the server. Our food came and it was great. However the manager stood in the door way with a scowl that read nothing hospitable and welcoming.  The hostess came over and let us know it was "all good" and walked away. Our food was great but the bitter experience leaves the strongest taste and for that we will never return or bring clients here again.

The quality of the food alone would make Sauce one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco, but adding in the comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff and extensive wine list makes this place hard to beat. Rather than featuring the newest trendy dishes or some sort of culinary fusion, Sauce's menu features pot roast, steak and eggs, Mac 'n Cheese and other items you would expect from a home cooked meal. Chef Ben Paula has taken some very basic dishes and made them absolutely amazing.

A nice little spot we stumbled upon in Belden Place while exploring the streets of the Financial District. We had the portobello mushroom fries, mixed heritage greens salad, Rosie's organic fried chicken, braised beef short rib stroganoff, and cinnamon sugar cronuts. The food was good, especially the stroganoff which was excellent. Unfortunately, the service was slow, but it won't deter me from coming back. Definitely give this place a shot.

Amazing food!! A must try!! Everything we ordered was delish! But the braised short ribs stroganoff was exceptional!!! We would have gave it 5 stars if it was just based on the food but the service was disappointing!

This restaurant is located in Belden Alley which is this super cute somewhat hidden secret of an alley with cafe lights strung overhead not too far from the Union Square area where we had just been shopping. We had a large group of about 8-10 people. It's actually a pretty good restaurant for large parties like ours. We had an attentive and friendly waitress. 3 stars because the food was kind of whatever. Kind of like the TGI Friday's of San Francisco.

Came here for lunch during the week and our party of 6 was say right away! The service was good--even though our server seemed to have a lot of tables. I loved everything I ordered! We started with the wontons which were delicious and I had the salmon as my entree. At first, when I saw the burger, I was a little jealous I didn't order that instead. But, once I tried my salmon I was completely satisfied with my order--it has bacon so of course I was won over! The burger was pretty big--two patties!-- so come hungry. :) My favorite part was you can order a home made cookie to go with your check!

Came back here and sat inside, mistake. Atmosphere outside is way better. Also, I tried the "famous" mushroom fries....I don't really get it. I think the only reason to come here is the servers are nice, the food is fine, but really the atmosphere outside in the cobblestone lane is great. If you do come here, don't waste your time inside.
Really good food, nice venue, service is a bit slow but it is worth it.
Delicious beef stroganoff. Very flavorful. And the cronuts were a great dessert. Great for date night or for a dinner with friends.

We had an amazing dining experience at Sauce! We had great service and the food was outstanding! We had to try the "bowl of bacon," which doesn't sound like much, but was actually very tasty. I had the Peppered Hanger Steak which came with loaded fries and an arugula salad. It was quite simply awesome! We finished with Mini S'mores, which were SO good! We loved everything about our meal!!

This is one of those places where everything sounds good. Everything. The Maine Lobster Roll, bacon wrapped meatloaf bites, Mac and cheese, the deviled eggs...I got the double bacon cheese burger + deviled egg filling. It was amazing!!! Good seasoned fries and a full bar, only down fall is there were many loud know-it-all customers. But it's one of my favorite places in SF.  And don't even try going there Fri-Saturday night, it's packed. And when there is a sports event.
Love this place and the atmosphere of the hidden alley. It's romantic and very fun! The food has always been yummy, try the bowl of bacon...amazing.

Finally had a chance to check out Belden Place aka French Quarters after passing by it so many times. My friend decided we should meet at Sauce, a place she frequents often when kicking off her night.
This review is only about the appetizers and desserts.
Cheeseburger here tastes like a big mac. The app share platter with a bowl of bacon, bacon topped deviled egg, mushroom fries, and mini pot pies were cray cray dericious. Nom nom nom
The bartender is masterful, the short rib stroganoff orgasmic!!! Topped off with Cronuts. Best meal in decades.

Awesome comfort food! Open late! Nicole was our server, very friendly and attentive. Had the mini meatloaf, Mac and cheese and Maine lobster roll. Food can be shared to enjoy more on the menu. Lobster roll could have had more lobster.

I had a big team meeting and at the end of day 2 - we broke into smaller groups for dinner at different restaurants. The leader of our group picked this place. I was intrigued since I had seen it on Check Please and it was universally loved.
Very expensive burger, fries, salad and Mac and cheese for lunch in the financial district.  For that price, I'd go somewhere else next time.

Was looking for a late-night place to grab a snack over the holiday weekend. This was the only place we could find open within a mile of the Embarcadero. We were pleasantly surprised. The ambiance is great. It's a cute place tucked into an alley street. The food was very good and the service was great too. Prices were reasonable. I'd definitely go back when in SF again and looking for some tasty late-night grub.

The staff at Sauce was very accommodating for our dinner party of ten, especially considering everyone in our group was late getting to the restaurant. Food selection is decent, and everyone loved their appetizers and desserts. In my opinion, the standouts were the tater tots for appetizers and the warm chocolate cake for dessert. Our waitress was amazing, as she had the arduous task of keeping everyone's bar tabs separate.
Tater Totts were awesome! Epic comfort food, but really delicate, clean and packed with flavour. Will be coming back for sure! Great service too!

I was taken to lunch yesterday and while I had been to the Gough street location once before I had only had the tomato bisque just because it was suggested after a friend of mine and I had several beers. That was pretty good, but I was at this location mainly to eat and had the bacon cheeseburger that was awesome.

Made a reservation for my birthday at a recommendation of my sister. She said it was fun, delicious food and great environment.  I was impressed with the phone call the day prior, confirming my reservation and also confirming that it was my birthday. Upon arrival we were greeted outside, I mentioned we had a reservation and were waiting for the rest of our party and would get a drink at the bar.  We ordered our drinks and immediately were told our table was ready. I liked that the staff was on top of things, but it felt pushy, especially since I had just mentioned that we were waiting for the rest of our party and just had ordered drinks. I again said we are waiting and would like to have our drinks at the bar.  The rest of our party arrived and we were seated.  The outside seating area is quaint and nice, European feel. We reviewed the menu which has quite a bit of what they call social plates ( small plates to share) and then entree's.  We decided to order some of the social plates. Portabello mushroom fries and the baked mac and cheese.   We mentioned to the waitress we would keep the menus so we could decide on our entrees.  Not 3 minutes later did another person come over and ask if we wanted to order.  I then mentioned that we ordered some starters and wanted to wait to order the entrees.  Again, this was a nice gesture, but I got the sense they wanted to push us out of there. We received the starters which were delicious.  Ordered our entrees and two of the couples asked if they could split.  We received our entrees which were beautifully plated, however, they didn't not split the entrees onto two plates.  Which is a little frustrating.  Dessert menus were offered and we ordered the cronuts, PB&J and coffee. Not once did they mention anything about my birthday.  I thought they might put a candle in the cronuts.  No such luck, both desserts arrived and nothing.  All in all I have to say that the food was delicious at Sauce. I just felt the whole dinner felt rushed, the wait staff had zero personality and I was very disappointed  that nothing was done for my birthday. Like I said a candle in the cronuts would have been a nice touch. Not sure if it was an off night for them, but I am not sure I would return.

The food was fine, but only if you are really hungry and can't get reservations anywhere else. It's akin to something as horrifyingly generic as the Cheesecake Factory, only with smaller and more overpriced portions. Again, it's perfectly edible but just not worth going to unless you're nearby and desperate (which was us this time). Really touristy as well, which is not surprising considering the location. We literally saw no fewer than five backpack-toting families come in during the dinner hour. Service was really good though!

Great little restaurant in Belden Alley.  I sat outside on a cool-ish day but did not feel too cold.  I felt as though I escaped the financial district during my lunch time. Burgers come with two patties and can easily be shared.  The heirloom tomato and corn salad with grilled chicken was a nice dish that I would order again.

Wow, where do I start. Our hotel concierge recommended this place. Got there around 830 pm and got a seat by the kitchen entrance. My kids and I could barely stand the overwhelming smell of toilet sewage that surrounded us. I'm not a picky sort of person but this was really smelly. We ordered mini meatloaves, tater tots, and mini chicken pot pies. I took one bite of the mini meatloaf and had to spit it out. It tasted like it was old rancid meat. My kids

Food is farm to table. Portobello mushrooms fries with dipping sauce are incredible. We are had mini meatloafs and shrimp pockets for appetizers. We shared a corn and tomatoes salad. The corn was fresh off the cob with tasty tomatoes. My entree was the vegetarian strudel. Others in our group had beef Wellington, pork ossco and salmon. All the dishes were excellent. The salmon was served over a spinach chiffonade salad which the chef kindly explained how he made it. My husband never eats anything green and he loved the salmon base. We finished up with 3 dessert to share---cronuts, chocolate cake bites and s'mores. The Cronuts with dipping sauce were the best and most unique.

Well, the service was slow. We had to wait forever between ordering our apps and the actual meal. The ginger beer was a little too sweet, the tots and mini pot pies were awesome, the salmon was overwhelming with horse radish... I had to send it back. I ordered the chicken and it was the saltiest dish I've ever had. Almost inedible. The bread was amazing.

This restaurant was wonderful! You wouldn't expect to find such a gem in an alley, but there it is! Don't be fooled by the outside...the food is terrific. We four adults and two kids tried the chicken parm...best I've ever had..my daughter had the short ribs Wellington. The meat was tender and super flavorful..the sauce made it even better.

My husband and I were in town visiting friends and we found this restaurant on yelp. The service was amazing! Our waiter was extremely nice and helpful on menu questions! We ordered the hanger steak, chicken Parmesan and the mini s'mores for dessert. Everything was amazing! My husband and I ate the entire thing plus dessert! I highly recommend this restaurant for the great service, atmosphere, and food!
AMAZING!!! First off, they have Old Rasputin stout! (Nuff said) and everything we had was great!

I really enjoy going out to "Sauce" for an occasional long lunch away from work. The burger is tasty, but my favorite is the seafood chowder with clam strips. I think it is a good value for your money and service is friendly and prompt.
Loved the butter fish, hit the spot! My wife enjoyed the chili as well. Great vibe, great food.

The hostess, Sophia, right from the start set this place apart from all the other options on this adorable little block. The sign of a good restaurant is that a chef is willing to accommodate food allergies. Mark was knowledgable and gave us great recommendations based on our restrictions. Not only does this make for easier group meals but you know everything's made fresh. Plus dog accommodations make our list! Thanks for filling all our requirements! Now I'll actually order and try the food...

So cute!  I love Belden Alley because of the outdoor seating in the alleyway.  Never been to Europe, but I trust when people say its a little slice of Europe's cafes with the outdoor seating.  I've been to Cafe Bastille in the alley before and Janice C. and I were looking forward to Sauce when we saw it was participating in Dine About Town.
Service:  A+
First time trying this place out and it was amazing. I had taste of pulled pork and short rib, my goal is to try EVERYTHING on the menu in the next couple of weeks!

I can see people lining up for this place from my yoga studio's new location so, rolling out of there at 2 pm I was about ready to eat a horse, but in the light of Ahimsa and all that, I thought I'd go vegetarian for my lunch and ordered the BALT (Basil, Avocado, Lettuce & Tomato with goat cheese).

When I look back over my previous review I can't believe I only gave this place 3 stars because the bear claw was amazing. And sadly it's no longer available and hasn't been in years - just goes to show what happens when I don't patronize my favorite places!
In the alley way. No where to sit, but the orders come out fast.
The Pulled Pork sandwich here is one of my favorite lunches in the entire city of San Francisco. If you haven't tried it, you need to.

BEST pulled pork sandwich I've had in a long time and I'm originally from the Deep South. Also the muffins in the morning are phenomenal. It's the best window I've ever eaten out of!! Also the staff is really cool.
This place is actually pretty good. I didn't expect too much out of it, but they are really amazing. Got the clam chowder and a chicken sandwich and both were spectacular!
Still shining.

Whenever the line at the Sentinel (their sister place) is too long, we just walk a bit further from our office to The Golden West. There's hardly more than 5 people in line when we arrive, unlike the Sentinel, where I've seen 30 people in line around 12:15.

Went today after reading the reviews... Was really hungry but the food fell short of my expectations... The devil sandwich was average and I have had better zucchini cakes...it's a little pricey for what you get ... I however like the location...
Soo... I just inhaled the Pulled Pork sandwich got here. The sense of urgency I had to write a review was just too much. Amazing.

Super speedy sandwich delivery and I love that everything is made on premise. I got the tofu, sesame ginger sandwich and my dad got the apple chutney sandwich. We both decided that they were lacking the next level of flavor, good nonetheless but not GREAT. The bread to filling ratio was a little heavy on the dough but the whole wheat was actually super yummy. I think marinating the tofu would have made it great! And the chutney needed more tang, the apples were a bit too sweet. I don't think I would return here but it wasn't a bad lunch.
The blueberry muffin is no joke! Immediately, you can taste and feel the buttery richness in your mouth. Make sure to leave some of the crispy top for the last few bites....if you're into that.
The deviled egg salad sandwich is a good portion for the price, but not an exceptional translation of deviled egg into egg-salad. It mostly just tasted like, well, an egg salad sandwich!

This review is solely about the bbq pulled pork sandwich. Not entirely sure what the hype is here. This is a far stretch from bbq pulled pork. The bread is AMAZING but the filling tastes like some sort of pork paprikash Eastern European stew and bears little semblance to bbq.

I started working on a project in the financial district and started a secondary quest for the best egg salad sandwich. First was Shorty Goldstein's, next up was the Golden West. Who knew that such delicious eggy goodness would come from a a random hole in the wall/lunch window in a random alleyway in the FiDi? The Deviled Egg Sandwich was heavenly! I like that their version has a bit of spice to it and the bread the sandwich comes in might be my new favorite sandwich bread.

Great find! I just stumbled on this looking for a place to grab a quick bite. Really inventive sandwiches and salads. I got the pulled pork with mustard cabbage. It was spicy and tangy with just the right proportion of pork, to cabbage to roll. The prices aren't cheap but they're in the upper-reasonable spectrum.
This place gets the fat girl going in my every morning as I walk by - who doesn't love the smell of coffee cake, blueberry muffins and banana bread in the morning?  Nobody, that's who.
Awful. I can't believe I paid $8.50 for a chunk of cold tofu. Not recommended for veg*ns.

I love trekking across Market street to this literal hole-in-the-wall (well, two holes if you count both the order and pickup windows). They keep things simple with a low-profile sign bearing the periodic table symbol for gold, and a short menu of about 10 items-- mostly sandwiches, but a few salads and a special that changes daily.

I do love the sandwiches here, but you can usually find me standing in line for a warm muffin in the morning. The flavors change every day, and I get especially excited when sour cherry muffins are on the menu. The apple cherry and blueberry muffins are tasty, too. At only $2.50 a piece, they are an inexpensive way to start your day on the right foot.

Although I haven't had the chance to try their lunch I have to say - BEST oatmeal ever. It'll change your views on oatmeal... its fully packed with an amazing mixture of fruits & nuts that change everyday and you then have the option of adding brown sugar.

Got the short rib sandwich. Really tasty and messy sandwich! There is a lot of good bbq sauce slathered overed the short ribs so I had to knife and fork my sandwich. The bun was the best part! So light and fluffy and it was absorbing all the bbq juices of the sandwich making it more tasty.
Fabulous to-go lunch options! Fast service. A nice break from the standard lunch options.
Their sour cherry muffins are to die for. My goodness they're so good!

This place is a perfect example of moth flying towards lights or how Toucan Sam would say follow my nose. Hidden in an alley, this place caught my attention in the morning with the wonderful wonderful smell of baked goods. I had to re route to work to see what that wonderful smell is.
Short rib sandwich is definitely one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life.
How was the west won?  With delicious meaty sandwiches that fill your belly.

Careful not to miss this place; it's a lunch window hidden in the Trinity alley. I got the short rib sandwich ($9), which honestly looked and tasted like a bbq pulled pork sandwich. It's pretty good, but maybe I should go back and actually try the spicy pulled pork sandwich to see the difference.
This is a to-go $9 sandwich spot. I got the pulled pork sandwich. The bread was my favorite part of the sandwich. It was a good sandwich, just not worth $9.

Forget about the other eateries in the financial district for breakfast. The Golden West makes the best muffins I've ever had. The apple, pear, and butternut squash muffins are my personal favorites. They are freshly baked and sell out fast so get there early. Take it from a fat guy and get a muffin here!

Here's another $9 sandwich place, similar to the sentinel (which I prefer). I got the short rib sandwich. To be honest, it kind of felt, tasted, and looked like the pulled-pork sandwich, so I'm still pondering on whether or not they screwed up my order. Regardless, the sandwich was a-ok. Not the best short-rib sandwich I've had, but good enough for me to eat it all. I was thinking about the sentinel the entire time, though.
Yum. A great lunch spot with unique sandwiches. I have never been disappointed. I also enjoy their muffins in the morning.
The pulled pork sandwich is consistently AH-MAZING. LOVE.

Just wanted to update that I've tried their lunch menu here. I had the pleasure of coming here with a friend so we each got a different sandwich and swap out halfsies. I got to try the pull pork and short ribs. The buns they use was really good, it was toasted nicely with some sesame seeds on top, it has a bit of a sweet note to it. The pull pork was good, it was a little lighter on flavor. The short rib tasted a little better for me, it has a bold saucy flavor. I wish it had a little bit more texture to it because it was literally piled up with meat and bun. Most guys would probably like it but I really can't complain since the taste was on point.
Super fast service. Got the short rib sandwich and it was awesome. Although I should try something new on the menu next time I will most likely just get this again...
I really want to like this place. After a few underwhelming experiences I decided to give it one more try. I ordered the chicken mole salad not knowing what to expect.
Shortbread cookie with Marmalade Apricot. Yum!!!
Love this place. Fast, convenient and amazing flavor. Definitely a fidi gem.
They close at 2:30 and by that time half of the sandwiches are gone and they only had foccacia bread! So, try to get there early if you can.
My new favorites are:
Came here on a late Friday night since man friend and I were super starving.

Overdue review but must give kudos when deserved. The food was fantastic and the service was equally exceptional. I unfortunately forgot our server's name, but she was extremely knowledgeable, sweet and attentive. We ordered the omakase and all the "yumm" and "oooh"s from our table convinced the couple next to us to order the same. 4 stars because darnit, it takes a lot to give 5 stars and I wasn't completely "blown away."
Brief disclaimer: this is the first sushi restaurant I have tried in San Francisco so I have no local point of reference however I have been to very good sushi places elsewhere.

Food and service was all great, but when I asked for a box to take my entree home, this buss guy said they didn't have any boxes. WTF, are you serious? He said he was joking moments later... um, why are you joking about that? I hope he gets fired.
Friendly knowledgable staff were happy to give me intro on different kinds of beef :)

We had a party of 5 and I found the main sushi dishes very over priced and small portions. It seemed they were more into decoration of there dishes then portions. The saki was also very over priced! Normal Carafe hot saki for two $48 ridiculous. Service was slow in getting our bottle of saki  $80. I am just not used to paying such high price for saki so maybe I do not know my saki quality! Received dishes but Had to ask for more wasabi as small amount and no ginger as again had to ask server! Have been to many sushi restaurants and this was very disappointing ! Lots of show but ridiculous portions and presentation over done! Food was flavorful but limited selection of sushi dishes and way overpriced. Appetizers were very good and reasonably priced! Just a confusing experience after being to many sushi restaurant ! Very elegant looking restaurant so realize high rent and investment to justify their style of business ! I am a restaurants  owner for 20 years also and disappointed overall !
I was invited to the opening party, it was wonderful and fun.  Went here two other times and was blown away right after opening.
Review #250 goes to Roka Akor because, dammit, I am ready to have a love affair with this place.
Our server Eric was on point all night! He was very conscientious of a food allergy and gave great recommendations. Roka Akor had great food and fun modern vibe. Definitely recommend!

The food was very good, but I was pretty blown off by how expensive this place was, given that we left the restaurant feeling quite hungry. Wagyu, black cod, and seared scallops were my favorite dishes. I would come back again.

Came here for the first time Monday night and had a great dinner with excellent service. I really wanted to check out the bar because I had heard great things from my co-worker.  After dinner, however, we were told the bar was CLOSED?!  Super disappointing as it was barely past 9pm.  I guess I will try again....
So, the short story is, good food, nothing special, debatable service for such an expensive restaurant. A little over the top in both flavors and presentation, but quality food.
great place

WOW....granted we are not locals, but based on reviews and recommendations we ate here while visiting San Francisco. We began in the basement bar, a very trendy space where you can also eat and watched the Giants win the pennant while sipping a Kirin on draft. Our reservation time arrived and we returned upstairs to eat. The fish is very fresh, cut expertly and has a wonderful presentation. We started with the pork belly dish and toro tartare, both amazingly good. We then moved on to the the chef's selection that comes on a glowing plate. From salmon to tuna to mackeral (with the mackeral carcass artistically arranged on the plate) to other pieces, we were not only pleased with the selection, but the presentation was just wonderful. Service was excellent,  the saki selections were good as well. Next visit, we will be back!
One great to visit in SF. Amazing.
Way to many better places to eat in The area. I wouldn't waste your money! Go and enjoy a real meal. I wanted to give this place3 stars but had to be honest!

The service was amazing.  Best u have had in sfo.  The food was average at best.  The restaurant is taking the right direction with their menu and mimicking dish from other more notable sushi restaurants, such as nobu and yellow tail.  Unfortunately the dish are missing the mark and left me underwhelmed.
One of the best meals I've had in SF this year. Fresh sushi, really interesting flavors in the small plates. Didn't try the steak but will next time.
The wagyu was off the hook... The butterfish tataki, hirame/hamachi, king salmon, uni and other sashimi tasted like it just came off the hook (meaning super fresh and delicious)...
OMAKASEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

One of the best experiences and food I have had in a long time.   The food is spectacular,  get the corn, Brussel sprouts,  wasabi pea dust shrimp, and oh yes did I mention the corn?  This is not your normal Japanese style restaurant.  You will be amazed by the flavors that come together in every dish.  Everything you order is meant to be shared so you can try a lot of different things.   The ambiance has an LA meets Food network kitchen feel and the executive chef is a bad@ss.  Our server was so nice as well.  If you like Moscow mule cocktails they have a play on it with homemade ginger beer that is out of this world.   Make a reservation and take ur time to inhale all.of that great food, and get the corn!
Will never ever come back.
one word - OMAKASE!
Been here twice already~
Made a reservation for dinner via OpenTable a few days prior and it was surprising that my table wasn't ready at my specified time...

You can easily drop $100 for food per person here but it would all be worth it.  The food was so good I ate until I almost exploded.  I had one heck of a dinner here and still dreams about the food from time to time.  I was quite excited to find out that there's a Chicago location I can go try once I return home.

Was blown away by the presentation of their six piece sashimi lunch. This restaurant is a dreamy mix of sushi and traditional Japanese dishes - the decor is warm and inviting too. One of the best sushi places I've been to in SF.

I was here last night with my family to celebrate my beautiful mother's 83rd bday.  We had been looking forward to coming here for a very long time and were anticipating good food and service.  We were not disappointed!  The staff was amazing!  We were escorted downstairs to the bar for a drink before dinner by a very nice hostess.  I think her name was Catherine.  The bar staff was equally attentive and accommodating. When our table was ready, our drinks were whisked upstairs and we were again escorted by the hostess to our table.  My mom walks very slow and everyone was very respectful and patient.  The whole staff was friendly and helpful to recommend dishes and answer questions.  I wish I remembered everyone's name who helped because the service was amazing. The two other staff managers were Erik and Christian.  They came by our table throughout dinner to make sure our experience was one to remember and it was.
Took my gf three before her bachelorette party. The staff were really nice. Great/fresh food, but on the expensive side

It was my last night in San Francisco so my lovely sister brought me here for dinner. It was Labour Day so the bar downstair was closed. However, the restaurant was open and we were sat in a spacious wooden table. The service here was great! Our waitress remembered all our orders without a pen and paper, it was pretty impressive, until later that night our lamb chop was late, and we suspect that they totally forgot that order until we asked. Despite the wait, I will still give five stars, the food was simply delicious. The pork belly was melt-in-your-mouth. The soft shell crab maki was absolutely delicious with the sauce.  Our Korean Style Lamb Chop was interesting, the lamb itself was great but the garnish was a little too strange for my liking. Overall, great food, great experience.
This review will NOT be helpful.   It was Awesome - that's all I remember!

You simply cannot come here without trying the black cod! It is outstanding & cooked to perfection. The corn is a close runner up & the gyoza was delicious too. The pork belly was crying out for a dipping sauce to cut the richness & the soft shell crab was a touch below portion & lacking an obvious burst of flavor. Don't miss the black cod!

We decided to ball out and do the omakase.  Dear lord it was delicious but so much food. The wagyu beef, pork belly, heirloom beet salad, and corn were all amazing. The wagyu came with some amazing dipping options, btw. Drink wise, I got the shochu smash, which was tasty. My husband got the isle of despair to (wouldn't recommend unless you like strong drinks). Overall, very good and would go back.

The bomb dot com. Came across this place as I was aimlessly wondering around trying to find a cool new spot. The decor is sexy chic. The service impeccable. Not only is the food delicious, the presentation of the food is OUTSTANDING. We ordered the spicy hamachi roll, black cod, lamb chops, rib eye, grilled corn, chocolate lava cake. I'm going back every day of the week!! I still dream of this place :)

We did the Omakase. The service was friendly, enthusiastic, and very good...although the course pace was a bit quick at times - but there were a lot of dishes! We took a lot home for lunch the next day. I'm not the biggest fan of sea urchin, but the sea bass, the shaved black truffle dish, the multiple tataki dishes, sashimi plates, the wagyu beef and the desserts were spectacular. A great wine list too with nice stemware. The place is always full (third time here), and could be a bit loud if you are looking for an intimate/quiet evening.  We had a blast and went home very happy - nice separate bar downstairs as well.
The first time I went to Roka Akor, their omakase blew my mind.
What a long overdue review.

I've seriously been trying to write more yelp reviews but it's so hard. I forget where I eat at all the time or I forget to tickets pic. Just 2 mins before this post, I deleted all of my pics from here... Sigh.
Good steaks & Good sized portions overall.  We tried all their main dishes, everything is good.  DO NOT get the Mushroom Rice.

Pretty damn tasty for being a hole in the wall. Great lunch option if you don't have to be too productive in the afternoon because this will knock you out!  Be sure to ask to try their different levels of hot sauce- very good!

Hooked on the Kimchi Burrito. I tried recently the new version of the suicide burrito, which instead of rice has rice noodles. It was very tasty, but not as spicy as I expected. It was delicious, but not burning hot!

This pains me to do since I'm usually a big supporter of mom 'n pop shops, but I simply cannot support a place that DOES NOT serve their food made-to-order. This establishment doesn't really have a "kitchen" but more of a prepping area. It would be one thing if I was at McDonald's. But this is not McDonald's and these are not McDonald's prices. Fresh is better!

Had the Bi Bim Bop burrito last week and it was underwhelming.  I think my problem with it was the eggs were not fresh.  I saw them put the scrambled eggs in the burrito from a tupper ware case and they did not look like they had been cooked within the last hour.  Meat was tasty and veggies were crispy but the eggs just tasted old and lukewarm, which really ruined it for me.  Also, while the tortilla was soft and warm, the burrito was not rolled very tight, but perhaps that is me being spoiled by my constant trips to the mission.  If I go back, will get one of the options without the egg.

And just like that, John's has fallen hard and fast. I've been coming here for years and always told my friends about how great it is. Or was. Yes the menu has changed and the once mighty bulgogi burrito is now a cold & soggy shell of it former self. I think there were some issues with the city about what can be prepared there without proper exhaust etc... That is just speculation but if that's the case, John you should just forego the brick and mortar store and open a food truck. Or two! I would definitely come back for the original recipe. John and co are awesome folks who I don't want to see fail, just bring back the original recipes!

I used to live in the South Beach area but I always worked in the East Bay so I could never make it on time to John's Deli with their typical FiDi restaurant hours.  Then in 2009 my job gave me Friday afternoons off. Score!  From 2009-2013, the majority of my Friday afternoons consisted of rushing back to SF to eat my bulgogi burrito and nap off into a food coma bliss.
fried rice in the burritos was what made it awesome. no longer an option and replaced with noodles.  pass until they can resolve this no kimchi fried rice business

I think I had too high expectations for this place.  I came here around 1:30 no line, mine you that this store is extremely small. I don't think there is a kitchen, so all their items are microwave or warm food that is a placed in the oven for a quick second.

New menu = cold burrito. The 'new' burrito does not include kim chee rice but instead replaced with cold noodles, shredded beef instead of spicy pork and it was dripping wet and messy. Before I wouldn't mind eating two burritos in one sitting but this time around, I couldn't even finish one burrito. I think the priced increased too? Should have known something wasn't right when I went during lunch and there were no line like before. Sorry, I won't be back unless they bring back the old menu. Will be taking the mile plus hike to HRD.
IMPORTANT TO KNOW:

Some of my favorite foods all wrapped into a burrito sounded like a great idea. The pictures posted on Yelp looked intriguing so I decided to give it a try. First attempt a few weeks ago, the owner posted a sign on the front saying the kitchen was closed and that they were working on a new menu that would be available the following week. Two weeks later (today) I stopped in. It appears that they have scaled down the menu quite a bit to 6 or 7 menu items. There was no bulgogi, daeji gogi, shrimp, or bbq chicken. No Suicide Burrito or Suicide Volcano Burrito (the one I wanted to try). No tacos either. I started out with disappointment right out of the gates. Today's menu had 3 types of burritos...vegi.....tofu......and bi bim. They also had a bento box of some sort along with a few other items. I came for a burrito so I went with the bi bim (w/beef).
Heres another update.
I used to go to this place at least once every two weeks but after their menu change, I don't think I'll be coming back.
Beware--the burritos are served with rice noodles, NOT rice. I had been once since the menu was changed and could not remember what I didn't like about the burrito. Now I remember--everything!

Kimchi burritos are my favorite item on the menu. From the outside, this shop doesn't look like much, but the food definitely makes up for it. Cash only and no place to sit, so this is a great place to grab something to go.
Quick, affordable, grab-and-go, hole-in-the-wall lunch spot! Came here around 12:30 and there were only a handful of people there.
I had a burrito here yesterday.

I hate to only give one star because this used to be my favourite burrito.  Please go back to your old menu.  This burrito was cold and the noodles don't hold the hot sauce like the rice did.  All the hot sauce goes to the bottom of the burrito and made the last few bites barely edible.

John, I hate do to this to you. Your kimchi burrito was always in my weekly rotation, but no longer. I was excited to check out the new menu and see what changes were made,  but was disappointed. I'm not sure why you changed the recipe after so much success.
I have been coming here for years, but after their recent menu change I won't be returning.

What happened to this place??? Food is terrible since this menu rework... Please bring the old menu back! Not sure what caused the change since every time I went previously, there was always a lot of customers. Probably won't go back unless something changes.

Whack , since they changed the menu this place is far from what it once was  .  Burritos  are now sparsely filled with some sort of shredded beef & take 30 minutes to make.  Shoulda walked out when I saw they are now $9 .

I have been going to John's for almost 5 years now since my old office used to be right next door.  I've always loved their food be it the kimchi burrito, the bi bim bap burrito, or the kim bap.  I am not sure why some Yelpers are leaving low-star reviews when they haven't even tried it at all.
Awesome whole in the wall with something I thought I will never have ... A Korean burrito. But careful, even though I like spicy food, I was well served with the lowest spicy ness level.

They seem to have changed the menu - the bulgogi burrito that was well worth the wait has been replaced by a cold shredded beef deal that is pretty tasteless apart from the cold veggies put in it, and takes about 20 minutes to make, at least this time. Shark jumped, it may be some time before I try this again, unfortunately.
Hole in the wall and a little run down, but the prices are good for the city. Food is solid and tastes like home cooking. Good to-go lunch spot if you work near here.
I got sick eating here. And now I see they're closed due to infestation?!?!? NASTY. Burn it to the ground!

If you're looking for this place, keep an eye out as you can easily miss it.  During the lunch rush, look for professionals hanging around a tiny convenience store, but anytime before or after the rush, you just might miss it, like I did.  John's Snack and Deli is literally a hole in the wall, with an occupancy level of 5.

They are not serving food this week as they are redoing their menu. Sort of bummed since I saw great things on yelp. However, you can't really sit down here as it is more of a minimart than a restaurant. The people here are hospitable and with that I'm sure they would have good food.

Solid place for Korean food. I probably should be more adventurous but I always get the beef kimchi burrito and it always delivers. The owner is very nice even if his staff really isn't lol. Hole in the wall that gets packed at lunch time.
closed!!!! rip kim chi burrito

Yup the Dept of Health closed them down for various violations including vermin infestation etc.  Don't know whether they will reopen but it's closed for now.  You can read the notice on the upper right hand corner of their store window.

Came to get the burrito but they were out. Was offered the chicken bento box and boy am I not pleased.  For $9 I got a box filled with old rice, a small container of kimchi, 2 slices of orange, and like 4 pieces chicken. I don't understand the yelp reviews.
This place is now closed as of 8/6/2014
Discovered this place about 2 months before my contract in the FiDi ended.
Dropped in for lunch earlier this week with a friend, grabbing one of their suicide pork burritos to go (because, alas, there's no seating inside the deli itself).
Bulgogi burrito.  Had half for lunch and thought it was ok.  Had the other half for dinner 5 hours later and it tasted better.

This is my first time here. I tried the bi bim bap burrito and it was yummy!! Nice flavored beef, egg, vegetables and rice with sauce, were wrapped up nicely in a foil. The burrito is not too moist. Actually I ate my burrito about 30 min after buying it, and what I was worried-- the tortilla might become soggy -- didn't happen. If you just want to have a quick meal, then you can give it a try. My only concern is that you have to find a place to eat since this is a tiny store without any seats, just like street vendors.

I really can't believe there are so many good reviews about this place. It's a tiny Korean food "deli" in the Fidi. I had high hopes after seeing that they had Duk bok ki on the menu, little be known that most of their really good Korean foods are actually just specials that pop up here and there. This place makes korean burritos, and if you're going there for that, go ahead and be my guest, but I will not come back after my experience.
FIRST ATTEMPT.

Can't say enough great things about this place. This is a small, hole in the wall sushi shop that also offers other small snacks like spam musubi and customized rolls. Super friendly staff includes the owner, who hails from the Kansai region of Japan.

I love this place.  Not a long wait, and I'm into fish and rice so naturally I would seek out Sushi.  I really liked their tuna rolls, and I had their miso soup.  I would recommend both, and I will absolutely keep going back.
Been here a couple times for lunch already. Close to work and cheaper than Sushiritto!
My new favorite lunch spot. Close to work, and it's never that long of a wait! 5 minutes tops, which is good around here at lunch time.
Delicious sushi rolls made quick in front of you even if you go during the noon to one rush hour lunch break!

Similar to sushiritto, except that you can customize your rolls here, which I really like. There's free salad and miso soup that comes with your customized roll. However, I do find that the size of the roll is rather small compared to sushiritto, making it a more expensive meal.

Had the spicy unagi roll, which was legitly prepared with Japanese precision and care. Correspondingly, I would not recommend this place if you have any sort of time commitment you are trying to meet. I came in a little after noon, and with only ONE other person in line ahead of me, it still took around 15 minutes to order and get my food (there are 3 workers total to handle the lunch rush).
Love love love, everyday office lunch kind of food. Food is fast, tasty, and convenient.
I love it!
Friendly and delicious, but they're a bit slow with their service sometimes. The rolls are mainly rice so I recommend getting a bowl. It's a lot more filling and worth your money!

I don't mind the small portion or higher price. But a roll full of bony, rubbery unagi is unforgivable. Earns stars only for the sweet cashier service. The worker in the back roll my sushi looked very unhappy though. No love when making food inevitably leads to a disappointing and lackluster meal.
Sushi Taka is, earnestly the bomb.  A delicious and quick take-out take on sushi!
Disclaimer: This review is solely for their office catering!
So delicious!!!!
walked 10 blocks in 80 degree heat during prime lunch hour to pay $10 for tuna smaller than the head of my pinky.
Small, unassuming exterior on the corner of Kearny and Sacramento with SUPER GOOD Japanese sushi rolls and and rice bowls!  You can "design your own roll" or choose from pre-defined rolls and bowls.

One of my favorite Japanese restaurant .... The cashier there are very nice, the sushi are supper delicious, you can really taste the fresh of raw figs and the soft of sushi rice.... :) love and enjoy

Poor knockoff of Sushirrito at similar prices. Also, there's no longer any green tea rice, which was mentioned in previous Yelp reviews. There's probably new management now. It's an order and go type of place with no seating inside.
Love love love sushi taka!! A must try if you're in the area around lunchtime.
Pros:

This place is great. Its never as packed as Sushiritto, the prices are better, and the there is so much more choices. Not to mention the people working there look you in the eyes when taking your money and order and  they don't seem to slowdown when things get busy.

I really struggled between three and four stars on this review but had to go high.  Today I was craving my go to chicken bento that I want when I tumble off the diet wagon and mosey'd on over to Sushi Taka.  There new girl working the front unapologetically informed me that they no longer carried my preferred box.  Instead, she offered me a few different options fo bowls and I decided to go with the Fire Bowl, because I like everything spicy!  I also asked for an extra side of wasabi, which I always need!  I walked next door to get a Vietnamese Iced Coffee (I said I'm off the wagon), and when I came back, my food was waiting for me!   The nice man who always makes the sushi gave me my food and was as pleasant as he always is and I was on my way.

I frequently come here for the spicy rolls, which are packed with fresh and delicious ingredients. Today I decided to try the dragon bowl, and oh-my-word I would love to eat it everyday for lunch!  In the dragon bowl, a generous portion of rice is covered by tuna, salmon, seaweed, fish roe, crab, pickled ginger, pickled radish, and avocado. I love the flavor of the wasabi mayo, and it is the real deal (spicy)! The staff is so nice and friendly. Get the dragon bowl! It is delicious.
Place is DOPE!

I ordered the Super Bowl ($9.65) and Miso Soup ($1.00) when you buy the bowl or wrap. It was good however the portion was deceiving. I thought what I got wasn't going to last me through the end of the day and I was right... It had a lot of flavor and something different for a change. Come by and grab a bite to eat if you're around!

The cold-stone truth. This place is good but way too overpriced to capture a 4 star review. Yelp says it is $ location, but barely. The selections with tax will rack up well above 10$. Furthermore, I would understand paying at such a price if they were well portioned.
We had Sushi Taka on site for custom made sushi rolls Friday and they were delicious. Fish was fresh and love that they could be customized. Perhaps a little too much rice, but the rolls were good.
Dear Sushirrito,

I just got a new menu item- the Dragon Bowl. It's salmon and tuna on a bowl that's PACKED to the gills with deliciousness and covered in a not too spicy wasabi sauce. From the mixture of flavors to the variety of textures. This is hands down the best lunch I have had in a long long time and I could eat it every day.

Please can I just eat here every day. Prices are good, staff is polite, place is clean, blah blah blah. No real place to eat here but when I come here for lunch on work days we just pop in and pop out. Never much of a line (so far....but I think it's gaining popularity and I'm sure I'm not helping that) and just SO MUCH better than Sushirrito.
Tuna... disappointing.  It was brown and not pink nor red.  :(

Sushi Taka is on a corner close to the edge of China Town. Parking was difficult to find since we didn't want to park in the lot that is under the park. When we finally found some parking, we walked to the restaurant. It's a relatively small place that does not have seating inside.

Came here to see if this place was better than sushirrito. I got the Sushi Taka Roll. The roll came out in less than a minute. I enjoyed the roll but thought it was alot smaller than the ones offered at Sushirrito. If you check in on yelp, you get a free miso soup. My girlfriend ordered the spicy taka roll which was ok. I actually felt it was weird that there was kim chi in the roll to make it spicy. The service was quick for a small bite but I was still hungry.
Came here on the afternoon of Christmas Eve, since my boyfriend and I were craving Sushiritto and they were closed.
SUSHI ROLLS made to ORDER.
Yummy, make your own sushi :)

I will have to agree with fellow yelper- Sani S., my teriyaki chicken bento box was microwaved and with some sauce thrown in. Everything just seemed way too salty including the miso soup that it came with. Although the young guy at the counter who took my order was super nice, I could not over look all the salt that was in my food.
Seriously bro. You're just going to microwave my teriyaki chicken. Like not even be Discrete about it?
LOVE THIS PLACE!

My friend told me that this place was better than Sushiritto so I was like okay lemme try. 4 stars average rating okay that must mean its good. It's on the corner of Kearny and that street where the 1 bus runs going towards Van Ness. I had to pee SO bad at that time and when I went in I asked if they had a restroom but they didn't. There were like 10 workers in the small ass "restaurant". It's not really a restaurant. More like a food court mall booth. You definitely can't dine in. There were hella workers for a small ass place. We got the unagi roll and the salmon roll. The cashier asked if I wanted a bento box or all theses misc stuff they have on the side. I asked if the two rolls will fill us up and he said probably not so I said okay lemme order a spam musubi. I was checking in on Yelp at that time so I got a check in special and got a free miso soup. I checked in with my hubby's phone too so he got one too. We left and ate our food at the park down the street cuz there were benches to sit. The rolls were pretty good but kinda small. They were about $10 each. I forgot if it was $7.99 or $8.99. Anyhoo, my hubby didn't like the miso soup much. After I ate my roll, I looked in my bag and my spam musubi was NOWHERE to be found!!! Grrr!!! I was pissed. They forgot my musubi and I paid for it!! So I walked my ass all the way back and they were closed... Luckily the door wasn't closed. They had blocked the entrance with a bucket or something. I told the guy who seems to be the owner that they had forgot my musubi and he gave me two from the shelf... I was like it's okay??? Cuz I thought those were just displays like synthetic food. He apologized, I took the musubis assuming it was fresh since he's giving it to me and wouldn't give me old ones right??? Went back to the park.... Okay the musubis were old. Tried to eat at least half to get my moneys worth but was simply disappointed instead. So overall....I liked the rolls. The rolls were good. Kinda small. Kinda pricy so I would probably only come here once in a while. I don't recommend getting the musubi because it wasn't good. L&L tastes WAY better. I didn't get the musubi fresh so who knows. Maybe it tastes better fresh? They gave me an old one. The bento box and other random stuff behind the glass displays didn't look good anyways. I didn't get a receipt when I paid AND didn't get a food I ordered so it SEEMED like they were trying to rip me off but I'm sure that's not the case. I would have liked it if they gave me a receipt so I can keep track of my order cuz what if someone makes a big order and they were missing stuff like how I was? The guy who seemed like he was owner was nice. He told me where I could find a public restroom down the street. Nice guy overall. But back to the food...I had a bittersweet experience because they forgot my food and I had to come all the way back and didn't get a fresh one. I would have been happier if they gave me a fresh one. Would I come back? Maybe once in a while. Still kinda small and pricey in my opinion.....so just 3 stars. I was relieved they didn't lock the doors and left when they closed for their lunch break cuz I would have been SO pissed. Maybe they have hella workers cuz during lunch hours hella people come here and they don't want to hold up the line. Yeah it was just weird seeing HELLA people in the small ass store lol.
Who would have known . . .??

Great little cafe in the 450 Sutter building. Good ingredients, very good food items and coffee as well as some higher end gourmet snacks & treats. Nice cozy little space. I hope they do well, it's a very convenient addition to the 450 Sutter building.

Please come and support this business, it's a small little cafe in the Sutter st garage near union square. My reason behind this is that they make a pretty damn good tamale. It's spicy and the masa is made right and the chicken inside is flavorful. You can also get a special hot sauce on the side which kicks it up to insanely spicy levels. If you enjoy spicy tamales that taste really good, don't let the looks deceive you and come try these. My mouth burned so good and I enjoyed every minute of it. Great for lunch or a quick snack. What is sad is that the person making the tamales is Asian and she makes them better than most Hispanic people, they are ridiculously good. Not better than my mom's but pretty damn close. Good price, good flavor and good spice. Very tasty indeed.
Yelpers led me to this destination, and I'd have to say:

Who would think to come to the Sutter Stockton Garage for a homemade tamale? I was on my way back from a medical appointment at 450 Sutter when I decided to stop here based on the little sandwich board on the sidewalk. I quickly looked at the Yelp app and found that people do indeed come to what looks like a little sandwich and candy shop right across from the elevators (photo:
5 stars for the tamales. They are amazing!  If I go anywhere this place my husband demands I bring them home.

The tamales are as good as any I have ever had in a store. On a scale of 1-10, with 10 being the best tamales I have ever had, these tamales are a solid 9. (No one can beat fresh tamales in a Mexican kitchen though)
Quotable.

One day while going to the post office, I saw a little sign saying "Best Tamales" - hah?  I love tamales and have been looking for a good place near home that has good ones.  I was instantly curious.  Immediately, I couldn't decide whether to check it out or go to the post office first.  Ok, post office first and then come back.

Five stars for kick ass tamales - olives and chicken and just the right blend of masa to stuffing.  I grab a large bag of these to bring back to the office crew when I park at sutter/stockton garage as the cafe is just out of the elevator.  The place is far from fancy, nor is it cheap, but the tamales are rockin.  They also have princess cake - which I have a really strange fondness for - not sure why as I'm not that much of a sweets person - but they always have it, and it always makes me happy!

I parked over at the Sutter Street Garage and remembered hearing about this cafe selling tamales.  I did online research awhile ago in search of good tamales in the city.  This cafe popped up as selling one of the best in the city.  My favorite place, so far, is located all the way down in San Jose, so I'm always game to try a place in the city.  When I realized I was at the cafe that sells tamales, I had to buy several to try out.  I went home, heated it up & ate one.  They're ok.  The masa was light and not too heavily larded, which I prefer.  The filling was very authentic - there was in olive in there!  My favorite is still in SJ though...

I thought this place might have been an inviting place to stay had it not been inside of a parking garage lobby. I ordered a chicken pasta salad, which was about $4. It was a decent amount of food and just enough for a nervous lunch before an interview. The lady at the counter (presumably the owner) was very friendly to me and others that came into the shop. A sign inside said their chicken tamales are supposed to be second to none, but I didn't get a chance to verify.

Sutter Cafe is in the lobby area of the Sutter/Stockton Garage, next to the elevators.  It was dark and closed, but I saw the Asian lady and she opened the door for me.  I asked what days and hours the shop was open & I said I was from Fremont and I guess she felt sorry for me and asked if I wanted a chicken tamale.

The place is small (located inside a building, next to the elevators for the Sutter Stockton garage), but it's stocked with a HUGE variety of food items: coffees, canned drinks, sandwiches, salads, pastries, bagged snacks, and candy by the pound. The store owner, Holly Li, is super friendly and sweet, offering to reheat food items and carefully packaging to go orders.

Have you ever had a pint of blood sucked from your throbbing arm after not eating for over 15 hours per doctor's instructions? No? Allow me to shed some light: If you are prone to dizziness and headaches already, this endeavor will become an  excruciating nightmare around hour 12. By Hour 13 you're listening to Bright Eyes and contemplating cutting yourself. Then you'll really be ready to cartwheel off the golden gate bridge* around Hour 14. By Hour 15 you are in tears, head clenched in your hands, wearing earplugs to try and drown out the heinous sounds of your stomach screaming for food!!!

A week ago, I happened to park at the Sutter Garage and decided to try the tamales from the Sutter cafe I had read about in SF's 7 x 7 magazine.  Needless to say, it was as good as advertised or I wouldn't waste my time writing a review about it.  Initially I ordered one and figured I'll grab lunch afterwards but after a few bites decided to have another one.  It was a perfect balance of sauce and chicken.  Very tasty chicken I might add.  A month or so ago I paid $5 to attend the annual Tamales festival in SJ and although the tamales there were good, I do believe these are just as good if not better in taste and texture.  Oh, one more thing, the customer service here is exceptional.

If you're looking for a hidden treasure in Union Square--this is it. Sutter Cafe is a small shop located inside the busy Sutter/Stockton garage. Sutter Cafe, not to be mistaken with Sutter Street Cafe a few blocks down, has the BEST tamales (written about in 7x7 mag). Oh, and the Kona coffee is really good there too. The coffee there is way better than your local Starbucks chain. Yes, I'd much rather support the local small business...

Everything here is fresh, authentic, from the food to the atmosphere. Small little place that we found by accident and I actually feel like I'm in Italy! The service is great and the food is even better!

My wife and I had reservations at A16 at the recommendation of an acquaintance from the bay area. We came across this restaurant near our hotel and looked at the menu on the window. Looked good. Decided to look at A16 menu online.  Hmmm. For our personal taste, we liked this menu better, so changed reservations. Our dinner was terrific. The ambiance is OK but not great. On Friday night the place was not busy, easily accepting walk-in business. So, food and service were great, while ambiance was decent but not memorable. If you want good food and service, come here. If you want to impress based on location and vibe, this may not be your place.

As I write this message, I just want to let people know that I dine out a lot and have been to all of the top restaurants in SF.  I often use Zagat as a guide on restaurants.  This is by far the best place for the money.  I have been here with a couple of people and with a very large group and I must say, they have exceeded my expectations every time.  I have ordered many meals but prefer the Swordfish.  Their appetizers are very good as well.  Their wine selection is not bad at all either and reasonably priced Italian wines.

I was taking a friend out for her birthday and I chose Mangia Tutti as (1) I was looking for an Italian restaurant within walking distance of Punchline Comedy Club and (2) I was looking for something away from the overpriced, touristy North Beach area.
Came here after being told at another Italian restaurant a few blocks away that the wait would be 30 mins or longer.  This place was almost empty-one other table of 6 people.

Had an absolutely wonderful dinner here tonight. We were the only ones in the place and had a friendly and knowledgable waiter with great recommendations. Special risotto dish was to die for as well as chocolate souffle. Great wine and overall will be back

While the food is good, the service is horrible! We made a reservation for 7pm, showed up at 6:50, wasn't greeted until 7:30 and was seated about 7:40 at a table that had been empty and ready since we had arrived. While we promptly gave our order, we asked for a wine list. Our waiter went to the front, talked to a few people, and never brought the wine list. We had to ask someone else. It took 50 minutes to get our food, and we had to beg several times for more water. Once we got our bill, we were overcharged. When we pointed it out, they argued with us until we showed them the price on THEIR own menu. Then, they refused to recalculate the tax! I don't care how good the food is...it's not worth the hassle and spending the entire night there.
This place is decidedly mediocre.

Nice, simple Italian food.  My wife, son and I had the caprese, spaghetti with meatballs (which my son split with two other kids in our group), duck ravioli and spaghetti with clams.  All of our dishes were very good.  The pasta was cooked al dente.  The service and food had a very homey feel.  Overall a very nice experience.
Delicious food and wonderfully run family business.  Come in expecting a casually time dinner and not one of those run in to grab a bite sort of places.
Really solid italian food. We all had pasta, and it was all fresh and well portioned. The wine was cheap but good, and they gave me a full glass.

Friend took me here for lunch and I was really pleasantly surprised by how good the food was.  Good traditional Italian fare.  We had arugula with grilled shrimp, orechiette with Italian sausage, asparagus and mushrooms, duck ravioli in sundried tomato, basil sauce with pine nuts, and sautéed spinach with pine nuts and olive oil.   I had food coma afterwards so maybe not so good for a weekday lunch, but it was good food, and the service was friendly.   Apparently it's run by the couple that served us.  In a bit of a random location with a somewhat cheesy sign out front half hidden by the awning, but felt like a hidden gem!  Not at all busy.

Absolutely delicious traditional Italian dinner! My girlfriend and I both loved our meals and the service was excellent. I had the special of fettuccine with local seafood and would definitely go back again. Also enjoyed homemade tiramisu for dessert. Would definitely recommend to anyone in search of great Italian food!

The Pappardelle Bolognese was cooked perfectly al dente with a great beef ragout. Read good reviews about the Orecchiette but waiter recommended the pappardelle. Great atmosphere and service. Nice wine selection.

This review rates a dinner our team of about thirty-five had at Mangia Tutti recently and it's noted that serving a party that large can create difficulties that serving a table of two does not.  However some of the issues would impact either table, small or large.

The food here is generally good. They deliver what a good rendition of the ole faithful a : salmon, NY strip. The swordfish here is quite nice. And the prices are quite reasonable. Overall, it's a solid choice, if not a mind-blowing one.

My fiance, mother in law and I had a wonderful dinner here. It was a fortunate accident that we discovered this place. Per usual, all the restaurants along Columbus were packed and we were hungry! The service was perfectly attentive and the food was wonderful!  Pasta was made in house and was satisfying without being heavy. As a person without a sweet tooth: don't skip dessert!! It was just the right amount and delicately prepared.  Couldn't recommend more strongly!
Food was good.  But we saw a rat run across the main dining area.   Felt quite gross after.
Best customer service I have ever received at a restaurant.
I would have given 4 stars if:
Relatively empty on a Friday night, we were seated immediately for dinner. Service is pretty nice, staff is friendly.

My husband visits this place, sometime multiple times when he comes to San Francisco. He brought me here on our trip and it was good. Their food is one of a kind and definitely worth a try. Their appetizer of bruschetta was very fresh and delicious. The food is made with fresh ingredients and that we both like since there is no "normal processed food flavor" AKA-sauce in a jar. Definatley recommend.
Our Evening at Mangia Tutti can be summed up in one word "Bland". Food, decor, pretty much everything besides the wine.
The restaurant food is very average. The sauces in the pasta were closer to olive garden totally not worth the price.

Went here for valentines day. Mediocre food, nice waitress but very slow service. Took 45 mins to get 2 glasses of wine. I get that it's a busy day...but 45 mins is just unbelievable. On top of that, the owner was extremely rude, and he is the main reason for the low rating.  Wouldn't come here again. Don't understand why everyone thinks the food is so good...maybe it was just a bad day for them.

This the best  italian restaurants in the City, nice people and awsome atmosphere. They have the  best fettuccine with giant  black shrimp  that I ever ate in my life. They took me back to the time I spend in italy and have had on  the best Fettuccine ever. Camilla the waiteress was very  nice and she showed me  what the wine  to get..... love it ....

This place is great!  We're staying at the Hilton and had a very cranky 3 year old.  We were meeting up with friends and going to dinner.  We stumbled upon this place and walked in.  The place was EMPTY... And I mean there was literally no one there!  We were seated and our waiter Jean Pablo (sp?) was nothing short of amazing!   He was very helpful and attentive.  His attitude was so warming and he was even helpful when it came to our 3 year old.

I love this place. Amazing Italian food. Love their gnocchi. It's melt in your mouth delicious and the capellini al pomodoro is fantastic. The owner is so welcoming and friendly. I have never had a disappointing meal here.
Relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff.
Only a handful of diners in this restaurant on a Friday night, but the service and food impeccably reminds me of a small Italian town.
Amazing gnocchi and appetizers and deserts were great too. Not too expensive and totally gonna come back here

I really picked the wrong night to have date night here. It was completely ruined by the obnoxiously loud, drunk, and classless party of 10+ that turned this little Italian restaurant into a bar. They were shouting at the top of their lungs, one guy kept chanting "shots shots shots shots," while another girl who was clearly drunk and had one of those high pitched voices that pierce your ear drums was shouting "BULL SHIT!! THAT'S BULLSHIT!!" That was just what I remember before I tried to block them out and keep from having an aneurism.
My partner Bear and I are definitely lovers of great Italian food, and ever since he first set foot in Mangia Tutti, he'd been dying to bring me here.  So tonight, he finally got his wish.

In town on business and yelped for some dinner options.  Went here with two coworkers after seeing it had 4 stars.  I had their carpaccio di manzo (a beef carpaccio with arugula mustard and capers). It was amazing.  The presentation was beautiful and it was so tender and delicious.  Then I ordered saltimbocca for dinner which was basically chicken Marsala with pancetta  minus the mushrooms.  This also looked incredible and tasted even better.  Dessert was tiramisu which was obviously homemade and close to the best I've ever had.  The waiter was friendly and funny and the atmosphere was very clean.  You could really tell the people putting out the food cared very much about producing the best product possible.  On top of all that the prices are very reasonable.  Do yourself a favor and try this place soon!

Tucked away in Chinatown, it's a wonderful authentic Italian experience, excellent service and wonderfully fresh well seasoned food.  Insalata tutti and the gnocchi gorganzola were prepared to order and very tasty.  The gnocchi were hot and savory without being greasy.  Staff were helpful and good chianti at $9 a glass was wonderful complement to a very satisfying meal in a comfortable environment.  Been there three times and it's consistently good.  Molto contento!

You get what you pay for. The servers are not fantastic, but they are also just like the run of the mill waiters you would get at any other restaurant. The food was much better than the service, however at $35 bucks a head I would expect a little more, even in San Francisco.
Mangia Tutti left a little to be desired. With all the other great restaurants in SF I don't think I'll be back.

Homemade everything.  The service was completely appropriate to my wants and the food reminded me of my trips to Italy.  We had the homemade duck ravioli and lasagna, both were fall off your chair delicious.  The tiramisu similarly supreme and homemade.  This restsurant is very unassuming.  I think the location fools people into thinking it's outside the parameters of the 'Northbeach' italian experience. This would be a mistake.  Do not underestimate this little secret.
Food was seasoned to perfection, staff was extremely attentive. I will definitely go back when I visit SF
Average at best. Came in on a Saturday night at a decent hour and there was only 1 other table seated to my surprise.
Great tasting gyro wrap and chicken with tahini wrap. Nice service.  Great that they open until 2am.

I stop by here on occasion after late work nights and it never disappoints. Ingredients are fresh, food is tasty, and the owner Reza is a pleasure to be around. I've only ever tried the gyro wrap and haven't felt the need to change it up yet (recommendation: get it spicy)
I've always wanted to try shawarma ever since I saw the after-credit scene of The Avengers eating shawarma after saving the city of New York.

Dropped by for dinner while casually touring San Fran with my family. My family members never tried Greek food before but was hungry enough to be persuaded to...and they really liked it! There's an extraordinarily  nice man working there with a good eye for customer service (always knows when you need napkins, forks, anything). He definitely made the atmosphere very comfortable and was very amicable. Very friendly and the food was fast and cheap! 5/5 would go again.
Super nice owner :-) It was very quick and EXTREMELY delicious.. Definitely worth my money and time.
I love this place. The people are very nice and the food and desserts are great.

I've been here a few times now and each time I find myself disappointed. I've had the gyro wraps twice which were always full of tons if lettuce and literally cubes of tomato. Today I got the rice plate. I should've walked out when I saw him take the meat and rice from the fridge and pop it in the microwave but I didn't. You get a lot of suspicious looking meat but hardly any rice and the pita bread looks like it was bought from the super market. Today is Sunday so my only other lunch option was Chipotle, not sure which is worse.

In case other recent reviews haven't made it clear, California Golden Cookies is now SF Wraps. I think the name change is great, given that they do serve more substantial food than the cookie (sweets lovers will take offense).
Change would do you good.

Pleasant staff and prompt service. I ordered the falafel and spanikopita appetizers to go. The falafel was super dry and seemed machine processed. The tahini that came with it tasted like paste and was inedible. The spanikopita was okay, but I've had better for the same price. I was very disappointed.

This place has a great tasting falafal wrap, but the falafal is a little dry due to the fact that it is pre-cooked and just reheated in the microwave. When I realized that it was microwaved, I stopped coming back. The owner (aka. the cook) is very nice though.

I'm not sure if most people know but this place recently changed their name to SF Wrap which I think is more appropriate.  Their cookies are good but their wraps are great and well priced.  I also like the people that work there.  They provide good and speedy service.  I recommend the chicken wrap.  It's fresh, has great taste, and perfect size for lunch.  I love supporting small mom and pop restaurants such as this one.
Not sure about the cookies, but the Falafel Wrap, either spicy or "Jerusalem" Style is the way to go.

This review is only for the cookies. Price and size was fine, but overall my friends and I were not impressed. We tried the chocolate chip and it was too sweet and not a great consistency. It was chewy in the middle but kinda hard around the edges. I also prefer my cookies thicker. Next time I'll skip desserts entirely and only try their food.

Dropped in with a friend several months back to pick up some cookies for a post-dinner treat. Whether it was due to it being the end of the day, or otherwise, I can't say I was particularly impressed with the chocolate chip cookie I had, sub-par in both taste and texture.
