Easily overlooked because the exterior looks faded and it doesn't look appealing to order up food here, but I went in anyways because I craved for Mediterranean falafel that day and wanted to try a new place!
Did not have any cookies - just got a mixed plate. Very poor quality. Flat flavors, cheap ingredients, and super dry unseasoned chicken and beef.
Bleh.

If you're searching for dessert, don't let this name fool you. After walking around San Francisco all day, I was in the mood for carbs and sugar which lead me to going into a cookie hunting frenzy. I stumbled across California Golden Cookies due to its name and proximity to our hotel, so we decided to check it out. Upon walking in, it became evidently clear that the focus of this establishment is moreso on the Greek and Mediterranean food offerings versus their dessert. That aside, we sauntered up to the counter which had a picked over selection of sweets. We split a chocolate brownie and a chocolate chip cookie, both of which were just okay. The brownie was chewy (in a good brownie way) and loaded with chocolate chips and flakes on top. The cookie was a little bland for my liking, and fell short in terms of its flavor and texture. I wouldn't venture out of my way to come back for a sweets craving, but it will definitely hit the spot if you're wandering past.

This is one of those small neighborhood shops that is becoming a rarity in some parts of SF: run by a baker who followed his dream and has been here in SF for a long time. Reza's bakery moved from Fashion Island to its current location, as attested to by the newspaper clippings lovingly framed and hung from the shop's walls. It's a simple little shop, no frills, with an unassuming facade. Someone looking for delicious baked treats or Greek might easily pass by it. I took the chance one afternoon and went in looking for some falafels after my marketing class last week. I chose a double chocolate chip cookie, a borma (one of the crunchy pistachio-studded pastries that are rolled and sliced) for the bf, a cinnamon sugar cookie for myself, and a tub of baba ghanoush to take home.
This review is just for the cookies.

My friends and I were famished on the way to Rickhouse and across the street this little hole in the wall, tucked in the corner of Kearny and Bush, beckoned our call.  They definitely sell cookies but their falafels steal the show.  The falafel wrap was not only cheap but very tasty as well.  Definitely one of the healthier choices in the area.    I'll certainly come back when I'm in the neighborhood.

I stumbled upon this place while walking down Kearny St. when searching for a healthier meal option. There were a few bars with food and an Italian restaurant, however, I wanted something on the lighter side. Before entering, I checked the Yelp app and this little hole in the wall was favored by a lot of locals. I had to give it a try.
This place was "pretty good".  I got a falafel wrap that was one of the better one's I've had!

YUMMM! So its 3:00pm and I have a sweet tooth along with a need for a "pick me up". cookies are my favorit dessert, but I was in the mood for a brownie. Yelp to the rescue...I walked down to this place and was nicely greeted by mabe the owner. My plan was to only buy ONE cookie, I ended up buing two Choc Chip w/ walnt and the Cinnanom Sugar cookie. Needless to say they wer both 1/2 gone by the time I got back to the office. So tonight, cardio and 500 sit ups are in order :)

5 stars for the stellar cinnamon sugar cookie!  i mean... SO GOOD.  once i started i couldn't stop, and when i finished i wanted to head right back out the door for another.  soft and chewy in the middle, just how i love 'em.  a dangerous fidi addiction!  5 stars for the sweet folks who work there.  3 for the mediterranean food. it's fine but nothing to rave about.... and w/ cookies like that who cares??
Very warm, generous, friendly service. Wrap was plentiful! All cookies (choc chip, coconut, and peanut butter) were even better than they looked, with really soft middles - even late at night!

I really like this place. Greek is one of my favorite cuisines and cookies are my favorite consumable period. This place offers both! Fast, cheap...Also maybe I have strange feeding hours but I went here three times in the course of a week (for various reasons found myself in the area, out of necessity-ish), and every time it was empty. Don't take this as a bad sign in this case! It just means you can take your time deciding what you want, and you'll get it immediately.

We went to a pub near here for my brother's post-wedding afterparty, and being a good little sister, I snuck off to find the best drunchies I could to surprise my fellow celebrating drunkards. I saw California Golden Cookies on my Yelp app, but dismissed it because of the name. But as I walked by on my way to a pizza spot, I realized the name was wildly misleading; they have way more than cookies! That's what I get for not scanning the reviews ;)
Ate at this place two nights in a row. The spicy falafel wrap is BOMB! Best I ever had. Moist balls (that's what she said), and it's actually spicy, too! Make sure you try the desserts.
Actually pretty darn good for a hole-in-the-wall... Not crazy about the use of microwave but the food tasted excellent and at a great price.

Like many before me, and I'm sure like many after me, I will always be confounded by the name of this place. I get it...they sell cookies. But why give short shrift to the decent Greek menu they also offer here? On a street that's already pretty competitive with the likes of Ayola and Baladie serving Mediterranean and Middle Eastern fare, you would think the owners would want to flaunt their stuff more. But no, you either have to know they serve Greek food here or just come by it by accident as you're chewing on your homemade halvah bar. Don't get me wrong, the cookies do look tempting as I get all saucer-eyed over chocolate chip cookies, German chocolate bars, walnut fudge brownies, even Turkish delights.

OH MY GOD. The cookies here are beyond incredible I could eat them all they long. Do not get me started on their brownies- try their German chocolate brownie or cinnamon sugar cookies- YUMMMMM.  We had the wraps first which were also very good. I am kinda of addicted now!!!
Chocolate Walnut cookies - The best!  Served fresh and warm, but expensive.

Despite the stellar reviews, the cookies and falafel are just average.  The regular falafel is filling and comes with all the traditional falafel wrap ingredients (falafel, tahini, lettuce, etc.); I found the Jerusalem falafel (with feta cheese) saltier than I would prefer.  The cookies were indeed golden and "homestyle," though lacking in exterior caramelization and interior chewiness.  The German chocolate brownie -- packed with walnuts, shredded coconut, and gooey caramel, and more akin to a fudge sandwich than a brownie -- was far sweeter and more decadent than I could handle in a single sitting.  On the positive side, the service is quick and friendly, and the price point reasonable.
Yelpers, you steered me right with this place.
came for lunch around 1:30 pm on a thursday. there was a short line at the counter but it moved quickly. the guy was nice and it didnt take too long to get my food--maybe 5 mins?

Very deceiving name. They have so much more than cookies! I have passed by this place many times and didn't realize what a gem it is! I was in the area coming from a happy hour and looking for a cheap dinner. This place stays open late in FiDi which is nice. The owner was so friendly. I got the falafel wrap, spicy and with onions. It was really good and under $7! You can't beat the price.  The cookies and other treats were really tempting. I learned the owner makes them himself. I will definitely be coming back!
Great hot sauce. Hummus is just the right consistency. Be patient. It's homemade.
Jonesin' for both Mediterranean food and good ol' homemade cookies?  CGC is your spot.  Me?  I was just craving cookies.
Uhh $5 buffet? This is better than a footlong from Subway!
This review is for the $5 lunch time buffet.

Never did I think my first time ever at a strip club would be during broad daylight...sober. Or let alone for a lunch buffet! "Ew, what kind of buffet!? That's gross," some of you might initially think but it's actually worth trying.

Usually most of the girls are very friendly and professional in this club. My most recent visit could be my last though. I had the unfortunate experience of spending time and talking with Hunter. She has been around for awhile, maybe too long. She has to be one of the most condescending negative people I've ever had the misfortune of interacting with. When I decide to spend my money on a good time, I don't want to hear about personal problems with your life, your kids, your family, home and all the other crap. One of the bartenders upstairs overhead her and could see I was getting irritated and kind of rescued me, thank you!! Management needs to let some dead weight go so everyone is guaranteed a great experience every visit. I would seriously not want to spend a dime in this club to put up with her attitude and listen to her problems again.

I first stumbled onto Gold Club on a day when I wandered by and noticed they had a sign out front of a free daily buffet. Legit. That blew me a way; how cool is the idea of boobs and chicken wings? I had a few opportunities to meet a few of the strippers outside the club and engage them in conversation - really nice and entertaining ladies. I discussed things with my wife as they went along and asked if she would be interested in joining me for an evening to check out the club. She was cool (cause she is straight awesome), and away we went. I reserved dinner for us on a Friday night and it was on!
Four stars because I'm a women and the gal in the back literally ignored me for like 5 mins and didn't even notice I wanted to buy a drink ...
$5 lunch in financial district is worth it, then again we prob spend more money buying water and making it rain than that.  To my surprise the fried chicken was good and the watermelons too!
This buffet is no joke. 5 bucks for their chicken in the fidi with scantly clad women.
OK seriously, eating a lunch at a strip club sounds gross right? WRONG! This place is actually clean, the food is GOOD and the ladies are decent to look at. Plus it is $5!
Get your phone stolen here.

I was very disappointed in the Gold Club.  First off, 90% of the seating was reserved for bottle service only.  Of course, we weren't told this until AFTER we paid.  30 seconds after paying we were greeted by someone who showed us a bottle service menu and explained this.  Suddenly we were no longer interested and considering going some where else.

This review is for the Friday lunch buffet specifically~ I believe the buffet starts at 11:30am when they open. You can find the buffet table set up on the side by the bar. The buffet ends promptly at 2pm and they clean up and put away the goods pretty quick. You pay $5 per person at the door and they take card~ alcohol will cost you more inside if you order any.
I can finally say that I've been to a strip club for lunch!
$5 awesome lunch buffet. The mac and cheese was delicious. Pretty reasonably priced beer. Oh and my first lapdance (stevie). Just phenomenal. A lunch to remember.
Best $5 I could ever spend for lunch. Fried chicken!

Beware... Unscrupulous establishment. Waitress took the liberty of adding a $100 tip to my bill after I signed it.  Tip was paid cash to the waitress so it's not like she wasn't already tipped well.  Just be cautious here.  I received a response from someone saying "These Bitches hardly make any money... so be nice."  In my mind that does NOT give them the right to become a common thief.
All I can say is wow, I'm impressed.
I don't always take cabs around the city, but when I do, it's to make it on time to a $5 all you can eat lunch buffet at a strip club.
Best deal in town.
First time at the Gold Club and damn this spot is impressive!

When my co-workers mentioned they wanted to check out a strip club during our lunch break, my immediate reaction was: "uhhhh..." Then, they added on that there's a $5 buffet that features one of the best fried chicken ever. In response, the fatty in me said, "I'm there!"

Great vibe, beautiful and friendly ladies, expensive drinks.. Just what you want in a strip club!! VIP area is where it's at, only 10$... actually, I should keep that to myself so it stays less crowded than downstairs! I also really like that it's not around all the other clubs, keeps it classy or something.
The place looks amazing, it has a high class feeling. The girls were pretty and tall and knew how to dance well, I would have liked to see more meat on them though. Really skinny model like
Just another place to loose more cash...

This place is cool! I have come here a few times to relax and have a drink. Nice looking girls. Some more than most of course! I hate the fact that most of the girls have fake gigantic boobs that look like shit with the bra off lol.

Strip clubs can be terrible or awesome experiences.  In the case of the gold club sf I'd call it awesome.   Good dancers, good food, and good fun.   I arrived just at the end of the lunch buffet at 2 pm and snagged some great fried chicken and found a table.   I was never pressured for dances but did find the girls during the day beautiful and engaging.   Thanks Josie for a great time :)

The girls are good but not great. You'll definitely find two or three girls you like and one you really like. Crowd is good and environment is relax. Drinks are pricey but its a strip club so no surprise. Waitress, violet, was great. All in all a good time.
$5 cover and free buffet during weekday lunches?  On Fridays they have fried chicken!  The fried chicken is delicious.  For this alone I give it 4 stars!  And really that's where my review ends.
How could I NOT review Gold Club as my first review upon getting my gold Elite badge??
Lucky me came back & made it out to Gold Club for the lunch buffet!
Hmmm. Why would they advertise Sunday free.. We are here technically on Sunday 1am.  They turned us down and said its Saturday.  Hmmm. Someone should learn their time and calendar...
Props if you can come here for the lunch buffet and only spend 5 dollars.

Who would've thunk the best fried chicken I've eaten at a long time would be in a strip club....  I came strictly for the lunch of course.  The other dishes at lunch were so so, but the fried chicken is simply great.  I don't even like fried chicken that much.  All the pieces I ate were really tender and great.

Watch your wallet and keep your head on straight. Girls are real hustlers. They ask to be paid up front and then don't deliver services. Management let's them get away with it. Better clubs on Broadway. Gold Club has REALLY gone to the dogs! AVOID!
I've been there twice now and I can't wait to go back.  The girls are attractive and talented.  Some put on a great show.
Hot chicken & cold hearts.
The women here are amazing. The food is good. I had a great time eating here, every time I went.
Okay, all jokes aside... this place has really good food!!! Best lunch in the middle of work I've ever had!
Not bad.

Went here on our last night in San Francisco. The food was amazing, girls were beautiful, and the waitresses were friendly! The most amazing thing though was afterwards, when we got stuck waiting 2 hours for a handicapp taxi van, the doorman went truly above and beyond to help us get home. He even provided us with waters and a warm place to wait. Seriously, THE greatest service ever!!!!!! They made an awful experience just that much easier! Thanks guys!!!!
We came here to eat dinner before our movie at the AMC Metreon and it was literally just a couple minutes away walking so that was perfect!

I have to give it just 3 stars. The clam chowder that they charged an up charge for was uninspiring and was a little light on the clams.  The Cobb salad was over dressed and small for the price you pay.

Food was good. Service was OK. What I didn't like was that there was neither a discount nor even a simple apology when the waitress dropped the dish that was being brought for someone at our table. The dish shattered and caused a delay since they had to go back and prepare a new dish for my friend. Also, beware that they have a 20% mandatory gratuity on all tables for more than 4 people.

After a disparaging summer adventure of running on Market Street with my SoCal friend, we decided to stop. We had officially missed our event. Next move was for her to Yelp a place to eat. Annabelle's is what she chose so here we went walking another few blocks back. LOL

For an entree, I ordered the ciopinno, a tomato based seafood stew. DELISH. I'd had it in Savannah, but only as an appetizer. A full bowl was just what I needed. This was a true taste of San Francisco. I'd always thought cioppino was an Italian dish. Not so. It's a San Francisco thing. That was probably my favorite thing about the trip.

I was served bland burger and soggy limp garlic fries. Everything lacked salt and was a bit limp and soggy. The bartender was somewhat condescending when I asked about the menu and wine recommendations. I was disappointed. The general ambience was nice, though, and I met a couple of nice locals...

Stopped by for a cocktail, happy hour well drinks were $4.00 and 25% off food.  Can't beat that on a saturaday at 4:00pm.  The deviled eggs, not to be missed. Drinks were stong, pleasant atmosphere.  Would have liked to hear some awesome jazz music playing, it was a bit too quiet.  Can't wait to come back.

Had a great dinner here. Feels like a secret spot, classic San Francisco without the crazy crowds. Great pricing. Don't underestimate the rigatoni with tomatoes,  artichoke hearts, seems simple but has so much flavor! The white wine Parmesan sauce is light and so good. Soak up the rest with the table bread. With such great prices we'll be back

We thought the food was so good that we went again 5 days later. All the reviews we read on Yelp about friendly service and good food were not overrated. Annabelle's is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant with a varied menu and a great staff. Recommend a  reservation for the weekend or when there is a big conference in town ( a lot).
Work luncheon. Ambiance was good, as you can't go wrong with the City. Selection for lunch was okay. Service was great! Food was well prepared and presented. First time for lunch.
Had the sausage pizza and added prosciutto. Pizza was filling and tasty. Good ambience and right across from Marriott Marquis. Long wood bar with two TVs. Friendly staff
Good food and service. Only thing I would complain about is Yelp claiming it to be $$ when it's more like $$$ (I guess it's $$ at happy hour).

Annabelle's is a very charming and historic San Francisco spot. It is located very central, yet a bit hidden away from the busy street. The ambiance is definitely inspiring for a nice conversation or a date out. They have a nice wine list, majority of which is from Sonoma, which is so dear to my heart.

I ate there last week with a group of friends and must say everything was awesome.  We started with the tomato bisque soup..delightful.  We shared the prawns wrapped in bacon.and calamari. Two of us shared the best burger in town along with a pizza WOW.

Always a great time at Annabelle's! I've been here twice, and both times, Katie was my server. She's a friend of the boy, so she definitely treated us well! But I've never experienced bad service from any of the other staff, either. Happy hour is great [I believe you save 25% off food, and they have set prices for wine / beer / well drinks], and it's super super reasonable. Dinner is awesome as well. I loooove the tomato soup. And the caprese salad is light, yet substantial [does that make sense?!] Tomatoes rule my life. Their pizzas are also really good - I love the texture of the crust. I also was able to taste the pork [SO GOOD] and cioppino [very unique]. I don't remember what I ate the first time I was here - plates just kept coming out! - but everything I've had here was exceptional.
Came here for happy hour with my husband and friends. Just had a couple appetizers.  Our server Marcelo was great and very attentive. He recommended the bacon prawns and they were delicious!

I was looking for a place close to the Moscone Center that we could have a decent meal and good conversation.  Annabelle's was recommended so I set up reservations.  When we got there the place seemed to be getting busy so I was glad I made those reservations.

This restaurant needs to improve the food quality . It's in the heart of San Francisco and doesn't compare to anything but the low end of restaurants. To be fair , the service was great, and the wine was decent, but for the money is was so below my expectations. I would not return or recommend it except to sit on the bar side and have drinks.

Great atmosphere and delicious food. Staffs always very helpful and the drinks are amazing . It gets pretty packed during the evening. Fav item is the Tomato bisque soup. I used to eat the bacon wrapped prawns before I became vegetarian . Have tried almost everything on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet!

Amazing food, on-point service, excellent wine list, and a lovely ambiance! What else can you ask for? I took my sister-in-law here on a whim because I was staying at the Mosser and we were hungry. I have several food allergies, including wheat, and they were able to accommodate all of them without any trouble. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience and would happily dine here again when in the area!

What a wonderful restaurant.  Located in Union Square, we stumbled upon Annabelle's on our way to the Cheesecake Factory. After looking at the menu, we decided to give Annabelle's a try, and we're so glad that we did.  Both the food and the service are superb. My son and I had the rigatoni with sundried tomatoes, artichokes, spinach and a very light Parmesan cheese that complimented everything perfectly. Katie, our waitress, was absolutely delightful. She is a definite asset to the restaurant. Our meal from the potato soup to the entree to dessert was fantastic.
Indeed as good as it get!

Great food, superb service and beautiful restaurant and bar! Love all the things I ordered, from appetizer to the dessert is super yummy! The manager was super nice and accommodating, he is very professional!

My friend and I went to Annabells last night for dinner. We were seated immediately which was nice. Our server was not directly rude, but uninterested and annoyed by us. I ordered a burger and it was just ok. For $16 it should have been the best I ever had. The garlic fries had way too much garlic on them. We finished eating and got our separate bills and a gratuity of 20% had already been added. I have never heard of a gratuity being added for a single person....way too much money for mediocre food and cranky service. I won't be back.

The Seared Scallop dish and Capresse Salad are truly wonderful. Just make sure to come at dinner time. The scallops are not on the lunch menu. Also, during dinner, sit in the dining room side if you can. They pack them in tight on the bar side.

What I witnessed at this restaurant was  Absolutely Disgusting!!! While waiting in the bar area for a table, we could see into the kitchen where they were prepping food. There was 2 chicken breasts that had fallen on the floor. I watched intently to see why they hadn't thrown them away. Workers were stepping over them etc. Then one of the prep workers picked the chicken up of the floor and PUT IT BACK in the drawer where the fresh chicken was to be used!!!! I could not believe my eyes! DON'T DINE HERE! We tried to find the manager to report but he was no where to be found. Disgusting.
Cobb salad was not impressive and prepared with dark meat only. Service was horrific. Hostess asked me questions while swinging her pointing fingers in my face.
Great service and nice menu. The service was very prompt and friendly. We had the burger and the Cobb salad. We also tried the deviled eggs which were fresh an tasty. Nice little spot.
High price, low quality.

Walked into this establishment about 9:30pm and sat at the bar. Asked the bartender if they had coffee for a drink, specifically decaf coffee for a nightcap of Bailey's and java. He said "No I don't think we will brew anymore, it will just go to waste." He didn't offer anything else and just looked at us like we were a bother to him... as the $16 they would have charged for two shots of Bailey's apparently didn't warrant our business. Absolute rude service. We left immediately after.
Saved by the Annabelle!

Ahhhh Annabelles, how have I not written a review yet?  Somehow there's almost nothing in this hood serving food after 10pm.  Except Annabelle's.  Which is a bar style place serving damn good food, and late.  The thing you want is the bacon wrapped scallops.   I know these are featured at lots of places, but Annabelle's does it right.  It took our waiter all of about 0.3 seconds to recommend them when we asked what to get.  Do it.
The food is good and tge location is great but...

We booked a room at the Mosser, and Annabelle's was next door.  Our server Angel was really an Angel!  He recommended two dishes, the cioppino for my husband and the half chicken for myself.  Both were delicious.  Service was excellent, and we are very glad we stopped in.  Will definitely return to both the hotel and Annabelle's.

Went to this restaurant for the first time back in June on my bday, and I was impressed to say the least. It is an older venue, but that just added to the subtle old school appeal. I was also impressed by the level of diversity in it's staff. You can really see that they care more about personality and demeanor rather than a person's individual style. This is, in my opinion, a true reflection of the rich culture of SF, especially in the SOMA district where Anabelle's is located. The servers were very professional and had had great manners ( they always said "may I..." and "thank you" which is like a lost skill among many restaurant workers today...)
Get the bacon wrapped prawns!

This place was connected to my hotel and the food and wine was great. I had bacon wrapped prawns and a seafood soup tat was excellent. The service was quick and I my seat was right next to the window so I could look outside. A bit pricey but I was on a business trip so I didn't mind too much. Would go back again even if I couldn't expense it.
It wasn't the best meal I have ever had, but it wasn't the worst either.
Excellent pumpkin soup, tasty chicken, great skirt stake with blue cheese , fair prices .
Ate at the bar and ordered a cold Great White on Tap. Nice location and decent food. A bit pricey, but it San Francisco. Not overly friendly service.

Rony & DGF are simply amazing. We (my company) have eaten there a couple of times and the quality of the food and service are excellent. Not to mention that it's just a cool location, Rony did an amazing job designing his space.

These guys care enough about health to generate calorie counts (which in itself is a commitment) and I'm told each item on the menu was purposely designed to provide a well-balanced ratio of nutritional needs. I can pretty much eat every meal there and be eating as healthy as if I had my own nutritionist/chef. Yeah, Mixt is healthy and does calorie counts as well, but I can get breakfast, second breakfast, lunch, afternoon snack, and dinner at DGF. It is relatively pricey but totally in line with typical FiDi food joints. Plus the staff and especially the salad guy, Marco, are super nice and easygoing even with busy lunch lines.

You won't get better healthy and fast food anywhere. I got sandwich and soup and it was so flavorful and filling. The service was fast and very friendly. The menu has a ton to choose from and I can't wait to try breakfast....this place is my new go to.

I had lunch here yesterday, and as a vegetarian I was thrilled with the choices.  I highly recommend the Cauliflower Soup, but all of the soups sounded delicious...it was hard to decide.  The teriyaki tofu sandwich was really good and unique.  Fresh veggie juices were a nice item to offer.  There is a lot of dining space, so even during a busy lunch hour there was ample seating.  I highly recommend DGF!
DGF is awesome. The people are great and the food is phenomenal. I eat there often and always have a great meal but what propelled me to write this review is something that happened yesterday.

I have gotten lunch from this place as well as used them to cater breakfast for my company.  Their food is ALWAYS fresh, and very flavorful.  The owner is very responsive if there are questions regarding an order, and their service is speedy, both when I went in person to get lunch around 12:30 pm, and with their breakfast delivery.  I highly recommend their smoked salmon breakfast sandwich, and their fruit cups.  I am gluten free and they only charge $1 extra for gluten free sandwich bread.  This place is great, reasonably priced, and personable employees. Great find.
Really fresh ingredient, and the service is just perfect!!!!
Really good food. Excellent options. Was a little let down that the juices are made in the morning (a common time saving practice, but not good for the juice).

I decided to give this place a try because there was a paypal discount. Got the Turkey Sandwich. It was seriously SO dry and completely flavorless. Even when I added, salt, pepper, and sriracha it didn't taste like much. I would have to say it wasn't even worth the additional $5 i paid on top of the paypal, so it is DEFINITELY not worth the price.
Ordered the 10 spice roasted leg of lamb sandwich. It was pretty tasted. Sandwich comes topped with kale, onions, and an eggplant spread. Couldn't taste much of the eggplant spread though.

I live in Atlanta. He lives in SF. He works crazy hours on a job site that isn't accessible to many food options. I wanted to surprise him with some lunch one day and I found DGF's site on Yelp. I placed my online order on Grub Hub, from Atlanta, mind you, and within an hour, hot and delicious food was being delivered via bike to the man!

I've been coming here for a few weeks and I can say this is a place for a solid good lunch breakfast and dinner! They have a great variety of juices and smoothies which are organic and was cheaper than the over priced juice places near by, their most expensive juice being $6.50 I think.

Ordered delivery for a leadership lunch meeting today. The only positive and reason for two stars instead of the required one start is that they delivered right on time which can be rare. The food was mediocre at best. Everyone who ordered sandwiches thought they were very bland and one person (out of 9)received the wrong order.
I have never written a review, but it was that bad.  Totally overpriced and disgusting.  No flavor...  I had the pulled pork and my friend had another sandwich.. they were soggy and gross!  Woof!

Had a very pathetic sandwich here the other day that was 90% bread, which was not even tasty bread. It's very difficult to find a place that makes such a disastrous sandwich especially at this part of town where it's so competitive. The potatoes were also cold...but the sandwich is bad enough alone...

It's okay, but not as expected. Got the specials - turkey Reuben and French onion soup. French onion soup was okay - as expected. I had expected a turkey Reuben to be turkey pastrami, but was wrong - regular turkey with kraut and dressing. It wasn't bad - just mediocre in my opinion.

My favorite lunch and working dinner place! They have such healthy and delicious options! The dinner options are one of the. Only well rounded and healthy places I have found in the financial district- which makes working late much easier!! Plus they have gluten free bread as an option for all their sandwiches!! Try their green monsta smoothie!!

My coworker had soup that was outstanding here yesterday.   I had the turkey sandwich which was nice but the bread was far too thick for the amount of filling.   If they put the toppings onto half the bread, I would say 5 stars!

Not darn good, DAMN good food. I've even fighting the urge to write a review for weeks now but can resist no longer. The food is so fresh, so satisfying, and the salads are freaking huge. On top of that, I've often been offered free bread apropos of nothing. I mean, I'm a cheap customer- basic salad and free cucumber/lemon water every single time, and still they treat me like a big spender when I stop by. When you've only got 30 minutes for lunch and need smart fuel to keep you long until dinner, skip the other comparable delis nearby. Do they have ample seating, self serve sriracha, and loads of vegan opinions, too? I didn't think so.
Meh.

Get your local and organic veggie-filled lunch here.  Love that you can customize your salad and you can get a pretty filling one for under $11 (meat is around $3).  We all know how precious our lunch hour is so save some time by calling in your order and having it ready before you go.

I can't speak for much else than the "fresh" juices. But for $6.00 a pint I was shocked to receive a watery cup of pre-made "juice" in an unsealed cup that I was told was made "within a couple hours." Ugh. It didn't taste too bad but certainly lacked any real vitality for which I pay that kind of money to drink. Might as well have had a $1.50 bottle of tea.

Reminds me a bit of Mixt Greens from my old job - now I can come to these guys and also get custom salads made. I love the branding and during my first visit, I ordered the Wasabi Miso Tri-tip Sandwich and the cashiers were friendly.  The one thing I thought they could have done was cut the sandwich in half; not sure if they forgot or if they normally didn't but it made eating a little hard. I love the fact that their side of mixed greens came with roasted red potatoes - totally made my day, hell I'd totally go and have those along if I had to.

Stopped by for dinner--it was almost empty so I was a bit skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised.  The pulled pork sandwich was tasty with excellent bread, and came with some roasted potatoes and a fresh green salad.  With a generous pour of Merlot, I had a nice dinner in San Fransisco for about $20.  I would have come back for another meal, but alas they are closed on weekends.
a big rip off for some mediocre unhealthy food. just to add, in-spite of 50% off offer.

Looking for a quick snack with the kids while visiting SF. Stopped in here and was pleasantly surprised! Kids each ordered a smoothie. They enjoyed the taste and I liked that they weren't the typical syrup-laden dessert concoctions most smoothie places make. Tasted like fresh wholesome ingredients. I got the sweet potato lentil soup....soooooo good!  Wish there were more fast/nutritious options like this place out there!

These guys would be better suited to working as door greeters at Wal-Mart. After telling them my order three times, they persisted in making it wrong right in front of me. The utensils brought to me were filthy, and obvious hadn't been looked at after coming out of the dish room. The food was mediocre, my food being bland, and my wife's salad so shy on dressing and other veggies she might as well have just ordered lettuce. Panera Bread executes the same concept with much more finesse.
Quick, fresh, tasty food. Restaurant is really quiet and easy to get in on afternoons. Good sized portions of food at a good price. I have always had great service here too. Must try the salmon!

As I am still in the middle of a salad that came with my sandwich, I am quite surprised to see less than 5 star reviews for this place. I was just marveling that you get a ton of AMAZING food for just over $10. And it is just that-DARN GOOD FOOD. It was first recommended to me 8 months ago by a co-worker. And while I liked the food, for my taste there were too many people involved in the process of making it--one took the order, one took my money, one made it, one screamed my name when it was ready. But the quality is SO DARN good--you get a generous salad and creatively cooked potatoes with every order(I think). The owner is ALWAYS there, and can answer any questions you might have. I order things with salmon, because I am forever the cat and adore my fish, but I've ordered corporate lunches from them and my people were squealing with delight. Also, they cut down on the "assembly line" and now there are only 2 people involved--my order just now was ready before I could get my phone out.
When I came here over a year ago, I had an amazing sandwich. When I came here a few days ago, I was quite disappointed. The food is just not that darn good! Does this qualify as false advertising?
I think this place is definitely over hyped.

Now my go-to breakfast place, and looking forward to trying other meals, too. Friendly competent service, nice sitting area, healthy, well-prepared food. Nice contrast to the ubiquitous diners. Wish it opened earlier than 8am.

The first two times I ordered takeout here I requested and paid an extra dollar for gluten free bread. Both times I did not get it. Shame on me for not checking before I walked all the way back to the office!
Awesome flavors, great friendly service. Fresh ingredients and a well crafted menu. Good job guys, I will return.

The food is great....excellent favors. Not to mention the owner is extremely kind and helpful. Fresh flavors, healthy and clean. Very accommodating they have gluten free and paleo options, which is awesome!

New favorite spot for lunch! Food is so fresh; service is great; prices are very reasonable. It's really hard to find a spot downtown that you can get in and get out of, without having to sacrifice on health. Their menu is really solid and all the soups are vegan. The bread that all the sandwiches come on is superb. Definitely will be going here at 2x a week.

On the outside Darn Good Food looks like a nice go to for lunch. My co worker & I recently tried it. Boy....were we disappointed. The food was bland & tasteless. We shared the salmon sandwich & a salad.  This place seriously in need of some flavor.

Wow. Other yelpers were right. The butternut squash soup and the lamb sandwich are amazing. I was skeptical that squash soup could be that good, but they did an outstanding job of making it taste good without doing either of the cardinal vegetable soup sins - making it taste like a vegetable purée or making it taste like butter. Instead, it's that awesome middle ground where the vegetable is clear and present, and accentuated with the mild spices to make it savory.
My new favorite is the Lebanese Fattoush Salad. It's tangy, crunchy, and overall a fantastic salad at only $9.

Best "deli" in the neighborhood. A lot of people say this place is more than just a deli. Let's be real. Its just a really really nice deli. Love eating upstairs. Would never guess they has such nice seating up there. Prices are decent. Breakfast sandwiches are good! Lot of options. Just like a good deli.
Your burgers are thick, juicy, and has taste

When you go anywhere with good friends, you're assured a great time. And when the waiter comes by to grab your order right before the end of happy hour, it's even better. Wine, beer, and certain appetizers were each only $5.

We lucked up and found this restaurant near our hotel. What an incredibly fun and great experience!! Not only did we have the Best waitress and we do mean Fantastic person named Anna, but we had a Fantastic meal! From start to finish, the food, attention to service, and ambiance Rocked!! Thanks SF! for having a winner!!
Had brunch on a busy beautiful Sunday. Food was great, a little view of the water and bridge, and friendly staff made for a nice relaxing time.
The bar food is probably better than the actual dinner menu, which me and my wife had.  The service is just ok, nothing great.  It's nothing really special.
Dark, crowded, difficult to get served drinks. Perhaps I was there at the wrong time...
One of my friends took me here for lunch.   I don't know if it was the company, but the burger was great.   Also, I appreciated the service.   Will definitely be back soon.

I've walked by this place every day for the past 6 months on my way to the ferry, so we decided to watch the WS game Friday  night and I'm glad we did. We sat in the cozy bar area (Happy Hour is great) against the wall, the Mgr. was very accommodating by bringing us another chair for our 3rd guest who hadn't arrived, even though it was busy. He brought us water and bread sticks which is a nice treat. The burger and fries we ordered were delicious! Our server, I don't remember her name (she had the feather earrings) was very attentive and provided service with a smile.  We're looking forward to going back and trying more of the menu!!

If I could give this place a zero star rating I would.  Never experienced the rudest waiters there ever.  We went with a group of friends before the Giant vs Dodger game to get some drinks and some waiter had the nerve to tell us we couldn't sit at a specific table (when no one was ever sitting there and wasn't even reserved).  I have never experienced a waiter with that rude of a behavior before.  Best result was to just leave and find another place (thank goodness we did).  Beware of this place and waiter!  Would never want to give business to a company that would treat customers like this.
Decent (and rare) place for a sit down breakfast in the FiDi/Embarcadero. Big portions. Nothing special. Clean pub vibe.

I like this place. its a nice restaurant/sports bar. Their lamb shank entree for dinner is a must try. the meat is falling off the bone soft. They also have gluten free beer and a hefty selection of wine by the glass. The service is always great and I never have to wait for a table.

Ah Perry's....was in town for Dreamforce this week, stayed at the Hotel Griffin, and found this amazing bar attached!  Racer5 on tap....watching the Giants win the NLCS.....great food to snack and dine on.  Friendly owners and bartenders....Brian took good care of me this week.  Thanks for a wonderful week away from home, I'll be back next time I'm in town.

Solid spot for food and price! Considering the number of times we have stopped in, it's a bit disappointing that we are not regulars list ;) Tuesdays and Saturdays half off bottles of wine is great and their ahi tacos are incredible!

We walked in on a Friday night for dinner and were pleased to be seated on the patio facing the bridge. It was a lovely setting and as the sun set was very romantic. We had the calamari as an appetizer, good flavor and not overly battered. I had a glass of the house Pinot Noir, it was smooth and delicious and my husband had the Racer 5 IPA which he enjoyed. For dinner I had the mixed greens salad, honestly I didn't enjoy it. It said it came with a champagne dressing, but it tasted very bland, just not much flavor. Don't let that stop you from going here though because everything else was delicious! My husband had the filet mignon and bacon Mac n' cheese. The filet melted in your mouth and the Mac n' cheese was very rich.

My coworker wanted to check out their happy hour, as we had a stressful work week...and after those long hours we were hungry! It took awhile to get their attention and get seated, which was annoying since they were busy but not that busy.

First off, I can tell Perry's truly cares about it's customers and wants to make them happy. After my review management reached out to see how they could improve things. I have been back to Perry's for happy hour, and enjoyed their great drinks and atmosphere. I hope to return again soon for a meal and hope to update my review of the food!

With five guys we stopped here for drinks in the bar last weekend. It was a nice swanky kind of place, but not enough seating in the bar and not really my kind of place. I am a little more low key and laid back. More of a mixed drink bar than a beer bar. They did have some draft beers. This place is ok.
I was here for the first time for lunch.

While at the Griffon we ate at Perrys.  It was so so...ok.  The bartenders were pretty rude.  Trying to get Sean/John whatever his name is, attention was difficult as I had to interrupt him talking to his friends/girls.  The next day a lady with long hair was behind the bar.  Not sure she enjoys her job.  Food was ok when you're hungry. I suspect this is more of a snack/drink bar place.

We had brunch here Sunday morning with the food credit we got with our room at the Hotel Griffon. It's got good food and drinks. The ambiance of the patio seating made the experience for us though, with the water, the bridge, the ferry building and Giants fans streaming past on their way to the game.
The Tortilla Scaramble was sooo good!

I was here for a large get together and was seated in the private room in the back. I ordered the calamari as an appetizer, the mahi mahi as an entree and the chocolate mousse for dessert. I also had a couple of cocktails and a latte.
Maybe 3.75 stars, good happy hour, food is consistently good for mid level dining.

I went to Perry's twice: on a Monday afternoon and Tuesday night, both times with coworkers (it was right across from our hotel). The first visit was so-so: crowded, lively, but not the most inviting. There wasn't a lot of room at the bar, so me and others felt like we were always in the way. The tables at the end of the bar in the back of the restaurant were empty (only the bar was popular, since it was 4/5 pm and the dinner rush hadn't hit) but one of the waitresses made it a point to say we could not sit at (or take chairs from) those tables. It didn't leave the best impression, but I got over it.

Perry's is a decent, albeit overpriced restaurant. The decor seems to be striving to be a nice sit-down restaurant. However, the atmosphere and clientele scream (literally) sports bar. I came here a few weeks ago with some friends who were visiting for a conference. We were wearing suits, and we were clearly overdressed. The bar was noisy and crowded with plenty of Giants fans yelling at the TV. The table we ended up being seated at was quite nice though.

Made reservations a week in advance. When we arrived we were seated in the bar area at a tight little table for 4. We were told the dining room had been reserved for a private party. We were there for two hours and never saw anyone in the dining room. I think it should have been mentioned when I made the reservation. That being said, the food was fantastic. One other note, 1/2 price wine on Saturdays....ordered a $48 bottle of Chardonnay and it had a twist off top. Really?
I overall enjoyed my experience here.

I made a reservation and arrived at the nick of time.  The place was packed.  Giants fans stop in for a bite and a drink before the baseball game.  We were able to get a table inside with a view. A glass of long breadsticks arrived after our waters.  My friend ordered the Perry's Manhattan (aka Bulleit Manhattan) and I had a white wine referred to as Gl Kim Crawford.  I had a taste of the cocktail. It was sweet and hit your pallet with a tasty flavor. We also ordered the grilled artichokes. I'm not too familiar in how to eat them and wasn't too much of a fan. It tasted like eating hard leaves.  No worries my friend liked it and finished it off.  The entree was an appropriate portion. It wasn't a hungry man-type portion but it was ok to get you in your way. I had the special which was a seafood pasta. It had scallops, mussels, clams and a little shrimp.  Soupy but not like a gazpacho but ok.  My friend had the grilled halibut which was tender and very good. It had a lot of greens, I think spinach, which was ok for a few bites but he wasn't a spinach fan so they ate around it. All in all, it was a very nice meal in a noisy environment. Oh, I almost left out. The hostess asked us if we wanted a window view or a booth. Since it was warm, we figured a window view.  When she seated us, our view overlooked the bridge and water off the Embarcadero when we stood. The moment we sat down, our view were a bunch of people sitting next to us on the other side of the glass. The had outdoor seating and they were our view. It was funny but no different than being inside.
The food is good and our waitress was really nice, but it took forever for the food to actually get to us.

They have the best buffalo wings ever! Great customer service all around and the food comes out fast and hot! I ordered the Tomato Bisque soup and had tried a little bit of my friend's food as well. The tomato bisque was good that I finished it all! They give you a huge serving which was perfect for eating it as a meal. Two of my friends had split a burger and fries and the restaurant was so nice to already cut the burger and half and split the fries between two plates!! I couldn't stop eating their french fries because they were cooked perfectly! My other friend had the Chop Salad which she said is the best Chop Salad she has ever had (I believe her because she finished it all and she's been in the food business forever!).
Good drinks!

The view is great but the service and food was awful! Our waitress brought out our crab cakes which I ordered as my lunch waaaay later than the rest of our food. She still charged us for the crab cakes even after we complained that the food had come so late. I do not recommend coming here unless it is for drinks and appetizers and to enjoy the view.

Described to me as "the Marina version of a diner." Well put - only, take your standards and lower them. The food is sub par, as is the service. It's a struggle to get seated - you have to wind your way through the crush of tourists to the host stand in the very back of the restaurant... and then wait for the host to return from wherever she is... then wait for her to find you a table even though there's no wait and plenty of tables are open.
Came in here yesterday for brunch and had a great time with family!
A couple words: GREAT HAPPY HOUR
My guest told me "You should write them a Yelp review" so here I go

Nice decor and location. My steak was ordered medium and arrived bloody rare. They re-cooked it and didn't charge me for the food. The calamari was excellent. The service was slow, but they were packed. Not the best and not the worst for the price.
No constancy- we had a great time earlier the same day - came back to new 'management' later that evening only to be insulted - literally.

Very good experience at Perry's.  I didn't have high hopes because I don't love classic american food and it's in somewhat of a touristy location...but I have to say I was really impressed.  The food we got (clam chowder, artichokes, spinach salad and chicken tenders) were all very good.  And the service was spot on as well, despite being pretty busy.  I'm really at a 4.5 for this place.  We will be back.

Hip. Trendy. Great location.  We came here on a Friday for lunch during the World Cup and it was packed with dudes (whom I'm sure were suppose to be at work by then) crowding around the TVs cheering for their favorite team.  Although I'm not a huge futbol fan, it made for good people watching.
Time: 12:23pm/64°F mostly sunny
always on godish which is great. their insalata con pollo is amazing. nicest guys ever work there.
One to like.

I haven't actually ever stepped foot into this place, but my office has ordered pizzas from Tricolore 3 times now and we have yet to be disappointed! The thin crust pizzas are delicious and crispy. It's so hard not to keep going back for more slices!

A solid lunch place for soups, salads, pizza and pastas. My favorites are chicken caesar salad, any of the soups and their pasta bolognese. You can eat there inside, or outside at 2 tables or take your food and eat it in the enchanting Transamerica redwood forest across the street.
Delicious, and very reasonably priced. Wonderful staff as well, they are super friendly and efficient!

I got half a salmone panini and a soup, the lentil tomato one. OMG the soup was absolutely delicious and I finished it ALL. I rarely do that unless I really like the soup. It was not salty AT ALL. Very pleased with the salmon panini, it was just right with not too many ingredients but just the right amount of salmon with a nice mascarpone spread. Such an unassuming place this is with good fresh ingredients. Next time I'll try the pizza, two slices for $7 and you can get a slice and half a panini too. A full panini is huge by the way, half of one is enough. The pasta salads look good too. I will be back and refer our Office Manager to them for catering as well.
Mike, the owner has always treated me like family... Honestly my favorite place in the world for fresh, healthy paninis! Try the smoked salmon one, its my favorite!
My new lunch place.  Happy that they sell pizza by the slice!
Ordered two pizzas today for the office and they were a huge hit!  Definitely the place to order pizza if you work in the FiDi area.
They have very good Tiramisu!

Tricolore is my all time favorite lunch restaurant in San Francisco. The food is fresh and delicious, the atmosphere is friendly and you feel like you got transplanted to Italy. Be sure and meet the owner Michael, an authentic Italian, he is always present and making sure his guests are taken care of. Great place!

I really appreciate business owner's who CARE about their customers, in addition, take the time to reach out to them and take the criticism constructively and offer suggestions to remedy the issue.  Such as Claudia - who reached out to me today and offered to make it up to me.

I was craving Italian for lunch. I found this great little place at the foot of Columbus. The veg panino and a proper bowl (not cup)  of minestrone hit the spot.  I also like how they use your name, not a number.
The best decaf coffee in my neighborhood :)  Michael, Joe and their crew are always very friendly.
Kind service, cleans and tasty!

Though Italian food isn't the first cuisine that comes to my mind when I think of vegan food, but this place is a little exception. For a fi-di lunch place, they usually have a couple of vegan options. I found vegan soups almost every time I went there. Somedays I will even find a vegan pizza. How wonderful is that!

I have to update my review because the owners of Tricolore read my previous review and personally contacted me about it. They apologized profusely for the poor customer service and meal I was served and they offered to make it up to me. I was very touched since I've left several negative reviews for other businesses before and this was the first time that one of them has ever cared enough to contact me about it. I really like business owners who prove that they actually care about their customers.

Pretty average place with pretty good prices.  I had the Mozzarella panini - half, and half is truly tiny.  The bread for the panini was pretty good, and my coworkers seemed to like the pasta, but not the pizza.

Tricolore Caffe did some catering for my office earlier this week, and did a fine job.  Their salads were especially delicious -  the fusilli salad was gobbled up before I even had a chance to taste it.  I did manage to grab some marinated vegetables, which included zucchini, peppers and mushrooms - and they were garlicky and oily, just what I wanted.

I love this little place.  Not only do I enjoy the location because it reminds me of alleys in Italy, but the food is darn good as well.  I've had their cesare, grilled veggies, pesto pasta, minestrone soup, salmon panini and their chicken and basil panini (not in one day, lol).  All of which has been delicious.  The people here are super friendly and down to earth.  I really appreciate when a business takes pride in what they do and this place definitely does that.
Contrary to other reviews, I enjoyed Tricolore's pizza.  We decided to eat here for lunch and opted for a fresh baked whole margherita. It look about 20 minutes, but it was piping hot and fresh!
Cheap, but the pizza is far less than the avg, wouldn't recommend it for pizza lovers

Shortly after I wrote my original review, the owner sent me a very nice email with a sincere apology for the unfriendly attitude I had encountered and an assurance that she had spoken to the person about it. This tells me that they do indeed care that their customers have a good experience, so I will look forward to trying them again.
TriColore !

The pasta is absolutely delicious.  The pizza is just okay.  The guys there are always friendly and ask how you're doing.  They turn and burn pretty quickly and it's good for a take-out lunch or to grab a slice of pizza.

I've worked a block away from this joint for a year and never really had any co-workers talk it up.  With a $3 LevelUp credit I finally gave it a shot today for lunch take-out.  If watery pasta and a 6 to 1 noodle to sauce ratio is your thing then then you've got to check this place out.  I honestly don't think they took the 30 seconds needed to drain the pasta and they rationed out the sauce as if there was a tomato famine going on.
Had the penne salad with artichokes, sun dried tomatoes and what appeared to be bits of turkey cold cuts (hmmm). A bit too strong on the vinegar, but it was otherwise fine.
Good pizza and surprisingly great fruit salad.  They were right on time with the delivery, friendly delivery guy.
Met up w/ Yelp buddy Simone W for a sunny-workday lunch & couldn't have been more impressed w/ Tricolore
Very delicious!, I had their prawn gamberi and it was very fresh and delicious. The portion is just right. It's a small restaurant but very quaint and quiet.

Love the sandwiches with home-made foccacia bread!!  It is SO GOOD.  I loved the fresh mozzarella, roma tomatoes, fresh basil, olive oil and black pepper (mozzarella sandwich).  The salads are good too and the prices are VERY REASONABLE and lunch friendly!!  Wasn't too big on their cookies...kinda flakey-ish crumbly texture?  Not my style, but their paninis are BOMB and catering service is reputable.
WEE!!!
Here we gooo...value!

If you happen to be near the financial district and are looking for a place to eat lunch, it is well worth the short walk! I have been going there at least once a week with a bunch of friends for the last couple of years and am enjoying it every time.
chicken panini

I'm doing some training in SF and stopped in for a Panini. They got my order wrong and had the nerve to get irritated with me. I found the cashier to be rude and dismissive. The panini was nothing special, I wouldn't come back here again.

A little disappointed that they messed up my catering order yesterday for a board meeting. They forgot to include the dessert that I had already paid for. When I followed up to alert them, Joe was kind enough to reverse the charge and apologized for the mistake. Given that I've ordered from them before it would of been nice if he threw in a little something more as an incentive to entice me to order from them again, especially since a tip was given in advance.
I was fiending some pizza and this is the closet place to my work. $3.85 for a small/medium sized slice, soggy crust and pretty greasy.
(See pics)

When you walk in the place looks pretty nice on the walk up to the counter you order your food the people at the counter pretty flat out rude. I mean it wouldn't kill you to smile at least when they take your order... The french fries were okay crispy hot when it came out, but nothing out of the ordinary for the burger. It was overpriced for what you get. I got the south from the border burger it was a semi satisfying they claim it had Chairrizo by yet it lacked the flavor. It had too many unnecessary ingredients in the burger but didn't really go together. I'd rather have a smash burger instead...

Good burger and fries in the financial district.  Lot's of creative menu choices and a wide range of meats for your burger.  My friend got a salad and it looked great too.  I liked the fries and next time I will check out the sweet potato fries.  The meat is good quality.
It was delicious and super clean place in San Francisco. Turk arkadaslar mutlaka ugrayin...

Great halal food and large portions. It is a bit on the pricey side, but the portions and quality is good. I was only able to finish half my food in one sitting and took the rest to go. I ordered the south of the border burger and onion rings, was happy with both.
One of the best burgers great service quick satisfying. Just terrific. I am so lucky to have found this place. A definite place to one to. The fries are too good for words

The manager who boarded up his bathroom the day of the SFGiants championship parade stinks! They had a out of order sign up and a  big plywood board completely covering the door to make it unavailable, but what good does that do if your employees are telling patrons you did it because you didn't want to deal with the crowds. If I would have realized that before I had paid for my meal I would have moved on to a patron friendly establishment.  I bet you made a lot of money that day even tho you are a total jerk!

Love this spot!  Very customer friendly? Fast service,  fresh and hot foods. Garlic fries to die ford! Ziggy special sauce is so yummy too! They use Harris ranch hala grass & grain fed meats. We always get the Ziggy's burger and garlic fries.  For 2 burgers $ 8.50 each and $4 bucks for a side of garlic fries total is $23 bucks and change. The portions are not small either! Your burger patty is always a little bigger then ur.bun too fresh juicy

Honestly, I only agreed to come here because my friend only eats Halal meat. Turns out, the Halal burgers at Ziggy's taste great! The burger is fresh, well-cooked, and well-sized. I ordered the South of the Border, which featured some awesome chipotle sauce and, most importantly, avocado! The fries are decent but not amazing. Maybe I should have tried the sweet potato fries or curly fries to make things more interesting.

The burgers here smell to die for. My favorite is the lamb burger. The burger is juicy, with a tasty bun, that does not get soggy as you eat it and has a great, slightly sweet note that balances so well with the meat. The fries are good, but I do enjoy more the onion rings.
Exceptionally good food, and halal too!

I have always walked by and seen the alligator sign that says "lamb burgers" and wanted to try it. But $13 for lunch was a little steep. I finally caved in and went with a coworker. I have a complex so I had to get French fries and a drink with the meal. It ended up coming to about $20. $20 for lunch!! :( it was good...but expensive

Walked in on a whim because I was so hungry!  The burgers were so good!  Mine was perfectly cooked and juicy and tasted great!  I didn't get the fries as I didn't initially realize the burgers don't come with them, but the burger was big enough on it's own! Place was pretty slow at the time but it was later afternoon on a Saturday.
Solid meal.  Had the burger and fries one night, went back again and had the beef skewer dinner the second.  Skewers were very tasty.

The halal burgers here are only average tasting.  I've definitely had better.  Everything is so darn expensive.  Add fries and a drink to the burger costs almost as much as the burger itself.  Great option in the Financial District for OK halal burgers.

I love breakfast and sometimes people don't know that burger places that open at 7am do have a breakfast menu this place has it all, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.. A true one stop shop to have something for everybody and they have a new menu with a few new items but overall I love this place at anytime of the day with a very nice staff to take your order and bring your meal right to you 5 stars for deliciousness and customer service
3.5 Stars
Come here for lunch with my co-workers every Friday. It's the best burger place in the financial district. period!
they have an amazing breakfast lavash wrap.

Really awesome burgers! Just wish the prices were a bit lower so this could become a more frequent option for me but still really good food. Also the customer service was really great as the guy at the cashier explained a few  menu options to me in detail.

Stopped by Ziggy's while killing time in the city. Wanted to try the chimichurri cheesesteak, but they were all sold out, so I settled for a burger. The toppings (cheese, guac, jalapenos, etc.) made the burger, thought the meat itself was a bit dry.
It was pretty busy when we came in on Saturday afternoon! We weren't even sure we'd get seats but fortunately some people left just as we were placing our order.

Our family had just went to the exploratorium and we were famished. We went by the Ferry Terminal and there were lines out the door for the she-she overpriced foodies' food. We stumbled on to this restaurant by accident on our walk back to the Omni and we were served quickly. The fish and chips were great. My wife liked the Greek Salad except it had a lot of olives which I was happy to take off her hands. My kids had the grilled cheese which was very basic. Nonetheless, a simple quick meal that is not McDonald's near the Embarcadero for under $30, I was ecstatic.
$5 milkshake was definitely not worth it
I came here late at night and got an order of fries, so I can't really speak to the quality of the burgers. But my fries were piping hot and not too-thick or too-thin, and salted, and delish!
I am not a big fan of burgers but this place won me over. I had the lamb burger and it was just heaven

We were visiting from New York, the food capital of the world, and my husband claims that he just had the best sandwich he's EVER had at any restaurant. It was the Chimichurri Cheesesteak sandwich at Ziggy Burger. I had a chicken sandwich with avocado which was also delicious. The garlic fries were an added plus to our meal.

Came here on fourth of July.  We were supposed to go to Gotts at the waterfront for food and the view but were too hungry to wait for service so ended up opting for faster food burger.  The interior and exterior are pretty much like any franchise joint and the service is mediocre at best.   The burgers hit the spot after a long day of walking but it's overpriced for what it is: simple and somewhat dry.  Adding condiments made it taste a lot better.  Another burger joint close by, Super Duper, is a better choice in terms of taste and price.  I'm on the fence about this place, but I had a great time with my friends here so it elevated the experience.  I guess it's at least worth trying.  I give it 3-3.5 stars.

The place is pretty simple with a menu that is not complicated. I took the burger and sweet potato fries back to my room and unfortunately the fries were soggy. Not sure if that was because I did take out, or if there are that way. The burger was good, but the bun was not impressive. If they did something special with the bun it would be a really good burger.

Oh Ziggy's! Oh over priced Ziggy's where you have to order at the counter and order burgers and fries separate. I hate those kind of places! The service was slow, and not very helpful. When someone is from out of town make them want to come back! Because I know I can say I more than likely wouldn't come back if it weren't for the fact my friend's burger smelled and looked extremely appetizing with feta cheese and I believe it was a turkey burger? I got a plain old cheese burger, this was before my yelping days I didn't understand what branching out from the norm when you're in a big city meant. All I do know is my burger that didn't come with fries was not worth $11.00 even if I bought a drink I could have had a five guys burger that was cheaper and tastier with fries! If I do go back, I may try them out again see if I caught them on a bad day, give a better more tasteful review they weren't horrible and they definitely have some exotic variety on their menu that I appreciate! The place was clean and had plenty of seating.

Bought togo from Ziggy's today. The burger was ok, but they forgot my fries! It wasn't even that busy when I went. Found out after I got back and I did not want to make another trip back to Ziggy's again.
My love for ziggys standard burger knows no bounds. I have taken it to Chicago so that my chi-town peeps can enjoy the deliciousness that I always rave about.
Meh.  The burger was identical to Nation's, except less produce, and it cost $8.50 whereas it's like $4 at Nation's.  You're paying for the panel and brick ("yuppie" look), not the food.

I came in here and ordered a burger because I'd originally wanted a chicken shawarma from Oasis Grill. A burger cost about the same price as a wrap from Oasis, but let's not forget that this is a piece of meat sandwiched between two pieces of bread. For $9. As I left carrying the warm brown bag and feeling happy that my hunger would soon be sated, I realized that I could've gotten an In N Out burger for half the price.
Best halal burger I've ever had! Seriously wish we had some nearby where I live cus this was TOO good. Usually grilled chicken sandwiches can taste disgusting but this was SO GOOD. HIghly recommend!
I ordered the fried fish Po boy sandwich, garlic fries and a drink.  It came up to $17.45 which I thought was a little high but the meal was good.
Really delicious both times I've been!
If it weren't for the fact that my coworker can only eat halal meat, I probably wouldn't ever come here.

Came in for a last-minute dinner and tried a burger and the fish n chips. Both left a lot to be desired, though the fries were decent. The fish itself was extremely rubbery and the batter they used tasted kind of like chopped up potato chips. It was really odd. I wouldn't go back.

This place was so good I don't know if it's cause I was partying all day and this is the first place I seen coming out the Hyatt but the down south burger with garlic fries was off the chain... So good

Breakfast lavish wrap is a winner. Burger was fresh tasting, not overcooked with good tomatoes and lettuce. Bun was better than most. Yes I ate both at one sitting. Sigh. Prices are decent for the portion size and the place is kept pretty clean.
Great view of market, clean decor and super friendly staff. I frequent this restaurant and the bar for happy hour... And sometimes after working out at the adjacent gym.

Wow.  A recommendation from a friend that turned out to be gold.  I was wary walking in, but impressed immediately by the location's decor and the staff.  Our server was well versed on the menu items, up on food allergies/dietary restrictions, and as fun to talk to as any old friend.  The food however, blew all of that away.  It's tough finding a place to go that can cater to numerous dietary tastes, and I was very happy to find one that had vegan food that didn't taste like someone slapped a salad with a piece of bread.  This was a birthday meal to remember and I can't wait to go back.
Fabulous food for the vegan, vegetarian, and paleo palette. Great flavor, huge portions and REAL ingredients. No fatty oils or butters used in any dish.

There are many great places in union square, however this is one of my favorites! Kombu Kitchen sits atop Market street with an incredible view of downtown SF.  The menu offers a variety of healthy, diverse and creative options, which is important to someone who works downtown and has tried just about every lunch spot.  Authentic, clean tasting, rich flavors and well prepared have me coming back as a regular.
sorry guys, though your mission statement is spot on, and chef seems to have some great accolades you will have to step up your dinner game to last much longer in SF.
I love Kombu enough to finally leave my first Yelp review. Yep, it's that awesome!
We came here around 530 on a Saturday.  It wasn't too busy.  We were greeted and seated promptly.

Terrible place to go.  Absolutely little customer service,  Had to ask if they can take our order and continue to ask for a drink.   Food came out late to where one of my friends had to leave and she just ordered the french fries.  When the food did come, it was mediocre at best.   I am not one to not leave a tip but this place did not deserve even the least amount.   After looking at my credit card statement, they double charged me.   When I called the manager  he just argued with me about customer service.  Seriously!!  I am, mean WAS the customer.  After dealing with this for over 2 weeks and speaking even to the General Manager, nothing is fixed and now  I  have to deal with my credit card company.  I am NEVER going back and would NEVER recommend this place to anyone unless they want poor service, poor food, and be doubly charged.  Watch your credit cards people!
This is San Francisco's best kept secret!!!
As the main thing this place has going for it is the view of Market Street I tried calling Friday morning (SF Giants Parade) to inquire about a table.
$100 per person to watch the Giants Victory parade from this joke of an eatery; I said no!
A HIDDEN GEM!
I

The entire experience at Kombu was excellent. The servers were friendly and prompt and had great recommendations. We started with the peach bbq sliders and chorizo sliders. These were among the best sliders I've had. We immediately ordered a second round. I then had the Thai burger and sweet potato fries for the entree and again it was all delicious. My guest had the sriracha shrimp. It was very flavorful and overall an excellent dish. I will definitely be coming back.

This is one of my go to spots in Union Square.  I never had so many tasty options for kale !  Tonight , I tried the brussels sprout and kale salad, and the chorizo sliders and truffles fries.  All dishes were full of flavor and well balanced.  I love the tiny bit of heat the  chorizo sliders have.
Food is hit and miss but the service is consistently rude and very slow. Today I ordered a wrap which is supposed to come with a side salad. Server said it was not her problem.

I have visited this establishment on multiple occasions it has an amazing happy hour, great drinks and appetizers! What really drove me to write this review was when I brought a client here for dinner, the service was impeccable the owner Kevyn and his lovely wife Kristen (who is the head chef) were so personable and accommodating. My clients were visiting from Milan, Italy and they told me that they had by far the best burger they have ever had since touring the United States. Alex our waitress was very efficient and fast! Her light hearted personalty really brought a great vibe to our experience. Overall Kombu is a hidden gem amongst all the hustle and bustle on Market, if you are looking for an intimate place with great drinks and a beautiful view you have to check this place out!

I was in town on business and had several bad experiences with Blu. I tried Kombu as I heard from San Fran business clients it was very good. Commotion in this town is tough so if they said it was worth it I was willing. Wow is all I can say. The food, the service, the atmosphere. Did I mention the food? Amazing. This place is worth a try. I went back on my next trip. I was equally amazing. Check it out. You won't be sorry. The other reviews sound like a bus boy who's mad. Not worth reading those silly comments.

Last week I came and had a business dinner here. When I first arrived I was immediately seated.by kristi with a big welcome and smile. Our server was amazing and had great reccomendations. Their service was very fast,friendly, and polite.
Perfect spot to stop by after a good workout.

This place is really exceptional. I work out at SCLA and stopped by for dinner during the Giants game. I started with the Sriracha shrimp as an app and it was so yummy, this will be my "go to" from now on. I then ordered the pumpkin gnocchi which was perhaps the best gnocchi I have ever tasted. The bar is fun and inviting as Andrea the bartender is always attentive and on point making sure you never wait for a drink or food. The owners Kristen and Keven are great people who are truly committed to making sure your experience is first class. I highly recommend....

I came here on a whim one night, I live close by so I was excited to give this place a try. From the moment we walked in, we were warmly greeted by the hostess who sat us at the table which I think, had the best view in restaurant overlooking Market street.
Invited to a business lunch. First time there.  Had no idea KK existed. Cool view from 4th floor down Market.  Relaxed.  Good menu. Hip sort of place. Ditto the better reviews below.

With wines like asexual Chocolate and the ability to make beets appealing to an audience otherwise repulsed by the thought of them, how could this place be anything less than amazing!  We came with a good crew, 6 total, and with the intention of having good food while discussing business. We were all beyond satisfied with our meal and our choices.

My partner and I enjoyed dinner at Kombu last night.  I'd looked at Yelp reviews after making the reservation, and there were a number of negative reviews.  To be honest, I was prepared to be disappointed.  Instead, we were treated to a delicious and healthy meal accompanied by attentive and friendly service.

The Paleo burger is amazing!  Had to come back the next night for another burger.  The restaurant is a little hard to find.  It is on the 4th floor next to the gym on Market St.  Owner told me he would work on the signage.  They even have online ordering.  So hard to find paleo friendly food while traveling on business.  Highly recommended!!!

This restaurant is tucked away on the fourth floor of a building in the middle of downtown. From the outside you would never know Kombu exists. My bf and I found this place though a TravelZoo deal. When we arrived we thought the restaurant was very nice and were super excited. It was small with nice modern decor and a great view of downtown! My bf and I were seated right before 8pm and had a window seat. When it came time to order my bf ordered the grilled shrimp entree but we were told they ran out of shrimp. We proceeded to order something else... For drinks, I ordered a Sav Blanc but was told that they ran out of that too. So I ordered a Pinot instead which the waitress skimped and poured me only a half glass.... My bf ordered a Blue Moon, the waitress came back 10 mins later to tell us they were out of Blue Moon too. Our appetizer finally came out 50 mins later!!!!!!! We had ordered the white truffle fries as our appetizer and 50 mins later our waitress comes out with sweet potato fries and tells us they had ran out of the white truffle fries... We did not want the sweet potato fries. They were burnt. I would have preferred if they had given us the option to select a different appetizer item. Overall, this restaurant has a really nice view and nice decor but they have extremely poor management. They were extremely understaffed. Our waitress was pretty much serving the entire restaurant. They apologized and said they were busy due to a large party.... But shouldn't a restaurant be prepared to adequately serve their max capacity?? Did they only prepare to be half full on a Friday night? I am very disappointed in Kombu.  I've never ate at a restaurant that ran out of so many items. I am usually not a tough critic but I don't think Kombu will succeed at the way they are managing right now. I will not be a returning customer.
