i've been to the plant a few times before. i liked the "burger" and had some sort of quinoa salad that was decent (but not amazing). having recently moved offices closer to the plant, i decided to see if it would be a new go-to place to lunch. i picked up the avocado grapefruit salad ($12) and was utterly disappointed. while the ingredients sounded like they might be good together, they do not. arugula/fennel/grapefruit all have bitter undertones and together it was just bitter on bitter. $12 for a bitter salad with not enough dressing and no protein! salads at focaccia (a block away) are much better!

The Tempeh Reuben manages somewhat admirably to make a reuben - that most flavorful of sandwich - nearly flavorless. Each ingredient is de-amplified: sauerkraut without the "sauer," boring 1000 Island, sourdough instead of rye. Likewise, the mixed greens were dressed in nothing but oil.
came by this place to get a quick breakfast while waiting for the bank to open.

The Quinoa Bowl with shrimp made me sick a few weeks ago. Also, I would like someone to look me in the eye while eating the Dino Kale Salad and tell me that they like eating hard kale covered tasteless oil sprinkled with a couple carrot shavings. I've found all entrees (quinoa bowl, teriyaki bowl, and tempeh) very oily.

The food at The Plant is definitely bougie food. It's relatively healthy, everything's organic, pricey, etc. However, they seem to have the most confused staff ever. Last week, I placed an order for pick-up. When I arrived, the cashier searched for my order for a while...only to realize that they had accidentally given my food to someone else. I waited an additional 20 minutes for them to re-make my food. Admittedly, they did give me a coupon for a free smoothie to apologize, but I was in a rush and the extra waiting had made me pretty cranky.

Super good breakfast burritos and yummy blue bottle coffee.  My wait time was kind of long, but worth the wait.  I would say about 5 to 10 minutes.  Not bad considering how busy it was for a thursday mad rush hour.
I made the mistake of trying to get a quick bite during the weekday lunch rush. Merp.
Expensive for very little. The flavors are good but 375 chicken add on was not even 2 oz. probably will not go here often
I work in the fidi, but I don't make fidi money, and reviewing this has to be taken in this context. Because really-Cash rules everything around me.

Worst $4.08 bagel ever.  Almost as bad as the cashier's attitude.  If you don't like being in the service industry GET ANOTHER JOB! Ordered a bagel and cream cheese (which was thrown on in a lump - not spread over the bagel and while the addition of cucumber and tomato was nice, put that information on the menu!!!  This was my third AND LAST time sharing my hard earned cash at The Plant.

I go nuts for all their gluten free options. I love getting a smoothie with a gluten free scone or their green curry or their gluten free bagel egg sandwich. I also did a 3 day juice cleanse which was filling and I felt great afterwards. I'd probably come here everyday if it wasn't so pricy. But I think the prices are worth it for the high quality delicious food.
Loving the protein smoothie. It is delicious!!! Tastes like cookies and cream but has banana, blueberries, your choice of milk (soy), etc.
Yummy tea, got the yin and yang. I liked how bitter and smooth it was. Tasty!
I wish there were more places like these nice Hong Kong Tea Cafes in the city! I'm Chinese-American (Cantonese) and I always wished there were more tasty canto cuisine more readily available!
If you're craving an egg tart and some milk tea, it hits the spot, but it's pretty mediocre fair. Oh well :-(
Pretty underwhelming lunch experience. I didn't expect anything amazing, but I didn't expect to be so disappointed I'd want to write a review, either.
I've passed by this place a dozen times, but it wasn't until I started to work near it that I gave it a second look.

I try to find alternate routes on my morning walks to work so that I can explore a lot more of SoMa and the financial district. I walked by ovo this morning and the inside of the cafe caught my eye. I also saw the words "egg tart" and became instantly intrigued. Since it's not in chinatown, I wasn't expecting a traditional egg tart. It's obnoxious and unfair for people to come in here expecting just that. Since I was expecting a sort of modern/fusion offering of HK cafe style food and snacks, I would say that I was pleasantly surprised. That and GG bakery isn't the same as it used to be, anyway. So let's not compare apples and oranges.

Well, I'll start off by saying that the egg tarts here are nowhere near as good as the ones from Golden Gate Bakery. But they definitely are pretty satisfying, especially without having to make the trek out to Chinatown. They have two different types of egg tarts. One with the traditional flaky crust and one with a buttery cookie crust. Ovo also makes an apple tart, pecan tart, and BBQ pork tart/pie.

The egg tarts are now flaky and warm all the time -- Ovo has figured out the previous issue with keep the crust of the flaky tarts as such. Good job! The HK milk tea is still excellent, although I've found that the afternoon staffer tends to make it sweeter, while the morning one goes easier on the condensed milk -- I like mine on the sweet side, so would suggest that you advise the tea maker on your preference. The cup design is a bit of an issue. I agree with other reviewers that it doesn't insulate well and tends to leak, making walking around downtown with your tea a bit of an adventure. This is a detail that should be fixed and can be taken care of easily.
Food is ok if you are hungry, but not so tasty, packaging reassembling airplane food is not a coincidence.
The last reviewer (Mitch L.) 's comment was candidly said: Ovo cafe was indeed a pleasant surprise.
Went here for the first time today. It was ok. I had the chicken cutlet in the curry eous George sauce with milk tea.
Food is on par with other HK cafes.
Great service but the food is extremely low quality.

First time customer here! Really warm reception by the workers right when I walked through the door. I ordered the tomato chicken with brown rice + a fried egg. Usually this meal comes with a milk tea but since I opted out for the tea, Ovo gave me the egg for free plus another $1 discount! Food was cooked within 5-10 minutes and tasted clean/healthy. Exactly what I wanted. Upon my departure, I got to take home a flaky egg custard tart as a parting gift! W0000t, pretty bomb service :) will definitely be back again!

Pleasantly surprised :) HK café culture runs deep in my roots. Thus, I was happy to have found this little gem so close to the office.  The pork cutlet over brown rice with chili pepper sauce, milk tea, and egg tart combo was more than enough to satiate this craving for familiar "comfort food."

The original and butter egg tarts are good, but not the best I've tried. However, the BBQ pork tart is another question altogether. The crust is light, flakey, and slightly sweet without being dry and the filling is a nice balance of meat and gravy. My mouth is watering thinking about it. I'm just sad that I wasted room in my takeout box (that fits 4 tarts) with anything but the BBQ tart.

Not a bad place to grab a quick snack and coffee.  For under $5 the omelette was delicious and the iced coffee good.  It's got a touch of Hong Kong style to its menu.  One thing.  The menu says sui mai all day, but the cute counter person said it's only available during dinner time.  Owner - update your menu to be accurate.
The food tastes amazing here, especially their sauces. The only bad part is the wait. They only have a few people working in the kitchen (3-5) so the wait can be awfully long.

I had the chicken cutlet with the tang sauce. They gave a good amount of chicken and the overall size of the dish was a fair amount. It wasn't too big, but also wasn't too small. I found the tang sauce to be pretty plain. Next time I will try their curryous George sauce with it.

First off egg tarts are just straight up freaky, but this place was still pretty cool, the manager said we could have 2 flakey egg tarts for $2, they're originally $1.50 so that was pretty nice of him. Catch em on a good day I guess you'll be in luck or whatever if you're into that

This place feels great to be in. The milk tea is amazing! Best ive had it, and ive been to hkg. The food was what was expected and the tarts were on par. Its kind of the chipoltle of hkg cafe fast food. Only thing is that is a little pricey. But hey i guess they got bills and wages to pay.

Rating this place was conflicting. It was a hard decision. But in the end, I believe they deserved 4 stars. However, do note that this is based on my two trips here and only trying the flaky egg tart, pecan tart, iced coffee, and HK style milk tea. I will try their hot meals next time.
food's fine, this is about the "service"
I love HK style cafe food!

$9.79 for a plate of rice, a piece of cold broccoli, four grape sized tomatoes and five hunks of poorly cooked chicken. Really Bad Food, but the service was good I just wished they'd told me not to eat there.
Love their Curry Beef Brisket. I had it twice within 3 days already!

This place is alright. I had their pork cutlet with curry and it was pretty tasty although nothing to rave about.  This is definitely a good lunch option if you work around the area and looking for a quick bite.  I find the value of the meal for what you get to be sufficient.

This place is great! Egg tarts were buttery and delicious, and the milk tea (Ovaltine too) were the best I've had in a while. I also recommend the Sea Salt Coffee. Meal sets are also fresh, not overcooked, and decently priced for a place downtown. All very good. Will be coming back soon.

This place is alright, definitely wouldn't say it was good, but if I have an intense craving for HK milk tea, this place will do. I'm not sure about the entrees, but the pictures itself didn't look too appetizing.

Yeah, this is not good. Even for fast food, it's not good. Even a Quarter Pounder has some merit because it has some semblance to a real burger. The food here looks like what they serve in economy class on an airline that still uses propeller engines. The aluminum tin container certainly evokes that feeling, and even more, the lukewarm food does. It's apparently based on a Hong Kong-style of fast food with a bit of a Chipotle-like approach. You first stare at the overhead menu and decide what meat you want. Then you decide whether you want it over fried rice, brown rice or clearly the obvious choice, spaghetti. Then you decide what trite-sounding sauce you want ladled over it. There's Curryous George, Tang-mato, Firecracklin Pepper and Dreamy Creamy.

I'm sorry, I had to dock one star off. As much as it pains me since you serve the food of my home land. But when you set a certain operational hour, you have to make sure your menu is still available to those who orders. I've been here multiple times now and every single time I try to order the Russian Borscht soup, they always say it ran out. Every, single, time!! For as long as you are open, you should have your items available. I shouldn't be punished with your lack ofs just because I decided not to come during lunch!!
Nice foods. Peper sauce is wonderful.

Since I was hungry, my dad was trying to feed me Subway and I was not having it because Subway upsets my stomach, but we just so happened to pass by OVO Cafe so we stopped, it was perfectly put on a corner, right next to a photography spot and beautiful brick apartment building, I was in love. They have quick service, polite employees, a variety of healthy and filling food. Great fish sticks  Try the Sea Salt Latte and Ovaltine smoothie one time. One thing they are missing is a woman/womyn working there on the weekends. Thank you so much for the food and drinks. I'll be back to visit soon. Take care.
This is the closet to home while on fidi. After my time here, I kept dreaming about coming back for more, so I did.
Ok food, but preposterously understaffed. Takes 10x time for Chipotle. I'm still waiting... Rage guy!!
Cashier was working too slow, causing an unnecessary long line of people waiting. Food was ok.

I came in today with a few co-workers during our lunch break and it didn't have a long line! I ordered the egg tart and milk tea here :) I wanted to order other items off their menu but I already bought lunch for the day :(
Ovo Cafe is an interesting restaurant...  They have curry, egg tarts, and pearl milk tea.  I've tried a number of their dishes, and my favorite is their Chicken Cutlet Katsu with the Fire Curry.

The staff was pleasant and very patient as I had a tough time deciding what to order, everything on the menu looked delicious! I ended up ordering grilled chicken with a spicy curry sauce with fried rice and side of vegetables and an ice milk tea. I also got a free buttery egg tart just by liking their Facebook page! Awesome! Anyway, the restaurant is very clean and cozy. Oh shoot! I've almost reached the character limit so let me just say that the food was delicious!!!! I definitely recommend this place to you guys. Thanks!
Yummmmm...baked rice!  I always had a hankering for baked rice but didn't want to hike it over to ABC Bakery in C-Town for dirty subpar food (yeah they've been steadily declining for years now).

Meh.  I ordered the salmon sandwich and fries.  Nothing really jumped out in terms of taste or decor. Beingin the financial district I expect more out of restaurant/bar. It definitely had a very old 80's feel to it. Service was  so-so. I  use a lot of napkins and I had to ask for additional napkins a the end of my meal. Just something I expect from a server, is to come over and ask if we needed anything else or notice it. Maybe I'm being picky but if the food and atmosphere is very mediocre I expect really great service. Even the host who seated me and my uncle, who I havnt seen for 20 years, sounded like she was just repeating herself with today's special with no enthusiasm. If I come back it'll be for the beer and not to sit in and have a meal. Great location that they should capitalize and fully remodel.

Remember you first trip to Applebees? Was, It enjoyable. It was this is a commerical chain I believe but in the Idea that it was anything like The London style food and drinks. (Its pretty close) I've been to London, and truthfully, It doesn't "Wow" me. The same with this place. Its pretty good when you're hungry, the Sheperd's pie, can barely bring the flock around. I was a little upset, I might give this place a try again....but I will say this, A Long piece of hair was in and or around my Food.

Just had breakfast. Good service, great prices.They leave a carafe of coffee on the table. Great potatoes, not the deep fried ones. Would have 5 stars but I asked for eggs over easy and they came dry.

Do NOT go here for big/corporate events. We order hundreds of dollars worth of food and drinks and they were so unreasonable and unaccommodating when it came to the check. They wouldn't let us use any separate cards. Everything had to go on one card which made payment unnecessarily chaotic for us. As someone who has worked in the restaurant industry before, it's actually not difficult to have separate tabs/checks. It generally results in more tips. As a frequent event coordinator at my company, I will never give them our business again.
It is an ok bar with mediocre food and limited selection of beers. Waitress corrects your english if she does not like the way you are saying something.

I ordered from the hotel we were staying at and they delivered within the the time range they said they would. The items we ordered (the Reuben and The turkey club) were good. My husband said he wished he ordered the Cesar salad, instead of the fries (it is a great, big salad). The price was right on for an american pub. We would go back here,  when we walked by the restaurant the ambiance seemed nice (and that was a Friday night).
Came here on a late Sunday night.  No wait, but there were people enjoying the bar.  I ordered two things - Ale and Onion soup and Long Beach Fish Tacos.

This is a chain bar with locations in Boston and Winnipeg and various other cities. This place is decorated on the edge of public house clique. The food is okay - typical bar hash. The nice part of this bar is that it's nice and big and we came in with a fairly large group and found a handful of tables downstairs that could accommodate our huge drunken group. So, yay for quick bar service and open tables on a Friday night.
Good pub food, good service, decent selection of beers. What more do you need in a pub?
Didn't come here expecting anything. Glad I set my bar low, because it could only go up from here, right?
This was a great place for happy hour for our group of 10+ people. Management was extremely accommodating finding us space and making it an easy experience splitting the tab.
This place has a lot of beers. It's got that going for it. The trivia night is pretty fun if you can get there early enough and find a seat.

Checked out elephant and castle expecting a chain/hotel bar experience. I was pleasantly surprised. The service was fantastic. In particular, the bartender Tara was fantastic. Great conversation and nothing but the best hospitality. This establishment is quite lucky to have her given all the competition in SF.

A bit on the pricy side, but that's to be expected for the neighborhood. What was not expected was it was relatively quiet on a Friday afternoon. Good selection on the beers on tap and a pretty decent selection on the lunch menu.
Great place for burgers--come during off-peak times for fast service!
Danny is the best! Such a great bartender; really made me feel so comfortable. Had a blast at the elephant!

Crazy waitress went nuts when we only gave her a 10% tip. She sucked the service sucked and she was only worth 10% I believe I was being generous she made a big scene and embarrassed the hell out of us. The food was good don't get me wrong but we will never go back there. Absolutely ridiculous

Came here after work for happy hour on a Thursday with friends and was surprised how quiet it was! Had myself a beer on tap and the service was alright. The server was attentive when we were able to get her attention and she looked quite tired / annoyed. Perhaps a long day? Either way, I felt like she was giving us a little attitude. Not sure if I would come here again bc the ambience is a bit quiet and the crowd (when there is one) is geared towards older people. Or maybe I went during an off-day? We left around prime dinner hours and still...not many people.
I love this British pub! It brings me back to fond memories of England. Definitely a must for Anglophiles!
Best poutine in SF!
I have given this place a few more tries and I've had a totally different experience.

Second time here. Once for breakfast and this time for lunch. I got the bacon wrapped meatloaf and it was so good. Makes me want to go back and get more for dinner. If you get a chance, go here and try it.

This place can get busy during happy hour which can be a down fall or a positive depending on why you are going. Large groups are great here. Im not a huge fan of the drink menu and sometimes the table service can lack but that could have been due to the amount of people there. I would come back just for a busy pub experience with coworkers. All in all nothing wrong with this place but nothing amazing either.

I'll be up front right now, the only thing making me give this place 3 stars instead of 2 is the fact that they serve sweet potato fries.  If they didn't, this place would be wither a solid 1.5 or shaky 2. It's a self styled English pub but I don't fucking buy it for one second.  You know why I don't buy its Englishness? They don't serve Guinness warm. GTFO with that cold shit. Guinness is best served warm or tepid. Only Bud and that other piss can be served chilled.

I had breakfast here while on business travel and to be frank, I've had better both in terms of service and food.  When I sat down, I was greeted with "do you know what you want?" - I wasn't offered a menu.

This place feels like a proper pub, and has a great selection of beers and cider on tap.  They also know how to pour a proper Black & Tan, which is surprisingly hard to find at the bars in the City.  The food is just okay, though.  Nothing really jumps out as being that good on the menu.  The staff has always been pleasant when I've been there, and it is very conveniently located in the Financial District for after work gatherings.

We stayed the the La Meridian, so it was very convenient that Elephant and Castle was right across the street. I was kinda skeptical because of the mixed reviews and the concierge didn't mention them... But they had 3 stars and their health score was 100/100, so we said what the hell... Plus we were all wearing jeans and hoodies so, we couldn't go try Tadich Grill. Sounds casual but it was pretty fancy inside.
Not busy but OK for a Weds night. Bartenders couldn't care less about your drinks. Fair prices but poor service
That Mac and Cheese is the bomb. Also I go there during lunch and the barkeeps are pretty friendly too :-)

We made a reservation for lunch, not knowing and not being told, that it was the first day of the World Cup. We were shoehorned into an awkward table and the noise level was beyond ear splitting.  The service was so bad, the manager finally comped us our meal, which didn't arrive until more than an hour after we ordered it.

Food was decent for an irish pub. Truffle potao chip must tryb once at least. Come by when there's a Futbol game and get the special for it. Nothing really stand out or got my attention for food wise.

Chain that serves English style food with some Indian influence. It's World Cup time so most of the TVs were on that but on the lone non-soccer TV, I couldn't understand why they had NASCAR rather than Giants. The food items (Shepherd's Pie and Chicken Pot Pie) were pretty good but not that notable. The service was friendly but a little absent during the midpoint of the meal. If this place was in Dublin (California. Not Ireland) I'd give it 4 stars but for SF, you have to raise your game a bit.
There is a reason I try to avoid chain restaurants, and E&C is a great example of why.
Food was pretty good. Got the nacho appetizer. By the time my Steak and mushrooms came out I wasn't too interested in getting into them.
Had a Slum Dog with poutine, and a Boddington's: a slightly above average meal. Nice server, just reaaaaaaly slow (it didn't seem that busy).

I would rate the Elephant & Castle as a solid 3.5, but I'll round up instead of down because there wasn't too much to complain about, and to balance out the many reviews here that focus on irrelevant factors. The service was good and the food was solid. This place is an unapologetic pub, so if you go there for fine dining, you need to re-evaluate your criteria. The food was good--we had a burger and a veggie burger, both of which were quite nice. The wine was good, the noise was not overwhelming, and the decor was nothing to write home about, but not filthy or offensive in any way. Keep your expectations realistic and you'll be pleasantly surprised by the Elephant & Castle.
Pretty standard Irish Pub.
Waitress took our order. 30 minutes later came to inform us our ticket got lost. Order finally came out wrong and the pot pie had way too many mushrooms and the crust was under cooked.

We stayed at Le Meridien right next door and saw this pub right out of our window. We were quite hungry so we figured we would take a shot. It wasn't very busy so no one was attentive to us walking in and standing there waiting to be seated.
the best burger i have ever ever had.in my 27 years of life!!!! it's also hella chill and in a safe location in the sf financial district. love it omgggg

Don't get the meatball sandwich here - I think they use the meatballs from Costco, not the kind made from scratch like at other Vietnamese sandwich shops. Pretty disappointed as I'm eating it right now.
Good to-go lunch spot.  Prices are very competitive for the area, and the portions are decent.  I normally order the meatball banh mi, and if I'm really hungry grab a pork bun too.  Cash only.
The Nicest couple ever operate this little shop. Between Grant and Kearny on Market St, you might miss it if you blink. I recommend... Everything.
The Chinese old man has no manner. People need to learn how to treat customer right. Is a "thank you" so hard to say? I said have a good day! Learn from Japan ok?

Pretty yummy bagel for the price. I usually get egg,cheese, tomato on jalapeño or poppy seed. It's strangely difficult to find a bagel sandwich within a two block radius of where I work so this spot does the trick. Their naked juices can be a little over priced but overall it's a reasonably placed establishment. The owners are both really sweet, especially the woman who's usually there in the morning. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for something quick, cheap and tasty.

Love this hole in a wall shop with a mom and pop feel to it. Seems like two couples owning and running the place. Customer service: excellent! They couldn't get more personable as I stopped by to order and they knew the other customers and their past orders.

Awesome lil' I mean lil' place. The owners are stuffed behind a 4x4 working space and they just pump out the ban mi's like no tomorrow.  My friends and I got in and out in 4 minutes but it was after 2pm. Support local small businesses!!! Yeah :^)
One of my favourite places to get a quick lunch - spring rolls with fish sauce Linda is always so sweet and customer service is great !

Yeah, Oakland and the East Bay will spoil you rotten on the subject of good Asian cuisine, especially of the Southeast variety. I've been back to working in the city for a year now, and even now it's hard to temper my expectations in terms of the price:quality ratio for Viet and Thai (it even feels like the Burma Superstar in the city is pricier/more crowded than the one here in Noakland). So it should come as no surprise that there was a solid 2-3 month disconnect between my seeing Cafe Dolci, and actually being mentally prepared enough to buy one Banh Mi for 5.50.

I'm a big fan of bánh mì sandwiches, and was thrilled to find a place in downtown that makes delicious tofu ones.  The tofu was expertly prepared and carrot radish salad incredibly fresh and flavorful.

The sandwiches were good but overpriced for a Vietnamese sandwich (around $5-$7). Cafe is extremely small and they're only opened limited hours. They also only take cash which may be inconvenient for some.
Quick, cheap and delicious. $7 for a banh mi with grilled pork and pate. Friendly man working here as well!
Banh Mi Dac Biet and Cafe Sua Da!

I am big fan of Vietnamese Subs. So i went to this place to try out. The place is as small as a closet. The sub is cheap, just $5.50 for a 7" sandwich. The sub was tasty but nothing extraordinary. I have had better ones in Financial District neighborhood. The primary ingredient tofu was not marinated to give it a good flavor plus the carrots juliennes was too thick for my taste.
I loved the Banh Mi here. Tried the grilled pork with added pate. The bread was perfectly fresh and crispy on the outside. The lady who works there is awesome. The price can't be beat.

I'm on a quest to find the cheapest lunch spots near 4th & Mission (poor student here, who is too lazy to get up early & pack a lunch). This place is in the running. When I went after class at 1:30, there was no line, so I was in and out in about 2 min. I got the spring rolls. They had 4 kinds: pork, shrimp, and pork & shrimp, and tofu. The pork rolls were tasty, big, and filling, and with the Coke I didn't really need, the total price was about $6 and some change. The people who run this place are so friendly, too.

There's definitely room for improvement.  I grew up in a highly populated Vietnamese community so my standard for a Vietnamese sandwich is a lot higher than the average folks.  I give props to the lady running the place.  She definitely is very very sweet and I would recommend this place to anyone looking to get a cheap Vietnamese sandwich in the area.
Awesome hole in the wall for take out lunch. $6 for 3 huge and delicious vietnamese spring rolls + peanut sauce. Yet to try the bahn mi but heard it's really good too.

I was shocked to see how small the shop was. I guess that's pretty typical in the city life- shows what I know as a suburban girl. Don't come here expecting to sit down. I ordered my food and went to the food court, in the Westfield mall to eat :)
The pork sandwhich was fresh & delicious! The lady making the sandwhich was so sweet! It felt like my aunt was making the sandwhich for me :)
i got a delicious banh mi (vietnamese sandwich) with ham and pate. it's a good sized sandwich with lots of great pickled veggies. reasonably priced at $6.50.

Decent roast pork banh mi for $5.30 in downtown. How do they keep it that low? By cutting back on the meat like lots of other places, it seems. The veggies are the usual (slivers of carrots, radish and cilantro, with jalapeno for that spicy kick). Also, the pork buns that you can buy here (steamed or baked) apparently come from chinatown. The lady behind the counter was super friendly; she's been making these sandwiches for something like 15+ years?! Anyway, not a bad spot for a quick fix if you avoid the lunch crowds.

Love this place! Stayed in SF union square for about a week, and tried a bunch of local eats. This place turned into my go to for a quick and inexpensive bite to eat. I tried the veggie tofu sandwich, which was yummy. Mainly I got hooked on their breakfast bagel sandwich. Really well done. bagels are delish! Chai is absolutely amazing! No seating. Grab to go, but there is a close park nearby. Cash only, but ATM next door. Nice owners. Definitely recommend.
They have great vegetarian banh mi, and a friendly couple working behind the counter.  They take cash only.
I've been having spring roll cravings recently and in my Yelp search for spring rolls in the FiDi, I came across Dolci. I decided I would give it a try.

Literally a hole in the wall - not in bad shape, in good shape, but closet sized inside.  you step in and order, then step out and wait.  But a good sandwich given the pint-sized prep area inside.  Good roast pork sandwich with generous flavors and veggies and very good bread.
The best spring rolls I've had in a while! I also ordered a grilled pork sandwich which was also delicious but the spring rolls are what I'm still craving for.

This is the epitome of a hole-in-the-wall. The door to the back of the "room" is no more than 5ft, and the couple working the place have maybe 4sqft to maneuver themselves. It may be unsuitable for a prison cell, but you can get a damn good and affordable FiDi lunch.

Dolci is seriously cute and seriously good. I had a wonderful grilled pork sandwich and the price was fantastic. Granted, this is my first time eating a bahn mi, so I don't know if it's like the best in the city or anything, but I liked this enough to want to eat it again. And then once more for good measure.
GREAT grilled pork Bahn Mi sandwich. They have a variety of sandwich types. I'm sure they're all good.

This little cafe is easy to breeze by on the busy market street, if it weren't for the lunch time crowd gathered outside. I stopped by impulsively after craving a breakfast sandwich way into the afternoon. Not only did they still serve breakfast, it was fast and uhh-maay-zing! While I was waiting the workers explained that they were husband and wife and had been working in the cafe for 12 years! How can you not take a little romance with your egg sandwich?! Give it a try its yum yum yum.

Cafe Dolci is literally a hole in the wall similar to Little Saigon Deli. The primary differences are in the sides offered (I like the Chinese sausage stick rice!) and the variety of drinks including a fresh mango tapioca drink.
Love the huge chicken steamed buns.

Cafe Dolci's Banh Mi is as authentic as it gets.  The ingredients are as fresh and tasty as in Vietnam.  I have tried many other Banh Mi places and have to say this tiny enclave of cultural honesty turns out outstanding food.  All the reviewers who spoke of the smell might as well order bologna sandwiches.  In all the years I have eaten at Cafe Dolci, I have have never seen a pre-made sandwich.  They also make the best Cafe Sua Da (iced Vienamese coffee.

I am pretty sure they gave me an old sandwich the last time I went. The first time I went I would have given them 4 stars, it was good at a good price. This last time, the sandwich was old, I am positive it was sitting there for awhile, I should have returned it but I had already walked back to the office & started to eat it. No thanks.
It has been a hot day, and I thought a banh mi sounded really good for lunch. I really wanted to like Cafe Dolci, but it turned out to be just okay.

There are certain things I like to eat when I'm by myself so no one will judge me. So, right up there with bugles and squeeze cheese, I place Cafe Dolci's grilled pork banh mi. Unfortunately, I learned this lesson the hard way. It's the smelliest banh mi I've ever eaten, but it's really effing good.
I got the chicken banh mi sandwich for $6.50. unfortunately it kinda sucked. The bun was barely toasted and was light with the meat.

The fried rice take-away at Cafe Dolci probably isn't as good as the bahn mi.  At least I hope it's not.  The fried rice was stuck together, smelled vaguely fishy, and left me feeling overfull after just a few mouthfulls.

This is an affordable place for banh mi and spring rolls. It's nice because there aren't too many places in the area that offer this. However it is really, really slow! The place is really tiny with nowhere to sit and it can take the owners quite awhile to get your order ready. I suggest only going when you're not in a hurry.

I order this fried catfish sandwich and I just have to say, its delicious. The red curry wasn"t that spicy but it gave it a nice flavor. I was disappointed on the "Salt n Pepper fries" on the menu it states theres salt , pepper, onion, jalapenos n garlic. I do see the jalapenos and onions but no pepper. I like how it taste like spicy fries but no garlic flavor. Compare it to Super Duper Garlic fries, there's a big diff. I also notice the fries on the middle towards the bottom were soaked with oily. I would only get sandwiches from.

Hmm...those whole in the wall Vietnamese sandwich places may seem less trendy, but they know what they are doing...There is a science to making a simple Vietnamese sandwich. I walked by this place on Market and thought it had a nice modern, trendy interior. I decided to try the fried catfish sandwich and it was just okay, but not amazing. It was missing something. Anybody can put pickled vegetables, cilantro, and some meat in a bun. Was it even a Vietnamese sandwich after all? I also got a fountain drink lemonade. I would come back and eat here again because it's pretty good.

This new Vietnamese sandwich shop looks very trendy from outside, and always lines outside during lunch hours. But the sandwiches are so mediocre, nothing special. My friend and I both tried juicy steak, it was not that juicy, just plain.

Omg my hacker bowl with roasted pork was beyond delicious. I am obsessed. The mix of textures and flavors was extremely appealing. And they gave me a UCSF discount Run don't walk. Swoon. (WHY DOES THIS SCORE SO LOW!?)

As someone who enjoys banh mi and ate it frequently when I lived in Vietnam, I really was rooting for Bun Mee. I appreciate that they allow you to add a hardboiled egg, but it is hard for me to give a more positive review of the food when they messed up my order. Even though I ordered the belly bun without cucumber or cilantro, which I said twice for confirmation, I got a sandwich with both. I understand that they can get busy at lunch time, but when the prices are 2x of other places offering the same thing... It was disappointing to discover I didn't get what I wanted once I was back at my desk.

This place is always crowded at lunch...and for good reason! If you can spare the time it takes to wait in line, you gotta try the pork belly sandwich and definitely add the hard boiled egg option. Pretty much blew my mind, I was hooked
Food was good.
I really wanted to be blown away by Bun Mee, but its an OK place to go for lunch. I went during lunch time so it was a bit crowded, but finally a seat opened up!

I literally have now come here 6 days in a row. Their service is nice, it's fast, it's fresh it's tastes good. I get the Saigon peanut bowl when I want rice and the bun bowl when I feel like noodles. Add steak ! It's tender. Decor is super hip and for a market restaurant it's not so crowded that you want to kill yourself. I'm a fan.

I'm beginning to think people on yelp have no idea how to review and what to review. This place is amazing. The food is so fresh and incredible. I'm very selective about rice and meat dishes because I'm Persian but this definitely hits the spot. I'm more on a health mission so i got the Peanut Bowl and it's perfect. The steak isn't the juiciest steakhouse steak but it's fine for a rice bowl. They use a bunch of vegetables and give a hefty portion. Minus 1 star because the meat could be better. The staff Is also really really nice which is always such an awesome thing to add to any dining experience.

Definitely mediocre banh mi. Prices are extremely expensive for what it is (but maybe because I'm used to socal dirt cheap prices). I went during a kind of odd hour and they had happy hour! I got their combo banh mi. It was okay. BBQ pork with a slice of ham(what...) and pate. Customer service was ehhhh. There were two people standing in front of the register and I was waiting to be served and they were just both saying how they both clocked out...uhh okay can I take my order from someone else then? Anyway I don't think I would come here again. Just to try! Nothing great though

The food was good but the service was TERRIBLE.  First off, I placed an online order, even receiving a confirmation of my order.  I go to pick up my order 2 hours later and it was downhill from there.  The lady at the register was beyond rude, accusing me of not placing an order with them, perhaps I was suppose to pick up at their other location, perhaps my card was declined.  Nope, all was good on my end.  It was their system that failed.  Finally, after shoving my email confirmation in her face, she makes my order (taking her freaking time).  30 minutes later, I finally had my food.  To add insult to injury, you lose my order, take 30 minutes to make a coupla sandwiches (which were good, but definitely over-priced, and not served with any kind of graciousness), and then charge me for a bigger bag.  All in all, I will be taking my business elsewhere.  There are plenty of banh mi joints in the city that will feed me great food, while not treating me like shit.

An absolute disappointment.  I was really looking forward to this place as my coworker just told me she thought it was pretty good. Craved it all day. I leave my house early and head over before work. Luckily there is nobody there and i order right away. I order the bun bowl. I wait about five minutes before they tell me they have no noodles and it will be 20 minutes. I have not twenty minutes to wait so they refunded me and I left. Hungry, with no time to eat before work. I get hangry at work and convince my manager to let me break before they close at 8. I go back. Again nobody is there. I walk to the register and am not acknowledged by either of the two people behind the counter for moments ling enough to make me mad. Finally the girl looks at me and then at the guy counting the register @ 730. So I speak up and tell them I'm back and want to try them again and they tell me they have no noodles still. No apology, nothing.

I've been meaning to try this place and after a long day of work I figured I'd treat myself to a sando. Stopped in and instantly was drawn in by the decor; Awesome modern wallpaper and cool dangling lights. Also playing was some seriously funky hip hop and r&b, which got me in a great mood after being stuck at a cube all day. *insert sprinkler dance here*
For a sandwich it was ok for a Bahn mi it was terrible.
When lunch time rolls around, this place is hopping. The line tends to move quick though. Their crispy tofu sandwich is prettyyy good though. The chocolate coconut cookies are so yummy!
Ban mi's should be quick and easy. I stepped into Bun Me for a quick pit stop and waited 20 minutes for my mediocre sandwich.

I've never been to this location but I took my friend out for lunch at around 11:30am and no lines! She ordered the crispy tofu banh mi and I ordered the crispy catfish sandwich with red mango curry sauce topped with an egg. We forgot to order fries and ice coffee but definitely a must buy to pair. Their strawberry lychee drink is also refreshing and light to pair with everything. This location is bigger than the Fillmore store and a lot more tables to enjoy your food. They also have sriracha sauce onevery table which definitely makes me love this place even more! Come for a banh mi and let your mouth do all the reviewing!

I was traveling on business for Oracle Open World.  This is located across the street from the Palace Hotel, where a bunch of my sessions were held.  My box lunches were such a hassle and ordeal and just totally unappealing that I told myself I was going to treat myself to an awesome lunch to make up for it.  Bun Mee did not disappoint!

Expensive. Nearly 7 dollars for *just* the sandwich. Only things I remember about it was that there wasn't a huge amount of veggies and the bread was super hard, possibly stale and reheated. The strawberry lychee drink was good. The music was obnoxiously LOUD.

[context] I grew up with Vietnamese food and only in the last few days have I really started enjoying it. I've had amazing spring rolls and I just learned how to make them myself yesterday night from my mom. To be fair, this review is only for the Summer rolls.
No, thanks.

So went here for lunch and the line was out the door. So I asked one of the servers how long it would take to order. Will was his name, and he made a bet with me if I wasn't at the front within 10 minutes, he'd pay for my food.
Food is decent, but CHECK YOUR ORDER CAREFULLY!

This is my new favorite lunch spot to go to when I'm at work. It's usually pretty crowded but it never ceases to amaze me how quickly the line moves and how quickly you get your food. I always get the saigon peanut rice bowl with chicken and it's sooo good. I've gotten the sandwich before too, but I'm obsess with the rice bowl.
Juicy Steak and Salt 'n' Pepper Garlic Fries w/ Limonata! Sounds good yeah?! Actually the bread/roll was the best part (key to a good Bánh mì)
FIRST IMPRESSIONS

WOW!!! This is the best place in town! You can't go wrong with any items on the menu, hoping they set up another shop in Marin! Great service as well! Try there pork and shrimp summer roll, and there 5 spice chicken salad!

I am not into hipster type places. So that is why I will give this a 3 because it was just "A-ok." The 5 spice chicken Vietnamese sandwich was very flavorful. The chicken was real good. This place is in the financial district, it got real packed quickly so try and go early. The workers were nice, small place and seems clean.  Yes, I would go here again, but only if I am in the area. I can get an authentic Vietnamese sandwich for $3.50 in the TL and not pay techie hipster prices of 7.50 a sandwich :-)

I was trying to decide between the lemongrass pork and the pork belly, ended up asking the 2 cashiers; 1 said pork belly, the other said lemongrass..not good answers for the indecisive person I can sometimes (all the time) be.  I ended up getting the lemongrass pork since it's their number 1 seller.

I went here for lunch and this place is fantastic!  The catfish sandwich was delicious, really amazing food!  Very cool decor, great atmosphere and the blonde manger was very helpful.  Highly recommend!

I know BunMee's from Hamburg. There is only one place, and i never heard about that before. It's operated by two germans that love vietnam. If you ever get there look out for a place called Nananamai.

Awesome place, and has turned into my go-to spot for lunch.  The bun noodle bowl is filling and super tasty, maybe even healthy too.  The fries are a must even though they may not be healthy, but fries are never on the doctors recommended list.  The atmosphere is fun, and they are quick and consistent every time I've been so 5 stars it is!

I am Vietnamese so I had the sandwiches plenty of time. BUT...this place is hella over priced. $7 for a sandwich. It is almost triple (maybe double the price for SF), of regular Vietnamese sandwich spots. Size is probably 1/4 smaller than regular. The only thing I can say good about this is...the meat is seasoned very well. But they also give you hella daikon, carrots, cilantro and peppers. Most Vietnamese spots have like 60% meat in the sandwich. But the sandwich seems to be less than half meat. I give it 3 just because the meat was good if youre into that.

I ordered online went to the shop for pickup and was ignored for 10mins. When I finally got the attention of someone I was told my order wasn't ready. Finally 20 mins later I got my order. Open the box of egg rolls to find then burnt.  Between the poor service and burnt food I say skip it.

Best sandwiches!! But the chef with the buck teeth is a fuckin RUDE as muthafucka!! Thats why this location only gets 3 stars!!! BEST believe I ALWAYS have good judgement when it comes to customer service...I work with patients & their health needs everyday!
Wait, what?  I have visited the Pac Heights location so many times, what happened?

Went here with some co-workers for the first time and ended-up splitting a Lemongrass Pork and a Belly Bun with a hard boiled egg.  I enjoyed both, but definitely preferred the Belly Bun.  It was a bit more moist (mostly due to the fat on the pork belly), but the flavor was really good.
Wicked good vegan options. Crispy tofu is the fave, but sometimes I do the eggplant and sub vegenaise. Reasonably priced for the hood, and quick service. Also: sweet fries. Sweet. Fries. Hot damn.
Love love love this place. Right next to my office. Healthy and perfect during the chilly days
The wraps are tasty.  Good if you are short on time and need something quick.  Sometimes they can mess up the order and give you something else but I deal with it.
2.5 STARS
Had the quinoa bowl with lemongrass chicken. Excellent taste and good portion so overall a great value for my $10.
Healthy, delicious, and best quick/cheap breakfast option in the Union Square / Financial DIstrict area.
Healthy and delicious.

It's Vietnamese, but it's a weird chain...Don't expect great PHO experience if that's the reason why did you come... Noodles are more like spaghetti with a weird taste, they use metal spoons instead of classic Asian deep spoons. Broth itself is nice, however the overall experience is damaged by the factors I have mentioned above.
There was no line and service was quick. I had the chicken pho soup and loved all the wonderful flavors.

I'm sorry Urban Picnic, but there's nothing very great about you. You may be a very nicely designed colourful place with clean tables and nice seating in a conveniently placed area where business is bustling about, but you don't know how to do Vietnamese food right. Prepare for a harsh but honest review:
It was a poorly made and painfully spicy sandwich. Do not ever go here !! I made a mistake to step in here.

I stopped in here for lunch today and ordered the roast pork banh mi. I should've listened to my gut and left. Not only was it overpriced at $8.50 (cuz typically banh mi sandwiches should really be under $5 at a real Vietnamese place), it wasn't even authentic.

It was okay, not amazing.  I think I got my expectations up too high with their 10 best kale salads rating.  I mean, it was a kale salad, what can I say?  I also had a sandwich -- the turkey bacon avocado, and it was a good Vietnamese sandwich.  The decor was very white and plastic.  I would go there again, for lunch but not dinner, if I come back to San Francisco again.

This, friends of San Francisco, is my first review on Yelp.  And what has compelled me to pull myself out amongst the ranks of Yelp lurkers and onto the screen?  Two of the worst Bahn-mi's that i've ever had.  The two stars is some left over good spirits for some residual good feeling i felt for the old guy who served me with a smile.
Disgusting.  The staff was rude, the cafe was a mess. Seven bowls were left on the tables, unbussed.  I asked for some sauce and I got sarcasm as a response.  I will NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN.
I think 3-Stars is about right.
Only got the simple combo which is a bowl of pho broth and a small side salad. Those were decent, but kind of hard to screw up something that basic.
I have bad eyesight.

Appreciate that maybe the more traditional Vietnamese offerings might have been the way to go, but the Sriracha chicken sandwich was very underwhelming. It was flavorless with not even a hint of spice, had unappetizing looking chicken, and came with guacamole instead of avocado as listed on the menu (I know, this is me being picky).
as long as you stick with the green juice, the chicken pho and the kale/quinoa salad, you will be pleased.

I have been meaning to yelp about this place for a while.  They have one of the best breakfast options I have found in the FiDi.  Our entire office loves their egg wraps and egg bowls and they are super healthy.  We eat here at least a couple times a week and it is always consistently good.
WOW! Appealing, healthy and oh so good
Loved the 5 spice vegetarian protein soup! Probably would have liked to have less salty soy protein chunks..too salty, but overall very tasty!
Over-priced food and poor customer service.

First time here, looking for a good value salad in the FiDi (is there such a thing?!), and I was disappointed. By the time you add protein, it's over $10... Add avocado and a tip, and you're at $14 - which better be a great salad. I got the kale and quinoa - Unfortunately the dressing was not balanced and tasted flat, there were only 3 cherry tomatoes in there, and plain boring tofu (not grilled, not narinated) just chucked on top. Finally, there was nothing Vietnamese about this salad - isn't that meant to be the concept here??

Went here because it was closest to the bridal shop which was the reason for the trip to the City. The food is pricey and bland. They don't seem to make any effort at all to give you a good tasting or complete meal. But I am writing this review because of the poor service. I am sure that Urban Picnic pays very high rent, and it is very convenient when you are looking for something quick to eat and you're in the neighborhood. However, I feel the people who run this place, instead of valuing their customers, take advantage of their location, and the consequential high traffic and abundance of customers, and disrespect the people who are paying them for their products. Wise up owners, and value your customers. Being polite and appreciative will make everyone's day a little brighter, including your own.
Love the clean bahn mi Sammie's here but today no one even greeted me as I stood there like a mook waiting and waiting and waiting to order.

If you're looking to get skinny this is the place, because you won't want to finish your food as it's gross and over priced. Then to finish it off, you'll find your self throwing up from food poisoning.
Cool twist on typical Viet restaurant. Quick and decent spot close to my work. Bit pricey. But pretty tasty.
I'm going to keep this super short cause that is all that it deserve. I was hungry in downtown where there are lines out the door everywhere so I went here. It got me full. The end.
Many things on the menu are labeled 'Superfood'. What is superfood, exactly?
Biggest ripoff in san francisco.
Their food is bland and their staff is rude. But hey, if you like the taste of plain rice noodles, then this is the place for you!

I work a block away and came here just to try something new but the food is extremely mediocre compared to the other nearby options. I know the ingredients are organic but it is still overpriced. I will not be back.
Disclaimer: I had heard of "banh mi" but had no freakin' clue what it was. Still don't, really.
Mediocre food and lack luster service.  Had the ban mi and slaw which were only so s, but the service was not good.  Time to try another place and you should as well.
WARNING:  Food Safety Concerns!!
I had the veggie protein quinoa bowl  it has a variety of mixed vegetable and quinoa. And it is very delicious.

Love their kale quinoa salad which is substantial, has a delicious dressing, and is covered with nori, almond slices etc to add flavor and texture.  Also enjoyed their kale and Ginger juice.  Their sandwiches look pretty good too.

Mehhhh... Don't think I'll be coming back. The staff here isn't to friendly. They weren't that busy when I came in yet I didn't get hello or a hi can help you nothing from the cashier was a tad nervous about even approaching the scowl faced woman at the register lol. That aside I ordered the Bahn mi lemongrass chicken wrap....it was ok. It was cold and overall not that great. I'll give them a star for the shiracha aioli that was good. With the organic options in the city I don't think this is a place I'll be returning too. There is many better options out there.

The Kale and quinoa salad is so yummy and healthy! I added tofu and with some jalapenos and sriracha it is so good. A bit pricey but really convenient if you don't have time to make something this good at home!
Meh.
Ramen here is pretty good!

Sushi spot inside Temple night club. So weird to eat at place I used to frequent years ago, when Temple was the spot. Before they stopped caring about a dress code. Before it became a rave complete with glow stick yielding 21 year olds. Not that I like dress codes, or love glow sticks--it's just an observation of times a-changin'. Man, I sound old. But back to the food.

Every time I walk in the doors of Temple, I expect to see about a thousand Asian women all dolled up in four inch stilettos, packs of white dudes hitting on them, and then roving packs of wasted people looking to hook up with one another.
Surprisingly good ramen!
Dropped by this restaurant since it's less than a block away from my office in SF.  The place is definitely going for the "modern" feel, which I like.

I have never, ever had a better plate of chicken wings anywhere.  Amazing recipe.  Black sesame seed encrusted chicken wings with other spices.  Who would have thought that you should visit a Japanese restaurant just for their wings?  Well, you should.  But I don't see it on their online menu.  Maybe it was a special or something.
Came here with my coworkers yesterday for lunch because we really wanted some sushi. We ended up here -- and were the first people to be there.
4 different meals here, all overpriced, and just not that yummy.

My friend and I came here once before during the evening right before club time on a Thurs. They had awesome yummy buckets of calamari and the sushi was delicious! We went there today for lunch because we aren't from San Francisco and we were craving their buckets of Calamari, but to our disappointment they don't do Calamari. We ordered four rolls:
ONLY and I repeat ONLY reason it wasn't 5 star is because we stood at the front with the sign "wait to be seated" for a while all alone, not sure what to do.
Pretty innovative rolls, but it was pricey. The mackerel roll wasn't very good but all of the fish was fresh. Even with the Groupon I think I spent $40!

I've eaten here 4 or 5 times and never had any bad experiences. Great service. Great happy hour drinks and beers on draft. Fair prices. Love the happy hour handrolls. I come here with friends after work or before a movie at the Metreon.

So I am still on the quest to search for a solid sushi joint within SF.... I know some of you are saying are you kidding me? How can it be difficult to find a solid joint in SF? I have no idea. Please help.
Ki doesn't Kick.
I'm still giving this place a tentative four stars, but half the time I call to place a to-go order, no one picks up. That's super perplexing to me. Yes, I'm calling during business days/hours :)

Wow! Shocked anyone could not love this place. I guess if you go in hating it already and are a f*cktard! Then I get not loving it. So DISCLAIMER!! Go to KI if you ARE NOT a douchebag primadonna sh*thead ONLY!
After not writing any reviews for months, my terrible experience here compelled me to come out of Yelp hibernation in order to warn my fellow Yelpers.

Absolutely excellent food, and an ever changing and delicious cocktail list. Their menus light up when you open them, which is pretty cool. The staff is consistently kind and patient, they also make a strong effort to remember the regulars. Don't be thrown off by the night club "Temple" or the somewhat empty SoMa streets around it. The food and service are more than worth it.
Ki is great, I've been twice. The food is always delicious and their atmosphere is really modern.
Understated place with a side of pretentiousness.

I would have never thought of attempting to try out this place simply because it is located inside the Temple club and very easily overlooked from the outside.  I heard about this place through a friend and we grabbed lunch here!
This is a great Friday night date night location.  It's kinda clubby in the restaurant, with it's Michael Jackson's, Billy Jean lit wall all of lights.

Came for a friend's bday dinner (then went dancing at Temple). The Lotus Drop drink was pretty good and the sushi roll I had (Geisha) was not bad either. Decent for a restaurant associated with a club...
Their calamari was good. Their sushi rolls are alright... It's a small space. It's a not a place I'd go for sushi though. I'd rather check out elsewhere... Service is great though.

Ki's man focus is sustainable sushi. If you don't know what that is, look it up... it's interesting and certainly commendable. I walk by all the time and decided to venture in. After my first visit, I was smitten! I've been back nearly 20 times in the past several months. Shane and Shelby are the BEST wait staff. They never disappoint and always make me feel like family. Osama was the chef but he moved on, leaving behind many great dishes created by him. I've had the bento box and the ramen a few times but I mainly go for the sushi. Wacky combinations like the Fish & Chips, How Weird and the Pink Flamingo. Each dish is artfully arranged, like the Geisha Roll... it's almost too beautiful to eat! Love the way the Spicy Lobster roll is presented... I think I just found another use for my tealight holders! The Tofu-nagi is unbelievable... you don't even know you're not eating real unagi! Osama even made some sushi out of the tender insides of a coconut. I was hesitant because I expected a coconut flavor but there was none and the texture was just like a slice of sashimi. HEAVEN! As I mentioned, I visit (again and again) for the sushi. It's the best in the area. The ambiance is a little strange because it's attached to a nightclub but they keep that part curtained off. Peter, the manager, is always accommodating and often let's me try new beer he orders. If you're in the area, it's well worth the stop and the prices are so reasonable!

I came here for lunch on a Thursday. I had heard great things about this place, but my lunch experience was horrible. I first waited about 10 minutes in the lobby before someone came out from behind the curtains to seat me (they have these strange huge black curtains blocking the bar and dining area, with a "Please Wait To Be Seated" sign in front. For lunch, really?). Per my request, I was seated at the bar, which was filthy. Food remnants abound, and puddles of liquid. It was eventually mopped up, but only after I was sitting there for several minutes.
The Amberjack was delicious.  They focus on Sustainable Sushi.
hot sake at happy hour was fun but sushi did not taste fresh. music was depressing. went there for price range but I learned u gotta go for higher dollar signs if you want fresh sushi.

Kind of a sketch spot as it's located right next to a night club, but inside you'll find an ultra modern little Japanese restaurant and sushi bar. The decor is a little overly modern (kind of Geisha-housey, if you've been there in LA), but very clean and not uncomfortable.
Gross. I went to Ki today with a friend because he wanted Japanese. Most of the Japanese places in the area showed 1.5-2.5 stars, so Ki looked promising with its higher rating.

Pretty decent sushi. The Real California Roll was a bit of a disappointment for us, kind of bland, though the lil berries on top were cool. The alt rock n roll was good if you like it a little sweet, and the weird roll was definitely weird but I'd get it again. The Yerba Buena was pretty but average. Meanwhile, the decor is chic and noticeable, and the waitstaff was slow. Overall? Meh, I'd go again if inbthe neighborhood or had a groupon. Wouldn't recommend it to a friend as a great place to eat. However, props for the sustainability factor ( the only serve sustainably harvested fish) and the free entrance to connected "Temple nightclub".
Surprisingly good for a restaurant inside of Temple. Been there twice in the past month and the food has been very good both times.

Really weird atmosphere, really mediocre food, and surprisingly high prices. If we had walked out of here having spent only $50 for 2 people, we might have let it slide, but for $90 we were baffled. We didn't eat everything because some of it was so weird and we thought we were playing it pretty safe with meat skewers, edamame and a couple rolls. By 'meat sampler' they really meant chicken sampler, offering a chicken kidney, red meat, white meat and chicken skin on various sticks. The chocolate dessert was, however, exceptional (if slightly too big).
A 4 got pushed up to a 5 star rating because of the sustainable menu.  Finally a place that actually limits their menu to sustainable (truly sustainable, not just "farmed") fish.

This restaurant was located inside Temple Nightclub, and was rather small. The initial hostess were friendly, but our server wasn't nor was the service provided good. I only give them two stars because their service was lack there of. We were seated next to a table that arrived after us, and their server had told them of the specials of the night while ours did not. We also were not greeted with a "thank you" as we left, something that I appreciate when I dine somewhere. Makes me feel a little better inside for giving them my business.
Best calamari ever :) each piece fried to perfection. Will definitely come again
This place is OK.  Kind of pricey, but not really worth it for what you get.  The fish and chips roll was awesome, kind of a cool twist/good idea, and worked wonders on my taste buds.
Vegans rejoice!

Went here for a bachelorette party dinner with a group of my friends. Ironically we were the only people in there, because this place had awesome sushi and very friendly service. They kept bringing us out complimentary drinks/shots of sake and made sure we were having a fun time. They have lots of vegetarian rolls and very yummy miso soup. We all had a blast and felt catered to the entire night. I recommend checking out Temple Nightclub after dinner since you get a free pass. All in all, it made our night super fun and convenient!

My favorite go-to location is still the one at fisherman's wharf. Tried this Boudin at Embarcadero and everything was mediocre. The service was slow, even though there were no customers. It took like 10 minutes for us to receive our bread bowl and sandwich. The clam chowder also didn't taste consistent to the one at Fisherman's wharf. I ordered the soup and salad combo, and got the BBQ chicken salad. The salad was basically a caesar salad with BBQ sauce and tortilla chips on top. The menu mentioned corn but there was no corn to be found on my salad. I didn't even bother with complaining as it took so long just to receive our food in the first place. The only nice thing about this location is that there are seats outside so you can people watch, bask in the sun or fog while you eat. We were lucky to be there on a nice day and it was great sitting outside. If I go back to Boudin, It would definitely not be at this location.

I would eat here everyday if I knew the cost and carbs wouldnt catch up to me. Everything that I have ever had here has been amazing. My fav is the california veggie and spring salad combo. My co-workers swears by the broccoli cheese soup thats only available on Tuesdays. Love this place!!!
Nice relaxed place for a Sunday lunch.

Just seemed like something I had to do. Get clam chowder and sourdough bread bowl to go and eat of the ferry to Sausalito. Great plan. While waiting for my order, the order fillers announced to the cashiers that they were out of chowder.

Great place for a quick lunch. I had a clam chowder and a half sandwich for about eight bucks. The bread was fresh as I had expected going to Boudins. The chowder was pretty good too and included actual clams. I don't think it came from a can! There's not much else to say, I was in and out of the restaraunt in less than ten minutes.

It kinda burns my buns to give this place a lower rating than I normally would give. We came for lunch on Saturday as we were excited about the prospect of grilled cheese. We picked out our options, paid, and sat down with our number.

Staff is at their limit with just getting food out the door.  Customer service is a very distant second thought (some were better than others).  Some in our party did not get their order because the server left before he delivered the order to our table.  Apology was weak...
Let me start by saying that I like the food here and nice upscale ambience,  this place is definitely newer and most attractive of all large restaurants on Fishermans Warf.
Boudin's clam chowder and sourdough bowl is worth the 4.5 hr flight!  Can't beat the location and view
Great food, just rude counter help. This guy who helped me on two occasions this past week acted like he owned the whole chain. He made sure I never, ever return to this or any other location.

The service is the best. We have dinner here about once a month and have always been served with a smile.  The fish and chips is so fresh. The pizza has the right flavors.  I will continue to come have a good pleasant meal at Boudins by the warf in San Francisco

Delicious soup and sandwiches!  Asparagus soup on one day and Mushroom soup on another day... both were so very good.  I'm a pretty picky person when it comes to soup and was impressed with the quality and flavor of both.

Clam chowder in a bread bowl. Can't really go wrong there. The only problem I have with it, is that there isn't enough soup to my bread. I end up with wayy too much bread. The sourdough bowl is pretty good and the clam chowder soup is definitely better than any canned soup you can get.

I was so excited for some soup here! I couldn't handle a full bread bowl so I did a half sandwich and soup. I was told at the check out my meal came with a cookie... Awesome. Checked my bill when I got home- I was charged $2 for my cookie. Yeah so I guess that doesn't come with my meal. I'm not going back on principle.
Sourdough bagguetes were a bit hard to chew. Gave my mouth a workout. Also, the yelp map places this place at the WRONG location.

Prefer the indoor seating next to the cafe. Kids loved the bread making factory demonstration. Had the traditional clam chowder in sourdough bowl and it didn't disappoint. I even got a keychain with a bunch of charms on it for $5 at the register. I wouldn't order a coffee at the lunch counter because it becomes rather confusing when it's busy in there. Get your coffee at Peet's which even has some an awesome selection such as almond milk lattes and Mayan mochas.

I have to give them 5 stars because my daughter loves the clam chowder even in the morning on a Saturday, my son loves their daily cookies for an after school snack, my husband loves the salads for a quick lunch and I love it when my family is fed!
Bread for any day and any time
My first time eating here was on February 2, 2014, on National Clam Chowder day, when Boudin was offering a special buy one get one free offer on clam chowder.
A lot of choices and very cute to see them bake the bread.
Four stars for today.  The last time we were here, it would be 1 star.

I stopped by this Boudin location to get a quick lunch, and it didn't disappoint. The food was good and fresh, but it is really the service that prompted me to write this review. Starting from the person who took my order, the people who prepared my salad, and the girl who came to take my dirty plates, I felt that I got a 5 start treatment. And it was during busy lunch hour.  Now, moving on to the food - my oriental chicken salad was HUGE and VERY FRESH.  The bread was freshly baked. Also, I liked that they have a lot of seating for patrons. I had a very satisfying lunch experience there, and the salad with a beverage set me back around $11. I shall return!

We really wanted to like this place, but as hard as we tried they made it very hard!  We made a reservation ahead of time and arrived almost 30 minutes early.  The host told us to wait until our time so we did.  As we waited people without reservations were seated immediately.  I asked again if we could be seated and the host told me to "hang on".  A bit rude but whatever.  Finally after staring at him with laser eyeballs he decided to seat us.  We waited for 28 minutes before our drink order was taken.  The waiter seemed frazzled as he came by twice during our waiting time to inform us they were understaffed.  When he did take our order he was drenched in sweat.  He delivered our drinks on a soaking wet tray and proceeded to serve us our drinks and spill his "tray water" on my daughters coat.  He was way to frazzled to realize that.  Our order was taken and our waiter then immediately chased someone down to apologize for his service.  We received our food and it was mediocre at best.  All in all, I   Would say I wouldn't go back and I would never recommend this place to anyone.

I'd been wanting to come here for lunch after I realized that they did grilled cheese (it's one of my many food weaknesses). Then to discover that they did a grilled brie?? You've caught me: hook, line and sinker.

Stopped in for a quick lunch before we started our day in the city. I got the chicken pesto sandwich and it was ok. Nothing special about it and the chicken was sliced rather thin. It came with a side salad. My wife got the bread bowl with butternut squash soup in it and she was raving about it, but to me, it just tasted like ordinary butternut squash soup that you can get out of a can so what does she know, right? Anyway, my son got a chicken pesto pizza and the thing was larger than his head, but don't worry, he still finished it! My other son was just happy that they had gingerbread cookies so that was all he ordered. They come in a package of three, but midway through the first cookie he realized that he did not really care for gingerbread cookies so I got stuck carrying them around the rest of the day while he finished the other half of my sandwich.
Went here to grab a loaf of sourdough bread to take back to Texas on my way home from a business trip and  it was fantastic!

Although it's not listed on their menu, they do serve breakfast sandwiches.   You get to just for a variety of two choices:  ham, scrambled eggs, and cheddar cheese on sourdough toast or bacon, scrambled eggs, and cheddar cheese on sourdough toast.  Amazing right!?

My husband goes to San Francisco on business, and sometimes I am allowed to join him.  Boudin is one of the places that we frequent for breakfast as I walk him to work.  This time I ordered the three cheese egg sandwich.  So good.....and so big that I had to eat it half then and save half for later.  The sourdough bread is scrumptious, even more so after coating it with Parmesan cheese.  My husband ordered the oatmeal, but unfortunately, it wasn't ready.  He had the lemon poppyseed muffin, which was bursting with citrus flavor.  Can't wait to return!

This is a pretty good, quick place for lunch (I'd probably consider picking something up for dinner here every once in a while, if they didn't close so early).  It's certainly more expensive than getting lunch at Subway, but if you have the frequent buyer card, I guess the free loaf of sourdough bread and occasional discounts help make it a better value.  That the free bread is so good is great by itself, in my opinion.
A close second option to Breaking Bread if you find yourself searching for a sandwich shop to grab a quick lunch.
I have been a customer for a long - long time and while the food is usually okay the service can be very spotty.

A little pricey for the potion size. They messed up my order accidentally when I ordered the Chilli. Instead I was handed a tomato soup bread bowl. I wasn't mad or in a hurry but the food was worth the wait! Plus the orange juice is sexy tasting. This place reminds me a lot of Panera Bread.

I've eaten at this particular shop since they first opened (and don't ask me when that was, a long time ago).  Over the years, they've changed their menu but the staff have always been really friendly and if you show up there a lot (as I do) they even know your name (which always impresses me considering ALL the people they serve).  Although I probably have tasted all their sandwiches, my go-to sammie is the tuna salad because they don't try to fancy it up ridiculously as almost every other place does, and maybe they don't use the cheapest tuna they can find.  I mean, the tuna sandwich tastes excellent.  I do have to ask them each time to put it on sliced bread because having the gnaw through the thick tough crust on the rolls is not fun to do when you are also trying to work. I guess that's one thing I don't like about Boudin's breads, the crust is so thick and tough.  I generally skip the soup-in-a-bread-bowl gimmick (unless I'm coming down with a cold and need the additional carbs), I just have them put my soup in a carton to go, but their soups do taste much like canned soups so don't expect  homemade.  One caution:  in general, their new big salads (bbq chicken, cobb, italian, maybe one other) can be uneven--one of the secretaries in my office was complaining how she paid a lot of money (and the salads are not cheap) but got most lettuce and no meat or any other veggies.  I have twice ordered one of those salads only to find when I got it to my home/office and opened it that the lettuce was actually rotten (turning into mush) or the bacon was rancid.  You'd think that the salad maker would taste test each of the ingredients for her salads each day when she opens up to check whether things are still fresh, and safe, enough to serve but I guess they don't.  So I'm not buying salads from them anymore--I can go elsewhere and get a salad that won't make me sick.  I also won't pay so much for a melted cheese sandwich--I can do that at home real cheaply (and get exactly the bread and cheese I want).  But I do get my tuna salad sandwiches here--yea, could make it at home but then I have to fight the cats for the tuna, and I often end up eating the turn before it makes it between the bread...and sometimes I'm already at work when I hit by that tunafish jones.

I love their turkey avocado on multigrain bread and their tomato bread soup! Only problem is their tomato soup has cream in it so if you're trying to be healthy or are lactose intolerant, you can't truly enjoy this delicious soup! I'm also a fan of the bread of the month club - who doesn't like free bread once a month! Their spring salad is also delicious. Service is not bad, not slow but not super fast either. When I don't know what to get or want a yummy sandwich, this is my go to place!

I was introduced by a friend for this bakery and I must say that I didn't regret it. I have fixed order with them and I am also having point card that gives me discount after reaching certain  points and other things.

I came here with my parents yesterday when I was showing them around SF (I live in Berkeley). My mom and I were really excited to have good clam chowder served in a sourdough bread bowl. For me at least, the experience was kind of disappointing.

Great lunch spot.  When I'm in FiDi for work, this is one of my standard spots.  The grilled cheese is definitely on point (although it's weak every once in awhile) and the tomato soup is absolutely delicious (definitely not out of the can).  It can get a bit crowded, but if you get there before noon, you'll be fine.
Great place to go for a quick sandwich and clam chowder. Bread is cooked fresh daily, and they use freshest ingredients. Very good!
Had to try to the Clam Chowder in a sourdough roll! It was all I had hoped for!
A decent place to grab lunch and sit outside with a view of the bay but the food is mediocre.
Time: 1:57pm/68°F cloudy

Just had my first sandwich here. Turkey on french roll with all the fixings. Pretty good. Nothing spectacles as far as secret sauce but they are quick and friendly. They take all credit cards which I like :)

I worked through my mid-day lunch break and found myself with a grumbly tummy around 3:30 in the afternoon.  I just wanted something already made that I could quickly eat and head back before anyone at work noticed I was gone.  I grabbed a pre-packaged egg salad sandwich on sliced wheat bread.  I had stood there a good two minutes at least trying to decide if any of the sandwiches are actually worth getting as everything just looked so ordinary.  So it was the egg salad sandwich and a bag of salt & pepper potato chips.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The egg salad was not overly mayonnaise'y' and the wheat bread was soft and fresh.  It was just the thing to have with the salty bag of chips.  I met Kim that day and she says she makes her sandwiches fresh everyday.  Her prices are definitely cheaper than other places in the area and very no frills.

This place has the quickest friendliest service in the Financial district hands down.  The food is deli fare with a nice breakfast selection in the AM and for lunch it's your neighborhood sandwich shop serving up burgers and the like.  Every order I've ever placed has been in my hands within minutes and was exactly what I ordered and at a great price.  What else can you ask for?  The set up in this place is perfect.  Right when you walk in, you make your order and follow down the line to pay for your order where the owner, Kim, is always waiting with a smiling face. Their beverage items include drinks that have no calories which is great.  It's just really nice to have a place that is friendly and welcoming and quick with the service when you only have a few minutes to pop away from your desk to get some good food.
