They even make some suggestions if you are fickle like me and don't know what to get.
Home made sandwiches for a cheap price! Don't expect the amazing experience, but rather a good mom's sandwich for your lunch.
Best sandwich in FiDi
Order the hot hand carved turkey sandwich! Friendly service and fabulous soups.
You really do get what you pay for.
Cheap Cheap Cheap!
Parfait Company.

This is definitely your mom and pop deli shop.  Nothing fancy in terms of decor.  Its one of those get in, get out places which is great considering many places in the Financial District have long waits during lunch hours, but this doesn't.  I used to come here practically 3-4 times a week when I worked in the area.  I used to get their club sandwich for $4.25 (I think). Since I wanted to cut back on bacon, I started getting just the turkey.  And once in a while I get their  Vietnamese sandwich which is DELICIOUS, not too dry like some places. And cheap for FIDi standards. $5!
Super odd, but they have really good chicken pho and it's only $6 with all the fixins.  Stoked that it's in my building.
Sandwich Co. is a really solid lunch spot. I come here at least once a week actually because it's very close to my work and it's a great deal.

The BEST hot roast turkey sandwich (on toasted 9-grain with everything, no mustard (mayo, lettuce, tomato, onions, pickle, cheddar, cranberry and jalapenos). Haven't had anything else there, but don't need to!  The owner told me recently that she's been there for 34 years!  For an unassuming little place, they are clearly doing something right.
i work across the street.

Now Serving PHO!!! Really good Pho.  The kind of Pho you bring home to mama.  PHOtastic!!! The broth was very flavorful and the noodles were perfect.  I would just have them add some sprouts .... yummy.
Tsk tsk. They upped their sandwich prices by $.50. Turkey sandwich is now $4.25 (previously $3.75). Oh well. It's still a cheap ass lunch in the FiDi.
I've been coming here for nearly a year and unfortunately what drives me to review this place is an awful experience.
I went to lunch here on Tuesday 07.18.11).

I can't believe I have never written a review for my favorite sandwich place in SF.  The Sandwich Co is fantastic.  My go to sandwich there is the club.  For about $5 I get out of there with a giant sandwich that really fills me up and tastes great.  The folks that own the place are cool too.  Very family oriented and friendly and they're always the same every time I go.  I've tried some of their specialty sandwiches, but in general I'd recommend sticking to the cold cuts.
Where else in FiDi can you find a decent portioned, toasted and warm sandwich filled with meat, veggies, pickled daikon, and hot siracha sauce for less than $5 out the door?
Had: chicken salad sandwich on a roll, and tuna pasta salad. Good news: super cheap, for the FiDi--got out of there for less than $7. Bad news: super bland.
had one good experience - getting the vietnamese sandwich (not the best banh mi, but for $4.50 in the financial district, who's complaining.
I got a cold sandwich (turkey + avocado and mayo) It wasn't good. There wasn't any flavor and my avocado wasn't ripe. :( I ate half and forgot about the other half.

I actually am falling in love with this place. The spicy chicken sandwich, meatball sandwich, and turkey sandwich are all excellente! And, they have pho. And it's totally affordable and the owner is super nice.
THICK SANDWICHES
I am addicted to the hot turkey sandwich (even though the BBQ Chicken is very good and even cheaper).  The hot turkey reminds me of a jam-packed Carnegie Deli sandwich.

After a few more cheap sandos, I can finally say that the last time I was wrong was when I thought I was wrong but was actually right.  Cheap ain't enough.  The Bahn Mi is their best sandwich, but my last one was a little slimy and I bit into something that should not have been there.  A downgrade to three is actually quite generous as sometimes all I'm looking for is cheap not necessarily good.

I might be overrating this place, but I really like it.  It's $4 for quality sandwiches, cheaper than Subway with fresher ingredients?  The sandwiches are always made by the best workers possible and they put so much care and love into every sandwich I can taste it in every bite.  It's only $4 and they really care about each individual customer.

"The Sandwich Company."   You can see it written in big gold letters on the white marble facade of this typical Financial District building.  The outside of The Sandwich Company looks like a place where the girls from the typing pool at Sterling Cooper might go to grab a sandwich.  What, you haven't seen Mad Men yet?  No, really?
It's okay. It's reasonably priced. And that's about it. None of the sandwiches are spectacular, there's no place to sit. Grab a sandwich, have one made, or grab a salad. That's it.

Whenever buying a sandwich for lunch I am always shopping for value - that is what I get for what I pay, and not necessarily the most awesomingly amazing and delicious sandwich known to man, but rather something tasty that won't leave me upset 45 mins later when I return to work and hear my stomach growl.
Sandwich? What sandwich? I go there for the lasagna.

Just finished my turkey and avocado sandwich and it's true what they say. You get what you pay for. The turkey was kind of slimy and it tasted like butterball turkey you would get at Safeway. The ingredients were good and the roll was fresh. The sandwich and chips were 5.50 so at least the price was reasonable. I will come back to try their roasted turkey. Hopefully that is better.

This place doesn't provide fancy ahi-sesame-rocket-dijon sandwiches, but it's a good, basic, need-a-quick-sandwich-during-lunch-hour place. They're not trying to be Chez Panisse. They have basic, fresh sandwiches, 90% of which are under $5. The oven roasted turkey sandwich (made with real roasted turkey, not deli meat!) will run you $5.95. Dude.
I like this place.

It's not the best and it's not the worst.  But when your in a hurry and need something fast.....and CHEAP!  This is your joint!  I can get a small soup, sunchips and a soda for 4 bucks. The only downside, cash only with no ATM nearby.

They are a very basic place to get some grub, but boy do they have heart. Owners are super friendly and love finding out more about their customers. It's so rare to find a small mom & pop lunch place in the Financial District, that all stars go for the effort behind keeping it open and alive. Then on top of that, to keep it cheap? Awesome.
Once again I feel compelled to ride in for the rescue of a place that in my opinion has gotten an unfair beating on Yelp.
Lee's is around the corner near Bush and Montgomery, go there to get your cheap sandwich.

When this place first opened, I was pretty excited. I love the DIY-type of places. I walked in here like a giddy little college girl with my backpack full of textbooks and notebooks (well, I was still attending Berkeley at the time when I first tried this place).
Mediocre sushi and the prices are not cheap. I came in ten mins after happy hour ended only to receive dry leftover rice and a funny tuna that was squirted out of a funnel.

This place means well and portions are big but the quality is not there.  The tuna is squirted out of a funnel like it's frosting and all our rolls were dry.  We were looking for a sushi place in the financial district and this was not a good choice.
Another update? I know I know.
Very nice staff and super convenient location (1/2 block from my building).
The nori was super chewy.

Love the concept. This is for the people that know what they want, your reg sushi eaters. No matter what mood your in U Sushi has it. I was in the mood for a poke bowl because I was missing It from being in Hawaii for a week. Walked in and asked if they had it and they said Yes! To add to this they let me pick the sides that I would want and I went with 2 orders of avocado and fried tofu. Definitely exceed expectations and added to the my customer experience. Service at the register was all great, I was complemented on my jacket and we had a quick conversation about nordstrom rack aka The Rack. I'll be back.

delicious, fresh and affordable sushi, made to order no less.  For less than 10 bucks I wasn't expecting awesomeness but it was totally awesome.  You tell them what you want in the roll and it's made in front of you.
O M G all future lunch plans have officially been made. U-SUSHI is where I'll be!!!
Came here today for a quick to go lunch and I was impressed.

your standard fast food sushi place so quality is expected. The guy that helped me was really nice. They can make rolls without rice and you can just get sashimi by itself as well for an extra $2. They also have HH from 3-6. For a quick bite, this place isn't bad.
I tried this place for the first time last week. I can honestly say I love it! The employees are extremely friendly, and the service is quick.

Since Sushirrito was too far from the office, I tried walking into this joint and was instantly welcomed with smiles and excitement. It is a fun environment to grab lunch (after the lunch rush of FiDi).

I brought my own lunch for work, but didn't have any rice to go with my lumpia. I asked if I could just get a side of rice and I was able to get it for $2.00. Note that it's vinegar rice, which went perfect with my lumpia lunch. I also asked about the green tea cookies and they went out of their way to find the last two green tea chocolate dipped cookies. Really great service and they were really nice and accomodating. It looks like they really enjoy their job, too.
u-sushi is an unique restaurant concept, but I don't think it's executed that well.
Very friendly staff. Everything is customizable. Love this place for quick and healthy options.

So bad. I'm mad that they charge the prices of a real sushi place. It was like paying the full price of a meal someone made in an Easy Bake Oven. Toy food. Toy sushi. Save your money and get something decent.
I was very impressed with this place! I went today, for my second time and the customer service is awesome! I must also say how great their Miso Soup was and the Dragon Roll!
Yikes - what are these things they pass off for makis?! Horrible taste and a nightmare to eat!

Customer service wasn't very good, we stood in waiting with no one in front of us for about 10 minutes and no one acknowledged us. The food poritions for what you pay is crazy expensive. The lady at the register wasn't very friendly. All in all I would give it 1 star and probably never go back.

Looooove this place for some to go sushi rolls!!! Super efficient, pick whatever u want in the roll, tastes great and inexpensive. Nice people there too...would recommend for a togo. Ps:no seatings inside.

I was very curious how many stars this place has because there is no one here ever. I'm surprised it has 3.5 stars. Not that it doesn't deserve it but just because there are no customers. But that is good for me because I work right next door! I never get the  fish here. I always make my own thing, and the same thing every time. It makes for a nice healthy lunch (you may need to order two!).

Fast-food sushi -if you are into that - the food is good and the establishment is clean - very reasonably priced - you cannot sit and eat here - so be prepared to walk away with food. I did not realize that there were no tables at the joint until I walked there for the first time. Pretty good wait time as well.
Ehhhhhh never again.  I've always been iffy about U-Sushi: mediocre, Americanized rolls that cost almost $10 a pop.  And not even filling.

So...this place has some pretty mixed reviews. It's hit and miss and I totally understand why. There is no seating available but then again, if you're like me and just grab lunch to take back up to the office it doesn't matter. But if you're looking for seating, sorry mate. It's an assembly line, like Chipotle or Subway. If you're expecting something fancy, please don't get your hopes all the way up. They make fast food sushi and its good for what it is. My experience was a positive one and I'll definitely be back.

Ooooh!  Rediscovering this lunch spot.  1 fish roll + Miso soup came to $10.60.  And after 3pm you get a $4 premade roll for free!  I got the bay shrimp one.  It was really great.  One end of the rice was a little dry, but it was the end of the day...and free!  This made my whole day!!! I am also SOOOO stuffed. Crazy light dinner (if at all) for me!

Been coming here for over a year now since my office is upstairs from this place. I think I had the worst sushi roll of my life. The food handler seemed miserable made the sloppiest roll for me. This anti-bag law is ridiculous and goes too far...they handed me a leaky roll wrapped in wet paper condiments, chop sticks all with this "here ya go, now move aside" attitude. Even if I had a purse with me, this leaky mess would not go in ti. I think the customer experience is lost at this place. Dim wits for hire here.

4 STARS !! I tried this spot out... talk about convenience.. walk up no lines.. quick friendly service.  Your choice - create your own ($7-$9) or get the cheaper version in pre-made ($4bucks).  Had both, one of each, nice healthy lunch, beats the lines and the $15 salad ! The price was comparable to most spots. Filled me up ! It tasted fresh, even the pre-made was fresh.  And I am not one for sushi sitting around. For a quick grab and go, healthy lunch, hit them up but don't tell anyone !! LOL
They have added new rolls that are smaller and premade for $4! Which means I can now have a good lunch for $12 total. Not bad for sushi in FiDi.
I enjoyed this as a lunch spot a lot!
Time: 4:27pm/59°F clear

This used to be one of my favorite places to grab a quick lunch in the Financial District. But like all good things, it has finally jumped the shark. They've squished the design-your-own sushi roll space into a corner to make room for a massive assortment of ready-made rolls. There goes the entire concept of the restaurant: poof! I used to get a sushi roll and a side of miso soup. But they don't serve soup anymore. At least today's sushi came with a bucketload of wasabi--something to remember the place by, because I won't be going back soon.

So they switched to a concept called the FARM for several weeks, but it looks like they are back to being U-Sushi again.  I went with one of their pre-made rolls, which was a mistake.  Very fishy tasting Salmon and the rest of the fillings were pretty bland, even with the fresh ginger, soy sauce and wasabi alongside.
I think maybe two stars would be better, but I like the concept of build your own sushi so I'm giving it three. I would like this place and location to succeed, so my review will be constructive.

u-sushi is BACK...kind of.  I went in today because I noticed the F.A.R.M. sign was down and the old menu items seemed to be back up, and was pleasantly surprised to see that was mostly the case.  I didn't see any miso or salad/edamame offerings, and those rollaways are still there (I can't get behind the unique taste of seaweed and rice...and chicken caesar salad), and it looks like the yogurt bar is gone, BUT THE SUSHI IS BACK.  I could get my usual (white rice on seaweed, tuna and salmon, asparagus and avocado, spicy mayo, and fish roe -- I'm a really good orderer, and you're welcome to steal it), and it was just like old times, except all my usual workers were gone, but I mean, except for the lack of miso, the dearth of edamame, some rollaway thingys, and different people working there, IT WAS JUST LIKE OLD TIMES.
EDIT: U-Sushi is no more! In the same spot is their Sushiritto-esque joint called The Farm (?).

Terrible sushi rolls I ever had in my life. Each roll is too big with strange soy taste or whatever kind of variety sauces..... A roll inside salmon with cream cheese is .. are you kidding me? Paid about $9 with 3 sushi rolls and all of them are so bad. I never ever come back here again. Mind you, no place to eat inside.

Such a Bummer!  U Sushi is Now "The Farm" You USED to be able to make your own custom made sushi roll, which were always fresh and delicious.  Of course this was when it was called "U sushi"  Now at "the Farm" they have different types of teas...(uhhhh...I can get teas at any of the million 7-11, walgreens or other shops all around downtown.) A yogurt bar. (bleh) and pre-made rolls, that look more like sandwiches then sushi.  I tried the chicken avocado roll (with just chicken and avocado...snore) it's awkward to eat, they have lots of sauces but alas, I think these guys are trying to compete with the sushiritto place, but this place falls short.  "Goodbye U Sushi, it was awesome when it lasted, Hello The Farm, Good Luck to you, but I won't be back.  I would like to say, It's not you, it's me, but it's totally you.  You've changed, and I don't think we can see each other any more."

I am so disappointed. I used to love going to this place because I could customize my own sushi rolls. Apparently, it's under new management now and they've totally ruined it. You can no longer customize your own sushi and they have a few weird pre-made rolls, including sushi rolls with duck and bacon. If you're a vegetarian or only eat seafood, they've left you with very few options.

This pub reminds me so much the pubs in London, but twice as big. MARTY from Belfast, Ireland was friendly and made sure that clienteles were happy. A customer with same Irish take a liking of Marty and kept having a conversation with Marty, who showed no rudeness but all politeness that he was having a conversation with that one clientele and at the same provided service to other clientele s without having to wait for their drinks. My new spot in the Financial District . A great place to go when you just want to chill.lots of tv to watch your games..
Bar review only...

I was hesitant to write a scathing review, so I waited a day to see how I still felt.  Having worked in a lot of busy slammed bars and restaurants, I am super sympathetic to the front of the hues and always try to see the situation from their perspective.  And also kinda hate Yelp for extorting businesses by center piecing bad reviews, but here goes.
A great Irish pub and conveniently located in the financial district.
This bar is a great place to watch the game at. Plenty of endears inside, at the bar, and outside. The potatoes skins are a must. Selection of beer is pretty decent as well.
Amazing bar for college football games, especially Notre Dame. Good food, fair prices and lots of fun! They even show the UFC fights too!

I had taken my boss out for lunch to celebrate her birthday early on a Friday, she had recommended this place and I'm always down for an Irish Pub and Grill. While the drinks were nice and strong and decently priced (the Margaritas don't skimp on the tequila!), the service that preceded and followed left a lot to be desired. When we initially ordered our drinks by a young lady who was noticeably frantic and was all over the place, we had asked for glasses of water and the Margaritas to start with for drinks and a plate of their Calamari as an appetizer. We received the Margaritas and the Calamari within a decent amount of time but get this--no water or silverware? Were we supposed to eat the Calamari with our hands? The fact that there were no place settings at the table we set at was a bit baffling and it only got worse when we had to ask our waitress for the water (which she obviously forgot about) as well as a fork and napkins to which she said "it's coming". Uh, okay then.

The service here is abysmal. If you're only looking for a drink, it's ok, but time and time again I come here and get ignored by the waitstaff. I am actively looking for another local bar to watch sporting events from. Poor timing on food orders, inattentive waitstaff, slow to take orders and deliver food. I recommend you avoid.
There's a girl that looks like traditional Rapunzel. Horrible Moscow mule (a pretty standard drink) horrible service :(

One of my favorite spots in the Financial District. Friendly service, great happy hour deals, plenty of TVs. Having an accent seems to be a requirement for employment here which adds to the authenticity. Full bar with a pleasant selection of draft beer and liquor. Food is pretty standard for the area, and the portions are well sized for the price.
Great Irish bar! Great food and friendly staff! Sells 2Gingers Irish Whiskey which is a bonus! Highly recommend!
Very popular bar in the FIDI, especially with Brits and ex pats.
I usually go here for happy hour right after work...well never again.
Had our football fantasy draft here last year and will be doing it again! Very nice folks. Plenty of TVs to be surrounded by the ambiance of the preseason.

Crappy food, worst service ever. Never again. The only reason they exist is location, being an Irish pub and showing soccer games. There are a lot of much better bars and restaurants around. Try them out and you will not regret it.

This is a great place to watch a game or grab a beer (for the most part) after work in the Financial District.  However, everytime I eat there, I am sadly disappointed.  I know that it's just bar food, but it is in San Francisco, and I think it can be done better with more flavor and innovation.  But the most damning thing for this Irish bar is that they can't seem to make a proper Black & Tan.  Every single time we order one, there is no separation between the "black" and the "tan"; it's just one cloudy mess.
I honestly was surprised in how tasty the food was. Had the bangers and mash with a side of fries. Good food and beers, sold.

Great place to get a drink after work.  All of the bartenders and servers are, in fact, Irish.  You can always catch a game that's on and they have seating and TVs outside (a rarity in the area). They have daily special on drinks and bar food. Recommended.
I love the fact that they show real football on tv here (that's soccer to you American's) throughout the week.  I've been able to catch my club (Arsenal FC) play and enjoyed a few World Cup matches.

We were wandering and checking out the area since our hotel was a few blocks down and came across this place. Got a seat at the bar and the bartender saw and immediately asked what we would like to drink. No fuss, ppl seemed friendly enough, engaged on their own conversations. We were here Friday about 6:30 at night and it wasn't too bad. We did order the sliders and they were just ok. By that time we were already feeling good. Friends met us up and stayed a little longer. Bathroom was clean enough so can't really complain. Would stop by again if in the area.

Fuck this place. Walked in with my girlfriend yesterday around 8p, we sit down and the waitress walks over throws menus on the table, and walks away. Doesn't say a single word, just throws the menu. No "hello", "how are you", "I'll be right with you, but here's a menu for now", just throws the fucking menu at us. And it was only one menu. So I guess there is a great menu shortage at Irish Times that we have to share?
Nice looking place, gotta admit. Lots of TV's. But not the place for regulars because staff is unapologetically rude and pushy.
World Cup Game: USA vs. Germany
-Great service
Kool place if ya got the patience for the service

Listen you close way earlier than you claim. I went to you tonight at 12 something and you were already locked and closed down. I get it you're in the financial district , but maybe then don't advertise you're open to about last call even because that is a farce.

Well, interestingly, they have some great deals on various days, however, they are apparently confused about when these particular deals actually exist :/ I called in Monday at 1pm and asked, "Is the Monday 1 dollar slider deal all day Monday? Or only during happy hour (2pm-6pm)?" To which they replied: "Let me ask;" (I could hear 2 other voices concur; "All Day", "Yeah, it's all day". The following day, we went into Irish Times at 1pm and asked about the 2 dollar taco Tuesday deal . . . this time they tell us, no those deals are only 2-6pm. I proceeded to explain about what they had told me on the phone, they then told me that all of the specials are only during happy hour and did not believe me that I had called them and received the explanation they gave me the previous day. The funny thing is if you look at the chalkboard posted in the establishment it appears that the "specials" on various days are different than the actual happy hour deals which run every day. Anyway, this was quite the unpleasant experience. Oh well . . .
Delicious cod BLT ! Great atmosphere and fantastic service!  Went here for lunch with co-workers and had fast service!  The curry chicken salad looked terrific as well!
This is a decent bet for happy hour in the FiDi. I've come here a couple of times when meeting people who are either coming in from the East Bay or need to catch the BART right after.
LOL "NIGIRI" FISH & CHIPS

Had a hard time trying to find a place in SFO to watch UFC 170.  Finally found IrishTimes had the pay per view event.  Had a great seat at the bar with my fiancé and the tv screens were very good.  The food is what you would expect at an Irish sports bar and our bartender was a good guy with an Irish accent.
Not the place if you are looking for good food.  I have been here three times, and I've had the nachos, chicken quesadillas, and shepard's pie.  Meh, I'd rather eat at Irish Bank.

Laid back, come as you are place that's great for an after work cocktail.  Food is decent but I've never had anything more than an app to snack on while watching a game.  Numerous TVs and friendly/attentive staff that will change the channel for you and do whatever they can to make your time more enjoyable.  Can't say that about 70-80% of other bars in the Financial District that's for sure.
Good food! Happy hour specials are great! Perfect place to watch the game. Be on the look out for my favorite bar tender :)
Great place in FiDi for happy hour!

Walked in for lunch with a coworker and to watch the soccer match UFC 168.  Since it was lunchtime the place was packed and we had a short wait for a table.  Being a pub they had several draft beers available to choose from.  This is only a few places that has Carlsberg on tap and promptly made my choice.  The food is typical bar food, with a new Irish and British choices.  I ended up getting the Fish and Chips and my coworker got the Ruben sandwich.  Food came out daily quickly and it was nothing to write home about, but was decent non the less.  My fish and chips were a little to oily, but the fish was flaky and chips were cut like typical British chips.

Came here for UFC 168 since it was close to one of my buddy's places.  I got here early enough to get a table, and it got packed quick.  The chicken wings were good (I wish there were more to an order).  They weren't very spicy compared to Kezar, but they were hot and fresh.  I got a Reuben and a soda.  Even though the place was packed for the fights, the waitress was very attentive.  I think she even brought over refills for the soda before my glass was empty.

After 9 months, I am finally home and reunited with my best friend of 18 years. After some face stuffing and some window shopping "I'm like lets get some alcohol, I don't have to drive!" We bus it to the fidi, walked around, and happened onto this place on a Wednesday early evening. This place is packed with the after work crowd. We were able to find ourselves a table. The waitress promptly gave us menus and got us our drinks. Pretty fast and efficient service. We preceded to enjoy our drinks with the really loud crowd. I think this place is a great after-work hangout. Chill and not presumptuous. Saw a lot of networking going on. One men and one women bathroom. Two entrances/exits. Extra little room in the back if you are looking for seats.

I give 5 stars for our waitress! Very attentive and sweet! Every time I come into the city, my boyfriend always takes me to an Irish pub. I have no idea why. ( Oh, drinks are inexpensive and strong! Hello!) I hesitated stepping in to the bar, but glad my bf pulled me in. Basketball was on. Rockets versus Warriors. Great bar food. Stiff ass beverages. But only one female and male restroom. Gotta hold it for awhile. Our waitress was awesome. She recommended me a drink, I will,now, always order.

My supervisor has been ordering pasta from here for years and they know her very well.  After my experience today she will no longer be going back.  I went to pick up an order she placed for herself an my coworkers.  First off the woman at the register was a bit rude.  Cutting me off as I was letting her know I was picking up an order.

I like how down to earth this place feels like.   the beautiful smiles of the italian waitresses and ambience of that restaurant are both great.   not fancy at all, spontaneous stickers very unhipsterly spread on the glass walls and nice unbusy people around you.  need to take a breath out of too much style and fanciness really
Friendly service. Great homemade ravioli. Good beer specials. Good for a quick late dinner.

We were tired of over-priced union square restaurants, found this place on yelp, it is walking distance to Chinatown entrance. Price looked right. So we walked in. We ordered their special pizza and spicy chicken pizza. Restaurant looked okay, nothing special, there is a pizza oven at the middle, and some tables around it, there were also a couple of tables outside on the street. Pizza came quickly, it was good, not spectacular, just good. But we enjoyed it. Server was very attentive. Next table was drinking wine so I assume they sell alcohol. Restroom looked okay. This is an average store with decent pizza. Pasta was also in the menu but we did not try any.

Overall a decent little place. The salad was good but the pizza was just average in taste. Not bad at all but not the kind of pizza that makes me think of it after. They have outside seating and that is nice. The server was very friendly and the food came out fast. If I'm down that way again I'll probably eat there again.

My friend and I went here on our lunch break just. We both had pasta; I had chicken alfredo and she had a marco polo. We both LOVED the pasta and the food came out fast. Our server was good. No complaints about her at all. Wish I remembered her name though, I'd shout her out.

My boyfriend works right next to this Italian restaurant and raved about how good the pasta was. I tried some of the pasta that he had brought home the night before and microwaved the next day (which probably wouldn't taste that pleasant with any food for that matter). It was alright, maybe chicken Alfredo just isn't my thing. I did not hate it or like it.

Went to a Meetup event at 49 Geary and ate here afterwards. It serves Italian-American food like pasta, pizza, and salads. Not a fancy place and not a cheap place. I got the spicy chicken tomato pasta and it was okay. I was still hungry and someone gave me some of their sausage gnocchi and that was okay. Pizza looked okay. Salad looked okay. Not a terrible place to get some food.

I had the spicy chicken pizza here. From the first bite, I immediately thought, "holy crap, this tastes EXACTLY like Ellio's pizza." It was uncanny! When I told my friend, he said he was thinking the same thing.

My new go to place for pizza! I work around Union Square and don't have many options for good pizza close by. You will not get any crust reminiscent of cardboard or chewing gum here. The crust was crisp, but not oily on the outside and soft on the inside. Their pizza by the slice comes in their specialty flavors, not just the usual cheese or pepperoni!! Prices are very reasonable.
Update: This restaurant no longer wants business people having a piece of pizza. Everything else from my previous review is still valid.
Amazing serves!! Good food!!! Manager/owner is the nicest. And Yasmin our waitress was delightful. :)

Food was pretty good. The cashier recommended a spicy chicken pizza, which was delicious.  The crust was the perfect amount of crispy.  In fact, in my daze of fullness caused by the good food, I forgot my purse there.
The theme of the night: misleading advertising!

They have an awesome happy hour.  $2.50  beers and super cheap wine by the glass and bottle.  They understand when you've had a bad day and keep those glasses full to the brim.  Pizza is pretty tasty and so is the meatball and sausage appetizer.  Restaurant is clean, restrooms are clean.  Perfect after work spot to unwind (I personally go there when my friends are lagging and I need a drink ASAP).  Lots of TVs for you sport finatics

I would give it 5 stars but the bitch with the buzz cut hair was completely rude. Asked her for a ranch and she turned her back and sat down. Completely rude she heard us and the kind waitress next to her brought us the ranch. The pizza was great don't get me wrong but the rude bitch ruined the vibe.
I don't eat pizza or pasta...so why come here?

Very very average. Average food, average service, average prices. Below-average pour on beers on tap. Girl took a good 10 minutes to scoop foam out of two beers. Very "eh". Kind of small and not really good for groups.

I went here to get my pizza craving fulfilled during my lunch break. For the price (around 2.50 I believe) I got two slices, which apparently the two small slices they have me equate to one, of the Pomodoro pizza, it was just ok. The crust was bland and somewhat tough which made it unenjoyable, but the toppings were tasty. The pizza could have been way better if it was HOT instead of just warm because the toppings were great. They also give you your own personal chili flakes and Parmesan cheese in small containers with your pizza when you take it to go, which I love. I would definitely give this place another try considering I am Italian and it is two blocks or so from my office.
This was my lunch spot for a couple years when I worked down the street. Was it amazing? Nah! But it was that comfort, good service, and escape I needed

Horrible. We used Seamless through work. I ordered a slice of pepperoni and a side salad. Got my pizza and it was completely cold and had mushrooms. I picked them off then are the pizza. Big mistake!!! It's now the next day and I have only gotten a hour of sleep due to my countless trips to the restroom. If I could give them minus stars I would.

Pasta + Pizza are good. All pasta dishes are filling, and not to mention they come with fresh baked bread made in-house. The owner is awesome too! Try the meatballs! Just a bit pricey, but once in a while is OK.
Cheap beer and good pizza, its pretty simple, but good.

Just odered delivery 30 min.  they charged us.  15 min later they call and say THE DRIVER DOES NOT FEEL LIKE DELIVERING TO US.  WTF!!!!  Im from Philly, and this never ever happens.  Im appalled at the lack of professionalism. ITS YOUR JOB!! oh and no manager on duty.    Im going to call and speak to the boss.  My goal is to get you fired you smelly pirate hooker.
I'll be going to school near here in the Fall and I've been looking for good, cheap restaurants in the area.
Horrible service.
Abit overpriced for the quality. Nothing bad, but a restaurant supposed to be famous from their food.
I had a wonderful, delicious sea food pasta. The tiramisu is amazing! The servers were very friendly and nice! I loved the experience and will definitely recommend it to one and all!

The food was bland bland bland. I feel bad writing this because the service was great and the place has character. The management needs to better the menu -- because the location is great and the servers are greater. The food is bland and uninteresting. I find it hard to criticize any salad -- but their salads are BORRRRING. the pasta is boring. the pizza is boring. i don't even like super spicy food. but there was so little flavor -- and we ordered a lot of food with diverse array of menu items (salad, 2 pasta dishes and pizza).  I will try them again because the servers work hard, they have personality and seem so observant.  But the owners need to give the menu a major infusion of flavor.

I've given this place 2 tries, several months apart....quality of the food is just not there.  Giving 2 stars cuz the help is sweet & friendly.  Lots of noodles - but VERY short on the other ingredients as well as very short on sauce.  I can't afford to pay for just noodles.  Also, the bread is dry and with out flavor or butter.  Pass.

Terrible service! I was told I can only sit at a table if I'm ordering more than a slice so the waitress came over to try to force me to buy another slice or a salad or beer even though I just wanted a slice! I finally just said forget it I'll take it to go since they made me feel so unwelcome! When I go to pay for my slice I see they have a $7 minimum credit card purchase limit when I don't have any cash on me. Just ended up saying forget it all while the staff so rudely stared at me not apologizing the whole time. So lame i would never return here!

Superslow service. One shouldn't order chicken wings in an italian place, but wtf my friend was craving for wings and we ordered. After waiting for 40 long minutes for wings, we checked with the server. He says the wings are taking long to thaw. Yes, you get the frozen wings in here.

I've been to Italy - Genoa and La Spezia for a total of ten days. Genoa is where pesto was invented/created and is where I had pesto pasta. I didn't have pizza in Naples but I did in Genoa. Both pizza and pesto pasta was amazing and this place is like the real deal except Hispanics are making it. Trust me you should go to this place and give it a try. I've been to Italy.
It's nothing fancy but post run along the embarcadero on a warm SF evening, we were drawn to the outdoor seating and all day, everyday, happy hour pints.

I came here for lunch with my friend yesterday! We both enjoyed our meal and definitely want to come back the next time we're in San Francisco! I had the choose your own pasta with Fettuccine with Pesto sauce. Perfect amount for a reasonable price! I think my only complaint would be that the only dessert options they had was Tiramasu. I am not a fan of Tiramisu. I would've loved some Cannolis!

DO NOT EAT HERE, unless you want to spend $36.95 for an XL pie that is not even worth $20.  I have eaten at hundreds of pizza joints and not one of them doubles their price to serve pizza during dinner hours.  Ridiculous.  Go down the block to Escape From N.Y., save $15, and eat a much tastier pie.

When I think about how we'd ever get to giving any pizza whatsoever one star, it seems impossible. Pizza dough. Sauce. Cheese. From an oven. Even a microwave. Or even a blow dryer. No matter what, I'm down. But somehow when I was telling my pizzonycé, always down to Lady & The Tramp a slice gal, about how bad this was, she asked, "how could pizza ever be one star?"
Deceitful advertising on Yelp. "One Free Meal" is littered with "fine print" that you can only see after checking in online. That's bad business; negative 5 stars rating.
Good and friendly service. The meatball panini is delicious and a great value. And they have beer, and outside tables which are each always a plus.

I definitely have had better. My dish of spaghetti and meatballs was bland. They did give big portions and the meal came with a ok salad. They do have on Friday nights $3.50 beers on tap including Stella which is good.

My co worker introduced this place to me first by bringing me a delicious Philly cheese steak with bacon and avocado. A week later I had to come myself to check out the menu and the restaurant. They have many options but of course I had to get the avocado and bacon again. I was a little disappointed because my fries were cold and a little under cooked. My sandwich was good though and I requested ranch dressing which made it even more delicious. I would definitely come back and try something different here.
Downtown is full of sandwich joints the way New York is filled with blue and white memorabilia.

Very disappointing 1/2 sandwich, 1/2 salad. Sandwich was tasteless and chewy (not in a good way). Salad portion was tiny, and involved mystery meat apparently. For a dollar less I could've had a giant and delicious Cafe Venue salad a block away. That'll teach me for going outside my regular rotation :)
This review is solely about the crab cake sandwich. It was my cheat day and it was heaven on a bun. Carbs and fried crab cake with a side of fried french fries (which were also delicious) DO IT

Like many delis, Manhattan Hub gives out punch-cards to frequent customers: if you buy 10 sandwiches, your 11th is free. So I have been dutifully going to MH once a week for many months to collect my punches. Sure, they are insufferably crowded at lunchtime, but it's never been longer than a 10-minute wait, and the variety of their fabulous menu is worth it and their sandwiches are delicious.
Online ordering definitely helps. This place often has a lot of people. I don't like long waits so thank goodness. By the time I walked there, my food was ready :)

This place gets 5 stars for what it is: a convenient place to get your lunch if you work in the FiDi. I go here a lot and I'm never let down. Their 3 salad deal is great and the portions are huge. The sandwiches are also great. The line goes quick but sometimes it can take a bit to get a to go order during the lunch rush.

If you are from the East Coast you will be insulted by what they call cheesesteaks and NY pastrami sandwiches. If you are not, this place might be alright. The meats are rather plain, taste like something you would buy at a Safeway, not a NY deli. The sizes are rather generous, and some with all the toppings you would hope for, but the prices are also a couple bucks higher for what you would pay for a normal deli sandwich. In the end, if you enjoy rather plain sandwiches (yes, chicken club fans, that's you) then you will like this place. If you want something more for lunch, definitely skip it.
Came here for a quick lunch fix. Ordered a half soup and half salad for $8+ which is pretty decent for lunch in the Financial district.
Ordering online is so easy! I work a couple blocks away and by the time I order and pay online they have my sandwich and drink ready to go by the time I walk in!

Came here for the Arugula de Parma salad. The proscuitto parma was about the only part I liked. I ordered it and it was already pre-packaged and ready... nothing screams NOT FRESH like something that's already been made, even if they made it 5 minutes ago.
Nice lunch place with outdoor seating.  Great Philly sandwiches (I go for the chicken Philly).
Best Philly Cheesteak I have had outside of Philly - Here's a tip, don't go during the normal 12-1 rush and your Philly will taste fresher and better prepared.
Giving the corned beef reuben 5 stars. Huge sandwich with lots of corned beef that was delicious and not fatty at all. Served with coleslaw and a pickle. Enough for 2 meals!

ordered for delivery, service was on time, which is great. people seemed friendly.  most of the sandwiches were good.  pretty fresh.  reuben was very big, lots of meat.  but the expensive crab cake sandwich was imitation crab meal and potatoes?  not worth it.  but other stuff is good.

Ok let me just make this clear to avoid this place and their dumbass workers. Came here to redeem a go dish offer and I didn't know how the process was but I figured the dumbass women workers would have a clue but they didn't. Paid for my order but it was funny that I didn't get a number with my order which is what I saw was the norm here. Waited for 15 minutes before I asked someone that worked here where's my order. Got word that even though I paid for my order that since I didn't place the order that my food wasn't made or in the processed of being made.
So I found a Go Dish deal here for the bacon avocado Philly cheese steak.

Long time since I've been here and some work folks suggested it.  Thought the cheesesteak was pretty good.  Though it didn't look that big, filled me up nicely with no drink or fries.  I would have liked an option for cheese choice, but the whiz-like substance was tasty.  Only negative was kind of greasy liquid at the bottom from the grease and cheese sauce.  Good assortment of peppers and onions.  Price reasonable, $8.16.  Quick handling of the lunch rush.
Got there 20 min before close. Gps had hard time with correct spot. Got the pulled pork sand. Excellent. Great ambiance. Great menu. I will be back

Came here with coworkers for a quick bite to eat. I had the falafel wrap with hummus. The falafels were not dry, but they could have had a bit more flavor. The hummus that accompanied the wrap was not good-too watery in texture and seriously lacked flavor.
Sadly, I fell for a picture of beer battered fish and chip advertised on the window of this place. I ordered what I assumed would be one of their signature dishes substituting coleslaw for fries.
Solid.  Good food and variety, and best fish n' chips in the area (halibut).  A little pricy, but worth it.
Came here for lunch a few times. Had their salad and soup combo twice.

I have ordered from Manhattan Hub several times. Each time thinking that they will get it right this next time. I buy for 100 people each time and "Habet" seeming irritated that I'm calling. The orders never seem to come quite as complete as how the catering site says. Missing the side salads or not enough for the order size and me having to call every time to get the remaining items that we had ordered.

The salads variety is delightful and  are the sandwiches are tasty. The ambiance is decent and the service is minimal but to the point. the hub appeals to the suits and ties in the area that don't have much time, so if you're in a bit of a hurry and still want a decent (or slightly more than decent) bite to eat, this is the place for you. The soups are pretty good as well.
3 1/2 stars.

Their hummus is fantastic- pair it with their falafel wrap and you're in for a treat. They also have sandwiches that will seriously get you excited for lunch. There is outside seating so that makes lunch nice when we have sunny days.  The lunch rush is usually from 11:30-12:45- orders can take up 10 minutes so that kinda sucks but everyone that works there is moving fast and is super nice so I don't mind too much.

Found this a pretty fine place for lunch in the FiDi. Soups, salads and sandwiches all seemed fresh and portions hearty. Order at the counter and get a number. Outdoor seating in Leidsdorff Place is quiet and nice. Food is delivered quickly and prices are reasonable for the 'hood. Really enjoyed it.
Coworker: "What do you want for lunch today?"

I've been checking this place out a lot since it first opened because it's next to Bistro Burger, a place I go once in a while when I'm at work and always wondered what they had to offer. On the last day of my work, I finally decided to come here for their highly advertised fish n chips and by god were they fresh, juicy, tender, and delicious! It was a tad pricey but it was so fresh and delicious, it totally made my day so I just forgot about it being expensive. I really recommend the fish and chips to everyone. I would love to try this place again or at least come back for their fish and chips if I ever get a chance to go back down town. But financial district foods are always pricey.

I just grabbed a quick lunch the other day while I was working around the hood.  The interior design is very colorful and they serve a wide variety of fresh food.  The price is just about right.  Definitely will go back to try the rest of their menu.
Breakfast Burrito review:
I have been to the place two times, just to make sure it was not just a fluke the first time.

I really like the 3 salad option.  Their Chicken louie salad is super yummy.  The Jamaican jerk salad, pasta salad are pretty good too.  Pricy for what you get but sometimes you just want variety. Comes with a bread roll.
Eat here. It is good......

This place is OK. Not really A-Ok as the three star reading claims to represent, but just regular OK. The food is fine, albeit a little expensive, the setting is fine,  the service is fine. The real point is, you can do better by walking a block or so in any direction. Unless, maybe, you really want a cheesesteak, since they seem to be the only place around that does something like that.
Disappointing. My Philly cheese steak was pretty small and it tasted pretty bland.
Not bad. Fast. Casual. Easy.  Soup and sandwich was good. If you need a quick and tasty lunch, not pricey, this works.
I only take the time to write a Yelp review when I am extremely impressed or extremely disappointed. This review falls into the latter.

Didn't even get the Manhattan connection with the name til I just remembered now (duh), as it really is like one of those countless delis you would find all over midtown NYC. Awesome selection- next time I wanna try the Gyro or Philly. The pastrami was OK, but clearly was the presliced kind you could just as easily get at Costco...
Are you kidding me? I can get a decent Indian meal at lunch for $5? Why couldn't I have found this place earlier?

This place is great. I've been going here on and off for years now because my offices have been nearby. I usually get the takeout special, which has veg and non-veg options. The $5/$6 takeout is tasty, filling, and inexpensive. I love their beef meatballs takeout, and their veg options are very, very tasty, with a variety of vegetables in each dish, with a menu that rotates daily, especially for the veg options.

I've eaten a lot of indian food from a lot of Indian restaurants but I could say that Mehfil is the best without a second thought. First of all when I walked in the staff was very friendly and kind, which was awesome. The chicken tikka masala is to die for, my mouth is watering just thinking about it! They put the perfect amount of spices and the consistency is so good, the chicken is very tender. The Naan is simply the best. It is so so soft! I have no idea how they do it. I can say it's the best Naan you'll ever eat. Period. When it comes to Indian food, Mehfil is hands down the best restaurant to go to.

This is honestly the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to! The place is always clean and the staff is always nice and always helpful. They have a great variety for vegetarians too! Their naan is always fresh and always soft! The eggplant in tomato sauce is THE BOMB! I'm not a big fan of tomatoes but that dish is just so good! It doesn't even feel like you're eating something in a tomato sauce! Also their mango lassi is the best! It has the perfect amount of sugar and is the perfect consistency! If you're looking for some good Indian food definitely GO HERE! You won't regret it

I never write reviews for any places but this place is just so good that I had to!! I work in SF & whenever I work late, I ALWAYS order from here. Their chicken biryani is delicious!!!! Portion sizes are HUGE & can feed 2 people easily and possibly even 3. Their raita has just the right amount of spices. I could just drink it like a drink!! Their chili chicken is even better. I usually tell them to make it spicy and trust me..when u say that, they sure follow through! Their naan are very soft & thick..unlike other indian restaurants that make it thin & crispy. Their mango lassi and sweet lassi is the perfect consistency. It's like a milkshake. There's so many other foods that I haven't tried yet because these are just so delicious and I always crave it. This is something I look forward to every time I work late. Thank you Mehfil staff for always meeting my needs! If I could give them a higher star review but yelp only has 5 stars. Go here everyone!! You WILL NOT be disappointed!! Staff is as awesome as the food is.

I had the 5$ veggie lunch box.I bought 2 of them and apparently this is the only item that is CASH ONLY !! WTF!! You take cards for everything else and when i bought something for $10 you say CASH ONLY..! ? I ended up paying couple bucks extra to pay with card..
I have a very sensitive stomach to different food types, but I can say is I have tried almost everything on the menu and it is amazing. The flavor of all the dishes is so tasty.

Mehfil is back! Let me explain. When they moved up the street from their Folsom location, we noticed the food quality take a hit. This was our go to Indian delivery place but we decided to take a break after some disappointing experiences with food. Happy to say after that break we gave Mehfil another try and the food was good again. Our standbys chicken korma and butter chicken were delicious. The saag dishes are also tasty.  Prices aren't cheap but not unreasonable. Delivery service is generally prompt.

I am writing this review in less than 5 min i got the food...I asked for Plates & Plastic / silverware.....i did not get any.....i ordered authentic indian food and I myself can not recognize if it's the food I ordered.....anyways this place sucks BIGGGGGGGGG TIME........F T S
Started out ok. Over time you realize how little this tastes like Indian food. They use a lot of cream and a lot of color.

Very disappointed at the service of this place.  My Wife and I have eaten here before and decided to do take-out.  The food is not bad not spectacular.   My experience for this review is related to the service.
Don't dine in. This place is only good value if you get the daily 'to go special'.
These guys are just the worse.
Company catered lunch. I've had better Indian food, but this place is still pretty good! I'd probably stop by for lunch sometime if I wanted Indian.

So happy I found this place! Close to my work, fast service. Cheap lunch box; 6.00 chicken tikka masala.  The food was packed  hot to order, good portion, and most importantly, spicy delicious! YUM...I need my Indian food fix sometimes!

We got off the bart from Oakland and wanted Indian. We walked right into this place and were immediately greeted with friendly faces. We placed a takeaway order of garlic naan, samosa, and chicken korma. It was all very delicious. We had a few blocks to walk and everything was packed up in such a detailed manner that nothing spilled or leaked. The korma had just the right amount of spice. And we had leftovers for another day. The portions were great and the price was appropriate.

meh....this place is just ok.  The only thing I ever get here is the chicken tikka masala from the take-out section in the back.  The service isn't that great but what brings me back here is the $6 lunch plate that's pretty filling, there's hardly ever a long wait and it's across the street from my building.  The tikka masala sauce is almost consistent but sometimes it's way too spicy.  For the chicken, I don't think it's cooked with the sauce but grilled and then added after the sauce has been cooked because sometimes the meat is a little tough and dry.  I don't like that they keep their nann wrapped in foil in a water cooler so the bread isn't crispy anymore and you don't even know when it was made.  I think it was better when the restaurant was called Bindi.....it was 50 cents cheaper and they didn't keep their nann in a water cooler.

I am vegetarian and when I order off their a la carte, their food is delicious. And when I ask for spicy food, it is actually spicy. Most places do not give me spice to my level when I ask, so I like this place for that.
i dont know if its just today.. or everyday the same... its pathetically bad.. bewate of this place

Some people just love this place, but I found the seasoning on the dishes to be a bit mild for my taste.  They have a nice deal at lunch, served family style.  We did not leave hungry.  I can't think of a better Indian option in this area.
Bottom Line: One of the best tasting restaurants around and it is unbelievably inexpensive, $5!

The worst indian food i had in SF. I had ordered mehfil e khas curry with kadhai chicken. The rice was not at all basmati and the curries were pathetic to taste. Save your money and pick some other restaurant..
Terrible experience. Completely empty, we sat down and waited 15 minutes with no service. When I politely asked someone for help I got ridiculous response. This place is run by morons.
Always get the chicken tikka masala to go lunch box for $6 which is a good deal for the area and it's pretty good.
I mainly go here for lunch, and it's hard to beat the $6 plate full of food. The pick-up counter at the back is where it's at.
I wouldn't say this is the best indian food, but I always go to the back of the restaurant and get the take-out. Maybe the sit down, fresh food is better.

Maybe 4 1/2 stars. My first time at the restaurant, a midweek dinner. The host quickly seated me, took my order and my food was served promptly and pleasantly. Following everyone's recommendations I ordered the chicken tikka masala, which was tender and well but not over-spiced. The naan was freshly baked, hot and crispy.
The best Indian Food in San Francisco! My boyfriend and I are always here. The food is always great.

We asked for spicy paneer makhani and the only thing that the vegetable tasted of was chilly powder. Not good at all. Also they had added alot of synthetic color that even after washing twice my fingers look like cheeto fingers..

I ordered chicken tikka masala, veggie samosa, plain naan, and raita online through grubhub for delivery. Food came 30 minutes faster than expected, was still warm, and was delicious. The chicken tikka masala was very good and also came with rice (most places charge extra). The samosa came with 3 different sauces, so next time I won't order the raita (which was only a couple of bucks but was a huge serving that I don't know what to do with now). I would order from them again.
TL; DR: Great food! Slow delivery, broken online UI.

We love this place when ever we come to San Francisco but today it was quite disappointing. They quoted time the food was going to be ready as 10minutes and took over 25minutes to get it done with out a single update as far as what was going on there was hardly anyone in the restaurant. I would understand if the store was really business but a dead day like this restaurant s should work on their customer service a littke better than what it was today plus there were so many peoplw working in the restaurant I dont really know why it took so long. Disappointing very disappointing

This review is for their delivery only - I've never been in. Good food for good prices - the biryani was especially delicious, and the chicken tikka masala was a huge hit with my office. Generous portions, great naan, and they include rice with your order so you're never stuck with a quart of tikka masala sauce and not enough naan to soak it up. Haven't had anything from them I haven't liked yet, and they deliver on time. Definitely my neighborhood go-to place!
They're super cheap and fast, especially for a place in the financial district. They also deliver consistently on time.
I had the rhum sauce lamb which was really good. I didn't taste too spicy (maybe I got used to spicy food?). It's also very affordable and the dishes come in large quantities.

Man after the A's game we BART it over to Folsom to get a quick Indian cuisine craving fulfilled but oh CRAP! it's closed but there's hope a new paper sign saying they moved to 2nd Street. you mean to tell me we walked in a complete circle? Any how they moved and it seems like the food got better. I was a big fan of the Chicken Vindaloo and the Tikka Masala. The Na'an was awesome and we loved the Samosa's and the restaurant is a lot cleaner and they have their own bathroom now. no more sharing with another restaurant which is weird all itself. I highly recommend this I think it's better than Any of the Clay Oven Restaurants sparsed in different areas around the city

I have been at Mehfil a couple of times now and on both occasions, their food wasn't good. (More specifically, I was there for late dinners (after 8 PM) on weekdays). Also, the service wasn't very good - the person who waited on us wasn't too eager to please us. The food felt like it was made in a hurry for an lavish mid-night meal. Cannot complain about the quantity of the meal though - that was fine.

Awesome chicken tikka masala lunch box with rice for just $6! I swear they have the best chicken tikka masala in the city. I won't go anywhere else. The butter chicken is also amazing. When we get delivery, it's always chicken tikka masala and butter chicken with a side of naan. The dishes come with rice. The best!
Love it here. Fast lunch specials, good for dinner, delivery service. I have consistently gotten takeout from Mehfil and never been disappointed. Love the service, too.
For an Indian place, It has a way above average decoration, ambiance, and service. When it comes to food, you can't go wrong with the salmon tandoori. I would give definitely 5 for all tandooris.
A nice twist on your standard bar fare. We ordered from the Happy Hour menu: crispy cod bites, hummus, and brussel sprouts. All were excellent... Entire bar is "seat yourself."

hanging at the best sports bar in Sf! drinking leffe belgum blond beer with todd and john. food is good! great selection of european eclectic beer. tv's any where you look. just wish giants were winning!

I used to love coming here for after work drinks. The food is delicious, but the service is mediocre or just terrible. Last time, our server asked if we wanted another drink and after replying yes, he briskly walked away assuming we wanted the same. We tried to change the order at the bar, but bartender refused since he already poured the glass. That's a douche move. There goes your tip.

I had a reservation here for the Giants World Series game. At 11am the day of, they cancelled my reservation. If they weren't going to take reservations today, they should have shut it down on OpenTable a whole lot earlier than the day of, because now everything else will be booked. It's not like they didn't know the game was happening today, and the woman wasn't even very apologetic.

It's a standard place to get happy hour if you're in a larger group. They have booths around both the bars and plenty of free standing chairs + tables that you can drag together.  It's the kind of place you go to for an after work co-worker's birthday celebration that you're not that close with, but everyone else is going, so you might as well join in on the fun in case you miss out... GET IT?
Nice place for some food, drink and a game. But all of their tv's have lousy pictures. Seems like they could fix that.

A pretty cool bar location worth checking out if you happen to be in the area for happy hour. Although it seems that they try to cater to the restaurant crowd at times, the vibe and the core of this location is definitely sports bar originated.

Found my way to  the Royal Exchange after attending another event, and I have to say right away I like the vibe of the place. It's in the heart of the financial district, which is important to remember, because last call on a Thursday night is 10:45pm.  It's very manly feeling bar, the bar tops, tables, chairs all wooden, most of the bar is brick and wood. But I really liked it.

It's a nice watering-hole to get an after work drink. The inside has old-world solid mahogany wood (or was that oak). It looks warm and inviting. Makes your drinks more appealing. Maybe that's the ploy to get you to order several drinks and appetizers. HH is lively here with several TVs to get your sport on.

This is one of our usual lunch spots during the week.  The food is always good and the service is attentive but not too much.  Veronica on Friday July 18 2014, was especially funny and kept us laughing with her wit and great service.  Veronica has waited on us many times and remembers us and some of our favorite items.  Thanks Veronica!
TYPICAL IRISH BAR

Shitty service. I went to meet up with a friend and the hostess didn't wanna seat me until my friend got there. Nice so I have to stand here like a fool for 15 minutes? Give me a break. When  my friend got there and i asked to be seated since i was standing waiting forever, she said "I know you are waiting" and gave me a dirty look, wtf? This place was a waste of my lunch time.
Booths fit for four and waitresses that swoop in at just the right time, this bar is an after work gem.
Great place for lunch, food is always good. They just added Baby Kale salad and Arugula salads on the menu. Excellent choices!!

Excellent bar I have frequented in the Financial District for the past 4 1/2 years. They have something like 30+ beers on tap!! Excellent service as well as delicious food. Definitely would recommend!
Popped in here for some solo drinks and dinner whilst in town for work.

Come early to nab a table.  Our waitress was very nice and accommodated me quickly since I didn't have the same amount of time as the rest in my party.  She even went out of her way to offer me some options off the menu, since I was looking for something really light because I had to return to the office.  HH places need to have good service and this establishment did.  I'd go back for sure.
This is a cool after-work place.

Went here with co-workers for happy hour early on a Friday. Great selection of beers on tap with decent bar food. Made a reservation for a large party and we got a cozy room in the back all to ourselves. Would definitely come back for more happy hours.
This place has some of the best Salads for lunch.   Good size, excellent fresh toppings.    The steak sandwich with chimichuri sauce is addictively tasty.

Every time that i'm walk nearby this place I see a lot! of people inside. So the place very nice and pleasant. The burger not bad.and they have many kinds of beer. Probably they have more that bring so many people.so i recommend only after work because it's closed early /:

One of the best sport bar/restaurants I've been to. Great atmosphere along with convenient location. Great bartender with large selection of beers. Salad and chili are tremendous,  as well as great hamburgers. Potential for watching a game with the guys or taking the family out for dinner. I highly recommend the Royal Exchange.
I have been to the royal exchange MAYBE  4x in the past 5 years.... All for the same reason..

i come here after my 7pm Monday zumba class so it's surprising to arrive around 820pm and have the bar closing in just over an hour. i guess that's the problem with financial district bars... still, they have a great selection of beers on tap and super friendly and knowledgeable bartenders. i was steered into a Firestone Oatmeal Stout that was delicious! no regrets and a lot of thanks for that tip! when i strayed from that beer for my second round and didn't like what i got, the bartender swapped out my beer without question. i'll be back another Monday for sure!

Nice spot, food is average.  Last time here I had the BLT for lunch. Bacon was over cooked and burnt, for some reason they add raw onions to this sandwich, gross. They are stingy on the fries that come with your meal.  Fine for a drink, nothing exciting about the food
Actually it's. zero!!! The female server was so rude that we felt we were discriminated. If u are with color please ban this place!!!

I wasn't expecting too much for lunch at the Royal Exchange, mainly because I think of this place as more of a bar than a restaurant.  The menu features all the usual suspects of pub grub - burgers, ribs, fish and chips, blt, etc.  The attraction for me are their wonderful and enormous salads.  Read on:
Kwik Stop...

We ended up getting the back "room," - calling it such is a bit of a stretch, but it is more private than the bar. Still the beer specials were great, and the snacks tasty. Biggest reason i would return was the service. We had a woman who killed it with the witty banter, and kept the glasses from ever getting dry!

Food was very good but they went last call at 8:45 because it was "slow". When you have customers in the place (not just one but about 10) you don't do that. Especially when your hours are later. Seemed very shady and disrespectful of your customers. Won't be back. It's too bad because the food was spectacular and it seemed like a really cool bar. But ya, customer service is everything and they failed on this one.
Great burgers, great location for Fi-DI lunchers
I went to Happy Hour here and this overconfident bimbo bet me I couldn't do a backflip.  AND that if I did, she'd show me her boobs.
Nachos were the best in the city and lots of different kinds of beer on tap! Got the salmon blt and wasn't blown away though.
There are actually two pubs there on Sacramento, right next door to each other.  I picked the Royal because it had that classic "neighborhoodsy" look to it.

This place is a good place to drink but the food is expensive for what you get. I got the fish and chips for $13 and got 3 small pieces of fish and a handful of fries. The food was decent but not worth the money.

I'm a 'regular' who stops in here after work for a pint a few times a week.  Great selection of beer on tap - great micros and import selections.  I think it's an awesome spot for a happy hour gathering with co-workers.

I've been here a handful of times and I'm finally writing a review. I really only write reviews for places that make an impression on me, and the Royal Exchange has exceeded my expectations every time.

I've been here for lunch a couple times - it was OK. Not bad, but nothing to rave about. I'd recommend it for a casual happy hour or watching a game (it's spacious, which is rare for Fidi). Order a Moscow Mule and ask for a copper mug, but I'd pass on appetizers.

Came here on a Friday at 6pm and it was already crowded. Good beer selection and good HH deals. I had the cod bites appetizer. $4.95 for provably 10 plump pieces of cod. Yum! It died down quite a bit by 8pm tho.

Been here twice in the last 2 months for lunch. Had the Hot Pastrami and the Chipotle Chicken sandwich. Both very delicious! Just when I thought the chicken sando wasn't spicy enough, it kicked in!  It also paired quite well with my Total Domination IPA. Very solid beer selection. I will be coming here again soon!  Also bartender was very friendly. My advice: get here by 11:45 or you may not find a seat!

I work in the same building as this location of the Soup Company and get food to go from here all the time.  Ramona the Manager is a sweetheart and extraordinarily customer service oriented, and the entire staff is very professional and friendly.  The food is always really good and fresh, and you can't beat the value.  I often get a half sandwich (many choices) which at $3.45 is a deal and satisfies my lunch time needs.
A little expensive for soup (over $6.50 for a regular sized chicken soup), but really good!  Short line during lunch, too (though maybe I just got lucky).

Five stars for the kindness of the manager, who gave me a free soup after an embarrassing experience holding up the lunchtime line because I couldn't find my groupon deal on my smartphone but was convinced that I had already paid for it. Best smokey split pea soup I've ever had :)

A solid lunch choice in the Fidi area-- always quick, clean and with pleasant and efficient service! I like their chili quite a bit, which comes in a number of different types (turkey chili, white bean chili, black bean chili, veggie chili, etc.). The portions are hearty and it's great on a cold day (all too common in SF, of course). You also get a piece of bread with your soup so it comes out to a good filling meal at under $7. Can't beat that in the Fidi.
They sell what they say they do. I am not really blown away with the food or the service.
Great food, great customer service - win, win!

Love the southwestern corn chowder, but very pricey for soup, and keeps going up. Also, got a bad egg salad sandwich there a couple weeks ago. Couldn't even take one bite! Be careful of the stuff sitting out.

The creole crab & corn is quite a soup. It's probably technical to make, so I wouldn't want to attempt it.  Thank the lord that SF Soup makes it. It's so good and satisfying. I can hear Seinfeld screaming "the soup counts!". Go online and check their soup specials. Or better yet: sign up for their daily soup emails (hehe).  When you see CCC, run run run!
They are quick and efficient and friendly and have yummy food. What else could you ask for during a quick lunch break during work?
My salad was so fresh that there was a live caterpillar in it.  So fresh and so not clean. :(.

I work pretty close to this place- I had a hankering for soup one day so I headed here.  It's awlfully expensive for a bit of soup....$6.00!!  The employees are nice and the soup is decent enough.  I definately wouldn't make this a habit for lunch or soup for that matter.
My company orders lunch from here for us twice a week, so I've tried loads of their soups, salads, and sandos.  Here's a quick and dirty outline of what I suggest ordering and skipping:
Is it wrong to give 5 stars because I got a ticket that won me a free salad?
The roasted root stew is not bad... never had sweet potatoes in a soup before.
bought a 1/2 sandwich and soup today both were awesome!!!   try the creole crab and corn soup its the best and very inexpensive!!!!!

Why would you ever, ever go here?  You can get better soup in a can.  You can find better bread in your crusty office pantry.  I'd written ye olde SFSC off more than a year ago, but gave it one last try today:  turkey chili.  It was terrible, just like the chicken noodle soup and the chicken tortilla soup  that preceded it.  Please close down SFSC, and let another restaurant fill your space.

Ordered a Grandma Mary's Chicken Soup.  It was flavorless soup with dry, flavorless chicken meat (I'm sure was fed with antibiotics).  The product of thoughtless cooking.  How hard is it to make a flavorful pot of soup, I mean?  If you can't even do this, it's because you didn't bother to try.  I should just get a Campbell's canned soup and heat it up in microwave, and it will taste 5x better.  This is the last chance I give this "Soup specialist".  One time too many.

The SF Soup Company rocks! I recently started working downtown and purchased a Groupon to this restaurant. On my first day there, I ordered the Tomato Bisque soup and a side salad. Both were delicious, particularly considering this is essentially "fast food" (although that term implies that the food is poor quality, which the SF Soup Company is not). I went back the following week for the Market Vegetable soup, which was just as good. My only complaint would be that the soup is served SCOLDING hot, and after struggling to get the lid off of my biodegradable plastic container I burned myself, so be careful. Other than that they make yummy, healthy soup, and I will definitely be going back again (ps- all of their options and nutritional information is listed on their website- great for the health-conscious).
I love the chocolate cookie wrapped in plastic wrap.  Chewy, soft and partly uncooked?
Time for an update.....a Mac N Cheese update!

I ordered the split pea soup, and I was amazed at how flavorless and lame it was. They added some fresh cilantro, which was a nice touch, but this was the worst I've had. Ever. A canned Progresso soup would have been MUCH better. The half sandwich was OK, but the bread wasn't super fresh. I'm not coming back.

In an area like FiDi, it's nice to have this quick, cheap, and wholesome vegan option. All the soups are clearly marked so you know exactly which ones are vegan. My favorite is the Southwestern Corn Chowder, which is available at most locations (I think.) Pile that cilantro on.
This is a chain but a good fix for relatively cheap soup when I feel like it.

I get the same thing every time I go here for lunch: Mexican Tortilla soup with everything (cilantro, chips, cheese). I grab a hummus wrap to go for dinner. I usually go sometime between 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. and I quickly get through the line. A few times my co-workers will be in the salad line and they merge to the soup line because the service is slow.
Lots of G Free soup options clearly marked. Very delicious. THANK YOU
This is my favorite Soup Company location.  I don't know why, as the food tastes pretty much the same between locations.  But I love how quick it is here.

SF Soup Company has some very good - and some very blah - soups.  You can check their daily specials online, and they'll give you a free sample of any soup you haven't tried yet.  My personal favorites are the split pea w/ham and the shrimp bisque.  This particular location usually has a decent mac & cheese as well.  Their sandwiches are usually fresh and tasty.  Overall, a nice place for lunch.  I just wish they were open later.
Love all SF Soup Company's!
Big bowls of soup?  Fresh sourdough?  Caesar salads packed to go?  Perfect lunchtime meals.
Fast, convenient and under $10.
This one's the closest sfsoupco (as I like to truncate it) to where I usually work and on cold days I'll swing by and be in and out in under 10 minutes.
I don't love the soup, but they have KA oatmeal with all the fixins.
Got a groupon for ten bucks worth of food for five.  Thought I would give it a try even though I'm not a great fan of soup.
I love this soup place because it's very satisfying. Their soups are very flavorful and will definitely keep you full!

Great lunch option when you need something quick. Service is fast and friendly but my tip for the management would be to add spoons to the area next to the soda machine where they have napkins and other condiments. Why no spoons? There's always a jam of people trying to grab spoons by the station near the door since it's the only spot they have them out. Put them in both spots so we can all get out of there faster!
This happens to be MY soup company, thank you very much. =)
This place serves exactly what you think it does - soup.
Overpriced and generic tasting. The chicken noodle soup tasted like Progresso and I could find much better tasting matzo ball soup at even Max's.

Restrooms upstairs for customers, along with a carpeted area and tables and chairs. The matzo ball soup I had was so-so - some good hunks of chicken but the matzo ball was missing the schmaltz- chicken fat - to make it good. Super hot tempwise.

Sweet Jesus I love you Soup Company! Please open a location in NYC so I can get my fix.  I haven't even lived in CA for 2.5 years and I still dream of eating Mexican Chicken tortilla soup with a chunk of fresh sourdough.....
Very consistent and solid lunch option in FiDI

Location location location. Pasilla is one of those restaurants where if they were located almost anywhere else, nobody would eat there. In the FiDi, now that El Faro has closed , there's almost no other Mexican fare. After my meal today though I'm definitely walking a couple blocks further to Chipotle for my Americanized sterilized tacos.
Personally I'm not a big fan of Mexican food but these guys make it really good. I've had nothing but good experiences with this place.
Consistently horrible service with only mediocre food.
Burritos are always decent and very filling. I usually go with the pork or chicken and been satisfied every time.
Don't let the location fool you. Although it's in Chinatown, the food is decent Mexican food. Good portion sized meals and tasty. I would give it five stars but it's a little on the pricey side.
