the free Jicama salsa is what keeps making me go back- in addition to the yummy food!

Food ok, guac ok, everything is just ok, to me it tasted sorta like chipotle but with slight more flavor, but different flavor. It was definitely edible and fresh tasting, just not too good. I was not a fan of the rice, but the gripped chicken was good, I am slightly disappointed overall.

Nice spot on Kearny for a quick lunch or dinner for work. The portions are pretty large. Got a single taco and it was huge, can't imagine having three of them, as they normally come. My main gripe about the place is that things were really salty. I got the regular grilled chicken taco and it was too salty for my taste. But, do NOT skip out on the guacamole and chips here. Definitely worth it. Fresh and delicious. Sure, your breath will suffer, but your stomach will be willing to apologize to your coworkers on its behalf.

Honestly, the best $8.50 I've spent for a nice salad in the area in 5 years.  Delicious. Fresh.  The servers were great.  I definitely recommend eating here verses spending the money for less food at Chipotle.
Better than Chipotle but, not by much.
It's really a 3.5, but their salsas def bump it up to a 4.
Spicy chicken tacos, mmmmmmm.

I was impressed with the Burrito Bowl I got here. I tried the Spicy Chicken and was pleasantly surprised the used chicken breast. It was tasty, flavorful and very filing. I really like the jicama slaw on the salsa bar.
Got a steak burrito.

After working two blocks away for the past 6 months I never took a second look at this place. I am from Texas but Mexican food is not my favorite, but my new MOGL app made me try this place. I was not disappointed. I ordered the spicy chicken bowl with peppers and onions added and the flavor was delicious! I gave four stars because there was not as much rice as I would have liked. The bowl was really perfect because I am cutting carbs anyway. I will go back again and again!
the times I've eaten here, I end up with the worst digestive discomfort which includes the worst  heartburn... I'll be avoiding this place.
tiny but good price & a delicious burrito. definitely going to be going back.
3.5 stars
Hey this is the place on the corner on Kearny and Pine where you can go if you are tired of waiting 1 hour in line to get into that Ramen place 2 doors down.

I like the food here, but they have lost my order before and did not offer anything for the 25 minutes I had to wait.  Not even an apology.  Luckily I was with a group of people who all got pissed off as well and none of us will be going back.  You need to at least say sorry and offer a bag of chips.
RUDE!  I recommend going to Tlaloc
I had a sub-par burrito here for $10. Never again. Just go to El Faro across the street and save some money.

I Agree with Mark D. This place is tiny! it literally has 8 chairs! I counted. Definitely better for takeout than dine in. Luckily, I went at an extremely odd hour - 3.30pm. Most other food joints were closed or cleaning up for the evening so I stumbled on this joint by accident and laziness (didn't want to walk too far).
The marinated steak tacos are beyond excellent! .....perfectly seasoned...everything I had was fresh, and my 3 taco order was plenty to eat....I will be back!

I'll give credit where credit is due...the marinated chicken is muy bueno.  However, what do I look like having to pay $1.75 for guacamole on what's otherwise a super burrito? Why is guacamole only served on the vegetarian burrito? Can we say RIP-OFF CHIPOTLE?! Not to mention the teenie tinie "Salsa Bar"...smh I'll make sure to hit up the Food Court should I desire a burrito while at work!!!

I always love getting away from the chain restaurants and finding better alternatives, and I think that Pasilla is one of the best substitutes to Chipotle. Their spicy grilled chicken bowl is filled with my favorites, and the proportion of each fits my liking perfectly. The bottom is layered with Spanish rice, but it's definitely not a large amount. The health freak in me loves that this bowl is more high protein and low carb. On top of that is a layer of beans, either black or pinto that are not too wet so that the rice gets soaked. Finally, they generously pile on the lettuce, pico de gallo, and chicken. The grilled chicken is extremely flavorful and you really get the grill taste in every bite. They also have a great selection of different salsas to add that extra kick, however spicy you want it to be. Pasilla has definitely become my go-to place for burrito bowls, and I definitely suggest splurging on a little guac to complete the entire thing!
This is the best burrito in the Fidi area for lunch. I like the spicy chicken burrito. Food is fresh and served fast. Better than El Faro across the street and Chipotle.
Quick stop for lunch if you order a burrito, not so much if you order a quesadilla. Not much room to sit, mostly a grab and go place.

This place has one lame burrito. Pork was chewy and dry. Burrito itself was dripping wet with hopefully tomatoes or salsa, but halfway through it's almost inedible. The guy asked me if I wanted "spicy", so I said yes but it wasn't spicy at all. Sad state of burrito affairs in downtown SF.
I've said it once, I'll say it again. They make a well-distributed burrito. Don't have to worry about getting a bite of only rice or only beans--well mixed!

My officemate and I get lunch at Pasilla probably once a week, possibly slightly less often. I dig this place, it's like Chipotle with actual food. The chipotle adobo dressing on the salad is aces, and the salsas can't be beat. Everything I've tried at Pasilla has been delicious -- I am primarily vegetarian, so I can speak only to their animal-free offerings, but I am given to understand the chicken quesadilla is also excellent. Prices are average for the FiDi, service is fast and friendly.

Steak burrito was delicious with just the right amount of spicy salsa on it. It also had good amount of cheese, which I happen to love. The beans were flavorful and the tortilla had a nice texture. They have a fresh jicama salsa that cooled down the heat when needed at the lovely salsa bar.  Salsa bar had roasted pasilla peppers. I did not try them this time but other people did, so I am guessing they are good. You do have to purchase the chips separately, though. Much better and a bit less expensive than Chipotle.
Not totally authentic if you compare this with a taqueria, but it sure beats the Chipotle places that are dotted around the Bay Area.
the steak salad with guacamole is terrific.
I came for the first time and was impressed. Didn't know what to expect, but the flavors was flavorful and delishes. Also the price was fair!

i was walking around w bb after work looking for some food in an area that is noticeably lacking in good food imo.  we came upon this and thought why not.  its basically a local version of chipotle and prices are a little cheaper.  chicken bowl was decent.  plenty of chicken that was pretty tender.  could have been a little juicier.  veggies were fresh and ingredients were heaped on in the right proportions.
My NEW goto place for a burrito @ lunch.  Hard to beat.

The salad was huge but the price seemed a bit much.  I would actually prefer if they had a smaller/cheaper option.  Overall though the chicken in it was delicious and the salsa I got from the salsa bar and used as dressing complimented it well.  I would maybe return here if I happened to be in the area.  It really is another Chipotle without the chain and same price.
Another word to describe Pasilla has got to be PLAIN... Boring might be a close second.

Amazing breakfast sandwiches!  Breakfast boat is soooo yummy!  New favorite!!   The bread is warm and soft, yet slightly toasted. The cheese eggs and Tita all melt together. The saltiness if the sausage is perfect!!  Will definitely start coming here in the mornings!!

I don't understand all the high reviews this place gets, their sweet potato tots are usually a little raw in the center, their turkey burger meat tastes stale, their other burgers are mediocre at best, and their execution is spotty and unreliable. The previous Burger joint in that location was much better. I only come here when the SuperDuper and Bistro Burger lines are too long, but no more.

I think that being new to the food court that is located in Rincon Center with other competitors, is the reason why their food and the staff flow is to be determined or to be for the better on improvement.

The skin-on French Fries made me happy with just the right amount of crispiness and salt.  Fries aren't usually much better than a ketchup vehicle, but these were delicious stand-alone as was the basic burger with it's lettuce, tomato, sauce and sauteed onions.
The sliders are so tasty. The bread for the sliders tastes fresh. The cashier is very friendly. I will be back.

This new lunch spot popped up in the Rincon center a couple months ago, and I finally gave it a try today. The line goes out the door during peak lunch hours, just like any other food spot in the Rincon center, but the line moves fairly quickly. I got the waffle sandwich with bacon and eggs. From the moment I saw the worker toss a soggy waffle into a panini press, I was unimpressed. Even worse, when I bit into the waffle sandwich, the waffle was still soggy! I would definitely not order this again. I'm giving this place 3 stars still because the fish and chips looked fresh and crispy, and the fries were really good. I'll come back and give this place another shot.

I really love the menu here. I had a hard time deciding what to order both times I went because it all looks so good.They put a new and interesting spin on things like having an egg on a burger or fried ice cream sandwiches. The burgers are so good, probably one of the best I have had in a long time. I can't wait to go back and try the desserts.
I have had the burger a few times which is always good, and last time my wife ordered the veggie skewers which were awesome.  Good food, fast and friendly service, and will be back.

The food court at Rincon Center is essentially the urban equivelant of a highway rest area.  It's role is to provide a quick meal for those working in the area but you need to have modest expectations.  If your alternative is going to One Market almost any option here is good enough and a quarter star better because you didn't pay $30 for lunch that day.

I love Roadys- it is what is says it is.  Generously sized and economical, quality ingredients.  If you have trouble ordering or understanding the concept, well, I don't think they can help you, you can't even help yourself.  It's a burger that's easier to eat, it's not supposed to be Michael Minna or Wolfgang Puck's version of a burger.
Why mess with the form of something that has been a great success if there is nothing to gain from it? I mean, perhaps to allow bacon strips to fit better?
What can I say...  This was my fourth time at Roadys Longburger and I'm still a fan!

I work in the Rincon Center and this place has been a WELCOME addition to the food court!  The staff is amazingly nice and accommodating and their short order cook is irreplaceable!  Currently I'm on the Paleo diet and they have helped me create a Louisiana Hot Link salad with egg and avocado that is to die for - and when they were out of sausages, I tried it with the bacon and burger & it was equally fabulous!  Have never been disappointed and worth every cent...I hope they don't mess with the formula (as start-ups tend to do)...it's working!

The Long Burger was pretty good.  But the experience at the store wasn't great.  Menu hard to read.  The ordering process was confusing.  Not much ambiance.  Par for the course with Rincon Center.  The whole food court there is on average a 3-star experience.

Awesome lunch spot! The OMG burger is a must try. A cheese burger with fried eggs! Sign me up. Really unique sides like Angry Edamame. Yum getting hungry just thinking about it. A definite place to check out. I have eaten a lot of burgers all around the world. Roady's is definitely one of the greats!

It's more than just a burger, it's an explosion in your mouth. The meat was juicy and was cooked to perfection. I hope I'm not exaggerating too much but there is no other way to describe this place. Must try when your around the area. The service is also excellent. It's rare to have a fast food place provide not excellent food quality but also great service.

The burger was excellent, and the service was supper fast. If you're the kind of person who does not have time to wait for more than 5 minutes for your food, then this place is perfect for you. I had the Corned Beef Hash Sliders and the Grilled Pesto Chicken Sliders both of these were amazing!!!! They were grilling the chicken per order, how many fast food place actually grill their chicken per order ? Probably none... (Well, at least not in the Rincon food court anyway) My food was super fresh and delicious.
CANNED CORNBEEF HASH, oh no they didn't!
The Burger was tasty and the fries were great. Not greasy at all. The service was fast, I would recommend it to friends. The idea alone is brilliant, I look forward to eating there again.

Decided to check out the second new addition to Rincon Market. The burgers at Roady's Longburger is true to its name as far as the shape goes. Instead of your traditional round patties. they serve it similar to a hot dog shape in a deli roll.
Time: 12:37pm/74°F partly sunny

The line at SOMA Chicken was out the door so I decided to give Roady's a shot. I had the Louisiana hot link sandwich and onion rings. I couldn't even finish the sandwich. Next time, I'll get to SOMA Chicken before the lunch crowds hit.

Just checked out this new spot after reading the positive reviews.  I must say, I was very impressed. I had the OMG burger and it is the best burger I have had in San Francisco by far.  The tater tots were great as well.  Can't wait to go back and try the other items on the menu.
So yummy.  Amazing burger and love the bun too.  On top of it, super friendly service.

New to the area and checking out various quick and easy places for lunch. Didn't have high expectations for Roady's but was pleasantly surprised - I had their OMG Burger, which is a fairly standard burger with an over-easy fried egg thrown in.
Nothing to complain about here. Couldn't distinguish this burger from the countless ones I've eaten at the Olympic Club. Fries were tasty and I believe the value is good.

As you can tell I haven't written a review in nearly 4 years.  But, I'm a burger guy and I'm always trying the new burger joint in town.  Roadys is the best burger in the FiDi hands down.  I've read some of the reviews and I don't think some people know the difference between greasy and juicy.  This burger is all juicy with the amazing grilled onion spread and the grilled bun.  If you even like burgers you need to go try this place and then you'll love this burger.
Took my 1st grade son and he liked the burger.  I really enjoyed the dessert  "crema pressata"...unique and very good!

Not very impressed by this new place... Their burger are very average (I'm generous) and I still don't understand the longburger thing. The person giving the food was lazy and my order was sitting there for a few minutes. I had to ask him to give me my food.

Tried this place out yesterday after walking by the store several times after my meetings.  Just for curiosity, I ordered the OMG burger because of the egg, and a side of sweet potato tots.  I must say the OMG burger was actually delicious.  The egg gave it that new flavor.  I would definitely eat that again, and also curious to try their other burgers and sandwiches.

Tried this new spot when I was in town last week and LOVED it! I had the OMG burger and my coworker had the sausage. Best lunch we had in that area all week, hands down. We just wish there was one near our NY office!
Loved this place! The burgers are looong!
loved the fresh sausages, great burger

I work across the street from the Rincon Center and saw this new burger place.  I figured  I would give it a try and it turned out to be the best decision I made all day.  The burger was very tasty (think Super Duper) and who doesn't like tater tots.  I will definitely be going back.

Just tried it for my first time and let me say...I was very impressed.  I had the Cheeseburger with french fries and it was delicious.  I love the concept of the burger on a hot dog bun.  It was perfectly cooked, not greasy and super juicy! Oh and I  have to mention the relish really made this Burger memorable.  I prefer this place over Super Duper any day!  I would come back in a second.  Can't wait to recommend it to all my friends!

It's just OK, nothing special.  But that's par for the course in Rincon Center.   I will agree with Morris C. that it is less greasy than SuperDuper.  I was glad to see the 2 women behind the  from the previous burger place are still employed there.

Not impressed at all. I ordered the Longburger w cheese and it was so soggy and greesy. The meat had no taste and the bread wasn't crispy or at least heated up. I asked for no pickles or tomatoes and sure enough they put it on the burger. Super Duper burger is way better across the street and worth the extra wait. Never coming back here again. I don't think they will last very long the way they are going.

Literally the worst burger I've ever had. I mean I'm no expert cook but how do you mess up something so simple as burger and fries? No flavor whatsoever and greasy as all hell. McDonald's has better burgers and fries and I absolutely hate McDonald's..... But, that's just my opinion. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Stick to super duper
I love the combination of ingredients for the OMG burger, feels less oily than super duper burger and great price! I cant wait to come back!

I had the beef noodle soup and it was sub-par.   Traditional beef noodle soup base is made from bones cooked for a long time and it has that cloudy look in the soup.  I think they mainly use soup powder for their soup because their soup is relatively clear.  I recommend Gold Star just a block up instead.
T'was the day after the Giants won their third World Series in the past five years and I might have been, allegedly, really feeling it that morning.
Their Pho Ga soup is fantastic.  The noodles were so good, and the broth was fantastic.  Not too salty and with a depth of flavor that was surprising.  Plenty of veggies too.

Today 10/15/14 I went to the Worst pho in the world!!!!!! Don't go this place is horrible, the service, the food. The worst part is the people in the kitcken fighting with the poor waitress. Never ever ever again!!!!
Came here for the chicken noodle soup. Chicken was very flavorful surprisingly.  Their noodle is actually just ok. However, their service is way above average for an asian restaurant.
Service was ok. Spicy beef noodle soup was solid, but not great.
Omg, worst pho ever.  It was salty, so salty.  It was like eating a salt lick.
Tried out Joy Hing BBQ Noodle.  Matt G. said it's one of the cleanest restaurant in Chinatown, I'd say so.  It's also more expensive to eat there too.
Hole on the wall of many in China town. Has all the  glamour you need for an authentic taste and they serve you right away even when busy. Fairly inexpensive. Quick Chinese food fix while at work.
3.5 STARS for food. 4 STARS for service.
We use to visit the old location once in a while and have not been back since they moved.  They new space is nice.  It is clean and larger and new.

I am a huge fan of Turtle Tower, and it bums me out that they close at 5pm (TL location) so I can never get my pho ga fix on weekdays.  Then I heard about Joy Hing.  I  have been meaning to try this place for weeks but didn't get around to it until this past Friday.  Friday lunch, changed. my. life.

This would have been a 4 star rating but they jacked me on the chicken. I ordered a large pho ga after asking my server if the large size would be more chicken than the regular size and she said yes of course so I ordered the large. When it came, it barely had any chicken in it. It was even less chicken than the regular size. I'm giving it 3 stars because the chicken and broth was good. I'll definitely give it another try and if I get screwed the second time, I will update this review and give it a 2 star for lying to me about the chicken!

The bathrooms were in excellent condition and they decorated this place nicely.  Service was decent and so was the pho.  Can't say it was 4 stars as the beef pho was good but this place is hard to get to compared to the many pho places where I live in Pleasanton that I can drive up to the door and park easily.  Came here based on high Yelp reviews so I kinda expected something more interesting that what their menu offered.  Still a good pho place and it is a nice, clean place to enjoy soup.

What other place do you get a personal one cup brew of refreshing Vietnamese coffee right in front of your twinkling eyes? Here, buddy. Oh and lets talk about their food, absolutely clean tasting and left me full a little less than halfway done. Joy Hing gave me much joy indeed. :D next time, pho!
tip: the green onion ginger mixture is too oily and way too salty.

SF yelpers really let my family and I down with your glowing recommendations of this place!  Perhaps I should have ordered the pho because the chicken, rice, Mongolia beef and the Jasmin tea was dismal at best.  The people were nice, but couldn't understand or speak much English.  Very disappointing and waste of money..I was skeptical of Chinatown restaurants already and this experience further confirms it.
What a cute little Pho restaurant.  Gets my vote for best one in China Town!  Plus the staff is very friendly!

I've never really had pho ga prior of coming but after I came here, I was amazed. There aren't that many reviews for this place because the friend who recommended it told me that they've recently moved.  Let me note that I'm writing this review after having tried pho ga again at three other places (one including the famous Turtle Tower - not impressed, btw) so I'd stop by here if you're craving some Chinese-style Pho Ga that comes with the delicious ginger and scallions concoction!

do not be alarmed. that eye bulging, mind searing headache you have is just an MSG induced reaction from the pho ga. if anyone in your office is wondering why you are  walking like a dehydrated zombie, just tell them you're audtioning for "the walking dead". which is exactly how i feel right now.
My vietnamese boyfriend and I had springrolls and a beef pho here and it was a perfect lunch!
Got the pho ga that everyone raved about. The chicken and broth are both very bland. $7.50 for a large bowl. Extra star for an above average decor in comparison to other Chinatown restaurants.
Passed by on a walk to the mall and Joy Hing caught my eye. I looked it up on Yelp and since it had so many favorable reviews I decided to stop for a bowl of pho on my way back home.

This place must be new because it is clean & bright, unlike most other Chinatown joints.  The staff is pretty friendly & the menu is extensive.  But on a recent lunch outing in chilly SF we all knew what we wanted...pho ga!
I LOVE PHO GA!

Pho Ga large bowls are HUGE. The hanai chicken is DELICIOUS and their portions here are huge. No wait during a busy lunch hour. If you're looking for a nice, cleaning-looking restaurant, then don't come here. But if you just want good Chinese food and don't care for the decor, then come here.
Love the chicken pho here. Also this is the only place I know where they give you the green onion, ginger, and oil sauce to go with your chicken!

This hole in the wall family run place is the ones we like to seek out, the food was just good wholesome Cantonese and a touch of Vietnamese dishes.  Our server was very sweet and attentive!  We were a party of 5 and we ordered 6 dishes and the total bill came to $ 75 which was very reasonable for such a wholesome and tasty meal!
Pho bowls are large, but when you put the chop sticks inside the broth you realize you have just that; a bowl of broth.
Serves very good chicken pho.

Now I'm not usually a harsh critic. If something is good I'll admit its good. This place though...HORRIBLE. I ordered for delivery and it literally took 2 WHOLE HOURS to arrive. I called the place and they completely ignored me. The food we got was COLD and nothing about this place impressed me. This is probably the worst food delivery I've ever had. On top of everything, the guy dared nye for a bigger tip!!! UH NO. you took 2 hours to get to a place not even 10 minutes away from you.
Giving this place a 3.5 because I can't muster up the will to give it a 4. Interior is very pretty. Staff is polite. Dimly lit and quiet atmosphere. Grab the Groupon before coming here.
Prices are very reasonable and the noodles are delish! I had the pork belly noodles and the flavor was so good. It was a nice ratio of juicy fat and tender meat. The broth was very tasty.
Food was good, but this place has seen better days.  They weren't making fresh noodles when we were there.

It's cleaner than it's of the places on Chinatown and the menu is extensive. Decent prices but you get what you pay for. Got won ton soup (generous bowl but far too SALTY broth that was laden with MSG), unagi hand roll (decent) and a spicy Alaska roll (salmon, avocado) that was a bit subpar. The rice was a bit warmer than expected and the spicy sauce lacked punch. I'd give this place 2.5 stars if I could. Okay for a quick cheap meal if you're looking for a slightly cleaner joint the place was nearly empty when I went in on a Wednesday night around 730pm.

This is a Japanese restaurant with strong Chinese touches. It's very good: cleaner and newer than most restaurants in Chinatown, more modern in style, and Chinatown prices to match (i.e., VERY inexpensive and VERY reasonable). Large bowls of soup with hearty broth are only $8. I ordered the pork belly soup: the broth was fantastic, the pork was extremely flavorful (cooked in 5 spice, so Chinese), but the meat could have been fresher. The udon noodles were fantastic as they tasted fresh! The separate dish of sashimi slices were large. I had the mochi ice cream balls and they were a tiny bit freezer burnt, but not too much to complain about.

Ordered on Foodler. Took 2 hours to deliver on a Tuesday evening. Delivery driver was SO RUDE. As soon as he got to the door, he started interrogating me on how I was going to tip him. "Are you paying cash for tip? Is it on the slip?" He was rude, pushy, and disturbing about demanding I tip him the second I opened the door.
Ended up here when it became later then we realized on a Sunday night in Chinatown and it was the most appealing option still open.

I was surprised to see so many unrealistic negative reviews for this place! This is actually a great spot for lunch if you work in the area and are craving Japanese style cuisine. I say "Japanese style" because although the menu is a mix of Chinese noodle dishes, and Japanese cuisine, it's all hearty and they even have vegetarian broth as an option!
This place is open late and that's why we went there. Also it is near the Hilton. The noodles were OK. Nothing memorable. Its nice that they are open late.
The oysters were amazing! Ordered them a second time the same visit!
I came here because I had Groupons to use here.
Great food, excellent price, horrible service.
A couple of reasons why it's not good.
I think Seafood noodles taste really good don't like people say that bad soup bone soup is very thick, and all are hand noodles I feel very delicious
Ordered two soy sauce chicken with toasted duck ramen , a beef udon , fried chicken wing and a Alaska roll for delivery.

Why I am a fan - late night noodles at a reasonable price.  my buddy and I strolled in after extended happy hour.  starved, we ordered up noodles and a bunch of side plates (including a rainbow roll which was pretty good).   Chicken Katsu - superb.  Pork Ramen - very good.
Seriously, what is this playing trying to be?

Came here with the bf on a groupon deal. The noodles were pretty good! At least one of the top that I have had in the city. The food comes really fast, the noodles came before our potstickers! I had the braised beef and the bf had the pork belly. We both agreed that the pork belly was the better of the two but they both were great dishes. The potstickers tasted good too. Would definitely come to eat here if you have a conference close by.
Avoid this place at all costs! The service is horrendous! There are a lot of better places in the city. Trust me!
I ordered from Eat24 because I was really craving sushi and I didn't want to leave my room for food because it was one of those lazy days.

Came here twice because we purchased a groupon, and on both occasions the restaurant was pretty empty.  The oolong noodles are their take of handmade udon (not ramen like most people expect when they come here).  We had the porkbelly and braised pork noodle soup, and a couple of sushi rolls.  The sushi was mediocre, nothing special, but I thought the noodles were pretty good! The only thing is their broth could use more flavor.  The noodle soup also had tofu, seaweed, hotdog, fish cake, enoki mushrooms, egg, and a weird meatball thing. This place stays open pretty late and they have a humongous menu, so if I was ever in the area and looking for a clean place to eat, I would give it another shot.
After 6 months,  the restaurant did improve . The portion was bigger and the booth taste like kitchen made.
I am a fan of anything soupy so my friend and I decided to try this place in Chinatown for lunch. The noodles are really good and chewy, the soup is more mild than more ramen places. Pretty good!

My mom, sister, and I ordered 3 bowls of noodles, Maki roll, and uni (sea urchin) nigiri. It took awhile for noodles to arrive, which was surprising given that the place was not overly crowded. Portions are on smaller side for Chinese cuisine, and the noodles were fine but nothing to write home about.  My beef brisket noodles had a big piece of meat (tendon? Unidentifiable, which I'm usually fine with) that was literally impossible for me to chew through. Ever enterprising when it comes to food, I attacked it in a myriad of ways - dunking it under the soup, shredding it into smaller pieces, etc. No dice. What were you, mystery meat?? A piece of titanium in protein form? I would never know.

Delicious.  Had the shredded beef and some rolls.  Food came out fast and was amazing.  Only hangup was getting the check.  Had to go find the waitress.  Then waited a long time again only to find that you have to pay at the register.  Or maybe you don't I dunno.  Just took too long waiting for her to come back and get the credit cards.

My parents, sister, and I came here after a long day of moving things in and out of my new apartment. By then, most of the restaurants around the area were closed, so we were somewhat relieved when we found this little joint on the edge of SF Chinatown. When we walked in, there was only one other party of 4 in the entire restaurant, but I guess that was understandable considering it was almost 11pm.

I ordered cucumber rolls, maguro sashimi, ebi, amaebi, hamachi handroll, and uni. The good news is that the delivery was fast and the presentation of the food in the little plastic containers was awesome. The bad news is that the sushi was just plain average and I would not order it again.

Ordered these items to go: Japanese Beef Noodle Soup, salmon sashimi, and two orders of California rolls.  Thought that it would be enough food for two people to get full off of, but unfortunately I was wrong.  All the portions for everything I ordered were small. Plus, my Japanese Beef Noodle Soup got cold, literally, in the time it took for me to walk just a couple of blocks to sit down and eat it. Which makes me think that it probably wasn't hot when it left the kitchen.  I waited for my food in their reception area, it took about 20-25 minutes.  The restaurant didn't appear to be busy (it was dinner time), but from where I was sitting, I couldn't really see into the rest of the restaurant.  I didn't hear any other customers there, but while I was there waiting for my food, about 4 people came in to the restaurant to sit down and eat.

I was hung over. I ordered through Grub Hub. I got the slow cooked pork belly ramen soup. It was pretty good, and cheap. The pork was savory and tasty. I got it with pork broth,it was not too rich and not too salty.  I also ordered a Three Amigos roll. It was cheap and good enough to eat and not feel disgusted. The delivery person was nice and the order came within 30 minutes! I will order delivery from this place again.
Great for students.

I have never complaint in yelp but we are so angry with no apologies after we found a fly in the soup when my gf just finished the half way...ill. This fly is not small and so hard to be seen because we thought it might be a seaweed pieces or pepper like things in the soup.

Ordered sushi and veggie tempura for delivery.  Food was 45 minutes late, tempura was soggy and bready, fish was low quality, sushi was gross (and it's my favorite food). Definitely won't be ordering from here again!

I am having this most beautiful, spicy Japanese beef soup. A HUGE bowl, of incredible broth, which I am slurping down feverishly (and doing a bad job of keeping from splattering on my shirt!). Full of noodles, beautiful beef, tofu, vegetable... Yum.

3-stars for their noodle, but 4-stars for their bento boxes!! Came here a few times for their noodle soup (supposedly ramen)....it's really not that good, but acceptable. Went again yesterday to try their bento boxes and it was delicious!!! I ordered the Beef Teriyaki with Eels rice. It also comes with house salad and soup. The portions are big and filling. I would come here again, but not for their noodles.

Pretty darn good and possibly one of the least expensive sushi places around. Only got sushi rolls and veggie tempura but it was good. The fish was fresh and the specialty rolls were extensive and really good.

this place is hit and miss. I think it really depends on what you order. I think I'd stick to the simpler Japanese style soup noodles, as some of the fancier combinations didn't seem to work.  I found mine to be too salty and kind of gloppy. Plus I had a couple pieces of steamed broccoli that were "off".
For dinner on Sat 7/19/14 I decided to try out Oolong Noodles Restaurant in the FiDi/Chinatown border.  It's on the side of the Hilton Hotel in Chinatown.

Came here when I was near to the area and craving some ramen.  Although the noodles aren't ramen it was still really good and would definitely come back again.  I got the BBQ Spareribs Noodle Soup and it did not disappoint.

My Mom and I ate at the Oolong Noodles Restaurant today for lunch, and we were both very pleased with our bowls of noodles and an appetizer of tempura.  The service was excellent, the environment clean and spacious, and of course, the food delicious.  Highly recommended.
I have passed by cafe med numerous times and today i finally decided to give it a try after i heard good things about cafe from one of my co-workers.

It was my first time there, I was in a hurry (trying to make it back to my desk before anyone realized i was gone). I grabbed a to go box and filled it with samples of some of my favorites: falafel, hummus, chicken curry, chicken masala, the noodle salad, the fried fish, and some naan.
Chicken fight.

Love cafe med! Their food is fresh and healthy. And the 50% off salad and hot bar is perfect and pocket-friendly for a late lunch! A million times better than chez fayala where they load up on grease and have the most unfriendly cashiers in SF.
How did I not know about this place till now.... I would give it a 4.5/5, but there was no option. This review is only for their LUNCH BUFFET

With plates big enough to serve a family,  I think I found my lunch spot to feed my Tikki Masala cravings. I Love it. Didn't order any of the dinner plates and went with the buffet style lunch. Great options and the food was just as good. Their chicken curry lacked taste but they made for it with their Tikki Masala. Prices were surprisingly reasonable. I walked out paying a little less than $8 for my plate of food.  Three things I would get again when I come back would be;

I came here for lunch with a friend and this place is insanely packed around lunch time. At Cafe Med, you have two options to get your food: you can grab food from the food bar (priced by the pound) or you can order at the back counter. I did the latter, and while that meant I didn't have to go through the massive line of more than 30 people, I still ended up waiting a long time for my lamb wrap to be made. The lamb wrap was nothing spectacular, but for around $8, I got what I expected. Overall, the wrap was a little bland (definitely ask for hot sauce if you want a bit more flavor) and could have been warmed up more on the panini press. Would I come back here again? Yes, but definitely not my first choice. If you're willing to walk a few blocks down, there's a Halal truck on Fremont and Market that I think is much better.
I love stopping by Cafe Med over the lunch hour when I can't decide exactly what I want to eat. They always have a great variety and I leave very satisfied. Great pricing too.

Stopped in here for a quick bite and I must say I was surprised at how much I liked it! The variety of foods and quality of the dishes made it a very pleasant dining experience for me. I stopped in after 2pm so I got a huge plate of food for only $6...was pretty crazy. I really enjoyed the chicken tikka masala, falafel, and fried fish the best. There was also a really flavorful cauliflower salad they had that day. Obviously it's hard to recommend just one thing since it's a rotating salad and hot food bar...but it seems to me this is a great place if you need something to eat and are in a hurry.

I primarily go to this restaurant when I want fish. The fried fish is good, but the roasted fish is better. Their rice is terrible so I never get that, but their scalloped potatoes are delish as is their cucumber salad. Otherwise, the selection is not that great for me as I'm not a fan of chicken or pasta. It's an ok place, especially after 2:00 when their prices go down to half off. Nice inside and outside seating. I'll have to try their burgers sometime as I'm always looking for a good burger place.
Work got several trays of breakfast sandwiches from this place. Every single sandwich inexplicably has sour cream on it. Sour cream? On a breakfast sandwich? Ugh.  Not even on the side.

This review is for the hot food buffet only.The hot food selection is just blah- I feel like majority of the food were for vegans! If you plan to eat the hot food buffet, I highly recommend getting the to-go box vs the plate they have EVEN if you are dining in. They weigh the food by pound. So obviously you save money if you get the to-go box to put your food in because it weighs less than the plate.

One of the best, quick lunch spots in the financial district. I struggle to find anything good in this area that isn't a sit down restaurant. They have a counter where you can order a sandwich, or you can hit the salad bar, which also has fish, chicken, veggies, etc. I would highly recommend this if you just want to grab something good for lunch.
Just like chez fayala but more fried stuff. Hummus is not good. Indian curry is also there.

The salad bar has great variety and you can order fresh made sandwiches, salads and shawermas! Great burger, they season them right on the spot. I walk an extra 3 blocks during lunch just to get the food. Would leave an extra star if I could!
Food is HALAL and very good! I like that they change the food selection all the time. Everything is very flavorful and filling. You can order sandwiches as well and they are pretty fast.

I tried the lunch buffet so I could try a little of everything they had to offer. Their hummus and tabouleh as well as their naan bread are very good. Their dolmas were quite strange, all rice and too much bitter lemon juice. The piece of Moroccan chicken I got, that I thought was a breast, was actually a shoulder blade and neck...so all bones. Decent variety of vegetables and salad options. If I were to go again I would try a shwarma sandwich instead of the buffet. Their price for the buffet $6.75/lb may be fine if you are only getting a salad but if you want a more substantial meal I think getting a sandwich or burger would be a better choice.

Awesome variety of Indian and Mediterranean food, nice people and a great location. Plus, you can order wraps and burgers off the side menu. Food is charged by the weight of food on your plate, great lunch prices for the Financial District.
Dropped in for a quick lunch. I was surprised by the wide choices of items in the "salad bar". I had spinach, chicken masala with naan. Very good!

They have a salad bar and a burger bar with open seating in a not very well ventilated space so it gets very hot and very smokey very quick.  The first time I went here about a month ago, I ordered a cheese burger and as soon as I did, I saw the chef but two patties on the huge grill that you can see.  After watching him make up the burgers (10 minutes has passed by now, almost half my lunch break), I thought certainly one was going to be mine but instead he hands the burgers to a guy who was sitting at a table with his date.  The cashier saw this and gave the chef a nasty look.  I asked when will my burger be ready he said a few more minutes.  It took another 10 minutes.  The burger was tasty, but constricted poorly and fell apart in my hand.  I had to use a fork to finish it.  The second and probably last time I went here was today and I ordered, quelle surprise, a cheese burger.  This time it only took 6 minutes, but not until I got to my desk did I realize he gave me a chicken burger.  I don't know why I keep finding places with the worst customer service ever.
Cafe Med-iocre

This is another new restaurant I went this past week. They had a decent buffet with middle eastern and Indian. The place is large, so it was nice to be able to find seating and didn't have to yell at each other. I picked some cooked veggies, fish and rice and the food was decent.
the shawarma is...adequate. the salad bar selection is pretty crazy big.

Not sure why I only gave 3 stars before, this place is great. I think I underestimated how much I love getting salad so cheap yet fresh, such delicious pasta options, plus plenty of different meats to devour.

I paid $12.50 for very mediocre vegetables and ended up throwing it out. The chana marsala was oily. Huge chunks of cinnamon in the palak. Roasted veggies were soaked in oil. Roasted fish was okay. -1 for value, -1 for taste, and -1 for how oily everything was on my plate.
Love this place. Such good food and at a very good price.
OH MAN!!  i hit the jack pot yet again.  YET-AGAIN!

Went here a few times to avoid the lines at Chez Fayala and thought it wasn't bad.  Today however,  had a piece of their fish from the self serve bar and it was raw!!!  Looks like the intent wasn't too serve it that way either.  They seasoned the fish, dunked it in sauce, and served it.   Last time I'm coming here!

This is for cleanliness. Went there today and watched a guy dump rice in the bin to fill it up - then watched him take a very dirty rag to wipe up the rice that spilled over the edge. You don't want to see a dirty rag close to food - but what was really bad is that .he had no problem with the visibly dirty rag touching all the rice along the edges of the bin, he even pushed some rice back in the bin - very disgusting.  I passed on the rice of course, but my friend took some from the middle.  Don't know if it was the rice or the curry, but an hour later my friend felt very sick.

There are many places to go to in the FIDI for lunch. The selection is almost limitless. But like most of us who work here we don't always have the time to pick and choose. We barely leave our desks and when we do we haven't had enough time to give thought to where we want to go. A few years ago these quick salad and hot food buffets started to turn up on every corner. These were great alternatives to your typical sit and order establishments because you could pick and choose what you wanted and basically serve yourself. Essentially they solved the dilemma for us of having to pick and choose and wait for food.
On Fridays, their sea food soup is by far the best soup I've ever had in my life, please make it every day. :)
my favorite by far is the med burger...juicy, tasty, so yummy.

Good salad bar with tones of options. Prices are based on per pound and 50% after 2pm. But in this visit, i ordered falafel sandwich with fries. Serving size was really good more than what one can eat for lunch. The menu says falafel sandwich but it is actually a wrap. I liked the taste of falafel was good but the rest of ingredients were not very fresh and the combination did not really go well, maybe because the ingredients were not fresh. I liked the fries and it was seasoned well but the falafel sandwich/wrap was a let down.
Best buffet place you can eat in the city. Fresh ingredients fresh food and healthy as well. Everything is made fresh the same day. I would give this six stars if I can

This establishment definitely copies what Chez has to offer, but what you can't beat is the quality of the salad bar when its after 2 pm. Not only is it half off after 2 pm, the food quality is better than Chez. Overall, if you need something to eat after 2 pm this is the spot, otherwise go across the street and get the real deal.
Opted for the falafel sandwich which was quite good, but too oniony for me but no problem, they were easily picked out.
Cafe Med is a good place to go if you need decent food fast.
Great beef shwarma.... Certainly worth coming back and exploring the rest of the menu.
Fresh, delicious, reasonable prices. Can't beat that. Ohhh yeaaa...the staff are very hospitable.

I love Cafe Med as an option for eating healthy on a budget. I eat at their salad bar almost every day. It's half-price after 2pm and has a great hot bar. I often find myself hungry and watching the clock as 2pm approaches. Sounds crazy, but I'm completely serious! (I'm a startup founder with very little time and money.)
Only fresh sushi you'll get in the area and it's all TO-GO!
Hamachi kama is delicious when they have it.

The small japanese man who stands by the handroll stand is a real character. He is all smiles but I am certain he leads a secret life as a legendary sword maker.  The food here is mostly grab and go bento boxes of medium size catering to SF workers looking for convenient food that tastes good. It isn't a cheap food option so its not a place I would go all that often but its great if you have a craving for japanese homestyle food. I recommend the donburi and the other boxes with various marinated meats over rice.
Used to go here before it changed owners/mgmt (f/k/a Ebisu).

When this was the downtown grab-and-go location of Ebisu, I was never impressed. The sushi did not live up to the Sunset location.  This place is much better. Still not great for sushi, since it sits out. But it's great for things like teriyaki bowls. I don't think grab-and-go chicken teriyaki can be any better than this place.

A fast, no nonsense place where you can walk in, grab your box, pay, and go. I've gotten their bento boxes a few times, and the portions are a tad bit smaller than I'd like them to be and they really overdo the sauce. But the speed at which you can get your food somewhat compensates for this. Go here if you're in a hurry; otherwise, skip it.
This place is cheap with the amount of food you receive. They have a variety of bento boxes, udon, rice bowls, and mochi.

Five stars mostly for the tasty vegetarian options here(mostly vegan!) from sushi to rice bowls to cold udon, there are SO many options to choose from!! I love how they change things up all the time. The guys here are friendly(one of them maybe too friendly haha) and there is never a long wait. Definitely one of my favorite lunch spots.

Good place for a quick grab-and-go lunch. They have a variety of pre-made bentos, rice bowls, noodle bowls, sushi and salad. I think most bentos and bowls are $10-13, so it's a little pricey, but everything looks pretty good!

I am just on a roll right now with Japanese food (get it, roll? heh heh...). I saw another review on the chirashi bowl and just had to try it out. I got to the place around 1:20pm and got the last bowl left. Well damn, it didn't look very appetizing, was smaller than I thought, and tasted just okay. This place is definitely convenient and fast, but get there before 1pm so you get better picks.

I was curious when I walked across this store and saw so many people going in so I thought I'd take a peek from the doorway and got pulled in by on one of the folks working there - really welcoming atmosphere. After taking a look around and greeted by two others in there I thought I'd give them a try and ordered a ribeye teriyaki donburi and an ume onigiri. First impressions was that it was that the donburi was somewhat small for its price but the beef was really tender. I think the donburi itself can lighten up on the teriyaki sauce because the beef was drenched in it but, overall it was a good experience. I think 2 onigiri's can make a meal ($1.50/ea) but figured if I was at a store, why not try something they're more known for rather than just small things.

A great grab and go option if you're short on time for lunch.  Wide selection of sushi, bentos, rice bowls, and udon.  Sushi options are your best bet, as the rice bowls/bentos are a bit hit or miss.  Haven't tried the udon yet though.
I get it, it's the financial district - grab-and-go, fast, expensive - it's what to expect.
No waits. Literally a grab and go. Lots of options that look very fresh and appetizing but on the pricey side for what doesn't look like a lot of food. Then again, sushi is deceptively filling.

Tenmatsu has become my latest addiction for a quick workday lunch. I haven't tried the sushi yet (eating raw food that has been sitting around creeps me out), but the bento boxes, hand rolls and tofu donburi are really good. Get here around 2:00 and everything is 50% off!

I'm rounding up from 3.5 stars. Generally, I'm a fan of these small, efficient "restaurants" (in quotation marks because it's just a takeaway place with ready-made items) and it adds more variety to the standard lunch spots.
Very good grab and go Japanese food.  Very friendly service.  If you want brown rice with your order, you have to go early and ask for it.

Their sushi rice is perfect and very flavorful. I recommend their salmon skin hand roll and string bean salad. Their miso soup is also the best I've ever had and is packed with veggies, tofu, and fish cake.

Surprisingly legit Japanese bento's, though I hear it's not Japanese-owned. Guess it doesn't matter if they can produce quality food. I had a hamburg bento and it was great. It's a bit pricey, though...  I'd go back more often if their prices were a couple bucks cheaper.
Very tasty and quick lunch grab. The bentos are excellent, and the sushi is good. The oyakodon is my go-to. I usually get a croquette or a thing of gyoza with it.

Long long ago, at the same location there existed a place called Ebisu. It too was a bento box store that sold almost exactly the same dishes and it was delicious. Fast forward to the present, we have Tenmatsu. I've given it a few tries but wasn't impressed. More disappointed if anything.
Solid lunch spot in the Union Sq/Financial District / SOMA borders. The food is good, but a bit pricey for what you get.
Probably one of the more underrated lunch places on Kearny. Huge variety of options, super quick, cheap.
This use to be one of my favorite lunch spots for work, but now it's just so mehhh. They changed chefs awhile back, but the items they produce continue to go downhill.
The grab and go stuff is all pretty good. But all I really care about is the curry.

Been coming here when it was still Ebisu (yup I miss it, food was better), but this place is still good.  Cheap smaller sized handrolls (about $2~$3 each) and onigiri's (about $1.50~$2.00 each).  Curry is enough to feed 2 average people.

Every so often during work the weather is extremely ugly and cloudy, Japanese curry sounds like a good meal to eat. THANKFULLY, Tenmatsu offers Japanese curry with various meats(fish katsu, beef, vege, pork katsu, etc) with white rice or brown rice. The curry is steaming hot(which is good), and packs a nice kick of spices(not too spicy). I usually get a mochi(they make it there so it is not the frozen types you can get at ranch 99), and the mochi comes with a piece of fresh fruit inside of it. I have tried the green tea mochi with mago and the strawberry mochi with redbean, which were both damn good. They also have a decent selection of drinks. I usually get the Sangaria MELON SODA....nice refreshing drink. Will be back again....

This little grab-and-go japanese place is really cute! My coworker told me about it yesterday and I couldn't wait to try it. I got the chashu udon. It came in a little plastic bowl, separated from the soup base all wrapped and ready. The soup base is a little like an instant ramen soup base with a little more thickness and the noodles were slippery and somewhat chewy. I honestly didn't have very high expectations for grab-and-go ramen/udon, but this is pretty good for what it is.
I love this place! Food is good with friendly service. There's no seating, but you can take your food a half a block down to St Mary's Square.

Today was my first try at Tenmatsu after new ownership took over and although most of the menu items have remained the same, I was highly disappointed by the spicy tuna hand-roll that used to be my very favorite when I was craving rice!!!  It was literally half the size and had barely any fish in it!  See my pic!  Also, they used to use Ahi and now they use albacore, there was a serious taste difference!
This is a grab and go Japanese place. I was pleasantly surprised at the variety they offered: katsu, bento boxes, donburis, rolls and sashimi.
MOCHI MOCHI MOCHI!

I found a hair in the salmon bento, so I had to alert them.  This made my appetite drop for the other bentos, so I thought it'd be safer to buy a crab/shrimp tempura handroll and mango mochi instead.  These items were phenomenal, and I ate them across the street at a sit-down onigiri restaurant named Onigilly.  Ha.  The quality and taste of Tenmatsu's stuff were 10x better than the 3 rice balls I got at Onigilly.  So now I'm conflicted.  Clean, sit-down onigiri place vs. to-go onigiri and bento place.  I have to give Tenmatsu another try.  I'm pretty sure they're solid.  Mango and strawberry mochis there are reason alone to go.
Guh. I should just move in.

Happened to stumble to this place on my way to Anthony's shoes next door and lucky me!!! What it felt like almost seeing the Virgin Mary, I see a table full of my favorite grab n go foods! Spam musubis, onigiri, mini hand rolls all under $2 each!!! Needless to say, I grabbed 8 of different flavored snacks and still had enough to grab a Hawaiian milk tea...all for less than an Andrew Jackson!
Great for grab-and-go. The sushi is just alright but works if you're really hungry and don't have much time :)
Ready to go sushi and bento boxes. The potstickers were good, but their sushi is not fresh at all.
This is a tiny shop that offers grab-n-go lunches.

This review is for the mochi only!  Under Ebisu, the mochi was damn good. Now, it's another story.  Went here today and picked up several different flavors of mochi. Luckily, I didn't get sick off this stuff; the green tea mango mochi was spoiled!  And the two other flavors were just not good. Even my 4 year old daughter tasted the difference. All the mochi had to be dumped. What a waste of money!
The place formally known as Ebisu is still a winner.

Eating an $8 lamb snausage right now.  The bun and fixins are good, but the dog is flavorless.  They serve-em-up dirty water style like NYC's $2 Sabrettes.  For the price, I expect a grilled dog that's not sitting in water all day.

I am not sure how retarded somebody must be to mix up a hotdog stand with a gourmet sausage place, but I guess you don't need brain to walk around in SF. Anyways, the sausage is pretty freakin' amazing, especially in a soft white bread with some onions and sauerkraut. I could eat this all week and still not get bored. Highly recommended if you would like grab a quick tasty lunch.

I was at treasure island flea this past weekend and got hungry. None of the food trucks really stood out so I went with the Missing Link, mainly because their line was short. Their gimmick is having hot dogs made from different meats (buffalo, elk, etc.). I'm not against trying different types of hot dogs but none of them really stood out, so I went with a regular beef hot dog. You would think a place that sells nothing but hot dogs would make a solid beef hot dog, I was wrong. I can't comment on the quality of the hot dog itself because it was cooked so horribly. The Missing Link puts all their hot dogs in a pan with hot water to boil the hot dogs and then when you order a dog they transfer it to a grill. The 2 hot dogs I got must of been sitting in the hot water for a looong time cause even though they were grilled, they were soggy, limp, and and had any/all flavor boiled out. To make things worse, they're really stingy with onions and sauerkraut.
Great concept but not for me. I was inquisitive enough to try it and not a big fan of either the boar or the veggie.

I was very disappointed with the hot dogs here. The bun was very soggy and on my first bite, it broke. I saw another customer who ate half of the hot dog and threw it away. I found it a waste of my $7.
Quick review b/c its that's simple.
DELICIOUS! I encountered the Missing Link at the monthly Treasure Island Flea, and it was by far my favorite part of the experience ( the Angora rabbit in a sweater was second).
I really wanted to like these guys.

Hella meh. Saw these guys at Treasure Island Flea Market where they were fighting a losing battle against the crowds, the wind, and pretty much everything else. They seemed like nice guys, but they were clearly overwhelmed. Napkins and mustard bottles were flying around, the cook was wiping his nose with his ungloved hands and they forgot what I ordered.

I tried The Missing Link at the Treasure Island flea market: First things first, the Elk link is amazing. It's so much tastier than the typical sausage. Somehow there is spicy cheese infused into the link, which I'm sure contributes to its tastiness. However, I was disappointed with the construction of the hot dog as a whole. The menu said the Elk link was topped off with coleslaw and aioli. But what it's actually topped with is shredded cabbage and something that may or may not actually be an aioli. This was an important difference to me because I was expecting a variety of complimenting flavors - not dry cabbage. I asked for extra aioli which wasn't very flavorful but still, it was better than eating dry cabbage.

MEEEEEEEEEEEATTTTTT!!!! I LOVE meat.  If heart disease wasn't a thing, I'd have a giant plates of wide varieties of meat for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  In fact, one of  my life dreams is to marry the owner of 4505 Meats.  But I have a lot in common with this guy too...he makes sausages, I like to consume sausages, what would we ever fight over that couldn't be solved with some wild boar?

Tried these wild game sausages while doing construction in the neighborhood, The wild boar was awesome, We  will be back when its time to sheetrock... Trying the Elk next time, the baseball cap models I was with ( Carpenters ) couldn't get enough
Awesome Links, all sorts of unique meats
I've tried the elk and boar links... both awesome!
Adventure of Link.

I had the lamb sausage which was alright except it was very big and kind of hard to bite into . Also , their sausage lacked flavor ... it was missing a kick to it . It's $8+ for a sausage which is kinda pricey for a hot dog . I felt like it wasn't worth the money because it didn't even taste all that great . You can get a tastier and juicier hot dog at one of the hot dog stands in Union square for only half the price .

These guys serve up some great sausages, be warned the people who hate on this cart are dumb! $8 for a gourmet sausage made of meat that one rarely ever sees, and cooked so perfectly with the excellent toppings for each one is a great deal. And the type of meat they serve changes regularly. They were so good the night I saw them, I had two! And to the person who wrote a bad review because they don't serve "regular" hot dogs: that's as bad as a vegan giving a bad review to a steak house for not having good meatless options. Get your head out of your ass!

Went by for the first time the other day and I gotta say I think these guys are the f%$#@ awesome.  I had like the boar sausage with the setup of jalepeno jelly and coleslaw and it totally hit the spot on a cold day.
Really? 8 bucks for a  delicious hot dog? Man, you can get a hot dog inside PacBell park for cheaper than that...
The Pheasant link was killer.  The sauasage itse'f was moist and loaded with flavor.  Dressed nicely, i think this was the first "dog" of sorts that I ever had that I can say had great presentation.

When you think of hot dog stands, first thought are probably those in the streets of NYC that have dogs sitting in what seems like filthy, polluted street water. The Missing Link  is totally opposite of that and a very unique lunch experience. This simple operation is more unique then one would think. Starting with the menu full of game meat (from gator to elk to bison), the selection also comes with customized toppings that accompany the hot dogs well. Each dog and bun is grilled on the panini to get a fresh grill creating the crisp outer texture and soft, juicy centers. I got the "Rudolph" reindeer hot dog (right before Xmas which is probably why I didn't get  presents) that tasted flavorful. These dogs are not cheap though at $8-10 a pop but well worth a try.

Great addition to the neighborhood!  Serving high quality grilled wild game sausages.  I've had the bison and the venison so far and both were excellent.  Served on a nice grilled bun too.  They take credit cards too and now have a communal table you can sit at.  Tip- That spot gets nice afternoon sun when much of the rest of the financial district is in the shade.

A "hot dog" (specialty sausage?) stand is not something you can visit every day, but I'm glad these guys are here. It's a great break from the other fast food fare in the neighborhood. (Don't get me wrong, I like the taco truck, too.)

I'm a nice person. I don't usually comment on other people's reviews, but why in the world would you hope this was a "regular" hot dog place? And when you see elk, bison, and other game meats listed, wouldn't you ASK why? This is SAN FRANCISCO!

Anyone who knows me knows that I can't keep my hands (or my mouth!) off of a good sausage.  Located near my office, I went to Missing Link to grab a sausage for lunch.  I ordered the boar thinking it would be a safe bet - I love a good pork.  They were sold out and suggested elk instead.  This was one big sausage!  It was delicious and not gamey at all.  Watch out, dudes, Ima be grabbing your sausage all the time.

Had my first foray over to The Missing Link today for lunch and I thought it was really, really good! I'm not a huge fan of hot dogs, but I do like tasty sausages, and theirs are fresh and very flavorful. I had a lamb sausage (probably the most tame of their options today) that was really good and not at all gamey (like lamb can sometimes be). Others in my lunchtime posse had a bison brat and loved it!
I like unusual meats, so I like this unusual hot dog stand. Pheasant is a bit bland, elk is tasty, bison is better still.
I'm writing this review because I was really hoping this was a "regular" hot dog place.

The white chocolate macadamia nut cookie was as hard as a hockey puck! Gah. I was so disappointed! The moral of the story is, don't get cookies at 6pm from this location. There's not much selection and they may be hard! If the cookie looks burnt, it's probably hard.
I have tried their chicken soup for first time and i must say its YUMMY..

I had a caprese sandwich and a peanut butter chocolate chunk cookie for lunch. The cookie was delicious-- very buttery and not too sweet. The caprese was okay, I've had better. I would definitely come back for the cookies.
i use to love their cinnamon rolls.  thought i would treat myself with one of the fluffy frosted yumminess.  but instead was given an icing smothered hockey puck ...
I placed my order for pickup at 9:42 to be picked up at 11:30
Being from the east coast I was kinda shocked to find there were no Dunkin Donuts in California - now I know why - if there was a Specialty's Cafe chain in nyc I wouldn't go to Dunkin either.

If you want a sandwich with quality ingredient, this is it. I always get the sandwiches here. The salad is so and so, not worth it in my opinion. It's about $7-9 for a sandwich. The service was good and the sandwiches are made pretty fast.
This location gives the other stores a bad reputation. Cookies are stale, dry, and nasty. It's a waste of time going here... But, there's one by the Montgomery Bart Station that is awesome.
The best $4 cookie you can buy. $4 for a single cookie you say? Yes $4 for one cookie but it's huge and delicious.

Was walking by and happened to stroll in to Specialty's. I got the Turkey Pesto sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The best part was I got my meal for free for being patient:) I didn't get a dessert but definitely want to next time!
Just had lunch at Specialty's today and enjoyed it a lot. At first I thought that Specialty's was this prissy, upscale, overpriced bakery for the loooongest time, but they proved me wrong.

I've posted about this location before, but wanted to post again after I decided to try giving them another chance (as they're across the street from my office). Unfortunately, they're still incompetent!
Can't beat the prices, and the baked goods are ALL amazing. I've never had something I didn't like at this place.

This location quite small, compared to the other ones. There is no seating inside so it's really a get what you need and GTFO kind of place. Luckily for them, I don't mind too much because my work is right next door on Spear St. I've been here a handful of times and have eaten their catered foods. I've tried the array of breakfast and lunch sandwiches, some scones, and some cookies as well. Their breakfast sandwiches are on point with the fresh bread they use, and the melted cheese that stretches as you pull the sandwich away from your mouth. I've gotten both the Denver and the Southwester. Seriously, you can't go wrong. Cookies are also pretty good - the chocolate chip I had was melted and gooey even when the cookie isn't warm anymore.

Gotta love their cinnamon morning bun! So delicious. The counter people who work in the morning are pretty awesome. They aren't super friendly but they get the job done. I have to only give 3 stars because yesterday I ordered lunch for our IT group over the phone. When I arrived they told me they didn't have my order and was I sure I ordered from that location. I was a bit annoyed by them because they said that they only take online orders etc., etc.  So finally I told them it was put on the company credit card with another name on it. They were able to find my order. I would've been really upset if it wasn't there. So their sandwiches and cookies are pretty good. But the fact that they were trying to tell me that I didn't order from them kinda really annoyed me.
Comparing to other Specialty's before this, this one lacks umph in seating and tables as well as adding a Focaccia bread to my soup order!
Awesome drinks, and AMAZING pastries.

No long and wordy review needed here. This place has some of the best cookies around. The flavors are pretty basic, chocolate chip, peanut butter, etc. That is fine though because they are consistently delicious.
Love their cookies - especially hot out of the oven!

I've had the pleasure of sampling many things from Speciality's over the past year but have never thought about writing a review. Suffice to say, their baked goods are always a crowd pleaser but be warned they are on the more expensive end.

Specialty's is palatable for a chain -- the cookies rate 4 stars. However, this particular location is frustrating. Due to it's pop-up size, it seems it more so functions as an outpost. It's not clear that you can order sandwiches onsite, the employees are friendly (if not training and a bit spacey), but the main complaint is that they RUN OUT OF COOKIES in the afternoon EVERY DAY. I have been in there on several occasions where there only have 1 or 2 kinds remaining, usually less popular varieties. Not sure how this Yelp listing rides a 4 stars because I've definitely witnessed other people's disappointment for the same reason. Easy fix manager -- get it together!
Terrible muffins BUT the strong, delicious coffee drinks, smiling barista, and unbelievably perfect cookies more than make up for it.

yeah this is the place. Ask for Larry he will hook you up. Big coffee and ham and cheese croissant. The croissant is the size of frisbee, hot, fresh and delicious. You can have it in your hands in 3 minutes.

5 stars for the excellent comestibles, but 10 stars for the customer service. Slight glitch in an on-line order last week, but Nick and Jennison fixed it beyond my wildest expectations. The reason that when I think goodies, I think of Specialtys-Spear St. first. Thanks guys!
Great Food but MISTAKES!

My boss ordered in sandwiches for a big meeting, and while browsing online, I stopped on the only sandwich that had a first name: Rebecca. Not The Rebecca. Just Rebecca. I ordered it simply because I was intrigued as to why this sandwich had earned a name while all the other sandwiches suffered from boring titles like pastrami sandwich and turkey pesto.

Amazing cookies, pastries, and sandwiches! I wish they had more low(er) calorie options for cookies and pastries, but to be honest, I probably wouldn't get them because what they have is just plain AWESOME. Sandwiches are great too. :-)

Okay, if this is the Specialtys by the new HeyDay restaurant then listen up...my co-worker and I ordered a sandwich on line, it said it would be ready at12:38 so we went to look for it on the shelf and it was not there and we even walked slow to make sure s it would be there as we only have a half hr lunch.

Your typical cafe for working people. Relatively healthy choices, tasty salads, and a large offering of pastries. I'm a big fan of the berry salad especially since I love goat cheese. The food is definitely on the expensive side, and the portions aren't the biggest (but maybe that's a good thing so you don't go into food coma and take a nap at work).

Best chocolate chip cookies ever. Get the semi-sweet and know that the cookies are huge! Good spot for lunch as well - the sandwiches are all pretty good. They also cater so this is a good choice for corporate meetings/events in the financial district as they have several locations in the city.

This is a very convenient place to get your coffee/lunch and perhaps most importantly, cookie fixes. I'll admit - the service used to be faster, but the food quality is still there. Personally I find their sandwiches to be a bit on the heavy side, and their salads to be ill-prepared (not tossed). However, I give them major kudos for those irresistible sweets that keep me coming back for more day after day. Like most Yelpers who reviewed this place, I love the semi-sweet chocolate chip cookies, especially when they are straight out of the oven and are still gooey and warm. I give myself such a treat whenever I'm ready to give up on my day. Overall, I'd miss this place if it were gone, but I wish that the service is more expedient and efficient.
The food is good, but here are my qualms:
Unbelievable...
This goes for all of Specialty's locations, since their consistency in food prep and service are consistently top notch.

Such decadent brownies!! I'm not a big fan of cookies (lay down your pitchforks!!) as I always get such guilt eating a big stick of butter. A brownie is no different but the taste and texture of a brownie provide much more excitement for my taste buds.

I never encounter a line in the mornings when I need my Cap fix. I tried one of thir morning buns earlier this week and even though I've heard great things about this place, I was not impressed. I'll still come get my morning coffee here and there at Specialty's but I think that is all for now.

Soooo, I used to work in FiDi.  When getting fat off of Specialtys and then working it off at the 24-Hour Fitness was the thing to do.  When its glorious halves sat prettily on platters in the conference room for those all-important lunch meetings, waiting to be compiled into your own Specialtys sandwich marriage: Hot Hammer and Cobb?  Hellz yeah!  Tuna Salad and Mixed Veggie?  Meat-haters unite.
Just got a peanut butter chocolate chunk cookie, there was about 1 chocolate chip and the rest was dry and filled with peanut butter. I'd rate this cookie about 2 out of 10.
Fantastic cookies!  God, how I miss having ready access to those cookies. They were truly THE BOMB!
Specialty's is my Friday treat!

I've had a couple of soups here. All of them are pretty meh. But the one that made me write a review is the pho. Why oh why did I get the pho. What's funny is the beef they put in it was actually really good. They sliced some beef from a cooker and put it in my soup. I was impressed. But beef alone cannot save this pho. Tomatoes?? And the noodles taste worse than instant noodles. Broth was like warm chicken broth or something. Stay away but get the beef in something else.

Had an amazing tomato soup that was fresh and lively. My colleagues had different soups which they both said were very good. The turkey cranberry sandwich was excellent as well. Only eaten there once I would come back with no hesitation.
Soup Freaks. Very nice service but terrible food. If someone claims that healthy food needs to be bland or even completely tasteless, this would be a good example.
Not a huge fan.

I rarely put negative comments on yelp but this place was such a disappointment. After looking up good soup places in the Financial district, I came here because of the Pho soup. It cost almost $8 for a tiny (16 oz) cup of soup. It was probably the most disgusting soup I've ever eaten. It came with 2 tomatoes, 5 pieces of chicken and like 5 rice noodles in a broth that's tasted like warm water. I had to throw it away after a couple of bites. This place is way overpriced and the quality is bad. Won't be coming here again.

This place used to be great.  No longer.  the soup was good, but way over priced.  I had a side of turkey.  Awful.  It used to be carved, now it's some kind of processed pressed meat.  The side of potatoes were basically raw. Glad I didn't get the salad, they looked wilted and underdressed and small. Sm. soup, side of turkey and small side of potatoes =$12 plus I left a 15% tip for carrying my own food, looking for silverware (which was not very clean) and trying to locate an extra napkin.  Plus, the worse part - I got sick the following day.  May not be their fault, but who knows?
The food here tasted great, but it was a bit overpriced for small portions.

Can only speak for the Cobb Salad. $8 bucks gets you the small, and it's pretty good (get the "champagne" dressing). However, portion size pretty tiny, they use mixed greens with the "cobbs" on top. Tasty, but for $8 it would be nice to at least crest the small bowl... More lettuce at at least?
This place is almost a scam. $12 for a 32oz bowl of beef pho that consists of rice noodles, green onions, and beef, nothing else? No wonder the place was empty during the lunch hour.

I've been there 3 times and every time I go there I wonder why... Tomato soup tastes like Tomato sauce for pasta, and the chicken sandwich is really not good (bad sauce, not tender chicken, bad bread...) and the vegetables in the combo are just decoration (no sauce, no taste). Sorry guys but in the area there are so many other good places that I can't give you more than 1 star.
I've been here a few times for lunch and tried various soups. The lentil soup was ok but not terribly flavorful. The chili was meh.

This is my usual stop when I work in SF. They make great... SOUPS!  The lentil is delicious but not vegetarian. You can mix 2 soups and create a new soup yeah you can be creative like that. For $2 add a side, get the beets.

I love soups and salads.  For lunch, I usually want something light and healthy so this place is perfect for me. I've had the basil tomato and mushroom soup and really liked them both.  Yesterday, I had the salad with tomato, mozzarella and avocado.  It was very tasty and I can't wait to get it again.  I love that there are plenty of vegan soups too.  I do not always want a heavy cream based soup.  The space here is big and in a great area.  I will definitely be going back for lunch.

Great soups I like the beefiness of their chili soup it's good quality, not bad at all. The spacing is great but not a lot of customers come and stop by and eat. I would suggest a small and quaint space. The food is good if you are in the mood for soups. I'll check more out of the place and try the other varieties of soups.

I should never have tried the Pho or the noodle soup here. It is actually very bland, almost a tasteless broth with some noodle floating in it. Their customer service was not satisfactory either, as the lunch hour was very busy and the serving was kind of sloppy. They even ran out of the bread to serve with the soup. I will probably not coming back here.

I purchased the southwestern black bean soup, with red pepper, cilantro and Sour Cream!!! That is delicious! I've never had black bean soon before and let me tell you I'll come back. Moez is great as well as his staff. Organic, flour and Dairy free. NO fillers, good nutrition low calories.
I went back and ordered the chili and a salad. It wasn't great, but much better than my first experience, so I wanted to update the review.
Had the chili for lunch
just try any regular sandwich, you will be surprised by the size !! you can add customer satisfaction to that ! RUDE, RUDE, RUDE...
I think their other soups are ok.

I really like coming here when I'm in the mood for a solid salad or soup (or combo). I also love their sandwiches, but I'm on an anti gluten kick, so I haven't been eating those lately - but I used to love their roasted rosie chicken, smoked turkey and freakin' cheeseburger sandwiches. I also used to get the oatmeal here for breakfast and that was healthy and delicious as well!
If you want a healthy lunch in the area, THIS is your spot!
the food was okay.
Food is mediocre. Their 'normal' sandwich is smaller then my fist. It's like 2 inches big. How is this a sandwich??????????
