STAY AWAY FROM THE PHO. Noodles were still so hard, broth was bland, prawns were over-cooked and mushy.

looking for a fast and healthy lunch?!  look no further!  how I missed this place all these years i'll never know.  i want to know what is in my food when i eat out, especially a fast food place.  this place makes the grade and will get my business again.  we got there around 11a and it was a good thing, too, because a line had formed after that for the lunch crowd.  we're from out of town but get into the city often enough to make this a go to place for good fast food.
I have been coming to Soup Freaks for a number of years.

Thought it was okay soup was kinda bland even after they added a lot of sriracha to it.    Just because something is organic and natural doesn't mean it has to lack flavor.  Service was not great and I was the only person in there they just seemed preoccupied and didn't really want to be there.  I get it but at least try to be helpful and offer suggestions.  I'll probably give it another shot and try a different soup but not a great first impression.  Some other soups sounded good and the salad bar looked good as other people have mentioned.
This place is amazing! I used to

It is absolutely horrible. Their soups are ridiculously bland, and their Rosie chicken sandwich is just pieces of cooked chicken that has zero flavor, on the tiniest piece of bread. When I asked for toppings for the sandwich, the server offered chicken broth. What?!? This is definitely the worst food I've ever had living in SF. Do not eat here.

I know this is a soup  place, but I come here for the the salad.  The chicken salad with champagne vinaigrette is awesome!  The chicken is always moist and well seasoned and the vinaigrette adds a nice brightness without being too sweet.

I am not one to give low ratings but I was quite disappointed with the service here. It was very unhelpful and unable to answer basic questions regarding what was in the soups. Ordering was slow even if we were the only people there.

I really like Soup Freaks and don't understand why it's not more popular. The salads are always really fresh, with ample portions and good ingredients. I don't get the soup very often, but when I do it's always good. And the service is friendly and quick. What more could you want? It's a great basic work-day lunch place.

I love the "Freakin' Healthy" salad at Soup Freaks, and get it at least once a week. I'd give this place 4 stars except for my one major beef: I eat a pretty high-protein diet, and they don't offer a single protein topping for the salads (that isn't meat). If they would offer tofu, tempeh, falafel, hard-boiled egg, etc., salad add-ons so that vegetarians had some better choices, I'd be here every day!

I absolutely LOVE soup but am very, very picky about what soup I have. My coworker and I came here during lunch. I'm a huge fan of sriracha, so of course I had to get the Hangover Soup, and got a small Freakin' Healthy salad as well. We went through the line, got our food pretty quickly and went back to the office for a yummy lunch. The soup was absolutely delicious. We were contemplating putting in more sriracha, but thankfully we were smart enough to taste it first. Perfect level of spiciness! The cilantro and bread was a nice touch, too.

A co-worked turned me on to Soup Freaks about a month ago (and I'm so glad she did). There are certainly a plethora of soup/salad/sandwich places in the FiDi/SOMA area. However, this spot always delivers solid food with a smile. Best of all, the lines are never too long. I'm usually in and out within 5 minutes.
The craving was soup, so I searched around for soup places on a Saturday near Fidi.  I found this place and decided to check it out.
The chicken sandwich now has tomatoes and a lovely garlic mustard dill sauce, both of which give it a much appreciated extra zing.

Just walked in after an appt, and liked the open space and clean look.  It's a cafeteria style setting, where you pick up a blue tray and then order from the menu, then they make your order (salad / sandwiches) right there- the soups are first up, and I saw Mac and Cheese soup (one of the days Moody's soups) and got that, but then realized it had peas and the guy was nice enough to let me choose another one- the Matzo ball soup- fresh dill on top!
1 star for delicious soup (TRY THE LENTIL OH MY GOSH), another star for the amazingly friendly staff (It's a husband and wife team), and another star for the spacious environment.

I wish yelp had zero or negative stars. This place was the worst experience ever!!! Will never go back. I ordered vegetarian soup & found a dead worm in my soup. Forget  remorse or apology, the person at the counter could not even understand english. This place is a health hazard & should be shut down.

Never again will I come here. The food is not bad but i cant justify paying $8 for a bowl of soup, and Im not cheap, i just get irritated after each time I come here. When I first started coming here back in '05 ish, the prices were lower, but they have increased drastically over the years.  Is it really fresh?? LOL , you can decide that for yourself

My favorite go-to lunch spot! I've overlooked this place for so long even when I worked in mall with a soup company part of their food court. I seriously come here about 2-3 times a week. Is that bad? And I always check what their soups of the day are. They have it listed on their website- I know I'm a soup junkie haha. So my favorites and pretty much the only ones I ever get are: Creole Crab and Corn, Shrimp Etoufee, and Lobster Bisque. On occasion, I will get their Clam Chowder. So they usually only have these soups at the beginning and end of the week. So when I see it on their website I make sure I head over there before 12:30 pm because they usually sell out by 1 pm. They also give you a hunk of sourdough or wheat bread along with your soup. It's seriously the best combo ever. LOVE this place.

Although I like this their soup and staff in general, the staff at Battery St  in SF is really rude and unhelpful plus the soup is often on the cool side...I suggest folks go other locations until this location improves from their current rotten attitude.

They can take my money any day! Their truck comes twice a week near my work and me and the coworkers LOVE it - though we've often hoofed it all the way to the actual restaurant. Just wish it was actually open more hours, but it's the FiDi, so I get why it closes early. Delicious soups and sourdough to die for! The sandwiches are pretty "eh" though, small and not that tasty, but the soup makes up for it.

I come here a lot but it's days like today that make me want to get lunch elsewhere. I got the chicken, summer squash and lime soup and it was literally all broth with two small pieces of chicken floating around in it. How is that suppose to keep me full for the next few hours? So, you basically gave me water for lunch? Cool. Thanks. I can't believe I spent $6 on that.

Had the tomato bisque soup and it was pretty standard.  Needed a touch of salt but wasn't completely horrible.  I also had one of the already prepped small side salads and it was ok, too.  I wouldn't say it was worth the $9+ I paid for them, that's for sure.

Soup Co is a great spot for a healthy, inexpensive lunch.  Salmon asparagus chowder is very good.  Love it that you can get a half sandwich.  Just one request - please make your turkey chili less salty!

They no longer serve mac and cheese... so the chili is now irrelevant and all hope for the future is lost.  Sure, I got it once a month, and the Tikka soup the rest of the time, that isn't the point...
Soup quality- okay
For what it is, this place is great. The soup is fantastic. The service is fast. There is not always a place to sit but it's not their fault. If you're in the area for lunch, this place is perfect.

I am addicted to the SF Soup Company! I love almost all their soups (esp. Exotic Mushroom, Smoked Chicken Chowder, or Tomato Bisque with rice, cilantro and cheese - yum!), but I appreciate this location in particular because of its friendly service. Everyone there seems to love the soup as much as I do, and they're able to turn a long line quickly, with a smile and always remembering the regulars. P.S. It's a gluten-free soup lover's dream-come-true -- the whole menu is labeled accordingly =)

I went against my better judgement today and ordered lunch from the Soup Truck by Levi's. I ordered the 1/2 hummus wrap and a small split pea soup; both because they are vegetarian and dairy-free. Blah! The hummus wrap was straight out of the fridge cold, and the lavash wrap was soggy. There was WAY too much hummus, and hardly any veggies on the wrap -- only ONE SLICE of cucumber! The split pea soup was just okay, and too thick for my taste. Never again, never again!

I love this place.  There are two soup menus; the regular menu, and the specials of the day.  The sandwiches here are very good, as well.  I always get the split pea soup, and it is consistently healthy and delicious, a combination that is difficult to find in any food establishment.
I ordered a Turkey sandwich and Chicken Tortilla soup....both were just okay. They seemed to lack flavor to me.
First of all, lobster soup is the only thing worth to buy here, it is so delicious !!!!!  For the other soups still cost $6 for a small bowl is a bit pricey!
My go to lunch spot in FiDi
I had the Grandma Mary's chicken noodle for lunch today. It came with a baguette. The bread was better than the soup. Their chicken noodle was really bland, so I wouldn't get that one again.
Their soup and bread is pretty great. Solid and delicious.

Huge line makes for a middle school cafeteria feel and the food is about as bad. I got the pesto turkey sandwich against my better judgement. While the pesto was good with a deliciously sweet undercurrent (probs sun dried tomatoes), the soggy bread killed the experience. I ate it as fast as possible and moved onto my turkey chili, which was far far worse. It had the consistency and texture of diarrhea because unlike ground beef that clumps ground turkey must disintegrate into copious particles making for horrible eating experience. The $0.99 chili at Wendy is far better and $2.50 cheaper. Avoid at all costs. Though I used a gift card at $8 for the combo, I felt I'd paid way to much for what I got. I'm not a grab and go and lunch at my desk person. If I was I might return to try other soups given the high praise on yelp, but I can't help but wonder how even one of SF Soup company's offerings could be of so poor quality when soup is your namesake.

This has been a great go-to spot for me since our office moved across the street in 2007.  The staff here is excellent, the selection is great and the food is perfect every time.  My favorite part about going here is actually the owner/manager.  He is one of the nicest people, always has a smile for us.

My office is in this building to the SF Soup Company is sorta the default lunch place to go when I'm short on time and forgot to bring lunch with me. I really love their vegan corn chowder (though I'm not vegan so I ask them to add a little cheese) but every other soup I've tried I've been disappointed with. I do also like them for breakfast, the oatmeal is hearty and they have a good mix if toppings for it. Their danishes are actually some of the best I've had other than at an actual bake shop. I like that they sell little refillable soup containers and considered buying one but was disappointed to find they only sell the large size. A "regular" soup is plenty of lunch for me.

There's no love in any of the soups I've had here. They all have a similar gelatinous consistency and the flavors are pretty bland. Soup always sounds like a good idea for lunch on a cold San Francisco day, but I always leave here disappointed.

I come here quite often, especially when it's winter time in SF and all I want is a hot, steamy bowl of soup. $6 is a bit steep for a bowl of soup, but I'm in love with the sourdough bread that comes with it so I don't really mind. The bread is perfectly toasted on the outside and soft in the inside, and I think i may like the bread more than the soup haha.Favorite soup so far is the Chicken Tikki Masala soup, which is very similar in flavor to the actual dish, and is rich enough to make as a dipping sauce for the bread. Oh and be careful, the samples/soup are really really hot, I burned my tongue last night, not fun at all.

Who doesn't want to come here to enjoy a bowl of soup on a cold day? Being that it is San Francisco, it is cold often and so I come here often too! I always get the Mexican Tortilla with all the fixings (chips, cheese and cilantro)! A regular bowl will run you under $6, which is an awesome deal for lunch in the financial district! Service is always pretty quick and there is ample seating as well. They also have so many locations all over San Francisco that you never have to walk too far to get to one!
Great soup, hence the name...duh.  Sandwiches and salads...ehh not so much.  They are good but definitely NOT what you should be getting if going here.

I actually ventured into this location because of my Instant Deal from LivingSocial. The service was quick and there were no lines at lunch time! Had the Thai salad with Peanut dressing and it was yummy, the only complaint I have is there was not enough dressing to cover the salad. I will be visiting this location again.

I got a breadbowl of New England Clam Chowder from here today.  The soup was adequate (not great, not bad, just "adequate").  I found it a little odd that they won't simply put the soup into the breadbowl, but you have to get the breadbowl separately from the soup container.  Also, they won't even bag anything "to go" for you -- you have to do that yourself using bags that are stacked up next to the soda machine....... which is just downright annoying.

This place sells soup like meals. $6+ for a mini cup of soup and bread??? They must be making a boatload of money. Although soup to me seems "cheap" and I think Campbell's canned soups, SF Soup Co actually has a great selection of soup that are fresh and tasty. They got classics like clam chowder and chicken noodle but also some new world creations. Good for the sick and cold weather for the comfy feeling.
A decent (I seem to use that word a lot) breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese, and sundried tomato spread on an english muffin.
Some Yelpers are officially retarded.

The Battery St location of SF Soup Co is good but otherwise the SF Soup Co is over rated. The soup is good but the serive is really unfriendly--very McDonalds like. And cheap...they have become so cheap about condiments and bread it is absurd. How much penny pinching can you do before you turn off your regulars? You reached that limit with me. Can't recomend these places any more...management just doesn;t get it.
I ate the worst breakfast ever so that you dont have to, and now Im going to tell you all about it!

Solid soup joint, rising to the top of the lunchtime options on those cold and San Fran rainy days.  Their very popular Chicken Tortilla soup is good, though if it matters any to you it's tomato-based rather than chicken stock.   I suggest you order yours without chips and ask them to add onion, it makes it a little lighter and the zing of onion makes it so much better.  Because they use tortillas in the soup recipe you won't miss the flavor.
wally, the manager is gem - 1 star
I love soup. Love, love it - almost as much as I like saying "Man-hattan Clam-mmm Chow-dah" .  I pretend like I have an accent, but I'm just silly.
I think I was wrong in giving this place 3 stars only. I find myself going here around 3 times a week now. Even if the line is long, the service is extremely fast and the soups are good.
OMG... the Indian Mulligatawny is my new favorite soup at the SF Soup Co. and I will try to back early enough for more.
There is something about ordering soup when I'm out that makes me nervous.
there are many choices when it comes to San Francisco Soup Co... seriously... there are 5 within walking distance of this location... this one takes the cake.

Great ambiance and the menu has lots of interesting options.   My co-workers and I couldn't decide what to order.  We got the tableside guac which was $14!  Yummy, but probably not worth $14. I ordered the nachos whic were amazing.  Can't wait to go back at night and try the Sangria.
My review has a major caveat - I didn't pay for anything, nor look at the menu.

Yes, the guacamole lives up to everything you have heard! Made to order while you watch mesmerized by the mortar and pestle. If we go back, I will split the main course as it wasn't as memorable. I had the pork tacos which were on the crispy side and came with at least 6 shells and enough meat to feed two.

Initially our office group went there for lunch in July.  There were 5 of us.  Two of us ordered the Chili Releno and it just wasn't very good.  When I wrote a review about it on Open Table, Executive Chef David Suarez contacted me and invited us back with an offer of two free meals.  The 5 of us just went back and not only did we get two free meals, they made us all a complimentary appetizer, and brought us a complimentary desert.  The General Manager Elias Mandilaras, visited our table several times as did David Suarez to make sure that all was good with the food and service.  All of the food and service was beyond excellent.  I just think that they must have been having an off day or something back in July.  We were very impressed this time and will definitely be back.
The guacamole was absolutely amazing, but the small portion for 3 people was barely enough...expected more for the price. Oh and it wasn't made table side?
4 stars for drinks and service.

Ew. Everything we ordered was nasty. I'd rather eat at Chevys. The $14 guacamole was horrible. Fish tacos- horrible. Chicken enchiladas- horrible. Nick was best thing about the restaurant. Oh- and the margaritas- those were decent. Never again!

We frequent Rosa for many business lunches, but will have to set aside this venue for some time.  During a recent appearance my colleagues and I were ignored by a server who failed to make any of us feel welcome.  Because of this, we decided that drinks were the extent of our visit.  Upon our deparure, my colleague noticed that his sunglasses were missing as we exited the restaurant.  Within a couple minutes we were back at our table and requested that his sunglasses be returned.  The table was completely cleared, none of the servers responded, but thankfully the manager told us he would look into this issue and follow up the next day.  I do not want to make any false accusations, and am hoping that the sunglasses were simply misplaced.

This is a decent, if pricey, place for upscale Mexican food.  Started with the tableside guacamole.  The tableside preparation is a nice touch, though the taste of the guac itself is decent but nothing special.  I then had the tres enchiladas.  They were tasty but a bit bland, though I admit it may be my fault as I asked them to not add any additional peppers to the dish.
The guacamole is probably the only 4 star aspect of this fancy mexican restaurant.  I loved that they made it in front of you and you could adjust the spiciness as needed, also, DELICIOUS!
Was here yesterday and enjoyed the attentive service we received.  We first ordered the chips, salsa and guacamole along with cheese and chicken
I have been a Rosa customer for about 2 years now, and in the past 6 months the service has significantly changed.

We went for happy hour and had a good time.  We initially sat outside and had chips and guacamole and drinks.  Everything was great, but it got cold and we moved inside.  They had no problem with moving us in and where very kind and accommodating.  I had absolutely no idea how massive the inside is.  It's HUGE!  I also like the interior design - it feels fresh and modern.  I didn't get a chance to sample a lot of food, so this review is really for the drinks, service, ambiance, and general experience.  The staff were attentive and friendly and everything was great.  I can't wait to go back and try everything!

Really wanted to try the upscale Mexican restaurant but very disappointing between the service and quality of food. Drinks didn't make up for it either ,,,, they are well at Rosa Mexicano in San Francisco but nobody seems to care much about customer service. I felt pressured to place my order and leave pretty much from the moment I was seated. The tacos were cold, the waiter forgot our second entree and it's almost impossible to get the staff's attention for water, salt, etc.

I went there for a podcast on Monday night, and as someone who grew up in Southern California as has lived in the Bay Area since June of 2001, I know Mexican Food. The guacamole was amazing, and I had the Tres Enchiladas and they were delicable. Finally, we went to dessert and I am huge fan of Ice Cream. I had the Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream and it was amazing. Very close to the Embaracdero BART and Muni Station. I will definitely be going there again.
If you like slow, inattentive service this is just the place for you! Then again, if 80% of your dining room tables are empty you let staff off and hope the "B" team can cover (note to GM: it can't)

I'm from the Midwest. This is the classiest Mexican restaurant I've been too. Baja tacos were delicious. The jalapeño corn  Tatar sauce was interesting and sooo good. Wish we has some place like this around me. Glad we found this little gem. No free chips and salsa which I'm used to in my state. Only downside.

Great guacamole, nice set-up with area for lounge and drinks separate from dining area. Friendly and attentive service. Good, not great, food, with average portion size. Expensive, but if on the company dime, then a great choice for a casual-leaning business lunch.

I come here every six months or so to remind myself that I don't like it. As a happy hour spot, it's workable when not filled with the badged conference-goers who so often get shunted into this corner of SOMA. I've had pleasant evenings on the patio with chips, guacamole, and margaritas.
High priced, average Mexican food. You can honestly get better Mexican food for a waaaaay cheaper price. Chicken Quesadilla for $14 is really pricey.
Meh.

While in San Francisco, my friends spotted a Rosa Mexicano and stated we need to go in and have lunch. I had never heard of this chain, but I was pleasantly surprised. The nachos and the two salsas were very good and the guacamole is as good as everyone is stating in their reviews below. The chicken tortilla soup is outstanding with bid chucks of white meat chicken and an exceptional broth. You get a lot of food for lunch; so much so that we had to take almost half of it back with us for later. The desserts were exceptional also, but I found the margaritas quite small for the high price. Overall, a great find and I will look for this chain in other cities I visit.

The pomegranite margs are good, but real killers; crab enchiladas excellent and any of the ice creams for dessert!!! (Except the avocado!!!)  Overall, the meals were great, service great, ambiance nice.  I kind of expected more though...four stars is the best I can give it!
Amazing Guacamole

Lunch was decent, but expensive.  15 base price for fish tacos (3 of them).  The tacos were tasty, nicely fried and breaded, but it's just too pricy.  They also have a happy hour, which seems a little more reasonable, so I might check that out.
Rosa Mexicano is a hidden gem in SOMA area of SF. It's a cool vibe, great drinks, and solid food. I've always enjoyed eating there with friends.

I love this place!! Their table side guacamole, nachos and baja tacos are AMAZING. great service too. Its a really good place for a business lunch or dinner, but don't forget to make a reservation as they get packed.

I came here for a friends' birthday, so I was paying.  We sat at the bar for about an hour and had happy hour margs, chips and guac, and taquitos.  The drinks and food were really good.  As others have noted, the guac was delicious. It was a loud crowd at the bar, but that lent to the atmosphere.  The bartender was nice, but not overly so.  When we finally got to our table, we weren't that hungry anymore, so I got a quesadilla, which had too much sauce on it for my taste.   I would definitely come back for happy hour at the bar, as the margs and food were much more affordable and definitely worth the price.

I always love me some good mexican food and was excited to try out this place since there aren't too many upscale mexican dining places in the city. Checked in to this place twice with a bunch of friends and both the times, we didn't really leave happy.   While the ambience, service, location and the vibe of this place is just super, the food was a bit downer for us. With the ambience that good, I feel this place is just a perfect spot for the happy hour!

I went to this restaurant for a company lunch and it was a great place to go with your coworkers. Really good drinks, and even better food. The staff was oddly pushy and really wanted us to order more and more, even though we had already ordered appetizers, drinks, and main courses, but with that said, it was still a solid place to go for a company lunch. Would definitely recommend the tres enchiladas, as well as the lemon margaritas!

Wow, if you've ever been to Rick Bayless' Frontera Grill in Chicago, this place...doesn't even come close. I had really high hopes going in because my coworker said it was great and was charmed by its nice decor, but I left somewhat disappointed.

Best service ive had in  san francisco! Food was delicious and the service does not compare to any other place! They treat the customers as family and cater to your every need. The food is to die for. I would eat here every day lf the week

Absolutely phenomenal!  I've been here about 5 times already and have never been disappointed. The manager, Roger, goes above and beyond to cater to everyone's preferred tastes! Some of my favorite dishes are the short rib enchiladas,  the ceviche,  and the guacamole they make right in front of you. Great for both large groups and couples dates. We'll be going again very soon!

I'm addicted to the guacamole.  Best I've ever had. I dream about it.  But it's damn expensive.  Poor me has to settle for Costco guacamole.  Their lunch special is around $14 and comes with soup, 1 taco, 1 dessert, and a tiny portion of guacamole.  Good variety for a lunch special.  Their drinks are pretty decent too.  But other than that, food-wise, you don't get much for what you're paying.
One of my favorite mexican restaurants. Love the freshly made guacamole. The pan roasted cod was very good. Flavor wasn't too strong and was well balanced.
Regular @RosaNYC. was worried based on the reviews, but have to say our experience here was great. Definitely on par with our great experiences in NYC.
$26 tacos.
I paid $14 after tip for a margarita.
Came here for lunch working in FiDi and I've gotta say it's a pretty nice ambience to have in this area. There's a nice patio and the inside is well-lit. It's a bit pricy, but what do you expect?
Giorgio's offers delicious creamy pasta and that I can never finish, although I admit, I choose not to eat like a pig for lunch.

Company caters lunch from here now and then. Honestly, I'm generally not a huge fan of Italian food, so it's hard for me to like this place. Overall, the pasta is definitely flavorful, but also very heavy. The sauces were too creamy or rich in some cases in my opinion. And the pizza, likewise, is pretty greasy. We also had various salads (house, caesar, spring mix) with our catering.

When our office wanted to order pizza to watch the Giants parade... I remembered a voucher Giorgio's sent me. Unfortunately, the voucher had expired, but I still knew that their pizza was delicious because I had gone to their Clement St. restaurant. So we ordered the pizza from Giorgio's. They let us know that pizzas were running late because of the parade. So they gave us an ETA from 12:30-12:45.

Their pizza - by - the - slice successfully emulates the flavor of real New York style slice without being overly greasy or messy.  The crust is crispy and firm and the slice size is more than generous. As somebody who has been searching for good New York slice for years, I'm glad I tried Giorgio's.
Alright. Who put the workers up to this shenanigans.

Mediocre pizza.  Sauce and dough are pretty bland, but well priced for lunch in the Financial District.  Based on the other reviews, if I come back, I'll stay away from the slices and would try pasta/salad instead.
Best calzone pizza there is!

First I give the place a one star for location and the cleanliness of the store,and another star for good customer service,warm inviting personnel. But for the pizza- one word:disappointing. I ordered two slices of cheese pizza. I could tell by the appearance it was not going to be good. The crust was to crisp,the sauce OK,and it could have used more cheese. I did not finish the slices,and just scrapped the cheese off. I think the location is so good-guaranteed traffic that they just don't give attention to the product. I look to try it again hopefully I can bump up the stars.

Pretty solid pizza place in Crocker for those days when the lunch you brought from home sounds awful, and you have a mad hankering for some hot pizza. The slices are large and in charge, one does it for me, and you can get the lunch special which is a salad and drink with your slice for like $7, or just get a slice for about $3, your call (duh).
I was craving meatballs, and these were great. Portion was almost too big - felt guilty for eating them all. Sauce was delicious and hearty. Excellent stuff!
Really yummy, inexpensive, and quick lunch spot. I got the regular make your own pasta with broccoli, sun dried tomato, pesto and penne. It was so big and made fresh to order.
Amazing!
Oh, man. These guys are awesome. YOU CAN BUILD YOUR OWN SLICE! Sometimes you just want things the way you want them, am I right?!
They decided to close up 30 minutes early ahead of their posted hours. Depriving me of a pizza.

This place rocks for lunch. For $8 you can get a large slice of pizza, a salad and a soda. The pizza is thin crust and has just enough sauce, toppings and cheese and isn't too greasy. You can tell the salad is fresh as well. They get a little busy during the lunch rush but are pretty good at getting your food out quick so you can go back to sitting at your desk and getting fat. Will definitely be back here for lunch sometime in the near future.
I had a bad experience but responsive management resolved the situation.

Giorgio's does a pasta-of-the-day that I've had perhaps a half dozen times. It's consistently extremely good, made fresh to order and right in front of you while you wait. Big helping of pasta, side salad, bread and a drink for $9... hard to argue.

5.71 Pasta. That is about as cheap as you can get in SF, and there's free bead. Finding cheap places are hard to find so when you find one (that's sanitary) you stick to it, so I'll stick to Giorgio's.

I get a slice of the special of the day and a slice of buffalo chicken (if they have it available that day). Pizza is awesome. More than enough toppings. The dough and crust are thin and crispy and never soggy. Who knew I you could get great pizza inside a food court at a mall? You can at Giorgio's.
yay! Giorgio's in crocker, any drink + pizza + side salad = $7!  good deal.
I think the food and service a good.  I find the restaurant too noisy.  I could hear the people at the table next to us and not my wife sitting across  the table.  We will be going back.

Threw an event here for 50. The staff was friendly, professional in helping beforehand, and helpful on the day of.. Despite the noise my group caused, they were happy to assist with anything we needed and brought out enough food for everyone.
So many years later and Palio is still easily one of the best happy hour deals in the city... or at the very least in the FiDi.

Love this place. Stayed at the Hilton for six weeks and came here at least once a week. The owner knew me by name after the first visit.  Each time I came in he made sure to talk to me. And the food....... It is fabulous!  I will come back here every time I am in town.
Beautiful restaurant with great food and service.

I just had lunch here and was so disappointed.  I had been here many years ago when it was excellent.  Now it is worse than average.  I had a limp Caesar salad with croutons that tasted like they came of out of bag, this was followed by a bland piece of snapper (they use frozen fish) in a sauce that was not working.  Nice old school room, friendly service, and this food is not up to current SF standards.

Wasn't impressed. I expect to be wowed for the price of their food and I wasn't.  It was good but nothing I'd crave or return for. The customer service was very good though and my friend enjoyed their cigar options.

Ate in the backroom with a larger group. The food was decent, but certainly not outstanding or memorable. The mixed salad was typical, the pasta and meatballs were decent, the fish was ok, but not great, and the canoli dessert was not great, with the shell too dry and flavorless. Good wine list and full bar offerings.

Wondering in the area looking for a nice restaurant to have dinner, we stood by Palio. The owner invited us to come in and check the restaurant, and assured us that the food would be good. We decided to try it. The food was excellent, and the service was attentive. The owner was attentive

I came here for a private buffet dinner. The service was good, but the food was very lacking. After taking a look at their regular menu, I'm not sure I would want to pay full price for an entree of mediocre food. In a large city such as SF, there are literally dozens of other Italian restaurants I would rather eat at.
The food is just okay, the service was quite poor.  There are way too many good places to eat in the City to eat here again.

Great food and excellent service. Another plus is that the tables are spaced out so you aren't cramped like in many places. My waiter kept my water glass full and was back to check with us whenever we needed anything. The Mista de Peche is excellent! The service and seating though put it apart from many restaurants in the city that don't mind ignoring guests or cramming then in.

Really wasn't sure what to expect coming into this place because the reviews on Yelp are just mediocre but I was actually pleasantly surprised with my meal. We got the veggie pizza which was great and the knoccie was pretty good to. You don't realize how big this place is until you walk inside the place is HUGE. There are several rooms that would be great for large parties.

I came here with my boyfriend for dinner and we loved it! We didn't know how to pronounce anything on the menu but it's ok, the waiters were kind enough to explain but we ended up going with a salmon with mash potatoes and broccoli. It was Devine! It was grilled and amazing! They have soup and salad as an appetizer and I recommend their tomato basil! It's like nothing I've ever tasted! Totally recommend!!
Recommended here by our hotel for our large group which included kids. We're enjoyed a great meal and friendly service Endicott war great for a last minute Saturday night meal

Returned to this SF stand-by after years of absence. Sort of expected memory to be better than reality, but pleasantly surprised to find the same excellent service and delicious food. Where to start? Great wine recommendations, no problems with splitting appetizer (they even divided it for us without asking) or with special request on entree (you want different sauce on pasta? No problemo...) . Food was excellent, server's timing was impeccable. Prices reasonable, too. Don't miss this SF tradition!

My husband and I visited Palio D'Asti for our anniversary and had a wonderful time. The service is fantastic and food kept us excited the entire evening. I loved how you can have small bites to begin the evening to work up to your main dish. We tried the bruscetta and crab deviled eggs, which were both spectacular! The eggplant scoffle appetizer was also very good. We finished our meal with the crap spaghetti and absolutely loved it even though we were already so full and content with our meal. Great evening!

The vibe of the restaurant is positive. The staff is super friendly, as well as the owner who interacts with his customers and asks how they're doing. He definitely values your presence and ensures your satisfaction.
We returned here for a quiet dinner and we were not disappointed. The food is creative and tasty. The service attentive and not rushed a very romantic spot and fit for foodies.
Loved the lentil soup, but did not find tempting vegetarian options. Ambiance is classy, service was good too. It looked like the place was good for drinks and social gathering to me.

Party of 6; service was very spotty and not very interested. Decor feels like a cheap casino restaurant in Las Vegas. Food was at best a C grade...I am a bit surprised how they do so well in SF financial district. 5 out of 6 of my colleagues felt it was a pro choice. Unfortunately I picked the restaurant. Crab pasta was capellini with sweet tomato sauce. My colleagues felt the pizza was quite mediocre. Salads we're ok. Sorry I had to provide a poor review but the restaurant needs to know.
The food is not worth its price. Not bad but not great. However I did not try their happy hour pizzas. That might be more worthwhile.
I had lunch here and it was very nice, food was great and the staff were friendly and seemed really happy. Overall great vibe.

Had a wonderful 2 hour dinner at Palio D'Asti with some guests from out of town. The wine list was excellent as always and we tried the calamari (an interesting red sauce came with it) and the D'Asti pizza with asparagus (which are currently in season!). My guests all had the swordfish special but I went for the risotto of the day (duck with Tuscan kale and fennel) - divine! Rounded it all off with a solo espresso and cannoli ("Eat it by hand" - advised the waiter, when I asked for a fork, so I did!) and cookie platter for all to share.

I was here for drinks and dinner a couple of weeks ago. Enjoyed the company, service and the food was just OK. Our waiter was an older gentleman who was super entertaining. I had the feeling that he had tons of interesting stories from his past and I would have liked to have listened to them.

What is this magic? Palio d'Asti has the happy hour deal of the century! Buy two drinks and unlock a 12" wood-fired pizza for a buck? Um, yes please! I really can't get over this deal. Stroll in to the bar on a given weeknight with a friend, each order a drink, and share a pie. In fact, stick around and order a second drink, then another pie. Two people, four drinks, and two pizzas for around $40? That's pretty insane. Especially when you're talking about fairly high-end pizza.
I came here with Gee H. because I had a

What a great place for Happy Hour! If you get a chance stop by and try one of their fahbulous pizzas for only $1.00! Had the Funghi made with wild mushrooms, fontina val d'aosta, roasted garlic, and rosemary. Can you say Yummy to the Tummy? Tried a bite of the Zucca and I say "Awesome". Can't go wrong with any of them at this point. Our bartender Hillary was top notch customer service friendly and took great care of us. Will definitely be back soon!
went in here last night for a company dinner.

Palio has been around a long time for a reason.  Not flashy or trendy, they stick to traditional Italian dishes that are beautifully prepared.  Their homemade pastas are delicate and flavorful.  The prix fix special is highly recommended.  The four of us had a nice array of dishes.  Salads included the Romaine, with dates, walnuts and goat cheese which could have used a tad less dressing but was very good.  The Italian kale, ricotta and orange slivers was solid.  The small portion primies all hit the mark, the lobster ravioli was great and the lasagna cinghale was a lovely pasta with that unmistakable boar flavor.  The mains were uniformly terrific  The grilled prawns were excellent, as was the duck leg with mushrooms and chestnuts.  The rolled coneglio was interesting and while a little dryer than ideal the fennel sausage and herbs made for some wonderful flavors.  The décor is fine with an open kitchen, booths and our server was one of the best we have ever encountered.  She was very helpful and her calls were spot on.  We'll be back.  Sometimes you just have to thank a place for delivering without getting too cute.

Forgot post this draft: Came in on a TravelZoo coupon was treated very nice not like a second class citizen. Michelle was very attentive n helpful with her suggestions. The three course prefix was more food than we could finish!
Really bad service. I won't be back.
What a charming spot right in the heart of San Francisco. A great restaurant with a good staff. The food is excellent. It's a must try, really!

Went on a Friday night and there seemed to only be 1 waitress working the entire place, so service was slow.  Everyone was very pleasant working there, from the bussers, manager, bartender, and waitstaff.  Service was slow but very kind, no problem.  Their specialty drinks are interesting, and good.  Nothing was super impressive but our group had a nice time.
3.5 Service was a little slow, but friendly. What a deal. $38 for a 3 course meal. You get a soup or salad, small pasta, and an entree.

I think I want to give 3.5 but that's not possible. I came here with my parents and sister on a Saturday. Making a reservation wasn't necessary since it wasn't packed. It was my parents first time eating out at an Italian restaurant so I wanted their first time to be really nice. Actually... I only found this place because I saw that there was a
Woohoo, first Yelp of 2014!

We came here for dinner on New Year's Eve. Before sitting down at our table we had a drink at the bar, and loved the idea of a Build Your Own Manhattan. Drink prices are reasonable - especially considering this is the center of the FiDi.

I used to eat here often years ago when I worked in SF. I ate here this ev ending and was very disappointed.  I ordered the veal and it was dry and overlooked.  I would have told the waiter but I never saw him again until he came by 30 minutes later to ask if we wanted desert

Been here three times now and it continues to keep our party happy and returning. We visit the City at least once a year every year for the past 30+ years and this has made the list to repeat. We brought the in-laws this time and even they enjoyed themsevles. We enjoy fine food and are very particular in our choices. Food is our priority but its nice when service accompanies the fine tastes the kitchen prepares.

Good spot to get some good healthy food in a hurry. I went and had their lunch special spiced chicken and potatoes while I was working down the road and it was great. Little on the price-y side for what you get, but it was fast and substantial.

The rain was pouring this evening, and my friends and I were trying to decide on a decent place to dine in right away to avoid being further drenched outside in the cold rain; so we decided to try this place.  Whoever was managing this restaurant at the time we were there acted like we were an inconvenience to him for some reason and treated my friends and me shabbily and was pretty mean.  My friends wanted to just leave and find another place, but we stayed since it was still pouring rain outside.  I guess he was having a bad day or something, but, long story short, we hurriedly ate our meal and left right away.
This place is a hole in the wall but the food is great!

It's a great spot in FIDI to have quick lunch don't have to wait at all it takes less than a minute to get gyro wrap it's fast flavorful and cheap as well I tried lamb and beef gyro wrap it was best gyro I tried in FIDI ,  my co-workers had falafel wrap she said  falafels are crisp and  fresh as well ...recommended
Hum!  Where do I start?  I guess I'll start by saying that I love Mediterranean food, truly, I do.
This place has quickly become one of my regular lunch places.

I've recently been coming to Gyro King every week for a lamb and beef gyro. The combination of meat and yogurt has got me salivating when it comes lunchtime. If you get it to go, you don't get any french fries. But if you get the gyro for there, you get a few french fries on the plate!
I love this place, I'm addicted to this place.
3.5 Stars.  The first time I came here I thought that I was totally loved it and would come all the time.
THE FOOD:
Good food, the wrap was dry, i would get the combos next time.
Can't say I'll stop here again.  When you reheat cooked gyro meat in the oven you basically end up with dried out meat which was the case here.
Food is good but always unorganized.  I've had the last two orders completely forgotten.  If you don't have a half hour to wait call it in advance or don't bother.

I ate authentic gyros and kebab before in Greece and in Turkey. What I ate at Gyro King did not remind me of any of the ones I ate in both countries. The rest of my recent experience at Gyro King was disappointing as well. The meat was very dry and it had no flavor. The tzatziki sauce was very watery and only had a slight yoghurt taste - far, far from what real tzatziki sauce should taste like. The fries were soggy and lukewarm. Not sure why Gyro King doesn't offer a version with authentic Turkish bread, that would taste so much better.

Not the best gyro I've had. The chicken was pretty dry and I asked for some of their extra sauce and they said it's already in the wrap. So consequently, I asked for some of their spicy sauce to add some flavor and it tasted a lot better. A good place for a quick lunch if you're in the area but wouldn't recommend it if you only have time to try one place.
The grilled lamb, chicken and beef are delicious.  The baba ghanoush is the best I've ever tried, and has kept me coming back to this place every week.

Lamb and beef wrap awesome lunch on Saturday also and with fries! I've worked almost next floor for two years and just tried this place now. Awesome food for 7 and change, nice atmosphere, nice people!
Beef kebab and chicken shish kebab were both too dry and hard. Falafel was dry and tasteless.
Just ordered hummus and chicken kebab to-go.  "Fresh" Bread is horrible and crusty and tiny compared to hummus proportion.
Gyro King? More like Gyro Pauper. I've had my fair share of gyro in my life, and this has been one of my worst experiences by a very long shot.

Don't go there! Cheap gyros! Its not even a gyros, far from what you would get in Greece! Chicken gyros had only chicken, lettuce and mayo... I didn't finish the wrap to avoid get sick, and got out of there with a good heart ache.

If you are looking for healthy food, plenty of vegetables, low carb, a place you can sit down at your own table even when there are lines out the door everywhere else try Gyro King.  There is almost always seating, order where you walk in, pay at the register.  They will bring your food to you.  I love the appetizer combo plate and the two different stuffed half eggplants.  One has meat, the other vegetables.  If you like spicy food, try the ezme spread.  Spicy hot peppers, tomatoes, walnuts and olive oil.  Very satisfying.  The chicken kebabs look good too.  The hummus is good as is the falafel.  You can get in and out quickly and have a healthy, tasty lunch in a homey setting.

For the past couple of months, I've had a big ole crush on tzatziki.  Searching through yelp for nearby places for that thick creamy goodness, I stumbled upon Gyro King.  The other places had tzatziki sauce that was runny... not what I was looking for.  In any case, I ended up with the appetizer combo plate: humus, eggplant, baba ghanouj, dolma, piyas, cucumber, falafel, tabouli and bread.  The bread was blah, but the rest was DELICIOUS!  The falafel was crunchy on the outside, warm/soft on the inside... everything else tasted fresh and flavorful in their own distinct way.  The tzatziki had great texture with the creaminess and barely there cucumber.  The oregano, dill and garlic balanced well and my craving was fulfilled... for that day.  It was a lot of food and had leftovers.  I'll be back for more.

Like a lot of places in this area they just want people in and out of the restaurant as quickly as possible. Reflects in the quality of the product. Does the job of filling your stomach with calories.
Friendly staff, very helpful when I was asking questions about their dishes too.

I love that Mediterranean food is Paleo friendly. It has made me try many different restaurants lately. This one is really good. Clean yet still looks like what is a family owned business. I asked if I could leave out the rice and get more hummus and salad. It was no problem. Friendly place with good food.
Very disappointing chicken and beef/lamb gyros.
Good food but poor service. Every time I ask for the Lamb&Beef gyro w/ Fries lunch special for $7.50, they always got to give me some sort of an exception to up charge the extra $2.00 for the fries.

I ordered a lamb & beef gyro, and it tasted like sponge. Worst gyro I've ever had in my life. It lacked flavor (or salt; oh, how salt would have made a difference), and the tzatziki sauce was so watery that while I was eating the gyro, it sank all the way to the bottom. Now, I am left with a gyro stub filled with liquid, and my shirt won't forgive me for the stains I have exposed it to.

The food is the BOMB!! I ordered chicken kebab platter which came with rice green salad hummus and the yogurt sauce. Huge portions and very reasonable price. You can substitute other sides if u like and they don't charge !!! Go on empty stomach and definitely try the bakalavas. The girl at the register said her mom makes them. She sure makes the best bakalava in the bay!! Definitely coming again

Really solid Mediterranean food.  They are always very busy at lunch and you'll have a 10 minute wait if you order a wrap.  I usually alternate between their lamb and chicken salad, which the chef prepares very quickly right before my eyes. It is a huge portion and delish!  I like that the lettuce, carrots, and pickled cabbage are flavored individually so you don't require much of the accompanying creamy dill dressing. I have also had their gyro plate and adana kebab wrap and they were equally as flavorful.
Today may have just been a bad experience in Gyro King, but they really need to work on their assembly line approach.

Yum! I was looking for something local and tasty and decided to try this place out.  I had the appetizer sampler, which was a heaping plate of vegetarian salads, falafel, and fresh baked, warm-from-the oven flatbread.  The flavors were right on and each salad was distinctly different.  Dolma that practically melted in my mouth; tangy eggplant; creamy babaganouj; and literally the best tabbouleh I've ever had--lemony and authentic.  Friendly staff; everything made from scratch in-house.  Some of the best Turkish food I've ever had.

This place satisfies a quick, takeout style greek craving. It's nothing too fancy, but I came here to pick up some hummus, pita, chicken kebab, and pilaf. The whole thing was EXACTLY what I was craving. They even deliver in the local area. Really good :)
My boss and employee swear by this place, why I don't know. I have given it three chances and haven't been impressed. The meat is fairly bland for me.
This is my second time been in this place during the lunch hours they are one of the fastest one they have the best homemade baklava and revani ( sweet cake ) ..... I recommend this place

I've been a regular at this place for almost a year. It's so good that I come here almost everyday! The chicken gyro is great if you like dark chicken meat. Otherwise, the shish kebabs are bombs (they do take about 10 minutes to make though)
This place is amazing! Get #32 and ask them to wrap your meat like a gyro. Omg heaven! Cheap and delicious!
Small portions and expensive food that is "so so" at best.
Second time here and both times good food and service. Reminds me if the gyro carts in Israel back in the 80's. Good plating also

i really like this place. the salad and vegetables are always so fresh and the salad bar is always nice and clean. the owners are really nice too. if you think they're overpriced it's nothing compared to julie's kitchen which robs you blind.

I am a fan. A lot of varieties of already mixed salad with a Asian flare. It is on the cheaper side of a $/# salad bars in FiDi. Do have to be careful not to load your box with heavy stuff as it can add up. I usually can get a good amount of healthy & delicious food under $10.
Nice healthy affordable option in the FiDi. I go for the cold food and salad bar and have never been disappointed. Solid.

This place is so overpriced. I brought lettuce and chicken to work and went to their salad bar to grab some veggies to complete my salad--a few slices of tomatoes, onions, etc.--nothing fancy. When I got up to the counter, the checkout girl said I owed $11. $11?! For some tomatoes? I can go to mixt greens down the street and get a whole gourmet salad for less! What really pissed me off was the way she reacted to my concerns over the price:

This is my go to for a healthy lunch. They have a great variety of delicious fresh salads and items to make a salad. It is completely over the top with their many selections. I am hooked in the tofu bean salad and their Chinese chicken slaw.
Sometimes you feel like eating a giant box of random panchan: kongnamul, japchae, oi kimchi, regular kimchi, blanched kale, marinated tofu, etc.

I've been craving vegan vegan vegan for the past couple weeks, after eating pretty much every meat under the sun in one day on the Fourth. I stumbled across this place after a meeting today and had to try it! I knew I wanted to try that delicious-looking soba so, seeing that the pricing is per pound, I picked up one of the smaller plastic containers. I probably ended up getting half a cup of soba, a cup of the AMAZING vermicelli salad (so nom), and half a cup of the tofu-edamame salad. It was an extremely carby and filling lunch and must have been just a little over a lb because it was only $8! Score!

I've come here a few times now, it's right down the street from my work and the line moves pretty fast. I've only had the salad bar, I'm super iffy about hot foods that sit there for a while. The salad bar has many options but it's not super big, just the right amount of ingredients. Everything is fresh and they keep it clean. usually I spend about $10 for a salad here but i like how i get to prepare it myself and they have small containers for the dressing.

Great veg-friendly salad bar in the FiDi.  Normally I stay away from salad bars but this one is not too big, got some more unusual (aka Korean) eats in here like kimchi, oi kimchi (cucumber kimchi), japchae, spicy beansprouts... this place is great and well-priced, nice staff and the food tastes great!

This place is super close to my office, so I decided to give it a shot. Everything was super tasty until...wait, what is this inedible thing in my mouth? I pull it out, thinking it's just an inedible piece of veggie. Nope. Fingernail. I examined it. Yep, definitely a fingernail. Like somebody had clipped their finger nails too close to the food. I think I threw up in my mouth a little. I took the food back immediately, showed the manager the fingernail. He appeared confused, as "they wear gloves". But, he was very apologetic and gave me my money back. No amount of apology will make up for that, however. I get that hair in food happens on occasion. But fingernail? Major YUCK.

I went here today for the first time during lunch at noon which seemed like an ideal time ahead of the lunch crowd.  The place seemed clean and had adequate seating.  The overall selection was fine and of solid quality. I'd prefer more hot items and meats, but I really liked the cold options and salads which were more plentiful.  Good place for vegetarians, I think.  I love roasted beets and they had a nice pile.  I'd return back on occasion and rotate this one with Green Bar since they offer more hot items there.  Happy eating!

I come here pretty much 2-3 days a week. Good food, nice people & can be back to my office within 5 minutes. They do a pretty good job about keeping everything at the salad bar filled and all of the ingredients are fresh.

Everything about this place is gross.  The atmosphere is depressing and the food fits it perfectly.  I never win in the "pay per pound" department so it was really expensive too.  If forced to go back I will eat only the macaroni and the sausage.  Those were pretty good.

This is probably my least favorite salad/food bar in the FiDi area.  I have eaten here about 5-6 times, and the place is deceiving...there appears to be a large selection of fresh and nutritious foods...but the food is prepared way too far in advance and most dishes are overly salty or overly soaked in sauces/dressings.
Solid salad bar, cold selection is great, hot food is meh. The glass noodles are crack!!! They are so salty sweet and delicious. I always spend too much on one lunch tho.

I don't like to write "burn" reviews, but this needs to be said: I used to go here all the time until it made me really sick one night. I feel bad saying it because the staff is so nice, but seriously, be careful. Maybe going earlier in the day when things are fresher? Either way, there needs to be a better sneeze guard, and folks need to be mindful of not throwing their tongs back into the food containers handle-first, because what I experienced after I ate here was extremely unpleasant.

First timers beware -- and don't make the same mistake I did -- the cost of your food is dependent on the weight. During my initial visit to Wildflower Cafe years ago, I naively thought I could pile on food at the mere cost of $7.99 for AYCE. Little did I know it was that price by the pound, so imagine my surprise when the bill came out to be over $15!
I like to come here when I'm looking for a quick lunch and some variety in my meal. This is definitely my favorite salad bar/hot food bar in the financial district.
Mix of salad bar, hot foods and asian salads.  Price per lb is $6.99 so be careful what you pack on to your togo container.

I love this place for lunch.  I have been trying very hard to eat as many fresh, unprocessed foods as possible.   However, I hate ordering salads at places such as Mixt Greens, where mostly you get lettuce, with some toppings, but find yourself hungry again after a couple of hours.  I am not a rabbit!  Most of that lettuce goes to the trash bin.  With Wildflower, I can alternate between making a nice salad with the veggies and toppins that I actually like, plus a nice amount of protein - either turkey or their cooked chicken thighs (yum)...or side salads and  veggie dishes plus chicken and brown rice.  Either which way, it is fresh and healthy, if you make the right choices.  I am also full until dinner.  I usually end up spending $8-$12 for lunch, which is very typical for FiDi, and again, it is fresh, and I am full until dinner.  Usually, if I try to spend less than $10 elsewhere, I find myself hungry again pretty fast.  I come in at least twice a week, and will continue to do so.  Thanks Wildflower!!!
Pretty good place for lunch in the fidi.  Hot and Cold by the lbs food.  If you don't select wisely it can get pricey.
To quote The Cult:  "I'm a wolf-child girl, howling for you"
There are far better options like lee's and cafe med nearby..food is just ok no taste at all..the hot entrees were cold and bland..and expensive.

I have been here way too many times to not have left a review already. This is by far the best salad bar I have encountered in the FiDi. They have so many options (broccoli AND cauliflower!) I am always thrilled. They also have lots of hot entrees - they used to have this asparagus that was seriously giant and delicious. The prices are right on the mark too - only $6.99 a pound, and they refuse to charge you for the bread. I don't care if I end up not working in the FiDi anymore, I"m coming back here.

Been a while since I'd been, but I think this is a very good place with nice assortment and enough elbow room to handle the busy times.  Good free piece of bread was very fresh.  Loved the noodle assortment.  Fair price for a meal that satisfied my hunger.
This place is decently priced for decent food.  Nothing special...just so so.

I like this place for the variety of vegetables and other items that are available (i.e. Brussels sprouts and Mac and Cheese). You many also create your own salad if you would like. The food can add up to more than what you think, so beware! Other than that, it offers a lot more healthy choices than Lee's.
Fresh salads, ok. But the chicken was cold and chewy. In this place stick to the salads.

Great salad bar. I normally skip the pre-made salads in the beginning and go straight to the end so I can make my own salad. They always have lots of avocado and other good mix-ins. I end up making a salad thats way better than mixt greens for half the price. I wouldn't go out of my way for this place but its perfect for a quick lunch in the financial district.
good place to have a quick lunch in financial district and price there is more affordable than other similar cafe

Tray up!!  This place charges you by the pound, $6.99/lb If I remember correctly or maybe just $6, awesome right?!! Plus, the food is oh so yummy! I really liked their salad bar, with all those fresh and delightful toppings. They also had fried chicken, mac and cheese, soups, and I think I remember seeing some pizza there too! I don't fully remember since its been a while back since I had visited this spot. Overall, I was happy and healthy too!! :)
Go wild.

Clean and numerous fresh salad options along with yummy prepared cold and hot food.  The food is always fresh.  Nice rotating selection of hot foods too -- korean barbeque on mondays and thursdays are my favorite, along with the mac n cheese and meatballs.  The owners- a couple-- are super nice and friendly.

Love this buffet! It has a lot of options and is pretty reasonable. I would load my plate up pretty well spend between $10-$12 and have lunch for two days! Plus it is the perfect quick stop and HEALTHY!
Great selection of entrees and a good salad bar.
Ouch! $17 for lunch. But I like it.

This place is great for vegans and vegetarians. Lots and lots of vegetables to choose from. Protein selection is few only  chicken and tofu but they do taste good. They also offer lots of fresh fruits such as Strawberries and Pineapple.

This place is great for lunch if you're not quite sure what you want because they have EVERYTHING! Everything is laid out buffet style (keep in mind it's not all you can eat) and you just pick and choose what you want.  Be careful not to go overboard though because it's priced by weight!

very quick, reasonable price for quality (comparing to whole foods salad bar here) I like the kale mixed with chicken or turkey, and a side of soba noodles and another fresh vegetable mixed in..... fairly fast lines, and they take amex. Minus one star for the strange lay out of the place, I wish each item was easily reachable from all parts of the line....

This place has an amazing food bar, ranging from fresh cooked meats to fresh vegetables and salads. The nice part is that you can choose whatever items you want to eat since they have a really nice selection and the workers are really friendly.  The unfortunate part is that if you're like me where you eat with your eyes, you may spend a lot more than what you originally intended to.
I liked the lentil soup here, tasty and filling.
Time: 11:07am/63°F mostly cloudy
Best salad bar in FIDI.  Good spaghetti,  pizza and chicken plates as well.   And... if your salad bar weighs exactly a pound your lunch is free!
Discounts after 2pm.  Salad bar, chicken plate or slice of pizza w/free soda.
This place is pretty consistent in its food quality. A few notable call outs would be cheesy potatoes, sausage mushroom pizza and cheese enchiladas. Very busy after 12:00 so go a bit early.

Pros: They have a good selection of food: Pizza, pasta, salad, and sandwiches.  Their prices are dirt cheap for the city!  HUGE slices of pizzes for $3 something, sandwiches for $5 and some change.  A steal!

The food at Portico's is always good. My favorite is probably the rotisserie chicken. this review is mostly about the take out/delivery service. Our office often orders food from Portico's for clients in our office and they never fail. Their pizza, pasta, chicken, it's all good.

First time trying the pizza and I was shocked at how much I liked it. The only reason I'd ever come to Portico's is for the salad bar. I had a mushroom/pepperoni slice and it was pretty filing. The crust was a perfect thin & there was just the right amount of toppings all for a few bucks. Luckily this time I decided not to wait it out in the salad line & take a chance on a hot slice. Glad I did. Now I won't only be going back for a hefty salad box, there may be a pixxz box on top of it as well.

I usually don't get to eat here bec of their hours, I'm so glad I finally got to try them. Their pizza is actually decent and the slices are huge! I tried the Mushroom and the Hawaiian, both very tasty. Looking forward to trying others in near future

I have been going here for years to pick up a quick lunch to take back to my desk.  The service and food has always been great, the recent addition of a fresh hot veggie bar has prompted this post.  Trying to find healthy food to go other that a salad is tough.  But the hot fresh veggie bar with mushrooms, Brussel sprouts, asparagus and much more makes this easy and very healthy.

This place is usually the go-to spot for me, because its steps form my work.. the salad bar is always stocked with fresh produce and veggies.  There pizza slices are HUGE! There Roasted chicken is perfectly cooked..other than the good food they serve, the father and son team that are always at the registers, are always very polite and accommodating!   You feel like the appreciate your business..

I'm just leaving a review here to give a shout out to porticos because I come here practically everyday to get toppings for my salad, and everyday they're friendly and ring me up quickly.  Good job, Porticos!
My go-to lunch spot! The salad bar is awesome! Always fresh! And they have little app size pizzas incase you want to have one but cant really afford to eat a whole slize cause you're on a diet. LOL.

Its an okay place to grab a salad.  I come here because it is located very near by my work.  I like it because you can put absolutely anything you want on your salad.  Right when you walk in its on the left.  Grab a plate and start piling it on.  Be careful though the charge you by the pound.  $6 a pound for a salad seems a bit high to me.  You have to choose wisely on what to put on the plate and carefully guesstimate the weight of your salad.  For a quick grab and go this is the place.  There is also indoor seating if you wish to dine in.  The atmosphere is a little loud during the lunch rush.  There is a small park located across the street for some nice quiet time.

Portico is a lunch staple for me. The salad bar is pretty much always fresh, has hot items and is cheap.   Compared to say, Mixt Greens and Julie's Kitchen which are out of the park expensive.  I usually go for the 'healthier' items such as mixed salads, salmon and grilled veggies.   I rarely spend over $6.  All in all a great lunch option for the FiDi.
The food is pretty good, but the management and staff are sullen and unfriendly; consequently the karma of the place seems very sad and off-kilter.

As a former New Yorker, I love finding places in California that will actually sell you a slice of pizza! And as someone whose income varies wildly, it's also nice to find a place that gives you gobs of food for relatively little money, especially when you're hungry. Add in the fact that Portico has a buffet and you can see why I was excited to find this place!

Portico's is an awesome place to share a pizza with some friends. My absolute favorite would probably be the Hawaiian pizza, and my husband sometimes switches it up a little bit and gets a sandwich. He enjoys the corned beef sandwich and says it's one of the best. Very yummy place!

I wonder are these independently operated?  I say this because the other locations are so much better and the employees are friendlier.  This location nickle and dime for bread and meatballs; whereas the location on 1st and mission is pretty generous with meatballs and bread.  Just don't like the vibe as much as I do the others locations.  Pass this one up and walk to 1st and mission, crowded, but friendlier and better cooked food.

4 stars for the relatively quiet upstairs area which I use to study and do work. Also, you can't really go wrong with salad and salmon for lunch and when you're dieting to fit your bridesmaid dress and look good for the wedding, Portico is the way to go.
Stumbled on this place when we couldn't get a quick spot at the Vietnamese place next door.
Porticos is my go-to place for lunch. They have a big variety of food and I usually go to the salad and hot food bars.

This restaurant has a different vibe than its Beale Street cousin.  Located at 1st and Mission, across from the mess that used to be the Transbay Terminal, the place is darker and not as much space to sit.  The staff seemed overworked but friendly and willing to get your order done and out the door quickly.

I love the salad bar at this location, tons of options. The food here isn't the best, but it's pretty cheap (especially for the area). You get what you pay for with this place. Also, there is a ton of seating which is nice.
This place grabs four stars for price alone. I had the pizza which was pretty average but a huge slice for $3 in downtown SF is very hard to come by. No lines, no fuss give it a try.
Portico has a pretty good selection of lunch items at a good price.  The salad bar has good variety and is very affordable.

A good, solid, reasonably priced salad bar is what draws me to Portico.  Not the greatest salad bar in FiDi but always consistent and worth a stop-by every week or so.  Pizza and sandwiches are pretty decent as well

I've only really been here after 2 PM since it's right down the street from where I work and the salad bar is only 5.95/lb after 2 (no lines too!). I think for 5.95, the salad bar here is well worth it. The first time I got it, I was careful so I actually managed exactly .99 pounds for a rather large salad with even some macaroni and shrimp salad (which btw is very flavorful and delicious- I put it on my salad every time now). Now that I know what's good, my salads are a little heavier, but I still manage to under $8, which I think is pretty good for the quantity and the variety of other "salad" toppings. I recommend the macaroni salad, shrimp salad, the salmon, tri-tip, and the long pieces of some mysterious turkey-spam kind of meat and the ham next to it; with all these other toppings, I don't even need dressing for my salad! The chicken is always a little dry though, especially since I hit the past 2 pm mark.
I go here almost weekly while I'm at work. Their staff is great and the pizza is awesome. A personal pizza and a soda for $5.50?? Kinda hard to beat if you ask me.

This place is awesome! They have a DIY salad bar with tons of topping choices that are cut into decent sized chunks so they dont weigh a ton (which is how most places get your $$.) It aslo has fresh salmon and steamed fish which is delicious.

Portico's is a regular for me. When I'm craving a good DIY salad, this is the spot.  I spend anywhere from $7-$8 . But what makes this place different is that have more of a variety of toppings.  Plus, I like the fact that the toppings aren't hugely cut (which obviously weighs the salad down) which in the end you end up paying grip for.  You can get a little bit of everything.  Another good thing is they have a diner's club card (if that's what you call it). Basically, x number of lunches gets you a $6 or $8 off your next meal.

Your prototypical fidi lunch spot. Nice variety of selections on the salad bar but you can easily shoot over $10 if your not anorexic. Their pizza isn't gourmet but it'll fill you up and they serve a decent rotisserie chicken lunch special. It can get loud at lunch but there is an upstairs area where you can get some work done during your lunch break.
I work across the street from this place andit always calls my name

Like, well, pretty much every other Fi Di lunch establishment, this one likely wouldn't make it on the outside.  It exists for the sole purpose of satisfying your lunch craving on a work-day.  And that it does, quite nicely.
Portico's is great when you want comfort food and don't want to spend a lot of cash. Here's my take...
If I had to constrict my review to Portico's in one sentence that would be "It's just OK."

Now here's an employee cafeteria that isn't an employee cafeteria. Just think of it...you don't have to be employed to enjoy the impersonal service that you remember experiencing when you did hate your job. Portico here is pretty much the same food selection - expansive salad bar and hot food - as the one across from the Transbay Terminal, but this one feels more sterile, more corporate since it is housed in an actual office building.
For the money, this is a great place to have lunch.  The place is huge and they are very efficient at processing you through the system.
Huge salad bar with a large assortment of toppings....
I was in a pizza kind of mood today, so I made the trek across Market Street to pick up a slice at Portico. I had the cesar salad/pizza combo with a pepperoni sausage.
Very good quality bread, pastries, sandwiches, and coffee. Only criticism is that the woman at the register is very unfriendly and doesn't say "thank you.'  so rude.

Oh yeah, Andersen. I work right across Market from this location, so I come here often enough to know how much time it will get me to get the $7.75 Half Sandwich/Salad Combo and bring it back to the office. For all its sterile Danish appeal, I've never been all that motivated to eat my lunch there. I mean, after all, I've been to Copenhagen and that city has a lot more charm and character than this chain attempts to evoke. Maybe if Danny Kaye came out pretending to be Hans Christian Andersen and playing a concertina. Of course, that could be challenging since he's been dead for thirty years.

Andersen Bakery is located in the heart of the financial district in San Francisco and there is a lot of competition for the dollar.  I have always been impressed by how clean and attractive the bakery is.  When you step in you see a smorgasbord of baked goods. Today I went for the blueberry muffin and it was heavenly!  Prices are reasonable also.the muffin and fruit drink was 5 and change.
Nice decent sandwiches.  They wrapped my two half sandwiches separately so I'm giving an extra star for that. Price is moderate. My chicken salad was under $7.
I like the sandwiches here, but the service leaves more to be desired.

Sorry Andersens, all your baked goods taste like they are made with copious amounts of almond essence. And I've must have tried 10 different items, as my work gets your pastries for daily meetings. Never thought I'd say no to free muffins, etc..!

I tried the smoked ham and Emmenthal and wasn't overly impressed. It wasn't bad or anything - they actually gave you a decent portion for the price - just decidedly mediocre. I'm from the East Coast, so was unfamiliar with the franchise, but my overall takeaway was that it was Au Bon Pain-caliber food with hip decor. If I hadn't been rushing to a meeting, I would have definitely sought out a better local eatery. In an average city, I might rate higher, but considering SF's reputation as a hub of gourmet food, this place only gets 2 stars in my book.
Solid sandwich but kinda pricey.  Eight dollars for a turkey sandwich with avocado.
Updating my review after they've been open half a year and worked out the kinks.
I work right next door and this is my go-to when I'm in the mood for a sandwich.
I really love the cheese breads. So good on a rainy day.

Came here for lunch just yesterday. I wanted a quick lunch to grab and head back to the office. I ordered the chicken Caesar salad and a cup of their butternut squash soup. Both items came out to be about $11 so it was not bad. I didn't have to wait to long for my order because the salad was prepackaged and the dressing was on the side. It was a quick and easy lunch and I did like the soup so I will be sure to add this to my quick lunch to go spots into my rotation.

I placed an order for a cake for a bridal shower at work. They offered free delivery so it was even better. The cake came early and we were notified in change of delivery. I had a good experience with the bakery and good to use for work . Will definitely order from them again!

I heard of Andersen Bakery, but I have never walked into one until yesterday afternoon.  (My oldest sister has purchased pastries and breads from them many times in the past.)  She bought me an apple caramel muffin.  Though the muffin was dense, it sure complemented my cup of hot tea very well.
Lost and found.
As I work near 525 Market, I knew I'd be practically living in this place just by default, no matter how good it actually was.  Thank goodness it doesn't suck.

I used to go to Andersen Bakery when they (and my old job) were located further down Market.  I'd always loved their lunch soup and sandwich specials, so I was sad when my company moved away.  Fast forward a few years, both my job and Andersen have opened shop in the FiDi.   I've stopped in several times recently for lunch and was happy to find the same quality I came to expect from the old location.  My go-to lunch is a turkey & fresh mozzarella half sandwich (always really fresh tasting and the bread is delicious!) with a cup of ravioli soup, though the other sandwiches I've tried have been pretty good too.  They have a small but good selection of beverages, and their coffee is not bad either.
Delicious soups, though make sure it's appropriately filled before you leave. They do care about customer service, which is what makes it a 4-star place in my book.
I really have a soft spot for Andersen Bakery -- I loved their pesto bread as a kid -- but I just can't bring myself to recommend this place for lunch.

Close to my work, so it's easy to stop by for a bagel or pastry on my way into the office. It really is nothing special, however, and after my first time I wouldn't come here for lunch again. Somewhere else, this place might get 4 stars. However, with all the varied and delicious food you can find in the Financial District, especially sandwiches and salads, this just doesn't measure up.
