The only other Andersen Bakery location that I know of is in the Newpark Mall in Newark.   My ex-coworkers used to LOVE  and I mean LOVE the Andersen Bakery in that old aging mall.   Fast forward to today and I'm no longer working in Newark and  now in the cafe competitive SOMA area of downtown SF.  There's over 30 places that can make the sandwich in 30 different ways.  Competition is pretty freaking fierce!

The sandwich and soup were great. The pastries up front looked delicious as well. Make sure to budget a whole lot of time before you come however as it took a very long time for order to be ready (while people served after me got their food first).

Andersen Bakery just opened up in the neighborhood. There wasn't a huge line of people in front. I'm guessing the reason why is it's an average place. The inside of this place looks really nice with it's freshly made feeling and smell.
Big sandwiches at decent price considering the quality of the food. Their chicken salad sandwich (on sourdough) is SO GOOD. I have yet to try many other sandwiches b/c I always get that one.

Walked in while on the way to the Ferry Building. I imagine this bakery gets really crowded on weekdays since it's right in the middle of FiDi. But on Saturday, it's mostly empty. They serve coffee, sandwiches, different kinds of bread and pastries, and dessert. I got a slice of the chocolate ganache cake, which looked pretty good (plus it was inexpensive). It was decent, slightly too sweet for my preference. The bread all looked pretty good and I might come back to try them.

There aren't many places in San Francisco where your lunch would cost you $7.50 and some change, except here at Andersen. This was my second time grabbing lunch from Andersen and I got the same thing both times; a half turkey and mozzarella sandwich with a house salad. The sandwich comes with romaine lettuce, sliced turkey breast, fresh mozzarella cheese, red tomato slices, fresh basil and mayo; you have your choice of bread but I chose Ciabatta. The house salad was mixed greens with cucumber slices, baby tomatoes, cheese, and house made croutons slices with balsamic vinaigrette. The half sandwich is more than enough on it's own but the salad is nice if you are bit hungrier or save it for later! Everything tastes very fresh and the basil adds a kick to the mayo on the sandwich!
As I see the cook destroy 3 crepes and discard them, i looked down at my own under-cooked crepe and realized it wasn't going to be what I had hoped for.

Decent spot, but takes forever to get my order. I usually have the D3 which is the chicken, cheese, sesame seeds, avocado crepe. It is filling and the crepe is cooked with wheat flour which makes it healthier. The cashier is always friendly - which is good, but all the food court choices are just ok to me at Rincon.

Today was horrible!! The crepe was dry, tasteless and had a gritty constancy to it! The fries were drenched in oil and looked like they were pan fried after being deep fried. There was the special fot like 10 bucks.. A savory crepe, a side and a drink.. The best thing I had today was the coke. It's funny to cuz I started to eat it right outside at the  one of the tables.. The chick inside saw how disgusted I was and just shrugged. Went to Yang Sing afterwards to fill my belly up with sesame balls instead. Was so tempted to go back in and let them know that the food was disgusting but there was a line growing and didn't want to start shit!  Total waste of money!!
Great lunch spot. Had the duck salad and it was very delicious. They run great deals if you're willing to eat lunch before the usual lunch rush.

So-so. I used the GoDish app to get my ahi tuna salad for a discounted price however the salad was only sub par! Disappointed because I got such a great deal but there were so many things I didn't like about my entree. The seared ahi tuna had absolutely no flavor whatsoever, there were no cheese options (which I put in every salad), and the dressing was super bland (sun dried tomato vinaigrette). I won't be coming back unfortunately, I'd rather pay full price for a quality salad somewhere else.
I always get the D4, which is a steak, bell pepper, arugula, and chipotle sauce crepe. It has never disappointed.
4.5 stars

Been here a few times now... I'm pretty excited about this place.  There's a wide variety of interesting things to try, and while nothing's blown me away yet, it's all been decent.  They let me substitute brie for the cheese on the beef baguette and that was yummy.
Nice little place located in the back area of Rincon, has sandwiches, pre-made salads and make your own salads. Saw a couple items on the breakfast menu that were interesting as well!
Wooow, the food is amazing here people. Service is really good, i am totally satisfied and i will come back for sure. Recommend to all the hungry people haha

I saw a lot of people here so I got in line and ordered the veggie burger. The friendly order taker-cashier said it would take 5 minutes. After waiting about 10-12 minutes, I took my box and being ravenous, proceeded to take a big bite. It was tasteless, really without flavor. The burger texture was mushy, the bun uninteresting. I was very disappointed. The only reason I give any stars is because staff were friendly; too bad the food wasn't good enough for me to go back

Tried a table for first time today. Ordered a grilled chicken breast sandwich and fries. The chicken breast was on a long baguette and as soon as I pulled it out of the sandwich sleeve, the two pieces of bread came out and the contents slid right out and stayed in the sleeve. I ate the chicken separately.
The team at A Table did a great job of getting themselves noticed inside Rincon Center. The white walls with the bright lights will definitely catch anyone's eyes.
Center of attention.

Thanks to the app Go Dish, I scored the ahi tuna salad which comes with french baguette bread and a macaron for a measly $5!  The place gets crowded quickly due to their small space. The drill is to order your food from the guy at the register and then proceed to the salad counter to choose six ingredients as well as your choice of salad dressing.  Sandwiches are premade and you can pick that up right away. I really enjoyed my ahi tuna salad and especially the chili balsamic vinaigrette dressing.  A Table will definitely be my new favorite place to grab a quick lunch!

This place just opened 3 weeks ago. I was very impressed with the selection of food and loved my ahi tuna salad. It was larger then I expected and all the ingredients were very fresh. I'll definitely come back! Macaroons were great too!

After working in the area for many years it is always great to see something new open up at Rincon Center.  When the focaccia-driven Italian-ish place closed I wondered what would replace it and for a long time the answer was nothing.

New eatery in Rincon Center!  A Table replaces a froyo place, and indeed it was a great change.  I love the mod, bright look of the cafe.  A Table serves up savory and sweet crepes, grilled sandwiches, baguette sandwiches, salads and some special plates.  If you're in a rush, they have salads and some sandwiches in the fridge ready to be rung up and taken away.  They also serve pastries too.  I ordered a chicken crepe ($7.95) with avocado, caramelized onions, and substituted the swiss cheese for jack.  After I got rung up on the iPad like device, they asked if I wanted a free pastry.  Of course the answer was yes and I chose the mini almond croissant.

They have the best spicy pho, and always get the seafood one (it's not the freshest seafood, but what do you expect for less than $10?).  I only get this pho here,  I wouldn't try anything else.  It's not the cleanest place around, I have heard of complaints.  But it's a pho place, I think they are all the same, cleanliness wise.  Just order the pho, and you are good to go.
Had spicy chicken noodle Pho Togo.. Not so impressive. It's full of oil
Since the closing of Pho-Hoa, there are VERY few places to get Pho in the Financial District.

A disappointing return visit. I had been thinking about fresh spring rolls all week and went to HK&K since I knew they had them.  The rolls were fat and sassy, but mostly filled with what seemed to be shredded iceberg lettuce and vermicelli noodles.  There was no discernible mint or basil in the rolls.  One plus was the dipping sauce, which was nice and peanutty.
Go up the stairs, order and pay at the counter and seat yourself.  Also drinks and utensils are self serve.  The staff will bring your food to your table.

After discovering that Hong Kee & Kim serve boba, I made the quick walk here from my building and got the milk tea with boba for $3.75. It came in a decently sized cup and had a great flavor, but they were a bit stingy with the amount of pearl. I decided to come back in the evening for my meal break to try the food.
The good: Quick lunch combo :)

This is one of the few places open late in the financial district. I typically order the BBQ Pork Ban Mi Sandwich here. I have tried the pho a few times when it was cold outside. They make a decent bowl of pho. The cold vermicelli is good with the BBQ pork over it.
The pho is decent, the service is quick and nice, and the utensils are all relatively clean. A little more expensive than Chinatown, but hey, we're in FiDi and this is convenient. ($9 for pho)
Haven't been back in this part of town in a long time and ordered the won ton soup.  Delicous, delicous, delicous!!
Outstanding (and quick) lunch options for less than $8 (before tax). Expansive vegetarian options too!

We ordered delivery from this place for our staff lunch. The manager or owner is super nice but the food was not up to par. I had the mongolian beef chow fun and I could tell that the beef was not fresh. Others had the grilled pork and egg roll vermicelli. They said that the sauce was not flavorful and the egg rolls were chewy.  I would also like to mention that they got all 19 orders correct. It's just too bad that our staff was not happy with their lunches.
I always get the vegetarian chow-mein here. It is delicious. They can make it a little spicy if you like it like that too.

This is my go-to place whenever I want Chinese/Vietnamese food within walking distance from my office in the Financial District. Honestly, the pho can't compare to some other places that one might go to in a more Asian neighborhood, but for the location and price, I'll choose this place over some other nearby shops anytime. I really like their spicy beef noodle soup as well for the days I'd like a bit more of a kick to my food. The preserved egg and pork porridge is good, though some may feel it runs on the watery side, but I don't like overly chunky and thick porridge either. I think the five spice chicken and the grilled pork chop with rice are both pretty yummy and well portioned. So I give this place a 4/5 star based on price and flavor for the location it's at. There are definitely other restaurants that are better if you go farther out in SF or down over to San Jose, but this place has treated me well for many lunches and they have quick service.

Good pho, but probably a bit more expensive than it should be. I had the spicy seafood pho and it had more seafood in it than most other pho I have had. My order was to go and I was walking out the door within 5 minutes at lunch time on a Wednesday. The place used to be a shabby Asian restaurant but it has been renovated and re-purposed in the last couple of years.
Love the Chao fun and Pho there. Really authentic.
The broth was delicious, the soup nice and hot, the noodles fresh, and the service pleasant and prompt.
I come here a few times a month to get my Pho fix, but it's just ok. Just enough to get me through. Not bad, just not great.  The rice plates are decent as well. "Phood Nation"

I love their Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. Best hangover food ever. I'm also a fan of their Katsu Chicken & their fried egg rolls. I come here often for lunch and I will continue to do so. Staff is friendly, food is good so they'll be seeing me often.

I'm sitting here currently having their beef noodle soup with steak and beef balls. I also had the fried chicken wings. The chicken wings were crispy and full of flavor. Granted, this will probably be the last time that I spend 5 dollars for 4 chicken wings though. Onto the soup...delicious broth that is slightly creamy. The steak was just the right texture and cooked just rare. What I did happen to notice (and this is my only complaint) was that the serving staff told me to get up to get my silverware, even though they served everyone their's.

This is a good option for Vietnamese or Chinese food for lunch in the financial district. Their prices are reasonable and the food is good. Keep in mind, this is a quick lunch spot type of place so it is nothing fancy in terms of decor or service. I recommend any of the beef phos, wonton soup, vermicelli bowls, and the preserved egg congee. I've had the chicken pho and spicy seafood noodle soups before, but those weren't as good.

Life saving pho to the rescue.  Open "early" on Sunday morning, was able to get some pho for a sick friend, to go.  They were fast, I was in and out, and they were able to package the soup separate from the noodles.  Better so that the noodles don't get too soggy.
I like the spacious dining area provided at this place - in the Financial area and with feasible pho too!

Place was empty at 6pm--usually not a good sign. I ordered the five spice chicken per Yelp recommendations. Speedy turnaround--7 minutes to carry out. The chicken was tasty, flavorful, with a nice crispy pan-seared crust (not breaking). Only $.25 up charge for brown rice which was very reasonable. The broccoli that came with my dish was too crunchy for my liking. Also, as I was leaving I realized I could have gotten the special with the egg rolls for only $.20 more--shame on the wait staff for not mentioning this. There was some grease to the dish but not overly so--not the healthiest thing I ate this week but acceptable for $7.88. Three stars for the extra grease and lack of up sell to the egg roll.
I seen this spot while walking during my lunch time.  Me and a couple of coworkers wanted some pho and I think this was the nearest spot next to our training facility.

Pho and 5 spice chicken, the only 2 dishes I ever get here. Hkk is a good option if you're looking for some solid Asian food in the financial district. The service is quick, food is aiite, and the prices are reasonable for downtown sf.

Their five spice chicken over rice is the dish to get here. It's their special and also their most popular dish because for $7.55, you get chicken over rice along with 2 egg rolls and broccoli. The boba milk tea here is decent, too. This place can get quite busy during weekday lunch, so expect a 10-15 minute wait for a to-go order. If you are looking to dine here instead, you'll have to order at the counter and then attempt to find a table. This can be a challenge, since it's not only very busy but also they're very slow with cleaning up tables from previous guests.

I had been suffering from a craving for jook for the past two weeks. Finally, I decided to satisfy the craving by having lunch here since it was down the street from work. I ordered their beef jook, and Boyfriend got their barbecue pork fried rice and I eagerly sat there waiting, excited to soon be putting into my belly what it had been wanting for what felt like FOREVER.
Super fast service, good portions and really good affordable pho! Don't know why it's not more packed in here
A+ for take out, convenient, delicious, quick and cheap

There used to be a Chinese place here, which I truly miss.  I started coming here as soon as they opened....and have been disappointed every time.  I only get take out since when I get released from my job, it's usually between 2pm and 4pm and the whole place has always been completely empty except for the service girls.  The girls are always very sweet.  However, everything I've ever gotten from here has been sub-par, even for Chinese food.  Plus it's always taken them close to 45 mins. to get the food to me, even just a cold salad.  There are other places to eat around this area so I've stopped going here.  Plus there's this stairway you have to climb to get up there, and then you have to climb down it and it's kind of steep; my old knees aren't always happy to do that climb anymore.  If I want Vietnamese, I do the 5-6 block walk to Sai's.  If I want Chinese I'll go the Henry's Hunan, another easy walk.  They could do do much more with this restaurant but they haven't which is so disappointing.

The Spicy Chicken Noodle Soup and the Beef Pho (recommended by the cashier over their Chinese Soup) was pretty atrocious. The broth is bland, the vegetables are incredibly dried out, and they are stingy with the meat. There was nothing redeeming about this dish.
Came here with my coworker today for lunch and I must say, I would've not known about this place because it's pretty hidden. You have to go upstairs from Oasis Grill.

This is my go to spot when I'm working in FIDI. Nothing fancy about it, just good food at a decent price. It's located next door to Oasis grill (upstairs) off of Drumm st. The place is pretty open and spacious when you get upstairs.
Great location.  Food could be better, though.  Also, this restaurant does not make notations for spicy foods on the menu so for those who do not like hot/spicy foods, it's trial and error.

For a Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant that is located in the financial district, this place is the shiznette!! I am so glad that my cousin brought me here because this is my go to spot for when I feel like eating out for lunch or just have a really bad hangover.
3.5 STARS.

Cheap and decent Chinese food in downtown San Francisco. Service is pretty fast and can get busy starting at noon. Come in a little earlier to avoid the rush. Menu ranges from basic Chinese dishes and even has boba drinks. No need to bus your own table as its done for you - not a full waiter service, but they don't bring your food to you and bus your table.

I was super excited when I saw my friends get their meal first, huge portions!!!  Then I got mine...#30, Spicy beef noddle soup...I dig in, and it's mostly just broth, not a lot of noodles or meat.  So disappointing!  While my friends happily munched on their lunch, I was there slowly sipping my soup.  Most likely will not be returning again...

This place sucks. I arrived upon opening, ordered, and received my meal quickly but -- if I have to add 2tbsp of sriracha and hoisin to the broth then it isn't good broth. I tasted it beforehand and it was flavorless and watery. The noodles were really starchy, the brisket was undercooked and too fatty, and they skimp out on tendon and tripe.
Fast cheap horrible food. Bbq chicken tasted like it was made last week, the walnut chicken a few days ago and chow fun yesterday. At least the water was clean.
They sell pho here now.  Best in this part of the Financial District and only place to go for it.  Don't bother anywhere else.  Hands down...
The restaurant across the street wasn't cooking anything as they were revamping their menu so decided to eat here for a quick lunch. It's set up like Panda Express, but it's definitely far superior.

You walk in, immediately see it's all Asians eating in this tiny place. At least when i walked in. That just tells me, this is good quality cooking. Always knew this place existed, but never set foot until today. Wanted a hawaiian short rib plate but there was no short ribs today, so went with a mixed plate of BBQ Beef, BBQ chicken and they gave katsu chicken in place of no short rib. Katsu was amazing, lightly breaded/fried and chicken melted in my mouth. I quickly finished that for lunch. Only ate a bite of each BBQ meat to try, but will save that for dinner. Scoop of mac salad was good too. Not bad for $9.25 total, every thing was fresh. What made the experience even better was one of the regulars walked in. I said hello to her, calling her Aunty as i noticed her Hawaiian heirloom jewelry, she smiled and said Aloha. She also told me which dished were 'ono'. Yep im coming back here! IO noticed they was eggplant tofu and a good mix of other fresh looking veggies ready to be eaten by the FiDi lunch masses.
This place has a lot of potential to be a great chinese fast food joint ... potential
Right now, my favorite lunchtime place.  large menu selection, good authentic quality, fast service, and cheap!  What else you need for a workday lunch?
The concept has potential and the location is great. The beef is mystery meat and VERY greasy. Many things are battered and deep fried. Not even cheap. Stay away.

One of my favorite lunch spots having worked in the Financial District for 10+ years--the owner is SUPER nice and courteous, and staff is friendly, too.  Sometimes I ask the owner for suggestions, and he'll customize my lunch entree based on what's good and fresh (i.e. salmon).  Other times I run out of ideas for lunch and he'll "surprise" me, and what's served is always delicious and price is reasonable to say the least.  I highly recommend this place for either dine-in or to-go order.  77 is our staple that we come back again and again.  :D

Came here for the 1st time on this really cold day craving soup. I saw that the restaurant was rated 3 stars, but decided to give it a shot anyway. I ordered the Wor Wonton Soup for $8.25. It was a generous amount of noodles, cabbage, wonton, & other meats. Granted that I am a small girl, I felt it could be shared with another person. I've definitely had better wonton soup, but I was going for convenience & didn't expect to be blown away with the taste, especially here in the Financial District. The lady that greeted me & took my order was very pleasant, always with a smile on her face when speaking to a customer.
After deliberating with myself for nearly an hour of whether or not I should try this place out for lunch, I decided to come by.

Purchased the sea-food pan fried noodles. The food was pretty fresh for a Chinese/Hawaiian restaurant.  If you are expecting a 5 star restaurant then go somewhere more expensive. The food is definitely better than Lee's deli which is right next door.
Ok service, bad food. Food wasn't fresh at all and tasted old. There are better chinese cuisines in a quarter mile radius out there.
My buddy Gialisa comes here and the trick is to order off the menu rather than line up for the food troughs.

I have noticed that I have never seen a place on yelp with an avg rating of below 3.  As someone that wonders about the mysterious of the world, I wonder why this is the case.  If this place can't crack 3 stars, I guess it's just not possible.  I can't imagine anyone trying to argue this place is better than panda express, cooking up a bag of frozen chinese from safeway or just some cardboard stir fry.  If you eat this food and enjoy it, you apparently have no taste buds and I feel sorry for whatever accident caused this, maybe french kissing a boiling pot of water.
If you are optimizing and speed and convenience as opposed to the food, this will work for you.

I order a lunch special of Mongolian Beef. Def more rice then the entree. They are very slow. My co worker order Hawaiian BBQ and it took almost 25mins for them to give him his order. They encourage you to use cash because you get a free appetizer. I didnt get mine nor did my friend.  Service was def a downer food. Food was just ok.
One star for the friendly service.

I had the spicy tofu and fish in black bean sauce that cost ~$9. I felt that the core food (fish and tofu) could have been a bit less cooked as it seemed quite soft as if a part of the gravy itself. But I liked the combination of spices.

Two choices: call ahead for an order ($7-$9/plate), or wait in line for buffet style (2 items ~$8-$9).  This (mostly) Chinese food is better than the small-chain deli next door, because it's cooked in smaller batches so has a lot of turnover - typically hot and fresh.  I've order the black bean beef chow fun, and it was tasty with plenty of beef - but too many onions.  From buffet, I've had salt & pepper pork chops, kung pao, black bean green beans.  All have been decent to good.  I go there more often than I check in...
i love the lunch to-go food.

Blame Canada. Blame it on the Bossa Nova. Blame it on the Boogie. But for Pete's sake, don't blame me for having a once-in-a-while craving for won ton soup on a wintry workday when the cold breezes cause a chill both indoors and out. I had a hope that 77 Chinese Cuisine may offer a good one, but that hope was dashed when I attempted to order the $6.50 Won Ton Noodle Soup with a request for extra won ton. When I went to the buffet line with my order, the woman kept looking at me like I was speaking in tongues. I repeated my order as another woman kept shoveling food onto a plate for the customer behind me. She said rather inexplicably "Chow Mein".

This is my usual fix on greasy chinese food.  Sadly, this will be my last visit as they raised the prices again.  I cant afford to pay $9.50 for 3 items. Call me cheap but now they're overpriced chinese food

I really like the Mongolian beef here. The first time I had it, it was ok. The next couple of times was really good. (Had a good amount of spiciness.) But the last two times I was there the Mongolian beef was so spicy I could not even finish it. I had to leave the rest for my fiance to finish (he loves spicy food.) Next time, I'll have to see if I can get the level of heat reduced, but that makes me nervous since the other times I have been, it was not nearly as spicy. Anyway, I really like it here and the pricing isn't too bad.
Is this the best Chinese food in SF? No, but it does the trick. The staff is nice, they give you your food fast, and their portions are perfect for lunch.
We eat here frequently for lunch.  The food is solid and the service is friendly.  Can't go wrong for the price here.

I don't know about their Chinese food, but the Hawaiian short ribs I ordered was possibly the worst "hawaiian food" I've had. The meat was stringy, fatty (and not the delicious kind), and low quality in general. I enjoy salty foods, but not when salt is the main flavor.
The FiDi has lots of great food... but for chinese food, it's lacking. I'm spoiled by the stores on Clement, so that's probably where my bias comes in.

I love this place.  I stumbled upon it while looking for lunch one week, and I've pretty much been back every week since.  The food is good, better than Lee's or Panda Express in my opinion.  The only thing is it can hit or miss sometimes, but overall I have been pleased.  The staff is great too, very friendly.

When the weather starts to get nippy and warmth is what I seek, I usually come here for won ton soup.  They serve one of the more tastier won ton and chicken broth in the FiDi area.  It's not the best but it'll do.

Ever have one of those day when you have no idea what to eat for lunch? That happens to me quite often.... I ended up wandering around found this place on a whim. i went in ordered a spam masubi and unagi fried rice. Portions are huge. I wasnt able to get to the fried rice. The owner and cashier lady are both super nice and eager to help/take your order. I'm a fan! Love the sweet customer service and food!
I was looking for cheap, greasy, delicious Chinese food and this place was where I found it.  Perfect for if all you want is your Chinese food fix.  Decent prices and pretty tasty meals.

I've been here twice and both times got the Chicken Katsu. I think their claiming "Hawaiian BBQ" a little loosely - they have about 6 hawaiian bbq items on their menu, but whatever. The Chicken Katsu is decent, as is the Katsu sauce. They also give a good amount. Macaroni salad was very bland - not my favorite. The worst part about this place is the wait. I must've waited 20min for my food and well, not so great as it was pretty empty there.
"Hi how about next?"
Been here a couple times for the hot food bar.  Quality is fine.  Can't complain about it from the type of place it's coming out of.  Relatively cheap for the area.

blan flavor, abrupt service and no labels indicating what is in the warming trays. So when you are choosing your combination, you have to ask the iritated server what everything is. and she gets iritated that you have to ask. WTF! Plus there is nothing Hawaiian about this place.

Not amazing, but quite good considering the hordes of FiDi customers they serve. What is amazing is that they still remain polite while doing so. Worth checking out if you need fast food - they serve all the standards like chao mien, sesame beef, and fried pork chop.

I've been visiting this place for a few months now and not too impressed with the size of the portions that they serve.Almost as small as Lee's Deli or around $6.95 a pound.Not enough for my gut! Flavor is ok and service is ok too.The only reason I would recommend eating here is the service is fast.Try New Asia at the Galleria for HUGE portions and cheaper prices.

Very good food! I work downtown SF and I have yet to get tired of this restaurant. Their food is fresh and plates are very well proportioned. I highly recommend The Salt and Pepper Spare Ribs. That is definitely on my plate every time I go. The people are nice and waiting time is not too bad if you go around 11:30AM.
It's a slightly nice break from the sub-par Asian food in the area. San Francisco is a great place for food, but for some reason working around this area I exhausted my options pretty quickly.

Umm...I'd recommend not putting "Hawaiian BBQ" in their restaurant name.  Ordered the mixed plate w/ all 3 bbq's and none of them were very good or Hawaiian tasting.  Tasted just like Chinese food.  And not stellar Chinese food either.  Mac salad was super bland.  If only I'd read some reviews before coming here, I woulda headed to L&L instead,

Located on Sutter, away from the grime and noise of Market St., Caffe Bianco is situated in a gorgeous gilt and marble shopfront with atmosphere to spare.  From the personal attention to the handmade fare, you get the idea that this is not a fast-paced, dine-and-dash establishment.  It's a great place to sip your espresso and people-watch from the cushioned benches in the bay windows or enjoy the view from the balcony of the quiet upstairs dining area.  Smooth jazz plays over the PA and the friendly staff will bring your food to your table if you dine in.
Very good deli. I always enjoy the turkey. Nothing too special, but really hits the spot when you want a good sando.

Horrible service - long wait and they don't process their orders in order of receipt - 3 people who came after me received their meals before me - and I only ordered a turkey club sandwich! stay away if you're in a rush - don't let their short lines fool you - there is a reason they weren't crowded when we went there.
Best place to have a lunch meeting downtown

I love love love this place! It has been around for ages (according to my friend's mom who has worked in the Financial District for over 20 years) and I can see why. They have amazing choices for sandwiches, salads, and soups They can be quite packed during lunch so make sure you allot enough time! The interior is great for coffee meetings.

I love the grey hair gentleman who handles checkout. He is like the traditional gentleman you often seen in a movie. Very well dressed, traditional, composed and have a sense of humor. I ordered mocha blanco without cream. I didn't expect it to be very good but I just need a little bit caffeine to keep going. It was heavenly good. Perfect amount of sweetness and a nice aroma. I decided the brings friends over next time. It is a bit crowded around lunch time. Drinks around $3, lunch around $7. It is a deal

Ordered veggie lavash wrap, they were out of avocado, and asked me do I want cheese instead. I said okay and chose provolone. Employee (he was very nice) asked me if I also want sprouts. I said sure. A female worker there made my wrap. When I got back to the office, there was nooooo cheese and noooo sprouts and the hummus that was supposed to be in it was such a small amount that I thought seriously? Ehhh, sorry, I don't think I'll try them again.
Been here a few times now for breakfast and lunch, and the people are incredibly nice here, or in my experience they have been.  I think it's a family owned business but can't say for sure.

I was excited because they said they had wheat tortilla.  I ordered an egg white and feta cheese breakfast burrito and added avocado for $1 (total was roughly $5.70 with tax) to go.  I should have checked it at the cafe but how could they really mess up my order? Well they did. Not only was the tortilla wrong, there was no avocado.  Lame.  They get 2 stars for getting the egg white and feta cheese right.
Good coffee. Nice people. .good looking fresh prepared food although I haven't tried it. I'm a sandwich in the afternoon or bagel in the morning person and need it faassstt.
Best chai tea latte ever. Period.

The first time I came, the older man who I'm assuming is the owner was extremely rude. I came here to use the Paypal coupon through the app, and I was having some troubles. The second time I came, they took 20 minutes just to make my salad. It was ridiculous.
Caffe Bianco has become a workday fav.
Caffee Bianco has an amazing atmosphere. It's a great cafe to hang out it (I would take someone to a business lunch here or for a professional coffee date).

Super people running this place, Benny is always there to greet you with a smile!  Food/ beverage made fresh with a passion for perfection.  It's like a hidden gem in the middle of the financial district.

Pasta was good! I got the meatball pasta with bread. Wish I got more bread, but otherwise food was good. Loved that there was the right amount is meat sauce (yum)! The restaurant was very cute and quaint. Enjoyed sitting on the second floor with a view.

I'll open by saying if it weren't for the pace of service/prep, I'd give them 5 stars in a heartbeat.  Everything is handmade, fresh, custom to your order.  They have a wide variety of options, predominantly sandwiches, including soup, side salads, small dishes, and entrees as well.

I am writing this review for essentially one item theme, their breakfast sandwiches.  They are the only thing I have had from there and they are really tasty.  I am keen on good quality eggs (in my household I am known as the egg-whisperer), and this place is legit.  I recommend their wrap (tasty and cheap) but any other sandwich with egg involved is tasty.
Liked the ambiance.  Breakfast sandwich took a long time to come out but tasted good.
Update - service has been a bit faster since the very long wait i had.  Maybe they were having and off day.  Still not as fast as i'd like but gotta admit, great food and the staff if very friendly

Stopped by because I needed a quick spot to make my lunch. I ordered their chipotle chicken wrap, it took awhile to get my order made (there wasn't anyone else there) but it was a good wrap and reasonably priced. I'll probably stop in again for another lunch sometime.

This place is usually packed but lunch was slow there today. I got the cheddar tuna melt on sliced sourdough. It came with various veggies as well and I added avocado at no extra charge. Really good, well priced and nice staff.
Last Monday noon I found myself hunting the streets of the financial district for a "clean, well lighted place" I could eat and read.
I work in the same building as this cafe and will no longer visit it. Does that tell you enough?
Love the quiche, arugula salad, sandwiches and fresh fruit. Quick service, great to stop by on your lunch.

The lunch salads offer a good variety and are certainly well-prepared! I like the space - upstairs is spacious and comfortable, lower level a bit more crowded but still ok. Occasionally will branch out and try other things but usually stick with the salad sampler

This a cute little cafe. I ordered the egg sandwhich for breakfast. It was tasty. You can order your lunch using the gopago app. On another visit I got the veggie lasagna and it was good. They have these little pastries that have apricot inside them. I'm not sure what they are called but they are sooo good. The only down side is they are $1.50 each and it's not that big probably the size of a donut hole.

Caffe Bianco does not have the best coffee in town, nor is the service as quick as you'd like but it's a great spot to sit down relax or meet people. It has the feel of a mom and pop shop and all the staff are wonderful.

I definitely have mixed (but generally positive) feelings about this place. It is my go-to spot for business meetings because it's close to my office, and one of the less-populated spots to sit down and have an informal coffee meeting. Their regular coffee tastes pretty bad, and the service is a bit slow--but I get it all the time anyway.

This place is unfortunately not that good.  Once I had a BLT that really hit the spot, though.  However today I ordered an egg white + turkey bacon tortilla wrap and instead got a regular scrambled egg with a slice of turkey for a sandwich.  Gross.  When I got my food  the cashier who took my order (and who I saw explain in detail to the chef what to make me) was nowhere to be found.  I also had already waited forever and didn't want to make a scene.

Had the cafe bianco club sandwich: turkey, salami, cheddar, lett., tomato.  The sandwich was very skimpy, maybe half a slice of turkey and salami.  No sides included.  This sandwich is not worth the cost.  Maybe other selections are better values.  One star for being centrally located.
I have been coming here for years. It's tucked away, so I often forget  about it, since I am an want-it-on-site-kind-of-person.

I was looking for a quick place to grab a bite to eat before going to an appointment. What a lovely lunch spot with reasonable prices as compared to other places in the Financial District. I ordered a chicken salad sandwich ($6.50) that came in less than 5 minutes. It was so delicious-- although I think that may have been butter that was put on the bread! But still the chicken salad was very good. You can also grab pasta salad and other things if you need to get back to the office and don't have time to eat there.

Caffe Bianco is a lesser-known gem in the Financial District and my one of my go-to places for casual meetings over coffee. Their salads and sandwiches are good, and their prices are pretty reasonable for a FiDi cafe. I like that they have the upstairs seating area that's a bit more quiet when I need to focus and work. Even during the busy lunch rush, I've usually been able to find a seat here. There's free Wi-Fi too - just ask the cashier for the access code. The occasional negative is that sometimes there's miscommunication between the person taking the order, the food preparer, and the cashier, so I've had my order not prepared in a timely manner a couple of times.

I'm giving this five stars not because it's some sort of world class dining experience, but because you can sit down and have a "grown up" lunch here.  Why go to a place like Subway when for about the same price you can have a nice sandwich on a real plate with real silverware? If you ask for tap water, they give you a real glass. The food is tasty, the old Euro decor is charming and I've only had good experiences with the staff.  For a "order at the counter and they'll bring your food to your table" place, it's rather elegant and you leave feeling like you had a more expensive lunch than you actually did.

I wanted to like this place. I have been coming here since the start of the new year. The food has always been pretty reasonable, despite waiting 10-12 minutes for my sandwich after I have ordered it. Which has happend numerous times. But what happened today, cannot go un noticed.

This place is a block away from my work, the coffee is GREAT, and the man behind the counter (owner??) has always been super kind and friendly. I also do love the ambiance--very pretty, roomy, clean, quiet interior with comfy seating and big windows overlooking the street.
I now agree with my fellow yelpers about the mustache man giving attitude to customers, and being mean to his staff.
GRUMPY, RUDE OWNER!!! WILL NOT RETURN...
OMG, what a pleasant oasis in the frantic bustle of the morning coffee rush!

Business here is much like a whisper. It never seems to be busy, but that just means faster service for me! I'll come to the Courtyard Marriott to get work done sometimes, and the staff has a lot of ground to cover in terms of customers. They constantly patrol the actual bar area, the lounging area with tables next to the patio area, and then the patio area itself. They're all super sweet, and I've never had a problem with the service here.

totally mediocre. had 2 beers and a burger. burger patty seemed to be that frozen crap from costco, I wouldn't advise it to anyone, beer selection was ok..bartender super slow. I wasn't sure whether its 2 or 3 stars.. its sunday night in soma, and the only benefit of this place is that its open.

How did I not know that this place existed?  I may be adding an extra star as this place happens to be across the street from my place, but I'm glad I found this gem.  Beer, burgers, wings and TV's and a little peace and quiet.  Why is that so hard to find in this SOMA/FiDi corridor?  Well if you don't know, now you know.  Prices are little higher than usual due to the fact that its a hotel bar but if you're looking for a low key sports bar in the area, this is your spot.
Had a not-so-nice experience with one of the bartenders here. He didn't seem to keen on the fact that people were paying with card that night. Weird.
Amazing.  It's true.

Love this place. I've been working in SF for the past year and staying here. Great staff, shout outs to Robert, Laurie, and Kellan. My totally amazing co-worker who is not on Yelp agrees. The food is typical pub fare, but coming here is like being in your own living room, so comfortable and friendly.  A great place to watch the game, enjoy a brew, and meet new friends.  The only negative thing I have to say is don't order the salmon.
lame...who does not open until 4:40pm...hello?!?!? what about game days like today?!?!?!
Whispers is a really great hotel bar. They have fantastic beers on tap including Lagunitas "Little Sumpin'." They also have Woodford Reserve, so double yum.

I wandered downstairs for a drink around 9:30 PM. I was extremely disappointed that there were only two other people at the bar (both were having beers), but the bartender was extremely friendly. I knew exactly what I wanted- the San Francisco Iced Tea for $12 (I had been staring at the specialty cocktail menu upstairs in my room all afternoon, and couldn't wait to try it!). The drink was absolutely DELICIOUS!!! The bartender was surprised at how quickly I drank the cocktail... various bartenders have marveled at how quickly I'm able to inhale the first couple of drinks and remain sitting upright in my seat (maybe it's a sign that I should slow down). I asked him for a suggestion (I don't like anything too sweet), and he made me an appletini. Also very tasty! After a couple of drinks though, I had to head out for the night because there wasn't much activity going on.

I came here today for an early dinner.  My dining party and I were kind of in a rush and made sure our waitress was aware of this.  She was very accommodating and made sure we made our deadline of being out within 45 minutes.

I came here for a drink after work due to a recommendation from a friend and am quite pleased with what I found; a secret bar that is perfect for the after work drink / happy hour.  Recently remodeled and located in the Courtyard Marriott on 2nd street, Whispers is never too crowded and has a great vibe.  It's a great place to hang out after work, watch some sports, and have a beer or five.  I love it when I walk in and Laurie, Anton and the rest of the staff will run from behind the bar, hug me and parade me around the hotel lobby like Eli Manning after the Super Bowl until I beg to be let down 1 hour later.  I think they think I'm Jet Li, but I never disagree with them because they make great drinks and maybe I shouldn't have told them that my name was Jet Li.  Oh well.

They used to be a 4 (quality good, quantity very good) but as the salads seem to keep shrinking so has their rating.  Today I basically got 1/2 chicken ceasar salad for $8.99.  For 2 bucks more I'll go to Mixt Greens for both quality and now a quantity upgrade.
This place is ok, nothing super special.  I usually get the sensational spinach salad or get a custom salad.  Not too impressed with their soups but I appreciate their proximity to my office.
My goto place for lunch when I'm in the City.  I love the salads.

One of my go-to lunch spots during the workweek - I always get the split pea soup, which is delicious, plus a hunk of sourdough bread. The guy who is usually soup scoopin' during the weekday lunch hour rush is really nice and jokey ("You want cilantro?" "No thanks!" "OKAY, EXTRA CILANTRO FOR THE LADY!")
#notimpressed.

Would include more stars if EVER I were to enter this place and NOT HAVE TO CLEAN MY OWN TABLE WHEN I SIT.  There is never a clean table, which means they're busy, but hey, wipe a table down why don't you? Observed others just today, cleaning their own tables. The manager should spend less time socializing w/ his girlfriend during the busy lunch hours and more time managing his shop. The convenience however, can't be beat and when the manager isn't making them, their salads are pretty darn good.
Nothing's special about this place since it's close to work.

I used to love this place.  I used to love it with a passion.  My go-to soup was the Mexican Chicken Tortilla with a side of sourdough.  It made me feel good since it was low fat, low sodium, etc, all that good stuff...but last time I had my go-to soup, the quality seemed to have gone down.  I think I've been traumatized because I haven't been there since.  Perhaps I went on an off day.  And maybe I'll try it again...but for now, my 4 stars shall remain at 3.
Pretty good.Had the half sandwich and soup combo for $7.

It pains me to write this review since I used to eat at this place daily since it is so close to my work.  Great prices/portions.  I used to get a small soup and side salad every day.  One day I noticed a ladybug in my side Caesar salad.  I removed it and kept eating slightly grossed out but knowing they use organic greens and I'd give them a pass.  The next week, it happened again ANOTHER bug but this time it was a gross black one.  Small but sitting right on top of their side salads in the cooler to grab.  Please please clean your store so I can start going back here.  $13/day a mixt greens is killing me but I can't stomach eating at a place with 2 bugs in their salads.
The appropriate response, when they ask if you want cheese on your Turkey Chili, is "YES OH GOD YES PLEASE DON'T STOP"
I'm not a big fan of the soups at the Soup Company, but I will say I love their salads and hardboiled eggs!
Possibly the best branch of the SF Soup Co chain.  Ample, comfortable seating, excellent salad station, and friendly staff make this location a cut above.  And Linda is The Best!!

Substandard sandwiches and fairly bland soup. Good if you work in the building, it's raining, and you don't have an umbrella. Otherwise, there are much better delis and small, fast, healthy restaurants in the area.

I tried them 2x, because of their gluten-free options.  I didn't like them either time.  I did not enjoy the taste of their Chicken Tortilla soup or their Turkey Chilli.  Obviously this is a personal preference and it isn't my taste.

I go here at minimum once a week, sometimes upwards of three times a week.  I used to just go get their sliced french bread, as it is great tasty bread and I'm a big bread fan.  They have good soup, I have never been disappointed.  I also am a big fan of the hummus wrap.  Heftier than the sandwiches and more filling, great tasting, and 3.25 for more than enough.  I'm serious, sometimes I can't eat it all in one sitting and I have to save some for later.  Where else can you get filled up for 3.25?

I had a townhog certificate to SF Soup company, and it especially said salad, so I ventured away from the one near my work, which doesn't have tossed salads, and went to this one. This branch is way nicer than the one I'm used to! It looks like they used to have ice cream and smoothies, but despite it being a very warm day, that part was all tarped over. Still, you can order soup, or you can go over to the salad line. All salads can be made into wraps for $7.  I probably should have done that, but I wanted to get the most out of my $10 coupon and I wasn't thinking. Salads range from $7-10 and are tossed in front of you.  I had the asian chicken salad, with the dressing on the side. I'm sure glad I got the dressing on the side, because wow it was so greasy! The salad itself was pretty big and had a good amount of chicken in it. I didn't finish it.. I do think it had too many greens vs other things. The quarter of the dressing I did put on the salad made my mouth get coated in greasiness and my stomach roll a bit, so I didn't finish it, but I was pretty full anyway, due to the edamame and chicken. I think if I were paying full price, I'd be dissapointed, because for about $10 I could get a WAY better salad at mixt greens nearby. Still, I would maybe come back and try a different salad, as a wrap. This place is large and clean, which is always a plus. And it was not crowded at all at around 145pm on a Tuesday afternoon.  I realize I've only written about salad, and this is a soup place, but they are making a point of it, and have a separate salad station that takes up equal amount of space to the soup now, so..

Everytime I am working in SF, I have to go to SF Soup Co.  There are several locations all around downtown SF in the Financial District.  They consistently make good quality soups with a hunk of sourdough or wheat roll makes for a filling and mostly healthy lunch or snack.  My favs are the Mexican Chicken Tortilla and Grilled Chicken and Roast Corn Chowder.  They also have a SF Soup CO at SFO for a good grab and go soup on a plane....

They make me feel like the police when I walk through the door because all the employees scatter from one another like Rice Rockets on The Fast & The Furious. Don't worry, guys. I don't bite.  Anyway, gimme a regular soup and half-sandwich please. It's a cold fall day so I'm hoping this meal will satisfy my hunger and hypothermia. I have a real bug up my butt because after eating here I'm slightly embarrassed that my city's name is associated with a company who's food is so undeserving. Womp womp.

Boy do I hate being lactose intolerant. Back when I was a growing young boy, from about age 5 to 17, I was able to drink milk indiscriminately. I would eat multiple bowls of cereal for days, all while reading the backs of cereal boxes or watching cartoons. Now my old age does not allow this (except for the watching cartoons part). The fact that I always have to be within distance of a comfort room (aka: C.R., aka: bathroom) after consuming something with lactate reminds me of what I took for granted in my youth. *sigh* C'est la vie...

I guess it's too much to hope that you pay your employees enough to warrant them being more than mere automatons. "Would you like a drink or dessert with your soup?" How about you just pay more attention and ask me if I'd like whatever condiment is supposed to be on the soup and then put the cheese/cilantro/scallions/whatever on my soup. How about you just do that?
I am not a huge fan of paying upwards of ten bucks for a quick soup lunch, but I do it anyhow.  I really like the turkey chili bread bowl, but would suggest grabbing the soup and salad combo.
West African Peanut with Chicken soup is amazing.
san francisco soup company is my latest lunch obsession.

Service was really good here and the food tasted fresh as well.  I got the split pea soup.  There were so many other options I could have gone for but the green looked too heavenly to pass up.  I came here after the lunch crowd with some dude- who apparently goes all the time- so he worked it for me.  I got to try a tomato bisque and a little bit of his bok choy mushroom soup.  yummy!

Summer weather in the City is often perfectly suited for morning oatmeal or soupy lunching, and this local chain has some awesome concoctions. In addition to tried and true regulars, they continually mix it up with special guest-stars -- check the "Soups of the Day" tab on
Wow! What a nice refreshing surprise!

I pretty much only go here when I win free soup via their soup of the day email (sign up on their web site).  Today, I had one of their new selections, Mexican Meatball Soup (Albondigas).  It was good.  Had a lot of meatballs.  Their hunk of sourdough that comes with their soup is top tier and very fresh.  Line was long at prime time but moves quickly, especially with the efficiency of non-signature credit card payments.  Manager lady is very nice, even amid all the mayhem of the lunch rush.  It's just that soup is not that exciting, and so I can only give it a 3, especially given that it's not that cheap for soup, even good soup.  Their Clam Chowder is very good as well and is my default pick if none of the specials are appealing.  Other recommendations if they are on special are Green Chili Chicken Chowder and Louisiana Gumbo.
I am sick, been sick for a good half of a week and this has place has served up the best medicine.

As far as I know, this is the only Soup Co with made to order salads.  They have the same model as Foccacia where you can choose which ingredients you want.  What makes this place better is that there are tables to sit at so you can meet a friend for lunch.  I also love the soup, and the staff is really friendly.  There is one woman who is pretty stingy with the salad ingredients which is why I'm giving only 4 stars.
I come here because it is so close.  if I don't feel like wandering around at lunch or if I want to grab something quick in the morning than I just come here.

The soup here is decent overall although I do like Soup Freaks better. They have many different choices - one side of the menu is things they have every day and the other side is the soup specials which vary depending on the day. However I do have a couple of problems with this company, this location in particular.
The soup is good for a cold day and is not high quality, but they have a large selection.
I worked above this place for a summer it is fucking awful.  You might as well skip lunch if your only option is this place.

Honestly, the location is the reason I go to this place for soup. It is right downstairs from my work. The only soup I like is the Mexican Tortilla soup. Everything else in this restaurant is pretty crappy especially their salty chicken noodle soup and horrible french onion soup (which they have occasionally) and like everything else in the financial district, it is definitely overly priced.

The soup here flat out sucks.  The soup tastes just like a regular crappy can of Campbell's soup with cheaper ingredients and then they charge you $6-9 for it.  I just don't understand why this place gets so many 4 star ratings? Convenience?
On chilly days like today, I start dreaming about soup at work.  Ok, maybe more like daydreaming about soup.... There is something so very soothing about the concept of a steamy bowl of tasty soup.

Since "Soup" is in the name of their establishment, you would think they offer more soup options, right? Unforunately, they don't. They only offer 6 soup selections. It's the same selections each time you walk in. I love "Grandma Mary's Chicken Soup", but not all the time! I've also tried the "Organic Tomato Bisque". It's good, but a bit rich.

If you like soup... and you have too much money, this is the place for you.  The soup is OK.  I can not complain about the taste.  That being said, it is over priced.  They really need to change up the lineup as well.... Maybe rotate in some new soups on a regular basis.  I would only give 2 stars, but I do like the over priced Oatmeal.

Having lunch here right now. Mahi Mahi fish with Mac and rice. $9.00 a side of Portuguese sausage  has 3 pieces in $4.89.00! Wow. Complained to the manager about value. She pointed at the menu board and it's says Portuguese sausage breakfast with egg and rice $4.99!  People sometimes miss the point. O well never coming back here. Smug.this us a glorified filipino restaurant. At least in a real filipino restaurant you get your money's worth.
Good quality / price ratio. Shop could use some renovation.
WHY is Hawaiian mac salad SOOOO good?! Oh, because it's probably like 1000 calories in that one scoop and so bad for you.

Poo. I love Hawaiian food. But this is the first time I got food poisoning at restaurant. I ordered 2 spam musubis and a side of macaroni salad. The spam musubi was nice and toast but the macaroni salad was a bit on the mushy side. I wished the macaroni had more of bite to it. But it tasted like any other mac-salad. I was able to finish my meal, but when I got home I did not feel too good. I had lot of stomach pains and the symptoms of eating bad food. The symptoms lasted for about a good four days. I couldn't eat any solids because my stomach could not hold it down. The store itself did not look dirty, but my stomach cannot take absolutely anything that is expired or over-processed. I do not think I will be coming back.

usually order their laulau combo, with brown rice and Mac salad. comes out to be around $11 so it's a bit pricey for my liking but the food is good. pork is tender enough. my coworkers are big fans of their spam egg and rice mini meals.
Been coming to this location since school started months...well almost a year ago and its been a go to spot for lunch.

It's L&L. If you're the sort of person that likes this sort of thing, this is the sort of thing you'll like. Thin "teriyaki" sauce, starch overload from two scoops of macaroni salad and rice, the whole thing is diabetes on a plate. That being said, it hits the spot if you're in the mood for it. I've never been in an L&L that's not at least a little sketchy and this one is no different, and that's part of the charm.

Docked a star from my previous review. Reviewing solely for the Ramen Burger... And here I thought it would have been something amazing since they were advertising it. For $5.95 + $1 for Chicken... Why didn't you mark that so I wouldn't have gotten it... It was very small... The ramen top lacked taste. It wasn't fully fried. It broke apart really fast. Chicken was yummy though (not surprising because I know their plates are yummy). I'm just not impressed with this... so disappointed...

I was really hungry and looking for something different to eat and happened upon this place. The good was great! I loved it that I'm gonna make an effort to come back again. I'd definitely eat here if you're in the area it's worth the stop and the staff is very nice too
We stumbled upon this place in 2006. Since it was a long time ago, I'm not sure if its still the same, but yum!
Maybe not as good as Hawaii but I'm still very satisfied.  It's never extremely crowded and the food still tastes great.  A common lunch choice for me.

If you want quick, decent food, this is the place to go.  It's a standard L&L establishment and menu, thought they do have a ramen burger.  There's not a lot of seating, and that's probably because it's in FiDi.  So best to just get it to go.
Tried the Loco Moco Ramen burger here today. It had good flavor overall but here is the breakdown:

This place is AWESOME! Being in Hawaii for most of my life, and married to an ethnic Chinese-hawaiian woman, it brings back my long lost memory of my home of Kauai. The food is just the same as when I use to visit my uncle's little cafe and have their delicious loco moco and other plate lunches.

The food is so amazing here. The mini Katsu is to die for, perfectly seasoned and the rice is cooked just the right amount. Definitely coming back for more! The spam misubi is also a must try! Its one of the things i get whenever I come.

When I came here I only got a spam musubi. The spam musubi was the best I've ever tried! The staff was really nice and the food came quick. Definitely a place to come for a quick to go snack! I also tried a little bit of my friends ramen burger, it's a good place to have a quick meal. Also a great hangout space for friends !

Got the ramen burger and the katsu musubi. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The ramen burger is definitely the best I've had. The ramen bun was crispy and just the right texture. The egg was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of gooeyness. The meat and lettuce was topped with a tangy sauce that was the perfect compliment to the burger. The ramen burger is definitely something I recommend. The katsu musubi was also amazing. The chicken katsu was cooked to perfection sitting atop the bed of rice. Definitely making this a go to spot.
Nice ramen burger. The loco moco is a lot better than the regular. The staff is friendly. The food is cheap. Overall very nice eating experience.
Got myself a ramen burger here- strike another one off the food bucket list!

Ramenburger did not live up to the advertised picture.  Pure bait and switch. Didn't even finish it, not worth the calories.  Added ketchup and that couldn't even save it.  No condiments besides lettuce. Everything was dry, it was very small, noodle bun was very tiny, everything was very dry and bland. Price was too expensive for $6 even in ridiculously priced FiDi.
L&L Hawaiian Style...
Personally, as someone that was born and raised on Oahu, I didn't really enjoy the Chicken Katsu Curry. The Katsu felt like it was microwaved and the curry was not as great.
mixed bbq regular size only come with one rib.

Haven't been here for a few months, but I think they raised their prices.  Ordered a mini BBQ short rib and 2 spam musubi and the total came out to $12!  For $12 I would expect more food and be full, but I wasn't.  I'm not even a big eater.  The mini BBQ was disappointing.  Just 1 short rib, a small scoop of macaroni, and a small scoop of rice for $6.50.  The short rib was full of fat and after cutting away all the fat, I was only left with a small sliver of actual meat.  The span musubi was okay, but not great. Quite expensive too at $2.10 each.  I bought 2 and after I paid, I saw a sign for a special on musubi, 3 for $5.  Wish I saw the sign earlier, but so disappointed that the lady at the counter didn't even mention the special.  Not a great experience and mediocre food at expensive prices.
L & L is a pretty standard Hawaiian BBQ fast food chain. Decent in terms of quality and service.
Mini Katsu - 1 SAUCE CUP

I came for lunch and got the BBQ chicken with brown rice to go. The macaroni salad was amazing!!  I really loved it. The chicken was also really good, when i expected it to be ok (like mall food I guess) and partially inedible. Overall I was very pleasantly surprised with it all! I could only eat about half so I will have more for later!
Haute cuisine it is not, but L&L excels at hitting the spot for Hawaiian greasy spoon. Sure, the floor is a little grimy, and some of the decor is faded, but that's part of the island style, right?

Every time I eat hear I feel like I'm going to get a delicious heart attack. I usually get the Chicken Katsu or BBQ with all mac. OMG. It's delicious but I I feel my arteries closing with every bite. The mac salad is delicious but boy is it probably bad for you! All in all, it's cheap and delicious. I'd go back.. if fact I have...like everyday.
Classic L&L. It's good for fast food. It's "made to order", but you know.. It's still fast food. Lol.
I always get the BBQ chicken with all rice. Good food, large portions, decent price. Especially for this area. I always order pick up and have never had an issue here. Staff is always friendly.

I come here all the time until today , I will never come again due to the little troll that works behind the the counter. I ordered a Cheeseburger and fries , the menu doesn't say that it comes smothered in ketchup and mayo so politely asked for a new top bun and she so rudely made a face rolled her eyes and walked away...I stood there waiting and she came back and was going to charge me for one side of the bun ! Really ????? You make a face and charge me for something that doesn't even cost as much as your going to charge , k thanks never coming back

I used to eat here at least once I week.  It was addicting.  It is because of all the MSG they put in the food.  I noticed that after I ate here I always felt so terrible a few hours later.  As soon as I mentioned it in my office, others noticed it too.   Maybe good once in a while, but I will never return.
Good for a quick fix of Hawaii.

I first went to an L&L many years ago on vacation in Hawaii and loved it. Simple, cheap, delicious, and different than any BBQ I was used to on the mainland. I'm not sure if the chain went downhill or if they just can't maintain quality control for the mainland locations, but I was disappointed. It's not 100% awful, but it's not what I remember. I've had three dishes in the SF location: garlic shrimp (ok), BBQ chicken (good), and beef short ribs (inedible). The shrimp was good but it comes as part of a "healthy" platter with brown rice and a salad. Just get white rice and macaroni salad and you'll be happy. You don't go to L&L to eat healthy. The chicken was good though. Moist, delicious, kind of sweet. Sort of like teriyaki but better. But the beef short ribs were so gristly that it was a choking hazard. It was kind of like like trying to eat rubber band, except tougher. I should have tried the pork lau lau. I think that would have been better.

I ordered the bbq sampler and got the brown rice instead of white rice (extra $0.50) and the side salad instead of the mac salad.  It was a little over $10 with the brown rice sub and tax.  The box of food was huge.  There was more meat than I expected.  I liked the kalbi/ribs the most.  The chicken was just average.  The meat was pretty salty but eaten with the rice and salad helped.

You can never go wrong with a simple rice place with either BBQ chicken or Chicken Katsu and a side of macaroni salad. Also, if you're in the Fi-Di, they have a special on Masubi's. Check it out, definitely a quick and cheap alternative to the $10 lunches in the area.
I'm crazy loco for loco moco in San Francisco.
i like their chicken
LOVE! Go a little after 12:30pm to avoid the line. Orders come up quick though!
Botton line: my bahn mi was VERY dry and lacked flavor.

We only made a stop here on our recent trip to SF was because of the coconut waffle sandwhich! It was a clever twist to the original banh mi, very new and different from the Vietnamese sandwhiches I've had in Virginia. I LOVE coconut so this to me was really perfect. The coconut waffle smelled amazing and had a nice crispy and sweet taste. It's definitely a MUST TRY!. The girl that was working there was really nice and friendly too.
I had both the spring rolls and the pork sandwich.

FiDi is as you would expect saturated with quick eats (e.g. sandwiches, salads) and expensive spots for the business lunches and dinners. It's hard to find good Vietnamese but now that I'm spending more time in the area I'm noticing there is a shocking amount of Vietnamese sandwich places.
The sandwich was Ok. Very basic. Not amazing, but I would go back if I really wanted banh mi, because it is one of the only places that serves them near my work.
Has all the necessities and reasonably priced for the area!!!

Sandwich is alright. The pickled carrots were a bit bland and seemed like they weren't pickled long enough. The jalapeno unfortunately had zero spiciness to it. Bread wasn't toasted enough--probably because of the line. Yeah, I could probably go on and on but overall my sandwich wasn't amazing in flavor but did fill me up.

Got the combination sandwich and added an egg for $1 more. Happily drinking my sweet Vietnamese iced coffee and opening the sandwich to pick out the jalapeno pepper that I forgot to ask them to leave out when I notice the egg is not a fried egg but just entirely egg whites!  T_T Why would you do this? I was so looking forward to a nice half runny egg (if done right) to ooze over the sandwich. So disappointed. Sandwich itself was OK. Would have been perfect with and egg that had a yolk.

I found this place walking to the Griffon hotel for my stay here in SF.  When I passed by there was a small line of several people.  That is a great sign.  Popular but not too popular.  I got a super combination sandwich and one of those green colored coconut waffles.  The sandwich was great with chinese style bbq port, tofu, jalapenos, pickled carrots, etc.  And only $5.75.  The green colored coconut waffle was good but very quickly lost any of its crispiness by the time I got to eat it.  Tasty though.  Not sure why it is green.
Decent Vietnam sandwiches fairly priced.
This place is  pretty damn good. I have tried the Chicken Sandwich as well as the Meatball sandwich. I like them both literally the same.
Short lunch break? Need to bust back to your desk and grind more spreadsheets than an intern? Broke?!

Green waffles were a novelty, but a little soggy for my tastes.  The roasted pork sandwich was also ok, but did not wow me.  Overall I thought that this was a good place to try if you like bahn mi, but I don't think I will be back until I've tried all of the other similar spots in the area.
Spring rolls are okay... the peanut sauce is a bit watered down.

Pretty good! I've had three vietnamese sandwiches in Fidi: Les Croissants, this place, and the cart stand on market and battery (i believe). this ranks in the middle of the three. Definitely better than Les Croissants, but didn't have the same authentic taste as the ones from the cart stand. it tasted a bit american? not that anything is wrong with that, i just dont like it in my vietnamese sandwiches :)
sooooo goood and affordable. get the waffle

My latest go-to place for a fresh, tasty, and inexpensive lunch.  I'm addicted to their chicken sandwich, and will often munch the green coconut waffle as my salad-equivalent first course.  (It would be a shame to have a cold and soggy green coconut waffle for dessert.)

I was working nearby for a while and was trying all the places that had banh mi in the area. I hit the jackpot with this one. Well toasted bread, enough jalapenos to get that burning sensation in your mouth and good flavor. I noticed that the sandwich wasn't as good as the first time, if they were super busy and were trying to make them quickly (i.e., the bread wasn't toasted enough). Sometimes I wish they'd add a little more sauce, but I liked them enough that I had one every week. Yum!

This is a good and good value Bahn Mi. Nice crispy roll, good meats and great condiments. I had the classic pork combination and it was fine... not much in the line of jalapenos though. It does deserve more than 3 stars but not quite up to 4 in my book. I'll have to keep sampling and it will be a pleasure.

I work across from the street from this place but I kid you not, I would not have noticed it if it weren't for a sneeze that threw me off balance right in front of the ordering window... (I did not sneeze in your food... promise)

Came here with the coworkers for lunch. I've always had the pork vietnamese sandwich which is only $4.75! Pretty good deal and not that expensive! The sandwich is a bit small; however, it fills me up! The sandwich includes pork, carrots, cucumbers, and jalapenos. The bread is a bit crispy/crunchy; however, after awhile it becomes hard. The flavor of the pork was not too bad. Service was pretty efficient and quick. It may not be the best vietnamese sandwiches, but it's doable.
90% of the time, my sandwich is made in less than a minute every time.
I was really jonesing to get a Pork Vietnamese sandwich. I live and work in SF so I don't always get to go to Cam Huong in Oakland(the best sandwiches ever, in my opinion).
Hole in the wall, but AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS SANDWHICHES!
Awesome place for a quick bite. I usually go for the pork sandwich (no jalapenos) plus a Teas Tea. Lots of meat and the right amount of tanginess.
2 stars for the sandwiches but..
The sandwiches and the green waffles are great.  (Who would've thought green waffles could be so addicting..it's true what the other Yelpers are saying about this place).

I enjoyed the food. I enjoy Vietnamese food, but never tried it at a deli. I was not expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. I definitely will go back and look forward to trying the green waffle next time.

Disclaimer: Having eaten enough vietnamese sandwiches in my life to fill up The Transamerica building leaves me a bit more critical than your average reviewer.  let's put it this way. You may have grown up on PB&J or ham & cheese. I grew up on vietnamese style sandwiches so even though this place is cheap (under $5) I can't excuse what they pass for a Banh Mi. First time here so I get the super combo with viet iced coffee and the coconut waffle.
And now for a dramatic reading of Dr. Seuss's "Green Eggs and Ham", we have the erudite Ed U...
Had their class combo.

Little Saigon Deli is a great place to get your lunch on. I had the chicken sandwich for less than $5.00. It's marinated chicken on a roll with sliced carrots and jalapenos. What's also great, is the Embarcadero is 1 block away where you can go post up and enjoy.
green waffle is ok, made to order, and comes hot off the grill (if you don't mind the wait) ... ask for it to be crunchy or it'll be soggy
Avoid at all costs especially when the delicious Les Croissants is only a few blocks away.

I always order the number 6- shredded tofu with veggies hold the mayo. I've only had Vietnamese sandwiches from a couple of places and they pale in comparison to what they serve here! The tofu is flavorful, the veggies are always fresh and the bread always seems freshly baked even when most of the time I don't make it in until 2 pm. Also, the ladies who work there are friendly, the sandwiches are made quickly and are under $5.00! The only times I was disappointed were when they were out of tofu for the day. I highly recommend this place!!!
Well many things about this place would have given me cause to give it 4 stars or more...
About the baguette, I'm going to have to agree with David D.

These Vietnamese sandwiches are awesome!  Bread is fresh and crunchy when you bite into it.  Reasonable price.  It's a tiny little spot next to ONE Market, but they have everything you need!  SO DELISH!

This was the first banh mi that I didn't like.  Overall, the sandwich was smaller than I'm used to getting at New York joints.  The bread was a little chewy, the meat lacked flavor, the vegetables didn't have a bright, fresh flavor, and even though I asked for "spicy," there was no spicy sauce on it, only a few peppers.  The green waffle had a good flavor, but was a little soggy - should have been cooked another minute or two.  I do have to say, the vietnamese iced coffee was good and strong, with a rich flavor.  It seems like there are better places to get this kind of sandwich in SF.

Came here for a drink after work on a Friday, they were busy and we were patient but after 15 straight minutes trying to get the attention of one of the two bartenders (cash in hand), we gave up as no one even acknowledged us with eye contact (common courtesy as a bar tender so the customer feels they at least understand you are there waiting).  The kicker was when the bartender asked two guys seated at the bar with full beers if they were doing ok or needed more after bringing their drinks not 3 minutes before.  We'll take our money to an establishment that doesn't make us feel like we have to beg them to take it.

Bad experience. Me and my husband were really excited to find this low-key bar near our hotel on our first night in San Francisco whilst on our honeymoon from Australia. We sat at a table inside for a few minutes with no waitress in sight, so my husband ordered our beers at the bar, assuming this was fine. We were then ignored for the rest of our time there - we had planned to order food but the waitress never came over to ask if we wanted anything, she flat out pretended we weren't there. A table next to us were served, so she was definitely ignoring us on purpose. We left after one drink, when we would have spent plenty more in the place if we hadn't been made to feel like a*sholes after accidentally offending.

I stopped in Murphy's one night after spotting it when I first arrived in the city a few nights prior. I stayed just down Kearny at the Hilton, and I was glad to have a pub nearby. I'm a big fan of fish and chips, so one of my free evenings I decided to stop in and give it a try. The atmosphere was lively and typical for a pub. I was encouraged to see the place was pretty full. There was an open seat at the bar, and since I was alone, I decided to grab that instead of wasting a whole table to myself on a busy weeknight. The bartenders were friendly and attentive. I was able to order my food right there at the bar, which was nice. Of course I ordered Fish and Chips, but unfortunately it was a bit of a disappointment. Reasonably quick came out three chicken-finger-sized pieces of white fish alongside a generous amount of steak fries. It wasn't bad, but it just wasn't anything great. The fish was a small portion and the fries weren't crisp. It was just "meh" as they say. I've had similar quality Fish and Chips at IHOP, no kidding. This is a pub, after all, so I expected better. If I went back, i'd probably try another dish. Maybe they have other specialties that would be more satisfying.

My company sometimes has its Christmas luncheon here. Other than my company's Christmas luncheon I've eaten here a couple of times for lunch. This is a no nonsense pub that doesn't have an extensive menu, but the food here is excellent. In past I've had restaurant-named items like Murphy's Burger and Murphy's Cheese Steak Sandwich. The burger and cheese steak are delicious because the beef is tender and moist. The fish and chips are fantastic because you get 3 pieces of fish and the THICK steak frites are crispy.

I have not tried the food here, but it's a pretty chill place to grab a few drinks. There are barstools and tables, and I imagine it can get pretty crowded. Takes awhile to order drinks because there are generally not many people working at once. All the bartenders are super friendly, though! The cocktails are not all that strong, so just a warning. Otherwise it's a cool lowkey pub for hanging out. No strong desire to return here specifically, but I had a good experience.

I took my co-worker to lunch today and was craving a quick burger. Our office is on Sutter and stockton, so we walked down Sutter towards Kearny to see what we can find. We saw Murphy's and thought we'd give it a try.
The food and beer are overpriced. The new bartender on Sunday night is a real c-nt. She should go manage the kitchen or something because customer service isn't her thing.
