Friendly comfortable atmosphere. Generous drinks and incredibly friendly staff. Generous pours.  Love it. Only downside is a fairly limited scotch selection.

Sat night over labor day + you'd expect some effort, but no tunes other than weird recorded stuff. The chicken pot pie was a poor excuse. $25 after tip for that and a pint. I'll go elsewhere next time. Their loss, since I'm a regular visitor to the area.
Not much to say other than City prices and mediocre food/service.
The drinks are like any other bar. The reason why I rate it three stars is because the inly activity to do is drink. No dancing and only socializing. Can't complain about that though!
Perfect place to grab a quick drink with friends. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was basic pub food but was fresh and tasted good.
A review of the bar only, not the food.

I came here at noon on a Saturday with my son for lunch and a beer. He had a burger and I had a veggie burger. The burgers were excellent; expensive but excellent. It's a pub and there are plenty of good beers too; I had a couple, my son didn't (he's not 21 yet). There were few people there, just a couple barflies. I'll come back again for sure.
Stale Salad at Noon! Rubbery Stake oops Steak... Overall Yuk

This review is for food. We stopped in for a bite to eat while trying to catch a world cup game on the tvs.  The tri tip sandwich came out cold.  If they're going to sell a tri tip sandwich you'd think they would at least attempt to serve it warm.  Also if you're hoping to listen to audio during a game this is not the place, we were told it "was not possible" to have sound on.  The service was friendly and the drinks were fine so on the bar side of things I think this place is fine, perhaps just eat somewhere else if you can.

Seems like something goes wrong every time I come here. They didn't give me my credit card back last night, so I'm waiting all weekend for a call back to see if they still have it or if they gave it to someone else. Last time, the cheese sticks were actually cheese-less (how do you even do that?), and before that, our order of fries got delivered to the wrong table so we had to wait about an hour total for just fries. Ridiculous. The waitress was very friendly and kind, but I was shocked by how many things got messed up. I'm not going back...unless it's to retrieve my card.

Let me caveat this review with a disclaimer that I am not usually of a not-so-composed disposition when I am here after work. One beer in is okay. The glass of JW that goes down afterwards starts getting me a little bit giddy. Throw in a bourbon after that, and I'm pretty happy wherever I end up.

Was here the other night and bar tender Lisa was juggling the entire place on her own. Even though she was way over worked she quickly realized a patron left their wallet and proceeded to tracked down a members of that person's party to make sure the wallet's owner knew to come back to pick it up.

I love SF pubs that cover their walls with sports / celeb memorabilia, have sprawling tables where all your friends can sit together, and offer games like jenga and decks of cards to keep things lively. If you also love those things, Murphy's is the bar for you.
Chicken pot pie really good. Pleasantly surprised
Came with a couple coworkers on St. Patrick's day. It wasn't too crowded at 6pm and we got a table.
Hopping busy patio on weekend nights, so that's nice. Inside is pretty standard pub. Nothing too special. Bar food is OK. Again nothing great but not bad.

Meh. Pretty packed for happy hour crowds after work. I mean, it's in the Fi-Di, so what do you expect? Drink selection isn't great (for beer), and the food is your standard pub fare - greasy, fried. The place generally smells kind of funky, but props for having a nice patio area out back. Lots of room to stand or sit and talk, and waitresses do come by to take your order. It just doesn't feel like a bar, though. The crowd makes it feel like a hangout spot for Fi-Di workers after hours.

If Murphy's was a lady, it would be the one you awkwardly sidle up to wearing whatever sort of liquor goggles you've donned that evening, long after all the other strumpets have rejected your feeble attempts at seduction.
I've been living in the area for years and worked down the street but for some reason I have never been in the joint. Well, that changed when a client wanted to meet and I was open to it
25 Beers on Draft, plenty of seating and they serve food. A very straightforward pub with no frills or fuss

seven:thirty arrival...past six happy hour and regular pricing...rough day and in pain...beer to quench and food to fill...decent pub along kearny...free and easy street parking after seven along yellow curb...full bar and pub food provided...decent bar with after work crowds...some suits and some casual...seat by the bar for quick service...pay as you order at the bar....pint of budlight $five each...will need two tonight....a murphy's burger $eleven.twenty.five....choice of fries, coleslaw, salad or mac'n'cheese...pick of salad for lighter...very sweet balsamic vinegar dressing...ask for dressing on the side...fine black peppered beefy patty..pickle wedge provided...basic lettuce, tomato and red onion fixings....adding cheese or others $extra...basic burger and beer dinner...casual drinking and conversations...
i don't enjoy giving a business one star but sometimes you just come across service that is such a turn off that something must be said!
Our group of 13 stopped by this bar. We left the instant the bartender gave us attitude...boooo

I really liked this place!!! Bartender was really friendly and made good drinks. The venue gave off a really good vibe and the people there all seemed nice as well. Will be coming back to grab a drink soon!
I don't need to drive so let's go drink!

Murphy's is a mediocre sports bar with mediocre food and service. The food and drink selection aren't very large.  I had fish and chips ($14 for 3 pieces of cod) and spicy wings ($9.50 for 10 wings) here. Both tasted fine, but I thought the pool of sauce that came with the wings a bit excessive.
If proximity to my hotel were everything, then Murphy's would have everything going for it. But hey, that's not just all it's about, is it?
Shhhhhhhhh...This is my lunch time spot...
Service is exceptional and friendly.  Had a glass of wine (avg okay I'm a wine snob) and an appetizer.  I would come back again good vibe and atmosphere.
Murphy's on Kearny has the best waitress!  We had three kids in tow, she gave us accurate portion sizes and good advice!  Recommend the garlic fries!!

Went there Nov 1 2013 for lunch. The woman bartender served me a beer with a serious and I mean serious chip I glass where bar tending protocol and formal regulations require that it be poured out and a new new one served. But when I asked for another due to chip she simply poured beer in chipped glass into another glass. When I asked for a new one so I don't eat glass that may be inside she got annoyed. . . Then she refilled against what was obvious she do not want to do, she  gave me the wrong beer. When I informed her that it was not the beer which is my staple so I know taste, she got  more than  rude. Service quality check needed for FRIDAY lunch bartender .
Prices are a bit high for a pub. Authentically Irish. Almost tipped out of my seat when a lady with a thick Irish brogue ordered a Magners cider with ice, followed with "Tank ya luhv"

This bar does not understand the basic concept of making money. My friends and I came in last night to watch the baseball playoff game, but unfortunately the sound was on mute. Instead, there was music playing in the background. The bar wasn't very crowded; in fact, the back room was completely empty. Not a single person. Since the biggest TV was located in the back room, we thought it might be possible to turn the volume on on just that TV. The talking/music in the front room was loud enough that the TV sounds would not have been noticed. I asked the server if we could possibly get the sound on, and she said that it wasn't her bar. Well then whose was it? Clearly it was still a part of Murphy's Pub. I explained that the room was empty and we really just wanted to listen to the game. She told me it was against policy to have the volume on in the other room. I was a bit confused and frustrated. We watched the silent game for a bit, but then went across the street, where the Italian restaurant was happy to turn on the sound on one of their many TVs for us.
Have you ever had a bite of something and immediately you thought... Omygosh this is so good.
Best yogurt in fidi. Try the frozen custard and the ethnic flavor. Neither have high fructose corn syrup!
Still lacking.

I've been coming here for years and I really do like this place.  The owner, who's usually working the counter, is very friendly and occasionally (especially during the summer) his family will be working there too.  The yogurt is good, the toppings are good (especially the fresh fruit - worth the $1), and the price is GOOD.  This place will not do you wrong.

Whole-in-the-wall shop that has delicious frozen yogurt and frozen custard! Anytime I have an afternoon sweet-tooth kick in, I go and get a little cup from them. Excellent customer service - super friendly, provides suggestions, and let's you sample. My recommendation is the warm brownie and fresh strawberries on top of the frozen custard or frozen vanilla.
Large portion of froyo for the price

Caffe Ambrosia is almost like my little secret hidden away in the alley way of Trinity Place. For those days that I am hankering for some Froyo in FiDi, I stop by Caffe Ambrosia. This small little mom and pop stand makes sandwiches but the crowds come for the frozen yogurt. They have several good flavors but I always come back from the Original Tart. If this is your first time, start off with a "mini" size, the name is deceiving. If you want some soft pillows of goodness, add some mochi for a dollar. You'll thank me later.

Located down an alley way, this small cafe looks like it has a lot of regulars as the man behind the counter already knew peoples orders as they walked in :) He was very funny/friendly and even mentioned they had more toppings (like mochi!!!) if I desired. Sampled a couple flavors, and liked the French Vanilla best~ Junior size is more than enough! My friend got the Medium AND the warm brownie topping... Sooo much froyo I had to help him finish. The brownie was really good though! I'll have to get that on my next visit. Cash only and don't forget your punch card!

Great raspberry sorbet-- which is an awesome non-dairy treat for a vegan like me. The texture is super smooth and sizes are generous (a junior is usually enough for me!). If you're not on a dairy-free diet, there's froyo flavors like French custard, coffee, vanilla, etc. and the flavors change sometimes!
FROYO: delicious, AMAZINGLY large portions, and super friendly staff
This place is truly a hidden gem in the Trinity alley (yay for non-touristy spots!). My friend and I stopped by after a filling lunch, looking for a smoothie to fill our dessert stomachs.

This is my well-kept secret for the last few years I've worked downtown. They don't have the traditional, Pinkberry sour type yogurt here - it's more like a Berkeley Yogurt Park, closer-to-ice-cream type of froyo... and it's delicious. Yes, the junior size IS plenty enough, and they will give you toppings VERY generously. Great flavors, great price, nice owners, and not a very well known spot so no lines!! I come here every chance I get for my froyo fix downtown.

Hole in the wall alert!  Tucked behind an alleyway, I stumbled upon this place when I was in desperate need for an afternoon pick-me-up.  I learned quite a few things at this place in a matter of minutes.
After salivating from the glowing yelp reviews, I expected a lot better. In a nutshell: way too sweet, flavors were not stand-out, and the warm brownie topping disappointed.
Highlights
i was in need of quick sugary snack to get me through the rest of the day, so i decided to come here especially after reading the many highly rated reviews from fellow yelpers.
They say everything in the alley is better. It's true. Cafe Ambrosia has the creamiest yogurt. I usually order their junior French Vanilla or Irish Mint with strawberries.
Caffe Ambrosia has the yogurt business locked DOWN!!!  They have the all time BEST flavors in the world - yep in the WORLD :)

The fro yo is amazing here! The texture and flavors are so on point. Both the tart and the sweet flavors are good. I'm generally not a sweet fro yo person, but their pistachio is so delicious and pistachio-y! By far the best frozen yogurt place in surrounding, walkable area. So. Delicious.

this is the best yogurt spot in the FiDi, period.  they also have great smoothies and delicious sandwiches, all at great prices and served by the owner and his wife, who are both lovely people.  Couldn't support this place more, they're doing it right.

Went here to grab some froyo. Maybe I have been spoilt by the self serve system but having someone else make the froyo and determine how much and many toppings I get does not work for me anymore. The toppings  were pretty limited as well and the chocolate sauce was from a Hershey's can. Given that, ~$4.25 for a small seemed a little excessive.

Pretty good frozen yogurt accompanied by  generous servings and friendly service make this a perfect stop for an afternoon pick me up in the FiDi. They also have a buy 10, get 1 free frequent buyer card :)

Okay, I tried their yogurt shakes with fresh fruit today and I knew I had to change my previous review. The owner is super, super nice and will basically create a yogurt shake with whatever ingredients you want (within reason). My friend ordered an oreo shake with a hot brownie blended into it, another friend ordered an oreo shake with reese's pieces and m&ms, and I had the plain tart yogurt shake with raspberries and blueberries. This place is seriously amazing. I wasn't a huge fan of the froyo itself, but the yogurt shakes are incredible!

The froyo here is super creamy! I tried a few of the flavors and enjoyed the pistachio and the tiramisu the best. I got the small size and it was a LOT of froyo. I probably should have passed on the hot brownie topping .. but did I regret it? Definitely not it was pretty tasty. :)
it's really nothing special..
I had the vanilla + pistachio junior cup w a warm brownie ~$3.50 - liked what I had and will be back for more.  Friendly service.

Caffe Ambrosia is the BEST fro-yo in all of San Francisco...better yet, the WORLD! The owners are total gems, serving up the tastiest warm brownie toppings I have ever had. I would recommend this hidden delight to all who work in the FiDi. If you don't work or live nearby, I would highly advise getting on a speedy bus for an afternoon treat!

While it's little wonder that I didn't find out about Ambrosia earlier (what with it only being open on weekdays, during work hours and all), it's really quite a shame that it took so long. In the area by chance for a convention last month, I stopped by in between talks, getting a junior size of their vanilla froyo for a little under $3 [
Their serving portions are good sized.
Geez the junior portion is HUGE - I only even ate half of it. I got tiramisu which was WAY too sweet but I'm down to come back and try their other flavors.
Hole in the wall frozen yogurt shoppe that also offer sandwich and smoothie selections!  This tiny place is squished in between buildings and is located in an alley.

Gem of a Frozen yogurt place.  I've enjoyed all my visits.  Some cookie's and cream fro-yo with Oreo's, its a tasty, surgary delight.  Great portions for the price which is very reasonable.  Friendly customer service.

Tiny little shop in an alleyway right next door to my work's conference rooms.... Dont trust the online menu link since it really doesnt let peeps know what they have.  Basically you can get Fro-yo sundaes or fruit smoothies or shakes.  Nice ealy morning and late evening specials for the fruit smoothies, of which they have a wide array.  Very nice guy at the counter (the owner?) who offered suggestions in response to my vauge and very stoned uncertainty as to what to order. He suggested the Bannana Strawberry smoothie and I was eyeing the Oreo Cookie Shake which he said was VV good too :) Suggested I add a hint of Chocolate to my Vanilla cookie shake for the ultimate afternoon sugar pick me up.

A fave of my sisters for yogurt. Owned by a nice young Asian couple, the place is tucked away in a small side street alleyway. The portions are big and price is cheap. I got a junior and he lets you choose as many favors you'd like that can fit into the cup. I got chocolate, vanilla, and kona coffee for $2.45. Flavor was good and creamy. However I didn't care for the coffee flavor. Chocolate & vanilla was yummy.
Just found this little gem while walking along Sutter St. Glad I saw their A-frame sign or else I wouldn't have even noticed them.
Haiku Hour:

Wish I was able to come here more often, this place really is a huge gem!  VERY generous portions of their frozen yogurt - it was my first time coming here (after a couple of years of wanting to come here, but never got the chance to) and I ordered the small size for $3.15 and was just amazed at how much fro-yo they will give you!  I don't think I know of any other fro-yo place in SF that gives you so much - their small is easily like a medium that you'll get at other places, I'm sure.  I got the tart flavor and it was absolutely wonderful!

A real hidden gem; I wouldn't have known about it if one of my coworkers hadn't taken me here for my birthday. It's in a little alley! The guy who works here is really nice. So far I've tried the tiramisu and marshmallow twirl and the vanilla and chocolate twirl. I loved both! It's more on the creamy side...tastes-like-ice-cream-but-made-with-yogurt type of froyo (in contrast to the tart and tangy froyo) haha.

I came here today with one of my friends, and realized that I have actually been to Trinity Place. (: I hadn't seen Caffe Ambrosia when I was passing by that time, but my friend brought me here for froyo, and I'm glad she did!

If you know what you want, I guess this is an OK place to grab a quick bite to eat. But I personally get stressed out by such small places where the owner/cashier is watching you the whole time, as are the people in line with you. Which maybe wouldn't be a big deal if the cashier was friendlier...

1st Timers! DO NOT GO BY WEBSITE PRICES! HAHA! What our office mates calculated as $24 became $42! Wth! At what we thought was a reasonable price for Won Ton noodle soup is too expensive with its current price. Really? $7 for Won Ton. You can get a humongous bowl of Pho at Sai's for $8. The owner got mad at us too for not knowing the prices! Lol! Like it was our fault. He also says," This is not Chinatown, I don't give discount here!" Uh, Kearny & Clay is Chinatown and secondly, we didn't ask for a discount. Oh well, lesson learned. 1st and LAST time going to this place.

I got the soup to go once before and I did not think it was anything special. I am so glad I came back and ate it there. The lady at the cash register is a little rude and impatient, but it is only because they are so busy! I am impressed by how quickly the food comes out considering how many people are there.

My BF loves noodles and soup.  After having delicious dim sum snacks, we walked here to share a regular bowl of noodles.  Broth, dumplings, and noodles all tasty.  Price cannot be beat.  They serve a really nice hot tea gratis.  They make the egg noodles there and I saw a couple people purchase the fresh noodles to take home with them.

Good Wonton. There was not much communication but the elder lady was kindly serve us tea, mutiple times. The food in general is average. The owner surely has the potential to make the place nicer and to expend a little bigger.

I was really excited to try this place because of how legit it looked from the outside, with the cooks in the window. I ordered the wonton noodle soup and was a little disappointed. The wontons were pretty small and there were too many noodles in proportion to the amount of wontons you get. The noodles were also a little hard for my liking. The broth was kind of bland. Overall, it was a good deal - only $5 something for a filling bowl of noodles - but not the best.
Good Wonton, Size of a wonton are the same size to that in Hong Kong or any other south east asian countries.
While this place has been an SF Chinatown tradition, it doesn't seem to live up to the hype.  Don't expect too much from this Chinatown hole in the wall.  For the price and speed, this place is fine.
The old people that run this place are hard working. The food is great and affordable. My only complaint is that they only give you 3 wonton. That's OK though. You can add more pieces at a low cost.

I tried this place for the first time at lunch today and had the wonton noodle soup with extra szechuan sauce (spicy pork red-ish sauce). I loved it! It tastes just like what they have in Hong Kong. The wontons are small enough to fit the whole thing in your mouth (and I have the smallest mouth ever!). I hate it when I have to bite into wontons coz most likely the liquid will just ooze out and can at times find my eyes to land on . The noodle is al dente and the szechuan sauce is yummy. Service is ultra fast. Ideal for a quick satisfying lunch that won't leave you extra stuffed and sleepy at work after lunch.
The food here is well north of dissatisfied. If you like Vietnamese food, look elsewhere. This is below average for San Francisco.

This place has been here forever. I used to come here with my mom as a kid. It's a big hole in the wall, so much so that sometimes you need to share your table. But the food has been consistent throughout the years. Me and my lunch buddy had the wonton noodles and chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. The wonton is delicious and we dipped ours in chili sauce. The noodles we dipped with the red vinegar. Chinese broccoli, you can't really mess up. So if you're looking for something quick and cheap, this is your place. The texture of the noodles is crunchy which I really like. And the broth is good. So nice on a gloomy day like today.
Cheap good food for a cold (August) San Francisco day.No frills food at a low price. Portions are smaller than other nearby Chinatown restaurants. Service was quick.
I stopped in one day on my walk home from work because I really wanted some wonton soup for dinner.
I used to go here often back 5 or more years ago when i had classes in chinatown.
This is my all-time-favor lunch place. Its soup is so authentic that you can't easily find even in China nowadays.

Just a classic...Simple setting but great chewy noodles and bite size won ton with an excellent steaming broth that makes it easy to warm up on cold SF days! Delicious, my favourite spot for a cheap and quick bowl of noodles
Homemade noodles and wun-tuns. They have secret recipe for making the soup. That's why the taste so special and tasty!

One of the best noodles joints in San Francisco!!!! From the outside it doesn't look like the nicest place but when you see the head chef cooking all the noodles from the window, you can help yourself but watch and then you get hungry!!
Now they open to later hours and open on weekends.

The rice roll is definitely overrated. But the wunton soup is pretty good. The beef tendon is great. It would be awesome if they have other types of noodle for people to choose though. Overall, Not sure if it is the best in the city but it is quite worth the 15 min walk to get it to-go for lunch.
Still going strong. CBS is still the bomb..... I will travel for miles (and do) for this Curry Beef Stew.

I love this place....my go to place in the city to get wontons is this place. I don't know what they put in the soup but its AWESOME. Rather, it tastes like authentic savory taste of Wonton noodle soup. They have other selections too but I would not come here for anything else besides its wontons and noodles. The owner is this old lady who works hard (she's a millionaire with a lovely house in Nob hill). The whole restaurant is family owned. Best wontons ever and hits the spot on a cold day in SF.
The only legit wonton place in the city, from my experience.

This place was a'ight, not the greatest, but certainly not the worst.  It does offer very reasonable prices.  I think that I would rather go down the street into Chinatown and pay a bit more for something a bit tastier.  But definitely serviceable.
Best wonton noodles. Noodles is "QQ" and love the little wonton. Very tasty ... I like they use porcelain bowls and wooden chopstick. Feel very traditional and environmentally friendly.

Went here because saw it on Bourdain's list of recommendations. Food was quick for being freshly prepared. Won tons were flavorful, but seemed like a lot of the side dishes were being nuked in a microwave. Also, portions were small, but I managed to get full. Noodles are very al dente--if you're not used to Hong Kong style, it will seem drier than most (even though it is in soup). Soup tastes of everyone else's orders because everything is cooked in one pot by the chef--not a bad thing, but no separate flavors if you order different dishes.

This place deserves 5 stars for it's wonton noodles alone. My family (we are Chinese) have been coming here for decades, and we love the perfect wontons and soup stock and al dente noodles despite the smaller portion sizes. (My brother still complains about the small bowls each and every time, like he didn't know they were that size.) be sure to get the curried fish balls, and to try the curry beef stew over rice or as a side to share. Their shui gow is pretty outstanding too.

Best wonton noodles.  We came here for one more meal before we head out to the airport.  And yes, it is still the best wonton noodles restaurant, IMO.  We got to the place right before lunch time, so we were seated right away.   This place do get crowded and by the time we left, there was a line waiting.  And it is worth the wait. It is a small place and people do share tables.

I really like this place! Hits the spot on a cold day, and not too strong with any overwhelming flavors. The portion is somewhat on the smaller side, so if you're a big eater like me, I like to add in extra meat or noodles for only a dollar more. Lunch can get crowded on some days, but otherwise, they try to seat everyone (i.e. share tables).

Honestly the price for the food there is much more expensive than Any other restaurant in San Francisco , however , the quality is much more behind. I can find any better one in Chinatown but cost less and more delicious. So regret myself didn't take a look the menu first!!!!! Don't waste money there, honestly !

Today was my first time visiting Hon's Wun Tun House.  To be honest, I have been passing it by because I was a weenie and thought it was a little bit too much like a scary hole in the wall.  Color me stupid.  I decided upon passing it last week, and seeing it packed to the gills, I had to try it.  I love fresh made won ton and noodle soup.  Well, I will no longer be a stranger, I ordered the #23, BBQ pork with won ton and noodles.  It was everything a good bowl of soup should be, noodles al dente, won ton fresh, filled with great flavor and the thin slices of bbq pork were just enough with a great flavor.  I came away full and happy.  Not the largest bowl of soup in the neighborhood, but I am full and contented.  The prices on the menu do not reflect the price you end up paying, old menus, old prices, but who cares, it was damn good.  Colleagues shared tea eggs and declared them good.  One colleague already said, YUM, let's go back soon and since she knows her noodles and wonton being well traveled from Taiwan, that is good enough for me.
I love this spot!
Fast and fresh no frills good food.
I've been coming to this place ever since I was a little kid.  They are cheap, good and fast.  I always get their won ton noodle soup.  Their beef stew is quite delicious too.
very one dimensional.  for the same price, can get much more interesting, fresh and tasty noodles/broth/dumplings at Ramen Underground a couple blocks away...

I walked past this place over a year ago and thought it looked really good, finally took the time to check it out. The place has sort of an off smell when you come in. But after a few minutes you get used to it. The smell seems like a combination of cleaning solvents and broth.
Mom and pop shop located on the bustling street of Kearny. Perfect place for a get-in, get-out hole-in-a-wall restaurant.
Solid wonton soup !
Won ton noodle soup is good. Their dumpling (shui jiao) soup is also pretty good. I always get a combination of these. Can't comment on the rest of the menu.

Good beef brisket (either in noodle soup or over rice). Also, excellent won tons in soup. The soup base has depth and flavor - I sometimes order a bowl of plain soup in addition to my meal and drink it up. This is how authentic Cantonese beef soup is supposed to taste.
I'm sorry but this location just isn't very good.

Ate here before the Giants parade. I got the produce omelet, and the carrots were hard. There isn't really an ambiance, there's multiple TV's at all angles and they had music playing along with the blaring television. It was very unpleasant. The omelet came with home fries and toast. It was decent except for the carrots. It was also a quite chilly inside. I don't think I would eat here again.

omg the breakfast burrito. I'd give it 5 stars for the taste, 4 stars cause it does get a bit pricey.. but oh my god its amazing. they have home made baked potatoes in there with awesomeee cheese (you know, the actual good stuff). I like to get mine with salsa verde on the side instead of the pico de gallo and it is heaven.

This was my first time in San Francisco and I was going into the city with my friend and her father who was treating us to lunch. He chose this place and I was expecting awesomeness. Unfortunately, this was not the case. I ordered the Paris Burger which has brie cheese, mushrooms, and caramelized onions. When I received the burger, the bottom bun was soaked in grease. It fell apart within in a few bites and the bottom of the basket i got the burger in was a mess of grease as well, dripping from the burger. I wouldn't say it tasted bad just extremely greasy and not my cup of tea. Luckily, it was a free meal I won't have to return here. I really wanted to enjoy a San Francisco burger but this just didn't cut it.

Average. Nothing special about the place. Found this place when looking for a snack and some shelter from SF winds. Got the curly fries and curly fries only. It's $3.50 ($3.93 after tax). Dining area is very empty and big. Has music playing for a real laid back ambiance and also a couple tvs
Some hamburgers are good some are not even tasty. Honestly, I would just walk a couple blocks to Super Duper.

I'll give this place an OK. I went there this morning for breakfast and I got their Breakfast Burrito. First off, they took forever to give me my order. They weren't busy at all and when I got back to the office to eat my burrito it was good, but I had an egg shell crunch a few bites in. Almost finishing the burrito made another crunch in my mouth which was gross. I had to spit it out of course and I was pretty upset after the second one. I feel like the cook was trying to hurry up and make it but they need a better "egg cracking" technique because I don't find that the restaurant cooks are very passionate about cooking.
Sat and ate here while the Brazil was playing Mexico in the World Cup. It was intense in there! But very cool and hospitable.

The prices here are absolutely ridiculous. It was bad before, but they just raised the prices again... Today I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and a combo and it rings up to 13.98. 13.98!!!! Are you for real? Basic burger is 6.50 so basically they charge $2 for 2 slices of bacon.
God, why do I keep coming here for convenience.

Waited over 20 mins for a big catering order in front of me. Not too much work to throw an extra burger alongside the catering order. Rude and unacceptable for people that are on lunch and need to get back to work.
Everything about this place is excellent! Great burger and fries to die for. Well not die but terrific. Staff friendly and helpful. I will be back with friends.

It's a no-frills burger.  I had the cheeseburger meal, which includes fries and a soda.  $10.36.  (Burger by itself is $5.49 plus tax). It was mid-rare as requested.  Fries were good.  There are fancier burgers available including a pineapple burger, which has a slice of pineapple atop the meat.  None of the extras seemed to justify the additional $2-5 cost.
Food is delicious and fast and friendly service.
Pros:

Had the Paris burger with sweet potato fries with water. Kinda pricey at 12.95. Line was out the door but they took orders pretty fast. Turkey Burger was okay, not much Brie, fries were small portion and over cooked.

$13 for a veggie burger and frings seems high but when you through in the fact that everything was cold and mushy, at 12:30pm when food should have been turning over quickly, is just absolutely ridiculous!

Today i feel pissed because the cashier did not even mention about my combo can cost much cheaper if i pick a small side plus drink for only $3.69 - and he charged me $3.99 for small side order. If he understands customer service even helping customer get better deal for the bucks i definitely would appreciate it instead i found about the combo myself but as i feel upset already i just updated my review and lower my stars - they deserve it!
CONTEXT:
Everything was really good with the burger except it was way too salty!  And the lettuce was weak.

Bistro Burger is good and close to my work. I called ahead and ordered a mushroom swiss cheeseburger and onion rings. The burger was cooked perfectly and the onion rings were fried to perfection. It really satisfied my craving for a burger. They aren't cheap but at least they aren't as expensive as some of the places in the ferry building. It was my first time at this location. Not super busy on a friday at lunch. Will probably be back when I'm craving something like this again.

This place has the best beef taco salad I've ever tasted. But every time I place an order around 4-5 pm, they give me leftover meat (of steak and pork) when clearly I've asked for beef. I was fine with the meat substitute the first time, but the second time is absurd. I'm not going to bother for the third time.
This place is literally two blocks from where I work (One California Street). The lines here get out the door long at 12pm. But there's no wait if you come after 1pm and that's the time I always go.
This is a quick in-and-out place, great for a hamburger or turkey burger, especially if you like to have it YOUR way. I see they've started offering breakfast and I expect to check them out.
I was very excited to try bistro burger, and I was very disappointed after I did.

Came here twice, once for lunch and once for happy hour. The few times we came, it was pretty packed, being in heart around so many offices and middle of embarcadero which was not surprising at all. The place is of decent size and has plenty of tables and seating. It also has outside seating which was a plus with a good view of worn out zombies rushing out of work for the weekends. I ordered a Sauteed Mushroom Burger and a side of large garlic fries to share for around $14 all together. The attitude from the cashier was pretty disengaging, but for fast burger joint like this, I really could care less. The service was actually fast. For the price, the flavor of the Burger was kind of bland, compare to other Sauteed Burgers I've had in other places. I meat as cooked right surprisingly unlike the previous time I came. The garlic fries was also pretty brittle and dried as my coworkers who I shared the fries with also shared my complaint. I still enjoyed the meal given I was pretty hungry at that time.
I work nearby this Bistro Burger and since I saw a line to order here, I mistakenly thought that they must be legit good.  Ummm not so true at least from my viewpoint.

Went here with my coworkers for lunch after seeing the ridiculous line at Mixt Greens. I decided to keep it simple and order their Bistro Burger so I could have a good baseline of how their burger actually stacks up with no frills on top.

It's nice they are open till 7:00 but seeing all the chairs up in 1/2 of the restaurant, I thought the place was closed and it was kind of uninviting to eat in, along with annoying music playing loudly.  I never like it when it's obvious employees are trying to close of shop while still open.  Had a Google offer for free fries and drink with a burger.  I hadn't been here is many years and I actually liked the burger a lot more than in the past.  Got it with no cheese so appreciated the meat and cooking and seasoned just enough.  However, fries were not that good and use of shredded lettuce vs. real leaf lettuce results in the 3-star rating.  I would recommend their burgers, though, and I prob will be back for a meal on the way to the bus another night.
Good fresh food, using Neiman meat, cooked to order. The California burger with sprouts and avocado is very good. Onion rings are some of the best I've had. Love this location on Mission.
i go here often for lunch.
OK burger but saw more than one person in front of me get the order screwed up. Tables were not bussed making for sparse seating and long wait to order at lunch time.
I came here a couple years ago and remember having some good burgers.
Before my night class, I'm usually looking for a late lunch.  Around 4pm most of the lunch place in FiDi and Soma are closed.  Bistro burger is open until 7pm.

The western burger & teriyaki burger is tasty. Lettuce & tomato are included in the burgers I ordered. The curly fries are addictively good. There are also free sliced pickles that are soooo good. Prices are reasonable at an average of $8, especially for a SOMA lunch spot. There's some seating inside & outside, but I usually get there too late to get a table.

I go to Burger Bistro because it's convenient and in my building, i would not go out of my way to eat at this joint.  They are soooo inconsistent, today i ordered a Western Burger medium rare to go, I got  a Western burger with (1) piece of crumbled burnt bacon and burger well well over done.  It's so annoying to order food to go and not get value for you buck and not the way you ordered it.  Their saving grace is the taqueira bar, the food is fresh and the ladies that make your food are nice and if they see you regularly they remember what you like.

RAW MEAT in the customer accessable FRESH SALAD and drink display.  Don't eat their salads!!  And the cashiers are rude.  After years of eating here the raw meat in the self serve salad chiller and the rude attitude of the cashier I'm done with them.

Oh Bistro Burger, you have so much potential. So much. I mean, you serve hamburgers, and chicken burgers, and turkey burgers, and veggie burgers. You have a billion topping options to customize your burgers. And let's not even get started on your myriad of sauces.
This place is cool when they actually get your order right.
TL;DR - Okay price for an okay burger in FiDi.  Turkey burger is pretty good.

Looks good but it was pretty terrible! Food looks good restaurant has a nice ambiance but the service was really terrible and the food tastes like shit. Really it was pretty terrible I scraped my tongue and I'm going to soak it in black coffee to get the muddled flavored off.

I had lunch with a friend here.  The decor is really sleek and modern.  Noise level wasn't too bad.  At least we could talk without screaming over the din.  I ordered the shrimp fettucine and my friend had the meatloaf sandwich.  The fettucine was good.  Light lemon sauce, spinich, tomatoes and a pretty decent number of shrimp.  My friend said the sandwich was yummy.  Service was fast and efficient.  The food wasn't  bad at all.
Love love love this place! Atmosphere is very nice!!! And customer service is great! Food and drinks are incredible! And of course the location- just perfect! What a wonderful place to be!!! :)

It was a quick lunchtime meeting and was pretty good.  I ordered the lobster mac-n-cheese and it was pretty rich and tasty!  Great sandwiches, salads, burgers, etc.  My friend ordered a chicken Caesar salad and it's a salad with a big chicken wing/breast.    A great hotel restaurant.

I'm a sucker for aesthetics, so when I walked by MaSo one day and saw its cute garden maze-y entrance way, I knew I had to take my hags there for dinner.  The place was not exactly hoppin' on a Friday night, which is kind of nice so you can hear each other talk.  I had the crisp, delicious babe farms green salad; the sparse, but still scrumptious, mahi mahi and gulf shrip; and a side of yuka fries.  And although it's not advertised, they do have a specialty cocktail menu, of which I partook two watermelon martinis.   Yessir.
The bread here is super good. The crab cakes were amazing.   Lobster mac and cheese was ok, and dessert wasn't too memorable.
Only 3 stars? Wow I'm kind of surprised.

Came to have Dinner with my daughter some quality ladies time.. My daughter had the Burger... And can i say wow... It was mouth watering... And the fries had so much flavor, i just tasted her food, i had fish with smashed potatoes, thought it was a little off having those two together but it actually was Delicious!! With my glass of Wine.. It was an excellent evening.! Unfortunately i didnt get my waiter name but he was amazingly helpful throughout the whole evening.! Def. Will come back!!

It can get especially crowded during happy hour.  Also, it's a hotel bar so it's pretty pricy but I wasn't blown away by the food (I got the burger, my friend got a salad).  Doubtful if I push to come back.

Had dinner here with my Dad tonight who was in town on business and staying at the Westin. He refused to go anywhere else since it was a Monday (even two blocks away), but the meal was surprisingly good.

Danny the bartender is a whiskey connoisseur; enough said.  He was just awesome :).  The place has excellent service, a decent selection of scotches, and a nice atmosphere -- it would have been nice if they were open a little later than 10pm or so.

We had the lobster mac, huge lobster sandwich, blackened flounder, ahi tuna apletizer, spicy italian sausage flat bread, pretzel crusted crab cake, clam chowder and espresso and it all was delicious. Service was AMAZING too. Portions were very big for lunch at such a fancy place. I can only imagine what dinner must be like! Reasonable prices for the venue and great food quality. Will definitely return.

Maso is close to work and a great place for celebrations - I've been here for a post holiday lunch as well as a birthday lunch.  Coworkers love it - it's a bit pricey for every day eating but priced fine for business lunches or celebrations.  The bread basket has a great variety of warm breads.  The olive oil is good, but if you add balsamic vinegar (you have to request it), it takes it to a whole new level.

MaSo is a great restaurant! I'm glad I've never had bad service here. The bartenders are really great. I love how they updated the outdoor veranda. It's nice to be able to get a drink outside. I think MaSo has a great menu, I would say it's California cuisine. You know, locally sourced, fresh, organic, and all that jazz. So it's good quality. It's definitely not cheap. I like the atmosphere here, I will definitely go back.
Great space, service and food! We will def be back!

A solid 3.  Close to 4 but there are few strikes against.  I often stay at the hotel so I've had multiple meals and happy hours here.  The hummus, especially during happy hour is very good and a great deal.  The burger is above average, the salmon is good and the lunch salads are excellent.
For drinks in a beautiful steampunk-ish setting and a bartender that will make your cocktail according to your ingredients, it's pretty great. Just expensive, but what do you expect from a hotel bar?

Ducca went away with hardly a whimper which is my flimsy excuse for not knowing this place took its place in the Westin. The coy name comes from turning SoMa backwards. MaSo. SoMa. SoMa. MaSo. Get it? For what purpose, I haven't a clue. They describe their cuisine as "sophisticated twists on comfort food favorites", so what better time of the year is there to come here than Thanksgiving? Yes indeed, Jamie W. and I came here to try their $49 Thanksgiving Day 4 Course Prix Fixe menu (photo:

We went for the Dine About Town (DAT) event.  When we arrived we were seated by a waiter and given the menu,  After waiting over 5 minutes for someone to come to our table, I flagged down a passing waiter and asked the the special Dine About Town menu, which they brought over to us.  Next I had to flag down a second waiter to get the drink menu, which was then brought over to us.  There were 4 of us and two people in my group wanted wine, so we had to ask for the wine menu also.  It should not have to be that difficult to get  food and drink menu(s). Just bring them all at the same time when you seat us.  I had the pork osso bucco and it was delicious.  Surprisingly it was a large portion.  Everyone else liked their food too.
My fault for getting sucked in by their delicious Dine About Town menu, and not reading the Yelp reviews first.
Our friends were staying at the hotel so we decided to meet them up for some food and drinks.  We ordered the fries, the flatbread, and the wings.  In general, it was all not very good.

In an upscale hotel, I anticipate a better-than-average dining experience. I was modestly disappointed. The worst aspect was a table of fellow diners who apparently come from a place where some people don't feel any need whatsoever to behave like humans. Lordy, they were -- no exaggeration -- SCREAMING with boisterous voice & laughter. I tried to ignore them, owing to a live-and-let-live philosophy, but the decibels made my attempts useless. I so, so pitied the poor souls sitting adjacent to these Neanderthals from...Texas perhaps? It is noteworthy that there behavior went unchecked by staff.

For a hotel restaurant, this place is pretty great. I rarely find myself eating in the restaurants of the hotels I'm staying---why would you when there's better (leagues better grub) to be had just a few steps away?
It's expensive, $6 for a coke, $8 for a beer, the service is fine at times, terrible at others but it's quiet and comfortable which can be a rarity downtown.

The food: SO GOOD. We got the tuna ceviche, crab cakes (YUMMMMM), mozzarella burratta, scallops and prawns, and lobster mac, and just shared it all.  Everything was really good, exceeppptt the lobster mac had a weird after-taste.  Dont know if that was just me though, but everything else was seriously YUMMY.
This review is for dinner eaten at Maso on October 21, 2013. The single worst meal I have ever had in all my travels to San Francisco.
Good business lunch spot that's still tweaking their service.

Went for drinks and appetizers.  Service was about as bad as I've had in San Francisco.  Granted we weren't sitting in the middle of the restaurant, but in the lounge area...but after we got up a second time to find silverware or clean plates, you'd think someone would have noticed they had paying customers sitting there.  No one bothered to refill water, and it took forever for anyone to remove dirty plates.  And it's not like they're short staffed; it's just that the staff clustered around the bar doing I don't know what.  The food was ok (shrimp bruschetta, duck tacos, french fries, and a cheese plate with not very distinctive cheeses and some sad looking grapes), but nothing worth going out of your way for.  And my Manhattans were watered down.  On the other hand, there were lots of open seats and tables.
Dinner at 8pm.

Meh. For these kind of prices the service needs to be spot on and the food could be a bit better. I get it, these financial district type places all get to charge a bit more but all in all it was a little disappointing. The entrees are decent but for the same price you could do MUCH better in this town.

The Happy Mac off their happy hour menu is awesome. It's a little spicy, so if you can't handle it I'd avoid the pepper slices they use to garnish the side salad. Everything off the regular menu looked pricey, but the ambience is nice and they put bacon in the Bloody Maries.

Very new restaurant inside The Westin in SOMA.  Went for lunch the other day to try out the grub and came away very happy.  The selections were good and I settled on the Niman Ranch 9 oz. Burger with Farm Goat Cheddar.  The meal started-off with fresh sourdough bread, which is always a good way to start a meal.  The burger was big and cooked perfectly.  Pickles and fries came with it to make a very good meal.  My co-worker ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese, which she said was delicious.  Overall, a very good experience.  Good service, good food and good company.  Will have to stop by for drinks after work.

Good for grabbing a drink with friends. The asparagus soup and tuna tacos were good. The fried shimeji mushrooms were not. Service is hit or miss if you sit outside. Come here for the atmosphere, not the food.
Good food, but oh man is it overpriced, Financial District or not.

I was excited to grab a bite and a drink here for happy hour because it was in an alley with a cute set up and it looked fairly popular, but I was disappointed. Since it was my first time here I didn't know if I had to seat myself or wait so I asked a server and she was very abrupt. Then when we were ready to order I made eye contact with one of the servers hoping to get some sort of service and instead of telling me that she will be with me shortly she just walked away. After waiting a while we didn't get any service so just decided to leave. I probably won't be trying this place again.

Decent grub for a hotel resto.  This place is brandspankingnew - so new that I doubt that entire staff tried the menu as I really had a hard time picking  a meal and my guy had no idea what was good! Since nothing spoke to me on the dinner menu - I went with the bar grub:  flat iron steak Sammy with a side of garlic fries. (think vietnamese sandwich with jalapeño aioli) totally awesome.  I originally though this woud be a Spanish/Mexican  restaurant based on its name - but it appears more Asian influenced. Nice digs overall. Glad that I didn't have to walk across the street to Ame as it was raining -  would come back the next time I stay at the Westin on market.
DJ...boots and pants and boots and pants...$8 beers and $11 Svedka...boots and pants...

It's a beautiful space but the service is slow. The jellyfish-like chandelier is surreal.  The crowd was a mix of touristy to fashiony to WTF to wedding guests.  Prices are typical of such loungey-type bars.  Thankfully, we had free drink coupons.
This place seems like a great place to go on a Friday.  There is a live DJ and all.

I love me a W hotel. I mean, seriously, you're not going to find a bigger fan. They're beautiful, hip, trendy, the crowds are cool, and the vibe is just spot-on. I stay at the W every time I have the option to... in Hong Kong, in Taiwan, on both ends of Los Angeles.
it was festive and well crowdie which i like much it. They are always conscious and inspite of many busy customers they served each person in their work.
A sleek, stunning space fit for the fanciest of people, but instead stacked with trendy, excited guests and locals alike eager to see, be seen, and sip some cocktails.
This is a wonderful place. I LIKE THIS PLACE.

I like this place either to start off your night or for a nite cap.  The after work crowd is energetic yet chill at the same time, while the "after hours" crowd is just as good.  You can have a conversation no problem, and not be bothered by elbows or drunken banter.  I've also never had a problem finding seating, be it at the bar or at a hi-top.  Bartenders are friendly and quick.  Overall, the Living Room is a sure good time.  3 stars from me!

The facility itself is very nice. The service was good - our waitress was very nice and her recommendations for cocktail drinks were great! I loved both of the drinks that I had there - one was a cucumber cooler with jalapeno and the other one was a martini with St. elder flower in it. I can't recall, but both were expectational. We had the chile cheese burger and the lobster green chili mac and cheese. Everyone in our party loved the lobster green chili mac and cheese. However, we couldn't say the same for the green chili cheese burger. The right ingredients are in the burger, but it is also overwhelming to have some many flavors together that it makes it flavorless. The taste/flavor of the guacamole was not present even though there was guacamole in the burger. I am a huge FAN of cheese, but the taste of it was lost with the charcoal meat. The bun got very soggy due to overwhelming amount of the guacamole and green chili. Overall, our experience was very pleasant and we enjoyed ourselves very much. I would recommend it for anyone who is looking for a good cocktail and lobster mac and cheese! Will be back to try the other items that I was not able to.

This is a an amazing place to hang out at before or after your adventures in the City. We came here to take a break before heading out for part 2 of our evening. The whole bar lights up in rainbow colors, in a very chic, totally hot way. The huge light fixture when you first walk in in the shape of a jelly fish is nothing short of amazing!!! And the fireplace seating is so warm and inviting. I absolutely love our experience here!

Came here before my spa appointment at Bliss Spa on a Thursday afternoon to have a cocktail and something quick to eat.  Food was ok, kinda too salty for my taste, and my Moscato was good.  I'd probably come back with friends to have a drink.
{ overall experience : average }

This is my favorite go to bar/lounge in the city. It is great place to start off or end your night. The atmosphere is trendy and upscale without being overly stuffy. The wait staff is friendly and quick. I love the corner booth by the fireplace - this is the best place to curl up and relax with good company and hang out while sipping drinks :)

By basis of being inside the W, this place guarantees a certain level of service, quality of drinks and atmosphere. Drinks were good, but as expected, a little pricey to cover that guarantee of service and atmosphere, but that wasn't the main reason I came here. There's a gigantic huge, brand-spanking new LED fiber-optic combo sculpture in the rotunda area. It's worth paying for a slightly overpriced drink to sit under it and admire what creativity combined with modern technology can create. That's what prompted me to visit the W, and that's what'll bring me back.

Being from out of town, I wanted to explore a great place to eat without going too far away from my hotel. Since I heard that the restaurant at the Westin Market Street was just "mediocre" (where I am staying), I wanted googled/yelped some places close by and came cross the Living Room Bar & Lounge at the W Hotel.

Due to close proximity to Yelp HQ, I stay at this W hotel a fair amount, and inevitably find myself enjoying a beverage or two at the Living Room Bar down in the lobby. Unlike most hotel lobby bars, this one features prominently in the lobby, and often erupts in to a sprawling party that spreads from one end of the lobby to the other. It's an interesting dynamic but one that fits pretty well with the hotel's overall vibe.

A room ostensibly packed with both the living and the lounging, this ever-present bastion of the W Hotel provides both a light break from the part of the hotel experience where, for instance, you go upstairs and drop your bags off, and another part of the hotel experience, where you're outside.

If I went on the show Best Thing I Ever Ate, I would say "Braised Pork Shoulder" at W Hotel - Living Room. This was the most amazing thing I have ever tasted. Forget about the price, I would pay $100 to eat this succulent dish again. The balance with the well marinated Niman Ranch pork shoulder and crisp gnocchi with mushrooms is simply mind blowing, your taste buds will thank you.

If you're staying at the W in SF and need to meet up with people, or grab a quick drink (or some free AM coffee), this is your spot. Otherwise, SF offers up such a wide variety of restaurants, bars, coffee shops and more that you don't really need to make a point of coming to the Living Room.

I was actually quite pleased with this place.  I hadn't seen the place since they remodeled it.  The music was too loud to talk, but the layout was really nice and comfortable.  There were plenty of places to sit and they had cabana seating upstairs as well as another bar.  A clean modern place with a good atmosphere.  If they get the volume of the music on point, it would be about perfect for a fun night on the town.

After dinner, we stopped here for drinks.  I grabbed a Black Russian and sat and observed the lounge like a sociology experiment.  Being in this place reminded me of being at the Cosmopolitan in Vegas, with all the 20-somethings lounging around the Chandelier being all 20-something like.  I miss being in Vegas with friends.  Being in this place doesn't help one bit.  Though sipping my Black Russian probably had something to do with it.

So I liked the moniker XYZ Bar better; but The Living Room is still a sweet place to get your sip on. After renovations, this place is feeling even more club-like. Purple back-lighting, and cool bar with light cut-outs. It's loungier against the windows, and all bistro tables and bar, across the aisle. Drinks are priced high, IMO, even for SF. A glass of prosecco ran me $11! But the bartenders and cocktail waitresses are all smiles, and prompt. Very posh, this bar fits right in with the W. But for folks looking for a more laidback nightcap at their hotel, my advice is: Stick to the mini bar.
Posh, lights on the walls, on the bar... neon colors with a black backdrop. This place screams trendy and it's pretty cool.

I might just replicate one of the rooms in my future house the same exact way this lounge is set up. It's hip. It's cool. It's trendy. The lounge area is set up to what appears as a series of extra large booths --- minus the dining room table. A group can settle just in and talk amongst each other while a couple can quietly romance themselves in conversation. Business men and women can engage in important talks. All this happening within your booth yet you get so drawn into the environment you feel as though you and your entourage are the only ones there.
Sure, it's nice and all, but the sugary Bergamot Bliss cocktail was low on the booze and high on the price ($13).

I may spend more nights at the San Francisco W than I do at my own home in Chicago. I've spent many nights at this bar of my home away from home. In fact, it makes the perfect late night office because it's always more fun to get some work done with some wine and grub.
I can't remember the last time I was here, when I came back last week, I thought I entered the wrong place!
Tonight is the grand opening of the much anticipated Living Room and Lounge at the W Hotel.  It is beautiful!

name: The Living Room Bar and Lounge

reviews.text: Fair selection of items that are fresh and more to my taste than Lee's, Julie's Kitchen or Chez Fayala. It is a salad bar type of set up and you can also order sandwiches and daily lunch specials.
Good food, nice salad bar with plenty of options.  A nice lunch spot if you like classical music and want to avoid pricey trendy chain lunch spots

Awesome salad bar! Make it however you want with whatever you want. They even have hot food available. I wouldn't necessarily call it Asian cuisine but it does have that Asian flavor to it. Very good in my book! They also have nice pastries and breakfast items. Definitely worth checking out!

So I walk by this place a lot and have always just shrugged at it, thinking it was just gonna be mediocre. Boy was I wrong. First of all, their salad bar is only $6.50 a pound, which is cheaper than most places. Second, their coffee is incredible. I've been going to Cafe Me and Coffee Roasters for my bagel and coffee in the morning and I've been making a mistake! Now, both those places are great, but this place is better and the same cost! The staff are very friendly and their prices are excellent. The asiago bagel I got was incredible, and the coffee was perfection!
I go here a couple times a month, as part of my regular rotation of salad bars in the area.

I used to grab a quick lunch here quite a bit and actually felt like I got my money's worth, but recently, their salad bar has not been all that fresh - semi-slimy spinach, veggies, and the hot dishes have been either dried up (spicy chicken - tried and was very disappointed) or slimy - looking.  I am all for supporting small businesses, but if I end up with a stomach ache a few hours after the lunch, it's just not worth it to me.
I like to go here when I'm tired of eating so much meat over the week.
Been coming here for years! Make sure to get a salad card so after so many salads you get one free! Always fresh food and everything is clean and neat. Owners are always smiling and cheery =)
Walking to the office from the Embarcadero Safeway & passed Cafe Insalata.  Always wanted to walk in & grab a latte so thought today should be the day
My coworker and I refer to this place as the "cheap salad place." If you're aiming for a more top notch salad bar, Wildflower Cafe is a few blocks away--it has better food and a bigger variety of it.
Salad bar: ingredients are decently fresh, and the selection of ingredients is fairly wide, with some uncommon but welcome choices, like hot meatball marinara.

Just skip this place. Overall, the food is uninspired and cafe has a weird cafeteria-meets-day-care atmosphere. Anyway, I ordered an egg sandwich (thinking it'd be a fried egg) and got an egg salad sandwich. That aside, the sandwich was terrible. Why line more mayonnaise on the bread of an egg salad sandwich? The bread was dry and so thick it overtook everything. The plain tomato & lettuce didn't help. I was disappointed to say the least.
Love the spaghetti and meatballs w/ salad and garlic bread on Monday and Wednesdays.  Also love the couple who run the shop since they're always cheerful and super nice =)
Bar fight.
Myself being a Fresh Choice / Sweet Tomatoes patron... I passed by this establishment and became automatically interested.
Another solid place for lunch in the FiDi and luckily for me, it's the close to my office!

Solid. You want a basic salad bar with all the fixins at a low price ($5.99/lb) this is it. If you want something that's glam and fab and, well, you know, don't go here. The sandwiches are made fresh. They are substantial. It's a "go to" place for lunch.

For some, Lee's is the go-to place for cheaper salad/lunch bar offerings.  For others who have a $13 lunch budget, Greens or Lightening Foods or the like might be theirs.  For me, I want my food-by-the-pound to be freakin' cheap and freakin' fresh.  Organic, non... I can't say there's any real distinction for me. I just want my veggies fresh, tasty and cheap.  Insalata delivers!

One of the most economical options in the area, and the simple fixings all around are just right a lot of the time. The place is always clean and salad stuff is always fresh, if not primo organic. Love the owners, so sweet.
I work a block away and I go there ONLY when  i really have to.
I've only been here once so far, but I like what I saw (and ate). The food is fresh and the prices are very reasonable. They even accept credit cards, which is always a plus in my book.

I generally hate lunchtime buffet salad bars, which makes it strange that I've been picking up lunch from Cafe Inslata's salad bar 3-4 days per week for the past several months.  The food is fresh and the staff is friendly and keeps the place very clean.  The prices are good as well.  I hope they continue to do well.
Decent salad bar with good variety (including curry chicken on the day I went!) !for a quick lunch.

Great place. Everyone that works there is very friendly. The salad bar is very good but I wish they would cut the vegetables smaller. The lettuce, beats, peppers and cucumbers are too big to cut at my desk with a plastic knife.

Friendly neighborhood sandwich place. The owners are exremely nice but come for the salad bar where they weigh by the pound. It is reasonably priced but the sandwiches are mediocre. Don't come from out of your way to get here but if you work close and you want a quick bite you should come by.

I heart insalata! I've been going here since my first day of work right around the corner. I've been a sucker for salad bars ever since I was a wee babe- and this one is pretty good. their hot foods bar is kinda scary in my opinion, but there are lots of fresh veggie options and if you get there in time, the homemade bacon bits are killer. staff is super friendly and you can get a punch card for a free pound of salad on your 10th visit. be sure to ask for the card, tho.... I was going there for months before I knew about it! plenty of sanwich and specials are also available. enjoy!

This place is about a block from my work and we come here at least three times a week. It's cheap and you pay by the pound. The salad bar is always the same but that means they always have california rolls, romaine, cottage cheese, rice, a few hot dishes and all the salad bar fixings.

Decent little salad bar with some generic ingredients.  Some looked fresh (spinach, broccoli, cucumbers, tomatoes) others looked canned (corn, peas) but overall a nice selection of options.  The hot dishes looke a little tired (dried but looked like it might be decent if you got it right after it was put out).
I hate saying this becuase the owners are the cutest things ever but, a friend and I saw a COCKROACH crawling on the salad bar....ehh i'll prob still go back ;)
This place has made my lunchtime decisions SOO much easier!

Right by my office so I'm here way too often.  I've only had the salad bar (guess the weight and get it for free!)  I love the fact that they have lots of tofu, roasted veggies, and generally healthy lunch options.  You can get a few pieces of sushi, some noodles, a hot dish, or the classic salad toppings.  Prices are very reasonable and its much nicer inside ever since they took down the millions of signs.
I LOVE THIS PLACE.

I make it in here occassionally specifically for the salad bar. It has tons of goodies and is very reasonably priced. I have also tried the lasagna and it wasn't half bad. Good prices, friendly people and tasty food. For a quick luch, what more can you ask for?
The food here is pretty good - but the staff are awesome. Super nice and totally remember me when I come in and what I like to order. They make my sandwiches exactly how I want and their quick.
Mediocre menu note, but if you're looking for a DIY FIDI salad bar, this is a good bet because:

Nothing good, but nothing bad either.  Everything taste ok.  The service here is great.  You get the smiles and the greeting.  They're not expensive nor cheap.  It's FiDi pricing.  Their special was beef stew and my friend ordered it and the sauce was pretty good.  The meat was a bit tough.
Where else can you eat for $4.99.

Folks who run the joint are super nice.  I like the salad bar - it's nothing really outstanding, but the roast veggies, soba and tofu make up for any omissions.  I've also had the soup, but i'm pretty sure it just comes in the giant cans from Smart n. Final.
Love this place. This is in everyway my standby lunch place as I work 2 minutes from here.
Hell to the NO!

I typically get breakfast here. Good oatmeal and bagels. I hear the breakfast burritos are tasty and large in size. My favorite is an egg white omelet with chicken apple sausage,  cheese and toast. Very consistent but sometimes there is a wait.
50% of the time I come here I'm sorry I walked the extra block.  They are slow and constantly out of breakfast items.  Over priced and arrogant employees.
Tried to give them another chance and today-a hair in my salad.  disgusted and disappointed

My favorite and freshest salad spot in the financial district. Beware, long lines if you go during the lunch rush. Actually the salad bar always has a line but it moves fast! These workers are awesome and so attentive. I always order my own salad with includes spinach/arugula salad mix, topped with marinated tofu, beets and red peppers or edamame. Sometimes I add in their lemon chicken with light balsamic dressing. Their spicy chicken is also to die for and I occasionally order their mac n cheese from the hot food area. Great lunch spot on the go with fresh, tasty ingredients!

An affordable and healthy lunch spot. My colleagues and I frequent this place weekly. A salad with three toppings and protein is roughly $8. Queues can be lengthy during lunch time peak hour (roughly 15 minutes wait time).
This is my closest coffee and sandwich spot. Quality is decent, and price is very reasonable.
This is the closest breakfast/lunch option to my work, so I've been here many, many times.

The breakfast options are great! I order the build your own scramble so I can pack it full of veggies. If you see a line do not fear the guys cooking the breakfast are efficient, very nice and fast! Salsa is off the hook! Only thing that would make this place better is if the ingredients were organic.
Delicious!!! I got a sandwich which was totally up to my standards, because it had all the fancy ingredients I like:

This place is pretty decent.  It's a healthy choice for lunch, it's really close to my work, and I actually feel full from their salads, even if I don't add meat (pretty large portions for a small).  My only complaint is that depending on who you get, you may get really skimpy toppings.  The bread that comes with the salad is pretty good. This place isn't that cheap, but you can't get anything "cheap" for lunch in the FiDi.  Also since I can only eat about half of the small salad each time, the cost split between 2 meals isn't bad. It's pretty much one of the only super healthy lunch options.  I've tried their hot food before too, and that was okay.  I like their salads better; the hot food can be pretty heavy.  The lines are very long during lunch time, so make sure you go no later than 11:15 or so if you want to beat the crowd.
So, $8 for a "small" salad (which is not in *any* way small) is quite a bargain, by any standard. Add some delicious meat, and you have a lunch.
Yay, Focaccia! (I'm shocked that the reviews for this place aren't consistently high...)
You can't do better in terms of value than Focaccia. For $6.50 you can get a small (it's not actually that small) salad with fresh, tasty ingredients-all made to order.
This is my default lunch place.  I can come here everyday and I do come here every time I go into my office unless another place is suggested.

I guess I am a dissenter or maybe I just have a different value scale than the majority. I want to like focaccia, the people are nice and there a lots of variety to choose from but alas my rating scale has them slotted down to this level. Let's go through it
Great and reasonable price salad that you can customize. It is no wonder the line is always insane.
Focaccia is a decent spot. Came here today to meet a friend for lunch, and in general we were pretty satisfied with what we got.

The salads here are solid. At first, I was a little disappointed because the salad ingredient options don't include all of my favorites (or some of the seasonal items that Mixt Greens has), but the salads here are tasty nonetheless and for a small salad, it's a tad cheaper that Mixt Greens.
I've been holding off from coming here because I read some reviews saying people have found bugs in their salads. But a coworker always said good things about this place. Good salads and fair prices.
Ordered the half Roma panini w/ side salad (caesar)

This review is explicitly for their breakfast service.  When I thought a breakfast sandwich experience couldn't get any worse.  I asked for a breakfast sandwich on wheat toast.  They have wheat, great!  Except every veggie costs .45 to add on top of a not cheap 4.45 base "sandwich" price.  Avocado?  1.00.  And the lady essentially put 4 pen-thin slices on my egg.  I could barely see the green.  Can you put tomato on that?  "What tomato?  On a breakfast  sandwich?"  "Yes, tomato."  She had to get clearance from her manager to put 1.5 slices of tomato without charging me another .45 cents.  I didn't dare ask for lettuce.  "Mustard, Mayo Please" ?  Her reply:  "You can do it yourself."  All for a grand total of 7.40.  And they call it a sandwich.

Come here for the salads!  Portions are large (they jam pack the container with greens), lots of topping options, and reasonable prices.  Comes with focaccia - which is a little oily, but hey, it's better that way!  Line can be super duper long around lunch, but they move fairly quickly.  They also do lunch box catering too.
great salad and a reasonable price.

Came to this place for the first time for lunch yesterday (had a focaccia marinated chicken sandwich with lettuce, tomatoes and cucumbers.)  Ended up sick all evening and all night. Did anyone else experience this yesterday?

I'm obsessed with this place!  Actually, I like the one on Sacramento Street better. The lines are way shorter and the salad portions are larger (they jam pack the small salads there).  But regardless, this place is seriously amazing and offers great food for a very reasonable price.
Boring food.

The food is excellent and the staff is too. However, management has some very odd views of customer service. In the middle of the lunch hour rush the salad line snakes 3 times out to the main floor. In the middle of the rush, they decide to close down 50% of the salad making bar??
Focaccia is amaze balls. I decided to try it out for lunch because one of my peers at GGU around the corner always is eating a pasta salad from this place during our Tuesday night class.
BREAKFAST GRABS!!

The Focaccia Mkt & Bakery just opened in South San Francisco in the Centennial Towers bldg right off of Oyster Pt/Sister Cities Blvd.  Why so secretive about it?  No advertising, no menu, no mention on their website, just word of mouth is how I learned it had opened.   And, boy, am I glad I did!

Went to this place to grab a salad with my girl Charlee... the line moved quickly but the service SUCKED. The server rushed me (i had never been here before so I wasnt sure how the create your own salad works) didn't explain anything to me then told me they didn't have Avocado when I saw it in my face. I wish i could give this place 4 thumbs down. My mixed greens were the same as anywhere else the tuna is salty as hell and my little ass salad cost 8.00 dollars. So not worth it. Save your money go somewhere else
Pros:

I got a sandwich, which was great.  Lots of variety to choose from, including an olive mayonnaise spread that, well, tasted like olives.  I mean, I should've known!  But I didn't, and so I was kind of unprepared for the olive flavor...   Well, the bread was good.

Foccacia is just next to my bldg it's probably the closest food spot yet I've find here twice in the last year and a half. I might be the small percentage that isn't in love with this place. It def has strong customer loyalty because the lunch lines are always pretty hefty! It sounds like people love it.

I went to focaccia a couple of weeks ago after not having been in years.  I used to come here all the time because it was close to my old office.  I was so excited to have a focaccia sandwich.  I always used to get a veggie sandwich on whole wheat bread with brie and lots of veggies.  I was there early and there was no one else in line.  The sandwich guy clearly saw me, but still made me wait over 5 minutes before even acknowledging my presence.  He did not say hello.  He did not ask me what I wanted.  Instead he stared at me and just sort of nodded his head.  I asked for a veggie sandwich with brie.  He said, no brie.  I said ok, how about muenster and provolone.  He didn't say a word, but he rolled his eyes several times at me.  I have no idea why.  He seemed annoyed at everything I asked for.  I had forgotten to ask for balsamic, so I asked to add it after he'd put the veggies on.  This really annoyed him.  When he was finished making my sandwich, he sort of threw it on the counter.  I asked him his name.  He said it was Luis.  Then when I went to pay, he'd charged me for a regular sandwich with extra cheese, even though I had no meat.  They never used to do that!  I wish I'd chosen to go to Oasis around the corner instead.  Even when I haven't been there in years, Mohammed still recognizes me and remembers my order.  Customer service has declined significantly at focaccia.  I don't think I'll be back.

I've eaten here for lunch almost every day for over a year, the food is that good. The salads are as fresh as you could ever hope for, the sandwiches are thick and interesting, even the soups are delicious. I especially recommend the split pea soup with bacon. If you need a quick coffee in the morning, they have good coffee and there is a nice baked goods selection to choose from.

I have ordered sandwiches from here, salads, and hot food a couple times. but most recently, I got the meatloaf lunch combo. It was pricey at $10.99 plus tax for lunch, but the meatloaf, mashed potatoes and vegetables were really good. I must admit my love for comfort food is pretty strong :) The meatloaf had really yummy juices and sauce and I could tell it had a good amount of cheese in the meat mixture. Healthy? No! Delicious? Hell yes!

I love coming here for a quick to-go lunch when I'm working downtown. I usually get a small custom salad ($5.95 and it's the perfect size for me to be full). You can pick your own toppings and dressing and they'll mix it for you on the spot. Their hot meals and sandwiches are delicious as well. The sandwiches take a little longer if you want them to be toasted, but I'll recommend the pesto mayo sauce with ham. It gets quite crowded during peak lunchtime hours (11:30AM - 1:00PM), but they're very efficient so you don't have to wait that long. Sadly they don't have a seating area.

This place usually has a line almost out the door for the amazing salads.  As a person with food allergies I have never had a problem with cross contamination.  Each server is careful with not pounding utensils over other items, they mix in a fresh bowl, with a clean set of tongs and gloves.  Many, many ingredients to choose from to create your own salad.  They also have delicious roast chicken and other hot meals to choose from, and there is hardly a line for the hot meals or sandwich counter.  Another option for grab and go deliciousness in the FiDi.
