Okay, I'm a believer. I must have walked in and out of the place at least 5 different times. The lines were always long, and the prices scared me a little. But today, my stomach told me to just give it a try so I did.

Wow. Excellent, quick, food.  Pizza is awsome, and you can also get the healthier choices (or combination).  A lot of variety, buffet style.  This is NOT a classy sit-down type restaurant.  Highly recommend for fast good food.

Convenient location but more limited selection than the portico on first street. I would rate 3.5 but since half stars aren't available I've rounded to 4 stars.  Great place for salads and/or sandwiches or pizza.

Good quick lunch spot. A lot of variety. They have a salad and hot food buffet at lunch but I always get the 1/2 chicken and double veggies or the 1/2 chicken Caesar salad where they actually shred the chicken off the bone for your salad. Everything seems to be very fresh and made daily.

Not a bad place for a quick fidi lunch.  My new office is across the street, so I am busy checking out lunch places in the neighborhood.  Portico is a good choice since they offer quite a few options - pizza, sandwiches, and a massive salad/hot food bar.

So pleasantly surprised with this place. I always walk by but never went in b/c I thought it was only a pizza joint. Came in for lunch and saw the buffet layout. No lines (it was raining too). Picked up at least 5 oz of salmon, brussels sprouts, the kale salad w/ red bell and strawberries (SO good, I might just pack the box full of this next time), roasted beets, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, and dolma to top it off. I put it on the scale thinking it was going to be about $12-13, and it was $7.95! Everything tasted great. Polite staff. Me like.

Good spot for pizza, salad, soup. I have personally had all three, but this review is only about pizza. If you're smart, you'll wait for a fresh, whole pizza to come out of the oven instead of ordering a slice that's been sitting out for.... well, who knows how long?
Pizza and salad bar. Not bad. Perfect for quick lunch in FiDi then back to work!
Time: 12:37pm/63°F sunny
Portico is one of my guilty pleasures. There are just some days that I really want pizza - nothing fancy, just good ol' pizza. And when I want to indulge my guilty pleasure, I go to Portico.
Do you think cafeterias are strange?  Think a little longer.

I get lunch here regularly & it's a decent spot to grab a nice personal pizza under $5 or a sandwich. Minus the one time the lady at the register called me "Miss" as she asked for my card, this place is pretty good. Made for an awkward but funny moment.
With their doughy crust that is not thick nor too crunchy and melted cheese all over, I must say that I am a fan of Portico's Pizza!

This place seriously has the best roast turkey sandwich I have ever had besides my house. I am beyond addicted. The turkey is super juicy, warm, and tastes like a bit of Thanksgiving in my mouth. The only thing I wish they had was cranberry, but I'll live. Other than that, the salad bar is always great. I just wish this location was a bit bigger. It's very narrow. The staff is super friendly and try to get through the line as quickly as possible. Over all I love it, just wish it was bigger.

I've been eating at this place often because it is right next to school. Let me tell you: it's amazing. They have awesome combo meals, the pizza is very good and the soup is the best I've had so far.. but my favorite are the salads. There is a large salad bar with many options, so it is nice to be able to make your own and pick what you are in the mood for. All the ingredients taste absolutely fresh. The prices are super low for the quality and quantity of the food. The salads are sold by weight and it is $7 for a pound!

Thumbs up for their $8.65 half-chicken and two-sides lunch combo! Pretty good deal for lunch, and especially since there usually isn't a line during the peak of lunch hour. Sometimes the chicken is really deformed and missing a lot of the meat, but usually it's cooked well. The staff are generally friendly, but some of them should learn to smile more often :)

I love this place staff is extremely friendly!!! Lunch special is amazing!!! I frequent this place with co workers bc of cost quality and efficiency. The Salad bar is great!!! I'm not a big salad person but my more health conscience co workers are ALL over it! Being sold by weight gives them a lot of salad for reasonable cost.
Good variety of food, very convenient location for me, but a little too expensive.
This place is great! you can tell by the crowd at during lunch hours.
Pizza as a topping in the salad bar?  I guess now we know what heaven looks like!
Portico on 1st is possibly the best quick-serve lunch stop downtown ... what the heck happened at this location?

Seems a little turnover in the kitchen is a good thing. After not going there for years despite proximity, ventured back and was pleasantly surprised. It's better, people are still nice, and fairly cheap. Won't shun completely for now.

Called there about a half an hour ago to see what time they were open until. The dude who answered to phone said for the next two minutes and I bolted over there. I was really craving pizza, and was ready to take whatever they had. When I got there, there was fair amount still left so I scored two of the Hawaiian slices. I was really satisfied. I'm not into an inch of dough and a gummy crust, so Porticodoes not dissappoint. I would definitely go back.
This place is really good, their pizza is very fresh and so good, as well as their salads. I really enjoyed it here!
Seriously - don't bother.
Please note: This pizza is not bad if you get it fresh out of the oven.

I completely had the wrong idea about this place. I walked in like I knew what the hell I was doing and instead I felt like an idiot. When somebody says "salad bar" I'm thinking all you can eat salad like at most other pizza joints. Well, not here. My gay was definitely clownin', saying I needed to go to Sizzler for that.

Much as I would love to write a ridiculously long review, there's not really much to say. Clean looking interior, people are nice. I always come for a slice of pizza to go: it's not the best pizza you've ever had, but for just over $4 after tax, you get a decently fat sized slice. Nothing in the area offers much in comparison in terms of pricing, so plus one to Portico's there. Pizza isn't too thick, but not exactly thin crusted either. Crust isn't obnoxiously crunchily hard, so that's good. Spicy chicken isn't really spicy and the combination has all the toppings you'd expect.

I had tried Portico at its other location before and was quite good.  This one is narrower and replaced what used to be a pastry and coffee cafe long ago.  It has been here for years and I really don't eat pizza by slice.  It turns me off.  Today I just needed something like say a slice of pizza so I headed over there.  The slices are very big and do cost as much as a lunch but once I took it back to work I realized how few Pepperoni and Sausage was on top.  That is my first impression of the slice of pizza.  Their personal pizza deal seems great.  It starts at 2 pm to 8 pm which is good to know.  Most financial district food places are wrapping things up to close for the day about 3 pm and on.  A personal pizza with soda and what not for $5.50 is very cheap and I don't think there is a catch.  Their salad bar looks great also.  I recommend it.  Their other location on first has better pizza.  I just didn't like it there.  They keep calling me "boss" and I feel like I am a prison guard and they are inmates.  I don't where they get this boss thing from but I avoided the place since even though pizza was very good.
my slice was definitely nearing the end of its life span. i've been to the one on mission at lunch and was really impressed. i guess i'd recommend not hitting this spot up near closing time.
Getting naked.
Four months later - wow, to the day!
This place has never disappointed me !
This particular location is not as good as the one at 1st and mission which I used to go to all the time in my old office. I think there are 2 reasons for this:
Decent, cheap, and perfect for lunch. Love the salad bar and a (BIG) slice of their cheese or pesto.

I've only ever had their salad bar which boasts a good variety of fresh stuff. It's way, way better than Lee's Deli but the quality isn't as high as as Mixt Greens. I wish this location did 1/2 price after 2pm as some of the other Porticos do.

Since coming back into downtown for work, the selection for a decently priced lunch has been quite scarce. I can't eat Mcdonalds/Jack in the Box everyday and I dont feel like paying 8-10 bucks for a deli sandwich or salad. I just dont think its worth it....10 dollars a day for lunch everyday will not look good at the end of the year.

Seriously? The salad was okay, but as I was eating it there, some homeless dude kept talking to me then tried to take the left over gristle off my plate. Even though i ignored him then stated loudly "I'm not in the effin' mood" and it was obvious he was begging, nobody did anything. I like to eat in peace, thank you.

Hella nasty found an empty butter packet in my food. Made a police report and everything and called the district manager. You have to get your own bread and butter. I never touched either and the package looks used.
This Place has some good PIZZA. the SLICES ARE HUGE lol We were visting SF AND WE SAW this restaurant and tried it and when i go back to that area of market i will buy another HUGE SLICE

Meh.. the pizza wasn't too hot at this location, I think there are plenty of other places in SF where you can get a decent slice.  It does have the convenience of being right next to the Montgomery BART, though..

Had hoped for more but got what I expected. Their Asian salad was ok but nothing special. A lot of shredded cabbage and carrots with green onion and a little sprinkling of black sesame seeds. I left off the crunchy wontons to save on calories. Dressing was tangy but a little too thick. The biggest let down was the wild blueberry coffee cake. I take my bakery goods very seriously and this was not even worth the calories to finish.  The only good part of the meal was their coffee from Intelligentsia and the reason I gave them three stars. Luckily it's only my first meal in SF and I have four days of exploration ahead of me.
Food is good, place is big, only thing that's a constant disappointment is the service.

Cookies cookies cookies.  I've eaten food here.  But who remembers THAT.  I only remember the cookies.  Because they're so DAMN good.  I would give it 5 stars in an instant, if they weren't so damn expensive.  Almost $3 per cookie is RIDICULOUS!!!!!! And it really disgusts me that they charge such rip off prices for them.   I'll be if they lowered the prices on their cookies, people would buy so much more of them that they would make even more money.  Maybe not, they probably figure that they sell out of them at $3 each, so why lower it.  It's really sad though, when you think of it.  $3 cookies.  Imagine, 3 cookies costing you a ten spot!!

This rating is only for the coffee part of the store. I got a latte the first time I went there, and the barista was chatting with his coworker while he was making my drink. Then as his coworker was leaving to go home, the barista said to him, "Hey, look, I'm going to break your heart!" - meaning, the latte art heart he made on my drink which he messed up with crappy milk foam. Then he continues laughing and joking with his coworker - no "thank you" or anything to me, the customer.

Huge coffee shop, great coffees and teas, great baked goods (onsite baking), reasonable, and SF urban chic.  What's not to LOVE?!?  Quite a few haters on Yelp I see, so go to Starbucks!!!  GREAT casual coffee/breakfast/lunch joint.

Have never had a bad item here! All the day olds are delicious and half price. Can't beat the black and white cookie; that's my favorite! But all of their scones are amazing too. Basically, try everything - whatever looks or sounds good to you on a particular day.

I finally reached my breaking point.  My standing joke is that going to Specialty's in the morning adds a good 15 minutes to my commute.  I always order the same thing, iced tea with lemon.  Most of the time it doesn't come out with lemon, so they disappear in the back for a while to cut up what I would assume by the time it takes, are all the lemons for the day. Today, I ordered my usual iced tea.  10 minutes later, they gave me a hot tea, no lemon.  What part of iced tea with lemon don't they understand? Then they woke up and they gave me an iced tea, and guess what? No lemon.  They went to the back to cut up lemon...

This is a great chain restaurant where you want a nice place to sit, drink coffee and have some food. I've also ordered from Specialities online and its one of the most pleasant websites to work on. I ordered a complicated order to deliver to a office and each item was able to be uniquely customized with photos so I knew exactly what I was ordering. I recently got a chance to eat at the restaurant and it's just as pleasant in person. The only reason i give it 4/5 stars is their breakfast items lack a bit in creativity. It's just egg sandwiches with a variety of toppings, and they are a bit salty.

Ohhhh gawd!!! I just cant stand how good their egg breakfast sandwiches are!! Really good prices. And really efficient service! Everyone is always super nice and bubbly. I also like the self service machines to order our food, very convenient if theres a line. Plus i never realized how big this place was. Very nice outdoor seating area plus the ambiance is very tech and sophisticated.
I have previously enjoyed sandwiches and soups from this location. However, I've noticed that the quality of the food has slipped up during the busier times of day.

This Specialty's cafe recently reopened after remodeling. It now is associated with Peet's Coffee, which is good, but the prices have increased DRAMATICALLY. A muffin and a small coffe, which cost $4.47 before the remodeling, now cost $6.67! That's a 50 percent increase!
Very attentive, good quality of service, excellent food. Was awesome after a terrible experience across the street at Noah's. Thanks guys!

I love the Specialtys chain, I really do.  But at this particular store I had a kind of disappointing experience yesterday.  I ordered my food to go.  I got: two milk chocolate chip cookies, a large cobb salad, beef and blue sandwich, and a chicken cobb sandwich.  Ate the salad right after getting it and wanted to save the sandwich (cobb) to eat today.  Turns out I didn't get the right sandwich--they gave me a Waldorf chicken salad one instead.  No thank you :( So, I tried to call them right after discovering this but the phone just rang and rang.  Oh well...I could take my business to a dfferent branch!  Here's my favorite items on the menu:
This Specialty's deserves 5 stars for its:
Egg Veggie Sandwich was Awesome

The breakfast items are good and the cookies are great---when theyre not overcooked.  I do not like thier salads at all. I usually go in morning to pick up stuff for office mtgs.  The bald guy who works early in the morning during the week is a complete a-hole. Very rude & condescending. Seems resentful & was practically sneering at me because i didnt hear what he said & asked him to repeat it.  I have bad hearing & i was very nice about it. Im a morning person & was in a great mood until i went in there. I almost went str8 to the mngr. This guy was so nasty. Ugh....ill just get my meeting stuff across the street at Peets.

I've been going here from time to time ever since they opened across the street from my work.  They have a kiosk system to place your order which remembers your previous orders making it quick to reorder when you visit again. Don't use their kiosks to order! It fails to send the order to their cooks or it simply breaks down. Your order gets lost and they have no clue until you ask them. They should remove these since they have not worked reliably for over a year. Their food is nice but pricey and there are plenty of other options around.

Super fresh sandwiches, soups and salads. Not to mention that they have amazing desserts! I got the turkey cranberry sandwich and tomato bisque soup, which was fantastic! Their tomato soup was better than the tomato soup at the Melt. And my favorite Specialty's cookie is the black and white!
Just had the Chinese chicken salad. Good dressing but very little chicken and TONS of cabbage!  Disappointing.
Welcome to Specialty's Cafe, the only place on earth where they are sold out of butter croissants at 6 am.
Was looking for a place where I could get some programming done. Place has great coffee. Friendly baristas. Ample seating with plenty of wall sockets. Definitely adding it to my regular coffee shops.
The turkey cranberry with light mayo.  Do it.  I love the sprouts.

I was so excited to pick up some delicious, freshly baked chocolate chip cookies to bring home to my family. I don't get into the city very often but when I do for meetings and what not, if I'm passing by a Specialties I'll stop in. Today.... I think was my last time. I asked if they had semi-sweet chocolate chip left? Answer "no"... Ok, how about the milk chocolate chip? Answer "nope, don't have those either". They could tell I was disappointed but I was set on ordering some cookies so I chose a few other kinds that they boxed up for me. I then headed home guarding that box on BART and excited to share my surprise with everyone! After dinner I opened the box of cookies only to find they were hard as ROCKS and burned on the bottom. I took a bite into the Black & White cookie and it crumbled all over and tasted charred & burned. Same thing with the others- the peanut butter chocolate chip was almost black on the bottom.... I really couldn't believe it! Unfortunately, I ended up tossing them all out and I felt bad for have spent the money on old, stale & burnt cookies. It's too bad because I was a longtime fan.

Pros: Cookies are delicious,....their food is OK, but.... their cookies are delicious.... did I mention that their cookies are delicious?  They have a lot of space, about a 1/3 of the tables have outlets, but overall, it's a nice spot to read and do work.

Didn't come here for any sweet treats even though everyone I know raves about them. I'm more of a savoury eater. So at lunch in my new area I decided to check out their lunch offerings. The veggie sandwich caught my attention. After receiving my heavy sack I proceeded to open it and to my amazement I had a hefty delicious looking sandwich in front of me. This thing was filled to the gills with sprouts, cucumbers, tomatoes, mushrooms, pepperocini & avocado. My bread couldnt even handle it. After 1 bite it basically fell apart. I tried as hard as I could to avoid eating it as a salad but it wasn't pretty.
I go to Specialty's for the ahem..unhealthy...good day-old cookies.

I stop at this location once in a while. It's usually before the lunch rush and I am the only person in the place. Today I had to ask for someone to ring me up and bag me a muffin. The employee closest to the cash register did his best to ignore me until I spoke up.

Awesome sandwiches will not disappoint.  Warm cookies and coffee does my morning good.  Very reasonable price considering all you get.  Fluffy big sofa in back makes you feel like your eating in your own Family room.  Now only if they had a big screen tv.  That would make me put five stars.
Specialty's is ubiquitous in SF. It is fast, convenient, good food and has the best cookies. What's not to like?

Not a total fan of Specialty's in general but I do like this location.  I meet my friend here for weekday lunch sometimes and I love the row of  iPads in the back for personal ordering.  It's quick and easy, you pay for it right there with credit card, then pick up one of those buzzers which notifies you when your food is ready.
The quality of the cookies is pretty variable here. I wish it were more stable because its so rare that I am willing to add 500 calories to my day, that when I do, it better be a good cookie!!!

Very average sticky pecan bun - enough to satisfy a craving but nothing more to speak of. Even warmed, the pastry was slightly hard and dry, and the caramelized topping hardened too much when it cooled down. Great ambience though - free wifi and plenty of study spots on a weekday afternoon.
Seriously the BEST Croissants in SF! Make sure to get the Turkey & Cheese croissant! It's HUGE and worth the buck!  (see pics!)
Favorite place to get cookies!!
lack of choices in the area for lunch so i find myself eating here more than i care to...
This place can be a madhouse during lunch. Take advantage of ordering online, and just pick it up yourself. It'll save you a ton of time.

I WAS on a sugar fast until yesterday. After a work day that started at 7AM, the person who came after me brought in a half-eaten Fuji Apple Coffee Cake. It looked and smelled absolutely delicious. Was it just my starving brain craving some immediate satisfaction?
I show up just before 11am, the place is almost empty and no one in line.

This was once a place that slapped stellar coffee in the face by having Intelligentsia on deck but hastily made in batch thermoses seen in board room meetings. Then, all of a sudden... I notice more Intelligentsia branding than usual at this location, pop in & lo, they're doing pour overs, cold brew on deck, and whole bean bags -- roasted within the same week -- for sale. It's a sly move by Intelligentsia, and pointed as they intend to open a side project roastery in Potrero collaborating with Ecco. The service at this cafe was kind, and fielded all of my geeky questions. This is now in the Soma coffee walk rotation.

Sometimes I stop in here for a cookie break when I'm out walking after lunch.  I always ask for the warm cookies & they usually have some fresh from the oven.  There's nothing better than a buttery, sweet cookie treat from Specialty's!

I kind of wish I knew the name of the gentleman that helped me decide between the sticky bun and the peach coffee cake because his customer service was phenomenal. It's silly really, deciding from one good dessert from another, but I'm a firm believer in listening to the staff.
Magic door.

Such a bummer, the food is actually really great but I hate getting my order wrong twice. I'm always on the go so I forget to unwrap the sandwich to make sure my order is correct. The first time I walked 10 blocks to get back to work, opened up my sandwich to find it was a vegetarian sandwich when in fact I ordered the Turkey Apple Brie and Bacon. That was a HUGE disappointment and I didn't have the extra time to go back. The second time was today. I ordered The Club and kindly asked to swap out the wheat bread for ciabatta and even that was hard to follow. No ciabatta bread for me today.
I always order their white chocolate macadamia, peanut butter or snickerdoodle cookies!
Cookies. Yum.
Always got good vibes from this place and when i finally went in i was not disappointed. Great customer service. Great food.
yummy cookies !!! :)

This place is simply amazing! Although it is on the pricier side, you definitely get what you pay for because this food is QUALITY! Just walked in to get a sandwich and got a sandwich with a friend and we shared a cookie. The cookie was simply to die for, I don't think I've ever tasted a better cookie!

Yeah, this place is still awful. Just ordered catered lunch for my office. Came on time, which is great. However, when I opened up my giant turkey sandwich I discovered something so atrocious that I can barely speak of it... Okay well I'll tell you.
The breakfast sandwich and coffee were good, got the poppy seed bread. Quick service and plenty of room to sit down.

I've tried Specialty's for lunch 3 times and each time my experience has been worse.  I've just spent an hour checking out their corporate web-site, the Yelp reviews for this site, and composing this review as a service to anyone else thinking they were worth buying lunch from.
The baked good are always delicious however their coffee is terrible as is the service.

I walked in here after being treated like half a person at The Holding Company (2 Embarcadero Center).  While the bartender at THC seemed to hate everyone who wasn't a young man in a suit, this place welcomed me with open arms, and even gave me a free cookie.  While the patrons at THC were waiting thirty minutes for the cooks to put overpriced eggs on top of their overpriced bagels, Specialty's had my reasonably priced hot sandwich ready in about five minutes, and it was great!! The soups here are really well made too.   Not a lot of seating, which is why I didn't give them five stars, but the customer service is what will bring me back to this place.
This is my go-to lunch place because I can place my order online and receive a text when it's ready for pick-up.  Super easy and convenient.  Food is good, not amazing.

After waiting 25 minutes for a cup of tomato soup and a piece of bread, i finally approached the counter and asked them what was taking so long when the soup is already pre-made.  Turns out my order was just sitting on the counter for quite some time and they never called my name.  When i asked them to get me a new soup that was hot, the had run out of that flavor, so I had to stick with the cold soup.   When i got back to work and opned my soup, they had given me the wrong flavor to being with... very disappointed with my experience overall.  The wait is always too long for a cup of soup...
Pretty good breakfast though not spectacular beyond sweet pastries. Only bar seating available and no bathrooms but super friendly. Great intelligentsia coffee.

I'm so happy their coffee of choice is Intelligensia's.  The dark roast is much better than Starbucks which seems to be around every corner in the Financial District.  I liked the coffee cake as well.  Place is clean.  The uniformed staff are Friendly and speedy service.

this was my first and probably last visit to Specialtys. why?  the coffee was way too hot and i could actually taste the burned milk. my idea of a cinnamon swirl is a baked swirly thing with cinnamon and a bit of sugar frost thing on top. when i ordered it i assumed that i was getting the exact same thing i am used to, but instead i received a block covered in sugar frost or something similar, no swirl and hardly  can taste the cinnamon.

This Specialties is close to my office so I go to the Sansome store out of convenience.  I have ordered food at Specialty's locations all around the bay area.   However I am fed up with this place. First, the cashier served a line cutter before others.  I stayed cool. Then,  I ordered a cobb salad.  One of the kitchen people calls out the name of the person when an order is ready.  I waited 10 minutes before my name was called and was told by another that my salad had been sitting on the window for 5 minutes.  The inconsistency and lack of care in service has me irritated to the point that I am not coming back.  This place does not have someone at the window.  Other stores have a counter and a worker who deals with customers. Maybe they thought that service would make up for any shortcomings. The staff here just does not care and even if they do, they are not showing it or are not being shown or given oversight on how to do a good job. Look at the other comments for this place.   Management likely considered that the system used at this aging store does not work, but decided that the customers at this location would have to put up with the crap that the staff and poor design dishes. I am done with them.

I usually like to stop by here when I don't really have lunch. Their sandwiches are huge and well worth the big bucks. I don't come here too often, but when I do, I love their PBnJ Stuff. I like calling it the "Adult PB n J". Hah.
I had the chocolate chunk peanut butter cookies and...they were the best!  Probably the best cookies I have had in a very long time. Fresh, good ingredients, perfect texture, and loaded with flavor.
Had to repeat my very simple order three times.
Friendly, yummy, & delicious coffee. Just the way I like it.

I ordered a BLT. As I waited patiently for my food, there were several employees just standing around, making jokes. A dozen other people came thru, ordered food and left. As I was about to ask where my food was, someone came up to me and said it had been sitting on the counter on the other side of the store for a few minutes. My name was never called. Once I finally sat down to eat my BLT, I opened an egg sandwich.
What kind of BAKEry consistently runs out of BAKEd goods by 9:30am everyday? THIS ONE.
Everything is great here. Add their friendly customer service and you're set for breakfast, lunch and snacks. Even dinner, if you arrive before they close, and want a sandwich.

How I missed Specialty's...any of them.  You just can't beat their huge cinnamon rolls and ordering online service.  I ordered 20 of those cinnamon rolls for a Christmas Eve party I was going to.  When I picked them up they were super fresh, soft and gooey from all that icing slathering on top.  Who needs Cinnabon when you have Specialty's?  I find their bakery items consistent throughout each location I've been too.  Plus, I love it when I encounter friendly service.

Nice place to grab a quick breakfast. The roast veggie egg sandwich was a little too greasy and salty for my taste. The bread ended up all soggy. The muffins are also not good. They are dense, sorta dry and just don't seem all that fresh. Mind you this was at 8:00 am, they should have been fresh from the oven.
Staff here is always friendly and always willing to help me indulge in my sweets craving whenever I walk through the door.
it would be spectacular if the avocado i paid for actually came on my salad.
Great hot pastrami sandwich for lunch!  Great service, fresh food, and great atmosphere!  I will return to try more food on their menu!
I swear that my partner is taking me on a "FiDi" food tour of everywhere he goes to for breakfast, lunch and dinner, before we leave Downtown for the "rural" charms of Walnut Creek.

Excellent fast, high quality, place to get something to eat on the run.  Most noteworthy to me was their excellent oatmeal.  Many places i see have oatmeal on their menus but it is usually instant or warmed-over, quick-cooked, style.

Overpriced for what it is. Also took forever to get my food and there were only 3 people there at the time. Oh and completely skipped over me while I was waiting in line because a couple guys in suits were waiting behind me.

Thoroughly unimpressive. Had the "oven-roasted" turkey sandwich. Low quality, bland turkey on white bread. Not the most expensive place ($6.-- for a turkey sandwich), but that's about the best thing I can say about it.
The service here is so great. Every time we come in they greet us with a big smile. They  remade a salad to fit our needs and don't complain about it.
I consistently have good meals at Specialty's. They have very good salads, sandwiches and cookies.
Had quiche recently that was as the kids say exquisite...

they offer a handy service where they text you when your online order is ready. Problem is, about 1 out of 4 times they text you but the order in fact ISN'T ready.  Even if you have waited a few extra minutes before going to get it.

Cookies and coffee are great, but we tried ordering a sandwich and salad and for some reason they had a tough go of it with the salad.  First, the sandwich came out a few minutes after the order.  The salad did not follow. After 10 mins we asked the staff what was going on, they checked in with the back person in charge of salads, and told us it was coming soon.  It took another long 5 minutes.  And the salad sucked.  They gave us no dressing at all.  Not gonna be back anymore.
Closest place to my office to get donut holes! $2.20 for a dozen glazed donut holes.
A decent enough option for a banh mi, but doesn't hold a candle to its competitors in the TL. I think it's the bread -- they use more of a doughey, flaky, roll than a traditional french bread.
I like this place because it's so quick. The food is cheap (less than $5 for a bahn mi), and it's ready in 2 minutes, give or take 1 minute.
This is definitely an in and out type of place. You go in, grab a sandwich, and head back to the office. You can definitely eat there as well, but I wouldn't really expect much from here.

I got the #4 grilled pork sandwich, based on recommendations.  It was okay...  passable, though the quality of the grilled pork wasn't that great....  its not so much grilled as it is braised/stewed.  But as it turned out, that wasn't the problem with the sandwich, I found a really long strand of hair in my sandwich -seriously, GROSS...   I should have known better, and kept on walking to the downtown banh mi store.

I ordered the Combination sandwich, a croissant, a latte, and a regular coffee. Waiter service was really bad. Paid $20 but only gave me about a dollar back. I asked her for the rest of my change cause i know it wouldnt cost that much. The cashier gave me about 7 dollars back and didnt apologize or see this as a mistake. Coffee was really bland. Done with this place, not coming back
My coworker has raved about the inexpensive sandwiches here for months, so I gave in and tried it. I was pleasantly surprised.
Pretty good Banh Mi sandwiches- and for a good price! I love Vietnamese food so this is a solid joint for a chick like me who works downtown and needs some cheap eats for the lunch break...

The #4 grilled pork is the best Vietnamese sandwich I think I have ever had. I used to go two or three times a week for a couple semesters when I took classes at the Chinatown city college campus and I seriously never got sick of it. The bread isn't too hard, the meat is tender and packed with flavor, and the veggies are fresh. Everytime I went you hear person after person order a #4, it's so good!!!
Came here for the Vietnamese coffee.. It's pre made mixed with syrup.    I could have gone to Starbucks for all of that.
Five dollar sandwich
I don't care for the variety of coffee here. Very commercial and plain. Latte was a two star affair. Staff was ok.

I found Latte Express by accident when I was looking for a coffee shop. With a name like that I kind of expected to find, well, a latte. But instead I found what would soon become one of my go-to lunch options.

Excellent grilled pork banh mi. Lots of veggies and meat. Vietnamese coffee was premade and tasted odd. The combo was under $8. Not a bad deal. Will be back for another sandwich. Also the fresh spring rolls looked good. Great find tasty items all under $5 bucks.

so looking forward to the sour sweet crispy veggies on top of the juicy pork.  did not get that.  for $4.50 before taxes...not much meat, it's dry (more like jerky) and the veggies...fresh but not sour or sweet. the ladies were nice and price is ok, but disappointed.
#11 . that is all.
I generally come here around 4:30 or 5:00 to grab a couple banh mi for dinner when we are working late. It's sad to say that I hear and see them just microwave the meats and dump it in the sandwich.

It's decent for a quick banh mi sandwich, although I don't agree with their prices. Maybe I'm used to spots in the East Bay that only charge $3-$4 for a viet sando. Service is fast but they need to smile more and at least pretend they like what they're doing. Once you order and pay the lady yells, "next!" like a nazi! They have some good pre-made spring rolls for the grab-and-go type person also.
The meat is good, but the bread can be better. Not crunchy enough. After awhile the bbq pork got pretty salty.

Conveniently located on the edge of Chinatown and the Financial District, Latte Express is a good place to go for a cheap but satisfying lunch. I've definitely had better banh mi, but for less than $5, it'll do! I recommend the grilled pork because the meat is really flavorful and contrasts perfectly with the pickled vegetables and jalapenos. Bread is such a crucial part of a sandwich for me, and I wish their baguette had more crunch and chewiness. It could have been toasted more and it didn't taste all that fresh. Overall, not a bad sandwich though!

The number four is great and  the bread is better than I thought it would be! There was not a huge rush of people when I went (noon on a Thursday)- enough foot traffic, but no line and all the bar stools and single table were open.
A nice toasty #4 grilled pork for under $5 was pretty good.  Id come back and try the #7 combo.  Being able to grab a seat during lunch was awesome.
One of the best grilled pork Bahn Mi sandwiches I've had. And it is under $5!  They have plenty of options including vegetarian.

I happened to be temping nearby and was famished, so I stopped in for a sandwich. I'm used to cheap banh mi -- like around $3 - $3.50. Latte Express adds up to less than $5 a sandwich - which is pricey for banh mi. However, the bread is nicely toasted, they give a decent amount of meat. 2nd time there for lunch in 3 days.. I tried both the combo and ham+pate. The ingredients seem fresh. Tastes good. They take card for anything over $5. I'm too lazy to walk up to Little Paris, so this will have to do for now. I'm going to have to give the Vietnamese Iced Coffee a go -- if it's good.. I'll bump this up to 4 stars. For now it's good.
Delicious and cheap, what more can you ask for?
No more chai lattes.

Really enjoyed and great price.  I like their new location (at least since 2005) which has more room than I recall at the other spot.  Very fresh bread (I saw the bread delivery bags from "Bakers of Paris" in the trash).  Nice amount.  Not as good as the Nom Nom truck that disappeared a few months ago, but almost as good and much better price and a place to sit.
A small sandwich, coffee, pastry shop on Kearny in between the Financial District and Chinatown.
A solid 4 star spot.
Vietnamese sandwiches!
there are a lot of vietnamese places in the city run by chinese ppl and they suck hardcore. but this is really good. they are actually viet. reminds me of socal
Tasty #4

I come here more than I like to admit!! Pretty much every time I go for the spring rolls. They are the perfect size for lunch, super fresh, and come with peanut sauce. The employees here are also really friendly. Overall I am a big fan of Latte Express - 5 stars!

Yes! Finally, I had a great authentic vietnamese sandwich in the FiDi. The banh mi Ham and Pate here is excellent, and here's why. The ingredients are layered in a way that really brings out all of the flavors. The ham is thinly sliced, and the pate brings the sandwich to a whole new level. The veggies are pickled just right--they're not overpoweringly sour. Lastly, and most importantly, the bread is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

It is my firm belief that Vietnamese sandwiches (banh mi's) shouldn't be $10, no sir!  Latte Express delivers on a variety of fresh combos from BBQ to chicken to pate. They prepare it fresh when ordered and can easily adjust the spice level to your taste.

Since the last review, I was able to speak to the manager...and be served by the same individual. It possibly was a misunderstanding on one of us, or both of us; nevertheless, I want to bump up the points on this place, since speaking with the manager, I have been satisfied with the customer service...
Bahn Mi here is great, wish it had the special sauce but oh well.
Sucks...I used to really like this place but I can't eat here anymore...let's just say there is a cleanliness issue here...plus the staff are just plain out rude.
Big fan of this place, found it by accident walking by and had to get food to take back to work.

I work in Chinatown, and I haven't had a vietnamese sandwich in maybe a year because Little Paris on Stockton closed down related to the MUNI constructions.  (I'm picky about the authenticity of my Vietnamese food.)

It's like clockwork, we're always trying to find a place to eat for lunch. I work on Howard and Spear and never seem to be satisfied with what's offered in the area. I've always passed this joint but never really stopped in, as I've always thought it was a sandwich joint. My coworker mentioned there were some Asian options and I was definitely curious to see what kind of options were available.

This is a five minute walk from my work place and I enjoy going there for lunch especially when I am craving for some dim sum! The price is a ok but the food taste really yummy! It's a food bar and you get to pick what you want, my takeout usually comes out to be around $7-9. No parking for sure...
Very good here and they open early. The staffs are very friendly. The health score is why one star is missing.

Food is decent tasting. Like all Chinese food, quite greasy. It's a food bar so you pick what you want to eat or you may order as well. The thing I don't like is its 5.95 per lb and most of the food have greasy thick sauces.

I just found a piece of metal wire in my food during breakfast (eggs),  had I not found it in time it is likely I would have eaten it and been forced to go to the hospital. Eating here is taking a big risk as the food prep and handling is not done with much care. When I returned the food I was given a refund but not much concern was expressed about the rest of the eggs that were still out.
Love this place! They sell cronuts :)
Very convenient deli serving pay by the pound Chinese dish and salad. Collection of sodas are good too. The eat-in space is wide and clean. Wanna go again soon.
I know this place is economical, but their turkey sandwiches are just....gross

Fairly good Asian food, with a surprisingly large selection. Considering where it's located, I would've expected a more "food-court" selection, but was wrong. It's also very convenient, which is the other big thing it has going for it. It's only a couple blocks from the muni, and right in the middle of the financial district!
This place has a big variety, and i like that they sell cronuts, thats pretty cool.  It's hard to come out of here with less than a pound of food however.
Convenient spot, as always, coming from Lee's.

I would go here for drinks and in desperation only.  Don't get me wrong, I have been to plenty of Lee's lunches when I first started working in the Financial District as a recent college grad.  The cheap sandwiches were a must and fit my budget.  These days I am doing a bit better so I normally skip this place, although I do like that they have added quite a bit of hot cooked food.
They have croNOTs here. Not to be confused with the trademarked Cronuts of NYC. They are filled with custard and will run you $2.50.

I didn't actually eat at this location.  I only came here to buy cronuts as they're sold here.  I came in early in the morning so the place seemed clean.  The lady behind the cash register was friendly.  I like that there's a seating area and huge salad bar.  They also have a counter for sandwiches and noodle soup!

Lee's has many locations.  My previous quick dependable spot on Fremont has been demolished and now I've found the "super" Lee's at 170 Spear Street (with seating!).  Huge salad bar, soup bar, and (of course) sandwiches.  I stick with the sandwiches which have consistently generous portions.  Hardworking staff, good quality food, prepared quickly. They know their customers are in a rush at lunchtime and make sure the lines move quickly.

One of the crazy efficient (one might even say machine-like) women behind the counter who bags, takes my credit card, and sends me on my way in 3.5 seconds stopped to give a little boy a free cookie today.
Lee's Deli is great and this location is among the better ones.

I was really disappointed in the price and quality of food. I was really excited to try their asian cuisine which has a lot of variety. I filled my carton about half full, everything is weighed to determine the price so I figured I wouldn't have to pay too much. But when I went to pay, my meal was $11. I was shocked. For that price I could get twice as much food from pretty much any other chinese restaurant in the city. The quality of the food was also dismal. I mean, you can't really have high expectations for food thats been sitting around all day, but what I had was really gross. For the same price I could have gone down the street to loving hut, and actually felt full and satiated. After sitting down, I heard this other guy go up to pay and he actually had the courage to say something to the cashier about how ridiculously expensive his meal was.
This place is far overdue for an updated review. The last couple of times I have eaten at Lee's, I have been very unhappy for a couple key reasons.
Noodle Soup Bar!  EEEEEEE!
I got food poisoning. Bad. I'm not totally sure why but it might be related to leaving greens and food (including seafood and meat) out at room temperature all day. Damn.

for food quality, i'd give lee's 3 stars, but for value i have to bump it down to two.  i got the hot food bar for lunch and it was so expensive!  for decent food, it should not cost this much.  ridiculous.

You're an aspiring screenwriter except you lack talent, vision and originality. You're in a bit of a rut ever since your last screenplay, "Grapes of Math," a harrowing tale set during the Great Depression which focuses on the Escalantes, a poor family of math teachers driven from their Los Angeles home by drought, economic hardship, and changes in financial and mathematical equations who help Okies learn how to pass Advanced Placement classes in Calculus, was soundly rejected by your script agent.
This is the best Lee's Deli in the Fidi, I've been told.

I had $1.32 worth of food...small salad. They tried to charge me 2.00 and glossed over the fact my food was much less. I called them out on it, and said 2.00 is their minimum.  Good variety of food, but I don't like being over-charged and them not being honest about it. I wont be back.
I got the chow mien and shrimp dumplings amongst some other sides and now an hour later I feel like my body wants this food out of my body asap and I can't focus on anything else except for the pain.

Their sandwiches are ok but their buffet food is so packed with MSG I lost feeling in my left leg. The idea of Lee's Deli is fabulous, all you can eat anything, but in this case I'd choose quality over quantity. You want to meet your grandkids? Don't eat at Lee's.

I'm a sucker for this place... value, value, value. That's the thrifty Chinese side of me when I want to eat here. They offer a wide variety of hot food and salad setup buffet style. They charge by weight so avoid getting a ton of rice and noodles. Everything is generally fresh when I'm there either around 9AM or 11:30AM. After 2PM, you get leftovers.

I came here for lunch about a month ago and I kick myself for not going back already! This place has a variety of entrees and a stocked deli! I had brown fried rice, salt and pepper fish (surprisingly not sold in a lot of Asian food places) and a few dumplings. Since they charge per pound, you might want to take a lap before loading your to-go box! You might end up with more then you can actually eat in a sitting. The pricing is decent though, I believe I paid around $8 for my food. I honestly didn't get that much but next time I'll have to remember what my lunch weighs and the price point.
There a lot of horrible places to get "food" like products in the city, this just happens to be a really dirty one.
I go here often for lunch. It is right by my office. They are very affordable and the service is lovely. They ladies there know my order and always are generous with the sandwich toppings.
**BACON, BACON, BACON, BACON, BACON, BACON**

I've been hittin this joint for YEARS, food quality is always above level,I work across the street so  the workers in the morning know my schedule, and they know exactly what and how I like it- & I love the customer service- Nice and FAST- and honestly.. I never get sick of it cuz they have just soo much to choose from-This is also the PERFECT SPOT to take friends to grab a bite-at least everyone can choose whatever there hearts desire here- Its like a mini food court but all in ONE-This place is a ONE STOP SHOP for breakfast. or Lunch- energy drinks, candy bars, , brownies, cookies,  MONSTEROUS HOT PASTRAMI  sandwiches, Won-ton soup, Salad Bar, Sushi, Burgers, dim sum.. I could go On and On and On.. The best part.. you can mix you're own stuff up- My regular morning breakfast? sliced pita, with hummus, tuna, sprinkled parmasean cheese and a slice of bacon, with a couple of strawberries, pineapples ... YUM.. so ya if you're twisted like me and like mixing it up a bit, or even if you're into the Normal stuff- this is the place to get it-

Lee's was a pit stop while I was waiting for a bus. I paid by the ounce for the buffet, which was massively salty. The picture that I uploaded cost me $11. That little plate cost eleven bucks? Seems like a rip off, even for the city. I know that meals in the Financial District are expensive, but at least it could have been loaded with something else than MSG and sodium. I won't return when back in the Bay Area.

Lee's is a perfect spot for those who want basics for cheap. They've got a variety of breakfast and lunch sandwiches, a hot bar, a ramen bar, and yummy deserts such as rice krispie treats with m&ms on top, snickerdoodle cookies, and yummy brownies. For cheap! The staff is also very friendly and very fast.

Quite possibly the best dining option along the embarcadero financial district border. I always go for the fresh broccoli (best in the game), mushrooms, and teriyaki chicken. But there is something for everyone. Make sure to check out the new inside seating.

Good bye, Lee's, my most frequented near-work breakfast/lunch spot. I am moving and I shall miss you, so I figured I owed you a yelp-out. I shall miss your hot and cold salad bar. I will miss your eggs in the morning. I won't miss your giant selection of fried, unhealthy chinese food that I pretty much never ate, but I will miss your generous offerings of healthier fare. Your made-to-order sandwiches were also the bomb-dig. I will miss the excellent selection in your beverage fridge. Most of all, I will miss Sharon, the friendly, fleet-fingered cashier. Nobody can mow down a long line of customers like she can.
I stop by here 3x a week for lunch. It's a Chinese operated deli/ salad bar/ chinese restaurant, sandwich shop, and noodle soup place.
I'm surrounded by Lee's Delis at work, so it's inevitable that I'd eventually get something to eat from one of them. I've only had the wonton soup, so my review is based on that only.
One of my default places to go to lunch. In short: cheap (for FiDi), fast, and moderate food.

Eddies is a great bar. Good TV, decent drinks, awesome burgers, super chill space. But anyone who gives this place more than 3 stars is not a regular. I'm convinced that the service here gets worse the more you frequent. It feels like pulling teeth to get an order right or to get anyone's attention. I shouldn't have to flirt with the waitresses to get the same attention you would otherwise get at a normal bar with functional servers. Charging me for food that never came is not right. Blaming me for not bringing it up is not right - if you charge for food that never came it's not that you forgot - you just fucked up. Eddies is an easy bar to get right, but hiring incompetently is the fastest way to destroy that success.
This is an awesome lunch spot... on Mondays.
The Thinking Man's Hooters..

Not too bad. Got a drink and the tots w cheese and bacon. They were really good. The decor was pretty nice, huge chandeliers. I went post NLCS game on Thursday night, it was one of the only bars that had some space to be able to get in.
My reoccurring thought: "This HAS to be the  cooks first night on the job!?"

I've been to Capt Eddie's in the past for drinks after work functions. It's cool I suppose. There used to be old school Tiffany chandeliers but they were taken out and are presumably in a museum now since they were too expensive to be in a borderline dive bar.

This is the worst bar I've been to. My friends and I wanted to grab a drink after dinner and decided to stop by here. The waitress took our drink orders: Moscow mule, old fashion and peach iced teas. They came out pretty quick, but when we took a sip...it tasted like there was NO ALCOHOL! We tried to let the waitress know and she was very rude. She asked if we just wanted the check. Never going here again!
Eddie's is a convenient place to come watch sports games or do Happy Hour after work in the FiDi area. Delicious food, strong drinks, and lively atmosphere...what's more to ask for?
Looking for your next happy hour spot? Try this place! Loads of TVs for all your sporting needs. You can also ask nicely for another channel and they are always willing to change it for you.

In general, I like this place and I would give it 3 stars.  I had an event there two months ago which I put on my credit card for work and have either called or gone in to get my receipt once a week since the event.  I still don't have it and they continue to say we know and will get it to you.  For business purposes I can't wait two months to get a receipt and will no longer have events here.

I went for lunch here on Monday and made an astonishing discovery -- actual fresh handmade turkey burgers!! I've been looking high and low to find fresh turkey burgers in this utopia of healthy and active living aka San Francisco but have failed miserably. Now at least I've found a good enough substitute for my time consuming turkey burgers and it wasn't half bad either.

My group of coworkers came here from another bar because they had food.  Unknown to us, they still were completely full at 7:30pm on a weeknight!  We waited a while and the staff there were trying to seat our group of 10 but since it was open seating, there's really nothing more we can do except wait and take a table whenever people leave.

Shell of what this place once was.  Gone are the trains,  Tiffany lamps and all but 2 motorcycles.  Raw bar is gone.  Crowd is young hipsters looking for the next hookup,  paying far too much for booze and oblivious to what history the ghosts tell here...
Had a blast last night at the bar with Panda.  The beer was cold, and she's impossibly beautiful.

Came in Monday with a coworker to try out the place since we saw the burger and fries deal for $5.95. There was a pretty large crowd here for lunch (maybe in part because of the special, lots of people had burgers).

If you want to grab a few cocktails and munchies, this is a good place - if you want to watch a game, might not be the best place - it can be a bit loud, which I do not mind - the bigger issue is that they do not have enough TV's or places to sit without "blind spots." The two times I went here to watch a game was disappointing - both times I was seated by the hostess right in front of a pillar - blocking over 70% of the view. When asked to be moved, she said it was not possible. So unless it is a social happy hour, will not go here again to watch a game with buddies.
Tiny wings. $1 on WW

After a couple of drinks at Sutter Station, my friend recommended this place. We came in and sat at the communal table. While I went to the bathroom, my friend went and ordered us both their Moscow Mule and Chicken Wings. The Moscow Mules were just okay. The chicken wings were pretty good. While there, we also ordered the Fries with Bechamel, Bacon, and Jack Cheese. I pretty much devoured that thing. They were pretty good. I had also ordered the Bulleit Rye Regiment and Cucumber Gimlet. I thought those tasted better than the Moscow Mule. On another note, they were playing some 80s music in the background. Always a good thing in my book.
#Review: #DARLINGSOCIETYAPPROVED
Don't let the decor fool you, this page has a long history.  Ask the staff....interesting story.  Gives the place some character - a must have for a good watering hole.

Come here every so often after work for a quick cocktail or two, Staff is really friendly and outgoing. Your cocktail will never be short on the amount of liquor it has in it which is perfect cause thats just how i like mine. They always have a ton of sports on all of there TVs which is nice because usually by the time i get home i miss all of the east coast games. Having a 90 inch monitor also helps when wanting to make sure you catch all of the sports action. Throughout the week they have different specials so if i'm hungry and don't have any plans for dinner i grab a bite to eat here and it seems pretty reasonable priced considering we are in the financial district of SF. The sweet potato fries are pretty much a must each time i'm here. The place did a complete 180 from how it was prior to the new ownership as it doesn't seem like a horder is living in it. There are still a couple of old school bikes hanging on the walls which are pretty cool. If you are looking for a fine dining experience this isn't necessarily the spot for you but if you have had a long day and want to unwind over a cocktail while catching some sports this is your spot. The fact that the female staff isn't awful on the eyes doesn't hurt either.

So long and thanks for all the saliva! This place leaves a lot to be desired. Typical overpriced barfood and fufutails in the FiDi. The wore out fake asian bartender icognito "Panda C" on the receipt decided to antagonize me during my meal about the size of their 10oz Lagunitas glass which I posted a tip about today right as I was sitting there and using my Yelp name!

I was in SF for the day and walked from restaurant to restaurant until we found one without a line out the door. That's usually a bad sign but we were happy to just sit down, have immediate great service, and a pretty tasty meal. Its not like the place was empty, they had a good crowd but the open bar table that we could just sit right down at was like an oasis. Within seconds we were greeted by the bartender who got us drinks quick and kept checking up on us throughout the meal.
Excellent veggie burger. The fries are generous for 1 person. The decor is fun with old school bikes! I found my favorite veggie burger place in SOMA!
$5.95 burger and sweet potato fries on Monday night? Yes sir.

Definitely come eat here! The food here is delicious. The menu items are rotated periodically and the selection is really good. A favorite of mine over the summer were the fried green tomatoes - the perfect appetizer/snack bite while enjoying a drink or two with friends.
Average sound level was 97 dB (1 hour safe exposure w/out hearing protection).

Rickenbacker's is a 3 star place, but they get an extra star for being downstairs from the office. They have the usual middle of the road beers and common fried bar appetizers and burgers. They do do them well but nothing amazing. Ole reliable.
Eat here and you will not regret it!

We walked in for a team building event kind of at random. We were pleasantly surprised by the layout and atmosphere of the place. We were even more amazed that we came in on "one for two Tuesdays" so we were pretty happy. For appetizers, the wings, nachos, and fried green tomatoes were amazing.

Came after work, good for a larger group but a little noisy to have a conversation (even at a table).  Drinks were good (pretty standard).  I was a little disappointed with the small bite veggie options (only fries).  Its good to grab a quick drink and sit outside before headed home, but not really a destination.

Not bad for after work happy hour joint or to watch sports if you need a place in SOMA. However, the service is slow and the burgers were lackluster, at best! It can get pretty loud if you're coming here for a business lunch.

They were playing golf on the large screen, but they were playing 80s music on the music system, so I was torn. I miss the old place with the bikes hanging dangerously in my face. I like the Liberace chandeliers, but it doesn't have character it used to have.

Really torn between this place...  When I first came here after they renovated the place, our waitress was extremely nice and even gave our table truffle oil french fries on the house, which by the way tasted simply AMAZINGGGGG!!!  Defintely a must order if you stop by.
I sat at the bar with some co-workers one recent evening for some bar food and beers.  Here's what I liked:
It is not often that I choose to write reviews, but the startling change in quality in this once-great place has caused me to write this review.

Wandered in randomly one night to watch the Warriors game when their ginormous televisions lured us in. Pleasantly surprised by the full bar, beers on tap, and selection of small bites, i made a mental note to return. Apparently used to be some dive biker bar but now has been classily remodeled, complete with giant green crystal chandeliers.
I actually quite liked it. There's nothing like it in the FiDi - casual mid-range sit-down lunch. Some basic and some semi-creative options. Booths.

As an Air Force officer, I was looking forward to seeing some type of Air Force memorabilia here since I learned about Rickenbacker during my many visits to Maxwell Air Force Base, the Air Force's center for military education. Rickenbacker is one of the US's most decorated fighter pilots and yet I walk into this bar and only see Indian Motorcycles. I had to kind of scratch my head as I still don't quite know the connection. I mean, as an avid motorcycle rider, the Indians on display are pretty sweet, but I'd rather focus the heritage on the store's namesake to his real legacy.

Very disappointed. Went in at 3 with potential clients. Asked if they were open and told yes but only at the bar. Sat, got drinks, then asked for a menu. Only then were we told there was no food until 4. AFTER we sat and got drinks, really? We waited until 4 and actually had to ask for menus.
Bad crepes bad selection of premade orders. They won't let u create your own with the ingredients you want. They are not portable and are hard to eat.
(3.75) ~ Good overall "Crepe Wraps", that can be eaten on the go...
Pretty bad egg sandwiches. Totally undercooked egg and lacking of flavor.
Coffee is Great!  But maybe I have unrealistic expectations for their crepes, which didn't live up to the expectations.

I have really wanted to like this place since it's convenient and I love crepes.  Unfortunately some of these crepes are lacking in flavor even though the ingredients are bold and should go really well in theory.  Also, they are served like an icecream "cone" which causes all of the ingredients to fall to the bottom and by the time you get there you're full of tasteless crepe bread.  Since I'm not in love with the crepes I got a salad at one point (again, convenience is my downfall) - but even the salad was just so-so.  Limp letuce, the chicken tasted like refrigerator and chunks of dressing.  I hate paying an arm and a leg at Max's yet  I also don't want to pay for mediocrity either.  Looks like I'll have to leave the building for lunch for now.  Silver lining is that it's sunny out these days so I don't mind a bit.
Good Crepes on the Go, with friendly service and they use buckwheat the healthier version. No complaints here.
decent enough lunch salad, ees seem to be conscientious. No hipsters in line - that's a very good sign.
Had the breakfast crepe this morning, it was sooooo good. Cant wait to try a sweet one next time... mmm nutella!! And the "Elvis" sounds quite intriguing :)

Saint Germain did such a wonderful job catering my office party.  They not only provided sweet and savory crepes, but also an omelet bar, which was a total hit.   My employees raved about the nutella and strawberry crepe.  It was the best-catered event that I have ever thrown for my office party.

Love this place! I go here almost every day for coffee and at least once a week for an amazing crepe. The people who work here are sooo nice and unentitled. I really love giving this place business and they are so nice about adding/subtracting ingredients you want in your crepe. I also love that the crepes are gluten free buckwheat and ingredients seem high quality.

I was having mad cravings for a crepe after returning from 2 weeks in Asia.  Since I was waking up in the super early am, I figured I'd grab a crepe on my way into the office.  I arrived at Montgomery BART station about 6ish.
Tired of the same ol' downtown sandwich or burrito joint for lunch?

In my opinion it was a bit pricey for what I got. I paid almost $10 for a crepe that was cooked too long (too much of a crunch than I like, almost burnt). I got the glutten-free Smoked Turkey, Cheddar, Caramelized Onion, Crème Fraîche, Sautéed Mushroom, but asked for additional mushrooms instead of the turkey. It's in a convenient location, inside the BoA building though.
Last time.
Does not have gluten free crepes like their food truck does :-(

Creperie St Germain is probably the most convenient place to get breakfast if you're working in finance in the bank of america building. This place is relatively new, and makes some pretty delicious crepes, both savory and sweet. The reason I rank this 4 star is because even though its good, places such as crepevine make their crepes much better. In reality, crepes are pretty easy to make minus the consistency of the batter. I mean, which competent person cant dump strawberry, banana and powdered sugar onto a crepe and fold it?? That's why this place, compared to better crepe places isn't as good...the consistency of the crepe is solid, but not amazing. Don't get me wrong though, this place is still delicious!
Had to stop by BofA & thought hmm, a crepe would be good right about now & the line is small so must be destiny
Two and a half stars...

Went to give this place a try with a simple strawberry crepe and it was disappointing. The crepe was way too thick so instead of tasting a thin and crunchy layer of crepe, it tasted like layers of flat bread. The filling was disappointing as well. I know what to expect for $5 but nothing but strawberry jam, not even a thin slice of the real fruit? When I consume it 5 minutes later after getting up to my floor, the jam all sat at the bottom. The flavor was so concentrated at the bottom that I had to throw it away.

I went here for lunch because we wanted something quick to eat. I ordered the honey, banana and almond crepe. The batter was not bad but overall the crepe was not that great. There were barely any bananas...The savory crepes looked a lot better. I would probably give this place another chance and order their more popular items.
Its good, great for the location. Better than than most things in the area. Its SUPER convient. I will be back and I hope it holds on. Great Location.
Hi fellow Yelpers-

Figured I'd tried one of their crepes for breakfast the other day.  I ordered the Crepe Trois Fromages which translates, for those of you that missed 7th grade French, to 3 cheese crepe, with the 3 chosen cheese being Emmental, Camembert, and Blue Cheese.   The crepe was quite tasty though I personally could have used a little bit more blue cheese, especially at $8 the crepe which makes for a pretty pricey breakfast.
Had the ratatouille crepe with a surprisingly hearty side baby spinach salad. I had no idea fast food could be this good! Also, they're open until 5pm--a rarity in FiDi!

I like this place because of the environment! It's great for group lunches because it's quiet enough to hear someone across the table but loud enough to make it feel like an authentic Mexican restaurant!

Company catered lunch from Mercedes. I'm generally pretty indifferent to Mexican food and don't usually enjoy it that much because it makes me feel heavy and unhealthy, but the options we catered weren't too bad. The food tasted like pretty generic Mexican food and wasn't particularly memorable, but still a decent catering option. I wasn't impressed nearly enough to go to the restaurant itself to eat though.

I absolutely have a love affair with the staff at Mercedes. . . Been coming here for many years, and the same people have been here the entire time. They always greet everyone with a sincere smile and a "Hi, how are you!" . . . and then as I pass through the restaurant to be seated, any one of the other staff members will make the effort to grab me to say "Hello", or come to the table to remind me that they are glad to see me. And, no, I am not necessarily a regular here. They are just that way with everyone (I watch!).
Sitting outside is wonderful. The staff is very friendly and food is good and reasonably priced. Not much to complain about.

Went to Mercedes with my co-worker and we got in and out fairly quickly during a busy lunch rush. Certainly beat standing in long lines to pick up food in eateries close by. Decent Mexican food in a convenient location near my office. They have a variety of food to choose from. Tacos were tasty. I think they are open during happy hour so I'll have to try their margaritas next time.

Meh - that describes my feelings pretty well. It's a nice restaurant, sure. But is it quality? Not by my standards. Yes, there is complimentary chips and salsa, but this should be a given at Mexican restaurants! I didn't think the salsas were that great, though the chips were good!

We accidentally forgot to order 1 burrito with our to go order over the phone. When we got there to pick it up, we asked if we could order it then. They said "no". WTH???? are you kidding me? What kind of service is that? They said they were too busy to make 1 burrito for us. That must be the worst customer service ever. I wish I could give them a negative star. Needless to say, I won't be going back.

It is okay if you are stuck in the fidi, have a large party, and want a sit down place for mexican food, but I am underwhelmed by the pricey place. I'd much rather go to a truck and sit on a park bench. Their carnitas lacked distinction and far from the treatment a place in the Mission would give it. Asada is good. Fish dishes are okay.
LOVE! Some of the best service I've ever had. Yes it's a small place but I've been there 20 times bc the food is good and the service great.
Great vibe, relaxed, friendly. Good outside option. Price is right. Owner -operator. NOT CORPORATE!!  Food was just what we were looking for. We'll be back
YUM YUM YUM! AND FREE CHIPS IS AUTOMATICALLY A 4 STAR!

Came here for lunch with my coworkers. There were about 10 of us, and I'm pretty surprised that we got a table rather quickly. Service was prompt and friendly. The Giants game was casting live on the TV and I was tempted to order the giants burrito which was their special, but went with their fish tacos instead.

I called to put in an order last week, the lady that answered the phone to take my order had an attitude out of this world. I doubt that I will be picking up an order from that restaurant again!!! She gave me major ATTITUDE because I called during lunch hour, which is so UNPROFESSIONAL. The food was not that good anyways!!! VERY RUDE!!!

OMG!  I totally loved this place!  I found it on Yelp, of course!  Thank you Yelp!  I had lunch here with my very good friend, Linda the Great.  How great is she?  She's so great, she makes Alexander the Great, look like Alexander the Wuss!  I loved how the restaurant was decorated.  There was a picture of Frida in the woman's bathroom!   We had guacamole.  Delish!  I had a cheese enchilada with rice and beans and her Greatness had a cheese enchilada , beef tostada and a green salad(in place of rice and beans). Tina was our wonderful server.  All the food tasted very fresh and flavorful!  BTW, I'm dating a hot Spanish guy and I told him where I was eating.  He said that his mother's name is Mercedes, and she drives a Mercedes!
Good for lunch, very fast service. Fab chips and salsa!

There is absolutely no better place to spend a lunch hour in the Financial District than Mercedes.  The food is outstanding, and the staff is even better.  Sam the bartender  makes the best margarita in the City, and the owner Kate and the rest of the staff always make you feel so welcome.  Get there early and sit at the bar before it fills up!
I was pleasantly surprised by the enchiladas I had here at lunch today. The price was right and the food was quality. I will be back to try their margs soon!

Big, cheap, delicious burritos! Management and staff were kind, service was fast, and they sat me down with a huge bowl of tortilla chips (with two salsas) as soon as I came in. Very positive experience, and I'll definitely be coming back.
I walked in with the GoDish deal of the day, and was asked for a payment method - "cash or card". I had a card and received the following response from the individual at the bar "uuuuggghhh."
Great location and good food.  This place gets busy for lunch and is small inside so expect a wait at peak times.

I like coming here as a workday escape.  Healthy?  Not really.  Good marts and service, yes!  Everyone here is friendly and accommodating.  The food is good (not great) but for a sit-down Mexican place in the Fi-Di you almost can't beat it.  I just wish they were open for happy hours!

We went here during my girlfriend's birthday.  The chips and salsa was fresh made as I liked the green salsa.  I had the Salmon tacos which were nice and fresh with the black beans and rice.  The black beans were a little dry though.  My girlfriend got the flan for dessert for her being it is her birthday.  The prices were right and reasonable as the fish was fresh.  The service was very good as they made sure the chips were filled and asked if everything was okay. Would recommend
got a steak burrito through the GoDish app for only $5! very awesome deal.  service was extremely nice and the burrito was moist and meaty! i hope i can catch another deal tomorrow.
So I got really excited because I pass by this place all the time. I heard good things about it and I had to try!
Good People.  Good Food.  Good thing it's around the corner.  Very happy to be able to call in.

Wanted to get a quick bite to eat.  And if you work in SF and own an iPhone, it's a must to download "GO DISH" this app is freshly new on the market, but gives you up to 50% off on good eats in SF.  This placing being one of them.. a grilled chicken grande burrito for half the price! AWESOME DEAL, and pretty good.

No, just no.  I ordered tamales and received a large plate of refried bean-colored liquid and broken up masa.  Also, the back area really needs to be redone.  Sitting at that long table in the back gave me a dark, damp and dirty feeling, similar to seeing what a nightclub actually looks like in daylight.

We hosted a rehearsal dinner for 100 people at Mercedes Hair of the Dog Salon last Friday evening. The staff & in particular Kate Riley were a delight to work with and made the planning for this event very easy. All the guests have raved about the delicious taco/fajita bars as well as the fabulous Margaritas! Excellent place for a party!
The appeal of Mercedes' might exactly be in its name - it is a place for hair of the dog lunch in the middle of the FiDi.

Using Yelp as my GPS (grub positioning system), I found this place upon searching for nearby Mexican food. The ratings weren't as high as other places, but my heels had a .1 mile limit for walking.  A colleague and I went here for lunch and we were immediately greeted by a woman who appeared to be the owner. the place was bustling with business people on lunch breaks and the servers were very attentive.

It kind of irritates me when I order something, get back to my office and realize it's completely wrong. I wanted carnitas...not shrimp in my burrito. As a matter of fact, I happen to think that seafood burritos are gross. So, I'll be eating my nine dollar tortilla chips with some watery salsa. :/
I walk by the sign for this place everyday- a raggety small dog telling me to try this Cantina. Finally I decided to "forget to bring lunch" and treat myself to some Mexican.

We have held my company's annual client happy hour at Mercedes Cantina for two years now and both years they have done an outstanding job.  Kate, Sam and Rocio are consummate professionals - they cover all the details and work with you to make sure the event aligns with your vision.  My clients always have a wonderful time, and as the event planner, I am able to mingle and enjoy the party along with them because I know that the staff and owners at Mercedes have it under control.  I am a fan.

Ya so this little place is right by the hotel I usually stay at in SF and turned out to be a hidden gem that I wish I had stumbled upon sooner. Salsa is spicy and full of flavor. Ordered the chimichanga plate - could not finish it, was so full. Big portion and delicious. Hubby ordered asada tacos and said they were a good time! I would definitely recommend this place and I am sure I will be returning. Wish it was open for dinner.

I like this place.  I've been here several times and haven't really been disappointed.  However, I'm not really in love with it.  But, if you're in the area and craving Mexican food, you can't go wrong with Mercedes.  I'd skip the chips and salsa, though - they give you 2 different kinds and neither one quite works for me - and I love chips and salsa.  But, you should definitely try the guacamole and the top shelf margaritas.  Both are quite good here.  Mercedes is a little pricey but I guess that's to be expected for a San Francisco restaurant.

We often come here for team lunches because we all love Mexican food. There is hardly a wait if you get here by 12pm. The service can sometimes be slow and other times relatively fast. The food is pretty good and they offer a lot of different combos and items to choose from. Service is friendly and the place is colorfully decorated. Free chips and salsa while you wait for you food!
Frankly more for the ambiance and the nice service than for the food...
The catering is very reliable and the food is good.  Great chips & salsa.  I tend not to go at lunchtime, unless I have a lot of time.
+Fresh tortillas chips and tasty salsas.

I have been to this place many times. Mainly for office birthday lunches. HOWEVER, this does not mean it's the best Mexican restaurant around. I can think of two others that exceed in authenticity and taste.

name: Mercedes Hair of The Dog Cantina

reviews.text: I went here for lunch today with ex-coworkers. Been going to this restaurant as well as their restaurant on Montgomery since 1990. I will be honest and say I am habitual and always order the Henry's Special, Fish and Tofu, 33 and 23 respectively on the menu, I think, steamed rice and the pot stickers. I can't speak for the rest of the menu but these are delicious. Each of these less the pot stickers are about $9. Lunch for three with two sodas and tea for me with tip $48.
Get the kung pao.  They even have kung pao pork.  It's really good.  Most of the other disheds include carrot, which I don't like.

I imagine Henry's is about as close to a "chop suey" house from the 1800s as you'll find in modern SF. The food was fast and cheap and there was a lot of it. The flavors were intense and on the salty and spicier side of the pallet. Portions are large and served "family" style.
