Like most Chinese restaurants, their menu is gigantic and you can probably find something for every one.  They even have a bunch of Americanized specials that I saw quite a few mandarin as a first language customers ordering. The staff was awesome, my server was Jody and she really made the evening an effortless success. I'll definately be back.

My friends insisted that we visit Henry's Hunan for lunch and not knowing much about the food scene in this area, I obliged and joined them. We headed to lunch at 11:30 which is a little on the early side for lunch but they wanted to avoid the crowds.

We've had Henry's Hunan catered for a bunch of lunch meetings, because their catering and delivery is excellent.  You can order an hour before you need it, and they deliver hot and fresh food on time and in abundance.
Try beef pie, it's not a conventional northern Chinese beef pie, more like a Chinese-Mexian fusion, with lettuce and cheese in it, crunchy skin, I was surprised to have eaten this here, a must try.
Let's be clear, this is a Chinese restaurant called Henry's. They aren't aiming for authenticity, they aren't going for class. All these complaints about oil miss the whole point.
I never received my food because I was tired of waiting for them to bring out anything, even appetizers, after waiting for ~55 minutes.

Been coming here for around three years because a few co workers like it. Not entirely sure why... The food is very oily and salty - tastes like they reuse oil. The dishes are very inconsistent, especially their hot and sour soup. I had their chow mein once - and that was enough for me. Had a terrible burnt overtone that won't leave my flavor memory.

This is by far the worse customer service I've received in the ENTIRE city... realistically, in my entire life.  Went there around 12:30pm today and ordered the beef stew noodle soup with no onions. When my order came, there were onions.  Mistakes happens, I understand... I told the sever to take it back since I requested no onions. She said, "You take it out."  I explained to her that I was allergic and I can't eat onions. She had the audacity to say, "Just take out" then she walked away. I tried to get the manager, but I wasn't able to flag anyone down for the next couple of minutes. I got tired of waiting and begrudgingly tried to remove the onions. Part of me hoped that I'd fall on the floor with respiratory problems.. but they'd probably shove me under the table.  I ate part of the meal and had to ask for the check when I started breaking out in hives.  It's a shame that you give Chinese restaurants a bad reputation. I will NEVER come back.

I've been dining at this wonderful restaurant ever since it was in its first location, a tiny hole in the wall. I don't get to San Francisco often anymore, but when I do, I make it a point to eat at Henry's.  And for 25 years, I've told all my San Fran-bound friends that if there is only one restaurant that they visit while there, make it  Henry's, that's it's the best Chinese food on the planet!

Got the veggie chow mein and the dumplings. While the dumpling  flour was good, both dishes were completely drenched in oil. Yuck, I could barely eat any of it.. Points for faster service than I expected, and for actually accepting Amex (a rarity for Chinese places esp. in SF).
Not the best place; my Chicken with string beans was more oily than I like. But we were the last ones in the restaurant and so, we probably just had an unusual experience.

Dropped into this restaurant to grab takeout.  I ordered the Mushu Pork, which was freshly-made within about 10 minutes.  There was nothing particularly special about this dish, or the restaurant.  If you are craving Chinese food, then this is a great place to go.  However, I wouldn't go too far out of my way to come.  It's conveniently located around the corner from my office for easy access!
Having been back here a few times, I think they deserve five stars instead of four.  Consistently good, food is very flavorful and well cooked.
After I finish my plate. I notice that it was mostly onions and bell peppers on my vs the sweet and sour chicken I order. It taste good.
three words "diana's meat pie" mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmhhhhhhhhhh
I decided to give them another chance today, and today's lunch was even worse than the last time I ordered from them.

Fairly generic Americanized Chinese food place in the Soma area. The place seemed to have been around for a long time, with the stereotypical "Introduction to the Chinese Zodiac" posters on the tables and wall etc.

This place might look like a hole in the wall, but don't let that fool you.  This is the best Chinese I've had in a LONG time, and I'm so glad my boss took us here.  We let him order all the food, and I enjoyed every dish.    Diane's Meat pie is THE BEST!!! SO DELICIOUS.. Fried crunchy meaty goodness.  The green bean with meat sauce is also an excellent choice.  Will definitely come back here again!

We've eaten at Henry's a few times and the food and service is very good.  The Natoma Street location is really convenient and recently we were very happy they were opened around 8:30 pm so we could grab a late night meal before heading across the Bay Bridge after a day in the city.

Restaurant only about 1/2 full at 7:00 PM on a Tuesday night and service is slow as molasses. Are they slaughtering and plucking the chicken for my kung pao? Steamed dumplings are mediocre. I'm so hungry I could eat the whole order of five, but they're so bland, it's not even worth the calories. And I don't even count calories. It is cold and drafty, even though I am nowhere near the door. I haven't been here in about ten years, but I remember the good quality and service being much better. A middling experience at best, in a city rife with great Chinese food. And can we talk about SALT?? No reason to return here--especially with Fang around the corner.
The food is acceptable but the headache after consumption is not.  I don't know how much MSG they are using but an hour after I ate here, my head was throbbing.  Ugh.  Never again.

The food here is very oily and salty. The dishes pretty much fall into two categories: very salty and a little spicy and just very salty. I've been there a few times for large group outings. Oh yah, that's the one redeeming characteristic of the joint -- they accommodate large groups. Where else can you get 15 people to sit at one giant round table? Even the fast food joint Ming's one block away has better food.

Henry's is that classic Chinese restaurant in the sense that it's frenetic and has minimal ambiance.  WHO CARES?!! I dig the food. Their Hot and Sour soup is consistently good and really hits the mark.  The place is always efficient getting food out.  The servers are nice.  Where's Lou?  I like also the Kung Pao.  Good heat and good flavor.  Check them out!

I have been going to Henry's Hunan for over 15 years now and am just getting around to writing a review.  Delinquent, I realize.  But this place is excellent.  My friends and I try to hit it up about once a month for lunch during the week and it always delivers.  I recommend going at 11:45 or 1:00 to avoid the rush and some long wait times, but if you have a small group of 2-4, you can usually get seated rather quickly.
love the dumplings

Great Hunan food in the financial district and close to Moscone Convention Center. If you like spicy food, you are going to love this place. Just make sure to ask for a glass of water. Pretty authentic and really good food.

This place is a great place to get flavor packed delicious food. I've actually been craving it since I went with my boyfriend and our neighbor. He suggested it and I'm so grateful he did. We have been wanting to go back. The fish in chili sauce and the beef with string beans were amazingly tender. The meat pie thing that they have was also full of flavor! This is a must go back type of place.

Thank you for your message Frank. No worries. The prices are just the sign of the times "and" the area. By no means does this affect how much I love your food! I didn't mean to deduct stars off of your 5 star food.  Trust me, I can't and won't stay away. As a matter of fact I may pop in today. I hear there's a Tuesday special...Hot & Sour Chicken over rice. If that's the case I'm heading over....Also I have updated my rating to reflect what I actually do think of the food AND your outreach to your customers.

In town for a conference. Gave this a place a try since near my hotel and I personally like spicy food for which this place is known for. Bottom line the food was salty, greasy, and honestly not all that spicy. Hot & Sour soup was solid but Henry's special and dumplings not up to par.
Surprised they didn't have fried wontons at a Chinese restaurant, but had great pork fried rice.

My Chinese friends make fun of me for liking this place so much but I don't care. For gringos like me, the food is great! I really enjoy their Kung pao pork, Marty's special, fried fish, and soup. It's consistent and cheap. And the service is friendly, fast, and efficient. Great place to get lunch with coworkers.
I joined a group of locals for lunch and I really liked it!
Very good Chinese food, but not very Chinese.  The place is very clean - almost too clean, and very noisy.   The food is good, but it's sort of Americanized in an odd way.  Did I mention noisy?
I stopped in with some friends on a chilly Sunday night. Henry's was not too busy so we gave it a shot, and I'm glad we did.

Loooooove it! Diana's Meat Pie, who would have thought parmesan cheese in a Chinese dish but it works. Hot and Sour Beef, the sour was there but it wasn't overwhelming it was very balanced, again delicious. I never found anything greasy or overtly salty about any of the dishes that I have ordered. The portions are generous. My co-worker friend and I always order the Meat Pie to start, the Hot and Sour Beef and usually some other dish to try and rice. Prices are very fair, portions just right, a very satisfying experience. Recommended.
got the ma po tofu, the house special smoked meat, and a hot and sour soup.
So much salt! I had the kung pao chicken...man, it was salty. Restaurant looks nice though! We also got a table relatively quickly on a Friday, for how many people were here during the lunch rush.
Good quality food. tasty and very well prepared.
Really good tuna sandwich, they have a buffet style lunch with meats and even sushi and made to order sandwiches obviously! ;)

Alright real talk here. The food is nothing special. But not every food experience can be awesome. Its a casual lunch/breakfast place to grab a sandwich for those working in the area. Don't go here with friends to try some new good eats in SF. That would just be sad times. Its relatively cheap and when I'm hungry it meets the minimum expectations of quality associated with that price point and speed. 4 stars for that reason.
I liked Lee's. I went there to get a quick breakfast sandwich. They sometimes make different things from what I ordered but it's okay.  After all, it's a quick breakfast and they can't go that wrong.

I went to Lee's Deli for lunch today and was impressed with their selection and prices! I ordered the tonkotsu ramen with pork added. The base ramen was $5.20 and the pork added was $1.50 I believe. You get a lot of ramen for this price too! I have enough to save as leftovers for tomorrow. The ramen was slightly greasy, but very flavorful!
I have been coming to Lee's for years, at Montgomery & Market and Front Street, as well as other locations. There are 4 things to know:

I like Lee's. I really do. I swing by all the time for their dim sum. By all accounts, it's not amazing food, but if I'm itchin' for some egg tarts and pork buns, this is where I go. It also beats hoofin' it up to Chinatown from the Financial District.

Working at the fidi requires somewhere where you can go in and out for lunch. Lee's deli is the perfect example of doing so! I've gotten the avocado sandwich w/bacon and it's pretty delicious! I've also gotten the won ton noodle soup and it's pretty good as well (might need a bit of seasoning. kinda bland without it).

Not sure where to eat, but want a place that has quick service and lots of options? Come here. You can either put in an order for sandwiches, or make your box. There's a salad bar, small arrangement of sushi, spring rolls, dimsum, soup, and so much more! I think they charge you about $6/lb, which isn't too bad. The line to pay goes by fairly quickly. This has been my go-to spot lately when I'm in a rush.
I came here to get their wonton noodle soup because someone at my work always gets it and she tells me how good it is.
Suspiciously inexpensive.

I love coming here. I got a sandwhich and chips for $5.25 that is cheap especially in this current economy. I recommend this place for anyone on a budget. I wish SF had more of these in other part of the City.
The sandwiches are good and decently priced. The hot food is EXPENSIVE! $10 for what a Chinese restaurant would charge $6 for. The people that work there are very nice and friendly.
Most excellent and fresh sandwiches

I randomly came here the other day for lunch, and was pleasantly surprised. There is a great salad bar/ asian foods buffet, that is much cheaper than places similar to it in SF. Now its one of my regular lunch stops when I'm at work.

This place is the worst. I've stopped in a few times to pick up breakfast.  I'm in only 30 minutes after they've opened, so it's baffling to me how the food can already, at that time, be cold and sort of congealed looking.  I'm guessing it's been prepared the previous day?
I get a BLT here from time to time. It's decent.
After getting off BART from SFO, I needed a proper lunch before hopping on a Greyhound to the far northern reaches of the state. Enter Lee's Deli.

Ordered the Wonton Veggie to go. Wonton soup with baby bok-choy. Got back to the office to enjoy lunch....NOT!!! There were at least 100 tiny little bugs floating in my soup. I will never go back again. Gotta wonder about the cleanliness of that place and their products. I guess that was my Trick for Halloween =(

The first time I came here, I got their roast beef sandwich. They packed the meet but the roast been was flavorless. The second time I came here was for the buffet. The veggies were good but slightly on the undercooked side...just a tad. And their orange mandarin chicken was ok. The ho fun stir fry noodles weren't awesome. Considering the location, its decent pricing and sub-par for taste.

No wonder my friend warned me about this place....the price totally creeps on you!  I bought my friend & I lunch here, we took one of those to-go containers & headed off to the Chinese buffet part of the deli.  Our food didn't weigh that much but the grand total was $24!  $24 freakin dollars, I know it's Fidi, but still DAMNNN!

Came here on a random spur of the moment this morning for breakfast. I ordered a wheat bagel with light cream cheese, sprouts, and tomatoes. The lady who took my order was really friendly and fast! My breakfast was only $1.65...which is pretty cheap compared to other foods in the financial district!

Solid no thrills sandwhich.  You get exactly what you ask for and they have all the basic sandwhiches you can think of.  And did I say its dirt cheap?  Under 5 bucks for a sando is almost unheard of nowadays.  Just don't expect to be wowed by unique sandwhich creations, but if you are looking to save some money this is a good spot.

The prices alone are worth 5 stars because most everything is expensive in FiDi.. I work a block away and usually bring my own coffee and morning snacks to save money but when I don't I always go to Lee's because their food is fabulous and for about $5 you can get tasty coffee, not primo stuff but really good for coffee suicides, breakfast bagel, and a fruit salad cup which I am totally obsessed with.
Great sandwiches for a great price (Especially since San Francisco can be so expensive.) The staff is always prompt and courteous.

For a quick grab-and-go breakfast:  very fast service, great bagels/breakfast sandwiches, and good hazelnut coffee (self-serve, so you can make it to your liking).  Best part, less than $3 for a bagel and coffee...nowhere else in SF can top that.

Let's talk about lunch!   I usually try to bring my lunch to work, but most of the time i forget it on the kitchen table.... Lee's Deli never fails me!  I can walk across from work to this location and have a variety to choose from.  For the rainy days, I always choose their delicious soups.  For healthy days, I enjoy a spinach salad with cous cous.  Today, I love that they introduced Quinoa Salad with mint!!!  This replaces my dressing.  I only wish the steamed fish was not so salty...
The BLT's are loaded with enough bacon for 3 sandwiches, nevermind one.  That alone garners 4 stars.
Bumped down to 4 stars. I found a little black pebble in my hot & sour soup. What a travesty :(
I went to Lee's Deli because I was taking a class and the folks teaching it had a list of area lunch spots and I wanted Chinese.
Had a pretty good reuben there. The people were super nice there, and the service was quick. Would definitely go back for seconds.

This place was in the same building as my old job so naturally i've come here more times than I've wanted to. The selection of the buffet is not great, in fact, it's quite pathetic. I stay away from the buffet. I come here for bagels and sandwhiches alone. They ladies behind the counter are quick and friendly. They also don't skimp with the meat. The BLT has so much bacon that i actually taste that more than the tomato. The turkey cranberry is my fav though. Fresh white meat turkey on a soft roll lightly toasted with no mayo. Yum!

I've always been curious about all these little Lee's signs scattered throughout the city. Moseyed in to grab a quick sammich at noon. Five minutes and $5.95 later, I had a generous sized sammich chock full of real turkey. You know, the non-deli meat blob style. Nice surprise. Hurrah. Real slices of turkey always gets points in my book.

Got a message from Liane the same day I wrote the review. She hoped I felt better and let me know next time I visit, they'll comp my purchase. I really appreciate that, so it's obvious they care about their business and customer feedback.
I love this deli. I think it's so charming and has a nice menu as well as affordable prices. I think people should keep going there in the Financial District.

Not bad at all, they have a huge variety of food and all of it is pretty good. Keep in mind this is a deli so don't come here expecting some extravagant meal. Their prices are very fair and they serve food fast which is great if you work in the financial district like myself and don't get a lunch break (like myself) so you can run in and grab food and run out in a matter of minutes!
I now people are busy in the financial district.. and they want something cheap and quick.. of course.. of course..

I have  a love/hate relationship with these typical Chinese buffet/salad bar places.  Lee's is buffet style fast food Chinese food, salad bar, mini sushi offers, sandwiches, junk food,  and breakfast foods.   Lines can be a *$&S especially during 11:45 up to 1:00 p.m.   Be careful about timing your lunch breaks if you intend on waiting in the line out the door.
I love this place. You make your own salad at the bar they have all the good stuff. A Chinese buffet and a great menu

If you work in Financial District, you know how expensive lunch can get. $8 bucks here, $10 bucks there, it really adds up. When my coworker told me about this place, we ended up going on our lunch break. The sandwiches here are CHEAP! I made myself a small salad with fruits and veggies, which came out to about $5 (they go by weight), but if you're craving a sandwich they are also around $5.
Services Sometimes good and sometimes very bad. Sometimes the servers do not put enough food and have to ask for more fair amount
Honestly, I would not be able to do lunch-time workouts if it weren't for this Chipotle.

I was trying to figure out what to order for a lunch meeting at work, and Chipotle came up on my radar.  It turns out it's a great option, as long as you don't need delivery and can pick up the order.

How good chipotle is depends on the time you go. If you go during lunch hour prepare yourself for a long line that is out the door. And then...wear a jacket because its cold in the shadows of these fidi buildings.

The worst I've ever been to. The woman scoffed at me when I asked for a little more than the five pieces of lettuce that she gave me. I had I ask the cashier for a bag for my three bowls for my family and he was about to swipe my Togo order with a beer on it when the manager reminded him that I have to drink that in the store. Beyond ridiculous.

So when I'm sitting around clueless,  wondering what to do for lunch here is where I head to. The veggies bowl or the sofritas bowl are my go to dishes and my hubby dashes for the double chicken bowl. Super convenient location but skip the car and just walk. The lines get LONG between 11.30-12.45 but it always moved fast coz of the express service and magically there is always place to sit. Me likey!
I LOVE Chipotle to the point where it is probably an unhealthy addiction considering how many calories there are in the chips alone.  The chips are so, so tasty though.
Undercooked rice, small portions, & often make mistakes. This is not your best chipotle.
Great place. Quick kind staff that kept cooking every thing fresh and really emphasized good service.

Can't expect everything to always be perfect, but at least the workers here are fast and friendly. I wanted Chipotle for weeks now, and I wasn't really disappointed. The only thing that annoyed me was that my burrito was wrapped lose, when I took off the foil it basically fell apart. Other than that it still tasted good. I love the chips here, which they would put more in the bag since you pay for that separately.

No bueno...the serving size has noticeably decreased in recent months while prices are increasing - double fail. Add to that the loooong lines and weird wind tunnel at this location and you wonder why anyone goes at all. Yet we do - it's fast, predictable, and convenient.
Awesome Chipotle location. Very clean and with plenty of outside seating for sunny days.

Not sure what the massive hype is about Chipotle.  I'd much rather go to Orale-Orale or Tlaco (sp?) than have a burrito from them.  We order food from them at lunch all the time, and it's pretty boring.

I don't know why people are complaining about service and skimping on ingredients. This location is great and I always receive a big full burrito bowl on order. This place always works for me when I've got the burrito bowl cravings.

When I see the line that stretches out the door here during the weekday, I'm spurned to head on over to Safeway to get myself a sandwich or something. I came in here after my workout and it was super duper empty. Yay for me!
Looks like the people of FiDi are upset. They want their burritos and they want it fast!

The worst service I have ever had!!! Guy with no hat bald and a beard which I think is a manager!!gave me an attitude while I was ordering my food.!! I should never feel unwelcomed anywhere and this was the place where I didn't feel welcomed at all!! I repeat do not go here they treat you like shit..!!
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!

If I could give this less than 1 star, I would do it in a NY minute! I will NEVER go to this Chipotle or possibly any Chipotle again based on todays experience. I am, correction, WAS a HUGE and avid lover of Chipotle as is my company. But today as I was in line ordering my food, I caught one of the girls talking (saying something derogatory about me that I won't repeat here) to who I found out later, was an actual manager! I've witnessed her doing this to other customers in the past unbeknown to them, and me once before and I let it go. Well today I caught her red handed again and called her out on it. She denied it and then said she was talking about someone in the kitchen. The manager she made the comment to about me, confirmed it when I called it out and the manager apologized profusely. As I tried to calm down, I took the manager (Vivianna) aside to explain the chain of events that I had witnessed in the past so that she understood why I was so PO'd. She seemed genuinely interested and committed to addressing this issue.

This chipotle totally skimps out on all the items they add to your burrito/bowl. Most of the time I can't even finish half of my item, but when I come to this location, I can eat it all in one sitting - I'm not a big girl either! After two bad experiences, this location has lost my business.
This Chipotle is the worst. They had me stand in line to wait for fajitas for 20 minutes of my short lunch break. Then they messed up and put the wrong meat in. I will not return.

Really a great burrito.  Things that annoy me...no salsa bar, no chips included with your burrito, and $2 for guacamole on your burrito.  A lunch her can get a lot more expensive than you thought it would.  Other than that good quality.
This is the best burritos in the Fi-Di. I never thought I'd say that but here we are. It's a dark day.

If you get here after 12, you will be waiting for a good amount of time. Luckily, I got here before the rush and I was attended to within 5 min. Not bad for a chipotle smack dab in the middle of the financial district.
Always really long lines during lunch, however, it moves quite fast, counter ppl are friendly bunch. I hit this place on average once aweek.
The food is not as good as the other chipotles I frequent. Otherwise everything else is a typical chipotle restaurant.

I'd never eaten at Chipotle before this one opened--I guess I just never hang anywhere that has Chipotle around.  I go either early in the morning before getting to work, or I go in the late afternoon which is when I am unchained to forage for food--so there's never a line.  I'm not exactly looking for high quality excellent Mex either, just fast food.  I love their salads--although they need a better "bowl" because I inevitably get spilled liquid from it on my pants and jacket while carrying my meal back to my cell.  And trying to get a salad home, well, I don't even consider trying that one with their leaky bowls.  I also recently found they do tacos, not in the crispy shells as I prefer but I can get 3 tacos for under $10--they're ok but othing to write home about.  I haven't tried their burritos (too many carbs for me nowadays).  And I haven't figuredo out what a "barbacoa" is.  When all the less expensive "lunch" places have closed for the day because it's 2:30pm, Chipotle will feed you for not a king's ransom.
If you looked up "chaos" or "disorganization" in the dictionary, you would find a picture of this store.
I love the line here during lunch times. It's the only time of the day I can actually go outside and see people, and Chipotle doesn't disappoint.

Not that the food or service is all that bad, I'm eating my barbacoa bowl as I type and it tastes pretty good.  It is "meh" because it cost $10 with guac and tax.  To warrant that price it should taste spectacular.  It is essentially MexDonalds.  There are not many good Mex takeout style options in this FiDi neighborhood, so I might be tempted to go back some day.  Hopefully I will re-read my own review to remind myself how disappointing the experience would be.

This might sound crazy to some, but, this is the first Chipotle I've ever gone to. With plenty of authentic tacquerias I've never felt the need to go to Chipotle. But, FiDi is a different matter. As much as people hate on Chipotle, it's really not that bad especially considering the other Mexican options in FiDi which tend to suck. The chips are gross, but, the burrito bowls are pretty delicious.

I normally have very positive things to say about Chipotle. Most of the restaurants I've been to are fairly consistent in terms of food quality, service, and portions. However, this location needs serious improvement. I ordered a veggie burrito bowl to go and was shocked at the portion they gave me - only about a forth of the bowl was filled and it was mainly rice, which was undercooked. Maybe it was because I ordered it online, but I was definitely disappointed.

I just went to this Chipotle for the first time in San Francisco and they put way too much filling in my burrito (especially the salsa and corn) and it was falling out when they tried to wrap it up.  The lady was going WAY too fast and wasn't even listening to me when I said 'just a little salsa please' and drenched the burrito.  After 5 minutes in the bag, it had leaked through the foil and paper bag and in my purse. Come on Chipotle, listen to your customers. Waste of money.

Just like any other Chipotle.  Same stuff different place.  The service was ok, kinda busy for 1:30, but not terrible.  The portions here are adequate, but had to ask for extra stuff cause the server was being a little stingy, but not as bad as the guy on Market St.  I could go on a tangent here, but I'll digress.  Will probably end up back here at some point since work is down the block.  I eat Chipotle too much regardless if the service is good or bad and this place isn't horrendous enough to not come here.
Line is huge but it moves fast. They do a great job! Mmmm Chipotle!! The spicy tofu gets two tumbs up from me!

so, I have to say... I probably would've given less stars for the way the burrito was so clumsily wrapped... but the service completely made up for it.  The very energetic man behind the counter was so friendly and bubbly from the second I walked in. He really made all the difference in the experience.
Mreh

Among one of the worst Chipotles I have been to. The rice is consistently poor quality and the sauces look sad (where's the colour in the tomatoes???). The servers try to cheap out on quantity in such appalling ways. They should clearly know I like rice, but they try to get away with less than a spoonful on my bowl? So sad.
My fav fake Mexican food :)

Everyone always has the same brilliant idea as I do. They sit at their desks and daydream about the delicious burrito they'll have for lunch that will power them through for the rest of the day. They wait until 1:30 or even 2 and think, "Oh, everyone will have gotten lunch already and there will be no line!" Then they gallop over and lo and behold, there is the world's longest line awaiting you.

Lee's Deli is a good place for me to have a reasonably-priced lunch. They have made-to-order sandwiches, ramen soups, and udon soups along with their salad and hot food bars. Even though they serve breakfast, I've never tried it. Their food seems fresh, and the selection varies little so I know I can get at least three or four things that I like. I really like their ramen soup. You can select bok choy to go with it and shrimp or pork dumplings. On the hot food bar, they have a good selection of chicken, fish and beef dishes along with a variety of dumplings. There are Lee's Delis all over the city. I've only tried this one and the one on Market. The one on Market only has outdoor seating whereas this one only has indoor seating, but there are enough seats at this one that I've never had to wait.

There was plastic in my sandwich and when I went back to exchange the sandwich they burned the toast three times. Being in a rush, I said ok let me just get a hot dog. The hot dog was frozen. No joke. Getting my money back was not an option so I waited until they made my sandwich right. I won't be going back, obviously.
Large salad bar option w/ lots of fixings to choose from. Hot bar includes fair tasting Chinese food.

Lee's is the go-to spot of many of us who work in the area surrounding this location. They have everything from dim sum, sushi, sandwich bar, chinese food and breakfast in the morning too. Just discovered they have cronuts!
Great food and an awesome price! Love this place for lunch.
Quick, in and out, to go. Cheap. Easy. Everything I need if I just need to grab something to eat. My co-worker got me hooked on their shrimp dumplings. I can eat those things all day long.

Lee's Deliis best known for using the crummiest cheapest ingredients possible. I knew this going in, as another place I usually to go was closed for the holiday. Anyway, at 115, half of the warm food was already done- just emplty spaces where the pans should be.  The orange chicken and mongolian was prettty good. I had a couple pieces of sushi, and they tasted very, very wierd.  I hope I don't paint the toilet with my brown eye!!!!!
This review is for their sandwiches only!
LOVE the shrimp balls ! these stars are only for the shrimp balls lol

The food isn't bad but the workers here NEVER change their gloves when handling food.  They will make a sandwich or replenish the buffet tables and never take their gloves off.  It's as if they're afraid of getting their hands dirty.
Stick 'em up.

Open for Breakfast and Lunch, $6.95 a pound for a plate of whatever they have cooked up that day.  I think I came here for the convenience cause it's around the corner from work.  The food was nothing special, just ate out of hunger.  However I did enjoy the custard tart that I ate with the rice and chicken plate.  But as of now I think I'm done with places like this, back to eating healthy and clean, cause this place is a reminder of all the oil and grease used to create these various dishes.

Lee's Deli is such a quick, convenient and relatively tasty way of grabbing food to go. Located right next my office at work, Lee's Deli offers a wide range of different foods that might catch my fancy as I am trying to satisfy my stubbornly-growly stomach while running to catch the 6pm commute.
Bad.

I've only gotten on thing here and one thing only.....roasted turkey sandwich! Yes please and thanks...........just noticed today it went up from $4.50 to a little under $5. Still good and still will go and get it!

I love this place, this is practically the only place I have lunch now since I'm fighting off an illness where I can eat only fiber and proteins for awhile. I love going in and getting baked chicken or grilled fish, broccoli, and string beans. They always have a variety of different foods. Chinese dim sum, sushi, ramen, sandwiches, everything your little heart desires.  It gets quite busy at lunch time especially. I recently discovered that they have breakfast too. I love going in and having eggs and sausage links. The only star off is that they really don't have enough seating for the volume of people that place gets. There is always a mega line, but thankfully the workers are very efficient and the line moves quickly. I've been to other Lee's Delis but so far this is the best when it comes to selection, food quality, and location.

Saw they had a large selection of food, so me and my friend decided to stop here to eat. It's a self serve place and you pay for how much you decide to buy. They have easy to make sandwiches, dim sum, soups, and breakfast foods.

They say this is the land of plenty and this place sure has lots of it at a very reasonable price. I stopped by for breakfast one morning and was pleasantly surprised to see a breakfast bar with an abundance of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, tator tots. The other side of this food bar offers dim sum and they also have a salad bar. Breakfast is offered only during morning hours and you can mix and match all items from the food bar for $6.95 a pound. Around lunch time, they switch out breakfast and offer Chinese food, and other hot items as well as the salad bar with some pre-made salads.

Let me offer you a cheap-o tip!  Don't even think about getting that bagel with cream cheese and lox at Noah's bagels, which will cost you 7-9 bucks.  Keep walking up the street to Lee's, and get their bagel with lox cream cheese.  Even though you don't get the big slabs of lox, the lox cream cheese that Lee's uses is plenty tasty.  The BEST part is, it's ONE THIRD of the price you pay to get the bagel/cream cheese/lox at Noah's down the street!!  I'm sold!!

Lee's offers quick and easy sandwiches made to order at a great price.  They may not have all the fancy named sandwiches some of the more expensive places around Embarcadero have, but if you know exactly what you want, they'll make you exactly that.  Plus, they aren't stingy on the meat!

I had a meeting that started at 8:00 am. and knew I wouldn't have a chance to eat again until dinner.  I didn't want the usual breakfast bacon, eggs and a donut.  After reviewing Yelp, I found Lee's Deli.  It opened early and had a lot of menu options.

I always love coming here in the morning.  Lee's Deli is a deli/buffet.  There are two buffet counters in the front and the deli is in the back.  It's great because I can get a full breakfast for as little as $3 - eggs, bacon, taters, some dim sum?

Like most places you have to frequent this place enough to know what's good and what's not.  Better than most Lee's and cheaper than all other by the lbs. salad places in downtown.  Dropping  a star for the tummy ache I got from the chicken salad sandwich... and I have a strong stomach too.

Lee's reminds me ever so slightly of NYC delis, where you can get anything your little heart desires. They have a solid selection of sandwiches--I had a decent veggie burger and fries--and two $6.95/lb food bars, one with salads and one with Asian food. The merch looks well-presented and did not give me the "ick" factor I'm subject to at such establishments. [Cue trippy flashbacks to Midwestern Ponderosa Steakhouses.]

I go here almost every day for lunch.  the sandwiches are really good if you get the right ones.   I prefer the turkey,  salami, or roast beef.  they roast the turkey on site.  the people making the sandwiches speak very fast and can rush you (sometimes in a thick accent).   but once I got the hang of ordering,  i could anticipate the questions.   eventually, one of the ladies knew what I liked and makes it without me asking!  the sandwiches are huge too.   way better than subway for a equivalent price.
Love this Lee's! It's much better than the tiny, grungy one on Front street. This one is CLEAN and the veggies are so fresh. I hope it stays this way.

Excellent turkey burgers, good hot food bar, speedy service....no complaints except that they start closing up half an hour earlier than they should.  The quality of the food is hit or miss depending on what you get.

under $7/lb for a huge variety of tasty asian (mainly chinese) food, including a good salad and soup bar.  I enjoyed all of their food, and after having been to China, I thought some of the dishes were pretty close to their originals.  When you compare this to the $10/lb at Julie's kitchen, it's really hard to justify going there over Lee's.
Tomorrow may be a good day to eat at Lee's Deli.  I think their policy is to change the oil in their deep-fryers once every leap year, at the end of the day.
Since I get my daily morning coffee here, I feel a review is warranted.
I usually avoid Lee's except for the random bagel/egg/cheese combo when I'm hungover.  I figured I'd make an exception for this newly opened branch since the buffet looked intriguing.

A spanking new Lee's!  It seems I'm surrounded by Lee's!  Anyway, I ordered the won ton noodle soup w/ a side of bok choy.  This came in a big bowl for $5.45.  Shrimp won ton isn't exactly what you find in chinese restaurants (it's actually just shrimp wrapped in won ton wrapper.  Not the usual minced shrimp with chives).  Noodles are surprisingly soft.  Bok choy is fresh.  No MSG because I'm not thirsty.  This is cheap and filling.
With this new location, I now have more Lee's than Starbucks within a block and a half from my office.  And going out four blocks further, still more Lee's than Starbucks.

Love it! Yes, there are quite a few Lee's in this area, yet somehow it's so easy to overlook. Great prices on sandwiches and breakfast items. The hot buffet and salad bar both offer a nice variety. Prices are middle of the road. Definitely worth it if you're looking for a quick and easy lunch! Now, back to my tasty steamed fish...

Great tasting Buritto at a good price!  I come here several times a week and the food is consistently yummy! The owner's are warm and friendly and make the food fresh each morning.  So nice to have a mom and pop place in the financial district that makes REAL good food!

It was the most difficult experience I've ever had ordering a burrito. The lady was very rude and the food was cold. She made prices up as she went along.  I don't mind paying a little extra for something I want but I don't want to be cheated either.  I will never go there again nor would I recommend it.

This is my go-to place for the mornings that I need a Venti Soy Latte (Startbucks is right next door) and a big breakfast burrito.  You can get it with sausage, chorizo, or bacon and it just hits the spot every time.  It's a small shop.  You can eat in or take out.  Service is always very friendly and quick.  I have yet to try the other items on the menu, but trust I'll be back for more!

I came to give a guest lecture at AcademyX and happened to visit this joint.The lebanese music playing here brought me in along with the music in the park.Alex Gourmet Burrito has a really good location with the park and music playing to its advantage.However the food wasn't flavourful at all.The level of spice wasn't appropriate.The ingredients loose the flavour when all put together.The tofu was the saving grace in the vegetarian burrito.Not worth coming again.
Best burrito in SF! their chicken al pastor is amazing! I get it every week and the owners are very nice.
This place liberally uses Ye Old Microwave, and let me tell you, Gordon Ramsay and Robert Irvine are right when they say you can taste it.

My first time and I thought a good breakfast burrito would hit the spot for a good morning meal so I ordered their 'Breakfast Burrito' which mine was scrambled eggs, chorizo, salsa, and cheese.  The woman behind the counter (who seemed already irritated this morning) grabbed a tortilla then opened up the eggs which looked really dry, and so did the chorizo.  She put the eggs, chorizo, salsa, and then cheese on the tortilla.  I was really disappointed that she sprinkled so little cheese so I asked her if I could have more.  She then sprinkled a tiny bit more cheese and placed the whole thing in the microwave.  The microwave?  Really?  No steaming the tortilla first like other burrito places do?  Or even putting on the flat top to heat up?  Okay, I'll still go with this I guess.  After all, I placed my order not knowing.

I'm seeing a lot of mixed reviews here and figured I'd put in my two cents. I've been coming here for the last few months for lunch. Initially I went as explored places near my new office. If you're looking for a traditional San Francisco burrito this place is about on par with most others. However, where they really shine for me is their curry and cajun burritos. Yeah not traditional but delicious. The curry one in particular I find really great with black beans and spicy salsa. Their salsa is hot without being overpowering. Quite lovely. It's perhaps a little pricey but you're in the financial district of San Francisco. The couple that runs this place are extremely friendly as well. I'd highly recommend going off the beaten path and trying their specials. I go here weekly and have no plans to stop.
Disappointed to say the least - I've come here for Breakfast burritos, and was hankering for one this morning.  I decided however to push my hunger out and get a burrito for lunch.

I was not expecting to find such delicious authentic Mexican food in the Financial District, of all places!  The outside of this burrito shop is pretty nondescript, I was in kind of a hurry to grab lunch, and my expectations weren't too high... However, this place turned out to be pretty awesome!
It was a decent burrito. The rice for some reason, stood out to me and it was awesome! They have a lot of hot sauce choices on the bar which was nice. I'll go back if I am close by, and desperate.
Nice service. Good portions. Had a regular burrito and it was good.

family run burrito shop. The reason for 4 stars is that they have started of in a good way by differentiating by the meat's they have. I saw around 5 different chicken varieties , cajun , curried etc on the menu. The taste was quite good as well.
The burrito is nothing special. This is a good spot for a quick burrito from a very friendly staff.
Had a delicious burrito here recently. Fair price, funny and efficient staff. :)
Went in with 2 friends around lunch time, purchased regular burrito with pollo asado. I'd never been here before for lunch, but something was definitely "off" with my food. It tasted/smelled old.
I'm a tough critic when it comes to a good burrito- this place is tasty, consistent, simple and the lady behind the counter couldn't possibly be more friendly and hospitable!

I love this place. I work around the corner and have come to love Alex's. They serve huge burritos and are delicious. I like that they have different meats all the time so it doesn't get boring.  The couple who own it are very nice and always have a smile on their face.

This place is great! Really good affordable Mexican food and friendly Staff. Get the mini burrito or burrito in a box (without tortilla) if you are craving a burrito but don't want to feel like you need to take a nap mid afternoon. Good stuff!!
My burrito was huge and while it was the stuff of usual burritos it seemed less "mass produced" than the likes of Taco Del Mar and other chain burrito bars.
Great place to get a quick lunch....very friendly service and wonderful food

I have been getting delicious vegan breakfast burritos here for the last year - and didn't think twice about paying $7 for a burrito the size of my arm.  Recently I've decided to skip the tortilla and the lady has sent me merrily on my way with a very heavily laden container of beans, potatoes, salsa and guacamole for $6.
This place is a joke right?  Tried supporting a Mom&Pop burrito shop, but let me just say, the Mom&Pop shop slapped me big time in the face. And their food was gross. Blech!
Small business owner-operated? Check.
This is a great place for lunch around the Redwood Park area. Very friendly service, and great selection of food.
A co-worker told me he liked this place because they serve "authentic" burritos. I shouldn't have taken the word of a gringo, especially one who ordered a tofu burrito when we got there.

What a lousy, sloppy, wet burrito at a ridiculous price.  Wow, that was one of the worst I have had in the city!  I chose a tuff burrito and refused numerous items such as: meat, beans, cheese and sour cream; but when I asked for mixed vegetables, she informed me that they would be an additional $2.95. Seriously?  The entire cost of this very bad, soggy burrito was $10.22.  Never again would I go to this place!

I went here the other day for a taco salad and ended up throwing more than half of it away.  the guacamole wasn't real (what kind of Mexican place doesn't make - or at least use - real, fresh guacamole??), there was hardly any flavor in the carnitas, and it cost more than a salad at Mixt Greens.  it was ridiculous.  I should have realized that it wasn't going to be decent Mexican food when I noticed the sign hanging from the menu board saying they also served curry and wraps.  I will not be going back.  If you want good Mexican food, go to Tlaloc a few blocks down.
Good breakfast burritos, but not the best I've ever had.  A good place nonetheless.
I've eaten here a couple of times and I have one word: Gross.

I was really dissapointed with my experience at this place.... I really wanted a burrito on my lunch break and this was the only place I could find that didn't have a huge line at 1pm, turns out there was a good reason why.  First off I wanted a quesadilla but the woman said she couldn't make me one because she was "cleaning the grill."  Really? You can't make me a quesadilla at 1PM on a wednesday? okay..... I'll get a super burrito with chicken.  I ask for chips and salsa and she says I can only have verde salsa because thats what everybody gets with chips, there isn't a choice on salsa....  hmmm.  I eat my burrito and the chicken is cold and the salsa is hot (temperature).  Apparently she had just made the salsa and it was still warm..... strange.

This place is ok if you're in a rush. Really though the burritos are pretty bland. The ingredients look like they've been sitting out for a while. The price is ok for the financial district. The service is fast -- this place is never crowded. You can do better, even in the financial district.
Food average.  Gourmet not really.  Owner very rude.  Go to Tlaloc much better for about the same price.

Service was actually not as bad as some are complaining on here. Burritos were huge and price was decent for the Financial District. The actual food was ok, not great. I ordered the Cajun Chicken Burrito and was expecting something spicy. Instead I found a bland, sorry excuse for a burrito. i even used Tapatio to make it taste like it didn't come from the back alley. They are a pretty standard burrito/taco shop so their menu doesn't stray too far from that.
Burrito's are delicious , the service is quick and professional, and the overall package is 5/5 stars.

Don't go here unless you want generic, cafeteria level Mexican food. The woman who runs it has no clue. The food is over-priced and not tasty. Their burritos are just plain bad, the beans look left over from several days ago, the meat is salty and bland. I made the mistake of trying it twice. The second time my error was showing up for a late lunch, I mean were only talking 1:30pm, and she and her cook are already tearing down for the day. Not especially friendly either. Try the taco truck across the street much better.

Went yesterday on the way to school. I ordered the taquitos, which would take an extra few minutes. I waited. The woman behind the counter said they'd take a little longer than expected, and gave me some free chips. I ate, and I waited. About 10 minutes later, my taquitos arrived. They were average. Forgettable. Nothing that would make me sit and Yelp. I finished, said thank you, and left.
Ok burrito for an ok price

I have eaten here a couple of times, the food is a good price for the portion and seemingly tastes well. But every time I eat here I end up getting sick! It's a mix between that feeling you get 5 minutes after finishing your McDonald's you thought was a good idea and the food poisoning you got visiting that third world country. It always seems like a good idea until you find yourself running to the bathroom every few hours for a week. I will never eat there again.
Basic, average burrito at an above-average price point.
Great bakery!
Won't even take time to spread cream cheese on a bagel.
A solid cup of coffee (peerless) and baked goods that aren't overly sweet.

A co worker brought me here for lunch and it was cheap! The food itself was just okay, the butternut squash soup was bland and the Caesar salad was okay. I noticed all the yummy pastries and so the next morning I came by. They didn't have half of what they had the afternoon before. I guess they don't make their pastries fresh here. I settled for a almond croissant and the lady there had so much attitude, I asked if they had coffee or hot chocolate and she just said no. I thought this was a bakery? Usually they at least have drip coffee. I don't think I'll be coming back here.

This place looks good from outside but the food served is not so good and service is horrible. I ordered a hot spicy turkey sandwich. I was served super cold sandwich. When I asked server the sandwich is super cold his response is "what what" in a very rude way. Then he says "ohh, do you want me to make it again?" After 5 min, he turns back with some sandwich which is not spicy turkey. I mean there was turkey but there was no spice in it. The same guy who served made sandwich for me, was also collecting garbage after serving me sandwich.

I really like their selection of pastries here. There are muffins, bread sticks, danishes, coffeecakes, and more. The place is really clean. Service was really nice. Not a very long wait time for my order. About 5-7 minutes.

CARMEN took and made my order. My French cream was scattering around directly in the brown paper bag. The cream has smeared all over. It was pretty gross! Carmen didn't seem to know about the wax paper bag and proudly said they always put food directly in the brown paper bag. She doesn't seem to understand the brown paper bag is for carrying only and not food-grade. It was also surprising that Carmen and the other girl V were not able to refund me. Manager: my order was 171291 Mach 20th 2014. Please get this right. Thanks!

Ditto regarding the gross chicken. Just ordered the Chicken Avocado here. For the price, I'm expecting some honest-to-God chicken, not a sticky lump of "slices" of that slimy stuff that could be turkey, chicken, who knows.
I needed a birthday cake in a pinch and this was the place.  I got the strawberry shortcake.  Whip cream and lightly sweet.  It was surprisingly fresh too.  Very very good.

I didn't know what to get for lunch and happened upon Andresen Bakery. I decided to check it out and ended up getting a Boston Clam Chowder, which was ok. It also came with a slice of bread and butter. Yum! While you wait to get your order, they have samples of their bread on the counter :)
The food is still ok but the service is bad now. Ugh I came back to the office without my salad dressing.

Meh. Menu looks good, pastries and bagels are fine. Sandwiches are so underwhelming. Don't order anything with avocado. It's depressing. They give less than 1/4 of avocado for an entire sandwich.. even when the title of the sandwich is 'Chicken and Avocado'.

Good soup/salad + half sandwich deal at this location. $7.50 for that combo. Also, I went at lunch time and there were huge samples of like 5 different pastries. Super clutch. My turkey swiss avocado sandwich on sourdough was on point and so was the caesar salad.
I heard great things about this place. It does not disappoint. I got a small 6" ganache cake for a friend's birthday. It was perfect, light, fresh. I will definitely go back.
$1 bagel. My favorite is the onion cheddar and cinnamon raisin.

The prices are very reasonable here. If they charged more, I wouldn't purchase anything from Andersen's. The pastries are alright, but can't compete with the quality of the pastries found  at other bakeries/cafes in the area.

A little underwhelmed by this place. In fact, it was a bit of a disappointment having walked past it many times. The layout doesn't help the ordering process as people frequently have to peruse the menu once they get to the front of the line. Additionally, confusion seemed to reign with the kitchen staff when I was there. The sandwich itself was fine but unexceptional. I will definitely return to sample their pastries however...

A friend of mine told me how good and cheap the sandwiches are here and I finally tried it out and I couldn't agree more.  I got the turkey, swiss and avocado sandwich on their freshly baked bread.  It was really good and was around $8 which just doesn't happen in San Francisco.  I'll be headed back here for sure.
Fruitfly infestation in the pastry case.
It has become one of my go to places for a quick work lunch.
Andersen Bakery has delicious sandwiches, and I'm not much of a sandwich fan. The ingredients are high quality, especially the bread. This is a great spot to go for lunch!
I was surprised how good it is and how much they give. I got a half salad and sammy for $7.50
I liked the "fruit salad" - there was lots of fruit. The chicken was sort of gross and processed though. Loved their old standards soundtrack.
Salad envy.

Tried a Creamy French for the first time about 7 @ night. The morning after, about 5 am, I was horrendously sick. Vomiting well into the afternoon, the WORKS. Looking back, thinking of what could have made me sick, the only thing out of the norm was trying the creamy french for the first time the night before. Have no idea if anyone else was sick, but, this is the only thing I can think of...I hope it wasn't the creamy french, because it was so good.

I miss Andersen Bakery. We used to have one where I live and now they closed up gone. So sad. Not every city appreciates fresh baked breads, cookies, fresh sandwiches, and a relaxing atmosphere. In my city where I live ,we have an influx of fast food spots so sadly a place like this won't make it.
Decent barbecue chicken sandwich. Pleasant / cheerful service.
I remember seeing Anderson Bakery at the mall when i was younger, i never knew they had sandwiches, soups & salad. I always thought it was just pastries & etc.

I'm not eating pastries anymore...unless I really, really need one. OK, I've had an Andersen Bakery pastry but not at this particular location, the one in the Japan Center where I could gorge on it among my people. But not here, not among my co-workers who would look at me with disdain if they saw the tell-tale whipped cream stuck on my goatee whiskers. Believe it or not, I have come here to eat a bit healthier by ordering the $6.70 Vegetarian Feast, which is a simple, satisfying sandwich that places lettuce, sprouts, tomato, cucumber, fresh avocado, provolone cheese and a slather of Dijon mayonnaise between two slices of whatever bread you so desire. In my case, I went with nine-grain (see photo).

I was told this place was open about 4 months ago but never had a chance to make it in yet til recently. It's really a bright vibrant place lots of spaces to sit in. That's just about it as all their items seems like its premade frozen in boxes straight from factory to store then toss in oven. The only real thing that was probably made there are the loafs of breads as they have bread slicer machine to do it. I will come back again if Specialty's is not within 3 blocks radius.
the pastry there is really good.

Very disappointing. I've had a few croissants and pastries here and they've all been disappointingly dry and crumbly. I've come to the conclusion that they're just bland bread products "shaped to look like pastries."

This is the worst of their locations. If you actually want to be able to buy pastries or bread - don't go here. There are two sections with registers, one for the baked goods and one to order the food. No one is ever at the baked goods section to help out - even though there was a line for it when i was there! You litterally have to go to the back and grab an employee who may or may not help you if you want anything.
I noticed this Andersen Bakery near my office so I decided to drop by. I got the creamy French bread and cinnamon raisin bread.

Very disappointing because it was not CLEAN.  The person helping me was dusting the top glass counter onto the pastries. On another occasion she asked what I wanted and the whole time she was listening to another customer talking so she totally did not hear my order while I was just standing there waiting. When she asked again she got my order wrong. She definitely should be trained more before being in the front counter helping customers. Don't go in the morning. Not sure about lunch.

yay...another AB in SF. Their Oatmeal-Chocolate cookies are terrific, and are baked quite rustic, as you can taste the whole grains - I felt healthy eating one. The Palmier cookies are huge, with less emphasis on sugar specks and more on the honey-glaze. Lastly, they have thick bars of dark chocolate in their Chocolate Croissants. A quick zap in the microwave and the choco-innards get quite gooey.

I give 5 stars for the amazing service! They are extremely attentive and keen to details. I went there today with my friend Lara and ordered food for the first time. I was helped right away. They cleared our table right away too. I enjoyed the turkey bacon salad and tomato bisque ravioli. Lara got their Turkey sandwich on french roll with clam chowder and it was tasty as well. If you want to get a quick bite for lunch, I'd recommend this place.

Andersen, you're my new that special craving pastry shop. Dang, those creamy frenches are so good! I've come back the last few times just for the french. And they slice them for you too if you like. Yay!

I ate here for the first time this evening. I told the guy behind the counter I wasn't going to eat the sandwich for a couple of hours, and he suggested that I get the Spicy Turkey Pepperjack sandwich but with the bread (focaccia) and meat kept separate. He also included the pesto sauce in a separate container. That's pretty impressive service for a ~$7 sandwich. I toasted the bread at work and nuked the meat and right now I'm eating a really, really good sandwich, compliements of excellent service. Is the sandwich as good as Chez Fayala? No, not quite. But the combo of the service + the excellent meal:  I'll be back, and I recommend it highly.
This place has a very convenient location right on California Street, but my first experience was underwhelming.

Decided to get off BART a stop early to walk through the Financial District at 7:40 am on a Tuesday. Stopped by Illy for a little me time. Stop sign red walls, the famous teacup chandelier, men in suits, silver Illy tins lining a shelf, mini croissant sandwiches and pastries are lined up on the counter. This location is bright, a little cozy, with some pleasant soothing music I'm pretty sure is on one of my Pandora playlists.
No restrooms which makes it incredibly hard to work from.  Otherwise, good coffee, decent service, and great for quick meetings.
Overpriced place in general. Had a coffee and croissant. Coffee was ok and the croissant forgettable. Not the best service.
For ya'll that don't know, Illy espresso is the really the premier espresso.  That's pretty much the benchmark.  Yes, you fall short.  No, there's not a whole lot you can do about it.
LOVE THIS PLACE!

Illy is the best!  The baristas are super friendly - they remember your name and your order - and the service is fast.  There's a starbucks in my office building, but I go to Illy anyway because the coffee is so much better and the baristas/staff always seem genuinely happy to see you!

I love coming to Illy! Love the coffee, love the hot chocolate, Illy blows Starbucks out of the water every time. Vanessa is always wonderful to see, I enjoy coming in to a friendly face who also remembers my name, thats always a bonus. Illy has fast and enjoyable friendly service.
Tne coffee couldn't be any better.

They do offer free wifi here, an assortment of pastries, and European style coffee. I got a single iced latte (probably could have gone for the double). There is indoor and outdoor seating (could be good for a pooch) and the baristas were very friendly. Decent sized space but better for conversation and meeting up with a colleague, friend, client, than actually as a work cafe.

The most friendly staff at a coffee shop in a long long time. Cute faces and bright smiles all around. Bright comfy place to have a small social/business meeting. Oh, and did I mention how great the espresso was!

Coffee from illy is a great way to start the workday. I'm not into fancy hipster coffee joints (EHEMfourbarrelEHEM), I just want to grab a solidly made cap or shot of espresso and not be surrounded by dirty beards and other forms of ironic facial hair. Prices are reasonable, especially considering that they use Clover milk. I'm partial to lattes and caps but I'd love to try the freddo grecco next.  This is a cute space and I'll definitely be back.  P.S. try the bombolone!
How do I always get a free latte here?
I wish they had more choices on the desert.

This illy is just okay.  I have no problem with the coffee, but the staff is really hit or miss.  Take today, for example: I ordered a nonfat latte, and when the order came up, a barista shouted, "small latte, small latte!" When no one else stepped up to take it, I asked if it was nonfat & she said, "I dunno.  I think so."  You think so?  The woman who had just taken my order was standing silently by, fiddling her fingers, with apparently nothing to contribute.  I didn't push it, but this is a fairly typical experience for me at this location.
Clover stronetta farms milk and their own beans.
I am reviewing this place as I wait for my coffee. It takes that long here I have time to hop on yelp and do so. The end.
Tried their lavender latte. Didn't quite like it. Can't taste the lavender flavor but a bit different from the normal latte. The seating here is limited so don't expect to come with a few people.

I love illy coffee, and I was thrilled to find this cute little shop.  The barristas were amazingly happy and friendly.  The CLOVE VANILLA LATTE is really mild and creamy.  The sizes are small for the price, but it's great to have a SBX alternative.

I always go here for coffee, such good coffee... On occasion I'll get a mocha and they are amazing as well.  Sometimes this place gets so crowded that you can't get in the door (around 3PM), but I can't fault them for success.  They've had a revolving cast of baristas as of late, but Vanessa was always amazing, as is the Brazilian woman (sorry, forget her name).  Anyways, they're my go-to spot when I get drowsy during my workday, I prefer them over the starbucks across the street everytime!

Its the polar opposite of the trendy hipsterish coffee spots in SF - very crisp, clean interior, old-school Italian Illy espresso, and delicate snacks and pastries.  You'll never see a tattoo-laden barista here.  ;)
Went in for a cup of coffee. RUDE SERVICE RUDE CUSTOMERS!! if you dont like what you do for a living then you ought to consider seeking a new profession.

The hot chocolate I had was so delicious. It's probably one of the best hot chocs I've had in a long time. It wasn't too sweet and it was simply delightful. The ambience in the coffee shop was pretty comfy. I would wish that those two persons next to me wouldn't talk as high volumes but otherwise it was a positive experience.
My wallet is crying.
I miss Philz and Sightglass now that I've sold out and work for Corporate America, but this is a decent cup of espresso. Go here because it's close, workers are nice, and they take credit cards.

I love illy because it really takes me back to being in Europe.  From the pastries behind the glass, to the absolutely delish single latte, nothing evokes European coffee nostalgia like illy.  It's definitely pricier than SBUX and Peet's, but that shouldn't really be a surprise - it tastes better than those places too.  I come by here about two times a week, and I'm always happy with what I walk away with.

My experience has not been positive. The cost for a cup of coffee is expensive which I don't mind but do expect good service and better than average coffee. I've been dissappointed with how weak the coffee is. When I complained about wanting to get stronger coffee my server Jordan told me to get back to the long line to buy more coffee. Jordan said that I couldn't just cut the line.  I bring many clients to illys because it is convenient but it is difficult to take poor service and below average coffee. I agree that the location is perfect but the servers can use some customer service training.

I come here a couple times a week because it's really close to my office. The coffee and coffee drinks are good, but a bit overpriced. I like the atmosphere and it's less crowded than the other coffee chains nearby. However, with the exception of one guy, the barristas are rather sullen and unfriendly. I know it's early, but they could at least smile or ask "how are you?" This morning, the guy who waited on me didn't say a word, just looked at me expectantly until I ordered. I might give up on this place and go back to Peet's...

It's very tempting to get a latte from here everyday when your work is just right across the street. But too bad it's $4 for a cup that's smaller than a tall at Starbucks. So I call this my "treat yo' self" coffee when I'm in a fancy mood. If not, I'm heading to the Starbucks across the street.

Unfortunately, I no longer drink coffee on a regular basis, but when I did illy espresso was my favorite. Now I indulge in an affogato once in a while. You have a choice of 3 or 4 flavors of gelato for the base of the affogato. A great post-lunch-pick-me-up-treat.
BEST coffee in my opinion. Loved Illy in Italy, loved it in France, and I sure as heck loved it in San Fran. If only, an espressamente would open up in Orange County....
I tried the Lavender Mint and Jasmine Vanilla lattes and they are delicious! not too sweet, not overpowering flavor - just perfect.
One espresso is 1/8th the price of an hour of parking in the Embarcadero parking lot.

Tried the infamous mint lavendar lattes after weeks of passing by on my way to work, staring at all the cool hip coffee equipment longingly through the window, as I was pretty sure Espressamente Illy would be too expensive to afford falling in love with.

This coffee place is in my building and is my getaway when I just need to ge the f* out of the office. Outdoor seating is a nice little extra in the FiDi without having to go all the way to South Financial or Embarcadero.

This place is so cute...makes you feel like you are in Europe. The coffee is decent as well.  The staff is constantly changing so they loose a star there...otherwise great coffee shop, a must try.  Beats startbucks/peets anyday.
The first espresso machine that I received as a gift from my boyfriend came with a red topped can of Illy espresso beans. Ever since, I've had a little bit of a bias when it comes to Illy.
illy coffee holds a special place in my heart.

Despite a gorgeous espresso machine, cool lighting, tasty pastries, and an inviting exterior Espressamente Illy utterly fails.  No matter how good your beans or your machine if the barrista burns your coffee it tastes like crap.
Espressamente illy!  Espressamente illy! Espressamente illy! Espressamente illy! Espressamente illy!
Bf made me wake up early to come with him to a meeting in Union Square. My only condition was he had to take me to get coffee and to Site For Sore Eyes on Battery so I could use my Groupon. Holla!

Worst food ever!!! We ordered the chicken wings and they were not good, no flavor, not even in the dressing.  The wine taste like water and the glass was all dirty I had to return it back twice....gross. Very slow service...I guess you get what you pay for.  I would rather pay more for better,food, service, and drinks.
- 3 minus

If you are hungry, don't come here!!  Waiting over an hour for our food, asked the waitress 2x where our order was, everyone around us had been served.  Finally she said there was a printer jam....at least she was Johnny on the spot when it comes to the drinks!!  In from out of town to watch the game.  Very disappointed.

Super fun place to watch a game! A few friends and I came here for Game 5 and Game 7 of the World Series. Their huge screens are awesome and it's really spacious unlike most bars in SF. I suggest coming really early if you plan on watching a popular game to grab a table where the big screens are because they might reach full capacity.
What an abomination! Some family members and I had brunch here this past Sunday after being unable to get a table at Oola, and couldn't have been more disappointed.

Haven't been here in years. Decided to come and watch the Giants in WS game 4 because of the big screens. I remembered this place being alot better, seems to have gone downhill. Service was not great and food was just ok. Food took way too long to come out. Had the calamari and wings. The queso with chorizo dip was pretty bad, way too oily. Thank goodness the Giants won otherwise it would have been a huge disappointment all the way around.

The only time I go to this place is once a year when they hold the Photonics West reception after the first day of the trade show. They serve buffet style snacks and hors d'oeuvres for this special occasion. It has a pretty cool atmosphere with pool tables and tons of TVs behind the bar. It's worth it for a friends night out or a business meeting, but nothing else really.

I don't know why everyone gave jillians bad reviews I love this place! Huge TV projector size screens, nice booths, white fable clothes so you feel like your at a more upscale place, but still with a bar vibe and tons of pool tables in the back. I've been here on a 1st date and got the rottiserie chicken with mashed potatoes which was DELICIOUS and have also had a salad and fries which was also good. I admit it is expensive but for the environment and the seating and TV screens I think it's worth it. Would def reccomend for watching games /fights and cute date nights

This bar is really nice. The wait staff was friendly. The food is so horrificly over priced that when I saw what I was getting for my money I couldn't enjoy myself at all. $19+tax for $3 worth of wings. $11 +tax for 75 cents worth of chips and maybe $2 worth of cheese. Just skip it and go somewhere that doesn't charge movie theatre prices.

Had a private party and was pleasantly surprised. The service was fast and attentive, atmosphere electric (Giants playoff game). The food was great! I was expecting mediocre bar food but instead ate gourmet salmon in a Thai curry sauce that was outstanding. Everyone in our group positively commented on their meals.
The only times I have visited Jillian's was during conferences held at Moscone, where Jillian's only holds private events.
This place is terrible, don't bother.
I went here with a highschool friend for Monday Night Football.  I've been here before.   Even had my birthday here once, and this was definitely a pleasant experience for Happy Hour.
During a recent conference in SF, I came here almost daily.  including for Sunday and Monday NFL football.

Went here to watch some football on last Sunday. Pretty cool place to watch the games, plenty of TVs with all the different games on and a good fun environment. But unfortunately the food is over priced for the quality and flavor. Was pretty disappointed in the food and so were the others I was with. Would go back, but not to eat.
I was surprised the waitress didn't seat us. The place was empty and we just wanted some drinks and appetizers. After waiting for a few minutes, we decided to walk to another bar nearby.
This review is not for the restaurant-it's strictly for the bar &pool area.

This place was sad. Stopped in here recently with some friends while on business. The line at the bar was absurd. Seemed to be very little organization. The place was a big noisy echo chamber and after being there for about 15 mins they called last call around midnight.

I recommend coming here for a football game! Two large bars, with plenty of TV's!! One large projector in the main room. Has multiple channels going at the same time! Multiple sports! The service is nice and quick! And the food is so good. I got the Angus burger! Great Job! Bartenders are quick and ready for your order. Not sure what people are complaining but I had a great time.

We asked our concierge for a family-friendly, sports bar within 5 minutes walk of the Westin where we could eat and watch baseball, and Jillian's was 100% on brief.  It's just not very good. My lasagne eventually arrived cold with a  side of obviously commercially bought garlic bread and a garnish of oddly colored tomato. It took a while for me to attract anyone's attention, for it to be reheated and returned, a fraction warmer,  garnish apparently retired. The room was not busy, but service was painfully slow and palpably disinterested. We were not offered dessert, the check was merely deposited on the table. My son's chicken tenders, and husband's chicken salad, all seemed to have been prepared with a similar "cost-optimize the portion, salt the food but add no other thought, and churn it out to look like food you get in a hospital cafeteria" mentality. I kicked myself for such an uninspired choice in a foodie city, and suggest you don't make the same mistake. We trudged home not hungry, but kind of sad.
Though I might not think of Jillian's as a place for a sit down meal , it is a great place for an Event.

Came with coworkers after an event-site visit. Saw that this place was 2.5 stars so we didn't expect much, but surprisingly the burger I had was filling and quite juicy. The fries that paired with my burger was also very crispy and fresh. My coworkers had the pastrami sandwich, which was a little too sour for my likings. The service was a bit slow which gave them 3 stars. We had one server that took super long to serve us our waters and the food took awhile to come out. Probably won't be back unless I need to. They also have a cool bar scene in the restaurant for after events or night activities.

A nice hang out spot in the city. You can drink eat and play pool watch games. Close to alot of other things to do in the city. Food is so-so not a fan staff is okay and it is  bit pricey but not bad.

After researching tons of venues in the city to host my friends 30th birthday party at I was referred to Jillian's by another venue that was over our budget. I was so relieved to finally have found a place that looked cool (not being from or that close to SF I could just look at their website) and also was within our budget. Trying to find a place to host a party for 85+ people with food is not easy if you don't want to or can't spend thousands of dollars and Jillian's was flexible with our needs and worked with us to meet our budget. I worked with Jennifer in setting everything up and was very impressed with her, she always immediately got back to me with any and all questions I had and came up with a menu idea for us that I loved so much we didn't even make any changes to it.
The pool tables are family friendly and the only reason we come. However, I'm not a fan of the food. If this place had good burgers and wings, it would be fantastic.

Oh man.... I loved the ambiance here. You walk into a small room with a bar, walk up stairs to a much larger formal seating area (that also has a large bar), and walk down a ramp to the pool room. Cheap margaritas for the city, great service, fun times!

I love this place! Came in for happy hour. Prices were great...staff was nice...and food was surprisingly good! It's also in a great location (right next to the Metreon) and easy to get to. This is my new fave Happy Hour spot.

We hosted a large event here in their private dining area of about 100 people and had a great experience. Jennifer was extremely helpful in making sure everything was taken care of and we had all of our needs covered. The servers were so attentive, and even helped us find a solution for a broken banner stand! The food was hot, delicious, and had a great flow as the night went on. Our guests offered us their compliments for choosing such a nice venue with great food right across from the Moscone Center.

I wanted to watch the world cup match between Colombia and Uruguay and it was completely sold out. There were no tables available, the interesting fact is that my friends were already inside the restaurant and they had a table. These idiots did not let us in although my friends had a table!
