I eat here every time I go to San Francisco, at least once a month. I love the way the people work there, you can see there is a good team work as you can even feel it in the way they serve you and you enjoy while eating.

I find this place so healthy and clean!  With this weather... I always crave for a nice soup.  What I like of this soups is the variety.  I can literally eat here everyday without having the same soup! I love the classic clam chowder, the tortilla soup, the salmon chowder, the salads tooo!! mmm yummy!! I lately order half sandwich and a small soup and I quite feel like I am eating healthy, again clean and I can continue my day.  They usually have a loong line because this is a VERY GOOD place to eat.  Irregardless of the long line, they ALWAYS serve me in less than a minute.  I can even continue with a call and they know what and how I like it.  Come on! Its still fast food right? with good service??  This is a weird mix right!?  Its probably not considered fast food... its just well served!
I eat here at least 3 times a week.
SOUPMANIA!
Good variety- try the Mexican tortilla and tomato soups

I always get the New England Clam Chowder or Tomato Bisque here. Their soups have the perfect thick consistency, which I do prefer. Always served warm and is always full in flavor. I like how their soups are chunkier than if you were to order them somewhere else. This place isn't spectacular, but it's satisfying and you can't really go wrong with soup! It's a nice place to come on a break, and the staff is very friendly. The service is great as well.

Grandma's Chicken Noodle Soup - love it, love it, love it. Especially by the quart when I'm feel like I'm coming down with a cold. It's the absolutely the best soup - better than any canned soup you could find in the supermarket. Heaven in a quart.

I don't know how I feel about paying $6 for a cup of soup! Okay, I do...I don't like it much! But I was cravinggggg Tomato Basil soup on a super chilly day in the city! So I headed over here on my lunch and I wasn't satisfied! :( Honestly, I really think Safeway Tomato Basil is the best ever! And for $3, nothing compares to it.

I've passed this place so many times in the morning curious as to what they're selling at 8:30 in the morning.  But yesterday, I decided to go there for lunch.  $6 got me a regular sized clam chowder and a roll of sourdough bread.  Their regular size is actually a large helping.  I was stuffed after eating it.  Not to mention, the clam chowder is packed with potatoes and veggies.  So it was darn good.  I'm going back today to try something else.
I'm not very impressed. Their pre-made roast beef sandwich wasn't very fresh (and was caked with mayo -- YUCK!) while the chicken tortilla soup was a little bland.

I'd be willing to bet that the manager at the battery st location could do a heck of a soup nazi impression. He's no soup nazi though, good service overall. This is a staple san francisco soup chain that doesn't try to do too much. Affordable, tasty lunches. My favs are the creole crab and corn and salmon chowder. Can't complain about the corn and clam chowders either.

Had the southwestern corn chowder which was just mildly spicy and hot.  Very good.   Service was efficient and pleasant.   I had never been to one of these restaurants before but I would definitely go back again.
With a plethora of places to grab lunch we decided to venture out and try a new place. This journey brought us to SF Soup Company.

Couldn't resist a Yelp Now deal on a cold day. I got a half sandwich, regular sized soup and a large drink for $7. The soup alone is like $5. I have my favorites, the corn chowder and the clam chowder. This is a smaller Soup Company location and soup choices are fewer. It's located in a good spot, service is fast and friendly, and it's a healthier choice than McDonalds.
This review is for the company in general:
fave place to grab a good meal when traveling through SF airport
hair in my salad!!!!
The soups & sandwiches are pretty good. The prices are a little higher than I'd like, but I guess you can't really get anything under 5$ in the Fin. Dist.
Another fast trip to SF and another Soup Company lunch. Today, I went off the reservation and got a few sandwiches to sample.
I bought a sandwich today from Palio since I had not had one before.

After getting yelled at by the lady reheating my pre-made Rollo Pollo wrap, having to correct the cashier on what my order was, and standing around confused for a while with other confused customers awaiting their orders while the staff kept fucking up (which only got them more upset at us), I finally got my lunch.  It was awful.  It tasted like something a stoned college kid would come up with in the middle of the night.  "Let's see we have some kind of wheat lavash bread, some chicken, some leftover grilled onions, and a can of Chef Boyardee."  Really, the sauce had a pretty nasty sweetness about it.   The chicken wasn't any better.  I had to cut into one of the pieces to make sure it was cooked through because of the weird texture.  It was then that I realized it was probably cooked, sliced, and frozen months ago before Sysco shipped it out.  I'll only go back here as a form of self-punishment.  Like if I do something really stupid like lock my keys in my car, I'll say to myself "Nice going asshole, you're eating Palio tomorrow now!"
Standard B-/C+ cafe.

I'd give it one star, but I reserve that rating for places from which I contract food poisoning or hepatitis.  Bland food, kind of rushed service despite no one behind me (for good reason), and high prices.  In other words, typical financial district fare.
Nothing special. Quick service. Hot sammies aren't bad.

The good news: It's one of the only places in the Financial District that isn't a madhouse at lunch hours...only had the Mediterranean salad which is good! This one time the lady making my salad apologized for how long it took.

What a grumpy grandmas working there!  I asked for a glass of water along with my coffee.  The paper cup came dirty on the edges.  I pointed out. She took the cup, poor a water from the dirty cup into a clean cup and handed to me.  Amazing!  No sorry, no talk no smile.  Just a grumpy face expression.  Its like they doing you a big favor working there.
Staff is angry at all times! I stopped going. I suggest you do the same, unless you want to develop social anxiety over ordering food.

Went there to grab a quick bite. Boy was it quick! Ordered the mancalvo (turkey with sundried tomato pesto). The sandwich came with 3 pieces of thinly sliced turkey and a very wilted piece of lettuce slapped together between 2 pieces of bread with sauce. The sandwich was dry and it was a really pathetic looking sandwich. So for $9 and some odd change, you get a pretty thin sandwich. The saving grace for me was the bread. That part was good. I should have really listened to yelp on this one and taken the time to walk somewhere else for lunch.
Food was not good at all. Service was average. Read some good reviews about this place but  we obviously did not have the same experience.Not much to say about this place.
Came few minutes before they closed still was served and could sit down to eat. Service average friendly. Meat lasagne ok, plastic cutlery & plate. Ok place.
The location is the only reason this place is still in business. Be prepared for grumpy service staff to yell at you and give you dirty looks.

I had a big client meeting and needed to place a catering order for an early morning breakfast. Palio was able to not only take the order, but advise me on the portions and set up. The service was exceptional, delivery was on time, and the clients were very pleased... as was i! Thank you Bettie and Palio!

Grabbed a very quick lunch here to-go - was in and out in less than 10 min. Santa Caterina half sandwich, toasted panini-style upon request.  Assortment of chips and sodas, including Italian flavored waters.

Great location. Horrible service and average food. This place survives beacause of its location guaranteed. Staff that attend people always seems mad. Ive gone in multiple times now and the lady complains because she has to make my food. That's usually how restaurants work. I pay you, you make my food. The food is average at best. 1 star for being in a convenient location. Good day to you, see you when you lose your business

I've never actually been here in person - however I've been placing Catering orders for years! Betty is the best and she can generally accommodate any of my last minute requests with NO problem at all. The sandwiches and pastries are always well prepared and fresh. Also - the delivery guys/gals are always cordial and on time. Can't go wrong with Palio Catering!!!
This here is a fine establishment when you need to stop someplace for a quick round of attitude.
Refreshing.

Oh wow, it's been awhile since i was last here, but obviously nothing has changed. i just wanted something small for lunch so i thought maybe a small salad from this place across from work. quick and simple right?
What's with the older staff woman yelling at you when you go here?

This is a great place for lunch.  Very tasty food, quick service, friendly folks.  It has become my go to place for lunch in the sea of places around here. Interesting salads which include new ones that are excellent.  The soup is definitely a cut above places like SF Soup Kitchen (er --- Company), and they have good polenta and sandwiches.   I even use it for business meetings; nice high ceilings and not loud, so we can enjoy the coffee.

I agree with my fellow yelpers about the grumpy staff.  Service has gone downhill over the past years... Not sure why but I never ever get a smile when I order, pay, or receive food!  Also, I think they need a new panini grill. The heat doesnt penetrate deep enough in the sandwich so while the ouside may be a little warm, forget about it on the inside...
Disclaimer: this review is based on take away food.
Carmen & Betty are uber helpful. Thx for the great service and a great cup of joe.

I recently had a wonderful lunch at Palio Cafe. I came in from the East Bay to explore the city with some friends, and we wanted somewhere for lunch that wouldn't be too heavy.  Palio hit the spot!  I had half of a roasted chicken panini and one of the salads of the day--a pasta salad w/ broccoli, carrots and cashews.  I'm a sucker for cashews so this was particularly awesome.  My friend tried the split pea soup and said it was delicious.
Fast, fresh & healthy!

Great place for a sandwich or espresso, just enjoyed a pickmeup single shot. Also found out they are going to be using the new loyalty program MOGL which is great i heard they just launched the sf market , cant wait to start earning cash back. I came across mogl when i was in san diego , only loyalty program i will sign up with.
Staff is so friendly.
Great place to go for a quick bite to eat.  The panini's are amazing.
Since my last review, I've noticed that the staff has been alot more friendly, or at the least, not mean -- so I will be going there more often now.

Very fancy Italian food.  I usually like to go to traditional "grandma's cooking" Italian restaurants.  While the food was very good, it did not impress me enough to justify the high prices.  Though, on opentable, they currently offer a 30% off reservation option.
Wow folks are really hating on Palio Paninoteca but for a quick grab-and-go lunch place in the Fidi, I think it's actually quite decent.

I love the San Martino sandwich, although it is overpriced for its size. Still, it's close to  my job and is an easy place to grab a quick bite. But considering the only other option close by is Subway...
They have a really really good tuna sandwich. Add cheese and tomatoes to it and its even better.

I hate Starbucks so I went in to get a coffee which is better than the sbucks crap. Being there made me want to back to that long line and watered down coffee. I was not acknowledged. Then I had to wait what felt like 15 min to get my coffee. It was not a complicated order. I wouldn't recommend this place. Terrible service even though the food and coffee might be good.

Seriously guys, get it together! I have been here a few times because it is right next to my office and every single time I have been disappointed. The problem is mainly communication and some staff with seriously unhelpful attitudes- they are getting a second star however because there are some folks there who do really care and who end up cleaning up their co-workers mess. This morning I called ahead to get a bagel w/ egg and cheese and somehow the message was never communicated. One girl was on the ball and had the lady assembling sandwiches to get right on it but that lady just had a terrible attitude and took her sweet time throwing together a messy gross soggy breakfast. Seriously I am typing this instead of eating it. Boo, not a good start to the morning :-( Try for better communication and I don't know maybe team building exercises to bring up moral or something because some of your employees look like they hate what they do.
this review is long overdue.

i walk by this place every day on the way to work and thought id give them a try, as they are on the way and not a chain etc.  no sugar free flavors, ok fine, but the coffee tasted burned.  really i can do better at home.  i wont be going back.  plus the staff seemed kind of rude.  really at 8am, i need at least a nice disposition to make up for your crap coffee.

meh, this place was a case of me wanting to try out a new place's pastries in hopes that I'd discover something even better than Specialty's that I had been missing out on, but it seems that place doesn't exist... and if it does, it's not here. I got the chocolate croissant, which tasted like something you'd buy from Safeway. I also got to try their chocolate chip cookie because they had a sample by the register (+1 for that)... although glad I didn't actually purchase the cookie to try it because it's not worth it.
The horror...THE HORROR. I forgot to bring lunch one sunny Friday afternoon + this place happens to be one block away from my work so I decided to give it a try. I really wish I didn't.
Does not exist at this location anymore

I've been hearing about this place for a few weeks now and I finally had the chance to try it last night. WOW!  The best BBQ chicken in the city, hands down! Does Yohnson cater???  This would be a great place for a nice after-work dinner since it is conveniently located in the Financial district.
Quality NC style BBQ. Although the help's hygiene leaves something to be desired (see photo).
Man, have you seen that sausage?!?  It's beast.  Smokey Yo's Q tastes like cigarettes.  It's beast.  This place delivers!  It'll turn a skinny boy fat.
Great spot!  Ask him to lather the FRA-OIS spread on the sandwich...that's his specialty.

Smoking Yohnson's might be the best Q this side of the Mississippi... or at least this side of the Bay Bridge... well ok... maybe this side of California St between the 500 and 600 block.   I mean, If I had to choose between eating some Smoking Yohnson's Q or eat some burnt dirt, I would totally choose to grub it dooon on some of S-Yohn's bbq.  You should totally check this place out.  It is kind of a mobile eatery though... sometimes you'll find Smoking Yohnson's at the Desk, sometimes at the "Bank", and sometimes passed ooot in a BART car on its way to outer limits of Oakland.   Enjoy.

years of living in san francisco...having lived just up the street...first time visiting crocker galleria...never knew this existed...small and narrow shopping mall structure wedged between buildings...plenty of lunch options...fountain cafe upstairs...cafeteria style restaurant...menu above the wall and some specials for the day...breakfast, salad, sandwiches or full entrees...weekday lunch and taking a sandwich...bacon, avocado and cream cheese sandwich $5.75...a small soda $1.75...$7.65 total for a meal...fairly low pricing for a fidi lunch...tables plenty inside and more outside...hearty trays of pre-cooked meats and dishes for bigger meals available...decent meal, large portions and cheap prices...
Let's count this down--makes it easier on both of us:

Ventured into this cafe at the top floor of the Crocker Galleria. Free wifi and plenty of tables and chairs. Wasn't very packed during lunch hours but it was a full house. There's a salad bar in the back for $7.50/lb. Sandwiches and wraps are decent price $5-6.

I come here almost everyday. Hot food is the best! The menu changes everyday. Fresh from the grill items are good! Sometimes it satisfies my taste buds better than other days. Salad bar fair $7 something per Lb. PER POUND   Don't be surprise if you end up with a $20 salad.. Service? The cashiers are NICE. Sometimes people are too busy on their phones or talking with their colleagues. It seems people now days want their behind kissed and wiped..... Prices are fair for the FIDI area. There is a .10 cent fee for bags. This is the LAW not the business or the cashiers fault.How ever I'm giving this place 4 stars because they need a espresso machine.

Don't you just love when the cashier messes up your order so when you let them know they proceed to talk about you right in front of your face with the other cashiers because they think you can't understand them even though you know exactly what they're saying? Yeah, me neither. There are plenty of places around here for a decent coffee and bagel with much nicer service. No thanks
I came here once in search of a fancy coffee drink, owing to the fact that "cafe" is in its title.

I'm usually skeptical about eating at the restaurants at Crocker Galleria. There are plenty of places to eat downtown and Crocker is usually home to generic/ overrated / chains (like 360 "Gourmet" Burrito) that just don't fit my fancy. My homegirl Rita I. raved about the Mushroom and Swiss Burger she had at Fountain, so we went in for lunch today to catch up with our former co-worker.

This place is great if you are looking for a quick and fairly cheap lunch.I recommend getting the combo if you are going for a burger. The combo comes with a small drink and a side of fries. I got the cheeseburger and it was just ok at the most. The meat was overcooked and there was no seasoning either. The fries were pretty good though. They have the big chunky ones which to me is better than the skinny fries. The combo was about $8 which isn't bad. However, I wouldn't come here if it was out the way from my work place.

My favorite go to lunch place when I worked by Maiden Lane. I was always able to get a good lunch for under $8 and the salad bar was my favorite. I always grabbed some of their cold pasta (with the spinach) and mixed it with some real salad so it would fill me up better. They have tons of toppings too so you can add all the things you love, just remember to not go too crazy.
Got a panini grilled turkey sandwich here yesterday and was very happy with it! Tasted great and the service was fantastic. Not to mention it was just under $7.00! Definitely coming back here again1

I came here for lunch today and I'm disappointed I spent $8.00 on a patty melt and fries, the melt has no taste, the fries are fries, the music here is god awful, I'm just not feeling Dub Step or David Gueta at lunch time. The two people at the register are clearly working on different pages, they have things on their menu that they don't have in stock (fish and chips). This place has potential but the food isn't good and it seems unorganized and this shouldn't be too hard it's just lunch
The people who work here are RUDE.

When I need a quick and heathy lunch, I come here for the salad bar.  There are a ton of different options, and everything is always fresh.  The place is usually busy, but never so crowded that I feel rushed to select my lunch and I think I've only stood in line to pay maybe twice of the dozen times I've been here, and the line was never more that a three minute wait.
Where does one get pancakes in the FiDi? Where can you get some good old fashioned pancakes with eggs and bacon? Turns out it is harder to find  than you can expect.
If i could give half stars, this place would be 3.5 at the most.
People at work love this place and we even get breakfast from here time to time (you can't really screw up breakfast).
Pretty expansive and decently priced food in the FIDI hidden in Crocker Galleria. Most sandwiches and wraps around $5-6. Sold.
Just had their 2 eggs + sausage option. It's actually tastes really great and it also comes with four pieces of toasts covered with butter.

We used Fountain Cafe for a huge corporate breakfast catering order, and we could not have had a better experience. They were great to work with both in planning and executing the event: extremely helpful, responsive, detailed and gave lots of good tips and guidance when placing a first time order with them. The food was delicious - we have a lot of different companies in the area cater to our business but this was definitely a highlight, employees were asking where it was from to go on their own time! Cannot go wrong with their breakfast burritos! Thanks so much Fountain Cafe!

I was in the mood for a real grilled cheese sandwich and Fountain Cafe blew it away!  I ended up ordering a grilled ham and cheese with fries and it was really, really good and only $8.35 for a huge sandwich and pile of freshly made fries.  The other food and salad bar looked equally tempting and I saw one of the hamburgers which was huge and looked really good. I'll be back.  This is a find in the financial district if you want comfort food.
So impressed that I had to write something!
Two words sum this place up: american cheese.
This has always been my standby comfort food place. It's like an old school diner in the Financial District.
Nice salad bar, many selections.  Middle Eastern choices such as pita, hummus and falafel.  Clean looking.

I was definitely happy about the price, but just recieved horrible service. Tried to do an "online" order- I prepaid, and ordered a half hour ahead. They ignored me when I got there, I waited until the others in line were served. They tell me-oh, it's not ready.

I came here originally to try the sandwiches (#8) which were pretty good. There are probably better sandwiches and better value out there, but it was definitely solid. What makes the place stand out, however, is the fantastic salad bar at $6.39/pound (a guy at our office comes for the salad bar every day for lunch). There is a wide variety of salad items, with the grilled chicken being my favorite. Unfortunately though, there wasn't grilled chicken when I went today. All in all a good find, and I will definitely be back for the salad bar in the future.
On the third floor of the Crocker galleria. (It was hard to find, but definitely worth it.) I went here on a business trip, and then I took a friend. Nice service and good food.

This place is great! I've gotten both breakfast and lunch here and had great food both times. Breakfast is really good, I've tried their bagel sandwiches and omelets and they were both great. Their salad bar is pretty extensive and I've liked the sandwiches I've gotten there for lunch.
It was not bad, but the food could be warmer.  We had the Chicken Parmesan and pasta special.  The person is warming/reheating the food for 45 seconds in the microwave, which is not enough time.
Very affordable for the Financial District!  A wide variety of options for breakfast and lunch.  Their salad bar is awesome!
I get the grilled ham and cheese here. Comfort food for me at lunch. I feel like I'm 13 again, at diner with my folks after a Sunday night church service.
This place has a huuuge menu.  Fresh salad, above average sandwiches, and damn decent entree's all for affordable prices.  It's tough to break the $10 mark for lunch.  NO TIP NECESSARY!!  cha ching
I must say that they face tough competition with restaurants next door, in Crocker Galleria and many restaurants on Kearny Street.
This place is a home away from home.  I go in the mornings and every-time I am greeted with a nice 'hello' and a welcoming smile/greeting from the owner/manager.

Just found a bug the size of my fingernail clinging to a piece of lettuce from the salad bar.  Makes me think that they don't wash the lettuce -- what else don't they wash before serving it?  GROSS - goodbye fountain cafe.  there are better places to go in the Crocker.

The boyfriend and I have come here a few time for our lunch dates (yay for working near each other!) and we've both enjoyed it.  I like that they have a variety of choices for the salad bar, and the sandwiches we've had here have been tasty as well.  It's not the best food we've ever had, but it's pretty darn solid too.  I can't complain, and he enjoyed watching the baseball games during lunch on the tvs too, so that definitely helped!
Pretty good food.
Great for lunch, can get a hot lunch or check out the salad bar.
Good sandwiches, the tuna melt is my favorite. Kick ass breakfast burritos too. The manager there seems like he remembers everyone's name and says hello all the time.
This place has an AMAZING salad bar filled with tons of veggies and a variety of different kinds of pasta and other salads.
i just saw a huge roach climbing on the wall by the chip rack.  Do what you will with that information!

Tremendous selection of lunch offerings.... salads, sandwiches with huge sandwich menu... many choices of breads and other fixings.  Prices are very reasonable.  Service is buffet or cafeteria style... It's great to buy your lunch and sit outside on a nice San Francisco day.  Plenty of outside seating.
Is it the finest food? Not at all
Stay away from the Asian buffet and stick with the sandwiches.

I apologize for this review in advance, but seriously? Saying this food is mediocre is a compliment.  I'm not even quite sure what I put in my mouth.  I absolutely HATE giving reviews like this because I'm not only dogging the business but I'm reminding myself of the money I wasted.

Just for Convenience alone this place should get 5 stars but were basing it on what they offer right? hahaha, simply accessible is the word I can describe for this place, they have a buffet option in the morning, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, fried rice, steamed rice, CCM (chicken chow mein), frittata, dim sum options like shu mai, shrimp dumplings, did I mention this is a buffet???
"I'm going to get some lunch. Ya wanna get something to eat?"

Cold food and terrible service. I was next in line and the cashier took other people ahead of me. The guy behind me felt bad and said "go ahead" but the cashier insisted on taking him first. She didn't give me a receipt or say thank you or anything. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Dude.  If you want the best bang for your buck, go to Lee's.  Decent dim sum, salad bar with tons of variety, or ramen/wonton soup with noodles that you'll never finish, for $6 always!!! I always spent $6 or $7 and I'm always amazed at how much food I get.  I love it, you can't go wrong here.  The service is curt but so fast.

I love me some Lee's, it is what is and does it well...except for this particular one. THIS IS THE WORST LEE'S IN SAN FRANCISCO. Employees eating out of our food bins in the storefront? Eating and touching their fingers and back into your food? Check. Prices and attitude that change depending in who rings you up? Check. Dim sum that literally falls apart when you try picking it up? Check. Dim sum particularly THE WORST IN SAN FRANCISCO. I bet they don't even eat it. In short, no pride in food, horrible sanitation, and downright disgusting dim sum. A simple change to a Market St location reveals a night/day comparison. This Lee's is like the Australia of Lee's joints, where they sent their worst offenders. Blech.

I discovered Lee's after working in the 'hood for three years. And by discovered, I mean I finally ventured in after initially being scared off by the odd juxtapositions or items offered. Salad? Chinese? Soup? Dim sum? Breakfast sandwiches? Why would I trust that?

Lee's definitely has everything. And I mean everything, from fries and sandwiches, to salads, to a fairly extensive American Chinese buffet. For the buffet, you grab a to-go container, fill it up with your choices, and they sell it to you by the pound.

Was super easy and quick to grab my lunch, price was great for financial district and service was great. Would be five stars if parking was slightly easier and if they has corn beef.(ran out for the day)

Incredibly mediocre, flavorless asian food, as well as terrible service. I tried a few dishes from the buffet and a few items from the dim sum selection, and none of them were even remotely comparable to any decent asian restaurant. The pork was mostly strips of soft fat, the chicken was overcooked and flavorless, and even the vegetables tasted strange. The dim sum wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either, and I would definitely recommend Yank Sing 2 Go for a better, cheaper experience.
My last meal in San Francisco :(
Food is cold, and doesn't taste fresh.
Hello, my name is Chelsea, and I am a breakfast sandwichaholic.

While there is a HUGE variety of things to get at Lee's -ie. everything from Chinese dim sum to tater tots to a salad bar, I've only come here for their $4 Combination Vietnamese Sandwiches. Don't know why, but I stumbled into Lee's one day and decided that's what I wanted. It's a quick and cheap meal, especially during lunch. It's fair for what you're paying and I love that their breads are always fresh. I usually order my vietnamese sandwich with everything on it - veggies, jalapeños, carrot, cold cuts, and sauce. They also have beef and pork options for their Vietnamese sandwiches as well.
Pretty average buffet chinese food and vegetables.  Sandwiches and other stuff as well.  There are many Lees in the city, but this one is mine.

This place is good to come to once in awhile to grab a quick bite, it's cheap and they have a lot of choices just wish that there food would be hotter I've been here a couple of time since I work down the block and there items that they have on the buffet are always cold there eggs aren't good either seems like they use the liquid egg place is alright not the best in town
I love this place.  I've been here about five times and every time I am more satisfied than the last.

I ate here a lot for lunch or breakfast when I worked across the street doing a job. They're prices are cheap and it's buffet style food. Eating here once in a while isn't bad but i don't recommend eating here on a daily basis. It's hard on the stomach and greasy. They have good choices for breakfast and lunch. I like the lunch entrees they serve and it's paid by weight which I like as well. It's a decent place for the price but not the greatest in town.

EVERYTHING cooked at the buffet is OVERCOOKED.  Chinese ravioli, crusts were too hard and dry to eat, chicken strips, deep fried breaded oysters, etc. all OVERCOOKED!  I went in here to change it up as I usually workout during lunch hour I only have few minutes and limited to what's within 1-2 blocks of my gym and office.  1st, 2nd, and 3rd tries all strikes.  OUT for me.
This sandwich place has everything for lunch, you can get chinese food, sandwiches, breakfast food early in the morning.  The sandwiches, soups, salads are very good very reasonably priced.
This is the everything store! They offer a vast and crazy assortment things for you to buy and eat!

I go here only for the noodle soups and ramen.  The portions are HUGE and the food is good, especially on a cold, windy or rainy day in SOMA.  The Miso and Tonkotsu broth's are my favorite and the Won Ton Noodle Soup is really good too.
I am in love with the shrimp wonton soup at Lee's.  Why has it taken me so long to finally try Lee's Deli?  There's only 5 locations within a few blocks of work.

Came in twice this week around 6:30 AM to order a egg and cheese sesame seed bagel along with a Red Bull and got prompt service both days! Bagel was toasted perfectly along with being cut in half; along with being quite filling!
It was okay, nothing more, nothing less.

I haven't been to Lee's Deli in well over a year--I've discovered other reasonably priced lunch places with waaay better food (if you like food bars, Portico is pretty solid). But for some reason today, I visited this location for the first time. I had a small box at the salad bar.  The cashier tried to charge me the more expensive all meat/sushi price when I had a mix of items. She opened my clear box twice to check, conferred with another cashier in chinese, grumbled, then finally refunded the difference. The experience left a bad taste in my mouth. The food left an even worse taste in my mouth. Don't bother wasting your time or money for bad food.

They raised their prices, probably only 15-20c per lb but that adds up! I'm a college student i don't have crazy amounts of money. Ironic how we spend crazy amounts of money to go to college. Anywayssssss it was around 7:15pm and they were packing things up slowly. The salad bar was the first to go. They were throwing the salad stuff away when i got in. Alot of food was gone, probably 90% of all of it. But ironically a fair amount of manadarin chicken and alot of their asparagus was left- which is really all i like. This is the third time i've eaten here. The first two were quite afew months ago. The first time i ate here i took small samples of alot of things and dislike really all of them. Second time discovered asparagus green beans and mandarin chicken. Mandarin chicken is spicy with a large giner flavour that i personally find awesome. The green beans r meh but their asparagus...OMFG. Their asparagus kicks major!! I'm not obsessed with asparagus or anything, but there's is amazing. If i ever go back asparagus is probably all i'd get it's that awesome.

A little something for everyone.  I like the salad bar.  But the chinese food buffet is really yummy too.  They have sushi which I haven't tried, and of course the regular sandwich bar is good.  There's a certain comfort in knowing that Lee's has several locations downtown.  It makes me feel like I'm home.

To be fair about Lee's Deli's overall food buffet styles, I judge theirs as OK and not being harsh. Choices are fair amount to pick from but from the amount of space given you have to cater to the quick grab n go eater. Don't expect cooked to order and sit down comparison here. If it looks fine go for it. If not, there is tons of other option within 4/5 blocks.
meh food bar by the Montgomery BART stop

I work accross the street & bought lunch at least twice a week from Lee's. Two months ago I was sick 3 days after I ate Brocolli Beef from Lee, at lunch time I went to Lee's bought rice with Brocolli Beef, I saw the Brocolli seem over cook & the beef not fresh but I thougt it was fine since I got lunch at least 2x a week there. Half hour after eat I feel dizzy, vomitted, so I went home from work to see doctor, I got food poison. Since then I will never..ever buy lunch at Lee's anymore, can't trust the clean & fresh food, probably food left over from a day before. Also the other day I saw a guy dip his finger to the food on tray to try the food, and he did it again dip his finger to the food. I let the cashier now, she was listen but they didn't change the food on tray. So.. I decided to never buy food from Lee's anymore, can't trust the clean, fresh of the food on buffet, also don't want get sick anymore, it was terrible.

The salad buffet at Lee's is crappy. I stopped by last week after seeing a co-worker come back to the office with a Lee's salad. The greens were okay, but the selection of fruits and vegetables was terrible (no sliced tomatoes, avocados were hard, artichoke hearts were sitting in a vat of can-juice, etc.). At least the price was cheapish -- I walked out with a large salad of my choosing for $6.75.

I worked upstairs from this Lee's for almost 3 years and came here innumerable times. What I miss most are the bagels and cream cheese which were $1.30. $1.30!! Bagels and cream cheese are my guilty pleasure and I could easily scrounge up enough change to get one of these any given morning. I would also frequently get a bagel with egg and cheese - only $2.50! Amazing.

Food: Their burgers are amazing.  They grill them right in front of you and put the cheese on while they're on the grill, so it melts over perfectly.  They also toast the bun which makes it delicious.  Their fries are really good too and you get a good bit if you get the combo.  I've tried the buffet a few times but wasn't crazy about it.
I would say to not eat most of the items on their menu.
Low prices. Good, fresh Food. Lots of options. You can't go wrong here! And the people here are nice.

Remember the Rush Hour scene where Chris Tucker starts complaining about that box of grease to the guy at the takeout window. It went along the lines of "Damn Chin, that's some greasy sh*t". It all goes downhill from there when the old man starts to cuss him out in Cantonese, linkified to refresh your memory
This place has a hot pastrami sandwich on toasted dark rye for just under $6; that alone makes this place awesome.  If you want more details than keep reading....

Though prices at Lee's, and pretty much everywhere, continue to rise, from $1.75 to $1.95 for a bagel with CC, to be exact, (which I'm told is still very cheap, but it's the principal of the thing!) I still find myself yearning for their array of yummy foods.
Lee's.. oh Lee's, why must you be so damn convenient?!

The only time in my life that I have regretted NOT going into a McDonald's. Today, I made the poor decision to sample the breakfast buffet at this Lee's location. Greasy soggy tater tots that tasted of old oil, sausages that are akin to something one might find in a cat box but (I suspect) considerably less appetizing and, then, the eggs.  Oh dear, those eggs. Scrambled eggs so mediocre and bland that anyone who enjoys eggs for breakfast should avoid this place or risk ruining their day. At $7.55 per lb, I just bought $5 worth of sadness.
Three stars seems about right.

I love this Lee's deli. It's quick, convenient, tasty, and diverse. I love that you can decide from traditional Asian cuisine, salad bar (with an array of great toppings, the deli with a hoard of choices of sandwiches, and noodle soups. Basically my dream deli would be Lee's (the fusion of Asian food and sandwiches in the same place). My favorite combo is steamed rice, spicy tofu, Chinese broccoli, and some dumplings.

This review is solely based on their deli - ordered a turkey sandwich on wheat and it came w/ a long hair from the sandwich artist. They charge an extra 50 cents for sandwich rolls like dutch crunch. If you're looking for a sandwich, go to Subway around the corner on 2nd St. You're in trouble when Subway is better.

Almost a dozen Lee's Delis dot San Francisco's Financial District.  The delis are designed for quick, convenient, and tasty meals (typically, breakfast or lunch) for workers on the go.  This Lee's is located on the ground level of the old Bank of America building near the busy intersection of Market and Montgomery Streets.  This is close to the Wells Fargo building as well as the Montgomery BART station.  The deli is next door to McDonald's.

This deli is bad but in a good, convenient way. I feel like the owners never figured out what they wanted to really sell--hot Chinese takeout, dim sum, sushi, fruits both whole and cut, more chips than a gas station, build-your-own salads, sandwiches, soups, or pastries--so they decided to sell them all.

I like going here cause compared to everything else in the Financial District/SoMa it's cheap as hell. The food gets the job done, and the service is actually really good. Some suspect characters float around here on Market Street so they kind of mess up the vibe when you're trying to eat outside.

I've been here enough times to know the breakdown of the entire store with my eyes closed, but just never took the time to review.  To simply put it, when I'm lazy to go anywhere else for a quick bite for breakfast, I'll walk over begrudgingly to Lee's and get myself some shrimp dumplings.

Surprisingly, one of the better 'fast food' / Chinese food chains in downtown SF. The burritos are average, but for $5 you can't go wrong. The dim sum is average, don't expect a Sunday morning feast, but for a quick meal, it works. It's hot and fresh at least.

I remember back in the 80s and there was only one Lee's Deli across the street on the same side Market Street as Radio Shack and Sam Goody's Musicland. They had salad bar, sandwiches, sushi and frozen yogurt. THEY HAVE EVOLVED!!!! a month ago I was starving and needed to buy some dinner so I could work a 12 hr shift from 8pm -8am. I walked into Lee's and OMG, they had salad bar and CHINESE and most of all DIM SUM!!!!!I am in love and I dont even mind the price I paid for the food because it was that delicious!

I ate at Lee's the other day. It was so cold. I needed coffee and food though not hungry. Food to make me think I am warm. I just had my usual bagel and coffee. Breakfast buffet looks great and a lot of people eat it. I think of my body as an engine. It runs on fuel and is picky when working. Eating light does it. Ironically on return from Lee's sun had risen and hit high rises. It was no less than 10 degrees warmer within a ten minute window! This story got circulated all day. Amazing and happened to many of us. SF has horrible weather but we know we have to say is great! No problem!
Great place to have lunch! Select from a variety of salads or a Chinese buffet and pay by the pound. OR you can order sandwiches!
Good for getting a quick bite, but pricey and not very good.

Convenient spot with good breakfast selection.  Eggs, sausage, bacon, tator tots and hash browns.  Even the serve it yourself dim sum is decent tasting.  Not exactly cheap at 75 cent apiece.  And the pieces aren't exactly big.  But still - very convenient.
Food is okay, nothing to write home about.  Good place to grab breakfast on the go, bagels and hot dishes (scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, sausage, etc). It's pretty affordable.
I like the cheap dim sum. Good vegetarian options.
This opinion is solely for the salad bar.
The price is totally right here. As a frugal student looking to shed some pounds, this was literally the perfect place for me.
Multiple cuisines offered and you can pick and choose whatever you want with the plate you fill up!
Three for one.
Shrimp wonton soup with book Choy  is delicious especially when you have a cold or want something hot !
If the only money you have for lunch are the dimes you found in your sofa this AM then this is your spot.

So upset. I asked many times about gulten/ wheat free items. Finally ordered a soup with Udon, they told me it was made from Rice, tasted it and knew it was not RICE. Looked up Udon on my phone and it is made from wheat. So I wasted time and turned my lunch. Ridiculous. You need to know the ingredients of the food you are serving!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Lee's is my favorite lunch spot.  Walking distance from work makes this my go to spot. The food is reasonably produced for the area. Both the hot and cold bars are well stocked and fresh.  I never have to wait long.

Generous with their portions, quick services, and good prices. This is perfect for grabbing a quick lunch. Plus this place has a mini buffet bar to stock up on Chinese food (if you're craving that), make a cold or hot sandwich, or just get random stuff. It's just one of those places that has so much different types of things to eat, you're bound to leave with SOMETHING.

(See pics) Review #1308. Dim sum for breakfast is at this Lee's. And at 9am all lunch items are already ready, hot and shiny looking! This is also one of the cleanest and most brightly lit Lee's, probably because it's relatively new. The dim sum was actually decent as fast food. Note that nowadays many dim sum items were made with a lot of flour rather than meat to reduce the costs.

Lee's Deli ROCKS!  Honestly where else can you go for some GOOD priced grub that doesn't make you regret your last bite?  Then again I guess it depends on how healthy you're eating or what your guilty pleasure is, but none-the-less, Lee's has it all.
Oh look, dorm food lunches in the middle of the financial district.

One word: Nasty.  I've always hated buffet places especially one's that don't have a sneeze guard. But I decided to give Lee's Deli a chance after work because it seemed to have a good crowd at lunchtime and it had a sneeze gaurd for their buffet. So, I had the filet fish, the fried shrimp, and the sautéed cabbage, and the brown fried rice. The filet of fish tasted like they hadn't cleaned the fish before they cooked. The fried shrimp was over cooked and dry, the brown fried rice was bland and the cabbage was just okay. Anyway, I won't be going there EVER again.

It's close take out (because I haven't learned to turn off the type A personality and still eat at my desk) and I find myself craving the shrimp dumplings, green beans, meatballs, golden beet salad, rotisserie chicken, and the Hawaiian curry rice. I treat it like an hors d'oeuvre table! A little bite of this, a single piece of that....

I had lunch here for the first time today. I've seen Lee's locations all over the FiDi area for years but never ventured in. Today, I was hungry for Chinese food and figured that I would give them a try.
Thank goodness for this place!  Chinese New year Parade and choice spot just a couple of feet from Lee's Deli.
Situation
Me: "Hello, lady who staffs the soup counter.  I see that you have a choice of ramen, soba, or udon.  Could I please order the soba?"
These places are always underwhelming but I was happily overwhelmed by the selection even if my eyes could taste the unpleasantness. I grabbed a small, overpriced bite here with no regrets.
Not bad. Popular. Fast service. My coworker described it consistent. We'll see the next time...

This is the place to go to if you ever want to enjoy a #Friday #night #dancing with a bunch of half-drunk/ pretending-to-be-drunk/ beyond-drunk or what-are-you-trying-to-say party people! For me, it's always a blast. Super #fun #music, #friendly #young #crowd, and great dancing place. At the end of the night, expect trouble...especially if you see certain island girls dancing. So funny!

Last night had a blast with my good friend Kameron at this bar after some girls told us to meet them at Kelly's. The bars narrow and long with a long crowder bar at the front thats hard to get drinks form if you don't have cleavage as there's mostly male bartenders. A Corona with line was $8 average for the marina. The music changes regularly but there's a small dance floor in the middle of the place and more tables and setting in the very back. It's a good bar popular with 21-30 age group who want to impress with expensive cloths and large tabs. Even though Im in that age group and make really good money It's not really my seance I like being wealthy so I don't impress girls in short skirts with my pay checks, I leave that to conversation skills good looks and other hug things... Like being a nice guy.
Came here for a birthday outing. Brought 20 people. They charged the birthday boy a $5 cover charge.

My husband and I have stopped here often on our way  back to Bart, but not for more than a year. Last Monday we stopped in with one of our best friends, Sil, on our way back from a fabulous seafood dinner at Sotto Mare. It was a quiet Monday night,  but the guy at the bar was just a great bartender! Engaging conversationalist, and even treated the birthday celebrants to a wee dram of Irish whisky. I think that deserves a mention. Nice place!
They charge a cover for guys, but not girls.  I love being reminded that men are second class citizens at bars.
1. Worst service EVER

I had a Buena Vista Irish coffee in the morning, and a Kells Irish coffee in the afternoon. The Kells Irish coffee was topped with creamier whipped cream, and made with tastier coffee, and smoother whiskey. This is where I'm going for Irish coffee from now on. The bar was nice and the bartender was friendly.

I was told their burgers were really good and I have to say I wasn't disappointed. I work a few blocks away and went for lunch on a friday and got a nice table not too crowded. Also had a good drink here before a well made Moscow mule with the proper mug and all really refreshing. I would definitely come back again for lunch or happy hour. Well kept and not dingy.
I usually have great times with my friends on the weekend when I come.

Used to come here all the time before the revamp a few years back. Most of the reviews are right, lots of casual dancing fun. Fri and sat nights are mostly a younger crowd. And i probably would continue to go on weekend nights if i was still 21-25.

For the last 3 years I've had the pleasure of Mr. Sawgy the manager of Kells & his team having taken care of events & gatherings by just a quick phone call. The service & quality at this place is truly amazing as well as the music & dancing. Sarah who coordinates with you to make sure you event needs are met via birthday party's & events. Thank you Kells Northbeach One of my favorite Go to places for friends to catch up & to have a wonderful nite.

Completely agree with other reviewers .... Service here is horrible. It's the World Cup... You would think a business would be happy to make )what I'm assuming) is double what they would typically make on a Sunday at 11:00... Nope... Being busy is obviously an inconvenience to the folks of Kell's.... People standing out front waiting to get in.... Staff scowling at the crowd as we file in.  'Which seats are open?' 'I don't know, we're going to be really busy, you might want to go somewhere else.' Wow, just wow.
This review is for the way I was treated while watching the USA vs. Belgium soccer match during the day at Kells.

I LOVE Kell's! There are two levels with two different kind of Music so you have the choice! well upstairs the temperature is cooler and you have more space, more easy dancing and downstairs, it becomes hot and sweaty but the music still really good!
Friendly service, horrible food.
"Alright, let's go hit the D-Floor," Jeremy P. boomed as we slipped past the droves of tall, douchey young men at the front of the bar.

Sometimes the best pubs are the ones you least expect! Stumbled in here around 11:30PM with a huge group of people (about 12 at one time then 7 more showed up afterwards). There are two levels, an upstairs, and a downstairs. Both upstairs and downstairs have music - but it's not the same style. Upstairs is more like 80s classics and some remixed sing-alongs. This may depend on the DJ that night also. Downstairs is like a unst-unst dance club! Hot and sweaty. A bit younger crowd for me personally (18 - 24 or so), but wow, at that point in the night, it didn't matter!
Honestly had the night of my life in this place for my best friends birthday party. We weren't even trying to find this spot, which is what made it even more of a fun experience.

This place is run down but all in all it was fun! Good Music, drinks weren't expensive and people were chill. There was a $5 cover charge. The bouncer was outgoing! Bartenders also were very attentive and didn't just leave you standing at the bar waiting. It was very busy. Cool place to go if your looking to have some fun.

Just happened upon this place on a Weds. night on the way home from doing some errands. Stopped in because the idea of Irish pub fare caught our fancy. Had never been here before even though it's only 6 or 8 blocks from my house. Glad I didn't read the Yelp reviews first. My experience, on the contrary,  was very good. On the ground level, there's the restaurant. My husband had the Irish stew and pronounced it a bit runny but otherwise tasty. I had Bangers and Mash and it completely met my expectations. Then our server mentioned the comedy club downstairs as we were about to exit, so we decided to give it a shot. The amateurs were up first and they were pretty terrible ( f this and f that) but I'm glad we endured them to get to the good stuff. Each successive comic was better than the one before. The whole evening was thoroughly entertaining and the prices can't be beat!

Idk about the food and all that, but they have a dance floor, sexy bartenders, decent drinks for a decent price, and a very fun and board music selection. We went there on a Saturday night by recommendation and we didn't regret it. The "regulars" were a fun group of people, the staff was warm and friendly, and we danced the night away until closing.

The bar is actually a lot of fun most nights of the week, but watch out for bartenders who don't listen to your concerns. Luis in the downstairs portion wouldn't serve me a soda. I didn't want my friends knowing I wasn't drinking anymore, so I ordered a soda. He refused me.
Irish night club? This is a review for the late night club. If you are looking for a douchy night club this is probably one of them. Music is always great tho.
It's big, yet somehow still crowded. I think I paid cover? But the drinks were strong so it doesn't feel like a terrible loss. North Beach at it's Northest and Beachiest.
Went in for a few pints after a day in Chinatown.  The beer and service was great. We did not order any food so I can not tell you about that.  Seem like a fun place.

Cool place to come after work for happy hour.  It took my coworker about 10 minutes to order a drink!  He was literally staring at the bartender with his wallet out for a very long time.  I understand that they get very busy, but 10 minutes to get a drink is just really tough.

Sure, I'll do the Macarena with all the drunk ass bitches here. This spot is run-down, rowdy and the antithesis of classy - perfect for me! Plus, everyone is heavily inebriated, especially in the women's bathroom, where I found a girl passed out on the toilet in a semi-handstand.

Came here on New Years Eve with a bunch of friends. It's a pretty decent bar. There is a small dance floor upstairs and there are a  lot of comfortable seats and tables around the bar as well. The bathroom was downstairs as well as another bar. The floor space and music downstairs was also a little better as well. It kind of just seemed like they were just playing music off of an iPod or something because there were no transitions. The song would end, there would be silence, and then the next song played. Although it was New Years, I don't know if I was expecting too much of this place because there were cups, glasses, and bottles everywhere. No one was cleaning. A little disappointing but I will probably give the place another chance.

1 star only because there are no negative options.  Staff sucks here, with exception to one nice server lady. Layout sucks, not enough room to move around without having to excuse and pardon yourself constantly.  Then when the bartender sees that he tells you calm down or get kicked out. If you are having any sort of group or party, don't consider this place.  Try Cigar Bar instead.

Pretty cool place we stumbled upon while on a little pub crawl in North Beach... Kells is a little bit away from most of the other bars/clubs. It's towards the direction of the Transamerica building on Jackson Street between Columbus & Montgomery. We were looking for a bar with a slightly younger crowd than the one we just left and here we are walking down Columbus... we hear some classic hip hop being played & some people standing outside the spot. We had to go check it out... They were charging $5 for guys and girls were free admission. We walked in to a standard looking Irish pub with a long bar on the left side. It was packed, good music was thumping & the ratio of guys to girls was favorable to the fellas. That was an added bonus... But the surprise of the night was when we came to find out that there's a basement to the place. That's where the small dance floor was & another bar. It was packed down there too but you could still move around and get to the bar or go back upstairs if you wanted. It was good times. It definitely felt like a nice party in the city... Just what we needed to end the night.

Was here on a Saturday around four. Was quiet. Service was good. Sausage roll was ok, bangers and mash was just ok, hamburger was just ok, shepherds pie was just ok. It's a little disappointing that the food is not as good as the Kells in Portland.
One of the coolest bars in the area, and very low-key.
No cover for women, I believe $5 for men. Current music - ground floor and basement.  Small place so the dance floors gets packed. AE accepted.

Sigh... Forgettable bar food. $8 for 3 tiny chicken strips cut in half?! Give me a break. Good thing I didn't tip the girl... Speaking of the total came to $8.68... I handed her a $20 and she game me $11 change? Shorting me $.32 cents? Well that gets -3 stars automatically. Don't waste your time here at this fake Irish bar.
Just to be clear, for me to be happy going out with my buds I need this:

This place is so odd. Came here slightly drunk from another (better [Maggie McGarrys!]) bar and bought some drinks with some friends. When it came to last call I had a beer still left so I asked a bar worker if it was ok if I finish it as he wouldn't let a random guy buy me and my girls some shots, and he said that was fine. For a moment in time I thought he was cool. Then one of my girls was on her phone as the bar closed, and he got angry. He told her to not be on her phone at the bar. We ignored this as this is clearly not a speakeasy, and wtf? He became so irate and threw a rag at her which hit our other friend across the face. Wtf???!! He then told my friend, ''wtf are you 12 and need to be on your phone?!'' Ummmmmm wtf???!! We're at a lame ass bar I'm so confused. He was like Chef Ramsay angry at her it was so odd! This place sucks go somewhere else.

Just like a college frat party -- rowdy crowd, cheap beer, basement dance floor and all. I had an amazing time, probably because I was already drunk when I arrived. (Not a place to hang out at sober, FYI.) Kells was super packed and blasting fun tunes the entire night -- can't remember a single song I danced to, but do remember screaming in excitement and not being able to leave because the music was so fun.

We got there about 8pm or so? It was nice relaxing and spacious. I really did have a good time, until it became so crowded I couldnt move or breath... maybe they should have AC? The crowds were really overwhelming. We were all smashed in, but I danced anyway ;D
No Cover! Came here randomly on a Saturday night, [7.6.13] and it was packed!  It was very fun I must say, because of the variety of music they play.

Fun little Irish bar in North Beach owned apparently by some Canadians. So, I came here more recently to celebrate Canada Day with my friend Ayesha and it was so jovial. Friendly Canadians in red, free hot dogs and Poutine and a fellow guy at the bar handing out Ketchup Chips.
First time going to this subway. Dead cockroach under my table. Never going back.

I work at a hotel in the Financial District and there is nothing open on the weekends.  I order soup an hour before closing, "Nope, we are done with soup for the day." Tight. Ok, I'll get a cookie for my side instead "Nope, no more cookies." Great. Then the "sandwich artist" mops the floor while I'm quickly eating my gross sandwich. Your closer on 11-16-13 has a bad attitude and was rude to both me and another patron. Way to go, Subway.

I wanted to give one more star, but the woman who made my sandwich messed up my order twice! First of all, I always have my sandwich on wheat bread, but she proceeded for white bread. I stopped her and said, "wheat bread.". As with the vegetables portion, I told her no on three items in which I didn't pay much attention. After I paid and opened the wrapping, there's cucumbers I requested not to be in the sandwich. I give this place a second chance and think of giving another star.

This Subway is right across the street from the office...   The veggies are fresh and service is fast even when there is a line almost all the way out the door I can still get my sandwich and be back in the office within 5 minutes.
I love the staff here.  They have gotten to know me and know what I like.  Its very nice.  I always tip them 1.00 for making my sandwiches.  I would reccomend them.  check them out.

This is probably the place to go if you want a cheap meatball sandwich downtown ... I mean, Subway is Subway, so there's not a whole lot to say. For footlongs and meatball or steak subs, I'll go here. Regular sandwiches, I'd rather go to Lee's.

It's tough because the sandwich engineers work hard to get your orders done efficiently and correctly.  The owner/manager/whoever kind of has a bad attitude though.  I'm an avid Subway patron, and when my company moved offices here, she questioned where I got my points.  She can also get snippy with people as well.  So it all evens out to be 3 stars.
Friendly owner. Roast chicken breast is kept hot then toasted in your sandwich. Very few Subways i have been to do that. Nice window seating.
I am writing this review based on a comparison to the average experience at a Subway.

This Subway is the Worst! Whoever that Woman is Manager or Boss, She's just rude! I trying buying a sandwhich with with the points accured from my subway card. "She said there's nothing on the card" when I said, that can't be, theres alot of points on there, this is how she replied "THERE'S NOTHING ON THERE, NO MONEY, NO U.S. DOLLARS, NO MULAH." OH yes she did and in front of a long line!  She then tries the card again and says "NEXT TIME TELL ME TO REDEEM." So because I didn't say "REDEEM" Its ok to treat me like an idiot? I complained to Subway Corporate, don't know if that would help any but she's a real B**ch!
I figured that since I reviewed the worst Subway in the FiDi, I'd review the best one as well, even though I'm only giving them three stars (I feel odd giving Subway more than three stars).

So check this... Ive been going here for 3 years because of my job across the street. The dude who opens the spot is cool as ice...he's like my boy BLUE....but his boss/owner, the lady that runs the register...let me  tell you, she is rude, snotty (hey lady, its a subway, not Jack Falstaffs Sandwich Shop) and is skimpy with the toppings. Only reason I go like I said is the dude who opens it is good people...
Nice staff and open late, though I feel like sometimes the two people who work at night are swearing at me in Spanish under their breath.  Maybe not.  Oh well, they do it with a smile!

I eat here at least once a week because it is conveniently close to my office.  My only complaint is that they are stingy with the veggies.  An example: A month ago, the new girl gave me too many pickles.  When my sandwich got to the end, the manager, who was wrapping the sandwiches and manning the register, asked me who made my sandwich.  When I told her who made my sandwich, she gave the girl a glare that literally burned her ear off.  Now, she only has one ear.  Other times the employees will remove a pickle or a slice of tomato if they feel like I got one too many.  I guess those employees want to keep both of their ears.
Out of all the Subways in San Francisco I have to say this one is by far the best.  The crew is great, very polite and helpful.  Also, more importantly the veggies all are really fresh.
English speaking sandwich artists! I always got what I wanted here with a minimum of energy output.

I wavered between giving this Subway location in the Financial District 1 or 2 stars, but I ended up giving 2 because, like all Subways, you can *see* what they are doing with your food, which affords me some level of comfort; Subway is a good choice if you are in the mood for bland food (I am not being sarcastic, sometimes I want a bland lunch); and if you are busy and end up taking a late lunch, they are still open and operating later in the afternoon.

Efficient makers of decent sandwiches with the hardest to DECIPHER food menu. This is my local Subway, by local the other one is a whole three blocks farther away. Subway is the Starbucks of the coffee world in the FiDi. Same vein as Lee's but not as many options and a little pricer.

This is a review for Subway after all so the whole 5 star rating system must be taken in its proper context.  My happiness with this subway is for two reasons.  The woman who operates this one makes sure that it is run right and the customers are happy.  When I am trying to be good and not temp myself with the pasta across the street the speed at which I get my healthy alternative is paramount.  I can walk into this franchise and before I know it have my healthier lunch in seconds.  Before I can even second guess my decision and run across the street for Fettuccine Alfredo I am dangling the bag of baked chips and 6 inch sub minus the mayo and am on my way back to my office.

Turkey Wednesday's make hump day all the more enjoyable.  For $2.99 I get a  delcious assortment of meat, cheese, veggies, vinegar and salt that somehow always leaves you craving more.  If your after work liquid diet is a more important way to spend those hard-earned dollars than solid food, Subway shoudl be the perfect place for you.
Fills the stomach, quick in and out of the place and it's under five bucks.

Just say you are on a budget!  There is NO other reason for eating here!  Well I guess there could be one... if you are slowly trying to be come a vegetarian... then I understand... try ANY sandwich here and I bet you can not taste the meat!  The meat on this sandwich is thinner than Nicole Richie's thighs!  The chicken breast sandwich has less meat then Calista flockhart..... well you get the point!
Am I the only one who wants to slap Jared?

What is it about Subway that's so damn good? The 6" turkey on wheat with all the fixin's is my tried and true favorite. Sometimes I'll even get all crazy and get the foot-long. Damn- that is a lot of goodness. True, a Subway experience can vacillate greatly from Subway to Subway. I try to avoid the Subways in the gas stations (except in extreme conditions like a road trip to LA).  My friend once told me a story about working at a hotel where a Subway franchise owner's conference took place. He said the guys were mostly a swarthier, shady and unfriendly drunked bunch.  However, that couldn't shake my fondness for a turkey sandwich.

I love going to Subway on days I just don't know where to go for lunch. The daily $2.99 specials are really worth the money! My favorite is Thursday's Italian BMT sandwich. Not sure what the BMT stands for, but I like to call it the Italian Big Meaty Treat...:) It's so damn good with extra ranch suace in my Big Meaty Treat. I top it off with a bag of Funions and a can of coke.. ahhh food colma for the next few hours..
The food here is quite mediocre. I have eaten here at least 4 times and each time I leave muttering to myself as to why I didn't remember how lame it was the last time. Not even bad, just lame.

The food is so bland. I ordered some steak tacos and all I could taste was black pepper. My friend and my boyfriend both got burritos and they had a tough time finishing their food. The salsa that comes with the chips looks like black pepper mixed with water and it taste like it too. Their mild salsa consists of tomatoes and cilantro no peppers what so ever. I would never come here again. You are better off at Taco Bell. Taco Bell has better flavor then Luna Azul.

If you want food for before the movie or so, well it suffices. It is food court food but warning its expensive for the crap it is. The food took a good bit of time to get there and well, its not that hard.
Survival-grade food at a premium price. If you're at Moscone for a convention and tempted to go here for the convenience, think twice.
I don't think this review will make a difference.  But whatever.
Ate here because there was a convention at Moscone and there was no way that I was going to spend $12 for their food (ew).
Yuck.  Went here on a pinch of time.  Save yourself the money and go to find a Taco Bell because the flavor will be the same at a fraction of the price.
This place is A-OK.  Its actually VERY decent food considering you're in a food court. We were able to have lunch: burrito and a beer for under $10.
thanks so much for the bullshit microwaved nachos, guys. i could have spent that $7 at the movie theater upstairs on food that's at least honest about what it is.
I think this place is disgusting. The tortilla soup was $5 for basically red salt water. The chips were round and from a bag. So bad. Disgraaaace for SF!
It used to be pretty bad.  I would get the classic nachos, complete with movie theater cheese and refried beans, would load it up with jalapenos from the salsa bar and reminisce about middle school.
Looking for the worst Mexican food in the entire city?
BRRRRR.
The only reason that I have given this 2 stars is that my kid ate her food plus mine!  She usually doesn't eat beans, but she WAS starving and gobbled up her "quesarito" and my beans and rice.
Korean BBQ burrito... two words: bad idea. Imagine KBBQ with eggs, potatoes, and cheese... Yeah, I know. Yes, I ate the whole thing.
Lesson learned today - read yelp before eating anywhere. This place was crappy. Bland food. Over priced. And selfish on the condiments.

They have got a new Korean Inspired/Mexican menu.  Very tasty.  The Korean Beef Tacos, burrito and quesedilla are off the hook.  Beef, Kim Chee slaw....come and try it out.  You won't be dissapointed.
the food got better  the burrito is good  people should go and eat there  as a date or to huge out the music was nice  and u could be there along  as u want
They do not use real cheese on their nachos. They use "nacho cheese sauce". There should be a law against that.
Can I take the 5th on this review?

So this guy i have been dating asked me to meet him for dinner..we met at Yuerba Buena Gardens...we decided to head to this place cuz it was close to where we were and neither one of us could make a decision.

Go here only if you want a crappy, incredibly overpriced burrito.  Nearly $11 for a plain old super burrito.  The burrito is not horrible, but there's nothing really good about it.  It's got a ton of cheap refried beans stuffed in as filler.  Even the chips they give you are cheap, stale, store chips.  They must have have a 5000% profit margin on the food they sell.
This place makes Baja Fresh taste like El Farolito.

If you're in the mood for some crappy mexican food and really high prices, then this is your place. It cost $12 for a carne asada regular burrito with avocado and a drink. No free refills on the sodas. Here's the worse part. As i take my first bite, a mouse runs across the floor in the kitchen. I see it, i look up and there's a woman washing dishes looking at me. She'd obviously seen it too and she's giggling.

You think you've ordered a beef burrito, instead you're given a tortilla, flavorless rice, cold refried pinto beans, and tough meat. Tough luck!  For that they want $9.00!!! This is, hands down, the worst "mexican" food I've EVER had. It doesn't even classify as mexican. Way over priced and no flavor to write home about. In fact, the only place I will write about this is on Yelp. If you are reading this please take my advice, don't eat there! I recommend Casa Bonita's food over Luna Azul's. That's saying a lot!
Luna shames the sovereign nation of Mexico!
I hate giving 1 star reviews as much as I hated the dinner I regretfully had here prior to a movie.
Hmmm, Deciscion 2008: Food Court Edition.

can we simply hurry up and shut this place down?  i'm from the silicon valley (where we have plenty of great, authentic mexican food especially in  east san jose) but was in san francisco that day for semicon west 2008.  i had missed all the free lunches, so before boarding the bus back south, i stopped in the metreon to buy a quick bite.  this place had the shortest line.  faulty logic!  d'oh!  there was nothing good about the service.  the cashier wasn't very polite.  however, on my credit card slip, i messed up by writing the total in tip spot, so i crossed stuff out.  i felt bad about that, so i added in a $1 tip even though i told myself not to tip at this fast food joint.  i absolutely hate it when fast food joints ask for tips.  they don't even bring the food to you!  i'm a softy, and i too often fall for that trick by adding tip into the credit card slip.  it's because i hate how waiters assume asians tip bad, so i tip graciously with a vengeance.  it's an awful habit.
This place blows ass.

I have nothing against Luna Azul. It is just that the food was really bad. The lady behind the counter was nice; the "cook" did not stare at me too much, so, overall, it was an okay experience. It's just that my cheese enchiladas were so blah. My "salad" was like filer in a Taco Bell taco. The refried beans were just lard paste. The salsa bar just looked depressing.
Luna Ahhhhcrap!
NO, don't.

I work across the street and have eaten here quite a few times. Each time I tell myself that it will be the last, but I keep going back only because the better restaurants are usually too packed and I only have 30 minutes for lunch :(

Dropped by the Metreon food court yesterday with the man for a quick dinner after shopping downtown.  I decided to check out Luna Azul while he went elsewhere.  Decided against the burritos and/or tacos and went for one of their plate specials - the Carne Asada Fajita plate.  It came with the carne asada, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, beans, rice, and 3 chips.  It was just okay for me.  The carne asada wasn't that great.  It was all edible and satisfied my hunger pains.  If I had a craving for Mexican food and had nowhere else to go, I'd check it out again.
I really gotta stop with the sub-par burritos.  I deserve better, and so do you.

J and I were happily on our way to Firewood for a nice oven-roasted something, giddy because we hadn't seen each other in a week, when I get a burrito craving.  Lo and behold, Azul.  J was skeptical, but I was convincing.
What kind of burrito shop puts cauliflower and whole carrots in a chicken burrito?  This was the worst burrito ever.  I made an effort to eat it, but just could not bring myself to do it.
Here we go!  A new neighborhood, 20 minutes between classes -- I am looking for something that resembles food.  FAST!
i got the cajun chicken burrito and it was absolutely flavorless. and realizing i paid $7 for that thing was like a kick in the nuts.
SO overpriced.
Pho was good. Pho was expensive.
B E W A R E !!!!!! TOTAL FUCKIN RIP OFF !!!!!!!!!! 25$ for unauthentic pho and imperial rolls . The pho is tasteless Iv been to my share of Vietnamese places this is by far a disappointment

I really liked their five spice chicken and garlic noodle. The chicken was really well marinated with the spices. The sauce on the side suits well with it. On the other hand, the noodles were a bit scrambled up for me. It was in bits and pieces which I do not like when noodles are that way. But I did enjoy the flavor, definitely enough garlic.
Ordered a #10 Bun bo hue and found a dead cockroach in my pho. Never coming back ever again! There was also a bigger dead cockroach on their restroom floor. This place is filthy!
Home of the Pre-Tip Total rip-off.

I have gone to the Green Papaya the last 6 years in a row when I come out to the Oracle Conference.  Highly recommend the Spring Rolls and the Imperial Rolls.  The place is perfect proximity to Moscone Center and the Marriott, but I really walk there for the food & authentic community inside.  I have never had a long wait and really enjoy the staff, reasonable price, and their recommendations.  The 'rice' beer is fun to try too!

They play terrible music. Does the sushi train even work? Their pho was good to me but I was not sober. I did notice burnt garlic peels at the bottom of the bowl. $11 doe? My bf ordered sushi and was not impressed.

I want to like this place more but when you're charging $11 for a simple bowl of pho. That's just insane. I'm assuming rent around that part of town isn't cheap but charging such a price for a relatively cheap dish is probably why people don't go to this restaurant. I was surprised to see that they did have Bun Bo Hue here as well. I didn't get a chance to try it but I think I will come back just to see what it's like.

I just had a bowl of Bun Bo Hue which is a Vietnamese spicy beef noodle w lemongrass. I like a soup very tasteful and I don't feel a lot of msg like other places. The price is a bit high but for location and they use good quality meat I think it's not too unreasonable.  Overall a should-try place!

I am not sure half of the people who work at this place want to be there. The girl working seemed to be upbeat and into her work. The guy who took our order was ok. The chef and the other older gentleman could have cared less it seems. The service was so so, the Pho was good. They forgot my appetizer (didn't charge me for it thank goodness), so the only thing I can speak to is the soup. The bar seating was nice complete with a sushi train going by. Not much on the belt though except a couple of generic looking items. I would go back but not for the great service. Probably just for a bowl of soup.

Stopped by here for lunch as I was in the neighborhood.  Service was cursory and unfriendly.  Food was at least 30% more expensive than most Vietnamese restaurants, with no lunch menu (when asked, the waiter said it was too expensive and too inconvenient to have a separate lunch menu).  Food was poorly prepared.  A door with a sign stating it must remain unlocked was indeed "unlocked", but had a chain wrapped around the handle-no "escape exit" here.  When the bill was delivered there was a note stating there was a $15 minimum for credit card purchases.  What a hassle.  I always use my card at restaurants.

I went here for a quick lunch on my 30 minute lunch break. I work 2 jobs downtown so I don't have much time to try new things, but I've seen this guys signs all up and down Mission St. for years so I thought hey, I was in the mood for Sushi.

I had the beef pho and it was pretty good. broth was on point, and the servers were very generous with bringing out more sides for the pho. My girlfriend tried their vegetarian pho and she loved it. This restaurant is one of the few restaurants in the city that actually has a 100% vegetarian broth, and it actually tastes good. Not some watered down north most competitors offer. The owner was a very kind. Overall, it was a great experience and I'm going back with friends.

We meant to go to the sushi place across the street & accidentally came here. We won't make that mistake again. Mediocre food for too much. Had miso soup, spicy tuna & avocado, spider roll, pineapple shake & Philadelphia roll.
It was a good thing I got my 3 specialty rolls to go because I proceeded to get violently ill maybe 10 minutes after.
Not nice food and small portions. My seafood rice smell like it was prepared a week ago and heated in microwave right before serving. Not recommend this place.
