Ok so the first time I came here I had a really good experience and the dish I got was yummy.  However,  I usually like to wait to write a review until I have been there at least twice and this is a good example of why.  If I would have rated this place the first time I may have given it 4 starts.  My experience yesterday deserve no more than 1, but I'll give it 2 to meet half way.  The first time I went it was not busy and the server was friendly and attentive.  I ordered the curry claypot and the flavor was awesome so I was excited to try it again.  Yesterday when I went, it was slammed.  I ordered the Thai ice tea which is good then I told them I wanted the curry and vegetables and the waiter just did not get it.  I asked for the menu and pointed it out, but there was still confusion and I am not sure why maybe because I said I did not want tofu just veggies.  I also ordered a side of brown rice and that only seemed to cause more angst.  Anyways, I waited awhile then realized I was going to be late back to work so I asked them to bring a box with my food, but instead they brought my order to go, which was annoying because I wanted to take a few bites then box it myself.  I was hungry!  I let it go and walked back to work and figured I'd just eat fast at my desk.  I went to open the rice and it was white, grr.  I let that go then got to the curry vegetables and first off it was barley half full and for the price it should have been full.  Then the kicker there was meat in it GRRR.    At this point I was so annoyed.  I had to walk back and deal with that.  The whole process took over an hour and still no lunch.  They refunded me  for the food which was $15 and that seemed like a lot for rice and veggies.  I was beyond irritated.  I almost want to go back to see if they can redeem themselves, but I had so an awful experience I am not sure I will.
Nasstyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy place and the food it's very expensive and taste horrible very bad never go back I can cook way bether and that I am serious nastyyyyyyyyyyyyy phoooooo nothing like LA

I visited San Francisco in December for a week. I ate here on my 2nd day in the city, got food poisoning, was hospitalized, and spent the rest of my trip in bed feeling awful. I wish I had checked Yelp! before eating here. It might have saved me a trip to the hospital and allowed me to enjoy San Francisco while I was there.
I got food poisoning after eating here. Too salty and artificial. Would never go back.

Great Food.  Julie told me to come in but I told her to get something better.  I still followed Julie's advise. This is the best beef noodle soup I have ever had for Veinanese food and salad. I will come back again. Thanks Julie and the chef.

It's my first time in here and I can honestly say that I had a pretty good experience. Too bad many others thought differently.. Overall the staff were extremely nice and attentive to my needs. I ordered Ca Kho To (braised catfish in claypot) with jasmine rice, Imperial roll aka fried eggrolls as my appetizer and fried banana with ice cream for my dessert.  All of which were good except the dessert.  It was a little sweet for me even though I had a sweet tooth craving but it was still ok. The decor/layout of the restaurant was not bad. I enjoyed their background music (Instrumental Vietnamese love songs) very much that I stayed a little longer just to sit there and relax! (^_^) Their price was a little high but I thought it was worth it bc I enjoyed the food, music and great staff.

Garlic noodles and bbd meat seriously yummy. too pricey for setting and service. Extra roll at $2 when we pointed at the picture of what we wanted, was uncalled for. $9 for a spring roll outrageous. Won't come back, even though the garlic noodles were delish. $40 for lunch for 2 of us. yikes
It's really salty and beware... There is an 18% in generosity tip even if u hate their services.  Food was bad and so was the service
Green Papaya was a grave disappointment. Plus, a Vietnamese place claiming to offer delicious, healthy sushi is somewhat dubious in my book.
How to give zero stars? Pretty pricey for Vietnamese food. I would, therefore expect them not to add protein (aka worm) on my steamed veggies dish.
Yesterday , we went to downtown and pass this restaurant, so we go inside for Lunch.
Entrees are too small && way over prices. Plus the taste is very mediocre. It's clean && servers are nice, but that's about it.

It was way overpriced for a few pieces of meat that didn't even fill up half the plate it was served on. The prices were similar to that of higher class restaurants... this is nothing of the sort. The food itself wasn't even that satisfying... it lacked flavor. It was unpleasant...

Do not eat here.  I ordered what I thought would be a small bowl of Pho for $9 (already overpriced), but when the bill came, I had apparently ordered the large for $11.  If that's true, then their definition of large is pitifully small.  Either that or I was mischarged.  I didn't feel like contesting it.  The food itself was rather sub-par, nothing special.  Can't say anything about the sushi, but it seemed rather overpriced as well.  Service was pretty quick, but overall, not worth it.

Service was meh even though the place was close to empty... they were mostly just watching TV and chatting with their coworkers. To top it off, we may not have purchased much, and we did use a coupon, but that doesn't make us second class citizens!
Don't ever order frozen sashimi. Sushi suck here

This place is not very good and ruins San Francisco's reputation of a city with good food.  Their service sucks too.  Its a shame they are located in the path of Tourists b/c people who eat here are getting false experience of true San Francisco food and service.
Their food is pretty simple, nothing outstanding and definitely not worth the price.

It's pretty convenient as it's right across the street from the movie theatre and the service is crazy fast; at least the service was fast for me, as both rolls we ordered took only 10 minutes (we were on a time crunch for a movie) and we even had time for dessert afterwards.

Came here after shopping from Bloomies for the NutraWorks (diet) menu.  At first, the lady didn't know which menu I was referring to.  After a few minutes, she came back with it ;-). It took a little while get us served. We practically had to flag someone to take our order. But once they took the order, the food came fast. The portions are small for their prices and for traditional thai restaurant.  I think it's overpriced.  For their prices, I would rather go to Osha or Coriander - great food for the right price!
Surprise! Great food in a garage! Friendly, prompt, and attentive service. Typical Vietnamese fare available, though the menu is a bit scaled back. All for a reasonable price. Going back.
Catch your quick meal here after the movie at metreon. It is a quick economical meal option with room for desserts. Dishes are flavorful. Good quick bite. Not good for gourmet family dinner
Danger Will Robinson. Do not eat the sushi here. It tastes like mold. I'm sorry to say it's some of the worst I've ever had.
Internet is a big deal for me. I will gladly pay extra so that I can get online and work on a side project during my lunch break.

This review is in comparison to other subways.  The prices are higher than normal because of location,  there is normally a line, and because of that, you get no customer service and your sandwich is just thrown together with no care.

I don't know why people hate on subway.  It's a sandwich and if you want a gourmet sandwich, then you're in the wrong spot.  This a a place where you go for a good filling sandwich without all the hoopla. The workers here was always super friendly and fast.  The place is kept clean and I'm always in and out with in 10 minutes(I go during off hours).  My favorites sandwich is the Itallian BMT on honey oat with everything on it and smothered in sweet onion sauce.  I'm addicted to sweet onion sauce.  The produce is always fresh and never under ripened.
The staff at this subway location is quick and friendly.
Nothing really special here since its pretty much your average Subway.  Good for a quick and cheap lunch.
My experience here is consistently disappointing to me.

Line moves quickly at lunchtime. Their daily specials are a pretty good deal. I also like the fact that I can refill my drink since the drink fountain is accessible. Their chip selection is a bit limited, though. The place is a bit small so you might have people crowding around you as they're in line to place their order. Or if the weather is nice enough, you can take your meal to one of the outside tables.
This subway is conveniently located between office buildings in SoMa.

No more $2.99 daily special, huh? Ok then, I'll take that star away from you now. Without that, Subway will be facing some serious competition against the nearby Vietnamese sandwich places if they want my money.

Subway isnt special or gourmet or anything like that, but it's cheap. When I don't have time to go to the grocery store for sandwich stuff, I have to buy my lunch. Who wants to spend tons of $ on lunch when you just have to go back to work? Plus, I only have 30 min. Right behind work is a little food courtish thing and part of it is subway. Subway has $5 footlongs. $5 is already cheap for a sandwich, because most of them around here are almost $7 and up. But then, I can't eat the whole footlong, I can only eat half a foot. So really, I get 2 sandwiches! $2.50 each! Now, that's cheap! I always get the chicken sandwich with everything (except mayo and olives, yuk). You get tons of veggies, cheese, and you can choose whole wheat breads. My coworker tells me that if you go often, you can get a frequent buyer card and get a free one when they're punched (though that may be on the pricer six inch sandwiches). So I will keep coming back when I have nothing to eat!
goto the one by hyatt regency hotel.  you'll save yourself the heartache and probably be alot happier with the amount of veggies and sauce they use on your sandwich.
3 years ago I would have given my current "meal rating" as one or two stars, but I've been in the Fidi for a couple years now, and what I once knew as food to avoid, is now basically gourmet.
Subway rocks. The end.
Oh god.  Oh no.  I'm that customer, the one who gives the employees "trouble." But can you blame me?
I love this Subway and I guess I'm the only one.  :(

In the Subway Sandwich world I'd like to say I am their ideal customer.  When I walk in I know what I want.  My usual for years has been a 6 inch hot pastrami on wheat with everything on it.  I'm picky in what I eat but I figured once I get my sandwich I can pick off the olives and onions and bell peppers.

Really, when you go to a Subway, are you expecting something better? I know it sucks, but one day we were having sushi and I didn't want sushi and I heard that our assistant was going here for other people, so I asked her to get me something too. It was a moment of weakness that I regretted the rest of the day.
With all the Subways downtown, what is there to distinguish this one?
haha funny to write a review about Subway, but I just had it, and eat it fairly often, so it deserves to be on here.
I go here WAY too much.  It's right outside where I work and since I'm a workaholic, I just grab a sandwich and sit at my desk while I cry about being a workaholic.

You know those "defining moments" literature are positively littered with?  I had one recently.  I was forced to eat at Subway and I actually asked my companion, "so, what's good here?".  Like I'm eating at the freaking Ritz-Carlton.  Any specials today?  Are the tomatoes Heirloom or Roma?  Where is that cheese from and is it goat, sheep, or cow?  When did I become completely pretentious?

I would have given it two stars given that this is a Subway...but I had a very bad experience there.  One night, maybe around 7:30, I went to the Subway at 50  Fremont.  They were almost all out of bread at that time and thus I didn't have a choice on bread.  That wasn't the worst part as I'm not picky on bread.  Anyway, a customer walked in and ordered something, and after the sandwich was made, he decided he didn't want it because there was cheese melted on it.  Instead of throwing the sandwich away, the worker removed the setting from the bread and put the bread back to their little bread cabinet.  I guess good luck to the next guy walking in.  Sorry, but that's really sick if I ended up getting a sandwich with bread that was part of someone else's sandwich.
Two Star!!

When I was working downtown, this Subway was the closest one to my building and also the best.  There was another Subway across the street on Market, but they just slap stuff on in a messy order.   The best day to go for any Subway for that matter is Thursday when they have the BMT special.  A 6-inch sub with 3 kinds of meat for $2.49.  Ask for the Sweet Onion sauce, they never announce their special sauces.  Also the Clam chowder and potato soup are good buys, the rest of the soup is bleh.  Check it out when your in the neighborhood, filling for less.

Hungover? Have I got just the thing for you: processed meat on a hotdog bun. Mmmm. Does the trick every time to make me feel better. This location is an anomaly, however sometimes at lunch the line is a mile long, other times there's nobody in there. Weird.

Okay, most Subways deserve one star but this one does the best with what they've been given.  They are polite, the place is clean, I've never "seen" anyone pull-off a "sneezer" but the best culprits are never caught red-handed.

Have you heard of this place? They make sandwiches. Back East we would call them grinders or submarine sandwiches. Anyway, at Subway you first choose your bread and the size (6", 12") and they put your sandy together using the assembly line method with the bread slicer person handing off to the filling stuffer. I only get the 12" Vegetarian Delite on wheat with no onions, pickles, cheese, or hot peppers. It's pretty much a salad on bread and it tastes great with very low fat. I know what you are thinking - but wait, Colin, aren't there carbs in the bread? Yes, but don't worry about it. You need carbs to survive. The whole low carb thing is total bullshit - don't buy into it. Important note: eating at Subway is nothing like riding the subway in that it doesn't smell like puke or feature greasy dudes grabbing your ass. Also, stay away from that joynt Quiznos - so they toast the bread - big deal. I like my bread like my women - soft and squishy. I think there may be 1 or 2 other Subway's around the city so check one out.
